column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We chose this resort as it seemed value for money and the professional photos good. We wanted a pool, bar and the ability to cook ‘at home’ sometimes so we could avoid paying through the nose for fast food and the like in the theme parks and to be able to relax and suit ourselves.We chose the right place. The 3 bedroom apartment (we were on the top floor of block 8) was clean, well maintained and very spacious for our family of 5.The location was around 10-15 minutes to the Animal Kingdom and a bit longer to get to the other Disney Parks. We drove around 25-30 minutes to the nearest shopping outlets too. The main road to the parks is a busy road and you may sit in traffic at peak times. We didn’t mind this as we didn’t have any appointments or set times we wanted to be at the parks for. It also can’t be helped.The bar was great and offered reasonably priced drinks and great cocktails (Mudslide was delightful). Marissa was lovely and we chatted to her about her life in Florida.The staff were very helpful when our cards kept cancelling out because of me keeping them next to my mobile phone or other cards (my fault). I requested extra towels but these didn’t materialise so I took some clean ones from the pool instead. I did get some help printing a voucher from email for park tickets too. WiFi is fantastic.The pool was great for the kids and they loved the hot tub too.We were happy with the price we paid and the amenities provided. We enjoyed our night at the karaoke although we didn’t get up and sing!We’ll be back next year. :-)

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: First off, many of these units are individually owned, so your experience with the room itself will vary. What won’t change is the traffic in this area. It’s terrible! If you enjoy sitting in horrible traffic everyday of your vacation then stay here. This exit off of I-4 is always backed up for miles going east and west at all times of the day. It gets so backed up that you can’t drive on Champions Gate Blvd due to the solid line of cars trying to get on I-4. Many mornings we would have to wait 2 or 3 cycles of the light just to pull onto Champions Gate Blvd on our way to the theme parks and then would sit on I-4 for an hour or more. Traffic is so frustrating in this area, that you couldn’t give me a unit in this resort.Okay, now back to the room. Our room was okay. The furnishings were a bit worn but they were functional. The kitchen had everything we needed to prepare meals. Our biggest complaint about the physical room was that the sink drains were all clogged making the sinks unusable. The showers drained slowly as well. As far as the location of our room, it couldn’t have been worse for noise. The neighbor below us kept their yipping Yorkie trapped on their porch for hours every day and night. The dang dog yipped, whined and barked at everything. I literally hated that dog and more importantly it’s owners by the time we left. We knocked on their door several times to ask them nicely to bring their dog in and they didn’t answer. The neighbor above us had lead shoes and clearly must enjoy moving large pieces of furniture around their apartment all day and night long. From 5:30am some days until 1:30 am we listened to the constant booming from the ceiling above. Our building was also located right along I-4 so we listened to the cars and trucks as they slogged along at 4-5 mph blowing their horns. The walls and ceilings are thin so don’t plan on ever getting a good nights sleep.The pool was nice. You can walk to a few restaurants and bars. Publix grocery is close by. I personally, will never stay here or anywhere off this exit again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Arrived 22nd Dec, room bedding had not been changed since last guests, hairs and pubic hair still in bed, luckily there was clean sheets in cupboard and we partially changed the bedding. Told reception who refunded our cleaning fee, however once the cleaning fee was removed we had no cleaning, clean towels, or clean bedding for the whole week. Toilet blocked in ensuite, which was unblocked by maintenance, then communal toilet blocked, overflowing urine and excrement all over our apartment and flooded downstairs. Shocking cleaning and customer services. Shower was so weak you had to stay in it for over 15 minutes to get a proper shower. Bar and restaurant staff and food are awesome. But apart from that a complete let down.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: Im currently still on this trip at this Apartment Complex! It is not a resort by any means. The beds are terrible, bathrooms are far from resort like, and televisions are outdated with remotes that dont work.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Great location, 15 minutes to Disney! Can walk to numerous restaurants (Chilis, Red Robin, Miller's Ale House, 4 Corners Tavern just to name a few), grocery store, pharmacy, bank. Well kept pool area with jacuzzi and kiddie area. Clean, nice sized condos. Better view and cell reception with the higher level units. Staff is outstanding! Had a minor maintenance problem, called the front desk and the maintenance guy was at our room within 10 minutes! Hector, the manager went above and beyond to accommodate us! Hector, Andre and Carly at the Front Desk have absolutely exceeded our expectations! Would definitely recommend the Tuscana Resort :)

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column27: Excellent service - Front desk team rocks!
column29: I was very pleased with my stay last week at this hotel. From the moment I arrived the Front Desk Team made everything so easy and provided great customer service. Big shoutout to the Manager Hector, who was always on top of things making sure our every need was taken care of. I'll definitely come back!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: The time share we stayed in was a two bedroom, two bath unit. The carpet was in bad shape—very dirty. We contacted the front desk who had it shampooed that same day. That is great customer service !!! The outside bottom of the microwave was cracked, but worked fine. The appliances that we used worked good. The kitchen was short on utensils. Our thermostat stopped working one evening, but it was a cool night and we opened the window. Once again we contacted the front desk who took care of it almost immediate that morning. It met our needs very nicely. And all the staff we met were friendly, efficient, and so helpful.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Very disappointed in this resort. The unit was somewhat updated but the carpet was in pretty bad shape. The refrigerator and freezer were useless. Our items were colder when left in our coolers so we used those instead. The ice maker made one round of ice the entire weekend and it was so warm in the freezer that it melted almost immediately. We tried to call the front desk but the phones in the unit were not in service (there was no dial tone, just a busy signal). We were in building 9, which is the furthest from the front office, and did not feel like getting in our car late at night to complain. We tried to stop by the office the next morning but there was a line a mile long and we had a tournament to get to. Also, the sheets were scratchy and felt like cardboard. Be warned.....it is very dark when driving to this building and there is a big pothole in the middle of the road which they simply marked with an orange cone. Additionally, there was a ton of old furniture and gross looking mattresses for all to see stacked up near and around the dumpsters by building 9. It was a real eyesore and fairly unsanitary looking. We will not stay here again and do not recommend this resort to anyone.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Can I just tell you how very sceptical I was about staying here. Although we had a little hiccup our first night. However, our host immediately sprang into action, and took care of us-No excellent care. We have been treated wonderfully since our first night. We are dreading leaving this Saturday. And Letty at the front desk goes way over and beyond to make sure that whatever you need, you have. Letty was cordial, professional, and paidclose attention to detail.We are Marriott users; but we will be returning here again. Great staff, condos, and peaceful and serene environment.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We heard such good things about this resort from friends and family in the area. We were very disappointed with our stay. The units are big and can fit up to 6 people comfortably. The unit was filthy. First day we checked in we had to spend hours just cleaning the unit. The floor was sticky and made your feet black. The sheets had hair and looked dirty. Dishes were put away dirty and the showers had hair and whatever else in them. You should not have to spend money on a dirty unit. The furniture in the unit was really bad. Couch is so small and really dirty, dining table chairs have stains and crusty food on them. No pot holders, soap, toilet paper, garbage bags, paper towel, etc. we had to go buy everything. We didn’t have enough towels for 4 people. We went and complained and they said they were sending a vip service (which never came). We went down to see why they never came and we just got excuses. We got our cleaning fee back but that didn’t even cover the stuff we bought to clean the unit. I will not stay here again. That’s sad because it’s in an awesome location to visit our family and friends. On a positive note the pool is nice and we liked having a washer and dryer in the unit so we didn’t have to pack as much. Plus we had enough space for us not to be on top of one another. Our kids are 6 and 9 for those of you families traveling with kids. In champions gate area the locals will tell you to go for a vacation rental home. There are tons in the area. The pictures for Tuscana are not right on their site. No barstools or fancy leather couches. The beds are very wore and make your body ache. No extra blankets, pillows or sheets. The people above our unit were awake 24/7 and pretty loud. Banging even at 3am. So little kids and babies would never be able to sleep. Sad to say we will not be back here on our future trips. So much more was wrong but these were the major things. We never ate on site so I can’t review on the restaurants at tuscana. The pool bar was ok but no one ever came out from behind the bar. Lazy workers for sure.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Day 1, back and forth to reception to get into our apartmentDay 2, no air conditioning for 3 days sweating like pigs on the top floor rising heatDay 3, no frying pan or kettle to had to go and purchase thenDay 4. Maintainance around again as telephones not workingDay 5, we are sat out here have been for 40 minutes waiting for Maintainance to get us in our room and still no show!! After a full day of being out doors we are now sat in the car!Unless you want holiday hassle then don't come here

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Unit needed good cleaning - floors were swept but the dirt in the living room was swept on the couch & entertainment center. Shower head off master bedroom needs to be replaced - shower water only came out of 6 holes (out of 23)-rest of the water sprayed unevenly around shower head. Coffee table in living room needs to be replaced-one leg was wobbly & we tried to screw it back in but was stripped. No potholders for cooking-how do you cook without something to hold a hot pot. Front desk said we needed to contact housekeeping? Sorry - this is basic that you have this in a kitchen. Two grills on property-need to talk to front desk to use. When we asked to use one of the grills we were told that one was already reserved until 6pm. We said there are 2 grills - why can't we use the other? Front desk said that the did not know if the other grill had propane. Ok, so isn't it your job to find out about the propane and put a tank on it? Customer no service......Employees not friendly-no smiles or hellos-all seemed as if they were just there to collect a paycheck. We took a walk one evening and there were soda cans, cigarette butts, plastic bags,all sorts of trash around the property-uneven paving bricks in back of the units-with some missing. Really - you can't take pride in picking up the grounds? Key cards worked maybe 50% of the time - had to replace one of our cards just to get in our unit. Property is gated so your card most often did not work. Since it is gated you would think it would be upscale, when in actuality it is just as tired & boring as the staff. Save your money and go somewhere else - you will probably receive more bang for your buck somewhere else.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Horrible place with poor customer service
column29: I am here for business and this is the disrespectful email I get.I hope you are enjoying your visit to Orlando and also your stay at Tuscana Resort. If there is anything I can assist you with please let me know. I am writing you because we have had some noise complaint from Guest that is below you. They are claiming that there are a lot of stomping starting at 4:30am in the morning.We want to make sure that all our Guest are enjoying their stay with us. If you would like to speak with me regarding this, please feel free to reach out to me. Thank you for your understand. Best Regards, Kee YuRooms Division ManagerNothing was done to correct the way I was treated as I have never made noise. The units are dated smell and I had a broken coffee table in my unit as well as furniture that is old and broken.I would never stay here ever again and would book somewhere else next time I visit.I asked for the table to be removed it took me five calls to the desk until it was removed. I stepped on broken glass found in the carpet in my room and they never replace simple things like toilet paper.Stay away from here horrible experience!!!!P.s. there is garbage left outside of units and garbage juice stains in halls outside of room doors. So gross!!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Top Notch Service At this resort. Especially Andrew, Abby, & Kevin (Maint). We had the opportunity to have our daughter & grandkids join us on this vacation at the last minute literally. This group of individuals went above & beyond to make this experience more enjoyable for all. The pool areas were amazing at both Tuscana & The Fountains. The pizza at the restaurant was wonderful this coming from someone who was in the business for 30+ years ...it was all homemade !! We can’t thank you all enough for making our once in a lifetime trip filled with so many wonderful memories so enjoyable. Highly recommend this resort .Very nice area with Publix & restaurants right around the corner & Theme parks not far away . We will definitely return to this resort again !

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Our second visit to Tuscana and what a disappointment. The apartment was the most shabby, run down,non to clean, place we have ever stayed. The defects did not appear at first but below is alist of problems. Apartment ProblemsChest of drawers missing from one bedroomNo hairdryer in family bathroomNo remote for TV in master bedroomTwo lights out in en suite bathroomElectric kettle not working the tea kettle on the stove leakedafter 2 requests it was replacedMattress inmaster bedroom was badly stain and had NO mattress cover?The sheets did not fit any of the beds properly and there were no sparesOnly 3 coathangers in master bedroom closetNo mirrors in the bedrooms or lounge !No clock/radio in any bedroomKitchen sink was dirty the plug hole was full of waste food and the smell was not goodEn suite shower did not appear clean so cleaned it ourselvesSmoke alarm in the master bedroom started to beep and had to be disconnectedKitchen waste bin had no bag not even one to get us startedNo cleaning equipment ie a vacuum or mop with a bucket !The top complaint was the land line telephone did not work, it took 3 requests and a full week before an engineer came to the apartment to repair it The public area were good the swimming pool area especially but one cannot be outside all the.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Our second visit to Tuscana and what a disappointment. Whilst the 2 bedroom apartment was spacious for 2 adults and a teenager, the overall impression was tired and in need of attention. Most seriously, we found 2 needles on the floor in the bedroom/bathroom, looked like from an epi pen type. We alerted staff to this immediately and asked for the apartment to be vacuumed thoroughly. This wasn’t done. Bedroom carpet was heavily soiled ( we were offered to have it cleaned or to change rooms but didn’t want to have a wet carpet or have the upheavel of repacking. There was thick cooking fat in the microwave so clearly hadn’t been cleaned. Neither toilet flushed properly and one was leakingand bath/shower water supply was merely a dribble.Usual problems re key cards. Visited reception numerous times for these issues over our 2 week stay and politely raised the issues but to be honest, reception staff didn’t seem bothered and we just wanted to enjoy our holiday and had better things to be doing. Such a shame, don’t know what has happened in the 3 years since we last stayed.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: The resort is clean, tidy and well maintained and the family villa is huge with loads of space for luggage etc..the only thing I was a bit disappointed with was the size of the pool and the condition of the furniture in the villa. The pool is small and easily becomes crowded, even though it wasn’t that busy when we were there. The furniture really does need an upgrade as it’s old, warn and in some bits pretty uncomfortable. Didn’t bother us too much cause I’d suggest if your going on holiday to look at sofas, then save yourself a lot of cash and book 2 weeks at your local DFS rather than going to Florida but, after a long day at the parks, not having a spring poking your bottom would have been nice...staff were really helpful, there’s all the shops / restaurants within a mile of the resort and it’s a 20 minute drive to the parks...would definitely use this resort again..

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Always great to return to Tuscana at Davenport - Florida
column29: No doubt, as I always say, my home away home in the USA. This is the seventh time I go to Tuscana with my family (not always an Aston Resort). As time goes by we see improvements in the facilities and other things that have to be improved, but I can say this last thing because I know the place very well.Apartments are great, very comfortable and roomy. Bed & Bath cloths are ok, but they need to take care of cutlery, they are not enough and, in some cases, you may have to eat with dessert forks. But, honestly, this is not something that disturb in our stay.Internet is great, TVs perfect, washing and drying machines ok, kitchen, microwave oven good too.One very good thing is Davenport is at the West of Orlando, so when you go to or return from the parks you always go against the hard traffic. Davenport is very well located, has all kind of restaurants and supermarkets (Publix, Wallgreens, 7Eleven) for your convenience. But it does not have a shopping mall or a Premium Outlet, which is ok, since no traffic at all!.Go tu the parks, go to the shoppings and take a good rest at Tuscana.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: El lugar perfecto cerca de LOS PARQUES!!, pero sin estar en el mundal Ruido!!!!, Muy cómodo y cerca de los centros comerciales y de canchas de GOLF, cuenta con piscina y hasta un restaurante, quizás habría que reciclarlo, pero esta bien...Se pueden comprar en el lugar entradas a los parques y atracciones que están muy cercas!!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Loud karaoke, tired rooms and disinterested staff - good WiFi!
column29: Having just listened to karaoke at full volume for the last two hours (it's now midnight on Saturday, got another week of this) I'm finding it hard to write a positive review for this place. Apparently it's okay for them to do it until 1am (according to the security guard) so if you find yourself with no choice but to stay here then my tip is to make sure you're not in building number 1. This seems to happen on Thursday and Saturday, but at least on the last Thursday it stopped by 11pm. To make matters worse, after been kept up by the 'music' we were then woken up the next morning at 7am by one of the cleaning staff sat in her car with the stereo on full blast and the doors open. Zero regard for the guests. Next one is to make sure, if you're on the ground floor, that your master bedroom does not overlook the air con units, another thing that will keep you up. The buildings are pretty poorly built and you'll hear every footstep if you've got someone in the room above. Watch out for the cleaning staff in their golf buggy hooning around the carpark. Apart from that it really comes down to maintenance, the TV was hanging off the wall, kitchen is hit and miss as to what cutlery you'll have, overall the apartments just feel 'tired'. The staff are hit and miss, some rude, some just okay. Keycards seemed to stop working every other day meaning a trip to the lovely reception. Extra resort charge not explained at check-in (seemed like having to check people into their rooms was not what the girl on reception really wants to be doing with her life). Tuscana will likely respond that is on the website, but it should still be explained at check-in. In fairness to the morning staff, we did get moved to a new room after telling them about some of the issues with the room. Unfortunately that's how we ended up at the disco. One good thing, the WiFi. Had excellent service throughout our stay with high speeds. As we only used the pool twice and no other facilities the WiFi effectively cost $15 per day because of the resort fee so it's a good job it worked so well. We've been to Orlando many times now and one thing it offers is plenty of choice of places to stay so we will be looking elsewhere in the future (will also be avoiding Thomas Cook who recommend the place). Finally, whilst this is close to Disney you are South of everything and you only really have the I4 as an option. This is basically a crawl or standstill when you need to get to the parks in the morning or get home at night. Obviously not the fault of the resort, just worth mentioning. We'd stay further north next time.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Pros.Spacious three bedroom condoClean bathrooms/bedding.Pleasant staff.Cons.Unbelievably noisy. Upstairs neighbors may as well have been in the apartment with us. They used the washer/dryer at midnight, it was literally like a heard of elephants stomping around above us. Add to this the noise from the freeway....which can be heard through the appalling quality glazing. Rude guests with barking dogs first thing in the morning and beeping car locks. I didn't sleep for the whole week.Traffic. Beware, you WILL be stuck in traffic coming and going to the parks, doubling your drive. This isn't the fault of the condos of course but the location isn't good.Outdated rooms. The carpet in our condo smelled so bad and was covered in stains that I had to light a candle and open the doors to get the smell out. Everything bar the bathrooms was grubby. The couch had the stuffing spilling out. Cigarette buts and trash outside the room in the hallway.I would avoid the Tuscana at all costs.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Our condo was very well maintained, very clean and laid out well. Bedrooms were separate as well as the bathrooms. The only thing it needed were more kitchen items, like oven mitts. I tried using a washcloth but it sort melted (sorry). Every unit will be different though. The entrance and exit are gated, always had cars waiting to get in, I think they had problems with the card reader. Always took me a couple of swipes to get a green light on it, then several cars always followed us in.We ate a couple of times at the bar at the pool. It was very good and the prices were reasonable. As with many resorts they have a daily resort fee, so be aware of that when booking and checking prices.Champions Gate is a newer community and there is a Publix grocery store and restaurants close by.Florida and Hawaii both have bugs, keep your food put away and everything clean, you'll have no problems with them.I would recommend it and would stay here again

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Room was Fantastic. Customer Service not so much.
column29: My husband and our family went this past weekend to this resort. We absolutely love the location and the property. It's absolutely stunning. The hotel apartment was beautiful and extremely clean. The only downside was the customer service. We checked in Friday night and the guy at the counter was full of himself. The way he was answering my questions was really upsetting my husband and I. Then I asked for my receipt but apparently the printer wasn't working (which I understand). Now comes Sunday and the printer still isn't working. The girl at the counter said she would send my receipt right away to my email. At 6PM I still didn't receive my receipt. I called the hotel and the guy from Friday night answers. He tells me I still have a balance and they never charged me.. um, what? I told him Friday night to charge the card and he didn't contest it. Customer service NEEDS to be improved at this place. Other then the employees, everything was fantastic.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Good accommodation with easy reach of everything
column29: We arrived late but check in was flawless, we got to our apartment & it was large clean & had everything we needed, however we did notice a noise & went outside to the patio to hear 4 large air conditioning units making a lot of noise right outside, I went back to reception to see if we could be moved & was told to come back the following morning, I knew by the receptionists tone it wasnt going to happen. It wasnt a deal breaker as it happens as we spent little time there anyway. The bar & pool area were nice but I did have an issue with the bar & their so called happy hour. Beers were half price but what wasn't explained on the notice board is that it was only a select number of beers & not the more popular ones, they also served the beer in smaller glasses during happy hour but were still charging half price of the larger beers, I did challenge them about both issues & was told thats the way it is, poor customer service, however I must point out that the notice on the board was changed the following day to selected beers half price so at least one message got through. We also found that the language from the younger bar staff late in the evening was to say the least colourful & we were more than slightly embarrassed sitting there having a drink listing to this so we decided to go to one of the bars up the road after a couple of nights of this carry on.Overall we did find the Tuscana was well looked after, clean within walking distance of a number of shops, bars & restaurants & about a 30-40 minute drive from most of the parks so a good place to be based

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

Pool area was very nice and never seemed Realy crowded. Just a short walk for some nice restaurants and supermarket. Pleasant staff. Would stay here again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column27: Excelente opcion para disfrutar en familia
column29: Tuscana Resort brinda una excelente atencion de parte de todo el personal. El check in y el check out fueron rapidos y con mucha amabilidad. Las instalaciones son excelentes, comodas, limpias. Se puede estacionar sin inconvenientes, el acceso es seguro. Esta a pocos minutos de todos los parques de Orlando. La habitacion es muy completa, todos los artefactos son modernos y practicos. Fantastica la lavadora y secadora !!! Mucho mas cuando se viaja con familia numerosa !!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We have just got back today from a 2 week stay at Tuscana and we have nothing but good things to say about it, apartments nice and spacious, clean bedrooms. Great pool area and the best thing about our stay was Letty in reception, we were only originally booked in for a week but when we reached our other accommodation it was not great to do we made contact with Tuscana and Letty did everything possible to make sure that we were looked after. Thank you Letty for all your help.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: 17 Christian adults spent a Very Enjoyable Weekend at the Tuscana
column29: We reserved 3 of the 3 bedroom units, found the rooms to be comfortable and well appointed. Had some issues with the key cards, not realizing how easily they become de-magnetized by exposure to batteries in cell phones or remote keychains. The pool area was gorgeous and the Weekend Karaoke by the pool was alot of fun. Cooked a total of three meals in one of the rooms and a Great BBQ Picnic in the BBQ area. Saturday evening we showed a movie in the theater. Just a great all-around weekend getaway. Highly recommended, thanks Letty!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Watch out for the Extra Charges on arrival
column29: We spent 2weeks at this resort at the end of July and have to say it’s a mixed review.The positives - the location in champions gate is well situated for trips to Disney just 15min from the Disney resort, universal is about 30min and Kennedy space centre 1hr 45 so central.Some of the local restaurants like Chillis are great and there is a local supermarket close too.The not so positive, The rooms themselves were spacious and clean on 1st inspection but look deeper and you find broken, cracked and old appliances, rusty vents in the bathroom, a drain for the shower without a non return allowing foul smells to fill the shower room. We were on the 4th floor and the lift call button didn’t work so we had to either walk down or get the lift from 3, not a problem for us but not good if you weren’t fully able.The bar and pool are ok, the jacuzzi was filthy with scum floating on top so avoided that one and at one point another resident allowed their dog to swim in the pool, they were asked to stop it but only after it had done several laps of the pool! The food in the restaurant was basic and overpriced - I’d advise going off resort and visiting Chillis.Now the real kicker - on arrival read the contract you are signing! Tuscana charge $19 per day “facilities” , $60 cleaning at end of stay and $39 insurance, this adds $370 to a two week stay - tuscana claims the travel agents are told in advance, I wasn’t so you get a nasty surprise on arrival because they won’t let you stay unless you sign and the staff on reception are careful not to point the charges out to you! - reading other reviews this has caught others out too.Overall if I’d know about the extra $370 before arriving i’d Have booked somewhere else because it’s not value for your money in my opinion.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Es una opción para quien no quiere el alto costo de estar dentro de los parques pasamos una semana barbara a la mitad que en los hoteles dentro de los parques, pileta, dos habitaciones impecables, horno, microondas, lavarropas, secarropas, etcTodos los dias siendo verano a las 15 hs llovia, infaltable el secarropas.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: The Tuscana complex is divided into about 9 buildings with around 8 rooms each; we booked a three bedroom suite. We arrived early and received a lower-level room which had a few problems that we had to report. The front desk supervisor listened carefully and did his best to re-accommodate us due to a problem that required room treatment ... despite a VERY busy check-in period, the supervisor was able to move us to a better room. Do not expect high luxury. This is a family-friendly (and pet-friendly) resort with comforts that feel like home ... meaning not perfection. Examples: some cracked sockets, broken/missing fixtures, or crooked cabinet doors. But the freedom to bring our dog, hang out on a balcony, enjoy a full kitchen, and laze out by the pool were all nice low-maintenance benefits. No room service, shuttle service (to the theme parks), or major concierge service, but you get to be yourself without all that worry. Summary, be prepared that your room might not be "all that", but just relax and enjoy the comforts of home (with maybe some noise from your upstairs neighbors). Kudos and thanks to the front desk supervisor who helped us out a LOT with the room change!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Nice pool and good food at restaurant but that is where it ends
column29: -No hot water after one short shower-$80 cleaning fee we where not aware of until check in-Toilet moved every time you sat on it and seat was only 1/2 attached-no maid service-no place to buy groceries (Publix is near by but not walk able in 100 heat with bags)-Had to leave by foot at 2:30am to get to airport. Got drenched by hoses over the walkway no way to get out otherwise.-Was sitting in a lobby listening to someone complain they where charged for a 3 bedroom and only had a two and the staff was rude.-No place to get breakfast, small cups of coffee in the lobby.-Arrived at about 12am after a delayed flight to find no one was at check in and doors where locked. -No phone service with Verizon at least.-Shower smelled like sewer.-no safe-Bedrooms where nice

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Great for families as it has no stairs for toddlers to fall down. We booked via Thomas cook so got a good condo (I think they keep some condos just for them) Downside was no oven trays and 1 pan so couldn’t cook much . This was a shame as I wanted to cook cookies and couldn’t . Pool great though, with cabanas and fairly quiet as most people where out at the parks . Would recommend as really close to Disney and around £1000 for 2 weeks during summer hols for a 3 bed 2 bath is reasonable.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Stayed here last year. Fabulous Resort and close to all attractions. Staff very friendly and couldn't do enough to help. Had a 2 bed condo which was well furnished and clean. WIFI was great. Pool area and restaurant was great too. Couple of issues ie broken wall socket cover and issues with patio doors when first arrived but this was fixed immediately.Only complaint which is not the hotel's fault is that people were sometimes too lazy to take rubbish to where the rubbish bins were and would leave their rubbish at the entrance to the apartments and not take it to the designated rubbish bins.Facility's out towards Champions Gate were good as it had petrol stations, Publix supermarket, some restaurants like Wendys, Red Robin, Miller's, pharmacy, ice cream parlour etc.Great 2 week holiday.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Las instalaciones muy buenas y cerca a los parques, la información es regular, me dieron una tarifa fija para reservar y se pago, pero no informaban del costo diario fijo por uso de la piscina que al final es obligatorio 14 us$ diarios aunque no se use.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We have just visited Tuscana Resort for our first time and we loved it. Tuscana met all our expectations and more. We really recommend everyone who will travel to Orlando to stay here. If you stay at Tuscana Resort you can enjoy yourselves at the nice pool area, eat something at the great bar/restaurant, walk (or drive) to the heart of Champions Gate Village where you can find restaurants (i.e. Miller´s, Red Robin, Tex Mex, Wendys, Subway McDonalds etc), Publix, Walmart, Gasstations, Nail and Hair saloons, and much more. You will also be in a close distance to Disney (10-15 min) and all the other parks (SeaWorld 15-20min, Universal Studios 20-25 min), several Golf courses close by, and much more. You won't miss a thing if you stay at Tuscana Resort!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We are here for a basketball tournament and the condo was arranged by our coach. The condo itself is fine, nice size, decent kitchen, but it is in much need of repair. The carpet is horrible stained. Both the bathtub and the shower were visibly dirty. There are water stains on the ceilings which are indicative of mold. The bed in the master is worn out.... curves in the middle... horribly uncomfortable. The front desk staff was rude, could not give us towels for the pool, the concierge could not be bothered. The waitress at the pool bar was rude.... smoke cigarettes while working....kept grabbing food from the kitchen area, eating it herself... then making drinks without washing her hands.....must be s health violation. We have a late game today and asked last night if we could check out an hour early. The front desk clerk could not be bothered... told us to call this morning, but now no one will answer the phone!!! We are leaving now than god and are checking into another resort up the street!!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We arrived (4 adults 2 kids 1 baby) with excitement at our accommodation only to be deflated on entering the apartment room smelled musty and probably hasn't been decorated for a good few years my daughter walked around the apartment in her socks and were really dirty so we had to get a cleaner back in the room fan had a big layer of dust on it not what we were expecting for a so called 4 * accommodation. The picture is of the socks after being washed.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: From the outside the place looks excellent. Rooms at first seem fine too. Then....The cards to get into the room continually breaks down. A regular occurrence is making the trip to reception to either have the card reactivated or the repair man fix the door lock.The gym that is advertised...it’s main machine has been broken for two weeks but the girls on reception assure us the machine will be fixed that day. Three times on three days I asked and was told the same answer. Many of the weights have huge chips out them too and the leather on the benches are ripped up.The internet and TV service then breaks down and the reception claims it’s for five miles around the area. Well, the internet in all the local bars and shops works fine and they’re within half a mile. They’re unable to give an indication on when it’ll be sorted and blame everyone else bar themselves. Then there is the bar! I can’t think of a poorer experience and I’ve drank in many spit and sawdust joints.The barmaid ignores guests while she focuses on residents. So much that she has conversations for at least 5 minutes before serving guests. The drink prices change daily. One night a pint of draught was $6, then $3.50 and then $5.80. Each time the draught beer was the same make and size.The residents mil round the bar making it difficult to get served and the barmaid (who is also the franchisee for the bar) ignores the fact people are struggling to get past ignorant residents.The beer is flat where you will find more gas in still water.The vacuum cleaner in the room was broken when we arrived. After two weeks it was not replaced or repaired despite flagging this up.When taking rubbish down, you have to walk 100 yards to a fly infested tip. When I say fly infested; they’re swarming around the skips.Overall, anyone would be bonkers to use this resort. Do not use!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Lovely spacious apartments with all mod cons large oven microwave coffee machine washing machine and dryer. Spotously clean. Wonderful family accommodation and excellent value. Really enjoyed our time there.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: What an amazing complex. Condos are great with a 9 feet ceilings and grounds are really well maintained with a great pool area with a restaurant on site. There is also a movie theater but never got to see it. It's in Champions Gate area and so close to grocery stores, restaurant and a very short drive to Disney springs as well as all if the theme parks. Amazing location and felt really safe with it's gated community and a guard in dute every night.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Todo es muy bueno, el precio, la comodidad de las habitaciones (son apartamentos), la atención del front desck, muy tranquilo para descansar, con todos los servicios en los aledaños.Cuenta con pileta la que no pudimos disfrutar porque hacia frio.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We checked in late on a Thursday night after a long day that began at 4:30am. Upon checking in our room was disgusting. The carpet had not been vacuumed, the furniture and carpeting had stains all over it. The bathroom had hair all over the floor and tub. The side of the microwave was cracked in half and taped back together. Their was damage to the tiles around the bath tub and the room wreaked of cigarette smoke. I called the front desk to ask to change rooms and they would not let me since I booked through a travel company and that I had to come and speak to the manager the next morning. We were seriously grossed out, but was so late we decided to try to clean room up on our own. Went to use the vacuum cleaner that came with the unit and apparently it had been damaged and someone fixed with a syringe that was sticking out of the side of it. The next morning I went to the front desk and they allowed us to switch rooms which was a vast improvement, but still not completely cleaned, and gave us a refund on our resort fee. We would have left had our whole soccer team not be staying at the same resort and checking in that day. We went to the store, bought cleaning supplies and cleaned the room. We stayed at this resort last year and didn't have any issues, but plenty of others that were with our group did. While we appreciate the efforts of the staff to make the situation right the next day we will not be staying here again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: My whole family went to this resort last week and we had a little trouble with key cards. We had mold in one of our bathrooms and we called for house cleaning and they never showed up. So my mom has never stayed at a condo and they never would not clean once a week. Well this place did not. We were leaving on Saturday and my sister and her husband key card did not work to their room. They called the front desk and they told them. They would send someone right away. They did not show up until 30 minutes later. They had caller id. So they were not answering my brother-in-law call. We were ready to leave and this delayed us 30 minutes. I would not recommend this place unless they update everything and get their acts right. I did like the fact at the pool the had cabanas and a little bar area. Beds were very hard

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: The rooms are great for a family of 4-5, each kid gets a room, parents get their own. The kitchen area is nice to have, I wish that a broiler pan would be provided but I make it work. Washer and dryer are great to have, just make sure you spin your clothes one more time or the dryer will take hours to dry (seriously, it took 3 hours to dry our clothes even leaving the door open to vent the humidity). However, looking around there are things that need fixing but are not. Screws to hold cabinet doors need to be constantly put back in, bedroom nightstand lights do not work as the handle is broken, TV cuts out regularly and does not come back on for 5 minutes. The pool area is very nice however when you have to wait for 3-4 hours to get your room on the first day and have a cooler, the staff needs to understand that you are not using it but are trying to keep it cold while you wait an incessantly long time - check-in is at 4:00pm but we had to wait until after 5:00 to get in. We will come back (volleyball) but I am sure that based on how the rooms deteriorate annually there will be even more things requiring maintenance but not getting any.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Checked in later on Wednesday. Thursday morning complained about blood on inside of master bath door. Asked to have maid come clean. Was told someone would come right away. Sat in room for 2 hours waiting. Noone came. Complained again Friday. Nothing. Now Saturday evening still has not been taken care of. Master bed is so worn down you cannot sleep on your side because both ends tilt up.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Excellent value and close to Disney
column29: We stayed here at the end of December 2017 for a trip to Disney. The resort is located in Champions Gate which is about 20 minutes south of the Disney World parks. Resort has a variety of suite style apartment unit. Ours was a 2 bedroom with kitchen and dining table. The unit we stayed at was clean and comfortable and we didn't hear too much noise from other units. Resort has a nice big pool and hot tub although it was a little chilly for swimming the week we were there. Staff was polite and helpful. About the only negative I could see with this resort was some of the people staying there were regularly leaving there garbage all over the place which attracted the local raccoon population. The dumpsters were overflowing with trash as well. This should have been cleaned up by staff more regularly. All in all a very good family resort.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We were return visitors this year but due to the following issues we are likely not to use Tuscana again.The day after we arrived maintenance started in our block. Reception did not make us aware of this which I believe would have been courteous to do so. There were 2 issues with this, firstly the noise in the morning from the machines and secondly the bleach dripping from the ceiling one day when we left to go out. The second issue was a barking dog in the apartment below us, this again disturbed our sleep early in the morning and once during the night. I understand you have a pet friendly policy but you should advise visitors of this on arrival if there are pets in the block. I wouldn’t be surprised if other people complain about this. The final issue was a piece of metal sticking out from one of beds which my husband cut his leg on. When we mentioned all of the above to reception we were advised that you would give us a discount for our next stay. We are not likely to return due to the issues we experienced which is a shame as it’s a great location, has lovely grounds and very nice pool area. I hope you take on board my comments and have fixed the bed so that a child does not get harmed......

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Good choice as a villa/hotel alternative.
column29: Stayed here as part of a short break and chose to stay here because we didn't want to stay in a hotel. This was a good comprise between hotel and villa - more than big enough for the two of us and all the facilities of a villa. Location demands a car - but then again most do in Florida. Couple of minor maintenance issues whilst we were there but they got sorted out quickly and with the minimum of fuss by attentive staff.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: When we booked for 2 weeks we seen it ticked all our boxes, though you are always aprenhensive .First week done and I've found pool very friendly as all the staff aim to please.Facility's good ,food at the pool up to around 10pm is very nice and after a hard day at the theme parks the relaxed atmosphere invites you for that beer and burger ,chat before bed .Early swims in peace and kids relaxed in the pool in the evenings .Accomdation very pleasant and clean and tidy ,and we are left alone to chill .We have 1 week left and my view isn't going to change lol.Facility's out towards champions gate are very good also with fuel ,supermarket ,chemist and fuel on your door step ,plus a bar and pub if you fancy a stroll .Well done staff at tuscana

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Having come back to the Tuscana as return visitors we were bitterly disappointed with the initial room allocation. The condition and quality of the apartment in block 6 was vastly below standards However Jenny on reception did eventual manage to relocate and upgrade our apartment for the remaining 19 days of our 21day holiday. Today however have been surprised to be faced with painters on the corridors in the apartment block, their equipment and health and safety concerns due to exit signs and sprinklers being covered with decorating sheets. Concerning having already having had a full fire alarm evacuation earlier this weekI am therefore surprised that the managers at Tuscana are not taking health and safety seriously enough for the apartment visitors/residentsMy advice to visitors is check the rooms once allocated if substandard let them know and ask if any expected issues may be planned during your stay

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: This is the second time that my wife and I stayed here. I think we may just be having a little bad luck. All in all, this resort is very nice and has a great location. The accommodations are spacious and has everything that a traveler could want or need, such as a kitchen, and washer/dryer.  Our particular two room condo had some issues such as no working shower in the main bathroom,....the plug for the main tub was not working properly...some little things...all somewhat minor. We tend to have bad luck with bugs in the condos too, but maybe that is normal for Florida. This is a nice place and most should have a nice stay.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We had a joyful and comfortable stay at Tuscana Resort. The on site team were amazing! They coped for every one of our needs and overall went above and beyond. In the bedrooms, the blinds are funny, they only cover a third of the way each, leaving a third in the middle exposed. We just stuck a blanket up there, but we probably couldn’t cope with it for longer than 2 weeks. However, the reception staff were very moody and constantly gave you a judgemental look. The pool was very big and had LOTS of sunloungers. There was a restaurant, bar, spa and a fitness suite. On an evening, some teenagers would sneek in the complex and ride around causing chaos. You need to know that there is SERIOUS karaoke on most nights until late as well. That certainly shocked us! But overall a good stay for the price.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Fuimos en familia, nos recibieron muy bien, incluso pudimos ingresar antes de las 15:00 hs, lo unico es que las personas que estaban en recepcion no hablaban español.El departamento totalmente completo, muy limpio, espacioso y comodo, tres dormitorios, dos baños, un vestidor en uno de los cuartos, zona de cocina con microondas, heladera, lavavajillas, cocina, tostadora y todo lo necesario.La pileta en excelente estado muy limpia y con la temperatura exacta para no tener frio.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Had a great week here. Food was amazing. Thank you Craig and Jenny. Your service was fantastic. Units were clean and a great deal for the money. Convenient location to so many attractions. Bj and Karen Call

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: DATED AND A LITTLE CARE WORN BUT ROOMY AND WELL POSITIONED.
column29: Our family of five stayed here for a fortnights holiday in the Disney parks. The rooms were very airy but the furnishings were in need of an update, as indeed were the bathrooms. Still, everything was very clean and you couldn't fault the range of equipment available; dishwasher, washer, dryer, microwave, hairdryer etc,. Flat screen tv in every room and Game console for the kids. Free wi fi. Pool area looked great although we didn't try it out.The buildings are made of concrete so be aware that some sound transmission from floor to floor is inevitable.Accommodation is accessed via a room card which also enables you to pass through the security gates (there is a gate control card slot just outside of reception as you pull up in the car).Reception shuts promtly at 11pm so make sure you get an emergency number for the night security staff because if you lose the card you won't be able to access the security gates with your vehicle (foot access still possible).The resort is only 15 mins from The Magic Kingdom but the traffic joining the freeway at your closest junction is fairly jammed each morning so you can easily double that simply trying to join the freeway.There are various fast food restaurants, a 7/11, a pizzeria, chemist and a Publix supermarket all within a 5 minute drive.Despite the cons I would stay here again because, after all, you don't come to the Orlando area to stay in the room, do you?

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Nice place not luxury great staff and food
column29: Two weeks here and a great location for motorway. Good thingsPool very clean and toilet at poolStaffBar areaSize of bedrooms and living areaKitchen utensilsTowels plus free at poolBar foodThe people everyone seems happy and enjoying their hols Not so goodA little dated but you pay for what you getNeed recycling binsDon't clean rooms unless you pay extraCan hear people upstairs but you're so tired after such fun days you don't worryNeed instructions for cooker & washing machine (now I'm being a bit picky!)

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: My husband and I stayed at this resort the latter part of the week on Wednesday and Thursday. It was comfortable and staff was awesome! What I did not like was that we were on the second floor and above us was someone's child jumping up and down. Sounded as if they were jumping off the bed. I called office and was told that they would call people above us. The running and jumping continued after that call. I again called office and they told me that basically there was nothing they could do about it! We were very unhappy especially since we paid over 200 a night. The running and jumping did not stop...it was about 8:30 almost 9 pm. The next day the running started at 7am fortunately for us that day we wanted to see a couple of places early. So we hurried up and got out of there. When we left the following morning I told the staff that I was very disappointed with the noise level.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: This is an amicable, comfortable, clean low-key resort where families can chill out in a safe environment.
column29: This is not a five star hotel. There will be things that aren't perfect with your apartment. Our door lock broke a couple of times but maintenance fixed without fuss. However in general if you aren't overly fussy the accommodation will be great. As a European I don't get why Americans don't use electric kettles, boiling on the stove is much slower. The pool area is lovely. Again nothing to impressive but more than adequate to play in for the children and parents. Jenny and staff at bar are friendly and provide a great service. The food is good value and tasty. There are plenty of restaurants you can walk or drive to at Championsgate. Red Robin was probably the best of them imo. There aren't a lot of other amenities in the resort, golf and a gym. However, this isn't a problem as most people are there to visit the parks which take the day. It's location is handy and took half an hour to drive to Universal. I would recommend this resort to anyone needing a nice place to stay while visiting the parks or central Florida. The karaokee was good fun on Saturday nights. I like the fact that it is off the highway and even though you can hear the highway you feel secluded. There is a seven-eleven at top of road into resort and pharmacy, supermarket, Publix, a minute further away.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: The room is grimy. It's been cleaned but only on a surface level, there is ground in grime on all walls and door frames. There are bulbs missing, the cable box doesn't work, there are electrical outlet faceplates missing. The A/C unit randomly loses power completely and that's not good in FL, it heats up quickly. We asked for an extra blanket when the A/C was working but never received it. The pool gate only works sometimes and I've heard people talking at the pool who have come in from outside the resort because they know they can get in without a key. Very unimpressed, wouldn't stay here again. On the plus side, the pool is heated, quite large, and the hot tub appears to be clean. The food at the restaurant, which is run by a separate company, is very good. Location is convenient to Disney properties, just a couple of exits down on the highway.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I have mixed reviews on this resort. First the employees, Graciela, from house keeping, always smiling and trying to help when she could have ignored my struggles with the computer. Carmelo in maintenance 20 minutes before his shift ended had to fix our toilet and this man was all smiles and never was upset to help us. The restaurant and bar at the pool area is the plus. When all you want to do is relax there is no going back to the room to cook you can get a great meal onsite. Dave the owner has a great personality as did his staff. My negatives are the condos "can" be worn and out of date. You are at the mercy of the owner of the unit as to whether the place truly feels vacation worthy. I started my 3 week stay with having to spot clean a filthy worn stained carpet. The general cleaning was good but only so much could be done with the old carpet and furniture. I paid a lot of money. Some of the buildings border I-4 and forget sitting on your balcony if you want tranquility. This being said I will return and have been promised a much better unit next Feb. It is worth a stay with all businesses within walking distance. Thank you Jenny, the manager, for trying to take care of issues out of your control. The following questions are hard to answer as all units are not the same quality. I am rating on my stay in one of many units. If quality throughout the resort is important the owners need to be held accountable for updating.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: This Resort is a compact resort that is close to attractions yet still off the beaten trail. Clean accommodations and pool area with easy access to all areas of Orlando. The interstate is very close so getting around is quick and easy. It is also protected by a locked gate so you can feel safe and secure.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I did not actually stay at the resort. I visited it because I had heard that Thursday evenings at the poolside bar/restaurant was the place to be. Thursday's karaoke with Jim was a highlight of my stay in the Orlando area. He seems to have any and every song that could be requested. His sound system is also one of the best I have experienced. Jim also sings has puts on a great show.The poolside bar and restaurant provided delicious food and great service. Bartender Jenny was a delight to have serve our table. Just was friendly, courteous and mixed a mean drink. Later in the evening, she joined in the fun of the karaoke and got everyone involved in the song she preformed.Overall, this is a must stop when vacationing in Orlando!!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: The staff that greets you is less to be desired. Very rude and inconsiderate. Not personable at all. My AC unit went out 4 times during the stay, he coffee pot wasn't working and the worst part was being called a liar when I was told they never grant a late check out when I met someone who was. I have a support animal and was forced to wait outside for 6 hours in the heat because of this. They charge high resort charges and cleaning fees that are not made known until check in. Room was far from clean when I checked In. Go Somewhere else for the price

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Second time at Tuscana.Pros:-Nice pool-Convenient location to I-4, Publix-Large suites-Kitchen-Unit was cleanCons:-Resort and rooms need to be updated. Looking tired. -Fitness room is awful (including multiple pieces of equipment out of order)-Staff needs training that they are the face of the resort. Smiles and positive attitudes can go a long way. They weren’t rude, but don’t appear to be enjoying their job much-Extra daily fees are excessive for what is offered-Unit has limited amenities. Pretty much sample sizes. Bar soap and shampoo were awful. No conditioner or lotion. Limited dishwashing soap and garbage bags, no coffee filters-Depending on room location, can be noisy-Unit smelled very musty-Pool bar/restaurant is independently owned, can’t put charges on room so need money at pool. Service is very slow due to understaffing.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We started off the trip with arriving early on the day of our checkin and when we arrived we were told that we could not check in early. This was not a problem but, we requested a room with a patio that did not face the parking lot and we were disappointed when we received just that. To top it all off there were bugs that kept showing up in the rooms. We have seen three giant bugs and Tuscana has done nothing about it. Overall it's pretty dirty. When we requested a room change we were told that there were no available rooms and we are staying yet another night in our bug infested room.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: Resort staff friendly Great pool area Room clean Couch is not fit to sit on very uncomfortable Mold on ceiling in showerDoors could use wipe down (fingerprints)TV updated while we were there. Location very convenient.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: VERY NICE 2 AND 3 BEDROOM CONDO'S Not too far from Disney!
column29: I needed a quick get-a-way and decided to go to the warmest area within driving distance of Atlanta within 6 hours. I decided to go to Orlando. At the time it was freezing in Atlanta and it was continuously raining on and off in Fl. with unseasonably "cold" weather. When the weather broke for a few days, I decided to head to Davenport, which is like 5-7 Interstate Miles from Disney. I think Disney is like exit # 62-67, Davenport is exit number #58, I believe. Tuscana is immediately off the exit, no 10 mile drive to the resort. It is surrounded by Publix, lots of food choices, stores, and near the interstate. It was great pick. It has a contemporary spanish feel, upon arriving. The grounds is very nice. My only complaint would be that the Owners of the Condos, should update their furniture and appliances more often. I personally don't want to see a white substance on the cloth furniture on the living room sofa. Other than that, the layout of the condo was great. Sep. Dining Area, Living Area, Screened patio, Ensuite Bedrooms or Bedrooms easily accessible to the bath. I walked to the pool daily and enjoyed the cabannas. The Bartender was great. The second thing that I didn't like was the wild squirrels. I wanted to lay under the cabana and eat and drink my food, however the squirrels were on "10"! They would run up to you, jump on the curtains behind your head, crawl up the chair that you were relaxing on. I didn't like that, but other than those couple of snafus....I think its a great place to relax. I didn't see many kids, just a couple. I also saw over 30years and older just relaxing. To me, I would definitely stay again. I give it an 8!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Volvimos a Tuscana Resort por tercera vez! reincidimos porque nos encanta, nos sentimos como en casa. Esta vez alquilamos a traves de Airbnb, un departamento renovado, super moderno, con todas las comodidades que Tuscana ofrece en sus departamentos: totalmente equipados, con parking gratuito, bar, piscina y jacuzzi. Volveriamos sin dudarlo! precio, calidad, tranquilidad, cerca de supermercado, comercios y restaurantes... Championsgate crecio mucho, hay varios lugares para comer sin necesidad de ir al lio de autos y gente de la zona mas centrica de Orlando

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We checked into this resort quite late. We were given the keys to our room with no explanation or printed brochure about what is available to us. The beds were made but as it was very cold (we are from the Caribbean) I had to put on the blankets on 3 beds.The condo was comfortable except for one hitch. Every morning I had to report to the front desk that the toilet in the master bedroom was clogged. We spent 5 nights there and every morning we had this problem. Eventually, the second toilet in the condo became clogged.This was very disconcerting and spoilt our stay at the resort.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
