column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We had lost our initial reservation at another hotel and went on Hotels.com to find a substitute hotel to spend New Years eve. Tuscana Resort came up so we booked it and drove straight there...I arrived and stood in line that went very quickly, front dest agents were friendly and very helpful, took about 10 minutes to get checked in...Our room was on the 4th floor two bedroom two bathroom was perfect for my wife her mother and our daughter...just what we needed after the hotel that we booked was terrible and thank God we had this to come to...Very clean very quiet very recommended...thanks you we will definitely be back as we live in Florida...

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I traveled with my family and we all loved this apartment. We were 3 adults and 2 small kids. Loved the spacious rooms - it had 2 bathrooms and the kitchen was very large. Would definitely stay again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Lovely place for our Disney Holiday
column29: We stayed for 2 weeks in October. When we arrived we were very pleasantly surprised with how spacious and well kitted out the rooms were. There was ample space for us (a family of four).The hotel is really close to Disney (about a 10 min drive) so made an excellent base for the parks.The pool area was a great place to take the kids to wind down (whilst the adults took advantage of the very reasonable happy hour) - special mention to the bar staff who were very friendly.You have a Publix just down the road so you can easily stock up on groceries (and make packed lunches to avoid the eye watering price of food in Disney).If we’re ever in Florida again we would definitely consider staying here again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Bedrooms needs to be updated. We stayed in a 3 bedroom room, The website describes Queen beds in two rooms, twin beds in the third room and a sofa bed. The Queen beds are actually full beds. There was no sofa bed and when asked for it, they said they will provide an air mattress, which they provided on the following night and it was not fully inflated and off course no bed sheets were provided. When we asked for extra towels, they gave us detergent so we could wash ours since they did not have more towels. At the Reception desk, you could find the same lady from the night before with an attitude, not wanting to help and making you feel like you are annoying her. I observed the cleaning personnel driving the golf cart around the resort like they were in the Turnpike, if they are the ones who cleaned our room, I have no doubt they did their job the same way they drove the golf carts. This places is a run down so called resort. My recommendation is STAY AWAY! By the way bring all your toiletries, they provide a tiny soap that has been stores for years since it never dissolved ☹️.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Fuimos a Tuscana por recomendación y superó ampliamente nuestras expectativas. El alojamiento cumple de sobra con todo lo que se puede necesitar para una estadía inolvidable. Estuvimos en una suite de dos habitaciones. Es super amplio, muy cómodo. Cada una de las habitaciones cuenta con un vestidos gigante y con su propio baño en suite. Tiene balcón, heladera gigante, lava-vajillas, cocina eléctrica, lavarropas y secarropas. Una piscina enorme (que no usamos por volver tarde de los parque temáticos). En la gerencia reciben las compras que hagas por amazon sin cobrarte nada por hacerlo. En cuanto a ubicacón, Tuscana queda a 15 minutos de Disney y a 20 de Universal. A unas cuadras hay un supermercado Publix , un Wallgreens y varios restaurantes para almorzar y cenar. Lo volvería a elegir con los ojos cerrados.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Espectacular como siempre. Es la tercera vez que voy a Tuscana y volvería una y otra vez. Precio - Calidad muy balanceado. Recomendable. Lo único que se puede recriminar de esta última visita:-Cocina poco equipada-Personal de recepción que nunca atiende el teléfono y no hablan otro idioma que no sea inglés en un lugar súper turístico.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Stayed here for 2 Weeks 17th June and had a fabulous holiday at Tuscana Resort. I had been in touch with Reservations some weeks before arriving and everything we had asked was fulfilled 100% we even got upgraded to a huge 3 Bedroom Apartment which was fine. There were a few little niggles like a slow clogged shower it was also just about on its last legs, there was a few cupboard doors that were broken the dishwasher was no use to man nor beast and the balcony was veiwless!!!! Just trees lots of trees. The bedding really needs upgrades and the bedspreads had not been cleaned!!!! Ours stank of someone's B.O!!! And we removed it for the whole time we were there. Our door lock stopped working 2 times. We didn't complain about anything as it was all stuff that didn't matter in the grand scheme of things BUT!!!!! We had an awesome time there!!!! THE BEST BIT WAS......THE POOL!!!! Amazing amazing amazing the temperature was perfect the cabanas were great the pool Bar awesome too!!!! The hot tub was gross had a dead frog and bugs in it yuk so did not use it!!! Even more so when I watched a guest with a baby use the hot tub's warm water to rinse a cloth in to wash her child's poopy bottom then put the cloth back in quite a few times!!!! Eeeeeyew!!!! The Singing at the bar in the evening was ear piercing!!!! The singing was terrible to say the least. We did have a good time thank you.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)

column29: This was a great place to stay for a family. The area was quiet and there was everything in the Apartment. It was clean and it was great for 6 persons. I would absolutly recommend this Place. We had some issues With the firealarm and to enter the door, but they fixed it right away. The only negative was they should have 100 dollars extra for cleaning that we was not informed about before we went there, but still it was Worth the Money.The staff were very helpful and nice . Very Close to Walt Disney world, but you must have a car or rent a car from the airport.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We have really enjoyed our stay at Tuscana. The apartment was spacious and clean but could do with more kitchen utensils. And we also found that the food at the bar was really good and very reasonably priced. We were also made very welcome at the bar by Jenny and her staff.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Our room in building 3 was a 3 bed Condo. It was very clean and well laid out on arrival. Check in staff were very helpful and friendly. Pool was a good size and had a lovely atmosphere even in the evenings where we ate some food and ordered some drinks. My 2 children loved it. Only a 14 minutes drive away from Disney World and well sign posted. Close to I4 which is the main road to get you to all theme parks and attractions. The Champions Gate area is very nice with a good selection of restaurants and a Publix super market on site. My family and I will definitely be staying here next time we come to Orlando

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Room no was 3401, very spacious & well laid out, 3 bedrooms, en suite & main bathroom, plenty of towels. Kitchen was well equipped, tea, coffee & creamer in the welcome pack. Clean & tidy.Balcony facing towards the pool area & in the morning as the sun rose the sky was filled with beautiful hot air balloons. Pool area was very pleasant, bar was very reasonably priced. Perfect base just off the I4 & a short drive to all the Theme parks. On check out an Anemity Fee of $10.00, a Sales Tax of $0.75 & a Tourist Dev Tax of $0.60 per night was charged. would defiantly return. had a wonderful holiday.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: stayed there for 11 nights in early October and it was great, service was all we hoped for and no issues at all. We used the pool area on many occasions and for a family of 6 this was a very nice place to stay, short drive to all the major parks and easy access to the highways.Thanks for everything :)

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Just got back today from another lovely 2 week holiday at the Tuscana Resort & the only thing I could fault was that the very good Tuscana Tavern was closed for 2 days for redecorating, so my afternoon beverage & great food from the bar had to go a Miss for a few days, lol.Seriously the place was terrific, the staff were very welcoming & helpful on checking in & out.The condo 3202 was immaculate & full of upgrades.We couldn't fault our stay & have already rebooked for next march, can't wait.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We visited the Tuscana resort as a family of four - 2 adults, a four year old and a 1 year old. The large apartments allowed the children to run around and play as if they were at home and without the constraints of only being in a hotel room. The kitchen was perfect for cooking family meals and the in room laundry facilities were a great added bonus. We loved the pool area and BBQ area and found the place to be clean and well maintained. If you are travelling by car, it's the perfect base to explore Orlando and beyond. Be careful if using a debit card against your apartment as there is an extra fee of $40 - something that isn't communicated by the tour operator.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: This resort has so much potential. We did our homework and with written guidelines on extra charges from our travel agent and hotel email we booked in travelling from England. The desk clerk was very efficient, was adamant a few extras were payable and our evidence to contrary was incorrect. We had to agree to the charges or he wouldn’t check us in.After 3 days of emails with agent and management the resort finally agreed that no charges applied.Our first room was mainly modernised, clean and well appointed on top floor, in a pleasant and quiet area of resort.We got to know the excellent and efficient maintenance team over next few days as the usual areas needed attention ie air con, plumbing, iron and door lock were not 100%Our second room was not up to the standard of first room. Paintwork needed attention, carpets and furniture were well used and ceiling fans were very dirty. Plumbing under sink was broken. Most would have been repaired if we reported them, but we decided against it after our first weeks experiences.I consider some rooms are used more than others and the resort relies on guests finding out what needs attention and repair. The location is excellent for access to shops, bars and roads.The wooded area is alive with birds and wildlife.As we regard the resort our home for 2 weeks, and hoped to visit the area again, we left disappointed overall.Its potential was underwhelming.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Just back from a 2 week stay at Tuscana resort and can honestly say we were very impressed with all it had to offer. I requested a top floor condo as has read reviews regarding noise, and were placed in building 3. We found it very quiet and our accommodation was more than adequate for 5 of us. We ate in the restaurant twice, it was lovely food and huge portions definitely no starters needed. All the staff we meet were very helpful and we are looking forward to returning in 2 years.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Booked a two bedroom condo for two weeks for myself, my husband and adult son. Was a bit nervous when they made me sign a form with all added fees such as cleaning,but as i was with thompson i paid nothing at the end. The condo was a bit tired it true but it was clean and tidy and perfectly adequate for our needs.We didn't try the pool but used the onsite bar/restaurant quite a bit. The food was average but huge portions. The only complaint i have about the bar is the really bad karaoke nights they hold twice a week.Bad singing i can take.Bad singing and country songs i draw the line at lol.It was quiet in the week but tired from the day we didn't want busy anyway. Staff really friendly especially bar staff and had our order ready when we came in. I would go here again

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Un lugar comodo de amplios espacios. muchas zonas verdeslejos del ruido de la ciudad. los apartamentos con buen aire. camas comodas. buen wifi gratis. los baños limpios. la piscina un poco pequeña y la chica del bar muy atenta.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Need to update the rooms ASAP
column29: Well this is my third time that I stayed at this resort but this can be our last time. I stayed first back in 2009 and the resort rooms were nice back then. The second one was in 2014 and when I compared the resort with other ones that I have been able to visit it started to show that the rooms were slightly outdated but fine. This week we stayed at the resort again. As always the size of the room is great, close to mayor attractions, and nice food. Now the room is outdated, even for the size, the TV's are like going back in time to the 90's. The couch had a nasty stain and smelled like if someone had a really bad time there. One of the closets has mold in the junction of the roof and the wall. Also it had spider webs everywhere. The furniture in the rooms was scratched in every corner and even one of the dressers/TV table was broken in the base. Talking about broken stuff, it was amusing for me finding that the TV was broken and then fixed with tape in two of the corners. Another thing that scared me the most is finding a broken smoke alarm which based in the current regulations it is a serious violation of the building safety codes. This is the reason why I'm giving the poor review, the safety of the guests should be a priority not limited only to check who have the parking permit. We have to cancel and check out as soon as we found another hotel due to my wife had allergies and the amount of mold in the room gets her sick. Just hope that they can fix this problems and attract more guests.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Stayed here with the family in April 2017, Reasonaby close to all attractions. Check in was excellent. Best I have ever experienced. Very fast & efficient. Stayed in the 2 bedroom condo unit on the 1st floor. Very spacious and well kept. Fairly large pool area which was quite nice Only issue and it is small was the sunscreen porch only has 2 chairs which prevented all of us from enjoying the area at once. We would definitely go back

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: lovely resort but holiday ruined by Irma. lovely pool area bar and apartment. However terrible noise from upstairs apartment so heavy footed and unthoughtful. ridiculous. and to be fair noise from highway meant could not use balcony really. well equipped apartment but not sure would come back due to issues mentioned.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: stayed in block 8 very clean and modern 3 bedroom apartment, check in was quick and found it worth our stay didnt have a chance to use the restaurant or facilites but i would stay again, its was about 15 mins from disney park so you need a car, but mcdonalds and dunkin donuts and publix are about a 10 min walk so there are plenty of shops close by and a 2 gas stations

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Stayed at the Tuscana for 2 Weeks in July 2017. Great place to stay, we had a 2 bed Condo which was in very good condition, very comfortable and roomy. The condo has a full kitchen, 2 bathrooms, 2 bedrooms, a roomy dining area and a comfortable sitting room. Kitchen, dining area and sitting room are all in an open plan layout.The resort was as clean and we'll kept as it was when we were first there in 2009. Though the resort was very busy, once inside the condo you couldn't hear any noise from outside. With the Tuscana being in Champions Gate you are close to I4, therefore handy for getting around. Exit 58. The staff at check-in/Front desk are very polite and helpful. Checking in and out was handled with speed and no fuss.To finish, I'm sure that we will re-visit the Tuscana for our vacation again sometime in the future.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: La mejor ubicación a un paso de Disney y con todo lo necesario a mano
column29: Es la segunda vez que nos hospedamos en este resort y sin duda vamos a seguir eligiendolo. La ubicación es perfecta, a solo unos minutos de los parques, muy fácil acceso desde la i4, desde la bajada a solo 2 minutos y con todos los lugares para comprar, comer y abastecerse durante la estadía, a metros d ella entrada tenes: 7 Eleven, Wallgreens, Dunkin Donuts, Wendy's, Publix, UPS, etc etc.El complejo es muy comodo, limpio, super amplio, muy bien cuidado y la atención de sus empleados es genial, agradezco mucho a Abigail y Andres que siempre recibian mis paquetes sin ningún problema y estaban dispuestos en todo momento con una sonrisa, Sin duda de volver a Orlando iremos al mismo complejo, Lo tiene todo y por un precio super conveniente

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Rated one star higher based on one area
column29: I gave this four stars because the three bedroom condos are very spacious. The accommodation are spacious and clean.So 4 stars...but the accommodations we had were definitely dated. Furniture was literal falling apart. But the other problem I had were the hidden charges that you only find out about when you check in. I have no problem with the resort charge, in fact it was in line for the amenities. I had a problem with a charge for cleaning, which we were never told about...either by the travel agent or the resort when we made contact. They also would like you to take out an insurance policy for damage..rate was $39. Maybe if you rent to a bunch of spring breakers, then you have issues, but families there for Disney hardly cause deliberate damage. Needless to say we opted out of the insurance.The grounds are nice, clean and safe. The pool areas are very nice and they have a restaurant on site..we did not eat there. There are many eateries near by.Staff was friendly and we bought our Disney tickets from the booth in the lobby. You still must wait on line at Disney to validate.All in all, I would probably go back there since it is well situated for all attractions...about 18 min to Magic Kingdom..all hwy

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Horrible front desk staff! Ruined our stay
column29: My fiance and I chose this resort as we had heard good things. We had just recently got engaged, and this was a birthday trip for me. On the day of my birthday we arrived to the Tuscana after a long day of travel. When we walked to the front desk, We were treated as if we were invisible. When we finally got the woman's attention, she looked at us as if we were annoying her with our presence. She constantly rolled her eyes, and was extremely rude. When we finally called her out on it, we asked to speak to her manager. Not only did he act annoyed as well, he did not act as if what she was doing was wrong. We ended up tellin them we were leaving to go to a different hotel. And all he could said was "fine, go ahead". We were ecstatic to arrive at this hotel and start our vacation. Not only was my birthday ruined, But so was the beginning of our vacation. I was in the phone with my travel agency, almost in tears, When a kind woman named Maria who I believe worked in a different department, saw how stressed we were and offered to help. She upgraded our room and left us a care package. Once we got into our room she called and asked if we needed anything else. If it weren't for her, we would have found another resort. Maria should be praised for her customer service skills, And the other 2 should have been fired. I have never been met with such rudeness in my life. There are a TON of resorts we could have chosen, and we chose to spend our hard earned money at the Tuscana where we were treated like garbage. Needless to say we will never be back, but we truly appreciate what Maria did for us to make my bierbfau/engagement trip special. Thank you again Maria!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Arrived after a long and terrible flight from the UK to be greeted by a friendly member of staff and after a very quick check in and settled in our room 3 bed room which was not bad for a base for us as we didn't spend much in it as we were visiting all the parks (20 miles away on the I4). The first night we went to the bar/restaurant and was greeted by a great and very friendly member of staff (Jenny) the food was rated the BEST we had during our trip by all of us beating all the big restaurants local and in the parks. I can't say enough about Jenny the bar manager looked after all of us excellent even offered to walk our 16 year daughter back to our room at 10 at night.The only negative point was we didn't see house keeping at all no change of bending etc but had a washing machine so wasn't a problem and I suppose I could have gone to reception to ask about housekeeping. Wifi very good fast and reliable.Would I come back YES

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We got the bad part, unfortunately. We stayed at the Fountains Resort. The facility itself, from a construction standpoint, was of the quality we expected. However, the washer had mold inside and did not work. This prompted management to change our rooms which was a real hassle. The room we moved into had a couple of small things which should not happen in a quality resort. An upstairs bed had a problem in that one of the legs of the bed fell off and had to be put in on blocks the next day. Two drawers in the kitchen had fasteners loose that we constantly had to reattach. Initially the water pressure was low, but improved after we notified management. We did not expect these problems in a quality resort charging premium prices.We had a large group and occupied approximately 12 separate facilities and ours was the only one with issues so I doubt our experience was normal. I believe the problems we experienced could have easily been avoided by proper maintenance instructions.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: O apartamento era espaçoso (reservamos um de três quartos), com cozinha equipada e quartos confortáveis. Recomendo para famílias. Estacionamento fácil, ao lado do bloco.Caso sejam muitos dias recomendo pedir / pagar limpeza, ficamos 7 dias e não tivemos limpeza nesse período. Uma noite o alarme de incêndio do bloco disparou e passou uma hora até resolverem (não era nada), senti falta de algum funcionário se posicionar ou explicar.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Good accomodations but poor Customer Service
column29: We spent 4 nights at Tuscana in July and made the best of it but I am not sure that we will return to this property. I was aware of the resort fees and did not have a problem with paying them but if I am being charged a resort fee, I expect better customer service as well as a working phone in the unit and a functional bathroom. My problem started with check in. Although checking in was fast and easy, the front desk employee who's name I believe to be Andre was not very welcoming or friendly. He acted as if my checking in was a bother to him. I knew that I was taking a chance arriving an hour early and that there was a possibility that my unit would not be ready but while standing in line, I saw that guest were allowed to check in so I figure I would give it a shot. Andre was very short and with no explanation told me that I had to come back in an hour. I was confused due to other guest were allowed to check in early. I wasn't too bothered and figured that they could have been owners or requested an early check in prior to arrival so I decided to take the family for an early dinner and return at 4pm. When we returned, we were able to check in with no issues but when I asked Andre about the movie theater that is listed online, he pointed to the check in brochure and said that the information is there. When we arrived to the room, I read the brochure looking for the information on the movie theater and the brochure said to call the FRONT DESK STAFF. I picked up the telephone in the living room to call the front desk to ask about the movie only to find out that the phone did not work. I went into the kitchen and the bedrooms to find another phone but there were no working telephones in the unit. The remote controls to the televisions were also broken. I asked the housekeeper that was in the stairwell to call and ask for someone to take a look at the phone and the remotes and she said that she would call it in. After a few hours, a guy showed up with new remotes. I asked him about the phone and he said that he was only informed about the remotes but would take a look at the phone. He said that he fixed the phone but when we tried to use it after he left, it was still not working. I walked over the office to ask for a working phone and the front desk said that they would send someone over. No one showed up that night so I went to the office the next day to ask for someone to come over to fix the phone as well as the shower door that was off track and wouldn't open and the toilet that ran all night and never filled with enough water to flush. The front desk said that she would send someone but no one came that day either. My husband fixed the toilet and shower himself. I went to the front desk on the third day to ask for a new phone and again I was told that someone would come over but...no one came. On our 4th night we returned to the room to find that they had finally put a phone in the master bedroom but never fixed the phone in the living room.Other than those issues, the accommodations were spacious and clean and the kids enjoyed the pool but that is not enough to make me want to return to this property. We travel several times a year and prefer to find resorts or hotels that we can frequent but bad customer service is a deal breaker for us.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Stayed at Tuscana Resort with my family for the first 2 weeks in July. Check in was quick and we were directed to our room, in block 5. On arrival to the room our door key was not working. Returned to reception desk, who quickly sent someome to fix the issue. Our room was quite disappointing, run down with ripped chairs and worn carpets. Also old box tv's which were an eyesore. Tried to connect to wi-fi, which wasn't working. Went out for a bite to eat at Tuscana's Bistro, which was lovely and reasonably well priced. Returned to room to discover the door key was again not working. Reception again dealt with the issue quickly. Wi-fi was still not working, we were informed that this would be fixed. The next day the wi-fi still wasn't working and the door key failed another twice. My partner spoke to a lovely young lady, Abby, in reception. She couldn't have been nicer, was very apologetic, quickly arranged for us to move to another room and offered to refund the resorts daily fee (which is for wi-fi, facilities, etc). Our second room was lovely, had newer furnishings and flat screen tvs, it was spotless and beds were very comfy. All in all we liked the resort, clean, great swimming pool, friendly staff and excellent location. The one negative, and this is the one thing which would stop us from returning, is the fact that the ceilings/floors in the rooms are very thin. Thus, if you are unlucky enough to have inconsiderate people above you, you are going to be subjected to the constant noise and irritance of them stamping around their room, opening/closing drawers, etc. We were in room 1304 and the family above us were completely ignorant and oblivious to the fact that we were below them. Their son even had a hockey stick and proceeded to play hockey, in the room, on a daily basis! This is not the fault of the resort but perhaps reminding guests during check-in to be courteous to guests below them, would be a good idea. Would we return if guaranteed a top floor room? Possibly.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed at the resort for 8 nights and our experience was great! We booked through Airbnb, but the condo staff, specifically Jenny and Craig at the Bar/Restaurant are amazing and made our stay so fun! They were so accommodating and food and drink was excellent every night!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed at Tuscana for 21 nights which resulted in an additional payment at check in of $248. Please note that you will be charged a resort fee payment. They will say in their reply to this post that it is an industry wide charge. But I checked with 3 local, similar properties and none charged it. We weren't told by our travel agents about the charge so not the resorts fault. But definitely the reason we will not return. Considering the resort fee is so they can keep their standards high , we found the standards are not high. From the girl who checked us in, who quite frankly obviously did not want to be there to the desk staff member who didn't report our air conditioning fault , we found the staff disinterested. We had someone banging on our door at 1am , trying the handle and pushing the door. When I attempted to report this to get security to assist us my call was put through to an answering service. The woman was hopeless, she asked me the address of the Tuscana ?? And asked me if I had called the police? I attempted to explain to her that I felt if security could come round and make this drunk realise he was at the wrong door that would solve the problem. She said without the postal address she couldn't help me? Luckily my husband managed to move the drunk on but only after a good 10/15 minutes. If I had been there without my husband I would have been terrified with someone trying to get into my condo. I reported this to the front desk the following morning to have the whole incident laughed at, I was told "he must had had one too many beers" and when I mentioned how hopeless the answering service was this was also laughed off "she must have been a new member of staff " was my reply. This incident was not the resorts fault, they can't help guests getting so drunk they don't know where their apartment is but how it was dealt with (or not as the case was) was a big failure on the resorts part. We also woke up one morning to no air conditioning. This was reported to front desk at 9am, we were out all day and returned at 5.30pm to still no air conditioning. Not what you want when the temperature outside is 95 degrees!! It took 3 phone calls over the next hour to get someone to repair it. Whilst the maintenance man was in our condo he took a call from front desk about my issue and it came to light that my report at 9am that morning hadn't even reached the maintenance team. It's not all bad, we requested a top floor apartment prior to arriving(having stayed years before we know how bad the sound proofing is so knew a top floor is the way to go) and we were indeed given a top floor. Also the grounds of the complex are well kept. Our condo was not dirty, but a little grubby. Not sure the last time under the kitchen sink had been cleaned, but on the whole it wasn't too bad. For us we are returning since the introduction of the resort fee and for us it's one of the reasons we will not return. We all pay enough to stay without them adding extra charges on. But if they do add such charges it raises your expectations and you want things to be spot on and for us things need to improve. The front desk staff are the front line for customers and should be glad to see us and act in our requests. Honestly your resort was let down by your staffs attitudes and your resort fee charges, two reasons that we will not return. Orlando has so much choice of accommodation for travellers we have already booked elsewhere for next years trip. If your aware of the extra charges and still want to book I would definitely recommend asking for a top floor apartment. Having had experience of people above us on our last visit to Tuscana it was terrible, sound proofing is really bad.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: This "resort" was certainly a lot less than we expected. I'm not really sure you can call it a resort.....The good... Smooth checkin, the condo was very clean, and the security gate works well. Nice pool & workout room.The bad... The property seems really dated. Older appliances that are well worn. The staff here isn't rude, but not friendly at all. Very short & matter of fact. The televisions are all very small and the remotes are in terrible shape. Very limited supply of essentials (trash bags, toilet paper, dish detergent, etc.).The ugly.... Given that this is marketed as a "resort", they advertise certain amenities such as a grill, picnic area, and basketball courts. So after my daughter's dance competition, we purchased food, charcoal, and drinks to grill out. We were directed to bldg 9 for the grill and picnic area....what we found was a joke. A sad little area over near the run down trash dumpsters and barbed wire enclosure that featured a small playground, 25 ft basketball goals with no nets & a rusted out little grill that was lying on the ground. AMAZING!I went back to the customer service desk and told them (even showed them pics) and I was basically told to deal with it.Needless to say, we would never come back and don't recommend this place. We were so busy with dance that we didn't realize this until we'd already been here a few days or would have cancelled our stay.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: The resort was beautiful and very clean. The staff was very nice! Lisa made sure we had information about the area and gave maps and coupons for are restaurants. The onsite bar was great - everyone was friendly and the food was very good. Jenny, the bar's manager, is the BEST! She was funny and has a great personality. It's was a great stay- I had a great time!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: My stay was wonderful.the room more than met my expectations. The room was perfect, the only complaint was the lack of towels. No fresh towels were provided on a daily basis, that was thw only drawback. My bartender was on point as well. Jenny from the bar provided impeccable service that makes you want to visit over and over again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Been staying here for 6 straight years and love it every year! Tuscana Poolside Bar and Grill has wonderful food and even better drinks! Jenny, the bar manager, creates a fun, relaxing atmosphere that it makes it that you don't ever have to leave the resort. Rooms are spacious and comfortable. Can't wait to go back!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed from 15th June- 29th June family of 4 adults & one 11 year old.We stayed in room 3206 a 2 bed condo.We first all stayed here March 2010 and did enjoy out stay.So we returned and again had a great time.Ok someone stuffed a pair of men's pants in our plunger ( clean or not clean not very funny ) the plunger was needed on a few occasions when you used too much loo roll hence the finding of the men's pants.Upstairs seemed to Moon stomp until the early hours of the morning 3.00am and leave their television on all night.So we were all glad when they left.Swimming pool is lovely.Food is also good and fresh and reasonable price. Tuscana is on interstate 4 so easy to get to the parks.Be aware the traffic has got worse since our last visit.Overall a nice stay here and would recommend this place to anyone.P.s one night myself and hubby decided to walk down too the shop to buy some stuff and a Big storm hit us. Thunder lightening and the worse downpour I have seen in years.We were stuck under shelter at the store for a long time and no sign of the weather improving so made a run for it.Drenched through and thunder cracking above our heads I thought GAME OVER.As we legged it down the side roads a car pulled over and done his window down and shouted Tuscana we shouted yes. Jump in he shouted. What a kind gentleman he worked at Tuscana he didn't speak much English but I wanted to hug and kiss this bloke..So whoever you are Thank you again .The Smiths & The Hawes

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Tuscana Bar and Grill - Great Time
column29: This is the sixth year we have brought a group to the Tuscana. The rooms are spacious and clean. The complex is just off I-4 so it is easy to get to anywhere in Orlando. We always get excellent and friendly service at the Tuscana Poolside Bar and Grill. The bar manager, Jenny, adds a much appreciated personal touch and the food is very good.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Una delle tante tappe del mio viaggio di nozze, Orlando è uno di quei posti dove ritornerei sempre. Incredula sulla location, mi sono ricreduta non appena arrivata ed entrata nella hall. Il Tuscana è un condominio, si esatto, un condominio come i nostri in Italia, con diverse palazzine, con un corpo centrale dove si trova la piscina, il bar e il ristorante del resort, ad uso esclusivo degli ospiti. AL momento della consegna della chiave della nostra camera non abbiamo capito come mai ci chiedessero se desiderassimo il cambio biancheria, pulizie, ecc...compresa una cauzione per diverse migliaia di dollari... appena aperta la porta abbiamo capito il prchè, la camera non era una semplice stanza ma un appartamento di oltre 100 m2, arredato di tutto punto, con lavatrice e asciugatrice, piatti pentole bicchieri compresi i calici da vino. Tant'è che siamo andati al supermercato e abbiamo comprato la pasta Barilla e il sugo e ci siamo fatti una cenetta italiana ! La location è fantastica, tranquilla, silenziosa, i negozi sono a 400 mt dal resort, raggiungibili a piedi. I parchi sono a dieci minuti in taxi . Super consigliato ! dimenticavo, come in tutti gli hotel di Orlando, nella hall c'era una addetta alla vendita dei biglietti per i parchi e una addetta per suggerire e consigliare dove mangiare, cosa vedere a Orlando, che ci ha omaggiati di buoni sconto per ristoranti della zona.Piscina pulita e bar con cocktail scontati per durante l'happy hour.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: The best place near Orlando. This is our 6th time with my family. We always leave the resort thinking on the next time that we will come back. We really feel at home when we stay at Tuscana. When the resort was acquired by Aston we were worry about changes, but the place make lot of upgrades in many aspects: TVs, WiFi (a special mention here), Swimming pool, gate entrance. They still have to make some improvements and updates in kitchen elements, but nothing of greater importance. The same for towels.But I strongly suggest families from every part of the word to stay at Tuscana.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed May/June 2017. Room was more than big enough for ourselves and our 8 year old son. Two double beds in the room. Room fitted out with washer, dryer, fridge, freezer, microwave etc. Fairly convenient for Disney, about 15 minutes drive. That however depends on I-4 which some days had horrendous queues. Small pool but OK for a splash. On site restaurant was OK. Only downside was being charged $39 for breakage insurance for the two weeks. There was no takeover/handover procedure so who determines if anything broken during your stay?

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Just returned from 14 days at Tuscana and had a superb time.The pool/bar area is really good with cheap drinks and excellent food. It's good if you like sports and I watched the champions league final there. The girls behind the bar were great.Only small gripe was the room which could do with an upgrade. Certainly didn't spoil our time in Florida though.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed here for 12 nights. The condo was extremely spacious with 2 bedrooms, dining and sitting room, 2 bathrooms, kitchen with all the necessary appliances. A washer and dryer, iron and board and a vacuum. It was perfect for us, it was like a home away home. We were just a short walk from the pool and bar area. There was music in the poolside bar every night which was great. There is a Walgreens and Publix grocery store very close to it. It is situated just off the I 4 interstate so ideal for touring the area. Everywhere is less than 30 minutes drive away as in all the theme parks, (rush hour takes longer so avoid rush times) I would highly recommend this place if planning to Orlando. We would definitely come back here if in Orlando again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed in Room 3206 on the first floor - nice big bedrooms, walk in wardrobes were large, bathrooms were clean and of a good standard. All kitchen equipment, iron, dryer etc worked fine - nothing to fault! Air conditioning was a god send and the balcony was well screened. Pool was beautifully clean and heated, clean spare towels available, always found a free cabana & bar snacks were well priced & tasty - try the chilli nachos - yummy! The whole resort we found was clean & tidy, very well maintained, certainly lived up to the pictures in the brochures which makes a nice change! IF you want to be picky - then yes you can hear people tramping about above you, the air conditioning units are noisy at night, bathroom drains a bit shifty when you had shower (?!) and there was a $5 charge for pool wristbands BUT crikey it wasn't disruptive & worth it for the pool standards to be honest!!Locally at Championsgate you've got a 7/11 for petrol, Publix, Subway, really nice Italian - well worth a visit, Dunkin Donuts, fab Millers Ale House, Wendy's & Red Robin. 10 min drive from Disney etc and easy access to the motorway ( which we didn't hear from our room btw!) . First time but probably not the last time - well done Tuscana :)

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Me & my fiancé stayed here for 2 weeks in May. The condo was very spacious and clean with all the facilities we could have wanted. Plenty of parking and a lovely pool area to chill at through the day. Very convenient location. Couldn't ask for more. Will be back!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: This resort is great the condo was very very clean and had everything we needed even down to a iron (made me happy), can't fault it at all, the staff was lovely and very helpful and the pool area was fantastic, I would deffo recommend this resort to everyone young and old, would deffo go back, this resort made my holiday even better, thank you

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Típico complejo estadounidense. Buena relación precio / calidad. Recomendable.
column29: Complejo muy tranquilo, con seguridad permanente, departamentos muy amplios y equipados, buena piscina y solarium, wifi en todo el complejo y estacionamiento incluido. Relativamente cerca de todas las atracciones, siempre qué hay se cuente con automóvil.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: My wife and I stayed here in May. Though, we did not have a great stay, the resort is nice and is in a convenient location. The condos are spacious and clean. Ideally, I would give this place a 3.5, but went 4 as that was the next option: a 3 is too low as it is a nice place. We had proximity to Dunkin' Donuts and various restaurants and shops, along with a Publix supermarket and gas station nearby. The pool area is very nice. For our negative experience, we were given a room on the first floor and right from the start, we knew that would be an issue. Bugs and newts accessing our patio(which had a tear in the screen, was not ideal for us. Several lights were missing in rooms and the dryer never worked, from start to finish...staff simply did not action our dryer issue nor followed up with us or appeared to do anything about it, which was too bad as we were on a long trip and hoped to wash our clothes. All in all, a very nice spot and we likely just had a one-time bad experience. We won't visit again, but I believe anyone else should have a good stay, but try to not get a room on the ground floor if you are not used to Florida wildlife and bugs......it is not ideal. Really, I believe that the resort should not book ground floor rooms unless they absolutely have to. In our case, the resort was half empty, so we could have stayed elsewhere....we probably should have asked, in hindsight. Future travelers beware.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Close to parks, nice staff, great apartment
column29: We were a family of seven visiting Tuscana for 1week. I didn’t pick the place, and the reviews was not that good. Well, I like the place. Our safe didn’t work, call the front desk, 5min later someone was there to fix it. The AC shut down, let the front desk know, and it was fixed while we were away. The keycard would stop working, just went to the front desk and all was good. Never any problem to get thru the gate.The staff was really helpful, the place is family friendly.We arrived late, but we had let them know so it was easy to check inn. The apartment was really nice, 3 big bedrooms and 2 bathrooms (1 with shower, 1 with bathtub), nice kitchen, and living room.The beds were actually amazing, perfect. We were a group from age 11, 28, 40+ and 70+. Close to the Universal and Disney parks, about 20min.Can recommend Outback steakhouse in Vineland.We all loved the place, only thing was that the pool closed 10 at night. Wished it was open until 12.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Pros / grounds immaculate. Pool excellent. Bar and food wonderful. Location great.Cons/ really loud on ground floor from people above. Cannot use Hoover as stinks of vomit. Room 4106. Extremely large cockroaches getting in from air con. Gate to entrance never opens first time. Drainage/sewerage awful. Stains on sofa. Sticky cupboard doors in kitchen. Rubbish shower. Curtains do not close so you are woken very early.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We are Florida residents and visited Tuscana while we had family in town. I'm very familiar with the area, so the location, slightly removed from the masses around the parks, was good for me. Additionally, for the price per night, I don't think you'll find a much better deal. We had a two-bedroom condo in building three. My first piece of advice, avoid anything on the back side of building three. We had unit 3307 and the stairwell light was extremely noisy. Given the typical low-budget construction of these types of condos in Florida, the entire bedroom wall adjacent to this light was humming. It's enough to keep you awake. I've seen a review from April 2017 mentioning the same issue and it's not yet fixed. I think the entire facility suffers from a slight lack of general maintenance. Our condo was great otherwise. It had some wear, but, overall, it was nice. We had 5 adults in it comfortably. The beds were ok and all of the appliances worked ok. TVs in both bedrooms and living room. The pool area is pretty nice. This facility is about 20 minutes from the parks. Traffic is always an issue near the parks, so trying to avoid it is futile. I would stay at Tuscana again and I do recommend it for families and people looking for a decent place for the price. They will charge an amenity fee and cleaning fee, but it's still cheaper than a hotel and much nicer. Free advice from a Florida resident with a thorough knowledge of the area.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: 6th time & have already booked for later this year
column29: Stayed for 16 days and couldn't fault this lovely place again. The 2 bed condo we always get has been well and truly upgraded,The pool is spotless , the sun loungers and cabanas are all new , the pool bar's food is still as good value as ever.The reception staff are always very polite and helpful roll on October 1st.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We were surprised when we arrived at Tuscana. The houses we stayed in were like new, Everything you could want was nearby. There was a restaurant and bar on sight and also restaurants within walking distance. We were fortunate to have the use of a second pool which was barely used by others. The golfing was exceptional and easy to find from our resort. the resort people were very accommodating.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: we has no complaints whatsoever with Tuscana. the staff were all friendly and helpful, any little concerns (room keys not working, no DVD player in the room) were quickly and efficiently sorted out.we stayed in a 3 bedroom ground floor property. apart from a few footsteps of excited children running upstairs, we were NEVER bothered by any noise or unruly guests.the place is perfectly placed within walking distance of shops and restaurants.perfectly placed just off the I4 for driving to Disney, Universal, I drive etc.I would definitely return here.full marks!!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column59: San Carlos de Bariloche, Rio Negro, Argentina

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Arrived late evening, given limited information and key cards to room. Cards did not work. Back to reception new cards, failed, janitor visited reprogrammed the lock. This happened 3 times in 2 days. Eventually they replaced batteries in lock and all was fine. The 2 bed apartment was on the 3rd floor. Well equip'd,spacious, air con, balcony was netted. Only 2 seats on balcony although you could have 6 people sleep as it had sofa bed. All tv's were old style CRT (deep) with no hdmi connections.Swimming pool was clean although would struggle to cope if resort was full. Resort itself was very clean and tidy and well maintained.Now although the sound of voice does not carry between apartments the sound of small baby bull elephants running mindlessly back and forth and jumping up and down on their heels does. To such an extent that the pictures and the lights shake. Im constantly amazed by the lack of respect for others. Sound does travel between floors.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Excellent Property. Read all the Contract
column29: The "selling price" is super. The property is well landscape. Lighting is good for evening hours. The apartment was well equipped, clean and comfortable. My mistake was not to read the entire agreement before signing. The advertised price for the stay is a bit misleading without reading everything. I stayed on night and only used a fraction of room. However, the nearly $70.00 cleaning fee caught me off guard. Plus a gratuity is added in. Anyway, the stay cost me about one-hundred dollars over what i had expected to pay. READ THE AGREEMENT. I stayed a in fine resort with the same amenities as here and all except taxes were included in the advertised fee. The property was close for my participation in a State Charity Golf Tournament at the golf course adjacent to the property. So, I learned a valuable lesson -- all is not what it seems on the surface. Even so, I have no regrets about staying at the property.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: All and all I would definitely recommend this resort. The place was lovely. The rooms were clean and very spacious. The pool area was lovely with lots of seating and towels. We had a faulty fridge and they brought us a new one right away and took the old one away. My only complaint would be that the bar area appeared to be rather short staffed and clean up of dishes and cups around the pool area wasn't a high priority on those days there was only 1 member of staff on. However, all and all, we had a very nice stay.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: People as usual made me nervous with their mixed reviews. This resort more than lived up to our expectations. We booked this through a vacation club my parents own. It was a very spacious condo with bedrooms on opposite sides of the condo. We had a nice balcony that backed up to the woods. I feel like I am on HGTV for saying this, but you can hear I-4. It isn't a deal breaker. We loved the pool area. There were plenty of chairs and a nice bar area. You could order cocktails and drink them by the pool. We had a great stay. The only thing I could complain about is that in the smaller bathroom the water didn't come out of the shower head great. But I survived! I would have loved bar stools at the bar area of the kitchen, but I know they were probably worried about people kicking the wall. If you have a chance to stay here do it.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We needed a two night stay in the Orlando area and we discovered Tuscana Resort onlineDo not be surprised at check in if you are required to give a credit card pre auth for either 250 or 300 dollars, I'm not exactly sure of the amount but it will be refunded when you check out as long as you do not damage the place.If you do not give the credit card pre auth the resort will charge you a non refundable about in the 50 to 60 dollar range.The resort was clean very clean and our apartment in building 17 was very comfortable.There are no spectacular views from the screened in balconies. The pool area was clean and the food from the poolside bar was excellent.I found the staff at the resort to be very helpful. I would stay here again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Tuscana is a lovely resort off junction 58 I -4 the staff were very friendly and facilities were very good the site was very clean as is most of Florida, the pool area was bigger than most and we spent a few days there as it was I pleasant environment.One very small issue which I'm sure they will resolve very quickly,but didn't whilst I was there after several requests,was an extremely noisy light fitting which kept me awake for 14 nights on the second floor of building 3 of the communal stairwell.it seemed like a big issue to get a cherry picker in to resolve this whilst I was there as this was, as I was told,the only way they could sort the problem.... switching off the dawn to dusk light would have given them 5 stars and a much better review and several good night sleeps for me,however due to the health and safety claim culture of America this was not an option.However don't let this put you off it was a minor 14 night issue which I guarantee will be sorted by the time this is read by them.The resort is very close to the I-4 which will get you to all of the major parks within 20 mins, I highly recommend millers the restaurant at the end of the road we ate there almost ever night it was extremely reasonable costs and the staff were lovely chillies next door is also good, but touch there on table kids games centres and you will get charged.There are plenty of facilities in the area a supermarket and food outlets, Championsgate is an up and coming area and given a few years will be an established resort area.Over all I would stay at Tuscana resort again given a choice. Please get your noisy lights sorted x

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

No information was given head of time that guests are to manage all cleaning by them selves and that there are no equipment to keep them clean. No information was about the service that was given on pool bar or pool area or restaurant.
