The sink broke but I would not say it was their fault. They fixed it as soon as they could, it was Christmas so staff was scarce. All and all very happy with the stay and would go back.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Nous avons passé 4 jours en famille en avril 2017. Première étape d'un voyage qui nous conduit à Miami. Le complexe est facile d'accès en voiture en venant de l'aéroport d'Orlando. Nous sommes arrivés tard et avons pu faire un check in rapide que nous avons complété le lendemain. Nous avons été agréablement surpris car nous avons eu une suite plus grande que prévu et avons eu 2 salles de bains et 3 chambres... L'appartement est grand et très bien équipé. Un grand frigo, un micro ondes géant, plusieurs télévisions,... Le mobilier est certes un peu vieillot mais on s'y sent vraiment comme à la maison. Le personnel est très sympathique et souriant, toujours prêt à aider ou rendre service. Nous avons eu des problèmes avec le WiFi sensé être compris dans les ressort fees assez élevés pour cet hôtel. Nous en avons fait part au personnel... Après plusieurs essais, ne parvenant pas à nous réparer la connexion, nous avons eu droit à un remboursement partiel des frais ce que nous avons énormément apprécié. Le logement est un peu bruyant mais cela reste acceptable. Nous avons passé un agréable séjour. Merci au personnel du Tuscana pour sa gentillesse. Nous reviendrons si nous avons la possibilité de revenir aux Usa.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed here for a week as a timeshare exchange. The best part was that it is 5 minutes off of I4. The units are all 2 bedroom apartments with a small kitchen and 2 full baths, a dining area and a small living area. There is also a screened porch. Upon arrival there was a mix up in our reservation but it was not their fault. Upon entering the rooms, they were clean and the beds were made and comfortable. Closet space was adequate. The down side was that the furniture in the living and dining areas was old and flimsy. Also, while the apartment can sleep 6 comfortably the seating is inadequate for that number, especially the porch. The pool area was nice with plenty of lounges if you got there either early in the am or late afternoon. There is a bar & restaurant at the pool area. All is kept reasonably clean but the pool could be cleaner and is really smaller for a modern resort.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: My wife found this resort on a travel site and on first glance it was not good as we are to fly out of SFB in the morning early and this resort is advertised in the Orlando area and is actually in the southern area. The condo was very nice and the staff was very friendly. The overnight amenities were fine and we had a nice relaxing stay even having to get up a bit earlier to get to the northern side of this area. Very reasonably priced but make sure and read the fine print because the cleaning fees and other fees are not included and they tallied up to over 60 dollars. We are glad we stayed and will probably inquire for our next visit in this area. Ciara at the front desk did a great job but needed a little assistance from mgmnt but she was very friendly. Thanks for that.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Close to all the Disney attractions - approximately 20 minutes away by car. The MCO airport is about 30 minutes away. The pool is great, very warm and clean. The restaurant/bar was fine. The resort is in Champions Gate, there are many restaurants close by and a grocery store as well. We stayed in a three bedroom condo and it was very clean, spacious and up to date. Free internet and a t.v in each room. The only down side was that we stayed in building 1, right beside the pool, and two nights per week they do karaoke until about midnight and it is very loud. After a day at the parks, you just want to relax and sleep, and you simply could not until the karaoke stopped. That said, we would stay there again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Estuvimos hospedados en el complejo y nos encantó! Excelente predisposición del personal, el lugar es hermoso, muy seguro, cerca de los parques. Nos alojamos en un departamento grande super cómodo y con todo lo necesario. Desde ya volveríamos al Tuscana.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: When booking through Hotwire, the hotel will add a "secret" $45 cleaning fee. This fee is not disclosed by Hotwire (i.e. Expedia) prior to check-in. Basically, they hold your pre-paid hotel room hostage until you pay the cleaning fee. We were staying 1 night and checked in late (i.e. after 11 p.m.), so there was no possible opportunity to avail ourselves of the service of cleaning. All hotwire hotels need to disclose all possible fees prior to booking. Once you have paid for a "pre-paid" hotel room, you should not be required to make additional payments in order to receive the service of the room you've paid for.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: 9 years on and still going back
column29: Tuscana Resort by Aston is one of those gated resort accommodations that you never seem to tire off even after 9 years the apartments have been maintained at a very high standard. I normally stay in the 2 bedroom apartments on the forth floor that way you don't have anyone above you tramping around on you ceiling.Both bedrooms have on suite facilities one with a bath/shower the other with a walk in shower. There are 3 TV's one in each bedroom the third in the living room area the apartment has wifi however you do have to pay for it $10.00 a day there is also a cleaning charge $79.00 for the week. Those are only extras that you have to pay. There is another charge if you leave the apartment without getting rid of you accumulated rubbish. You do have to leave a deposit on a credit card which will be returned if everything is ok it's around $300.00.The beds are comfortable however you do have to make them yourself each morning no room service.There is fully fitted kitchen fridge freezer cooker toaster kettle etc. Washing machine and dryer iron & ironing board.Plenty of parking the parking area has been recently resurfaced The pool area has also had a face lift with new sun loungers and gazebos very smart there is a pool bar for refreshments pool towels are in plenty there is a hot tub and a mushroom the mushroom is only for the brave or insane the water that cascades off the mushroom is ice cold not recommended for the faint hearted + it's in the kids padding poolYou are handy to the I4 at ext 58 for champions gate there is a publix's for general grocery shopping a couple of fast food outlets Wendy's and McDonalds a pizza place UPS store for sending parcels a couple of restaurants I can recommend chills or the ale house.If you prefer a bit more luxury there is the fountains villas which are part of the Astons group have never stayed at them but have looked them up on the internet they seem very plush however I try not to spend to much time in the accommodation on holiday I get enough of that at home.One noticeable down side is the volume of traffic I notice this time that with the new builds in the champions gate area traffic has increased getting about took longer so that's it for now

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed in a very confortable and spacious room, great service and locations, near from disney parks. the kitchen has everything we needed, and the pool area was perfect to spend the afternoon. Any complains, and very recommended.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We had some issues when we first arrived: rooms weren't ready by 4:00 as promised, and items not provided in our rooms. However, the staff went above and beyond to make sure we were happy and provided with everything we needed for a wonderful stay. Ciara and Abbey at the front desk were very apologetic and helpful when our room wasn't ready and got us into another 2 bedroom villa. When that villa didn't have the items it should have had, Graziella and the housekeeping supervisor, Letti (sp.?) made sure we got what was missing and more. Paul, the manager, took time to meet with my husband and make sure all issues were resolved. We had a lovely villa that we shared with our friends from Clearwater and ended up having a nice time. We would definitely stay again. Our only criticisms were the screened patio was a little small, the windows didn't provide enough light for the size of the unit and the bedrooms needed full drapes to block the light in the early morning. But the kitchen was large and really nice as were the dining area and living room. Housekeeping made sure we got the right amount of dishes, glasses, dish soap, towels, hot pads, a cutting board and knives,, and even provided extra frypans and large bowls when we had another couple over for dinner one night. They were really accommodating. We loved the bedrooms, each with a walk in closet and tons of storage and each with a large bath attached. In room washer and dryer were also a plus!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed in a 2 bedroom top floor condo in March 2017. We were a bit nervous after reviews but were pleasantly surprised. The pool area was top notch and spent a lot of time there. The pool was heated, very clean, had free sun shades, and a gradual entry for little kids! The condo was in good condition, had great appliances and granite counters, huge bathrooms. Our only problems were the beds were squeaky and uncomfortable should be updated. Also the rooms don't have black out blinds so bring a sleeping mask! Other than that we loved the area, services and staff were great. We had no a/c one day and they fixed problem in 2 hrs. Would stay here again!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Really good family resort- 3 bedroom room was spacious and they did have some amenities for the kids. Staff at bar and restaurant were great- Jenny, Marie and Craig were great and accommodated dinner for 30 on Saturday night!!!! Great food and even better service! Thank you

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Great condo for second time visitor.
column29: We stayed here for 1 week in early Feb. 2017 with 2 adults and a child and couldn’t be happier. This is our second time there and it won't be our last. We go to Orlando every year and stay at a different resort and this is the first time we will be returning to the same place and feel this was the best accommodation we have stayed in yet. We had a 2 bedroom which was very spacious and was very clean. Kitchen was very well equipped. Reception was very friendly and helpful. Pool area was fantastic, our child loved it, especially being able to use it in the evenings. We felt very safe. We used Publix supermarket, which is round the corner where the staff went out of their way to help you. When we come back we would not hesitate to use Tuscana again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Nice place. Friendly. Great concept. Love the 3 bdrm condo with kitchen. Good way to save some $$$ (especially with our Canadian dollar). Clean. Well equipped. Nice pool area. Good location close to Disney, half hour from Universal. Good price on flight and condo. Except the airline's now hitting with their big baggage fees. Lower price on one end but make it up on other end. I believe that's called bait and switch....Sunwing. Free mini van ... Not likely. Downside:- Bad water pressure- Three 22 yr olds . No internet !! Bad news. Said he be back to fix. Still waiting. - Free Dvd movies. No Dvd player!! - Not much info at check in about: garbage, recycling, waste disposal usage(do's & dont's), things such as garbage bags, toilet paper, other small amenities. Do they restock or do we. I believe more detail needed to small things. - Door key issues(twice). Reprogrammed door twice. Took a door key to reprogram hasn't returned yet. - Thin ceilings. Had heavy walkers first 3 nights who would not sit down. Last 3 nights new people was great. More work to take stuff up etc...but take top floor. But all in all a good experience. Would stay again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Price and location was good, that's why we booked. Got to room and found dated interior with a lot of need fixing items. Cubbard door in bathroom fell off. Was held together with tape and wrong screw. First shower we took door came off track and we told management three different times and no one came to fix. We left a week later still no door in shower. Not to mention it was a glass door and could of hurt my children or us. Comforter was ripped and stuffing was coming out. Children's pool was not clean or heated and staff didn't seem to care when concerns were brought to them. Wouldn't stay here again when there are so many other options close by.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed a week in a two bedroom two bathroom condo unit. The reason I'm only giving it 4 stars is the unit needs a bit of paint and polish. That said, it is extremely clean and comfortable and a perfect place to relax after a long day out. The kitchen is fully equipped as is the entire unit. There is plenty of room to spread out. The other item to note is that we were on the top floor, the 4th, and the resort does not provide luggage cart. There is an elevator though. You may also want to bring a fan or use a white noise app so as not to hear the highway noise. It is not bad, but I'm sensitive to that as we live in such a quiet neighborhood at home. You don't feel like you are near the freeway as you are surrounded by beautiful trees and a golf course. It was very quiet around the complex. The location is really great. It is a beautiful 1/2 mile walk to lots of restaurants, Publix and Dunkin Dounuts for coffee. It is a very safe neighborhood and fun to walk around. And you are very near all the parks. The resort has a beautiful pool and hot tub and we spent lots of time there. They provide plenty of towels and lounges and shade. We also loved their free DVD rentals with all the newest releases. There was 3 DVD players, and TVs in our unit. We will definitely stay there again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: If you want to hear every word, step, noise from your neighbor...this is your spot!
column29: Did not have a whole lot of interaction with the staff except for the unfortunate experience of dealing with VERY NOISY NEIGHBORS!. We stayed on the 3rd floor of a 4 story resort and you could hear EVERYTHING! The staff did try to rectify our issue but there must not have been great insulation for us to hear as much as we did. If you can deal with the noise, like we had to, and had a chance to enjoy the pool area, that is the upside. Plenty of towels, hot tub(which they allow children to use) and large pool area. Even had a kiddie pool. Happy Hour from 4-6, with half price specials except when the keg stops working and they don't offer anything in return. The resort is very close to the grocery store as well as plenty of restaurants. Approx. 15 minute drive to the Disney parks, hoping that Route 4 is clear.The room itself was updated and nicely decorated. It has a full kitchen with large dining room table. Two full bathrooms that are very spacious. If you are coming here to watch TV, this is NOT your place. TV's are smaller in size and the picture/color is not the best. There were plenty of towels in the rooms, but I did see people bringing pool towels into their rooms. They do have an elevator in each of the buildings.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Very nice and friendly staff would come back again for another visit.very clean bug free. Semi close to Disney plenty of things to do around the area. Does not mention but has washer and dryer in the place

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Great view from the condo, but for the price, would have tried something different. The condo was roomy with a hotel feel. The kitchen was Barron. Could maybe do basic cooking but not even salt and pepper available. Paid an extra 15.00 per day for service and never once did anyone show up. The convenience was the best part. Close to interstate, eats and Publix.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed in a two bedroom two bath condo. Our unit was clean and seemed newly updated. Walk in closet in the master bedroom was a nice surprise. The pool / bar area was clean and well kept, although there were a lot of loud kids (not surprising for Orlando). Karaoke night was really fun and appropriate for all ages. We would definitely stay here again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Great Place to stay, Excellent Staff, Great Pool, Great Food
column29: We stayed here for 9 days for My son's National Football Game. We were 1 of 3 families that stayed at this location, as some people opted for other locations. We were so Happy with the Pool, The Staff at the Bar/Lounge Area also known as Tuscana Tavern - Jenny the Bar Manager was great, along with all the lounge staff - they understood we were on vacation and made it the best time possible for us and the kids. The Food was excellent, would recommend avoiding buying your own groceries, and just ordering food from the lounge - works out to be the same price anyway!! The pool area is great - for kids, for night time celebration parties, everything - Overall Great place to stay -- We had a 3 bedroom Condo and it was beautiful - It is close enough to Orlando and all the attractions. Most importantly - The staff at the front desk was very helpful, understanding, the lounge was a great place to have a great time - Overall - Great vacation and this place had a lot to do with that!!!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Good stay but some unpleasant experience
column29: First off the property is clean and close to highway and theme parks. People at the concierge are friendly and helpful. I can't comment on resort facilities because we were too busy exploring the place to enjoy what the resort offered. We had two bad experiences.1. On the second night the ceiling in one of the bathrooms started leaking water through exhaust vent. Someone upstairs probably forgot to turn off water. The leak stopped after some time. Maintenance people came in next morning and said they would look into the cause but never came back. There was also leaky refrigerator that needed freezer defrosting.There was also foul smell in other bathroom. They applied bleach but the smell came back next day. They said they were in the process of changing old shower tiles in that building. 2. We booked for a private airboat night tour to see alligators at the counter operated by Expedia at Tuscana for $85 per person. When we got to the place we were surprised to find out that we were overcharged. The actual cost of the same tour was $63 + taxes which worked out to about $78. We were overcharged by at least $7 each for 5 persons. Since we paid the money in cash and we did not ask for receipt there was no way we could ask for refund of overcharge. It is anybody's guess as to where that extra money ended up. And we thought we got a good deal! So beware!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Good all round place to stay
column29: Condo and resort facilities were all we could have asked for. 2 large bedrooms, thou second bedroom would have been better with single beds.plenty space for 4.Reasonable standard and condition. Pool,bar and food were great and never to busy even in June.Just watch out for the ammenity charge on check in, our tour operator forgot to mention it!! Bars and restaurants were just being built at the road entrance, as well as close by in championsgate so may not have to drive up to Kissimmee now. Thou just off the I4 watch out for rush hour traffic when trying to get to the parks, can be tricky at intersection and getting on to slip road but once on Disney is only a short journey away.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: The place we where given on arrival was smelly The carpets when all stains the furniture was so old you would probably burn it rather that give it to someone This is the worst place I have stayed Would not come back for free till this place is remodeled

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: A gated area of self-accommodation apartments. Located just off the I 4 and not too far from Disney parks. Each apartment has a washing machine and clothes dryer Publix supermarket is only a stones throw away to from the apartment where you can purchase your washing powder toilet roll etc or be like me bring your own I have noticed some complaints regarding the TV's in reviews These apartments have a TV in each bedroom and also the living room they are old yes but hey they do work and are roughly 32inch screen - The fridge and cooker are quite big and can accommodate 6 plus people. The balcony is lovely and cool to sit on - each apartment block has an elevator should you not want to climb the stairs. The swimming Pool is very nice there is also a hot tub and small gym The food in the bar/restaurant is lovely Just Make sure you wear some insect repellant when at the bar because the mosquitos come out by the truck load!!!...... I have visited 3 times and am going again.....

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: Staff was not very informative of services and amenities. Hot tub was NOT hot!!! The beds were not comfortable! For the price you pay you could pay for a nice hotel room for less money. The room and cleaning fee is outrageous!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

For the money they charge and all the additional charges should have went to the omni. Unfortunately we are here with a group for a soccer tournament. The photo is of the toaster in the room. The tv'a are so old and small. The remotes don't work and the telephone is dead. Still waiting for a maintenance person for over 45 minutes The furniture is horribleI will never return here.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: Dirty carpet in dining room with spotsWhen checking in no notification to the fact that we were on an interval international getaway rental and after you use the starter kit you must purchase your own toilet tissue, dishwasher soap , laundry soap, garbage bags. No tissue is included in bathrooms in the starter kitWorth the price but you must bring some items if you are using all three. Bedrooms with 6 people Ask for a list of kitchen utensils so you know what to bringGood restaurantGood barGatedGood wi-fiGood hot waterGreat pool area with canopiesClose to publix and other restaurants including McDonald's Right off I-4 at poinciana exit south of toll rd 429Great location

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We have visited the Tuscana Resort once again with family for 17 days this time , after our last few visits .We stayed in the same condo as the last two previous visits ( 3202 ) & it still lived up to our previous expectations. ( 3 visits )The condo has had extensive upgrades & felt like a home, not just an apartment/condo.The pool , the Tuscana tavern ( bar & restaurant ) are faultless .There are miner faults with the resort, such as having to take, your own rubbish out ,but if this is all you have to moan / complain about , so be it.This is a holiday resort for families very near DISNEY, so please expect a fair bit of noise from children.CANT WAIT TO RETURN NEXT MARCH.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Great apartment to stay in very close to highway and local amenities, we stayed here as a base to visit discovery cove and then onto Kennedy space centre. Apartments are very clean and spacious and have all amenities you could wish for.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: My wife and I as well as several other family members stayed 4 evenings at the Tuscana Resort about a week or so ago. We stayed at the Tuscana several years ago and had a very positive experience back then. That trip several years ago, led us to returning recently. The problem is that several things related to our recent stay were significantly less positive than our stay several years ago. The downsides of our recent stay included:-I imagine that during our previous stay we must have been on the top floor or that the room above us was empty because during this stay we were constantly disturbed by the noise level coming from above us. The soundproofing and construction is more like an older apartment building than a resort or hotel. Needless to say, we were up late due the noise and then the noise began again early the next morning. Thus, unless you are a very heavy sleeper or do not need a good evenings rest, this resort may not be a good choice.-A total debacle took place regarding our room keys. We were locked out of our unit on at least 2 occasions. One of which was during evening hours on our return from Disney. After maintenance fixed the room key issue during that evening we were promised it was fixed and would be fine for the rest of our stay. Then the very next morning the same issue took place where our room key did not allow us into our room. I guess you could say that we were locked out more than once.-When we arrived we were given a Pass Code to open the Front Gate. All went well, until the resort chose to change the Pass Code during our stay and did not make us aware of it. They claimed it was for security purposes, however we did not see any sign alerting us to this.-While the Unit we stayed in during our previous visit was very clean, this one had several problems related to cleanliness. It becomes a bit gross when you walk into a room for the first time and Smirnoff Ice Bottle Caps are littered on the floor in a few rooms. Based on what I was charged as a fee for room cleaning, I expected better.-3 of the closet doors did not function properly. Thus, when you shut the closet doors you could not get them to re-open. Seems like a maintenance issue that they should have been on top of.-Several of the light bulbs in the lamps did not work and were out. Again, a maintenance issue to me.The upsides:-The 3 bedroom unit was a good size. The 3 bedrooms, living area, dinning area, kitchen, and screened in porch were all nice.-It was within a 15 minute drive of Disney.-The kitchen was nicely equipped.-Based on being a guest in the past, I was given a Fall Discount Rate for the 4 nights that we booked the unit.I am sharing the following as part of my Trip Advisor Review because I informed the General Manager that I would be doing so. I am also doing so because he took a very do whatever you wish to do approach with me about it. With that said, I would like to share that after our second key issue (on the final day), I requested to meet with the Manger of the Resort. If my memory serves me correctly his name was Paul (I am not 100% certain). I did chose to meet with him privately back by his office (not in the lobby area directly nearby to other guests), and although he nodded in agreement with some of my concerns, he did little in the way of taking action and made in my humble opinion excuses regarding the key issue and gate security issue. For example, he informed me that the key code to our room was changed at 11:00 a.m. on the day that we would be signing out, and in fact the maintenance gentleman that got me into our room informed that the key code was changed at 10:00 a.m. That seemed a bit strange since check-out time was 11:00 a.m. Thus, why change the code at 10:00 a.m.? It then became clear to me why we could not get back into our unit at 10:10 a.m. or so. In summary, the General Manager's approach with me was sort of like, yes I hear you but more of the same blah! blah! blah! blah! I was thinking in my mind, that he needed a course or seminar on customer relations. In the past my family has also stayed at the Highlander over on what I believe is Rt. 192. We will most likely make use of that option in the future. I was sorry to see that the Tuscana Resort had gone downhill.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: My wife, #nerdgirl and I stayed here with my inlaws for a few days while going to Disney and I have to say the place was a disappointment. My father in law stayed here a few years back and raved about how nice it was, how big the units were and that it was very affordable for being 15-20 minutes from Disney. First, we found bottle caps in the room and a piece of tile by the shower fell as my daughter got out of the shower. Then on our last day there we told the front desk worker that our key was not working. She informed us she would note it in the computer and someone would fix it before we got back from Disney that evening. When we returned at 8:30pm the lock was not fixed and we waited about a half hour until they fixed the door- and the maintenance guy said that there was no note about this situation. What made this even worse was my daughter REALLY had to use the bathroom. To top it off while we were out they changed the key code for the gate and did not inform us- a simple text could have prevented that issue. So if you want a large room close to Disney and don't mind a complete lack of customer care I'd recommend the Tuscana.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Stayed here with 3 coworkers due to conference rooms being sold out at the Omni. Personally, I like this better than a hotel. We had a full kitchen & living dining areas to hang out. A small screened patio with table & 2 chairs is also nice. We had one meal at the tavern & enjoyed drinks by the pool. We opted to pay the $39 damage insurance fee rather than trying to get a $300 hold off my credit card at a later date. A few maintenance issues: burned out light bulbs, no hot water in main bath shower were fixed the same day. Very near Publix grocery store, Dunkin Donuts & other shops.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Stayed for 2 weeks at tuscana in a 2 bed condo . Thought the condo was lovely and clean. Had everything you needed including iron and board, hairdryer, washer/dryer, dishwasher, fridge, cooker , microwave all kitchen stuff plates cups etc.... thought the $10 extra per night was a bit expensive as says it includes use of unlimited ps 3 games (there was 3 or 4 to choose from.2 american football ) also dvd but again not much choice. Be aware that cleaning service is not included in price unless you pay extra so bedding doesnt get changed and bins don't get emptied. Pool area lovely and always loads of loungers . Other than that had a lovely time in florida and would recommend a stay at tuscana.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms

column29: wir (4 Personen) hatten ein grosses Appartement mit 3 Schlafzimmern, 2 Bädern, Wohnzimmer, Küche, Veranda gebucht. Das war für uns eine sehr gute Wahl. Viel Platz, sehr gepflegt, kostenfreies WiFi, sichere Parkplätze, ein Restaurant dabei, großer Swimmingpool. Gute Lage zu den Disney Parks. Es ist natürlich eine Appartement-Anlage bei der nicht täglich gereinigt wird (self Service), dafür kann man auch mal selber kochen. In jedem Zimmer ein Flat-Fernseher. Da kann man nicht meckern. Ungewöhnlich für mich war, dass bei Buchung gleich eine Anzahlung erforderlich war und nochmals ein Deposit für eventuelle Schäden genommen wurde. Aber es war alles korrekt!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: El departamento es muy cómodo y amplio, súper equipado y con todo lo necesario para disfrutar de unos días de descanso. Nuestro departamento tenía 2 habitaciones con vestidores y baños en suite. Además la cocina muy completa, con vajilla variada y lava vajillas. Como excelente rescato que todos los deptos tienen lavadora y secadora de ropa.Para destacar como muy positivo también que en la administración siempre hay alguien que habla español y con muy buena predisposición para resolver cualquier asunto. Como negativo: la distancia al centro de Orlando.El resto todo excelente, ya fuimos dos veces y volvería a elegirlo.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I am just back from a 2 weeks stay at the tuscaba resort with my husband and 3 kids 15, 12, 10 Condo was lovely and clean pool was nice a warm staff where very friendly We ate out at the restaurant 1 night I wasn't to keen it but every 1 else liked it but I am a really fussy eater. We will definitely be back soon

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Just returned from our 2 week stay at Tuscana Resort. We had a 3 bedroom apartment, which had all the amenities required. We were on the second of four floors, however there is a lift The decor was a bit dated but clean. We had to wash n dry our towels & bedding, however they did supply washing powder. They also left dishwash liquid and powder for the dishwasher. However i would recommend you take a dish towel and a cloth to wipe the surfaces. The resort itself was bigger than I imagined but being October was very quiet.In previous reviews people mentioned the noise from the flat above. We were lucky as we only had people above us for 2 nights of our stay. We could hear them moving about and talking but in general it didn't bother us, but I could have been a problem if kids were running about for the whole of our stay. Our flat was carpeted throughout but don't know if they were all the same. Better sound proofing we be an improvement . The pool area is lovely with plenty of beds and clean towels supplied. We also had a meal on site which was tasty with the bar prices reasonable. We didn't go down for the entertainment in the evening so can't comment on that. The staff were all friendly.The resort is just off the I 4 motorway , about 20 mins from Disney and about an hour to Tampa, so very easy to get to. I would go back to Tuscana Resort

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Just stayed here .... It's a joke . I wouldn't stay again if I'm honest . Two biggest issues are the walls and floors in the apartments must be made of paper as I could hear everything the people around us were doing in the daytime and nighttime if you get my drift also the apartments are very dated although the place itself was clean and tidy. I've never been charged an amenity fee before and I've stayed in a fair few places . There's also no maid or cleaning service in your apartment . You must wash your own towels and linen. First person I spoke to at the front desk on arrival was rude and clearly didn't like her job enough to answer a couple of questions in a friendly manner . Definitely wouldn't stay here again .

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We ended up here because the Omni was sold out for a conference. We were pleasantly surprised. 2br, 2 bath, condo with kitchen den and 3 tvs..and we paid only $76 per nt. Great pool and snackbar. Now it is not a Disney Resort or the Omni, but for the price, it was super awesome. Could use some upgrades for furniture, but lots of room!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: A nice place close to Disney World
column29: This was a very nice place to stay. We had a 3 bedroom/2 bathroom condo that the 5 of us enjoyed and had plenty of room. Since this resort was next door to a golf course, we thought it would be pretty quite. But unfortunately that was not the case at the building we were in. We were on the noisy side of the grounds near the expressway. Very noisy especially when we were sitting on the balcony, but otherwise it was fine. So I would say if booking ask for a unit close by the golf course away from the highway. We also had a surprise when we went out to get into our car to go out to eat on Friday night. A huge hole in our wind shield made by a golf ball. I still have the ball lol. So now our insurance will pay the rental company to have it repaired, but the deductible will come out of our pocket. That doesn't seem to be fair now does it? The resort will not take any responsibility and they did not even know the name of the Gold course so we could contact them. We had to fly out on Saturday morning, so we did not have the time to pursue the issue. This resort was very handy to get on and off the expressway to travel to explore other places. "We found great restaurants close by that we enjoyed most every night for dinner. This resort had a very nice pool and area with many cabanas; first come basis. Also at the pool area were bathrooms and also a nice little bar and grill which we enjoyed very much. The food was pretty good as were any drinks we had. yes, we would recommend staying here, but get a building and unit far away from the expressway. We were in building number 5 on second floor. nice to have stairs and a elevator to use.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I have just had a two week holiday at this location, I had a three bedroom condo which had a double bedroom suite with bathroom and shower, another double bed bedroom, and a third bedroom with two single beds. A second bathroom with shower is also provided along with a fully fitted kitchen living room and dining room. The master bedroom also has a safe. The condo was clean and tidy and we enjoyed our stay here and would return again. There was a large pool on site with a bar restaurant and gym. The staff were friendly.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We booked through Thomson holidays staying for 2 weeks in a 2 bedroom condo. Check in was quick and easy. No hidden fees. We opted to pay the $39 as an insurance rather than hold a fee on the credit card. The condo was clean and spacious with everything you need to stay self catering. 2 very large bedrooms with walk in closets and 2 large bathrooms. The balcony is screened which is great. Parking is free. No cleaning service but we are used to staying in a villa so this was not an issue for us, we prefer the privacy.We made use of the free DVD hire. We reall enjoyed our stay here which overall we found very relaxing even throughout hurricane Matthew's turmoil. Location wise we found it perfect, whilst we did not visit Disney during this trip, it is only 1 or 2 junctions away on the I4 or the toll road and depending on traffic, about 20 minutes to Universal. The pool area, bar and restaurant were great. Jacuzzi was lovely.Publix, Walgreens, Chilis, Millers, Wendy's, Red Robin, McDonalds, an Italian, Fish and chip shop and Subway and more all at the end of the road in Championsgate.The only negatives were, we stayed in block 6 which backed on to the I4 which we found a bit too loud - the plus side of this is we were up super early every day with the road noise so got more done and we were a short walk to dump the trash. The other negative was the seating. We found that the couch and seat were very uncomfortable in our condo. I did email a few weeks prior to arriving to ask about possibly upgrading to a select condo but never received a reply. Overall we liked the resort and would probably book again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed in a 3 bedroom condo near the pool. Everything has been great. The condo is very roomy with every amenity we need. The pool area is very relaxing with a nice bar just off to the side. There is a bar happy hour every day with great prices! Our little ones have loved the zero entry pool as well as the kiddie pool.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: Excelente.. sin critica alguna!La pileta abierta hasta tarde, muy buena atencion aunque quizas deberian hanlar un poco mas d español...Tuvimos inconvenientes con el aire y en 20 minutos lo solucionaron.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Lovely If you want a quieter area.
column29: Really enjoyed our stay here, it is close to the Disney parks but away from the busyness of international drive. It was lovely coming back for a swim and some quiet time after all the excitement of the parks. Our apartment was large and well equipped. Some of the fittings were a little dated, but they worked well, and the apartment was clean and comfortable. It probably wouldn't work for a group who wanted to be in the middle of the shops, restaurants and attractions but it suited our family down to the ground. I especially loved the cabanas around the pool, which gave it a secluded, luxury feel.Our one frustration was the very noisy family above us. I guess they could have been anywhere though.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We have literally just checked out of our 3 bedroomed accommodation. We were dubious about staying here as we'd booked it with Thomsons before reading any reviews but have to say we have had a lovely stay. We stayed in building 3 on the top floor. Found it really quiet, apartments are fully equipped with everything you'd need at home. Very clean and plenty of towels etc. Staff very friendly and welcoming even providing us with directions to Hollywood beach which they printed off for us. Lovely clean pool which also had cabanas. We have visited Florida 8 times and would definitely return to Tuscana for another visit! Our only negative comments is with Alamo car rental. When we landed at the airport they didn't have the car we had upgraded to so they gave us one to tide us over until the next day. No phone call from them the next day we had to ring them 6 times and had to wait around all day for them to exchange cars. Won't be using them again. Customer service was non existent.

column29: Hay all although we don't stay at this resort we have been coming Orlando for 10 years and always go to tuscana on a sat night for the food and amazing karaoke from dj Tim and adavina and the best bar staff I have seen anywhere but this year the barmaid was a bit off only because someone had put a complaint in about her !!!!!!! Get a life whoever done this the barmaid Jenny omg is the best out there and they are lucky to have her dancing on the bar brill never late with drinks always a good night when she is left to do her thing thank you tim adavina and Jenny love my sat nights with you coyote ugly eat your heart out

column29: Quick Check in . Polite staff.Although, those hidden fees for Resort and cleaning. Advised us that there would be someone from expedia at reception next morning selling Park tickets(real helpful guy by the way)Oh. To stay at this place you will need to Drive or hire a Car. We did see taxis ..... but might be expensive. We were on the ground floor. We had kids on the top floor , who would make a racket when running. But we didn't stay in much. Really nice rooms and kitchen , bathrooms. Had plates ,cutlery . All you need for a few days. TV was basic. You where required to dispose of your own Trash(Not a problem) The Lights in the living room and dinning had blown, but we didn't need them as we were out most of the time. The Playstation 3 said it had Netflix, but we couldn't use it. The pool was really nice. Our minor issue might be that Wifi was really slow. Other than that , a nice place to stay at. We might be staying at this resort again .

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column27: September 2016, Tuscana a great FAMILY Hotel!!!
column29: Hi, this is my first review however think it might be useful for anyone looking to have a orlando holiday in the future.We stayed here first 2 weeks of September 2016, we had a 2 bedroom apartment and I have to say very very nice, coming from the UK this apartment was much bigger than you average sized 2 bedroom home in the UK, Full kitchen and appliances, 2 bedroom 2 bathroom, dining area and a living area, both bedrooms were huge with walk in wardrobes both had double beds. We stayed in building 6 was a little closer to the i4 than I would like but didn't effect my stay, this accommodation is fully self catering so do not get the daily housekeeping coming in tidying up after you but didn't bother me and a small walk to put the bins out, and for me was just outside my building, very clean apartment and 3 flat screen tvs kept the kids happy, local shops include (walgreens, 7 11, dunkin doughnuts and publix) and local restaurants include Chillis all right on the doorstep.Pool was nice and happy hour even better $1.75 bud lights what more can you needOverall a very very nice place to stay and would definitely return for another visit in the future the only draw back is that it was a little bit too far away from most attractions, around 25mins to universal and around 15-20mins to Disney so a rental car is essential don't even think about this hotel if you don't want to drive, nut we really loved the place felt very secure and comfortable.I booked with Thomson holidays and the usual $14 per day resort charge and the $50 cleaning charges did not apply to me a great saving of nearly $200 which you would pay in an idrive resort etcVery nice and Very happy

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: 3 couples and we enjoyed every minute of our stay. The resort was clean and felt like home. It was a condo, washer/dryer, dishwasher, etc. Movie Room, Pool, staff was helpful and amazing. I will be traveling to Florida next year and will be staying at this resort!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column27: August 2016, Tuscana stay. Amazing family holiday
column29: Great family condo with large rooms and very clean all around. Fantastic staff very helpful whenever you call. Close to amenities which is very handy. Has a restaurant and a bar on site. Above all close to parks and easy to get to in our rented car.Would always stay at the Tuscana anytime we visit. And would definitely recommend. Lots of parking available for cars and security is paramount.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms

column29: Stayed at Tuscana resort in 3 bed apartment , after reading some reviews was a bit nervous, should have known better.This resort is an outstanding place to stay its 20-25 mins away from all parks in the area, Disney no more than 10 mins, obviously a car is essential ,there are also lots of parking spaces.Rooms were large and spacious, clean and tidy with all you need for 2or 3 weeks away.Ok so TVs were old and boxy,but washing machine was excellent,but friends who we traveled with had flat screens in their apartment, and décor was a bit newer,luck of the draw, but, who goes to Orlando to watch TV and look at paintwork? Staff were very helpful, grounds were immaculate ,and the pool area couldn't be faulted. Will definitely stay here again, and I've never stayed in the same place twice, privacy of a villa with advantages of an hotel.

column27: Fantastic stay at Tuscana,cannot fault it
column29: We booked through Thomas cook,and check in was quick and easy.Got given a card to allow you to have a free movie rental for your room each day if you wish.We didnt get the chance to use this as our days were so busy.The condo was great,walked in and was impressed how clean and spacious it was.The walk in closets were a great size and having 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms was perfect for us.The full kitchen had everything you could need.The pool area is fabulous,with lots of loungers and shaded areas.We felt very safe and secure in this resort and would not hesitate to return here.The whole resort is very clean and beautifully maintained.Cant wait to plan a return to Tuscana :)

column29: Une résidence très impersonnelle, étendue sur une grande superficie (beaucoup de logements) et dont les photos ne montrent que les abords de la piscine... à éviter absolument les buildings 5 et 6 très proches de l'autoroute 4 dont le trafic ne cesse jamais. Les appartements sont à l'américaine, très kitch avec moquette et moustiquaire pas très nettes. J'ai trouvé une petite "bête" dans un placard de la cuisine, et les lits ne sont pas faits durant les 3 nuits du séjour !!! Il a fallu aller déposer nos poubelles dans un benne au fond de la résidence... Sinon, impossible de rester sur le balcon à cause du bruit de la route et des climatiseurs, mais 3 TV dans l'appartement de 2 chambres et 2 salles de bain. Assez commode pour rejoindre les parcs de Disney et Universal, mais vraiment sans charme ni attrait.

column29: Stayed in 3 bedroom apartment. It was very clean and provided enough room for our large family. Other family members stayed in different units so that we could all be together on our vacation. The kids loved the pool area, and the adults loved the pool bar! We had no difficulty snatching up a pool cabana on the couple of days we spent at the pool. It was also very easy to get to and from the parks in our rented car. Looking forward to coming back!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Stayed at the complex for two weeks and I agree in some part with some of the reviews that I had read before my holiday .We stayed in a three bedroom condo and yes it was a little old fashioned and needed a little TLC but it was clean and served its purpose . We only used this as a base as we were at the parks or out and about most days . The condo itself was huge and provided more than enough space for the four of us . We visited the pool twice and I would give that five stars , clean , towels provided , water at a lovely comfortable temperature and the food was good also. We have a few issues with some appliances , the food dispenser leaked and there was a fault in the patio door but this was very quickly rectified when reported to reception . Overall a lovely stay in Florida and I would defiantly consider staying again as I believe all condos are being update .

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: Despite some of the reviews about tired apartments, I found our stay at Tuscana to be more than agreeable. I would have gone for the full 5 marks, but for the noise of the i-4 outside my window! Other than that, I actually cannot praise the place enough! We stayed Friday to Friday. The apartment was spacious, clean, comfortable and exactly what I had wanted. The staff were great, especially Christine (who sometimes pretends to be Jenny apparently!) behind the bar. She was fabulous! On one night, our air con was not working so great. After a quick word at reception, it was fixed to the perfect temperature, without a hitch! Excellent service!The staff around the site were polite, courteous and always smiling. We felt safe, secure and at home here, so thank you to the Tuscana Resort Orlando!

column29: Muy bueno todo, excelente el lugar y accesible de la interestatal 4 que es la autopista que conecta con los parques de disney y univesal.Los apartamentos son enormes y con muchas comodiades. Excelnete para ir en familia y/o pareja.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Great price and location but really noisy rooms
column29: Stayed for 2 weeks and to be honest first week was great, our apartment was close to the pool. Had to pay $39 for extras like wifi etc and had a few minor issues with wifi but they were sorted relatively quick. The rooms are really spacious and with air con and screened windows and balcony to make the stay much more comfortable. We were really enjoying our stay until our neighbours above moved in. You could hear everything from general walking across the floor to them taking a pee, running a shower, kids jumping about as kids do, literally everything. This was fine we went as a family ourselves so expected to hear kids having fun but not so loud as if they were in the same room. They must of had jet lag as they were up making noise at 1am-5am. On the 3rd night of them arriving we phoned reception to ask if they could be made aware of their noise and things were quieter for the next night but it returned for the remainder of our trip. Its such a shame because everything else was value for money, but with no sleep it wasn't the same. One tip, don't take one single towel with you. This hotel provides you with washing towels and over at the pool they provide swimming towels so you can free some space in your suitcase.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: Es la segunda vez que me alojó en Tuscana Resorts, es excelente en todos los sentidos. Las habitaciones son amplias, cómodas y con todos los servicios. La ubicación es fantástica para recorrer los parques de Disney y Universal, y además también está cerca para recorrer el centro de Orlando. Lo mejor de todo es el precio, accesible y acorde a la gran prestación de servicios. Para volver siempre.

column29: Accommodation was clean comfortable and had everything we needed, the staff were brilliant friendly and professional. The pool side bar/cafe and restaurant had evening entertainment and the food was great too. My kids aged 11 and 13 loved the grand pool and bar entertainment which meant us adults got some quiet time too! The location is ideal for all the parks and attractions with shops and restaurants on the door step. We have already booked our next stay and can't wait to return.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Having stayed in international drive in basic accomadation on our last trip to Florida a few years ago we decided to try something new which was recommended by American holidays! We were not disappointed! I couldn't rate this place enough! It was spotless with 2 great sized bedrooms both with ensuites! Modern appliances in kitchen with great washing and drying facilities! The pool area was beautiful and we actually had the nicest meals compared to other restaurant about which were far more reasonable! It's in such a beautiful location with Walgreens, mc Donald's, dinky donuts etc just outside the complex! I highly rate Tuscana to anyone and I will certainly return here in the future!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column27: Buena estadía. Atención y servicios para mejorar
column29: Resort cómodo, estuvimos alojados una semana, si bien no pasamos mucho tiempo dentro del resort, ya que estuvimos en los parques de Disney y universal todos los idas, puedo dejar ciertos detalles. Posee acceso restringido con seguridad las 24 hs. La habitación muy grande y cómoda (estuvimos en una de 3 habitaciones, 2 baños), con cocina, comedor, aunque los colchones de las camas individuales eran de muy mala calidad. Comentamos eso en el front desk, y nos dijeron que no podían resolverlo. Está ubicado a 20 minutos de los parques de Disney.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Well this was my 6th Visit to the Tuscana Resort! For those unsure where to book this is a good base though it looks further out when you look at a map in-fact is a great location just off the I4 and just a couple exits to Disney and the 192.Champions gate has grown so there are a few restaurants a stones throw away.As to the resort - if you do encounter any issues the maintenance team at the resort are great and will act swiftly to resolve any issues that may arise.Checking in I admit is quite slow and I think the front desk staff could act just a tiny bit faster as the last thing you want after a long journey is to be kept waiting while they tap around on a screen when you are standing there being served. They are polite but very slow!That aside very pleasant resort great pool and pool side bar!Highly recommend for you to stay there and like my self you will be sure to return for your next visit!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed at Tuscana Resort as a base during a 2 week vacation and stayed in a 2 bed condo. The resort felt secure with coded security gates. Pros: The rooms were a good size and were well appointed with full sized oven, washer / dryer, refrigerator, dishwasher etc. There is a Publix close by and Millars Ale House a short drive/walk away. The swimming area is clean and modern with towels available for guests. I did not eat in the pool bar but other members of our party did. They assured me it was of decent quality and reasonable prices. Good location with regards Disney. Quite a distance from main tourist areas. This didn't bother us as such but may bother others. What I would say though is that a car is ABSOLUTELY ESSENTIAL! Do not come here without a car, this is not international drive. If you don't have a car then you will pay a lot of money for taxis!Cons: We were aware of the cleaning and resort fees prior to our stay but I feel if they were built into the price of the room it wouldn't leave such a sour taste in the mouth of guests. The BBQ area that is mentioned in hotel literature is embarrassingly bad, so much so that I wouldn't even have mentioned them had I been in charge of facilities. It consists of 2 primitive, disgustingly dirty bbqs that are well passed their glory days in the middle of a grass area that is not lit at night. When I contrast this to the immaculately presented large gas bbq ovens that are cleaned down every morning for guests and in well lit designated areas that were available for guests in the Sheraton Vistana Villages resort where we stayed last year I am very disappointed - a small point perhaps, but we love to BBQ and something the resort could improve upon!The trash area is close to a wooded area and the skips were often piled high with trash, this needs to be kept on top of as inevitably local wildlife become attracted to it. On almost every occasion when taking down the trash, I witnessed raccoons in and around the trash area. Overall though we were quite pleased by the overall package, some areas for improvement that grated on me somewhat, but I believe for the price we paid, the Tuscana was just fine and I would probably recommend it to others. (I should say that I have stayed in at least 5 other similar condo resorts in recent years in the Orlando area and these are my opinions when I compare my stay to other resorts. The other guests in my party had never visited Orlando before and were much more complimentary on the resort.)

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We have just returned home from our 2 week holiday (checked in July 22nd-checked our August 5th.)We stayed in apt 3202 block 3, 2 bedroom 2 bath apartment was very clean upon arrival and fully equipped,it was a very comfortable base for our travels to the theme parks ,outlets and restaurants.There are quite a few places nearby to eat,Chilis,red robin gourmet burgers ,wendys etc.Pool area is great with plenty of available sunbeds and cabanas,also has own bar/restaurant.Only negative is that the corridor lights could do with being switched on earlier as it is sometimes a little dark when you return to your room.Very close to Disney off the i4 (about 10-15 minutes) Universal is about 30 minutes away.Complex seemed very secure with gated access for cars,free dvd rentals for duration of stay.Would happily recommend and consider for our next Florida stay

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Much better than expected. Perfect for families.
column29: When looking for accommodation large enough for my family, I was quite limited. The Tuscana Resort was an option but the brochure pictures made it look a little old fashioned. Had to book there in the end and pleased we did. Our three bed apartment was more than big enough and the balcony has a handy mosquito/bug net on which keeps them out. Room was spotless and the complex is within handy and easy reach of the I-4 (main motorway). Although not needed by everyone I imagine, the apartment had its own washer and dryer which was really handy for us. Fridge-Freezer, oven, microwave and hob too. We didn't use the poolside bar or eat from there but we used the pool which we all loved. Again clean and a great temperature. This complex is perfect for families on a self drive holiday who are happy to just get on with it themselves. You will need a car! About fifteen mins from the Disney Parks and half an hour from Universal. Also there are two Publix supermarkets close by and a big Walmart about twenty mins away. (20mins seems a long way but because everything is spread out, it doesn't feel it). Airport is about 45 mins away. Away from the main Disney area but within a good reach. Had a great holiday here.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Stayed here many times don't get me wrong it's very nice the rooms are good family size near publix and other stores close to the parks. But the people up above us as totally ruined my holiday although I requested a top floor I was not given this although it's very quieter here and I can see un used rooms . Although I complained inward offered to swap 3 nights before I was due to depart ! Sadly it's totally put me off having a herd of elephants at 04.45am every morning and in the nights playing who can slam the floors the loudest !

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: A lovely place but slightly let down by the location
column29: We stayed here for two weeks in July and stayed in one of the apartments that is in need of updating.The furniture is very dated but they are in the process of updating these.Having said that the space and cleanliness of the rooms do not disappoint.We had a two bed two bathroom apartment and it was fantastic for our needs. Just be aware that you have to pay for the amenities when you book in(ours was 158 dollars) but this does not include housekeeping as if you want clean towels/sheets you have to pay extra or do it yourself with the washer/dryer in your room) We had a problem with the wi-fi and one of the blinds but this was sorted out straight away.I found the reception staff to be attentive and courteous at all times.The pool area was for me one of the best I have found in terms of greenery,beds cabanas and the bar(especially the girl who runs it with her infectious demeanour).The beds are especially comfortable and makes for a great relaxing day.The pool is clean and there is a little kids pool adjacent with a large water fountain for them to enjoy.This a gated community so you always felt that security wasn't an issue and parking was no problem. As the title suggests the only downside was the location as to get to the parks you have to go on the dreaded I4 with its inevitable tailbacks due to "drivers" getting to close to cars in front and causing the jams.There is also only a couple of restaurants in the immediate vicinity and these are inevitably full.There does seem to be a lot of building work going on so this could change in the next year or so. There is a Publix nearby and next to the Publix a fantastic Pizzeria. If you have booked or thinking of booking then the actual resort will not disappoint just the travelling to and from. I would go back to the Tuscana and its sister resort Chamipionsgate but this time just to stay in one place and relax.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: we had booked this place via Thomas Cook some months ago and have regularly read the reviews and i have to say i was very nervous. Now i'm sure there are older apartments on the complex but we are so happy with ours. All the staff cannot help you any more than they do. the pool complex is clean and very well looked after. poolside tavern is OK for bar food which we though reasonably priced. A recent contributor was un-happy about the $158 cost. it is in the Thomas Cook brochure. We are still here on holiday and decided to post early as it only gets better. lastly, we reported an issue with the freezer tonight and someone was at the door in 20 minutes!
