column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Great place, only a few miles from Disney. Apartment large, well fitted out and very clean. Check in easy if not quick and staff helpful. Pool area is really lovely and sun beds always available. If you want lots of nightlife nearby this it not the place for you. We love it.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: A Hint of Italy in Florida
column29: The hotel is situated around half an hour from Orlando International Airport and is conveniently located near local conveniences such as the Publix Supermarket and McDonalds in Champions Gate. The Tuscana Hotel is a Mediterranean styled hotel in the heart of Central Florida and, upon first impressions, looked stunning as soon as we arrived at the hotel. The service at the front desk was, to say the least, quite poor at times as the hotel staff did take their time to carry out simple tasks and we found we were waiting quite often to be attended to by the staff at the front desk. However, the reception area is well air-conditioned and is a pleasant place to sit while waiting for the members of staff. The rooms were as we had expected in the pictures and we were placed in an older room as some of the rooms at the hotel were being refurbished but we were just unlucky to be given an older room. Although it was older than the new refurbished rooms, this was not to say that it didn't fall on expectations as the room was designed as a simple yet elegant room. The beds in both bedrooms were comfortable and the bathrooms (consisting of a sink, toilet and shower as well as one bath in one of the bathrooms) had all the necessities including some free toilet roll that the hotel had left for us. The dining area was as expected although when I had sat on one of the chairs it immediately started to fall apart and almost made me fall which was quite entertaining. This, I would guess, would be down to the age of the room and I'm sure it will no longer be a problem in the not so distant future. The balcony was a bit bleak compared to other balconies I have seen but it had what you needed with a table and two chairs. The living area had a television along with a couch that folded into a double bed as well as a small arm chair. We could not fault the size of one of the walk-in wardrobes which was able to hold all of our shopping as well as clothes along with the safe to keep all your documents and money secure. Additionally, the air-conditioning kept us cool throughout our holiday at the hotel so there was no complaining there as we never woke up due to being too hot. We also had another issue when staying in the room regarding the room's Wi-Fi. We attempted to connect to our room's Wi-Fi but our devices kept saying that the password was incorrect and, after raising the issue with reception, they managed to get us online but with another room's router which meant that the speeds were slower than they should have been. Considering that we had to pay for the internet access in the daily amenity fee, this did annoy us. Finally, the kitchen area was very pleasant. It had a fully functioning dishwasher along with a fridge and a freezer and a microwave. There was no complaining with the kitchen and the washing machine and drying machine which functioned all of our needs during our stay here.The pool area is well maintained and is, from the days we visited, relatively clean. The sun beds are incredibly comfortable however the arm rests are metal and, in soaring temperatures, they get hot very easily rendering them useless as an arm rest. There are cabanas with sun beds in as well as an area for smaller children. The lady at the pool bar was very pleasant indeed and was very polite to us during our stay at the hotel.When you feel like exercising you should certainly check out the on-site gym. There are three treadmills along with some bike machines as well as a few weight machines with the dumbbells at the far side of the gym ready to be used. It is well air-conditioned and I, being British and not used to the heat, could exercise well knowing that I wasn't going to bake to death. To conclude, the Tuscana Hotel is a great place for any family wanting to visit the State of Florida who are wanting a great place to rest as it has all the needs of any family visiting the area.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: ... My wife and I have stayed at Tuscana for one month each February for the past 5 years.
column29: ... Great location to take in all that Central Florida has to offer. The pool is second to none and the property is beautifully landscaped and clean and well manicured. An in house movie theatre and excercise room help to complete the complex. Ensuite bathrooms, in-unit laundry facilities and screened deck all make for a comfortable stay. The restaurant and poolside bar area mean that while leaving the property is an option it certainly isn't necessary for those who may prefer to stay put day after day and just enjoy the compound.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Stayed here 2 years ago and the place is simply superb, hence we are back here again, the staff, the facilities, the rooms are absolutely first class, the staff even remembered me from my last stay. Now for the 'however' when we arrived we were told there is now a $158 charge for use of the amenities, none negotiable! This wasn't communicated to us prior to our stay by anyone at all and I'd have thought Thomas Cook should have done and unfortunately it's left a really sour taste in the mouth. Aston hotels or Thomas Cook should do the honourable thing and refund this money, however I'm not sure either are honourable enough, only time will tell. So if you have booked or are thinking of please be aware of this new charge! Had I known in advance I'd still have booked and I'll book again in the future, it's just the way it's been done! #mustdobetter

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: My family and I enjoyed staying here. We had a 3 bedroom and enjoyed the space. The pool area was very nice, we went down there just about every day. The restaurant was reasonably priced. Only issue was the noise above us, sounded like kids jumping off the bed onto the floor. I called the front desk on our last night there, explained that we had been listening to it all week, and I needed to hit the road the next day so needed a good night's sleep. She said that she would send someone up there to talk to them and I didn't hear anything else. I appreciated them taking care of it and the people above me being understanding about it. You always hate to have to complain about noise. Overall, really enjoyed the unit, it was clean and comfortable. TV's did not work when we checked in, but they sent maintenance down and they reprogrammed the channels for us. No other issues, very pleased with our stay. Would definitely stay again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Poop in pool two days in a row!!
column29: I told the only person working around the pool. It was a restaurant waiter and he told me he would let them know. Second day more of the same! I went to front desk and was told I should have reported it to the front desk. How would I have known this? They should have closed the pool immediately but an hour later it was still open. Went back to front desk and they finally closed the pool late that evening for cleaning and chemicals. That was it for my 4th of July vacation with my family of six! Never again!! Locked out of room and was told someone would be right down..never came! Old TV's. Tacks in carpet..ouch! Old coffee maker! Needs new manager...Paul was only good at apologizing and rolling his eyes like I was a liar!! Oh, back sliding glass door would not lock. Holes in screened in porch. Nasty breeze ways.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Booked through Thomson holidays largely because with two teenagers hotel accomodation is either unsuitable or too expensive. Were expecting basic amenities but were very pleasantly surprised, the apartment was spacious and very clean and was more than adequately equipped. Staff were helpful and the pool and pool bar area were fabulous, a shame we didn't have more time to spend there than at the theme parks!The grounds were beautiful and immaculate and so was the surrounding area. With supermarkets and restaurants all very close by it was ideal. The Disney parks were all approx. 20 mins away, probably quicker via the Interstate but we prefer a more leisurely drive.Having previously stayed in Disney hotels and private villas this was by far the most preferable accommodation.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Lots of other issues with Thomsons who we booked through, one being this was not our initial choice of desination but a last minute cancellation of our original hotel resort by Thomsons and with a family party of nine our options for other choices were minimal. We, like many others, read the reviews on Tuscana and were mixed in our expectations. We can only praise this resort and its staff. We had booked two (two-bed) rooms which were plentiful in size and catered for the majority of items you would need on holiday including two ensuite areas (always handy extra wash / changing facilities) washing machine & dryer and a fully stocked kitchen. The rooms were easily accessible and like the complete resort site were clean and tidy throughout. We were especially impressed with the pool area, which we used most nights especially after a day at the parks and enjoyed the peace and quiet around the pool area as well as the great atmosphere of the well stocked bar and entertainment. The food again, that we tried on a couple of occasions from the bar area was of a good standard and reasonable priced. The resort is reliant on a gated system for all residents to pass through and this helped keep the area safer and more secure. Saw where the adequate gym was located, and although had good intentions to use, i was on holiday so gave it a miss. Enjoyed the freedom of the complex and was never bothered by resort staff who if required were always near by to help with any problems (our room door entry cards failed to work on a couple of occasions) Lots of positives, only negative we would give for both rooms we hired is that possible the ensuites were slightly outdated with showers and sinks, but a very minor point to be raised. Would certainly book here again.Good points raised here does certainly not clear up our other issues with Thomsons who we are e-mailing seperately about their incompetences and who i doubt we will ever be using again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Flotte leiligheter i passende avstand til Universal & Disney. Var litt skeptisk da vi fikk en rett ved siden av motorveien, men ikke plagsomt. Flott basseng og restaurant på området - matbutikk og diverse restauranter rett ned veien. Vi kommer gjerne tilbake.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Booked through Thomas Cook and from their photos was not expecting much from the hotel other than it being a place to sleep. However on arrival we were very pleasantly surprised to discover a real gem of a resort with what we regarded as very spacious, clean and well equipped apartments.The pool area was a lovely place to relax in the evenings after doing the theme parks and various other trips out. The pool bar staff are great, the drinks and food are decent and not too expensive and they ran a karaoke evening a couple of times a night which seemed popular. As a location it also turned out to be very good, just off a main highway you could get anywhere pretty quickly. Champions Gate are still a work in progress, only close to restaurant/bar a branch of Chilies but this was fairly good. There are two new similar chain restaurants due to open shortly in the same area. Publix Supermarket is just at the end of the road and to the right. They do cooked food you can take out which was delicious and good value or you can shop to cook in your own kitchen. Would I go back? Yes most definately

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: Great resort with a very nice pool area. Great condo style rooms. Ours had 3 bedrooms with 2 bathrooms. We were 4 adults and 4 childrens and had plenty of room.There is a restaurant and bar service on site. They provide you with the pool towels, which comes very handy. You have a full kitchen, dining area and living room. All bedrooms have a TV. They give you free access to renting DVD's . I would recommend this to anyone but it probably does not come cheap.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We initially came here because I was working in Orlando for a week, and my family wanted to have fun while I worked. We found the apartment to be roomy and clean. It takes five minutes to get to Disney World from here, and the price was very reasonable. Since then we have stayed a few more times, opting to use this site instead of a hotel when we just want a few days close to Disney. The staff members are very friendly and accommodating. We plan to stay here again this year after I attend a conference nearby.

Would definitely return to these apartments. Only downside was the travel cot....it was very old and had seen better days, seemingly the last one in resort so baby slept with us for 2 weeks.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: After reading so many negative reviews after making the reservation through Interval Intl., a few months' ago, I was very pleasantly surprised and we had a great stay. We were in an updated unit, so flat screen tv's, sofa, etc. All employees were great, courteous and efficient. The condo was spotlessly clean, beds very comfortable. On the critical side, insufficient seating for 6 people, and only 2 patio chairs, the kitchen inventory needed checking, only 4 wine glasses for example and no kitchen towels, cloths or oven pads. The pool area is a little small when the resort is heavily occupied. On site restaurant was very good and the portions large, prices good too.Tuscana is in an ideal location for easy access to I-4 and the Parks and within a couple of minutes drive, a Publix grocery store and restaurants.All in all it was great and would return.

This place was better than some of the villas we have ever stayed in, spotlessly clean and tastefully decorated, with excellent amenities. It's like having your own luxury home. We definitely will be requesting to stay in this Condo again! Thank you Tuscana and of course thanks to the owners of the Condo for making our stay pleasurable!

column29: I will start with the positives - the hotel is in a good position and is kept clean and maintenance staff resolve problems quickly. Pool area is very nice.The negatives are having stayed in Florida before in a villa which was far newer and much larger with a pool, with free wifi i found this hotel to be much more expensive before even having to pay $10 a day for wifi and use of the pool. Also the apartment was very dated, with visible damage to a light and socket, these were resolved quickly by maintenance along with a blocked toilet and faulty key card x2.Blinds in apartment were damaged letting light in.It is not dreadful but is dated and far better value available elsewhere.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: We stayed for Memorial weekend. Furniture was uncomfortable and old. No blackout curtains. Bedding was cheap and scratchy. TVs were very old. There was obvious mold in our unit. The pool was nice but crowded and not the cleanest. This place is OK, but not as nice as I expected it would be. Definitely not a luxurious place.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: The Tuscana Resort Condominium was a great resort. It's listed in Champions Gate, FL, but my GPS found it in Davenport, FL. The thing to note with this resort is that it's a self service condo. They start you out with a trash bag, toilet paper, small soap, and one set of towels. You have to buy your own trash bags and toilet paper after that. This location is great for a family though. We stayed for five days in a 3 bedroom condo, thus everyone had their own room. This was much better than four people staying in a one room hotel. The resort was secured with a security gate. The swimming room was nice and there is even a movie viewing room!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: This place is so awesome, you will immediately feel right at home. There are a variety of condos equipped for all family sizes. This gated property is safe and security patrols the area all night. There is a restaurant/mini bar thats on site and it is wonderful.The location is perfect and is 5+ minutes away from restaurants, grocery stores, golf courses, and other vacation areas. I have been staying at this property since 2010 and will continue to do so. Looking forward to also staying at the new sister luxury property next door.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Arrived for a few days- check in was easy. Access is code access and given a map. Parking was no issue. Grounds were well kept. We did get a free upgrade of room which was nice. Two bedroom was nice a spacey. Kitchen was nice and no issues. Not sure about the coffee taste So bring your own and use bottled water. Tv was non cable but adequate. Main complaint was cell tower was weak or non existent plus if your not cable modem savvy you may have wifi issues. Pool area was very nice and they have a real nice bar outaide with great staff ( Lauren) . Breakfast was limited but real good and affordable. Overall a nice stay for our price of about 125 a night. Room was 79 and you get killed with so many taxes. Recommend!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Hidden resort charges and fees make this not worth your time
column29: The Tuscana resort charges hidden fee's which were not shown on my "total charges" bill when booking. I was charged close to $100 more when checking in for 3 nights and this is only disclosed to you at checking in. Had I know this I would have stayed at a better hotel closer to Disney. Once you find out about the hidden charges its to late to cancel without penalty. Felt like a total scam as they advertise one price and once you sign up and book you are made aware of other fee's only after its to late to cancel. The resort is not that nice for the amount you are charged, you can do better closer to Disney for the same amount.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Thin Walls Equals a Bad Night Sleep
column29: We often vacation in the Orlando area and prefer to stay in condos with our two young adult children, so we figured we would give this place a try. While everyone was happy to have their own room, the walls were thin and you could hear everything. Persons around us were hanging out on their balconies at all times of night and it sounded like a herd of elephants above us. The one morning my husband wanted to sleep in he could not because the blinds were worthless and allowed all of the sunlight to come in. The carpet looked like it was on its last leg. I would not come back nor would I suggest it unless there are no other options. I've definitely stayed at worse places in the Orlando area but I've also stayed at much better.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: This is our second visit & the resort is so lovely it won't be our last.Everything from the pool, The Tuscana tavern , the staff & of course the accommodation were faultless. Alot of the condo's are privately owned so there are some differences in the quality of the decor & the furnishings.The 2 bedroom condo 3202 we stayed in had an upgraded furniture package , new flat screen tv's , tiled patio with new patio furniture it was faultless.We will definitely be returning

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed Thursday to Wednesday. We requested a 3 bedroom near the pool. 4 adults and 2 teenagers. We were in the first building which was very convenient. They also accommodated our request to be near another family. It appeared we were in a renovated suite. The price was great! The location was convenient. There is a 7-11, Chili's, Publix supermarket, dunkin donuts/Baskin Robin's very close by. Getting to and from the parks was easy. Noisy - there was karaoke at the pool on 2 nights which we could hear perfectly from the room. There is no need to have it so loud. Noisy - The bedroom I was in was against the outside wall closest to the outside stairway. You could hear people walking up and down the stairs. I brought a fan with me that provided white noise which helped with the noise.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Como se você estivesse em casa
column29: Hotel muito aconchegante, confortável e tem tudo o que você precisa lá. Ideal para família. Completo, como se você estivesse na sua casa. Posto de gasolina (7Eleven), mercado (Publix) e farmácia (Walgreens) perto.Adorei, voltarei lá com certeza!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Very nice accommodations, clean and comfortable. The pool and bar were perfect to relax. Everything is close, restaurants, parks, shopping and golf. We love the Disney area and Tuscana and ChampionsGate is like the Beverly Hills of Orlando We are big, big fans!!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Es un complejo con seguridad privada de varios módulos de departamentos en la zona de Kissimee, a 15 minutos de auto de los parques de Disney. Nosotros estuvimos en Flia en uno de 3 dormitorios con 2 baños. Super completo con cocina, comedor, lavarropas, secarropas, lavavajilla, heladera con freezer y lo básico para cocinar. Todos los cuartos tienen TV (no pantalla plana) y en el living hay uno más grande tipo LCD y una play station. En el lobby se pueden sacar prestados juegos para la play y películas en DVD. Tiene aire acondicionado central con control individual en cada departamento. El complejo es muy tranquilo y permite un buen descanso sin ruidos molestos. Si bien nuestro depto estaba muy cerca de la autopista I-4, no sentíamos el ruido del tráfico adentro. No teníamos servicio de limpieza pero como no estábamos en casi todo el día, no fue un problema. El complejo tiene una pileta discubierta muy linda pero no la llegamos a usar. El wi fi tenía muy buena señal. Reciben 2 paquetes de compras online sin cargo hasta 2 días antes del check in. Cada paquete adicional tiene costo. Muy cerca tiene dos estaciones de servicio con un mini market abierto las 24hs, también hay un supermercado Publix, un Mc Donald´s y un Wendys cerca. Volvería a alojarme en el complejo. Cubrió todas mis espectativas y nos pareció bueno el precio.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Initial Issues on arrival but resolved satisfactorily
column29: We arrived and were allocated a condo which didn't meet our expectations or standards. Alternates offered were of similar dated standard. We were extremely upset as we look forward to our holidays in the US, been coming here for 20 years.This is a shame as overall the resort itself is very nice, in a good location at Championsgate. The pool area is nice and grounds very well maintained.We complained whilst in resort and were invited for a meeting with the Management Team. They apologised and explained that these were the only available condos at time of arrival as the resort is extremely busy. They state that they are working with owners to update these condos. We know the resort is busy by the number of cars in the parking areas.We have been given a complimentary move to another condo and this is great accomodation and we are extremely happy and now looking forward to the rest of our vacation.If the Management Team do stand by their commitment to have owners update these condos this will be a nicer place to stay and alleviate concerns of future customers. My advice would be: If you are not happy with your Accomodation on arrival escalate a complaint to the management team whilst you are still in resort. They have fully addressed our concerns and provided us with a satisfactory outcome for which we are extremely grateful.RegardsJohn

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed here during the British Easter holiday. It was boiling hot nearly every day and it was gorgeous. We spent some time at the pool trying to fit it around going to the parks. The pool area was nice. They would give you as many towels as you need. The apartment was massive. The beds we so comfortable and there were 2 big bathrooms. The kitchen and dining table was nice and modern. The living area had a good quality Sony TV and a PlayStation 3. The video rental had a lot of movie choice and had quite a few recent blockbusters but there were only 3 PS3 games. We stayed at the top of a block and there was a lift up which was good. One of the only negatives were for 2 nights, the apartment underneath us were shouting really loud. They weren't drunk, but we think that something had happened in the family. The next morning we discovered there was some fresh vomit on the pathway into the apartment block. We told reception and they did not do anything about it. It was still there when we left. The restaurant on site was a little pricey but was well cooked and delicious. We would definitely stay here again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: At first I was hesitant to book when I read all the negative reviews but for the price, we decided to take our chance and I am so glad we did. Our 2 bedroom condo was spacious and nice. The beds weren't the best but I've slept in worse. The pool area was nice and relaxing with the pool water being a perfect temp from being heated. The gate to get in didn't always work as it was glitchy but if you have patience, it's just a glitch and you move on.The staff was friendly, courteous, and helpful but apparently didn't know where our room was actually located since they sent us to the wrong building. We liked having the option to rent a free movie at the kiosk in the lobby. You could choose what movie you want and take it to the movie room.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Our apartment was huge, neat and very comfortable, kitchen was well equipped, having a washing machine and dryer was super handy as well as nice big wardrobes!Good area and a short walk to shops.free wifi was a winner too! We were all very happy

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I was in the area for business and decided to check this place out as it was about 1/2 the price as the nearby Omni Resort. I have to say I was skeptical because the price seemed to good to be true. I basically had a two bed-room apartment for under $150.00. I liked the gated security as I had to leave some equipment in the car. The room was very clean and very well appointed. The place seemed to be very popular with golfers and familys. I would stay here again in a heartbeta

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Tuscana is a nice area close to the airport, but the rooms were way way outdated, and uncomfortable. The couch in our condo was a sleeper sofa, that was thin and very old, and the chair was disgusting. We tried to cook, as it said it was furnished with pots and pans, but no skillet to make breakfast. Utensils came from the dollar store, and the air conditioning was broke the entire 4 night stay, The bathrooms were old, and the shower barely spewed out water, and the sink was plugged in our bathroom. The TV had to be 25 years old, and I don't think they spent one dime on this place since the late 80's. Hey it was a low price to stay, as we had 30 people booked there, but never again, as I want some nice comfort features, when I travel. Oh Yeah, it took 20-25 minutes to make coffee in the coffee maker. A total inside renovation is needed.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: nice, reasonable priced place to stay
column29: We had a 2 bedroom condo on second floor, everything provided, free movies to watch, nice pool though a little crowded at times, friendly staff. The furniture was showing signs of wear and tear, overall the room was clean and tidy. The track for the shower door was worn out and kept coming off the track when opened and shut, this was the only disappointment for me. Would definitely stay again because of overall cleanliness of property and room.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We chose Tuscana as part of an American Holidays package instead of a hotel on I-Drive as we have older kids - 16 and 13 and 1 bed hotel rooms are not ideal any more! We were very happy with Tuscana and felt I need to post this here as I have seen quite a few negative reviews recently and want to show both sides as I looked for before booking! Ours was very clean and had everything we needed - 2 large bedrooms with large walk-in wardrobes in each, bathroom off each (bath with shower in one, shower in other), safety deposit box in one of wardrobe areas, large L-shaped kitchen/dining, balcony with table and 2 chairs, ironing board and iron, large washing machine and separate dryer, toaster, microwave, dishwasher, all cutlery and dishes etc., dishwasher. Small supplies were left for dishwasher (enough for week), coffee machine, soap etc. Enough towels for 4 with more available at the pool which we used for the week including at waterpark. We only got to use the pool once due to our tight 6 day schedule but it was lovely (cool enough but we didn't mind that). We didn't get to use bar or food there but the menu looked fine. We spent most of our days away at parks etc. but it was ideal base to return to. Shops and restaurants closeby. WiFi excellent in the apartment - we were all very happy with this as we were not sure before we arrived. Generally WiFi is very good in parks also, Universal, Kennedy Space Centre etc. We would definitely use these again if we are lucky enough to return. We were told about the local fee by American Holidays before we arrived so just accepted them - $129 for the week (10 per day plus 50 odd one-off fee). We did not need or pay for daily service to linen etc. Washing machine and dryer were fine for that.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Arrived early evening so our condo was ready. Fast check in with everything explained, all our dealings with staff was great, very polite and knowledgeable.Condo starting to show its age with some things broken or not being fixed. Overall it was a nice place to stay.Very nice heated pool, however, kids pool was very cold. Parents need to control and supervise their kids. Bigger kids, young teens throwing footballs full length of the pool.Grounds were very clean and maintained all the time.The bar staff were great and fast service, meal prices were very good.Overall we enjoyed our stay and would go back again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Hotel bien ubicado cercano a publix. Problema para estacionar para hacer check in ... No hay estacionamientos. Buen trato en el lobby. La habitación muy alejada, pero amplia. La alfombra Húmeda y el lavamanos tapado. Pero mantenimiento fue prontamente a ayudarnos. Camas duras y televisores antiguos. Hotel cómodo para pasar la noche y desayunar. Necesita remodelación

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed over March Break in a two bedroom unit. The pool area was amazing. Pool water was warm and there was always lounge chairs available. The room was very dated. We had ripped furniture that was filthy dirty. This hotel is in need of room upgrades. The Publix was two minutes away, very convenient.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Nos alojamos por 5 días, el departamento muy amplio con todas las comodidades ( cocina completa con lavavajillas, máquina de lavar y secar ropa, 2 dormitorios, 2 baños más sofá cama en la sala) muy limpio y bien mantenido. Él área de pileta climatizada excelente. Buena atención en recepción. Muy buena ubicación para ir a los parques de Disney. Muy cerca : supermercado, farmacia y casas de comidas rápidas. Lo único que resta es que no tiene servicio de limpieza incluido y si la solicitas tiene un costo de U$ 45 cada vez.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Wow this place is spotless and friendly
column29: I have never been to Florida before. Needless to say we spent a lot of time driving around and exploring. We are used to renting a housekeeping cottage each summer, so I know I have to bring things like coffee filters, saran wrap, groceries, etc. The kitchen in the 2 bed 2 bath condo we rented was very well equipped (with the exception of the coffee maker - 30 minutes to brew a pot of coffee!). We got directions from the front desk about where to go to buy groceries (and spent $18.77 on a new coffee maker - no big deal for a week of great in-room coffee!). Front desk staff were very helpful. The pool area was always clean (and our fellow vacationers were all friendly too). I like that this place will not let you save a poolside chair all day. If you don't use it for 30 minutes - it's not yours any more. As a result no matter what time of day we headed for the pool, there was always a place to sit. I wish more resorts would adopt this rule. We have actually seen people at other resorts who have XXL t-shirts printed with "reserved" on them, and they place them over their deck chairs at breakfast time and keep them there all day long! And then there are the ones who reserve 2 chairs for themselves in the sun, AND 2 in the shade. But I digress. Our "co-renters" were not noisy. There was lots of parking available. The condo was clean clean clean. I look forward to staying there again … hopefully next February!LHallam, Midhurst, Ontario

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Very reasonable prices for a 3 bedroom condo. A little dated. Nice to have in room washer and dryer. Great screened in porch. Really nice pool with waitress to bring food and drinks poolside. Convenient location.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: My family and I stayed at the Tuscana Resort over March Break. We had a two bedroom unit which was very clean and spacious, older model televisions, but good for what we needed. The pool and the grounds were immaculate! Loved the heated pool and pool bar area (towels provided). Free movie rental was great too. I read many reviews before booking and requested an upper floor room due to noise (walls and windows are thin) and I did receive my request. We stayed in building 2, room 2403, which was a close walk to the pool, and facing the opposite direction of the freeway. (Do not stay in building 6 as it is right beside the freeway)The downsides were, the elevator was not reliable in this section of the building. Some days it worked, other days it did not! We told front desk and it seemed to be fixed, but then wouldn't work shortly after. There was a big group of young men's baseball teams staying at the resort, which took over the pool in the afternoon. It was hard for families with younger kids to play safely with footballs being thrown from every angle in the pool. Again, complained to front desk, nothing really was done. Overall, a nice place! Short drive to Disney areas (10-15 min.) and about 30 minutes from the Orlando airport. A few restaurant options nearby and a Publix grocery store too. If you want an inexpensive condo option near attractions, this is perfect!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I am an experienced traveler and I have never given a negative review. This property is awful. We booked this thru a travel agent that I have worked with for 20 years. She was confident in the property because it was thru Delta Vacations or MLT vacations and it was rated a 4 star property. NO WHERE NEAR A 4 STAR property!!!! We moved twice, each unit was worst than the one before....I have pictures, but just imagine the most disgusting furniture you can imagine...If you have furniture ( yes, they do not supply counter stools or patio furniture in every unit??)'. I am not going to go on ...even though I could, please just heed my warning...DO NOT STAY HERE n

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: stayed there 2 weeks to go to disney
column29: booked thru etour and trvavel, they screwed up our reservation to begin with, very dissappointed, always having to argue about special fees...2$ a day for using the room safe? taxes charged to your credit card after u left ? resort fees and all kinds of fees...spent my whole vacation arguying about fees...our room was on the highway, could not sleep at night...dirty on arrival, traces of wine on the kitchen walls...just not a fun experience all together

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I have stayed at Tuscana 3 times and currently stayed at The Fountains. The Fountains were everything we wanted for a place to stay. We continue to stay at these properties because of the Restaurant/Bar staff and atmosphere at Tuscana. From the owner to all the bar staff we thank you all for such great hospitality and top notch service. The food is fantastic and the drinks are spot on. That's how you keep so many people coming back year after year. Thanks again to David, Jenny, Lauren and the "new girl" :) for making our vacation great!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Our family stayed in a 3 bedroom unit. We found the only TV that worked was in the living area, which had one chair and a three seat couch(not enough for 5-6 people). The other TV's had very poor reception, plus they were models that obviously were several years old. There were only 5 wine glasses. While they furnished paper towels, there were no Kleenex. While they furnished a small bottle of dish soap, there was no detergent. The bedroom linens were a poor quality and very outdated. The absolute worst was the fact that our unit backed up to HWY 4 and the traffic noise made sleeping almost unbearable. The only nice thing I have to say is that the pool area was very nice. I don't plan to go back.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Muy buen lugar, comodo prolijo y de excelente acceso
column29: Es un lugar muy lindo, en una ubicación muy buena, muy bien cuidado y a un precio muy conveniente. Estuvimos alojados por 21 días en familia, la verdad que estamos muy contentos con nuestra elección dado que el resort es muy completo y la ubicación que tiene es genial, esta en la entrada de champions gate por lo que a metros de la entrada tenes wallgreens, wendy's, dunkin donuts, publix, y hasta un UPS. Los chicos del front des son super amable,s recibieron todos mis paquetes y siempre me atendian con una sonrisa, quiero agradecerle a Kelly que fue muy amable en todo momento. Respecto de los parques el resort esta a unos 15' nada que uno no pueda afrontar, quiza un poco mas alejado de los Mall pero nada grave. Quiza mejoraría los acolchados, centros de mesa porque no son muy agradables y pondría ya en esta instancia TV tipo LCD o LED, dado que en los dormitorios aun hay TV antiguas de tubo, pero solo ese punto le veo en contra. Sin duda volveríamos.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: This is the fourth time we have stayed at Tuscana Resort Orlando and by far the worst. The apartment smelled badly because the carpet was old and not clean. Also it had burn marks on the carpet. The two bathroom sinks did not drain well - even after maintenance came in to fix them. One of the toliets backed up. The wi-fi routed did not work.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We visited tuscana resort for 2 weeks back in October, and all we can say is amazing!! A very spacious condo, clean modern and comfortable. The area is great base for exploring. We spent many days relaxing by the pool, which has a very family friendly atmosphere! The bar area is brilliant as you don't have to drive out at night to get a good meal and have a few drinks, but there is a chillis that you could walk to that would take about 20 minutes. All staff members are very friendly and can't do enough to help you!! Overall amazing experience here, and we would recommend to everyone! Very sad we won't be returning this year but will be returning next year! The Guests

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Perfectly fine place to crash after parks, just don't expect things for kids.
column29: My wife booked this through Interval months ago. I started to look at the Trip Advisor reviews a week before we traveled and saw that I should take the time to call ahead and request a renovated room (we didn't get), and something away from people as we were with our 2 kids (3 and 1). So noise from other people stinks, and is a big hassle for us - and we also didn't want them bothering anyone too. I must write that the reviews regarding the staff was very unfair. If you're nice, they're nice right back. They helped with a FedEx package, and called when it arrived and Pedro checked us in VERY early (happily), and he also gave me two movie rental cards when a digging company cut the cable for over 270,000 people. People staying there were freaking out on the staff - but it obviously wasn't their doing. Moving on - the décor is SO DATED and O-L-D. The space is great - very spread out and plenty of room - 3 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. The rub is the dated beds, bedding and the crappy curtains that aren't really curtains. They only hang from the edges of the windows and DO NOT CLOSE and serve absolutely NO purpose. It was so STUPID because you should have curtains that close all the way across and NOT let people walking on the ground floor look into your rooms at night (or day). Every single door sqeaked and squealed - I mean - come on maintenance and put in some WD-40 or oil so every time you open a door your child doesn't wake up - it was absolutely ridiculous. And despite the bashing - and I'm bashing - I'd stay here again. It was close to the parks - only 3 exits to Disney and we ONLY needed a big place to come back to and sleep. The kitchen was updated and good and the Resort had Publix, McDonald's, Chilis, all on site (within Champions Gate), so you didn't even have to cross the street unless you wanted Wendy, Baskin Robbins or Dunkin Donuts. I've been everywhere and I've been in worse places. The thing that actually ruined it for us were the NOISY Canadians upstairs. They came from Ontario and we SO loud all night and it sounded like they were moving all the furniture around between 8 pm and 11:00 pm - they were horrible. Plus, they tried to sneak in their dog without paying the pet cleaning fee ($250 per week) and seemed like they were staying a long time with about 10 bags. Lastly, the TV's were the WORST. They were the old big box TV's and very limited channels. Surprising they had no HDTV's.

Dining room chair was broken, couch was old and saggy, beds were old and you rolled into the middle when you got in them. 3 bedroom condo and we were given 3 towels for the pool and told we needed to ask for more at the pool and when we did they asked to see the 3 we had . Distrustful location, dirty location and I would recommend NEVER renting here.They need to update these roomsRoom 5105

column29: Fuimos dos veces y realmente el lugar es excelente, tanto los apartamentos como la piscina. Un amplio estacionamiento, muy cerca de los parques y la autopista para llegar a cualquier punto. Cerca del Publix y 7Eleven.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: At first I was skeptical after reading some bad reviews and the steal that we paid for our trip. I was pleasantly surprised when we got there! The rooms were spacious and up to date! The grounds were very well maintained and the pool area was awesome!We traveled Feb 1st -10th with two kids(2-4). It was 15-20 minutes to get to all the main attractions. The road noise was there from I-4 but good luck finding anything not near a main road in Orlando. The facility was quiet but then again we may have been the loud ones! The pool bar was great and the bar tenders did a great job. The staff at the desk was helpful with the few requests we had, even acted quick when our door key failed to work. The DVD "rental" was an awesome feature as we caught some crappy weather.Anyone traveling here should not stress as it's an awesome place! We will be returning.Mike/Stacie

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Stayed 3 nights in a new 4 bedroom condo with large bedrooms, 3.5 baths with lots of spacious room with full kitchen. Very close to shopping, restaurants and numerous golf courses. Even got a later check-out after speaking with management staff.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: Perfectly adequate for a busines trip,but not really a holiday destination.Facilities may have been viewed as being good when constructed but now looks tired.If you were on a holiday then make it as a stop over venue only ,handy for I4.30mins ,$17 trip by UBER to Orange County Conference centre and Inernational Drive, so quite reasonable .

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: We are very upset about the poor maintenance of this resort. The glass door for the shower was not working, it is not in place, putting my girl in danger. This is totally risky and life threatening. The bedroom TVs are old, they dont have a good screen to watching TV is like watching on a 30 years old TV. The bathroom faucet doesnt work, so it takes for ever to have the water gone.  At 9 pm when we got to the hotel... nobody to do your check in!!!!Terrible maintenance... putting yourself at risk.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

The gym was small but had everything needed.The overall feel was safe and friendly!I would re-visit this location!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We rented a unit for 2 months and had leakage from the ceiling everytime it rained. Paul [--] the manager is horrible, he never even bothered to contact us to see what the problem was...when we contacted the owners to tell them, he was outraged and made all kinds of accusations towards us. They need to get rid of him and put in a manger and front desk staff that care about their customers. They are all so inefficient. I would never stay there again and recommend you look elsewhere at a resort that would value you!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Estuve del 9 al 16/1/16 , al llegar me entero que, pese a mi llamado desde Bs As prudencialmente anticipado, rechazaron un paquete con instrumental profesional que habia comprado. Durante una semana NADIE arbitro los medios para su recupero, visité el front desk dos veces al dia, donde las 14 veces se derivaron el problema. Finalmente y por una averiguacion mia, el Sr. Andre se desentiende de la cuestion. Mi compra fue perdida sin remedio. Dejan de atender al publico a las 11 PM, si llegas mas tarde, es cuestion de deambular buscando quien te puede atender.El lugar donde residir es promedio, no mas. Te cobran si no sacas la basura por tus propios medios. En toda la semana no realizan el,aseo ni cambio de ropa. Tuve que reclamar durante dos dias para obtener wifi. Como era cerca de las 23 hs se fueron sin solucionarlo.No lo recomiendo.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Es un hotel, comodiiiisimo, con todo el confort en sus departamentos amplios y muy equipados,...la ubicación para ir a los parques es perfecta,...tiene cerca lo que necesitas...super, farmacia, combustibles, lugares para comer, excelente ubicación. Tambien la atención es muy amable y todas sus instalaciones cuentan con lo necesario para que tu estadia en el hotel sea agradable, estuve en la semana previa a la navidad de 2015..y lo recomiendo...yo volveria encantada

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Lots of Space but Poorly Maintained!!
column29: We first visited Tuscana several years ago and were very pleased with the spacious accommodations including full kitchens and even a washer and dryer in the unit. Our return visit was very disappointing due to both poor facility maintenance and dated furnishings. Our shower was full of mold, the laminate flooring was chipped and broken in a number of places and the dining room chairs were soiled and stained. The beds have definitely seen better days and the televisions in the bedrooms were 1980s throwbacks. One night we tried the public hot tub and couldn't sit due to the rough, deteriorated surface and the following night our rental DVD got stuck in the non-functioning DVD player. When we addressed our concerns to the management, we received an apologetic email explaining that each individual unit owner is responsible for the condition of their unit. However, the public areas are also in need of some TLC. Moral of the story - you may be fortunate and stay in a great unit or be unhappy in a poorly maintained one - buyer beware!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Hemos estado allí en el año 2014 y 2015 nos encanta, es un lugar perfecto para ir en familia. Hay personas en la recepción que son muy amables otras no tanto. El ambiente es muy tranquilo, es limpio, cómodo y esta cerca de un acceso a la autopista.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Our unit was almost perfect. The standard of cleaning and organization was very impressive. We found the unit to meet our needs perfectly. 2 bedroom/2bath. Spacious storage for those travelling with a lot of luggage. Washer/dryer within. Full (beautifully cleaned) kitchen with dishwasher. Nice little (small) balcony with bistro table/chairs. A/C unit was very good and we were always able to maintain a comfortable temperature. BUTThe noise levels! It was unbelievable how loud it was .....bordering on frightening. It sounded like a herd of elephants was staying on the floor above us. The noise was thundering. I saw other guests with large dogs in the parking lot so I suspect they allowed them to run freely through the unit above us. The condo seemed to shake and echo as guests thundered down the stairs. I haven't experienced anything like this before. I could also hear almost every word on the TV from another unit. It was again unbelievable that a tv in another unit could penetrate the walls/ceiling so easily.While the place was great and the location very accessible to Disney ... With similar alternatives available I can't recommend Tuscana and we'll be trying somewhere else next visit to the Orlando area.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We had a great weeks stay at Tuscana. We were in a 3bdrm apartment - like a house ! Kitchen, dining room, TV room, laundry, etc. Championsgate is a lovely little community with a great supermarket & good restaurants. Easy access up & down hwy 4 to all the Orlando attractions. Our room was fine - not the Hyatt but more than fine. Don't get confused with typical resort/hotel amenities - there is no fluffy doonas or turn down service. This is more like staying in someone's house. We stocked up on our breakfasts & took our own lunch to the parks every day to get better quality & affordability. Boys used the pool/gym which was good. Spa needs attention. Gym was small but ok & handy. We bought tickets from an agent in nearby Celebration which the Tuscana put us on to. That's quite confusing so do your research before you go !!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: There was a problem with the keys to the appartment. The whole time. Sheets and pillows where missing at late arrival. Part of the family had no sheets and pillows the first night. Not good accomadationfor handicap either.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Great Stay in modern condo with large heated pool and restaurant.
column29: We stayed for almost two weeks over the Christmas break and had a great time here. The condo was very clean, spacious, had all the amenities of home including a washer/dryer. The beds were great and the resort was also clean and had a great and large heated pool area that the kids really loved. There was also a restaurant/bar at the pool that was awesome for those times when you either didn't have any food to cook or didn't want to after a long day out.The only negative about the place was the noise. I am unsure if this is common in Florida where the homes do not need a lot of insulation but there was a great deal of noise that was able to penetrate into the condo from people in the stairwell outside or the unit above us that seemed to have dogs constantly running around and left the TV on loud all through the night. If you are sensitive to this type of thing then I would suggesting getting a unit on the top floor. For us it was only the occasional irritant as we were out most of the day.The resort is a short drive to Disney and its parks as well as shopping around Orlando (20-40min) and also close to Kissimmee (30min).Overall we really enjoyed our stay and would certainly consider them in future. Although our unit and landlord was great other units may not be the same.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We were in a two bedroom /two bath suite. Very nice accommodations with well appointed kitchen and separate dining room. The heated pool was great! Though the jacuzzi was small. Pool side bar and cafe. Very family oriented. We stayed with a service dog and had no problems!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We usually plan our trip well in advance but on this occassion we took a late deal and flew out. Tuscana is in a very good location by Champions Gate. The road network is good for travelling to/from the parks. Less traffic lights than on the 192 so a clear run every day we were there. The reception staff were welcoming and helpful and we had requested a quiet top floor 3 bedroom in advance and Tuscana did manage to fulfill our request. The condo was a little dated but it was clean and comfortable with all the usual room amenities of a condo resort so it ticked the boxes. The condo was quiet and we weren't affected by any noise from other guests. The pool, bar and terrace are very nice and never too busy. We had a few lovely relaxing afternoons here. As a base for a busy holiday Tuscana met our needs and the location is a plus point. Visit Chillis located a stones throw away for a very good choice in menu and cocktails (you wont be disappointed). There is a Publix, Walgreens and all the usual fast foods outlets very close by. All in all, I would say that Tuscana is good value for the money we paid. The pool and bar area are well maintained and a pleasant retreat from busy park days. Would we return?....yes, I think we would if we wanted a condo resort, but already booked a private villa for our next trip.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: This place is awful! The first night we arrived we had to switch rooms because the unit stunk due to mold. There was mold in both restrooms and under the kitchen sink. The rooms are very dirty and outdated. We also had an ant problem. They were everywhere, crawling all over us while we were asleep, our clothes had to be shaken before wearing them, and they crawled over our toothbrushes and towels. When we called the front desk to report it, they said they would send pest control to spray. Pest control was a lady with a clorox bottle who rudely banged on our door, upset because we complained. The front office staff is very rude, unfriendly and does nothing to ease your concerns. This place is a little on the cheaper side but next time I'd rather spend a few extra bucks and be satisfied. Also be aware of the daily cleaning fee they charge even though the room is NOT cleaned at all, until you check out.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

WiFi, Free movie rental, and a Playstation 3 in the room.The only "but" is that they charge you a 10usd fee a day (ammenities or something like that), plus a 85usd fee for cleaning services (only once for the stay), in my case I paid 100usd that were not in my reservation fee. Don´t understand why they use this method that mines the expectations.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
