column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Cleaning fee for one night stay!
column29: We stayed here for a one night to have the second bedroom for three adults attending training at the nearby Omni. It was very clean but did have some minor maintenance issues which we reported upon checkout. The front desk staff were not impressive, most likely to checking in late at night and checking out early the next morning. Although the cleaning fee was known before checking in, it still was over the top for a one night stay.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Very nice resort in Davenport Fl. Although it was away from everything, it was ok due to the fact that we had no kids with us and it was just a girls trip. It was somewhat noisy due to soccer playoffs so it was quite a few teenagers with a bunch of noise but not overbearing. I felt really safe. Everything was nice and clean

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed with a group/team over Thanksgiving and through the weekend for a sports tournament. Loved that different families could choose between 2 and 3 bedroom floor plans - we could spread out and the kitchens made breakfast and snacks in between games easy. Publix is close by as well. The heated pool was perfect for the kids to swim and the bar/restaurant did a great job with a group dinner. Huge shout out to Terri who helped all our families check in with ease. Good proximity to the Disney parks, including ESPN WWS. Thanks again for a great stay. Hope to see you next year!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Good value for a condo, rooms vary.
column29: This is our second visit to the hotel as it is listed for a tournament we attend each year. With 5 people, I like it because we can get a three room unit for a great price. They have a nice pool, dvd and game rental. workout room, movie theater you can reserve and a bar by the pool. The units from what I understand are all individually owned, so the quality varies. One of our friends had all flat screen tv's, we had none. We had a few issues that needed seeing to and the maintenance staff was really great. They get high marks for seeing to things in a quick fashion. Great for family stays, room to spread out compared to a hotel room. The cost of the room does not include a number of other fees, so look at cleaning and a few others for the full charge. My only complaint was the bedding and the mattress. They really could stand an upgrade on those items. Also, cell coverage is spotty in the units, and wifi had to be reset every day. The wifi routers is in the unit, but would go out at least once a day and require a reboot.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Awful - cheap and dirty hotel with obnoxious policies
column29: Upon check in, I was informed of the "fine print". We would be paying extra money($70) for having the room cleaned after we left, a $10 per day amenity fee and we would need to pay $25 if we did not bring our own trash to the dumpster!!! While being told all of this, a couple walks through the lobby and myself and the group I'm with get a contact high from their marijuana odor.We get to the room...we were in building 9 which is far from main building and not walkable as the road to the building is unlit and wooded. We opened the door and walked into what could only be likened to a crack den. The carpet might have been "plush" once, but now it was matted down and stained. The furniture throughout the condo was cheap --- the lowlight was the couch that had more lumps than a mogul field.The electronics were comical. The 19" TVs throughout the apartment are from the 1990s. They gave us a username and password for the internet --- neither of them worked and maintenance had to come. They gave us a whole different set of login instructions.I was hoping the shower and beds would at least work properly. The shower head had no water pressure and two trickles would drop out of the head until we adjusted it --- then we had maybe 5 streams. Hoping to get some rest, the beds felt like I was laying on a sheet of cardboard. The linens were pilly and the comforters seemed like they were bought from Howard Johnsons circa 1970.I'm not sure how this place stays in business. There are so many other options in the area. We have stayed at Reunion Resort down the road and it was the polar opposite of this disgusting resort. Spend the extra money or brace yourself for the "Most Horrific Place on Earth"!!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Loved it so much I stayed
column29: I came as a hotel guest in June 2015, I was looking for a new home and thought it was a nice place to search from. I found the front desk staff amazing and met ever need. I found ALL the staff to be pleasant and helpful. I loved it so much, I found out there was one for sale and I bought it to be my new home! Such a lovely place! Such lovely people! I have been very comfortable and enjoy all the amenities! Been such a pleasure and have recommended it to oh so many people. Totally worth it...a value for the money!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I stayed at this property for a 3 month period while on a business trip. The property in itself was quite enjoyable. Guest services within the resort was of high quality and very accommodating. Golf course and pool attractive and enjoyable. Unfortunately my experience in what at first sight, would seem to be an upscale bar, were behaviors by staff in which were deplorable and incredibly distasteful. Service to say the least was sub standard. Surprising when compared to the property. The appearance and behavior of the bartender was shameless and outrageous. Once I got past the hair striped red, tank top and unprofessional short, shorts. I was subjected to poor service to the point of being ignored for long periods of time, while this individual was obviously "entertaining" what became apparent, directed toward certain guests and frequents. Performances and antics worthy only of low class. Rude, poor behavior, bar top dancing to say the least was just one of the many inexcusable and deplorable actions displayed. Food also less than satisfactory. How can this frequent behavior be allowed? I myself am a corporate manager in the food service industry therefore, believe management in this establishment must be witless and uninformed of the professionalism that should be common place in this business.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Nos alojamos del 23/10 al 02/11. Excelente, nos toco un departamento muyy grande, con dos habitaciones en suite, muy equipado, cómodo, limpio, todo funciona perfectamente, la atención muy buena. Volveremos sin dudarlo. La mejor opción, precio y calidad. Wifi, play station y alquiler de películas. Súper recomendable!!!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I was at the resort in late October 2015 and it was a fantastic experience. Check in was hassle free, my apartment was much better than I expected, its a self service resort so you have to buy your groceries but that was not a problem because the grocery store (publix) was a walking distance, toiletries were provided by the resort. There is also a nice gym and swimming pool for guests to use. Security was really good, no unauthorized access. For me, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay, the only downside was the distance of the resort to the main tourist attractions and shopping centres. But I will gladly visit again!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: F our of us adults stayed here for a week. The resort is off the main highway in a nice secluded spot. The security is good and you need a pass code to enter the grounds. It is very clean and the grounds are lovely and well hept. Our room was amazing, we could have lived there. We had 2 large in suite bedrooms, there was a walk-in wardrobe in our room. The kitchen area had everything and a washer dryer which was handy. The lounge area was good with a nice balcony although small. The complex had a lovely pool area and nice bar and restaurant. The only downside was the bar didn't stay open very late (10 pm onwards) and although food in the restaurant was good, there wasn't mucvh choice as they mainly did sandwiches. The resort is well placed for international drive and the Disney and universal studios parks. I would definitely stay there again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: As Tiffany H has noted, the soundproofing in the apartments is pretty much non existent. We only had to cope, with people carrying out their normal activities above us, and some insomniacs next door talking on the patio till four in the morning, which necessitated a move to the spare bedroom. Her experience must have been dreadful. Such a shame, because the resort is lovely, as also are the staff. The location also is ideal. Just off the I4, with a supermarket and lots of fast food outlets minutes away. However, if you're stuck with noisy neighbours there is little that the management can do. The Tuscana Resort is not a hotel. All of the apartments are individually owned, in some cases by permanent residents. A shame really, but that's the reality of the situation. If we go back to Florida, I think we will be looking at renting a villa.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I am currently led in bed in block 9 room 9301 at 11pm writing this review. It is with a HUGE disappointment I have rated The Tuscana a 2 because the staff deserve a 5* all the way. However, when we first checked in there were a group of young adults making loud noise keeping the whole family awake 2/3 nights running. Complaints were made and were just told "they will be checking out today" the party checked out and had a good 9 or so days... Until tonight. AGAIN, the room upstairs has been leased out to young people drinking, shouting, banging, swearing. We have asked them to keep the noise down and with no luck. Again another sleepless night and a horrible end to a lovely holiday. This needs to be sorted as I am currently extremely unimpressed having to listen to it. We as a family did not pay money to stay what seems like a club 18-30s holiday hotel. We wanted a family orientated quiet holiday where we can actually sleep.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Upon check in , I was told we were not booked in and no rooms were available and had I made a mistake and booked for next year in error ?. After getting my proof on my pc and showing to reception, who was relaying info from poss duty manager in the back we were told it was there error and they had made a typo in the booking. Gloria on reception handled it politely at all times and i repeat it seemed she was just reiterating instructions from the person in the back office via telephone.We have stayed here before so new what to expect and enjoyed the food served around the bar/pool area. The resort fee was waived by the DM due to the error in the original booking and us having to wait around till it was resolved.The DVD rental included in the resort fee is a decent idea too, so we also made use of this.1 Major problem was at 1 night I was woken in my room by my son saying someone was banging on the door to get in, I couldn't hear as some nights i wear ear plugs and this night I think was Karaoke or something and I was in bed early so had my ear plugs in. I went to the door and it seemed they had gone but my sone said they banged on 3 times shouting. I went back to bed only to be woken by a woman having opened the door to the apartment. She had been given a key card by reception obviously without being questioned or asked for ID shown. I asked her how she got the key and she confirmed this, she apologised said she was in wrong room, I took the key card from her and she disappeared. I tried it in my door and it worked so I trotted over to reception to see why.The guys on the late/night shift on reception said they couldn't see why or who gave her the key as the system was down.We were splitting our time in Orlando with days at the Tuscana and days at a villa on Highlands reserve so I am just glad that she chose I night when I was at the Resort, anyway no harm done as they say. I went to reception in the morning and eventually spoke to Jenny after having a somewhat ignorant response from the gentlemen with glasses on reception.I wanted to make sure it was logged and Jenny seemed to think it wasn't logged and she would log it, and raise the issue of not giving key cards out without following procedure to staff. I wanted it to be logged for insurance purposes in case any other keys had been given out and things may have gone missing on the nights I was staying at the villa. Jenny did handle it well, when I got to speak to her. An unfortunate series of events I know but I must be honest, after returning from a nights stay at the villa a day or so after reporting it I did half expect a manager or someone to have left a note/phone message or called me to explain the details of the key card problem but it never happened, which leads me to believe overall it was not as serious an incident to them as it was to me.So I hope it doesnt give anyone ideas to send a drunk girl to reception for keys hoping they dont check IDs or even names!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: This was my first stay at Tuscana Resort. The price is unbeatable and the hotel is maintained well, looks gorgeous both inside and out. We had a 2 bedroom on the 2nd floor in building 3. Neither of the bedrooms had curtains that closed all the way, only horizontal blinds that didn't keep the sun out very well come morning. The walls are pretty thin and our upstairs neighbors had children that caused A LOT of commotion while moving furniture around and it was easy to hear. One of the bathrooms had a leak and the sink didn't drain well. We weren't there long enough to care for it to be fixed. I would stay here again but definitely request a top floor. Close to the parks, looked and felt clean.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: A very nice stay, loved this place
column29: Stayed in Tuscana Resort for 13 nights with my family, everything was lovely and the staff was polite and helpful. The appartment was clean and nice, but some lack of tools in the kitchen. The swimming pool was nice and all the the hotel area as well and you realy felt safe.We were on the third floor and when there were people staying above us it was very loud so ask for a top flour. Thanx for a wonderful holiday Tuscana :-) I would come back and hope I will one day

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Pasamos una vacaciones en familia en Orlando el mes pasado y nos alojamos en Tuscana Resort. Un lugar muy comodo, amplio, comfortable, ubicado cerca de los parques de Disney y Universal. Esta muy bien equipado y la atencion es muy buena. Lo recomiendo 100%.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Overall we had a very nice stay @ this resort. It was all booked through a all in one and done site. We were automatically upgraded to a 2 bedroom upon arrival. It's not set up like a resort, we actually stayed in a "Time share/Villa". It was very homey but basic. The washer & Dryer worked out great because we packed less. We ate in most nights because we knew to buy food after we settled in because of the kitchen. The hotel staff was extremely nice and helpful. All Orlando attractions were in close proximity to our lodging. There was a small fitness center, restaurant/Bar. It had a very small main pool which was our major setback. There was no "getaway" from other people's screaming, yelling, fighting children.Over all we would book here again! Hopefully they would have added another pool, game room, & small convenience center...

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Excelente opcion para viajar en familia
column29: Mis hijos lo disfrutaron muchisimo. Fue como estar en casa!Amplias instalaciones, todo muy ordenado y limpio. Siempre parking disponible, al igual que la piscina y el comedor.A solo unos minutos se ubica un supermercado, fast food, gasolinera, oficina postal y farmacia.Y los parques estan bastante cerca.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: El resorte cuenta con amplias habitaciones al igual que el living comedor y cocina. Todo muy limpio y con todas las comodidades: lavarropas, secarropas, lava vajillas con todos los utensillos necesarios para cocinar. En un dpto de 3 dormitorios nos toco un baño muy amplio mas otro baño en suites para la habitación principal. La pasamos muy bien y no tuvimos ningun problema. Ademas esta muy cerca de los parques. Ahi cerquita nomas a menos de 3 cuadras tenes farmacia, fast foods, estación de servicio con mini supermercadito por si te olvidastes de algo a ultimo momento.No te falta nada para pasarla bien. Ahhh y la pileta es muy buena y amplia y tiene un comedor que te saca de apuro.No encontramos cosas malas, salvo que si queres dormir hasta tarde no vas a poder porque las ventanas de los dormitorios entra mucha luz, pero no fue nuestro caso ya que nos levantabamos temprano para ir a los parques.Totalmente recomendable.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Just returned from a 14 night stay, this property is just off the I4 at Championsgate about 15/20 mins from DisneyAccommodation was a 3 bedroom apartment with full kitchen and excellent Wi-FiThere is children’s play area and swimming pool plus restaurant and bar if you don’t want to go out; there is also complimentary DVD’s for your entertainmentThe apartment was clean and spacious with TV’s in every room, the kitchen was well stocked if you wanted to cook (we only made breakfast)This property is fully gated with a key code entry system and frequent security patrols which helps you feel safeThere is a Publix supermarket within 5 mins and a Chilli’s restaurant within 3 mins, there is also a garage and a pizza shopThe grounds are well kept and the area looks very affluent and well maintainedWould definitely go back

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Dissappointed!We checked into the property October 2nd a Friday evening, we received our condo key and the surprise of a wonderful “hidden fee”, when we got the the condo we noticed that the door to the unit would not close or lock, pretty inconvenient, and we were given the wrong WIFI name and internet code. These two issued were only addressed by management the following day, midday, which meant that we could not leave the unit. The Unit was nice, but the windows were so tight that we could barely open them, we were hoping to sleep with the windows open instead of the AC, but that proved to be impossible. We definitely did not appreciate finding out that there is that “hidden fee” – Cleaning fee, that was NEVER mentioned when we did our booking. The pool area was very nice, with lots of rules, that nobody seems to observe and no staff enforcing those rules… what’s the purpose of having rules. We had people smoking wherever they wanted even though there were signs everywhere prohibiting smoking. I adore kids, have three grandkids that I love spending time with, but there were so many unsupervised kids at the pool, it made our stay there very unpleasant.Don’t think I will be going back, would I recommend… not really.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Can't beat the price of a 3 bed condo
column29: All of these units are individually owned so there are degrees of upkeep I suggest renting in building 1 as it is closest to the pool. They really try to keep it low cost by not adding wait staff to serve poolside. So you need to order at the bar and help yourself. If you are looking for someone to wait on you hand and foot, this is not the place for you. But hey, the poolside cabanas are free and the karaoke is fun.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: Muy recomendable para ir con niños! Departamentos amplios, cómodos con todo lo necesario para descansar, lavar la ropa, comer. Electrodomésticos impecables, vajilla muy buena.öptimo para descansar , relajarse y visitar los parques!Muy buena ubicación , se llega fácilmente a todos lados.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: " one lovely hidden gem of a resort "
column29: This was our first stay at the Tuscana Resort & it won't be our last, the resort is 15 mins from Disney but far enough away to have its own tranquil settings .The 2 bed condo we stayed in has spacious bedrooms , lovely dinning area & lounge. It has lots of upgrades ( flat screen televisions , new lounge setee sofa bed & arm chair to match , new dining room table & chairs , the place is faultless .There is an amazing secluded swimming pool area with a separate kids pool area aswell , it has a jacuzzi & a lovely pool bar that sells very good & reasonably priced food.Loved it.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I checked into the property late in the evening on a Saturday. The gentleman who checked me in was very nice however he left out a lot of information that I needed about the property. He showed me a map and told me that my room would either be on the left side or the right side of the building and I should park accordingly however when I asked him which side of the building my room would be on he told me he wasn't sure he had only been working there two weeks and they hadn't given him the tour yet. We quickly went into the room to drop off our stuff. The parking lot in front of our building, building 4, was very dark and I didn't feel safe . The other buildings look brighter so I'm not sure if a light was out or if that building is just particularly darker than the rest. We we're dropping our stuff off in the room and quickly heading out to dinner when I notice that the microwave handle, see picture, was completely cracked. I took a picture of it to go to the front desk because I wanted to make sure that I wasn't going to be blamed for the damage. I waited for the girl at the front desk to finish going through something on her cell phone to give me her attention and then showed her the picture of the microwave. She told me she would make sure the management knew. After returning from dinner I went to go use the restroom and noticed a small ball of paper in the corner with hair on it, see picture. Pretty gross. The bathroom in the master bath had a toilet that wouldn't flush unless you hand held the handle down the entire time. At my check out I went to the front desk and asked to speak to the manager. I showed her my pictures of the microwave and the hair on my floor and made a comment that we pay a cleaning fee when we leave, and that the room should be cleaned properly. She agreed with me and took off the cleaning fee off my bill. She also asked me to email the photographs to her. I think it was overpriced for what we used it for. There's a charge for the room, a cleaning fee, & a resort fee. So if you're not staying for a number of days or using the amenities it's really not worth the price. We were there for a soccer tournament for 1 night and basically needed a place to rest our heads so I felt like it was a waste of money for us.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Es la segunda vez que vamos al Resort y vuelvo a re-confirmar todo, la comodidad de sus departamentos, la limpieza, el servicio, la amabilidad de su gente... la pileta es increíble. Lo recomiendo para hacerse un tiempo y disfrutar también del Resort. Esta cercano a los parques, a menos de 1K hay un supermercado, farmacia, estación de servicio, Mc, etc. Recomendable en un 100%

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We like to go to Disney and Universal parks but lately we are trying to stay at a place where we can cook, since you can really get tired of restaurant food all the time (and also your wallet get tired too!) Anyway, this was the perfect place, it was a 3 room condo, we got it on the bottom floor, spacious, full equipped kitchen, dining room, living room, 2 bathrooms, tvs on all rooms and on living area, and washer and dryer! it was like staying at a hotel with all the convenience of home. Comfy beds, decent decor, well kept. The staff was friendly, condos, common areas were clean, they have a DVD free rental service, and their pool is really nice, also a hot tub. They have a restaurant/bar, but we didn't have the chance to try it. Overall, it was a great experience and when we requested something they were quick (we were missing a toaster in the kitchen). I would go back again. Also the price is right for all the comfort.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

El departamento de dos habitaciones es muy espacioso y comodo con todos los artefactos y con dos baños completos.Contras: no hay black out en las ventanas por ende te despertas al alba y las duchas son muy malas chiquitas con poca presion.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms

column27: Excelete opción para ir en familia a Disney!
column29: Excelente condominio para ir en familia a Disney. Amplios departamentos con cocina completa, pileta y estacionamiento gratis. Cuenta con wifi gratis en zona de piletas. Es una opción muy economica y solo se encuentra a 20 minutos de los parques.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: This was our first time to Florida, I emailed the hotel a few weeks before we arrived requesting a top floor condo and that's what we got, it was clean, spacious and had everything we needed. The location is perfect for the parks, Publix supermarket and Walgreens are very close by and reasonably priced. The only thing I think could be improved is the condition of the cabanas and lack of umbrellas around the pool, we were here for 2 weeks in August so obviously it was super hot, the option to move in and out of the shade would be nice. The bar is reasonably priced as is the food but the bar staff are the best bit, they made us all feel welcome as soon as we arrived and they are probably the reason we will be returning next year. See you in August Tuscana!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: Tuscana resort nos dejo un muy lindo recuerdo. Es ideal para familias con chicos. Muy cerca de todos lados, centros comerciales, universal, disney, etc.El acceso es muy directo y estás a 30 minutos del lugar turístico más alejado. El lugar es muy lindo, y los apart son muy amplios y completos. Puntos en contra, la iluminación nocturna de la piscina, y lugares comunes no es la mejor. El gimnasio no es completo y en mi estadía no funcionaron ninguna de las tres cintas para correr . La partes edilicia común, ascensores por ejemplo, no se destaca por su prolijidad.Pero en líneas generales es muy lindo, sin dudas volveremos!!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Muy recomendable! Tipo apartment grande con dos habitaciones con cama matrimonial y cada una con baño en suite. Cocina y comedor amplios. Con todas las comodidades, lavavajillas, lavasecarropas. Tiene una pileta muy linda y lo qu mas me gusto es la tranquilidad q hay en ese lugar.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: This is my second visit to the Tuscana resort, and it will definitely not be my last. We had a 2 bedroom suite, which was immaculate throughout, as was the rest of the resort. The staff I met were always polite and courteous. The resort itself is very quiet and just a short drive to all attractions.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: As previous reviewers have stated, this is an excellent base for a family with teenagers. It is in a quiet location but there is a supermarket and a couple of restaurants close by. The apartments are very clean and spacious with all the facilities you need - washer, dryer, dishwasher, tvs, playstation etc. The pool area was lovely with plenty of sunloungers. The Disney parks are a 15 to 20 minute drive away. It was not an issue for us but the only disadvantage I can think of is that it might not suit if you like to have somewhere you can walk to at night - in which case you may prefer the International Drive or Kissimmee area. Oh and we couldn't use the in-room safe which was locked on arrival and wasn't fixed during our stay. Overall I would highly recommend the Tuscana resort and would definitely return.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Para sentirse como en casa, pero más cómodos !!
column29: Un apartamento para 5 personas, con todas las comodidades, dos baños completos con tina, vestier en cada habitación, tres TV, lavadora secadora, lo cual hace todo mejor, pues no hay que llevar mucha ropa, y siempre tienes esta limpia, así sean las toallas, las sábanas. Muy cómodo, espacioso, con cajilla fuerte, con internet, buen espacio de parqueo, pasamos 15 días de maravilla, a un precio supercómodo (US $ 80 por día), a 20 minutos de todos los parques, a 2 minutos del supermercado, de restaurantes. Nuestras vacaciones fueron espectaculares en parte gracias a la comodidad del hotel.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Viajamos em 2 casais, passamos 13 noites em um apartamento perfeito com 2 suítes, espaçoso, muito confortável, bem cuidado e composto tanto no tocante a mobília, quanto aos utensílios oferecidos na cozinha, além do aspirador, tábua para passar com o ferro, maquinas de lavar roupa, secadora e de louça. Fizemos quase todas as nossas refeições no apartamento. A área em torno é muito aprazível. Fazíamos caminhadas, usávamos a sala de ginastica e a piscina aquecida descoberta e a hidromassagem, possui também uma piscina infantil, spa, sala de jogos, internet wi-fi nas áreas sociais. O serviço de recebimento de encomendas é de qualidade. A limpeza geral é também muito boa, além do tratamento recebido pelos funcionários. Inquestionavelmente voltaremos com certeza.
column59: Sao Jose Do Rio Preto, SP

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: My daughter and myself have just returned from a 2 week holiday staying at these condominium. On arriving we were asked for a resort fees of over $150, which I think is exhorbidant, as you have already paid for the rentalThey are very spacious with 2 large bedrooms with private bathrooms, a well stocked kitchen, dining area and 3 flat screen tv's throughout and wifi, more than you could hope for, and even a lovely balcony to sit and have breakfast on.The pool area has plenty of sun loungers and is a peaceful oasis to relax by, also a bar and restaurant, we ate there on one night and the food was delicious, very reasonably priced.We were on the 3rd floor, when you had people staying above it was quite noisyWe did have a couple of issues, first there were no spare bed sheets and when I asked for some was informed that "None are provided and We were responsible for them" and jokingly told to "sleep in one bed one week and the other the next week"Considering the amount spent on the holiday I found this totally unacceptable, so contacted Thomas Cook who sorted it out for usThen we had a problem with our door lock, it would not close,and could not be fixed until the following day, we were offered another condo but we chose to not have the upheaval of packing and unpacking again so stayed and it was fixed the following day.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Hotel bueno. Personal amable. Habitaciones grandes y cómodas, cocina completa. Lindo parque y pileta. Tiene una play para ver peliculas y juegos, que te las dan gratis. Cerca hay un supermercado, gasolinera y comidas rápidas. Tiene un restaurant tambien bueno. Buena señal de wifi. Contras: en general es limpio, pero si sos muy detallista, no brilla. Los muebles son un poco viejos, asi como las teles y en sofa-cama. Están mas o menos cerca de los parques de disney(15 minutos) pero los de universal estan a 25 minutos, lo mismo que los outlet. Cobran una tasa de servicios, creo que de 15 u$s por día, pero te lo detallan bien al hacer la reserva, no es una sorpresa...Me desilusionó un poco que la pileta con el techo que cae agua no funcionaba, y parecía que hace tiempo que estaba rota. La verdad que creo que por lo que se paga, esta mas que perfecto. Absolutamente recomendable para una familia numerosa como la mía, donde cada dolar que una ahorra en el hotel, lo gasta en otra cosa. Volvería.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Excellent Stay. We had a 2 bedroom condo and it was immaculate. We stayed at several hotels during our road trip to Orlando and this place was right at the top. Our 6 days here were extremely comfortable. the entire condo was super clean with starter dishwasher, soap, etc.Pros: - The beds were made well.  - The wifi worked fine unlike some people who experienced issues. - apartment was clean. - most appliances worked well. Although we did not use some. - Mari at the reception was super nice and cordial. Explained everything well at checkin and was patient with guests. - excellent decor. For once, the wall art was not abstract but real soothing pictures. The apartment was tastefully decorated. Cons: - Checkin/checkout could be faster. There's invaribly a lot of people at the counter for some reason or the other. So the frontdesk is not just handling checkin/checkout but also other details like someone wants to rent the theater, etc. - Movie theater is not so great. The projector had a green/blue tinge throughout. Wear a light jacket and sit there 'cause the AC can feel really cold. - The fridge was leaking water but it was'nt too bad,so we did not complain. I'm sure they would have attended to it if we asked. - Televisions in the condo are archaic. Old CRT TVs..Wow.. Who's even seen that. There is a playstation that works as a DVD player. But the visual is horrible in that TV. We just watched on our laptop. Overall an excellent stay. We were out most of the time but came back to a beautiful and comfortable condo.Buildings 1 and 2 are the only ones close to the pool. From others you have to walk a little bit to get to the pool. Trash Bin are only next to Bldg 3,6 and 9.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We found the resort welcoming and the facilities with the pool, wifi, small gym and bar to be useful. It is a great location near the I4 and close to any attractions we wanted to visit. We loved Chilli's and it was great it was so close, and having the Publix and Walgreens so close by was a real plus. We were quite far from the pool and reception compared so some blocks, however this caused no problems and we enjoyed the ground floor room. We found our apartment to be incredibly spacious and great for our family. Our two teenagers enjoyed a double room each to themselves and especially loved the excellent wifi and TVs in each room for when they wanted a bit of down time. The air con was brilliant and staff were quick in responding when we had troubles with the Wifi at the start, rectifying the problem incredibly quickly. Overall we really enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay again :)

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: I stayed here for 8 weeks for business & 1 week for personal with my husband. This resort has a beautiful pool, the most delicious philly cheesesteak from the bar & is so comfortable. Minutes from the highway & close to all major attractions. It was my home away from home & I enjoyed my time there. The rooms were comfy, the bathrooms were nice... the kitchen was fully stocked & had everything I needed. I did have an issue with my key card deactivating. This is a bit of an issue when its nighttime & there aren't any staff to reset your keys. It's not a hotel - you are one your own here! There is a number available for you to call should you need assistance though. Overall, I would return again & would bring my family.

Staff in the resort was very kind and helpful in every aspect. We had some things delivered to the hotel and staff from the resort were effective. The dorm we where in had three bedrooms with tv in every room and a very big kitchen. Parking was close to the rooms and spaceful.I didnt try the restaurant.I strongly recommend the place.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: The reviews of this hotel vary massively but I will write this review based on being in the first block, specifically room 1408. Upon reaching the hotel we were pleasantly surprised by how close it was to Disney as well as the local amenities such as the "Publix" supermarket which is only two minutes away by car. The gentleman who served us on the main desk was polite, courteous and had everything organised. When we got to the block the lift was out and as my father in law uses a mobility scooter it would have been impossible to get him there so we went back to Reception and saw the same gentleman who organised a new room for my in laws for the night whilst the lift was being repaired which it was by the next morning. Upon entering the room we found it very clean and comfortable which an excellent dishwasher, fridge freezer, tumble dryer and top loader washing machine ( for the brits I suggest you read up on how to use a top loader before going). The rooms all had lcd TV’s except the back bedroom which had a 29” CRT TV and where all in good condition, every wardrobe had coat hangers supplied including ones suitable for trousers so you really don’t need to take anymore. The safe was easy to use and free of charge and the Air con was excellent. We had to use maintenance twice during our two week visit, one was to change the battery in a smoke detector and the other was that the air con panel went dead, both were fixed smoothly and quickly.The pool bar was fantastic and the young ladies were friendly and attentive as where the staff who worked in the restaurant kitchen, some people have said that the staff were rude but I have to say that I always found them to be lovely. The pool itself was great and was ideal for families as it was no deeper than 4 foot 6 inches so my five year old son loved the fact that he could walk around so much and even took his first swim without arm bands due to the confidence he found, the shelter around the pool where a great addition but they are in need of maintenance due to the heavy storms the area receives. The food served was traditional American with a few English dishes added in and was both tasty and cost effective (the pizzas were scrummy!)Security on the complex is brilliant with a key pad access in through large gates and gates blocking the exit and we never experienced any issues with loud parties or other such disturbances. I highly recommend this complex especially for families and I look forward to going back in the future

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column27: Habitaciones cómodas cerca de los parques de Disney
column29: Las habitaciones son perfectas: amplias, luminosas y bien equipadas. Sin embargo, no contaban con servicio de limpieza y, sin bien esto se justifica por sus precios accesibles, debería existir de manera opcional. Más allá de esto, los cuartos tenían microondas, lavarropas y secarropas, horno y demás; y estaban muy bien cuidados.La pileta del hotel estaba limpia y era bastante cómoda, climatizada por cierto. En la recepción se alquilaban películas y juegos, y las instalaciones en general estaban bien mantenidas.Una noche, la puerta de la habitación no se abría, y lo único que hicieron fue ofrecernos un cambio temporal, a sabiendas de que ciertos insumos de los que dependemos (comida para bebé, y ciertas medicinas) estaban adentro. No fue sino hasta que un miembro de mi familia forzó la puerta que pudimos entrar.Recomiendo este hotel para familias que se encuentras más interesadas en Disney World (está bastante lejos de Universal Studios), y compras (está cerca de algunos shoppings o outlets muy buenos.

column29: We stayed in a 2 bedroom condo and it was very clean and spacious. Only downside was having the screened in porch next to the air conditioner unit for the building. It was noisy but drowned out the sound we would have heard from the nearby highway. The pool area was large and we could always find a seat where we wanted. The only downsides were that we were not with small children and the parents who were there did not feel a need to supervise or ensure their children were well behaved (witnessed a child cannon ball into the hot tub multiple times). Also, the price of drinks was high at $7 for a mixed drink. (As a Canadian that meant we would be paying around $10 with the exchange) The hotel restaurant was dirty looking but the surrounding area had many stores and restaurants that are modern and clean. Felt very safe in this neighborhood. All things considered would recommend to friends and family.

column29: This is the 5th time we stayed here and it was as good as the 1st. Set in Champions Gate seconds off the I4 it remains a great location situated on an 18 hole golf course and close to many amenities, supermarket, drug store, post office, restaurants and take away's. 2 bed condominium's means there's plenty of room with a well equipped kitchen, 2 shower/bath rooms, washing and dryer machines. It's a gated community with a pool, gym and bar/ restaurant. Only a 5 minute drive to the Disney Parks a 20 minute drive to Universal Studios and SeaWorld a 45 minute drive to LegoLand and only one stop on the I4 to Haynes City where you can find every eatery you could imagine. Just can't wait for our next visit

column29: Estive em Orlando com a família durante 20 dias e fiquei hospedado nesse hotel/condomínio.São diversos prédios de 5 andares se não me engano, muito aconchegante, com a mobília completa e ótima estrutura. Acomoda 6 pessoas perfeitamente com duas suítes com cama de casal e uma sala com sofá cama e se não me engano, existe a opção de pagar uma taxa para uma cama extra. A cozinha do apartamento também é completa e assim pudemos preparar nosso próprio café da manhã e janta o que ajudou a economizar e também comer algo além de hamburger e batata frita. Os apartamentos tem acesso a internet via cabo, para utilização do wi fii é necessário pagar uma taxa extra (vale a pena, pois a internet é super rápida e todos podem usar ao mesmo tempo).Apesar de ficar "afastado" em relação aos hotéis da International Dirve, gastamos 20 min para qualquer lugar (parques, outlet etc...). Próximo ao hotel existe um "centro comercial" com posto de gasolina, wallgreens, restaurante e um supermercado grande de rede que não me lembro o nome (não era wal mart).Existe uma área de laser bem agradável com piscina e um bar transmitindo jogos... como chegávamos todos os dias tarde e cansados não conseguimos aproveitar, mas é uma área bem convidativa.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Not quite a hotel, not quite a time share.
column29: My family of 4 stayed here in May 2015. The location was great, close to Disney, Downtown Disney, other attractions and the airport. The grounds were very nice and clean. Pool + bar area very nice. Small sized resort style, which had a separate child pool and fountain area.The check-in process was very inaccurate to what we were told when confirming our reservations ahead of time. We arrived at 3:00pm to check-in. We were told check-in isn't until 4:00pm but they will accommodate us and that our room wasn't ready. We were not the only people checking in either, the family ahead of us was checked in without any problem. We were told to come back in an hour or so to let them finish preparing the room. We returned in 1.5 hours and the room was still not ready. We waited and had questions about our bill that was presented to us. There were several fees that were being added onto our room bill that were never brought up when making the reservation. When we disputed the charges and told the hotel to remove them they did not want to at first. There is a resort fee and a fee for having the room cleaned and refreshed everyday that was never explained. We were not the only family checking in that was unaware of these charges and fees. Several other people were inquiring about the fees and why they were not on the original reservation costs.When we finally got to our rooms we were not happy. The general cleanliness was very poor. The apartment decor and furnishings were very shabby and looked and felt like a time-share trying to be a hotel. The rugs in all in the 2 bedrooms and living/dining areas were filthy and stained in several areas. There were also several light bulbs out throughout the rooms including both closets. All of the drawers and cabinets were left open when we first walked in, every single one including the bathrooms. The bedding was not on half of the beds either. The couch and chairs had the seat cushions moved and stacked up. We had to call the front desk to have someone come back and reset the room and bedding even though we were made to wait over 2 hours to check-in already. There were curtains on the windows that only closed half of the window and blinds that barely covered the windows. We had wifi, it would come in and out though. I had to reattach the data line coming into router and prop it up in a way that it couldn't move just so it would stay working.The cleaning service we were told would be cleaning our rooms never came, not once. The bathrooms were clean enough upon arrival and thankfully had towels and toiletries. When we inquired later about the cleaning service we were never got a straight answer if and or when they would be coming. By the 3rd day we realized they would not be coming. It was convenient having a kitchen and an apartment to come back to after long days and was something we looked forward to however it was not up to our expectations. Perhaps the cleanliness and shabby nature of the unit is specific to our unit/owner not wanting to update their rental space. The hotel staff told us that each unit was privately owned but the resort company managed everything.Upon checking out we noticed on the hotel paperwork they gave us it stated check-in time: 9:00am!!! When we were checking out the people in front of us were checking in, it was 9:30am and they were not told to come back or that it was too early. We asked the front desk staff which was different than when we arrived, they said we could check in anytime we like and had no real answer why we were originally delayed.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: The resort was really clean well appointed. It had a great pool area with a small adjacent bar. We rented a 3 bedroom condo which we were pleased with, not super luxurious, but clean and comfortable. The condo was well equipped and had everything we needed, including a full kitchen. We prefer open outdoor balconies/patios, but theres probably need to be screened in to keep insects at bay. The location was the best part, close to all the action and really touristy areas, but removed enough to avoid the crowds and traffic (easy on/off the interstate). You can jump on the interstate and be in cocoa Beach or Tampa in an hour. Not many restaurants close, but many options within 10-15 minutes. Publix Supermarket, liquor store, Chillis, and convenience store next door. I would definitely recommend this resort while in the area.

column29: My boyfriend and I have just returned from a 2 week stay here and we cannot fault a single thing - we loved everything about it.Check in was super fast and the staff were great. The room was lovely and had definitely been done up, with flat screen tv's, etc...it was a really nice apartment with lots and lots of space for the 2 of us. I would definitely come back here, great location as well, although you definitely need a car but there's a gas station and a grocery store within a minutes drive of the resort. We had a really great time here and it was definitely worth the money. Loved it.

We go back every year...We Love it!

column29: I Cant say enough nice things about my stay here at Tuscana Resort Orlando! From the greeting at our arrival to the fairwell at our departure, this hotel was nothing short of amazing! Very clean property and the grounds are very well maintained. Staff always smiling and willing to lend a helping hand when needed. Rooms are wonderful and were exceded my expectations to say the least. This property is in walking distance to lots of shopping and dining in the area. Its away from the hustle and bustle of the Orlando crowds but close enough to be convenient to everything also! Pool and restaraunt are spectacular! I will never stay at another resort during my Orlando trips for sure!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Stayed here May 9 to May 16. location within Champion gate just off exit 58 I~4 is perfect for visiting Disney etc. The resort is the perfect size not to big not to small with good facilities outdoor pool, gym, and sports bar. Reception staff Andre and Gloria were extremely helpful and made the stay great. The accommodation is clean and tidy with all mod cons. There is a security gate, controlled by key pad access giving it a secure feeling. Nearby is a Publix supermarket and loads of restaurants. I can especially recommend Wendys, opposite the 7-11 petrol station. Right on the I-4 you can get to all the amusement parks and Orlando attractions very easily.All in all the perfect place for families to stay.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column27: Un lugar adecuado para viaje con familia
column29: Un bonito hotel para viajes con familias. El clima no nos permitió probar la piscina, pero se veía bien (de lejos). Las habitaciones con cómodas y amplias. Requieren una actualización de estilo. Tomar en cuenta que el precio no incluye limpieza diaria.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Nette Appartmentanlage in der Nähe von Orlando
column29: Wir waren für 4 Nächte im Tuscana Resort. Wir hatten 2 Appartments mit jeweils 2 Schlafzimmern gebucht. Das eine Apartment war scheinbar renoviert worden, der Boden war komplett gefliest, die Möbel in einem guten Zustand. Das andere Appartment war weniger gut in Schuss, teilweise abgewohnter Teppich, angestossene Möbel und ein muffiger Geruch. Die Wohnungen sind praktisch eingerichtet, die Küche enthält die wesentlichen Dinge. Die Sauberkeit hätte besser sein können. Es gibt ausreichend Handtücher, auch für den Pool. Falls man waschen möchte befindet sich eine Waschmaschine und ein Trockner in jeder Wohnung. Der Pollbereich ist ansprechend gestaltet, es gibt ausreichend Liegen. Wie es in der Hochsaison ist, können wir nicht sagen. Der Empfang war freundlich. Es gibt Wlan, man bekommt aber immer das falsche Passwort gesagt ?! Wir haben dann auf den Wlan-Router geschaut und da stand dann etwas ganz anderes.....nachdem wir dieses dann eingegeben haben funktionierte auch das Wlan....warum man diesbezüglich falsche Informationen bekommt wissen wir nicht. Die Anlage hat auch ein Restaurant, das Esen dort schmeckt gut und die Preise sind erträglich. Allerdings war die Bedienung (Jenny?!?) die unfreundlichste Person die wir jemals in den USA im Servicebereich kennen lernen mussten. Sie bediente innerhalb des geschlossenen Raumes mit einer verspiegelten Sonnenbrille, gab sich betont cool und war sehr schnippisch. Auch beim zweiten Mal war es genauso. Danach sind wir wegen Jenny dort nicht mehr essen gegangen. Insgesamt können wir das Resort weiter empfehlen. Allerdings möchte ich dort nicht 2 Wochen Urlaub machen.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: We arrived at the Tuscana and was greeted by the receptionist with a big smile (Great)At first they could not find our booking, they worked hard to accommodate us anyway, they eventually found our booking and we checked in. They gave us instructions and a map to find our room, Perfect. The keys actually worked first time, Great.The room was large and clean, some of the furniture is a little dated but to be expected. Everything worked, Washer, drier, dishwasher Etc.The pool is fantastic, the bar by the pool is also great, I recommend the Bahama Mama bucket, Awesome. A great place, not to big, and is not to far from the Disney Attractions. The staff are friendly and helpful, We stayed there for 1 week from 20.05.2015. There was some building work going on nearby but this did not impact on our stay there but I think Thomson Holidays should have informed us.I would recommend this place highly. I have visited Florida on many occasions and this is one of my top 3 locations.Well done Tuscana, excellent service.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We have just returned from a 12 night stay in Tuscana and would recommend it and will definitley return.We arrived with our 2 boys and checked in fast and were so pleased at how lovely our condo was. It was huge, 2 bedroomed, 2 bathrooms and kitchen dining area and lounge.Each bedroom had a walk in wardrobe that was huge and a large tv. We also had a TV in the lounge and an iron, ironing board, tv, washing machine and dryer and fully equipped kitchen .The condo was immaculately clean and straight away we settled in. The pool area was great, very clean and pool a great size with a small splash area for kids and a jacuzzi. The bar is lovely and although we did not eat in the restaurant it looked clean and nice and all staff were pleasant. There are also loungers in the shade behind large curtains that were great for our children to sit in the shade and read. The apartments are about 10 minutes from Disney and about 30 minutes from Universal. Great location! Outside the gated entrance there is a Wendy's,Public, macdonalds and a 7 11.Loved every minute of staying here and were sad to leave. Will definitley return!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

They have a great family pool with a kids pool and jet spa. The restaurant was delicious and convenient. The rooms were spacious with the bedrooms separate from living area so we could have privacy. There is a full kitchen with dishes and cookware. There is a Publix grocery right near the entrance . It was just so convenient to everything. Excellent staff. Very pleasant and helpful. A great value too!

Just a short drive and you'll be back "home" to grab a bite to eat, enjoy a dip in the pool or soak in the hot tub! I would love to return and make Tuscana my home away from home!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: I absolutely loved this property. Very very welcoming front desk. Inviting atmosphere. Great staffing. Rooms were very comfortable. Loved the pool. Loved the on site dining. Excellent atmosphere. I would stay here again!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: My wife and I booked a stay here looking to find a place that was peaceful, quiet and relaxing. Well we found it. This despite the fact that there were a bunch of children staying there for a soccer tournament. Our two bedroom two bath condo was spacious, clean and very quiet. The full kitchen was great and the fact that a Publix was only a mile away made preparing meals in the room a breeze. The kitchen utensils were a little worn so you may want to bring your own if possible. The only issues we had in our room were that the handle on the frying pan was loose and the DVD player was not hooked up. Fairly minor issues. The property itself is very secluded and very pretty. We spent the majority of our time relaxing at the pool, which was a nice size and the perfect temperature. We had no problem finding a quiet cabana each morning and enjoying the weather while reading some books. The on site restaurant was quite delicious as well, though they are separate from the resort so you cannot utilize a room charge. Still, it was nice to order food and not have to leave the cabana. There is no maid service, which was fine with us, and you do have to take out the garbage when you check out. Again, not an issue. There is a $35 room cleaning fee which we were aware of when we booked. I thought that was pretty reasonable. Overall I thought this was a nice place for a weekend getaway and we hated to leave, but one must deal with reality I guess. For a few days we had our own little paradise and we would happily stay here again. I should also mention that the staff was very friendly and always smiling. I would definitely recommend this place for a couples getaway, but it's also a nice place for families as well.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: My family (2 young adults, 2 baby boomers) are staying at the Tuscana for one week. I have mostly positive comments. We are in a 2 bed, 2 bath unit which is quite spacious and quiet. Also has an automatic dishwasher, washer and dryer in suite. Beds are queen size and comfortable...also has a pull out sofa in the living area. Each room has a tv too. There is a movie/game rental kiosk in the reception area which has a good selection and is a free perk. The building could use some updating as there are signs or wear and tear..,our suite has older appliances, but they do still function. If there were any maintenance issues, they were dealt with fairly quickly. The kitchen was stocked with basic supplies however some of the utensil pieces should be replaced as they are damaged. I would suggest bringing a dish cloth/sponge if you want to hand wash some dishes. Also there were no hair dryers in the bathrooms. Location in proximity to the theme parks and shopping is excellent. A Publix supermarket is the closest food store and there is the Posner Park shops which has a Ross, Target, Staples among a few other popular names. The pool is fine. There is also a hot tub and separate kids pool. We did not eat at the on site restaurant. There did not appear to be any recycle containers which is a disappointment, especially nowadays.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Great pool area, friendly staff, decent sized rooms. Could do with upgrading as the bedding was a little shabby, they hadn't bothered to iron the bed skirt which made it look shabby, the bedroom also smelled damp. I would stay again if the price was right.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: So I booked this hotel on Priceline and I read the reviews and everything seemed to be a nice place. WELL I WAS WRONG! There is a $50 cleaning fee that is hidden on their website. AND when you get there they make you sign an agreement that if you DONT take out your own trash you get charged $25 PER BAG, WHY THE HECK AM I PAYIING A CLEANING FEE??? The room smelled like an old apartment, you know the old carpet smell. ONLY ONE POSITIVE, the rooms/apartment were BIG.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Stayed this week and there is so much room!
column29: To start off Mari at the front desk is amazing, she checked us in quickly and made sure we had all the information we needed.Stayed in a 2 bedroom condo and it was very spacious for all of us and the wifi was fast and worked great. Each room has its own router so you arent sharing with other people so it was great.The beds are comfy and it was great having our own washer and dryer in the room.The only things I think that could have been better was the furniture was a bit worn in the living room, im not sure what was the problem with the coffee and end tables because if you touch them at all they shake like they will fall apart, and there is no way anyone could sleep on the sleeper sofa it was quite uncomfortable. All in all it is a great place to stay, convenient to all the parks and plenty of stores nearby to pick up what you need.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Great if you need separate bedrooms
column29: We normally stay on Disney property for the ambiance, but since we were traveling with a 2 year old who goes to bed at 8 pm and a 4 year old who goes soon after, we chose to stay here so they could each have their own bedroom and the adults could still be awake, watch tv, play cards, sit on the balcony, whatever. It was perfect for that. We booked through our AT&T Mastercard and got a great rate for a 3 bedroom and a 2 bedroom condo. They were so spacious with full kitchens and walk in closets - very nice large bathrooms too. Large dining tables and chairs in each condo. Our only problem was that two times, around 4 am, there was some type of bird in the lighted outdoor hallway that woke everyone up by chirping loudly non-stop for an hour. It sounded like a fire or car alarm. We tried banging on the doors a little to scare it, but never saw it. Did not know who to contact. Check-in service was very slow both times we used it, but nice. It was a short drive north to the very next exit to get to Disney World. There is a large grocery store at Champion's Gate (Publix I think), and a Walgreens and Chili's restaurant. Very nice to have nearby. We'd stay here again if the little ones were with us for sure.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Nice Hotel looks more like a condo!!
column29: I walked into my room and I thought I was in a condo! It had two bedrooms, two bathrooms, kitchen and living room and dining area. This hotel was amazing. The pool seemed really nice although I didn't go in because I was on a business trip but it looked good. The staff was really friendly and helpful. Seemed like it was not too far from Disney. So if I ever come down with my family I would stay here again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms

column27: Great way of staying in the parks, but finding peace and quiet
column29: Great apartment. Clean and comfortable. The restaurant was so welcome ... home cooked fresh ingredients, big contrast to park food.Local shops and takeaways really good too.It is close to I4, form where you can get to all the parks. Can be busy and slow. Would stay again.Apartment didn't advertise wifi, but did have free access when we were there, we suspect a dongle for the apartment below!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Great location away from the parks but only 10 minutes drive
column29: Only about 10 mins drive to the parks so perfectly situated if you want to be away from the main strip of International Drive and hustle and bustle. The accommodation itself was great - we had a 3 bedroom condo in block 8 which meant it was away from I-4 (closer units are really close to it and you can hear the traffic) - we were on the 3rd floor out of 4 and were troubled for the first week with very noisy people upstairs who insisted on putting the washer on at 1am which is next to the master bedroom and we heard every turn of the drum!! I can't fault front desk because every time I went down they phoned the room (different family staying only for a night at a time) & told not to hesitate to call security at night if it happened again however - no one ever answered. Perhaps Tuscana needs to review this. Overall, I would stay here again but would insist on a top floor unit. We stayed for 14 nights and the second week was more bearable as the owners of the condo were there - they obviously knew how the sound travels through the floors. If you want to use the wifi in your room you have to pay an amenity fee of £140 even if you only want it for 1 day - they need to look at including this in the room price. The food was good in the bar/restaurant.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We had a wonderful stay at this resort,everything was perfect. Great location, pleasant staff and comfortable and clean accomodations. Enjoyed the pool and had everything we needed. Will definitely visit again!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We have just come back from a two week holiday to Orlando and stayed at the Tuscana Resort. I had read some reviews prior to our stay and a few people had commented about staying on the lower floors and complained about the noise above them from other families , this is mind before our stay I emailed Tuscana resort directly (not through our booking agent) and asked if it would be possible for us to be on the top floor to avoid people running around above our heads! I had a response very quickly noting our request although they couldn't promise it, on arrival I was pleased to be told we were accommodated on the top floor as requested so that was great. We also requested a welcome pack too, so glad we did this after a nine hour flight and arriving late , it was great to have some essentials milk, bread , tea, coffee etc. We stayed in Block one , room 7405, I would have no hesitation in recommending this block and room! Block one is perfectly located right opposite the main building and you can see the pool from the balcony. The inside of the accommodation was so much bigger than the pictures make out , there were 6 of us in our party and there was plenty of room. The accommodation was clean and tidy , a washing machine , tumble dryer also , I found this very useful as we were there two weeks and there isn't any maid service, so handy to be able to wash towels etc. Tuscana resort I found perfect, it has a lovely snack bar / restaurant which we had lunch and dinner in on several occasions , it was invaluable after being in the disney parks for hours on end there were evenings we were just too tired to go out and find a restaurant to eat in , the restaurant at tuscana was perfectly adequate and very reasonably priced and great to fall back on. Tuscana is in a great location about 15 minutes from most parks , it has a Publix supermarket literally on the door step, a McDonald's , chemist, pizzeria .I've read a few reviews people moaning about the facilities in the accommodation are old fashioned etc, yes they probably are a bit, yes the television is a big old fashioned one, but come on you're on holiday in Florida, you haven't come all this way to watch the telly?!! And even if you do on occasion (which I did for the news and the kids channels , so what if it's a bit old fashioned , it works perfectly well and does what it needs to do).Tuscana worked perfectly for us , accommodation was good, food was good , staff were friendly and helpful, (our safe stopped working after a couple of days , reported it next morning maintenance man arrived on time and fixed it straight away) and it's in a lovely location. It is a self catering holiday so you don't get a daily maid service but that's fine not sure why some people have moaned about that, maybe stay in a hotel then if that's what your after? I would definitely stay here again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Don't waste your time or money
column29: Dirty, and rude staff. My family got in at 10pm and we left at 7am that's how had it was. We called the help desk after hours to ask what the wifi password was and it was a third party call center that was no help said they would call back and never did. We stayed up til 3am booking a new hotel for the remainder of our stay in Orlando.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: The resort was very well kept, grounds were beautiful and staff was very friendly. The pool area was gorgeous -- pool towels, lounge chairs and cabanas were available without issue everyday. The staff at the bar was extremely present, and the food was good and reasonably priced. Drink/food orders are delivered to you in the pool area.The condo was very clean and nicely decorated. My family of 4 stayed in room 7308. My only negative comment would be the noise from people in room above us. We paid a small up-charge to stay in one of buildings closest to the pool, and it was worth it! My recommendation would be to request a newly-renovated room on the 4th floor. However, if you don't mind a little noise from the condo above than 7308 is perfect. Wifi was available in the room and included in the resort fee.The resort is close to all of the theme parks and only about an hour from Cocoa Beach, which was gorgeous.I would stay at the Tuscana Resort again!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I do not like to write bad reviews, I worked in customer service for a very long time and I understand that not everything goes according to plan but here are some warnings if you choose to stay here.First let me say that the resort was beautiful, the grounds were well kept and the room was nice. We stayed here in April Thursday - Sunday and were on the third floor of one of the buildings. The people above us must have had young children because it sounded like a stampede of animals running around at all hours of the day. We called the front desk several times to see if there was anything they could do to get them to be a little more quiet and nothing was ever done. They just kept saying they would call them but never even asked me what room I was staying in. We were in town for a conference for my husband and It was hard to sleep when you hear pounding on the ceiling above you at 10:00 at night.I also have a HUGE problem with the fact that they charge you a cleaning fee. What do they clean? You are responsible for doing your own dishes and taking your own trash out which by the way there are only three trash receptacles in the facility so you either have to walk to one or put your trash in the car and drive there. I have read responses from the facility manager saying there isn't enough room for them to be located at every building but if you have been there then you know there is plenty of room. So you basically pay them a fee to have them make your bed and replenish towels after you leave. We were originally supposed to stay in the hotel the conference was at but it was over booked and were booked here and after visiting the other resort I wish we would have been able to stay there instead. We did not have a choice in the matter since we did not book this on our own. In the future if we come back to Orlando we will definitely not be staying here.On another note, they offer Wi-Fi that does not work. It isn't even worth your time to try and connect to it.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: Fui 6 veces y siempre tuve buenas experiencias. Gracias especiales a Karla Gross que siempre nos 10 puntos. Es un lugar piola para ir a Disney , muy agradable y cómodo cuando tenes hijos chicos !!!!!! 2 baños , cocina , lavadora etcétera etcétera

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column27: Ok place for the money but a bit disappointed
column29: The grounds are gorgeous and pool area is nice. Room carpet needed to be replaced and it was almost impossible to ever get ahold of the front desk. Being unable to reach them I had to fix a leaky kitchen faucet myself and also had a problem with the a/c which I was able to resolve by shutting the unit off for a bit. Staff was friendly and the resort is in a nice area. I would consider staying here again but was a bit disappointed.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I am really disappointed with this resort. The pool was extremely overcrowded and obviously was not as big as your professional photos represented. Check in took forever, there were no clean pool towels and once we got them, they were thin and ripped. The rooms smelled of mold and had very little to cook with. I have 4 kids and there was only 4 plates...yet the room sleeps 6. I come to Orlando often and for the money I think there are many better options.

La pileta y el bar son un gran recurso de ultima hora cuando llegas cansado.
