column29: As a family of 4 (kids 13 & 11) we spent 13 nights at this resort last 2 weeks in March. The staff were very approachable & professional and the bar staff were very good. The main reason we chose this accomodation was for the rooms which were very comfortable and a joy to come back to after a day in the parks, as was the swimming pool area. Only gripe was the bar food which we only sampled once, it was rathered tired and we probably caught them on a bad day. That said we did not have to pay for it. Would definetly return to this place in the future. Thanks to all at the Tuscana for our wonderful stay.

column29: Stayed in 3 BR unit 2 nights ago. Suite was large but sheets, towels and blankets are on par with Motel : thin, pilled up blankets and thin polyester bedspreads w bad prints. BEWARE THE ADDITIONAL $65-$75 CLEANING & AMENITY FE and for that you have to do your dishes and take out your own garbage or more fees apply. This surprise charge at checkin made the rate less of a deal than I originally thought. Pool area needs about 50 more lounge chairs during busier times. Convenient location for the Orlando attractions & Legoland & we needed the space as we have 5 kids but probably wouldn't stay again given overall room quality and appearance.

Informed the office te goal was to recover it before another person entered room. The next morning we were informed housekeeping did not turn anything in. We insisted they check since we hid it. The jacuzzi stopped working around 10 pm and I called the front desk to ask for somebody to come check it out and someone was there in less than 3 minutes...you won't be disappointed if you stay here

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: This is our 4th year staying here on vacation. We wouldn't consider staying anywhere else. Our family of 6 is quite comfortable in the 3 bedroom condos, but what really makes our stay great is the wonderful staff. Dave and Jenny at the clubhouse welcome us each year and really go above and beyond to see that the needs of our family are met. The food is always delicious and my children really enjoy the slushies and ice cream available at the bar. There are many days that the children prefer to hang out at the pool over going to a theme park. It's really great to go on vacation and still feel at home.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Your home away from home - Simple and perfect
column29: Simple and perfect if you are not looking for a resort in or around the theme parks complexes. This resort is about 25-30 minutes driving from the parks. On the other hand, you get to relax like you´re in heaven when you come home from the 35 miles daily walking in the parks and pay an affordable price. My party of 6 got comfortably accommodated in an extremely clean 3 bedroom apartment + fully equipped kitchen. There is nice community pool to splash at night next to a bar for cocktails and a wonderful Spa set at 100°F (38°C) to relax before bedtime... There is a Publix plaza and fast food restaurants around you can get things for the road of for the room. The down side: Blankets are the cheapest you can get at Walmart but at least clean and the worse ever... no free internet in the room... they charge $10,00/day... This is completely unforgivable... C'mon you guys can do better in this topic...But In the end of the day the review is positive... We did not pick room service although they had it available in some level....Tuscana Resort is recommended

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I deal in the complaint department everyday so I think I understand how to do a review.We went to 2 other couples on a week getaway, NO KIDS. Our First impression of the Resort, was This is Awesome. It was Clean and well kept. Check in was a breeze. The Front desk help was great to deal with, we literally walked in, signed a few papers and we were on our way to our room. We walked into our room and it was clean and again well kept. Everyone was very impressed. I have seen some reviews about the TV not being updated. Sorry but we did have an old TV, BUT WE WERE NOT THERE TO WATCH TV FOR THE WHOLE VACATION. The only complaint on the room was that we were on I-4 side of the resort, so when we woke up and sat on the patio, it was very LOUD. We made due though because we were on Vacation. We were disappointed that you could not bring in a cooler to the pool area, we understood that because of the bar and restaurant, but we made due. The pool was a little bit too warm, almost bath water in temp, but again we were not going to complain. We did talk to some that own on the property and they stated that last year the pool was broken so no one went into the pool. small price to pay. The resort was easy to get to and we had no problems what so ever. The staff was great, we did not have any hair dryers in the room for 3 ladies, and we asked and we got them right away. The men wanted to go golfing, so the front desk staff gave us coupons for the Kissimmee Bay CC or Remington CC. Decent golf, but too far to drive to. Would recommend that the Resort work out some deal with Champions Gate golf next door. We did not get that option.The only issue that we could see was that our party liked to cook or grill and the grills were on the other side of the resort. I would recommend that the resort put a patio to the backside of each building and put a couple grills there. Overall we had a fun experience and enjoyed the resortWe had issues with the WiFi, They do need to do something to correct this issue. I have seen this complaint on a lot of posts, but it does not seem to fixed,Also better pillows,

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Fine leiligheter som hadde alt. Vi hadde en med 3 soverom. Stort og fint, med alt som du trengte. Hadde vaskemaskin og tørketrommel på rommet, noe som er veldig fint da du reiser og er borte i over 3 uker. Rent og pent over alt. Internett som funket veldig bra. Fint bassengområde med masse solstoler og senger. Det eneste var at det skjelden var ledige senger/stoler der da de fleste reserverte tidlig på morgenen, enda det stod de ikke fikk lov til det. Eneste stedet det alltid var ledig var inne ved barnebassenget. Der fant vi ledige senger og der var det alltid rolig, siden det tydeligvis var mye kaldere i vannet her enn i det store bassenget. Var nesten aldri unger uti her, så vi fant ut at dette også var det mest rolige stedet å ligge og sole seg. Du fikk kjøpt drikke og drinker ved bassenget.

column27: Nice condo, but room smelled musty
column29: We stayed here in February and when we arrived the room had a funky smell to it. I thought it would go away after we aired it out, but the smell persisted the whole week we were there. We mentioned it to the front desk and they were supposed to send someone to look into, but they never came. Other than that, there was a lot of room and it is a nice place. The pool was nice even though the weather wasn't.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: Em janeiro, hospedei-me com minhas duas filhas, minha irmã, o marido e as duas filhas dela no Tuscana. Fomos encaminhados a um apto bastante confortável, mas a iluminação não funcionava. Eles providenciaram outro apto, mas foi um transtorno porque já havíamos desfeito algumas malas. Quando chegamos ao outro apto, vimos bagagem e voltamos. Fomos então dirigidos a um terceiro apto. Apesar da situação desagradável, a recepção foi sempre atenciosa. Os aptos são excelentes, com quartos grandes, closets espaçosos, boa cozinha, com o necessário, boa sala, com grande mesa de jantar. O condomínio está bem localizado, sendo fácil se locomover para os parques. Para os brasileiros, gera estranhamento ter que levar o lixo até as lixeiras coletivas, mas não é nada com que não se acostume. Voltaria a me hospedar no Tuscana

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Great value and location...but no free WIFI in units
column29: We arrived at the Tuscana Resort on January 24th (a Saturday evening) to check in...this was not your typical check in desk. There were 4-5 desks in the "office" area and each guest would sit with the check-in clerk. Once we had our keys, we found our building (#7) and went up to our unit on the 2nd floor. Upon entering, we were surprised at how large the 3 bedroom condo was, the carpet near the entry door was dirty, but overall the condo was clean and a welcome sight after 20+ hours in the car. We quickly got rooms assigned, unpacked and relaxed. We did bring our own laundry soap/dryer sheets as the unit has a small washer/dryer, we also brought our own paper plates, garbage bags, coffee and filters, hand soap, sanitizer wipes (to clean the remotes, door knobs, cabinet handles, etc) and disposable cups. There is a Publix near the front of the development, but be prepared for high dollar items. The only item we had to buy from here (aside from our groceries) was dishwasher soap as the condo allowed us 2 sample packets, but we needed to do one more load before leaving.All in all, this was a nice condo dev. It was VERY close to Disney and only about 30 min from Universal. We wish it had been warmer out as we didn't get a chance to use the pool but my nephew did play on the kids playground area and seemed to enjoy it.Our unit had all flat screen TVs in it (one in each bedroom and one in living area), two couches (one was a sleeper), large dining table, pots/pans/flatware, small table on screened balcony. No salt/pepper in our shakers. No free wifi in units, you had to go to their business area to use it free or pay $8/day for it.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: Stayed with my husband for 2 weeks in October, our first time in orlando without the kids!! We had a fantastic time, the apartments at Tuscana are a great base from which to enjoy all the Attractions, only about a 20-30 minute drive to most of the major theme parks, shops etc.The complex itself was very well maintained, the pool & bar area were clean with plenty of loungers & cabañas. Our apartment was very comfortable, spacious, clean & well appointed, with all the home comforts.Only a few minutes drive takes you to a Publix supermarket, a petrol station and a few eateries.Championsgate is a beautiful area of town, fountains, a golf course and some gorgeous hotels are all in the areaCan not wait to go back

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: Antes de viajar, havia visto inúmeras reclamações acerca de segurança nos hotéis em Orlando. Aqui eu me senti muito seguro. Talvez por ser um local um pouco distante do centro, não notei nenhuma movimentação suspeita. Tudo muito organizado e, embora o pessoal não fale nada de português, eles se esforçam para entender o que falamos. O lugar é muito organizado, mas a limpeza diária é por conta do hóspede, o que também não traz grandes dificuldades. Próximo há uma farmácia Wallgrenes, MacDonalds, supermercado, posto de gasolina, etc. Não se poe pensar em ficar no local sem locar um veículo.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We spent Christmas at the resort with some other members of our family and had another fabulous time in Florida. This was our 4th visit to tuscana at this time of year . The lad who checked us in was polite and very helpful .Our apartment was as we requested a upper floor , it was very clean with a new carpet in the lounge / dining area and had all we needed for our stay. On Christmas day we had diner at the bar/ restaurant which was really enjoyable. All the staff we encountered were well mannered and polite. The grounds within the resort are well maintained with a great pool and bar area . It is also well placed with easy access to the I.4 when travelling to the all attractions . I was pleased to hear that a planned upgrade of the internal furnishings of the condos is ingoing to maintain the good reputation of the resort. some things they could improve on would be to provide other forms of entertainment than just karaoke , and restore the festive decorations at the entrance of the resort to the standards of previous years as it was so attractive returning back in the evenings.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: Fuimos con varias familias, yo con mi marido y mi reina de casi 2 años, me preocupaba la seguridad del lugar y me sorprendi es un lugar muy seguro, calido, amplio, era un placer llegar al depa desp de un dia intenso de parques o shopping, un balcon cerrado con vista a una arboleda divina, super equipado de lavavajillas, lavarropas, secarropas, secador de pelo, ropa blanca, tenes el super cerca para comprar todo lo basico para esa estadia, cerca de todos los parques, que decir impecable todo, volveria sin dudarlo.Nuestro unico dia libre quisimos usar la hermosa piscina pero el agua estaba fria, avisamos en recepcion, no opaco nuestro dia ya que prestan pelis para ver, el wi fi es pago en la habitaion y anduvo de maravillas, tambien pagamos el estacionamiento dentro del complejo para nuestra comodidad y se paga limpieza al final de la estadia, son adicionales a tener en cuenta

column29: I'm at the airport after a stay at Tuscana. This is a great property! I wish I had found years ago. Clean, safe, really pretty grounds, smiling staff. It's great to be able to walk to the onsite bar/restaurant. Publix is a 3 minute drive. We didn't visit the movie theater, but it's great that it's there. Based on the price, I expected it to be a little beat up, but that wasn't the case at all. Lovely patio, other than I missed my memory foam bed, I can't think of one thing I'd change. column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Just returned home from a one weeks stay at the Tuscana and we enjoyed it immensely. We stayed in a three bedroom condo which was lovely. Very clean and well equipped with the essentials. There is no question that you need a car when staying here, Disney is about 20 minutes and Universal is a half hour away but all are directly off Hwy 4 so they're easy to find. There is a local "Publix", but it is extremely expensive so it might be worth the effort to find something more reasonable when buying supplies. This is not a hotel, so there is no room service etc but if you are looking for something at a reasonable price that has all the comforts of home, this is it. Yes the TV's are old but how much TV are you going to watch while on vacation? My kids thoroughly enjoyed movie rentals and the little cinema. It was easy to throw a load of laundry in at night but remember you have to supply your own detergent, dish soap etc. There were some kids in the resort but there seemed to be a lot of "snowbirds" too and there really wasn't much in the way of things to do for little ones. All in all a great time was had by all. Would definately reccomend the Tuscana.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Close enough to the attractions but far enough to relax in comfort
column29: We stayed in a two bedroom, two bath condo with a screened balcony overlooking a nature preserve. Our unit had a full kitchen with nice appliances and granite counters. A stackable washer and dryer in the unit were like new and super clean. Loved the walk in closets in both bedrooms! There were three TV's with cable and free WiFi available. The area attractions are fun, but it is so nice to come back to a bit of peace and quiet at the end of the day. The grounds are beautiful with several fountains which was a treat for us since it was dead of winter back at home! All of the staff went out of their way to be accommodating. The free DVD rental and gaming system can save a rainy day for a family! Would recommend this resort and will definitely stay there again if we are in the area.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Handy location for the Disney Worlds
column29: As a family of 4, we spent a week at the hotel.Checkin was a breeze and we were quickly off to our room.The hotel is very nice, the gardens are nice and the pool area was very tropical.We had a 3 bed unit in block 2, the unit is very spacious and had all the basics you need while on holidays. Fully self contained.One bad thing, the smell of the water when you use the shower is very nasty, smells like sulphur.We spent a lot of our time visiting all the great things to do in Orlando, so we pretty much just had breakfast in the morning and returned at 10pm at night to sleep.The hotel is in a great location to visit the Worlds or International road or most other things of interest.There are a few shops just down the road to buy all your food and groceries.The Wifi is very bad so don't waste your time getting it, we did but ended up getting a refund.One other bad thing, you have to get rid of your own rubbish which is a drama when your on the way to the airport and have to find a bin. The hotel should provide this service themselves.The checkin don't organise anything of your tourist activities either which is not good. A pain when the wifi is so bad.All in all we had a great time at the hotel and would def recommend it.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Great place to stay for Disney World
column29: Stayed in a 3 bedroom 2 bath condo for my family of 5. The condo was huge and clean. Free wifi, 3 t.v.'s, a full kitchen with dishes and cookware, a pool and hot tub, and free movie rentals made this the perfect place to stay. It's less than 20 minutes away from Disney World but for the price we paid per night (less than 100), it could not be beat. The only negative is the T.V.'s could be updated and better channels offered, along with laundry soap being available. There is a Publix supermarket just down the street and a Chili's Restaurant as well. Highly recommend the Chili's restaurant for the service alone. Best we have every had and happy hour all day means 2 for 1 drinks all day. Will stay here again if the price is right.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Excelente opcion para viajar en familia o con amigos
column29: Excelente atención, las instalaciones, y los departamentos son muy prolijos y bien equipadosHemos ido en varias oportunidades y siempre fuimos muy bien tratados.Siempre fuimos a los departamentos para 8 personas y realmente son muy cómodos. Ademas esta muy cerca de los parques de Disney y muy cómodo para llegar a Universal.Tambien muy cerca se encuentra un supermercado, estación de servicio, Mc Donalds, etc. Sin duda es super recomendable..

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Fui de vacaciones junto a mi familia en el 2011, 2013 y 2014. Es una opción que no falla. Aunque sin lujos, el complejo presenta un gran mantenimiento e higiene tanto en los departamentos como en las áreas de recreación. Excelentemente ubicado (a 20 minutos de los parques) hace que desde mi punto de vista sea uno de los mejores lugares precio/calidad en todo Orlando.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Great accommodations for family Disney trip
column29: I heard about Tuscana from a friend. I brought my family of 5 with 3 young kids for our Disney trip. Stayed in a beautiful 3 br condo that exceeded expectations for the price. Resort is nicely maintained. Condo was spacious and had everything we wanted. Only downside was the outdoor pool wasn't heated (we had been told it was) and the late night noise from karaoke at the bar on weekends. But overall we were very happy with location and amenities for the price.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I agree with other reviews that this resort is a little dated but having said that, so are we. It was very clean and had absolutely everything you could need for the ten days we were there. Oh, except for laundry supplies to use in the washer dryer. I had tucked a few pods and dryer sheets in my bag so we wouldn't have to buy them at the store. That worked out well. We were upgraded to a three bedroom, two wash room and there was plenty of room for at least six people. We wanted a quiet area and they did give us that at the back of building seven I believe it was. The only problem with being at the back of that building is that it gets no sun all day. If you are a sun lover you would be better on the other side. This resort has a lovely pool area. We only used it one day but it was very nice. I was told by those that swam, that is was freezing. We did go in January. Overall, the people were excellent, the location is fantastic. Right off 4. Please be aware if you are driving there, the signs for the resort are not very noticeable and we went right by it. It is off exit 58. We got in at 1:30 a.m. and there was a gentleman there with our keys and such. No muss, no fuss. Had a great stay there and would recommend it. It is good value for the money. Did not use the restaurant as there are so many around, but I did hear from others that it was quite nice. Oh yes, I almost forgot. The door to our condo was broken and wouldn't lock. We weren't fearful but they should see to that. There is a Publix grocery store at the entrance and by entrance I mean you really need a car in this area. It was great for getting our pantry supplies. The people there were also really really nice. The tvs are older but they were just fine unless you intend to spend most of your time in front of the tv on your holiday.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Secluded (too much), rooms are good for the price.
column29: First Impression:Upon arriving in Orlando, red flag #1: the taxi drivers have never heard of this resort. Once we arrived at the "front desk", nothing was clearly labelled as "front desk" and eventually we were greeted and checked in by a woman who proceeded to be shocked that we didn't have a rental car and unfortunately for us the only room free for us for our reservation was in Building 9, a "5-10 min walk", in reality the walk is about 5 minutes from the front entrance, but still. Not entirely convenient with big luggage and certainly not if you were disabled or elderly (lucky for us we are fit!). After being told on the phone before we came that there were no additional fees beyond the price quoted ($99/night for a 2 bedroom suite), we ended up having to pay a $55 cleaning fee as well as $10 for Internet.... not impressed with this.Pool/Restaurant/Bar:The pool is decent as is the restaurant/bar that is at poolside. There is only one pool and one hottub and they certainly get crowded as everyone comes out especially in the afternoon. Get out when the sun starts getting warm by 11am, by 1pm the pooldeck is packed.Rooms:The A/C does not work, we couldn't get our room cooler than 75F. The TVs are OLD, but really how much time are you spending watching them anyways? The WiFi did NOT work, we were charged $10 for this but had to connect to another room's WiFi (and were NOT reimbursed for our $10). We stayed in 9106. The room was clean and quiet. There was only shampoo provided and one bar of soap; definitely bring your own shampoo/conditioner/bodywash from home! The fridge had a leaking issue; the top shelf was covered in water. The 2 bedroom suite is large; you could easily fit 4 people quite comfortable as each bedroom has a large walk-in closet and en-suite bath.Location:This resort is in the middle of nowhere. We took a cab to Downtown Disney one evening and it was $35USD one way! There is nothing around the resort, you can walk about 10 minutes down the road to Chilli's, Subway, or McDonald's.Service:NO room service, valet, bellboy, maidservice, anything. Front Desk doesn't even pick up the phone the majority of the time and you get voicemail. Voicemail! And you are supposed to call their number in case of emergency!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Stayed here for a long weekend. Had a great rate for a two bedroom, and upon checkin was upgraded to a three bedroom. Unit itself was decent. Sufficient toiletries and kitchen essentials. Curtain rod was broken upon entering the room, called maintenance and it was fixed within an hour. Apparently the owners' wall mounted 50inch tv was not working, so they had placed a large box tv in from of it on a table. A little tacky, but it worked. Actually all the rooms had box sets. Sofa was torn in places. Wifi signal was good. Pool was great. They did not enforce the pool closing time, lots of people still in the pool past that time. No problems finding parking, and no excessive noise during our stay. Very close to the interstate. Grocery store and restaurants nearby. Would stay here again...

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Mid range facility with excellent location if you rent a vehicle.
column29: The rooms are very dated and many things don't work such as the light over the stove and the blender. Need to update TVs and have a full set of dishes. Got my replacement blender 2 days after I asked for it. They really leave you to fend for yourself which is fine for the type of resort but a welcome package would have been nice. Pool is nice and lots of seating. Our 2 bedroom suite was roomy but we would have liked stools at the breakfast counter. They need to work on their customer relations skills.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Espectacular, muy cerca de los parques, todos los servicios, departamentos de lujo. Fuimos con mi familia y amigos. A escasos metros de la entrada tenes una centro de servicios con un supermercado, bancos, estaciones de servicio , mc donals, etc, Ni lo duden.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Stayed 17 nights in the second building away from highway #4 there was a constant rumble of traffic that took a couple of nights to get use to. 2 bed room was nice the TVs were old 24 inch solid state not seen this type of TV for a while (even the dumpy places now have flat screens).Shower heads old need to run around under the shower to get wet.It is another Florida place nice high ceilings and thin floors could hear every move the people and one small kid with heavy feet made.A few stains on the carpets and the transition between the front bedroom and bathroom carpet wore thin step on the tap strip a couple of time in the middle of the night.There was some garbage that the condo down the hall did not taken to the dumpster (lazy people) it was there for 2 -3 days animals bugs got to it before it was cleaned up.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed at this hotel because it looked good online. We checked in and the staff was very nice and friendly. We stayed in a two bedroom unit with two baths. It was wonderful. The rooms were very large and the kitchen area was spotless. We went to Universal, which isn't that far away but you defiantly need to rent a car. The pool and hot tub area were very nice and their is an outdoor bar and an indoor restaurant, that also serves food outdoors by the pool. The restaurant was casual, but the food was excellent and pretty reasonable in price. The service at the restaurant we great and the people really, really nice. Drinks were not expensive either. This is a great place for families with children, but really for anyone. I would defiantly stay here again and would recommend it. Just understand that it's efficiency apartments (no room service) and isn't really close to anything in the immediate area.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Staff were always friendly. I booked on 'otel.com' and then we decided to arrive 2 nights earlier. Called their office & nice British lady booked 2 first nights to bridge with our booking. TVs are REALLY old - as is the couch. We knew that about the tv and could cope but the couch was so old and worn it was impossible to sit on. We were there for 17 days so a good seat would have been appreciated. The carpet was so worn in the 1st bedroom that my husband kept stepping on the tacks. 2 tiles in on-suite bathroom were broken so must have sounded really loud downstairs. Bathroom & Kitchen tiles & grout really need a good scrubbing - as do the cement hallways outside of the units. We were surprised the complex needs so much work when it's not that old. In evenings we heard kids running around above for hrs - sometimes until 2:30 am! Christmas Eve was spoiled with not being able to sleep because they were partying - yelling and screaming. The units are not very well sound proofed. Tenants left their garbage bags in the hallway so animals got into them & dragged the mess in hallway and on stairs. It was left there for 4 days. There was a loud fight in the parking lot (girl with a bat) that went on with screaming and swearing for over 40 mins at 2 am and no security arrived to stop them. On New Year's Eve someone had a blow horn that started about 8 pm and lasted until 3 am. We never saw a security guard patrolling like other condos we've stayed at so really didn't feel all that secure. Anytime we saw a worker in the evening they were riding around in golf carts - with NO lights! Very unsafe in fog. Stay if you get a ridiculously low price but for regular pricing we've stayed in way nicer.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Volvimos a Tuscana y no nos desiluciono! limpieza, calidad y comodidad son las caracteristicas de este lugar. Aunque la deco y los televisores son un poco antiguo, todo funciona perfectamente, es tranquilo y comodo. La gente de la recepcion es muy amable y te aconseja en todo lo que necesites. Sin duda seguimos recomendandolo como una excelente opcion para hospedarse fuera de los parques, si visitan Orlando. Ademas tienen un supermercado Publix a poca distancia, un Mc Donalds y un Seven Eleven. Tambien un restaurant mexicano Chili's, en donde se come super rico y accesible. Estas a pocos minutos de los parques, aprox a 15 minutos . Nuestro apartamento tenia dos dormitorios super amplios, con camas amplias (4 personas comodas), dos baños grandes, living, comedor y cocina. Equipado con lavadora y secadora de ropa, lavavajillas, microondas, Heladera y cocina electrica. Un placer

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: This was my third stay at Tuscana, and I was just as pleased as always. The apartments are huge, the wifi was fast and the workers were always friendly. We ate at the restaurant on site twice and loved it! The waitress was lovely and the chefs fantastic. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, as long as they had a car. Having a supermarket and fast food places so close was perfect, and there was no noise around the hotel. The only thing I can think to improve is the musty old smell in the rooms, it's smelled the same for the six years I've been visiting. If you're planning on hiring a car I would STRONGLY recommend staying at Tuscana. Best of all, it's a cheap stay. Shop around for the best rates and you won't be disappointed.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Okay but would not stay there again
column29: We rented several rooms at the Tuscana for my son's tournament at Disney Wide World of Sports. The property and rooms were very clean. The rooms definitely need to be updated, The boys brought their XBOX Ones to play between games, and the TV's were too old to handle them. They were not even flat screens. The bedding needs to be upgraded and updated. The staff was never friendly once during my stay. Upon arrival, they acted like they were too tired to answer questions and just wanted us to move on. Same treatment upon checkout. The checkout clerk never even looked at me when speaking. On my second day there, I asked for a light bulb to replaced in the bathroom and for a battery for the nonfunctioning remote control. The person told me they would be up right away. I waited up until midnight, and they never arrived. In fact, the never came at all during my whole stay. I told the check out attendant, and he seemed not to care. He just said, "OK, I will tell maintenance."In photos viewed prior to arrival, the room showed counter stools at the kitchen counter. None of our rooms had them. Thought that was strange. There was a basketball court, and since the XBOXes would not work on the TV's the boys thought they could play basketball. When we went over there, a huge tour bus was parked in the middle of the court.We thought we would have a cookout one evening as the property has grills and picnic tables. The grills were tiny (and need charcoal), and there was no lighting there, and only 2 tables, so that was out too! WiFi and cell phone service were terrible. My friend in building 3 had to go out on her patio for her phone to work to call me .Overall, the property is nice and very clean. I just didn't feel like we got exactly what was advertised. There were not very many places close by to eat dinner. It was convenient to WWOS and Disney. I would not stay there again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

Then I for here the keys did not work security did not help they help desk did not help. They say they were gonna call back it is know 2:30 am and they tall me to call back in the morning. So I got no working keys and I had to call back in order to get that information.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: We booked a block of rooms for parents of cheerleaders attending a competition locally. Close enough to the host hotel and far enough to get away from it all. lol. The units are clean, spacious, and reasonably priced. The tavern food is all freshly cooked and delicious. We hosted a buffet dinner for 78. Staff is friendly and accommodating. Enjoyed some adult time in the bar area with karaoke. Was also able to host a couple of movie nights for the cheerleaders at the on-site theatre.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: For the price it worked out
column29: This trip was for a youth football tournament. They were able to keep the teams close together which was nice. Issues with room keys seemed to be a common theme. Also hall lights in our building were off most of the time and flickered on and off. Beds were bad. TVs need to be replaced. But the price, size and location seemed to be right for our group. Would not stay here for a personal vacation. But would recommend for a large group trying to keep expenses down.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: This is a review of the customer service. I accidentally booked and paid a suite for the wrong date. I immediately noticed the mistake and called the hotel to ask if they would let me sleep on my desired night. They had rooms available for both nights. I called over 20 times. Someone picked up the phone and said that is was possible to use a room on a different night but it needs to be approved by "in-house reservations manager". When she forwarded the call, a wrong person picked up the phone and told me to call again. So I called again and it happened all over again. And again. And again. What an awful customer service. After 12 hours finally someone told me to wait and went to ask the reservations manager if they would allow me to sleep tonight instead of tomorrow night. The manager did not get to the phone but told that I cannot use the room on a different night. They could easily have allowed me to use a room today even if I paid for tomorrow. They did not. Well they earned some of my money this time but they will never ever see me or my family or friends in this hotel.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: My family 4 went to Orlando to go to the theme parks over Thanksgiving. We had an wonderful week! Tuscana is very close to Disney and not too far from Universal. The grounds were very nice, the service at the restaurant was great and the condo itself was excellent. I would recommend Tuscana to friends and family.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We spent three nights over the Thanksgiving holiday. The resort is very convenient to Disney, many golf courses and other attractions. We were two couples in a three bedroom two bath condo. The condos have well equipped kitchens and are well kept. They have a small restaurant that serves very good food and their wait staff is very nice. The grounds are secure (with an entry gate) and have ample parking. They could use a few more trash dumpsters. We would stay there again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Came for my daughters soccer tournament. Stayed in condo 4106, the furniture in the unit was not worth the $300 security deposit. I think it came straight off of the Archie Bunker show. Left early and stayed in a hotel off of 95.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Totally think this resort is lovely. Great warm reception, beautiful rooms (although the 70's were phoning asking for their tv's back). Beautiful pool area for all ages. The 2 bed Condo was approx 1100 square feet and roomy enough for 3 adults. Thank you for the welcome packages and the helpful front desk team. Karaoke on Saturday was fun. Resort is not far from Disney and approx 1 1/2 hours drive to both the Gulf and the Atlantic.Only downfall was the toll charges - people need to realize that they need cash and change when they land so that if they are renting a vehicle they are not court short and un prepared.We would definitely come back to this resort if we were in the area.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed her several years ago and really enjoyed it. We came back again for the last week of November and beginning of December 2014. The rooms were clean, but the beds were terrible. Every one of them was so old and thin that we have all had terrible nights sleeps. I would never stay here or recommend it again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Great location close to parks and good facility.
column29: We stayed in a private condo for a week and visited the Disney parks and Sea World. This location is very convenient and away from all the 'strip' traffic farther up into Orlando. Getting to and from the parks was simple and a short 15-20 minute drive. From the time we left the condo, we were in the park in 45 minutes. Great pool facility, great for kids, restaurants, shopping all near by.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Desde Guayaquil-Ecuador, nuestra segunda visita a Tuscana, esta vez entre el 16 y 22 de Noviembre/14. Como siempre todo perfecto: tranquilidad, cerca de todo lo necesario (parques, supemercados, restaurantes, la vía I4 que te lleva a todos lados, etc...).Estuvimos 5 personas en un departamento de dos habitaciones con cama queen size + 1 sofa bed en la sala de estar. Descanso absoluto, sin bullas ni gente indeseable. Todo bien cuidado. las áreas comunes y dentro del departamento todo OK. Muy útil tener todo lo necesario para preparar desayuno o cena si quieres comer a tu gusto o ahorrar un poco. En Publix venden unos sanduches muy buenos, baratos y apropiados para llevar a los parques (dentro toda la comida y bebida es muy cara!). Es necesario alquilar carro para estar en Tuscana debido a su ubicación, recomiendo tratar con Sixt, muy buen servicio y precios. Lo recomiendo al 100%.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Excellent place to stay with your family and friends for enjoyable vacations at Disney and Universal them parks.The apartments have all the confort you need for living as if you were at home. The apartments are really roomy, each bedroom has its bathroom and its dresser.You will find washing machine, dryer machine, Vacuum cleaner, TVs at every bedroom and one more in the living room. The kitchen is very well equipped with all the elements you need for having great dinner, breakfast or lunch.You do not have expect a typical hotel, it is more a kind of condominiums. Americans may be more useful to this kind of facilities, but in LATAM is not that common.The apartments are very clean as well as the linen. Good Air conditioning, warm floors, full of plugs.Nearby you will find supermarket, Pharmacy, Bank, Restaurants (you do not need them), Gas Station. Everything settled for a very comfortable stay.They do not have room service, which is very convenient...why?? Well...you do not have to leave the room for cleaning!!One point that is not that positive is that the room has Cable Internet, not WiFi. But ... you should be at the parks!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Stayed here for two weeks. Two bed apartment which was clean and a good size. Decor and furnishings need updating and if you were intending to cook warning, the range of kitchen utensils is limited which is strange and frustrating given the resort is billed as 'self catering'. Couple of pointers:1)The corkscrew did not have a screw! We requested a replacement but not replaced - not the customer service you would expect especially during the low season. 2) you need to stock a greater number of mugs/ glasses 6 of each is not enough.3) coffee machine needs replacing or a good soak to get the stains out. Looks grubby.4) supply cling film, coffee filters and foil in small but useful quantities - relieves guest frustration at none supplied. In the numerous s/c establishments we have stayed in these have been supplied. It's a small thing but adds to guest satisfaction and puts you above the rest.5) install a small safe. I feel happier if my passports are locked away if I am out! The shower was good (but again the tile grouting was tired and gave the impression of being dirty which it wasn't ). The play station froze the DvD image numerous times but we didn't go to watch telly but you would expect it to work if you did want to (it was reported to reception again upon departure). A light bulb went which was replaced in good time. We found the beds very comfortable. Loads of white clean towels supplied. And slightly larger stripy ones for the pool area. The washing machine and dryer worked well.Reception Staff were great. Very helpful. Pool was open til 10pm, clean and the pool area tidy.We ate in the restaurant twice. I recommend the homemade chilli and curry.The bar area was quiet. Closed at 10 if only one or two customers. Bar staff pleasant and knowledgable. Entertainment on Thursdays and Saturdays. Locals drink there so you know it's good. We really did enjoy our stay! All the points raised are offered to management to improve the standard of accommodation. The resort offers Good value and is a great location. If they want to survive they need to up their game with the new competition being built on the doorstep. Will consider returning should we return to Florida for a holiday.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Súper recomendable, por su ubicación, precio, y comodidad de las residencias. Los parques y centros comerciales a poca distancia. Hay un súper mercados muy cerca. Las habitaciones muy cómodas cuentan con todo lo necesario. El personal muy amable.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: My husband and I and 2 friends stayed in a 2 bedroom condo for 2 nights while visiting Disneyworld. Very easy to get back and forth to the parks. The condo was a good size and very clean. We were disappointed in the "old and worn" furniture but it was serviceable. Also many of the condos that are on the 1st floor overlook the parking lots. But it was still well worth the price. Went to pool and bar and restaurant one afternoon since we weren't going to the park until dark. Had a very pleasant afternoon and lunch and drinks were good and reasonably priced. The 2 employees we encountered (bar/restaurant and reception were both very nice and efficient.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We spent a week at Tuscana the end of October 2014 and had a fantastic time. Our 4 year old totally loved the pool area, the water is shallow in most parts and the hot tub was also great and well maintained. The bar was great fun, especially karaoke night and all the staff were helpful and made us welcome. Food was good and well priced. Our 2 bedroom room was clean and spacious. Very comfortable beds and well equipped kitchen for our stay. The TVs are old style but no time to watch them anyway! Free internet by the pool and reception were welcomed. The surrounding area was peaceful with local golf courses close and Disney about 15 mins away. Also restaurants really close - chillis had 2 meals for $20 and permanent happy hour! We can't wait to come back. Thanks a lot everyone.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Been to this resort three times had a 3 bedroom condo every thing on hand, restaurant with wide range if food all at good prices, well stocked pool bar, cinema, games room and a large heated pool, the condo had everything we needed very well equipt, the staff Go out of their way to help. The location is only 20mins away from the Disney resort and just the one highway, we were a party of 4 adults and 2 children it was all we wanted. We will definetly return for a third visit highly recommend it.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: This past weekend ( November 7-9) I stayed at the Tuscana Resort with a couple of friends that we were all going to EDC. We decided to stay in this hotel because it was able to accommodate all of us and it was for a cheap price. When we first arrived at the hotel, we thought it was really nice. It does have a nice look to it and its kind of in the back of a random road so you're all there by yourself so its relatively quiet. The rooms were very nice and the furniture was comfortable. Heres where everything takes a turn for the worst. We left for EDC and when we came back at 2 in the morning after being in the music festival for 7 hours straight and being in traffic for an hour all we wanted to do was sleep. When we get to our room our room key doesn't work, when you would put it in. It would show you the green light and right after a red light so we were very confused. We used all four of the room keys we had and none worked. Not to mention also that our doorknob was broken. So we decide to go to the lobby to see if they could fix it and the lobby was closed . No one was inside it. We saw a couple of security guards standing at the entrance so we tell them what was going on and he went with us to the room to see if his master card worked. The securities master card didn't work. Turns out the thing that lock and unlocks the door is running on low battery. Also the security works for a third part company so he has nothing to do with the hotel and all he has is the mastercard to enter any room in the hotel. The security was very nice and tried to help, he offered us an emergency room but we didn't want to take it because we wanted to change out our clothes and charge our phones. So he called maintenance to see if they could send someone out to fix it. After waiting for 2 hours in 46 degree weather. We decided to take the emergency room because all we wanted was to pee and sleep at this point. When we get to the emergency room we hang out for a bit and after a while we start hearing a noise. I heard it first because it was in my room and then in the hallway. Turns out the fire detectors were also on low battery so they started making a noise to be able to change the battery. The noise kept us up until like 5 in the morning. Turns out at 7 when the lobby opened they went to the room to try to open it and didn't work so they went back to the lobby and didn't inform us. When we went to the lobby around 7:20 and told them and then they sent maintenance to fix it. After they had to change our rooms because the doorknob was broken and they were also blaming that on us. They said our new room would be ready at 12:30. We didn't get it until 3. They had two separate companies clean the room than an inspector had to go into the room to check the room than go to the lobby get the room key and give it to us. Mind you the whole time the new room was right next to our old room. On sunday checkout time is @ 10 and we had overslept a little from lack of sleep. At 10:30 a cleaning lady opened the door to the room and we were still in there. We told her we hadn't left yet and in 10 minutes she started knocking on the door every 5 minutes. This was the worst hotel experience ever. The manager was rude and they were late on everything. The elevator also sounded like it was going to break at any second.

column29: Lovely 2 Bedroom apartment which was clean and well maintained. Always got a bed at the pool and towels were supplied in the apartment. We had no problems with the wifi. Check in/out was quick and easy. Lots of parking. Great Location. We had a fab stay.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Apartamentos totalmente mobiliados, amplos e em boas condições. É um ótimo custo benefício se comparado a um hotel. Como tudo em Orlando, você precisa estar de carro, pois a pé há apenas um posto de gasolina. Lembre-se que não é um hotel, mas algo como aluguel de um apartamento, então a limpeza deve ser feita pelo hospede, ou mediante pagamento a parte. Internet também é paga a parte. A estrutura de piscina também atende as expectativas.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We have stayed at Tuscana Resort twice now. Once in April 2011 and once in April 2014 and are revisiting in May 2015. Personally I can't fault the accommodation, people say its dated but isn't it supposed to have a traditional Mediterranean look (which it does have)? Yes the tv's are old fashioned but who cares, as long as you can watch something! Who goes on holiday to spend hours way watching tele. The pool area is lovely, the bar food great and the bar staff very friendly. The only thing I would say is that I didn't find the receptionists very approachable, we had problems with our wifi (which we ended up not getting for the whole 2 weeks) and I didn't feel that the staff were very helpful in trying to solve this. We had friends in a different resort and it would have made our life a lot easier if we had wifi to enable us to contact them and make arrangements. All in all though this is a great resort, I looked around for next year just because I thought maybe we should try somewhere different instead of going to he same place all the time but ended up booking tuscana again as it seemed the best value for money and I know it's nice x

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: This was our 3rd stay and as usual very enjoyable. Check-in was very efficient and the lady was very pleasant and advised that the resort was under new management, so we should notice some improvements, which we did. Pool towels are now supplied in the apartment and no deposit is required, WiFi is being rolled out and was defiantly better around the pool area. The only negative was that one of the desk staff had a real attitude problem when I reported a problem in our apartment. She barely bothered to make eye contact or stopped chewing her gum and I left with the feeling that I was getting in the way of her sales work. Needless to say the problem didn't get resolved until I spoke to one of her more enthusiastic colleagues the next day. Looking at previous posts, this is a recurring comment and whilst the management always respond that training etc will be carried out, this aspect of customer service has so far not really improved in the 4 years we've been visiting. Fortunately we see beyond that and enjoy the great location and facilities. Apart from the attitude issue the only other thing that was a bit disappointing was that the visiting paintball delegation decided that it was acceptable in the evening to be loud and intoxicated at the bar and smoke in the spa ignoring the fact that young children were still using the pool and also to spread countless paintballs around the place which not only spoilt the parking lots but caused a mess when you got it on your shoes and then on the apartment and rental car mats. Overall though we really enjoyed ourselves and really recommend it.

column27: Ticked All The Boxes - No Complaints
column29: We booked the Tuscana some months ago after researching all the reviews on tripadvisor and studying the Thomson website carefully. After we booked and as we got closer to departure we were getting slightly concerned about some comments made about different things TVs, garbage, WIFI etc. However we needn't have been concerned as we had a great stay at this relaxing resort. TV was a very large flat screen in the sitting area, no problem with taking the garbage to the end of the block we done this as we went out no hassle at all we even saw the local raccoons no trouble. The WIFI was fine no noise from roads although we were on the top of the block. Incidentally before we left like always we made some special requests in regard location, sunny balcony etc and these were all met. There is no safe in the room but we took a small travellers safe not heavy but nobody went near our room anyway and I believe there are plans to fit safes in the future. As these resorts are busy we did expect tired furnishings etc but even this was a pleasant surprise with really only minor wear on some items which is to be expected. The pool was beautiful as was the Cabanas and bar we never sampled the cinema as to busy and tired. Highly recommended.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: Positive:1.nice location 2.they transfer me on a bigger condo the moment I shown my military I'd3.the maintenance guys are very helpful4.A lot of free amenities like DVD ps3 games5.nice internet connection6.able to help me on my printing issue.7.well knowledge employee on customer serviceNegative:1.The pool is on maintenance when I got there just got fixed 1day before I checked out2.I called for maintenance for my washing machine somebody help us but he show up on late hours like 0900 pm,then he told me that he will fixed next day but until I left the washing machine never got fixed3.The condo/hotel that don't have any push cart I am calling the attention of corporate please put a push cart to every building your customer need it.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We've been to Orlando 4X now. This resort was by far the best we have stayed in. We like to always stay in Condo's so the kids have a separate bedroom. Yes this resort has double beds in each bedroom but my boys where so tired at the end of every day they had no problem sleeping in the same bed. As per other reviews the rooms are a bit dated but they are clean and what do you expect with the foot fall they get through there each week . We liked that the balcony had a net round as well not only is it extra security for small children but it also keeps the bugs out bargain. By far the best feature is the communal pool & hot tub, this is fantastic and you can always get a sunbed. The bar and in house restaurant where lovely and very reasonable. Fab quiet location just off the I4, may not be in the thick of the parks but you need peace and quiet at the end of the day.Only downside was we had a couple of problems with the card key system getting into the apartment. Sitting on the top floor of a building for 1 hour with hungry, tired kids in blistering humidity in August is not the best holiday to be kept saying they have send for maintenance. You would have thought that they could have contacted them by walkie talkie or something and given us estimate of time to help us. Eventually my husband tracked the maintenance guy down on the site himself to discover he had not received the call for our room and even showed us his phone messages to prove it. Saying that once he knew our dilemma he was very quick and prompt. Wasn't just us my sister stayed here in August as well in a different block and had the same problem, as did other guests we spoke to. Yes no safe in the room something we overlooked on booking but had no problems at all regarding privacy and security (couldn't get in the room anyway). I would definitely recommend this condo to any families. If we ever return again we would definitely consider staying here again, just please get the door locks sorted. Bring back the good old key system.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column27: We had a blast and the price was excellent! Fantastic location!
column29: Memorable vacation in a 4 Star resort, with a great location! We loved our 3 bedroom villa, and listened to other travelers by asking for a top floor, corner unit, which made for a quiet nights sleep! Pool and restaurant were lots of fun, with great entertainment by the pool. Highly recommend if you have 5 teens like we do who like to eat a lot! We saved a ton of money by cooking some meals and lots of snacks in the room, mainly breakfast and evening.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: I was there for the second time last June. I like it, but it needs updating. For example there was no wifi in rooms and I had to wait for one day to rent a router. They told me they are working on that so every apartment will have wifi soon. The apartment was also a little dirty and the decoration is old and awful.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: On arrival we were fairly pleased with our accommodation, spacious, comfortable and very clean although the furniture, tv etc could definitely do with updating. Was disappointed there was no safe in the room and on querying same with front desk was told there was "no need" as no one could get into the room. Ok. On returning to the apartment, was astonished to find an employee of the hotel coming out of the apartment!!! He told me he had put a resort directory on the kitchen counter! Unbelievable! What if I had been in the apartment taking a nap and hadn't heard him (presumably) knock at the door before entering! Was not at all happy about a member of staff entering an occupied apartment. Also, there are no communal bins nearby. We had to take our trash to the end of block 9 where an open skip was situated to dump our rubbish. Then on looking into the fly ridden skip was astonished to find a family of racoons living there!! Why don't you have communal closed bins at the entrance to each apartment block? Then to cap it all, found out at 9am when looking to have an early morning swim that the only swimming pool in the resort was now closed for two weeks for refurbishment! Why wasn't this mentioned when we booked in? If I had known there was no swimming pool I would definitely not have booked this resort. Am very disappointed. Did eat in the restaurant a few times and would say the food and service is excellent. However, there does appear to be several residents/workers here who frequent the bar and are very loud and noisy. Last Monday was Labor Day and there were several people hanging around the bar when we were at the pool in the afternoon and by the time we had dinner outwith the resort and came back to the bar for a nightcap at about 7pm, they were still there and by that time were exceptionally noisy and drunk. There were a number of families and children around the pool and this was definitely offputting. The Tuscana was recommended to us (last year we stayed at the nearby Bahama Bay Hotel) and to be honest will not be back.
