column27: Great place, get a top floor!
column29: We stayed there Memorial Day weekend Thursday-Monday, it was great until Friday night when people above us arrived and it was hell after that. The kids and adults sounded like they were galloping everytime they walked, and the kids kept on throwing themselves on the floor causing our condo to shake, this would go on until 2-3am and again beginning at 10am, until they would leave to either go to the pool or elsewhere. I called the front desk on Saturday morning, and they said it would be addressed, nothing changed, did not even get a follow up call from them. Called them Sunday morning as well, and let them know I called Saturday, she said she would follow up- no follow up call ("great customer service").Other than not being able to sleep and not being taken seriously, it was a nice, spacious condo. My purpose of the trip was to relax, and I definitely did that by the pool and when the horses upstairs were gone. The pool area was great, not too deep, and the kids stayed on 1 side of the pool, no lifeguard which was also great because you don't have to hear the constant whistle every couple of seconds.If the upstairs issue would have been handled properly, I would have given it 5 stars, but this was definitely an issue for us.

We love the location, the pool and the food from the bar was top notch for a hot evening spent swimming. I would absolutely recommend this to anyone traveling to Orlando. column29: Just returned from our second visit and yet again it was excellent with no issues. The love bugs are about the pool area again but are harmless if not slightly irritating. The unit was clean and well equipped and appeared to have new or cleaned carpeting. The resort tends to be busy at weekends as can be expected, but peace is quickly restored by Monday. I have arrived at Military units with less rules to be signed for than Tuscana and can understand why this aspect has been mentioned before. The public areas are kept very clean, but I did notice that the restroom time sheets were being signed in advance with the afternoon clean being signed for by 10am, probably at the same time as the morning clean. This isn't too much of an issue as the place stays clean but a bit surprising for somewhere that tries so hard otherwise. We really hope to return soon.

They have confotable self contain apartments, where you feel like in your second home because your hole family can share in just one 2 or 3 bedroom apartment, you can cook, and have the privacy like home. column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Nice place to stay for a couple of days
column29: Stayed with my wife, 5 year old and 3 year old for 4 nights starting April 17th 2013. The resort is in a pretty good location. Close to the outlet malls and Disney. We stayed in bulding #4 which is half way between the highway and the main desk area. We didn't notice much traffic noise from the I4 in our location but I can see how it might be an issue if we were any closer to the highway. The grounds were very nice and well maintained. The 2 bedroom apartment was pretty nice wth lots of room and two seperate bathrooms with showers. Don't get me wrong, the room was clean but I would say that the carpet was a bit worn and the curtains didn't cover the windows. Instead, they had cheap looking venetian blinds. The only issue we had with our room was that the shower head broke and fell off on top of our 3 year old when he was having a bath. Staff were very nice (and sympathetic when this incident took place). The pool area was a great place to hang out and we ate 3 times at the resturant there. The food was good and reasonably priced. Drinks were cheap and the bar servers were very friendly. All amenities are located about a half a kilometer up the road...grocery store, pharmacy, resturants, liquor store. I will say that I was a little supprised at how much sound could be heard from the room upstairs. We stayed on the 3rd floor (there are 4). We could clearly hear the people above us walking around but luckly they were quiet cause we were in bed by 9:30!  Overall, a pretty nice resort close to all amenities and Disney at a resonable price. Rooms were adequate but nothing special. I would probably stay there again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Loved it, loved it, loved it!
column29: We stayed here over 2 weeks and we loved it. We had a 3 bed/2 bath apartment for 4 adults and 2 children and there was loads of space; fully equipped kitchen, washing machine, tumble dryer, enclosed balcony (safe for the kids). Easy access to the pool and hot tub, the bar and restaurant (room key required for the gated access). DVD machine in reception for those nights when the kids are bored(!!!!), 10 mins, literally 10 mins, drive from the Disney roads into yep, Disney! Roads were easy to navigate. Only traffic we encountered was Easter Monday up I4 near Seaworld.Bar/restaurant staff were very friendly as were the reception staff. Can't remember any names now but I do remember there was an Aussie who was most helpful. The cleaning charge and the rubbish charge are quite clearly explained to you on arrival so I don't know why people are complaining. It's my understanding that some of the condos are privately owned and I really felt like we were 'home' for 2 weeks, so why wouldn't you take your own rubbish out? It's really not that big of a deal.Wi-fi was available all around the pool/bar/restaurant and reception area and we made excellent use of it!I really could not fault this resort. I would totally go back.

column29: Tiene todo lo que se necesita para pasar unas vacaciones inolvidables. El departamento está totalmente equipado para 6 personas. Fuimos con 4 chicos de 14; 10; 6 y 4 años. La pasamos genial.La pileta es única, el agua limpia y salada! La ubicación es optima. Mucha tranquilidad pero cerca de todo!

column29: We booked a two night stay in a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom. While the amenities were adequate, I would best describe the resort as "stingy". The rules and regulation were out of hand i.e. check out by 11am or $50 fee will be charged, make sure you take your trash to the dumpster or incur a $45 fee (although you are charged an additional $40 cleaning fee upon check in), included is one roll of toilet paper per bathroom, one liner per garbage can, and a charge for additional linens. There is internet access in the suite; however, it is a wired connection - really? Wired, in 2013? The overall stay was just okay, but I would not recommend it if you are expecting to be dazzled. I've stayed in several resorts in the area and Tuscana fails to make the grade. It's okay but not great.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We booked this for space and convenience. There were 4 of us, one couple and two single adults. The accommodation was easy to find and spacious and affordable. We were a bit disappointed in the overall experience. They have MANY rules and we were hit with a higher than expected cleaning fee ($48 for 2 nights). You are restricted to 2 not full toilet rolls per unit per stay (2 bathrooms). Check-in was all about what we couldn't due and how we would be charged if we broke the rules like leaving trash in bags outside our rooms instead of in the overflowing dumpster. The kitchen had basic things like dishes, glasses and silverware. Even salt and pepper shakers but no salt or pepper. A nice coffee maker but no filters, so if you do stay here, stop at a grocery store for even the basics.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed at the Tuscan for 2 weeks. It's a perfect location for all the parks, 10 mins to Disney and 20-30 to Universal. The staff were all lovely. Pool, bar and restaurant great and the food was lovely and reasonable priced. Serviced was a little slow at times but we weren't in a rush (they did forget our order one night however once the mix up was sorted they didn't charge us for anything and brought free drinks) rooms fine like others have said a little dated and definately need proper curtains!!!! However as a base it was good and I would certainly stay again and recommend. If not eating there the Chili restaurant down at Champions hate is very nice too. All in all another lovely holiday

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Lo que más me gusto del hotel fue el apartamento, impecable, no le faltaba nada, comodisimo, era par 4 personas pero entraban 6 comodamente, la zona de la piscina espectacular, el parquizado, el orden y la prolijidad nos dejaron con la boca abierta, el personal se esmeraba en atendendrnos porque nol sabiamos ingles pero realmente estaban a disposicion permanentemente, todo soñado!! ideal para ir en familia, volveria sin dudarlo!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Fuimos dos familias y es ESPECTACULAR
column29: Nos alojamos en Enero 2013. Todo fue tal como lo compramos por internet. El servicio es muy bueno. La atencion muy cordial. Los dtos. estan todos a nuevos, tienen absolutamente todo lo necesario para pasar unas vacaciones a todo confort. Todo el complejo esta muy arreglado, incluso la zona de pileta y bar. MUY RECOMENDABLE

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We recently stayed at the Tuscana Resort April 10-13. Overall, the resort was nice for $89/night through Groupon. The staff were all very kind at check-in and assured me many times if we needed anything to call. Upon going to our room (bldg. 9, rm. 9101) we loved how spacious the room was. The furniture was a little outdated & uncomfortable, but I've stayed in worse. As previously noted, the curtains in the rooms don't completely cover the windows, so that was a little annoying when trying to get my little one to sleep. The pool was nice, a little dirty. We didn't eat in the restaurant any, but cooked in our own room & even cooked on the outside grill one night, which was very nice. The grounds were very nice & well kept. Would stay there again as it was close to Disney, the main reason we went.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: The Tuscana tavern restaurant is excellent - really good prices for excellent food. The steak, the Caribbean salad and the kids' meals are very good. The bar service is quite good as well - they will also bring your meals poolside... very nice touch. The grounds are lovely and our condo was beautiful, well-kept and quiet (BLDG 9). All amenities (AC, washer and dryer, etc) worked properly and everything was very clean. The pool area was a pleasure - great place to spend a relaxing day. Have no complaints and had no problems with anything at all - wonderful home base for Disney, Universal - everything is reasonably close. As well, Publix, Walgreens and other conveniences are less than a km away. There's a good running route as well down Champion's gate blvd, Ronald Reagan parkway and back again (11-12km). A perfect stay. Our kids loved it as well.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Stayed at Tuscana from March 29 to April 3, 2013 with 3 Adults (incl. me) and 3 children. We stayed in the Bldg. 3 on the 2nd floor (2 bedroom condo). The Pros:Condo: Plenty of space for 6 people. The condoo was immaculate. I'm a neat freak so this was really important. The couch is a sofabed. It wasn't comfortable. You can feel the metal parts of the sofabed. Mattress could have been thicker. The living room furniture is small and dated. The dining room and bedroom furniture was average but nice. The kitchen was roomy and had all the appliances including a dishwasher. There is a separate washer/dryer closet. They do no supply detergent except a sample bottle for the dishwasher and sink. The carpet in the place is dated it was a low pile shag but it was in remarkably good shape and appears clean. It looked new actually.We experienced some sweet ants in the bedroom near the front door. There were a number of them coming out from and around the bedroom window. They crawled on the bed and on me while I was in the bed. They were all over the nite stands and walls. We called the front desk and they sent someone in 10 minutes. They sprayed and we didn't have any issues after that but it was a little unnerving trying to sleep knowing they were crawling on the bed. They came the next day to make sure we weren't having the ant issues again. They demonstrated good customer service and dealt with the problem quickly which we appreciated. Keep in mind this is Florida (tropical) so it isn't so unusual to experience these pest issues from time to time.The Pool - Loved the pool. It was a very inviting pool. The pool is heated and they have a jacuzzi. The pool restuarant food was tasty and reasonably priced too. They have karoke on some nites at the pool. You can pickup free wi-fi at the pool. Unfortunately, there is no wi-fi in the rooms. The entire property is landscaped well and very clean. I enjoyed the property. Tip: Bring paper towels, toilet paper (they only supply one roll per bathroom), towels if you like thick ones. Their towels are thin and worn. Also bring your own bath soap and washing powder. Cups and paper plates if you don't feel like washing dishes all the time.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: 1- Air conditioning not working -Service was provided but we had to experience some concerns about room availability, speciality when you are traveling with small kids.2- No paper towel, no extra trash bags.3- Only 1 half of toilet paper on each bathroom.4- Bath and kitchen towels completely worn out.5- Beds clothes dusty and worn out.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Great location for visiting the parks
column29: We arrived 22nd March for a two week holiday at the Tuscana resort which we booked through Thomson Holidays. We had a 3 bed 2 bath apartment on the 3rd floor of block 7. The apartment was large and well equiped (dishwasher, washing machine, tumble dryer etc) and provided a comfortable and quiet base for our holiday.The pool was warm with lots of sunbeds for when we had a few hours to chill.We had dinner at the restaurant on several evenings it was one of our favourite places to eat! The food was beautifully cooked and very reasonably priced. All of the staff we dealt with at the Tuscana were helpful and polite.The Tuscana is just off the Interstate 4 (Motorway) and my advice would be to check the location on Google earth before you travel. It is easy to get to but we followed the directions supplied by Thomson which were quite simply wrong and sent us to the wrong place.The Tuscana is a pleasant and safe place and we recommend it.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Another Fabulous Week- two years later
column29: We arrived March 28th and stayed through April 6th for our second vacation at the Tuscany. We love the Tuscana! We have had two wonderful vacations at the Tuscany. The staff is phenomenal and the food was awesome too! Thank you Jenny and Kathy! We will be back!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We love the Tuscana Resort- we came here two years ago and came back because we had such a great time two years ago. Well, once again, we don`t know how you can go wrong with this place!! Jenny and Katy are the best bartenders/servers ever!! We love them. They are so much fun and give the best service you can wish for. So much fun and so personable. They remembered us from two years ago. The pool is awesome - the kids can stay in for hours playing - it has a beach entry that makes it great for younger ones too. We went to 5 parks this week and had a few pool days in between - it was a great vacation....so convenient to all the parks. And again....the best part is the great service and fun time at the Tuscana pool - we love you Jenny!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: My husband I just returned from our 5 night stay at Tuscana. We had a fantastic time! The resort was everything that we hoped for (gorgeous 2bdrm condo, beautiful pool, excellent & reasonable restaurant, nice little workout area, friendly people, and located right off I-4 so easy access to all attractions). Proximity to grocery store and restaurants also a plus. We would definitely go back.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: My husband and I stayed at the Tucana Resort for 10 nights between 17-27th March 2013. Overall we were very impressed with the resort. Accommodation was very spacious, everything clean and units well equipped for a self catering stay. We were in block 5, on the 3rd floor. We used the bar and swimming area nearly every day and ate in the restaurant on numerous occasions. The drinks and food were excellent. Our only issues and unfortunately it became a big issue was because we had a floor above us the noise levels were excessive from the upstairs room. You can hear every step the people above us made, maybe we got unlucky for our stay because the noise was really bad, to the point my husband went upstairs and told the people how much noise they were making and even rang reception. I don't know if Tuscana Resorts can do anything about this but my only advice would be to try and get a top floor room if possible. The noise for us for a problem, if it had not been for this we would have said we had a perfect trip.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I stayed at the Tuscana resort from 16th March to 25th March. Accommodation had two bathrooms (one on-suite), three bedrooms, a large living and dining area and spacious kitchen and also a nice balcony with table and chairs. It was clean, comfortable and well maintained, perfect for our group of two adults and three children.Check in very quick and all the staff was very friendly and helpful.We arrived quite late and were provided with a map to our Block, it was dark and we were very tired from our flight and the only thing I would say is that the numbers on the block are not easy to see in the dark so maybe some extra lighting around the block numbers for ease.Key code required to get into the resort and plenty of parking outside the block that we were staying in. Pool area was very clean and water was warm so even when the days were a bit chilly you could still have a swim. Toilets and shower area kept clean also. Also free WIFI around the pool which was an added bonus.Bar staff really friendly and drinks was a reasonable price. We didn’t eat so I can’t comment on the food but plenty of people were having food.Nice grounds again kept very clean.Local supermarket and restaurants which was a 10 minute walk away.Location was perfect for us to drive to the Parks, it didn’t take any time at all and we were out every day. I have already recommended Tuscana to a colleague who is planning a trip next year. This is a great resort, family friendly, clean and a great location – would I go back, most definitely. Thank you for a wonderful stay.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: My family and I have twice stayed at Tuscana (May 2010 and May 2012) Both stays were absolutely brilliant. The rooms are spacious and clean, and the pool and poolside bar/grille have a great family atmosphere. The location is perfect - just off the I-4 and minutes from Disney World, International Drive, and many other attractions. We will definately be returning

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: The rooms were very clean, and the bar and grille had lovely food and atmosphere. The only negative and very important for most besides being clean are the bedrooms. I have to have it completely dark when I sleep, and two out of the three bedrooms were facing the parking lot with security lighting shining bright through the windows. that would have been fine if the windows had darkening shades, but they did not. it was miserable for two nights of having the whole bedroom bright! They need to work on that. Otherwise it would have gotten the highest reviews!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I stayed in the tuscana last September with my parents and my 2 young children aged 5 and 9 the condos and large with everything you will need for a self catering holiday its close to all the parks with out the noise and hussle of being too close, the staff are friendly and cant do enough for you, the bar staff and the same cant wait to be back here tuscana, keep up the good work

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Loved staying here so much. The whole complex was lovely. The bedrooms were massive and each had their own walk in wardrobes, had comfortable beds, nice kitchen with all the amenities needed, a balcony, two bathrooms, a dining table and a big TV. The reception area was also nice and so was the pool and the bar, the food served was nice too and all the staff were very friendly. I only had one issue - I got stuck in a lift for about 2 hours until someone heard me shouting and went to get help when I was going up to my apartment, but that didnt affect my opinion on the resort as a whole. It was right near a restaurant as well as a gas station and shop, and within 20 minutes of International drive and all of the amusement parks. Overall, it was great, will definitely have to go back.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We had tried another resort on our most recent trip to Florida and had a horrific experience, so we ended up back at the Tuscana. Nice, spacious rooms, clean, comfy beds, huge closets, washer and dryer that work, and most importantly-no bugs! All even more appreciated when you come from somewhere that doesn't offer all of this! Only complaint would be the uncomfortable living room furniture, other that, awesome stay. Thank you for saving our vacation!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We recently stayed here for a few nights in mid March.We are a family that travels extensively and has stayed at many time shares and owner resorts such as this. I found the room to be of very poor quality, I have expressed my concerns on the comment card as well. It seemed to me that the owner's found the most economical, cheapest way to furnish a room with absolutley no regard for the guests. The room is for six, however the couch is so small and with only one addition seat available that a family of four could not possible sit and watch TV, there is only seating for three.The kitchen table as well has only seating for 4, there could easily have been two bar stools for the breakfast bar set up to accomodate more people. The linens were so poor, we had to go to our car to get additional blankets because the blankets provided were threadbare at best. The blinds were of the cheapest quality and definitely no blackout shades, so since our room was right by the street light our room was flooded all night long. And as previously reviewers have stated the TV's were awful, they were all different and no more than 19 inch, it seemed that they were randomly picked up at any old flea market.Since we were only there for two days, we tolerated it, however had I stayed a week I would have complained immediately about the condition of the rooms.I do not recommend this place for a short visit as your really must bring everything, I understand that this is not a "hotel" or a time share but at a bare minimum some coffee filters and some salt and pepper would be nice. You really have to bring everything as they only give you one roll of toilet paper per bathroom, no paper towels and no refreshing of towels so you must wash the ones they give you.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Estuvimos en febrero 2013 ,alquilamos dos departamentos de dos dormitorios ya que eramos dos familias.La sorpresa fue enorme cuando llegamos,el lugar donde esta ubicado el condominio es precioso ,muy tranquilo.A 10 minutos de los parques,dpto.muy bien equipados,amplios,limpios muy confortables.Fuimos con miedo por algunos comentarios leidos....Pero la verdad la experiencia de haber estado alli fue excelente.VOLVERIA SIN DUDARLO

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I have stayed at this resort 4 yrs in a row. This was the first year I have ever made a complaint, it was also my first time staying in building 3. I am not the only person who has had problems with this building. The furniture in our unit was very worn the sofa had a tear in the fabric near the bottom. The patio doors had what looked like a black mold on them. There were several scuffs and digs all over the condo. The drains in the master bedrooms bathroom's sink and shower were slow to drain. There were bugs in the ceiling light fixtures. To top it all off we had sugar ants around the kitchen sink and dishwasher. We made the staff aware of the ants they said they would spray bleach around the sink, and have pest control in the next day. A note was left saying they were in but we continued to have sugar ants. Every time we made the staff aware of the problem they just said building 3 right... On check in the staff asked If we had ever stayed in building 3 when I said no they said well next time if you like one of the other building better let us know. It would appear that the staff is well aware of the poor condition of this building. It is a shame as we always loved this resort in the past but according to others that I know and my experience it has gone down hill.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I visited this resort in February and was suitably impressed. I was trying to find somewhere that had high quality accommodation, was child friendly & secure, swimming pool, bar, restaurant and somewhere to kick back after a busy day and have a drink/snack without having to drive anywhere. This ticked all the boxes.Firstly I thought the rooms were fantastic, they really had the 4/5* hotel feel with all the convenience and space of a well equipped apartment. You pay $150-250 per night for an equivalent quality hotel room....and thats it.."a room". Here you get 3 bedrooms- kitchen, lounge area, dining area, 2 bathrooms, washing machine/dryer.Location was good. Right off the I4, on the side of championsgate. There was a Publix supermarket 2 mins drive away (along with 7-11, petrol station, Chillis, McD's etc. getting to the parks was soo easy, straight on the I4 avoiding the manic 192. 15 mins disney, 25 mins universal)Reception was really helpful as were all the staff and the rooms were kept really well.For me this really was the the best of all worlds and ticked all the boxes and was good value for money. You can pick holes in anything (I thought The Ritz, London was rubbish, but that was based on reasonable expectation) Will stay at Tuscana again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: My wife and I stayed here month of February on our first extended visit of this type. Found the unit with everything we needed for our stay. A few minor maintenance issues were quickly dealt with by staff. Only issue is TV and furniture need updating--- an issue we were told would be resolved within next few months. We found it to be clean and very quiet. Pool area was very nice. Really have no issues and would consider staying there on our visit next year.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Good first impression, but too many issues
column29: I'll start by saying that this place isn't that bad. It is fairly new, spacious, and the price was reasonable. However, the walls are brutally thin and the appliances were without a doubt the noisiest I have ever heard. This may sound silly, but when you're trying to get a good night's rest and are constantly awakened by the refrigerator (even with the ice maker turned off), plumbing (truly, it was like a gushing waterfall in our walls) and neighbors, it really makes a difference between a nice stay and a frustrating/tiresome one. Two other annoyances: a sliding glass door that doesn't really lock (it is operational, but so flimsy that the door can be pulled open while "locked" with minimal effort) and an apparent force field that prevented our cell phones/computers from getting a signal, which made the "free Wi-Fi" a joke. In a town with countless condo rentals, my advice is look elsewhere and pay an extra $20-30 per night.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Excelente, lo recomiendo y la proxima vuelvo sin dudas!
column29: Amigos, la verdad que este lugar es super recomendable. Fui con mi familia y la pasamos espectacular. Los departamentos son nuevos con todos los servicios que se necesitan, cocina completa, lavadora secadora de ropa, lavaplatos, cocina horno, tv, internet, habitaciones con baño en suite. Es de destacar la limpieza en general del complejo. Ademas hay pileta climatizada, bar juegos para niños y gym. El personal de recepcion muy amable y correcto. Es de destacar la ubicacion, ya que esta muy cerca de los parques, pero a su vez no tener los accesos congestionados, como si otros hoteles que estan mas al norte. La proxima vez en Orlando vamos a Tuscana!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: recently stood at Tuscana with the family, it was a great expirience. We all enjoyed the pool and the friendly staff. I tip my hat to them the condos were spacious and well keep as well as the grounds. We were so close to the Champions Gate Golf course that I was able to see players at work. The resort is so close to the Disney attractions that it was a breeze to commute to and from parks. It was awesome

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Nous avons passé une semaine au Tuscana Resort dans un condo 2 chambres.Tout y est parfait or le fait du bruit de l'autoroute, ce qui est bien dommage.Personnel très gentil. Environnement idéal, proche d'un Publix et peu éloigné de Disney.On se sent comme chez soi et c'est vraiment bien agréable.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed at Tuscana Resort this past Christmas season with our son and daughter and the grand kids for the second year in a row. We absolutely love the convenience to Orlando's attractions without being in the middle of the traffic, etc. The condo was perfect, spacious and well-equipped. The pool and hot tub are wonderful - and don't miss out on the cafe's famous burger! Big enough to share and delicious, too. We hope to make this a yearly family tradition!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Super recomendable, a 10 minutos de auto de los parques, excelente lugar, gerente y demas personal muy agradable, limpieza y servicio 10 puntos. Comodidad en el apartamento y equipado con todo para hacer la estadia confortableSin duda volveriamos.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: A huge feel at home apartment and a very nice pool.
column29: We loved it. Tuscana Resort is really great for a longer stay. The apartment are big and nice with tree bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, a nice living room with diner table for 10 persons, a fully equipped kitchen with a dish washer, a laundry machine and tumble dryer. There is four TV’s, one in each bedroom and one in the living room. But they are really old 20” and with bad picture (not a flat screens).FItness rooms is well equiped and the pool area is perfect.Parking is free and you don't have to search for at parking lot.The minusesI really missed wireless internet in the apartment.The pluming was not so good in our apartment, the toilet was easily stopped and the wash did fill up when the water was running.The TVs really need to be changed to flatscreens. The beds are good but I really don’t understand why they have to be Queen size when there is plenty of room for King size beds. Overall Tuscana resort is a really nice value for money place with plenty of space for a longer stay. Its not luxury apartments and the interior is not the newest. But I loved it anyway. I felt it a bit like home at our 10 days stay. .We will return..

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Estuve en feb de 2013 con mi familia , en un dpto de 3 dormitorios y 2 baños , excelente totalmente equipado , wi-fi , estacionamiento.Atencion del personal muy cordial , bilingue y predispuestos a ayudar.Es realmente recomendable el lugar y sus servicios . Volveria sin dudar.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column27: The standard for other hotels/condos to live up to
column29: This was a great place to stay. The condo was clean and neat. It offered everything we needed for a family of 4. The staff was very helpful. Loved the movie theater and the pool. Our condo was far away from the pool but we easily hopped in the car and parked adjacent to the clubhouse. The gate made us feel secure. Very quiet also.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: I stayed for 7 weeks... I saw it all.
column29: I was sent down to Orlando for work for 7 weeks & this is where the company put me up for that time. I was moved to 3 suites because the power was disconnected from 2. This resort is managed by Tuscana, but each unit is individually owned. When someone doesn't pay the bill- the power is cut... even if you're occupying the unit! The staff was WONDERFUL with every move. They helped me pack, dragged my luggage to the new room & made sure I had everything I needed. Can't say enough about the staff.I was also there when the fire alarms went off at 4 am... then 5 am... then 6 am... not a regular occurrance. Someone had set it off. Also, please be aware that there is not staff there past a certain hour (if I remember 10 or 11pm) The main office closes at night. So if you are out late & you've lost your key or demagnetize it you have to call the emergency number-- it's a HUGE hassle to get back into your room so protect those cards with your life! The units are comfy & very nice. I stayed in a 2 bed/2 bath. The kitchen is great & the unit feels just like home! New-ish decor with updated kitchen. Just add groceries! Everything else is provided. I was more than comfortable for those 7 weeks. My only complaint about the rooms are the wired internet in the living room... not in the bedrooms. That made it a little uncomfortable when I'd try to skype with my family back home as I had a roommate for work. I don't see this being a problem with a family.The pool is salt water... small, but luxurious! The bar has delicious sandwiches-- the best philly cheese steak short of Philly & yummy drinks! We did take some time for Disney & they do not have a shuttle anymore, but they can arrange one for you for $20/pp. The next time I'm in Orlando, I will stay there again with my family. So comfortable, so close to amenities & more importantly ENTERTAINMENT! It's about 10-15 mins from Disneyworld!

column29: We stayed at the Tuscana Resort back in August and we loved it. We rented a two bedroom, two bath condo and found it to be perfect for us. We are three, My wife, my daughter and I, my daughter is 6 years old and the place is perfectly located with all the amenities you could need. Tha apartment was fully equipped with everything. there are store within walking distance and the pool and pool house are perfect to for relaxing and just raking it easy. there are evening activities for the kids like karaoke on Thursdays and Saturdays. You can't beat the location, it is conveniently located near all the major Orlando attractions, close enough that you can take a break from the parks during the day and go back to them later in that same day. the pool is great and my daughter could have stayed there all day.(so could I) ver all the Tuscanan is an excelllent place to stay, comfortable, clean rooms, beuatiful pool area, convenient location, (central to all the parks, restaurants and shops), fully equipped and furnished rooms. I would recommend it to all my friends! You can't beat the value!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We recently had a 4 night stay at Tuscana. Overall, it was a good experience. The 3-BR unit we stayed in was very spacious and clean. Someone else in our group found bedbugs in their unit, asked to be moved, and while they were given a new unit, they were told by the front desk that they'd be charged a cleaning fee for the unit they vacated. I believe they worked that out with another manager; however, note that some units appear to be affected by bedbugs. The kitchen is pretty nice, granite counters, comparable to a Residence Inn. Basic kitchen tools are supplied, but the items provided vary from unit to unit. Linens and towels are provided. The pillows were surprisingly good; the towels were thin but plentiful. The pool area was pretty nice, with a bar and towels provided (note the strict towel return policy - $10 charge for towels not returned). There is a very nice movie theater you can book for free and watch your own movies or one of Tuscana's. It seats about 25 people with stadium seating and a sound system. This would be a good option for entertaining a group. Location is good - very close to a shopping center w/ big grocery store, pharmacy, nail salon, barber shop, etc., as well as very close to I-4 (exit 58). Biggest complaint would probably be the thin walls/ceilings - you could hear and feel people coming down the stairs in the public area/hallways (which are open-air) at all hours, and could really hear people walking on the floor above. You might consider requesting a 4th floor unit that overlooks the nature conservation area in Bldg 3 or 7 to avoid this (although the units are a bit darker - the sun shines on the parking lot side most of the day). Another thing to consider is that there is a wired internet connection, but no wireless unless you rent a router from the front desk (and they were sold out when we checked in). If you have a lot of people on wireless laptops and devices, you will want to be sure to request a router as soon as you check in. Wifi is just a basic amenity these days - strange that Tuscana doesn't have it. Overall, it was a good value - I think we paid around $179 a night - for a unit with lots of space where we could do our own cooking. It's not fancy or luxurious, but it's a good option for a family going to Disney and the other attractions in Orlando. Location is right, price is right, and the pool is a nice place for the kids to hang out.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

Também nao tem acessibilidade nenhuma, e nem suportes nos banheiros para os mais idosos. Portanto, ideal para quem for jovem e saudável. Bastante longe das principais atracões, mesmo dos outlets, supondo que quem estiver lá estará de carro. Nao oferece shuttle. Também os quartos nao tem " blackout" e as janelas deixam passar a luz externa.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Our wedding was held at Tuscana Tavern. Our friends as well as we stayed at Tuscana Resort in November 2012. We could not have chosen a more intimate place to have our wedding and reception. Thank you Linda, for allowing us to be the first to use the resort for a wedding venue! The food was chosen from the regular menu and was delicious. They serve a British style breakfast on the weekend. Their food is always wonderful and you must try the Fish & Chips, the home made potato chips or the pizza. Janet and David are the gracious hosts at the restaurant and outside pool bar. When you stop at the restaurant tell them Barbara and Joey said "hello"!The resort consists mainly of 2 or 3 bedroom condominiums which are clean and spacious. Each bedroom has a big closet and the rooms are well appointed. There is a regular size refrigerator, stove, oven and microwave. They are a true value for the Disney area. The pool area is nicely landscaped and has cabanas! The huge pool and hot tub are heated.We highly recommend Tuscana Resort for a vacation visit, a local meal, or their Thursday and Saturday night karaoke. It is such an intimate place we are sure you will love it!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: If you like a great resort, but a dirty room, stay here!
column29: The resort is on beautiful grounds and not to far from Disney & Legoland. However before you go, please note each unit is owned by an individual. Our room had mold in all showers.(see pic below). Our sheets were stained, the pillows were lumpy & stained, something I'd never give a guest in my home. Carpet was disgusting, had pee stains and who knows what other stains. If you are over 5 feet 3 inches and 150 pound all the furniture will be terribly uncomfortable. You have no control over the air, so expect to sweat or freeze, depending the day. You are responsible for your own toilet paper after your roll is out, to strip the beds when you leave and wash towels. You must remove your own trash and provide your own bags, so be prepared to buy trash bags, laundry detergent, T.P., paper towels, etc. Staff was nonchalant about most everything. Pool is nice, Bartenders were great. Game room was good. Grounds well kept. There IS NOT a business center is is one lap top with a printer for you to stand at and move on.

column29: This is an excellent base within 20 mins max drive to all main attractions. It was clean and all staff were really friendly and helpful. There is a petrol station, chilis and supermarket at the end of the drive. It's was very quiet and had plenty of parking. The pool area was fab and spotless! It has all the usual things you'd need in the kitchen area including the important cork screw! The rooms were ample sized had we has a large enough bathroom and walk in wardrobe! The only criticism would be you only got 1 roll of toilet roll so make sure u take some! Be aware that some blocks are near the motorway luckily ours wasn't. We requested a ground floor apartment which we got. So email and ask for a block away from the motorway! I'd recommend stopping here!

column29: This is a perfect break in a great location that can't be faulted for value. There is 9 buildings in total all behind key coded gate entry. The apartments are all key card access and are very clean and all come with a starter kit to make you feel very welcome, Publix is just 5 minutes away for everything else you need. The pool and bar area is great and there are plenty of sun beds for everyone, the bar is very well priced for food and drink with friendly staff, happy hour 4-6 is a nice way to relax after a day around the parks. There is a small fitness room that is equipped with enough for your holiday should you wish. Tuscana is in a great location and Disney is 15 minutes away and Universal 30 minutes. There also plenty of restaurants within 10 minutes drive. Tuscana is a place I would recommend to friends, clean, friendly staff, great pool and bar and value for money.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Great place to stay near Disney
column29: We stayed at Tuscana resort in January 2011. It was a great experience and the next time we go back to Disney- we will definately book another stay there.First off- it's a great community- quiet and near to a small shopping center that has a grocery store, a liquor store, a pharmacy and McDonalds and a Chili's. After we checked in at the resort and unpacked, we hit that shopping center for all the supplies we needed to the whole week. Tuscana is actually in a closed gated community. When you check in, you get your keys as well as access code to the property, which I understand changes every month for security purposes. The staff at the reception area was extremely courteous and helpful, and made recommendations on where to do our shopping. The property as a whole is clean and well maintained. The pool area was immaculate. Although we went in January, the weather was still warm enough to hit the pool 3 times that week.The condo itself was clean, comfortable and well maintained. We had a three bedroom on the 3rd floor. It was also stocked with everyting we needed to be able to cook the meals we had while there. The appliances were also very clean and in excellent condition.The resort is a 10 minute drive to the entrance of Magic Kingdom- so for us it was ideal. The resort also has a shuttle, but since we had rented a car- we really didn't make use of it.When we planned our trip, the resort wasn't on tripadvisor, I actually found it on homeaway.com and got some great rates. Not sure what the rates are through tripadvisor, so I recommend you also look on homeaway.com as well. Overall, it was an excellent stay.
