column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: On the surface this looked like a wonderful place to holiday but groups of teenagers round the pool made it rather intimidating to say the least. On returning to our room we realised our video camera was missing and reported it to the management who confirmed someone had entered our room while we were out this was found out by the chip on the lock of the door by the management. We asked to move rooms and were given a key card to a room already occupied ! SO this was also worrying. NoBody was logging which key was whose so anyone could have potentially entered someone else's room. We even called the local police and the manager gave us a letter confirming that the cost of the camera would be reimbursed so we did not claim on our insurance expecting to be paid by the hotel and over 12 months later we are still waiting The staff and management have not changed Shame on you all !

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Have never written a review before but this really does deserve it...First holiday to Florida and from the moment I booked with Virgin we really did feel VIP. What a fab holiday and location. Words cannot express my feelings for this complex. Would highly recommend to anyone wanting to stay here, clean, welcoming you name it ...From the moment we booked in late at night to very polite staff. The bar staff were so friendly, and the food lovely ,my one and only regret about the holiday is that I was too tired to go to the bar every night as it is well worth chilling there. Will def stay here again on my next visit to Florida.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Had a wonderful vacation @ Tuscana, the staff were very friendly and helpful and did appreciate there concern for our welfare during our stay. We have booked again for next year and look forward to seeing our restaurant/bar friends again. All the amenities @ the resort were kept very clean and our 3 bedroom condo was very roomy. The food @ the restaurant was tasty and portions were generous. Special thank you to Mike, Dion, Kelly, Krista, Jenny, Janet, Dave & Alex. See you next year guys! S & B Phillips (SSM, ON, Canada)

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: After a bad start to our USA Hols (at a Hotel in LBV), we were moved here by Virgin Holidays. WOW from the minute we arrived to the minute we left we were made welcome, nothing was too much trouble, the two bed condominium was large, clean and tidy and well equiped - makes a change to come home with clean clothes after nearly 3 weeks away!The pool and pool side bar was a great place to relax and meet people, good food at reasonable prices, all of the complex staff are friendly and helpful. Next time we go back to Orlando I'll think we would just book here! it has every thing you'll need, good tranpsort links, local shops, banks and places to eat within a 5 min walk

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: En mayo nos hospedamos por 3ra vez en Tuscana. La verdad que el lugar me gusta mucho y siempre lo recomiendo. Championsgate es muy lindo. Me quedó pendiente ir al Ross que está cerca del Bestbuy de Davenport. Los chicos que manejan el complejo son muy amables y siempre tienen la mejor de la ondas para darte una mano en recibirte cosas que compras o asesorarte en algo que necesites. Sin dudas volveré.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We got back nearly a week ago having spent a wonderful two weeks at Tuscana. The condo exceeded our expectations;we had so much room and all the appliances you would ever need. Being able to keep up with the washing was a godsend. The area is lovely and quiet and the pool area is a great place to chill out. Also very convenient to all the parks and no trouble to get any where as Tuscana is so close to I4. We stayed in a hotel last time but never again, Tuscana ticked all our boxes; my four teenagers loved it too. Would love to return one day but will highly recommend to friends.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: After reading some of the negative feedback from this resort we were slightly apprehensive at what we were going to be greeted with but all I can say is WOW...... having just got back from a 2 week stay at this resort we can honestly say we would recommend this to family and friends. When we arrived, no waiting I might add, the resort had been hit by lighting and it had taken out the key fob entry systems and we were given keys to the condo, unfortunately the keys didn't fit but that was no problem they had taken on extra staff to get people into their rooms and I have to say they were fast, we didn't have to wait at all and we eventually got 4 key cards after 2 days. The only negative was that the jacuzzi was out of action for a week and a half, but that in no way affected our enjoyment of the resort. The whole resort and the condos were exceptionally clean and we were pleasantly surprised how big the rooms were (we stayed in a 3 bed condo, building 7), we were on the ground floor and did get a little noise from the condo above. I have to say the room we stayed in could have done with some updating but all the white goods appeared to be new, it was well appointed with cutlery, plates etc. We experienced no road noise or noise from frogs (as one reviewer commented) although we did see a few but we were on the back of a nature conservation so you expect to see some of the inhabitants. Whilst we did not eat in the restaurant we did have food from the bar, although only fast food this was very tasty and freshly made. I asked for potato chips and they were very apologetic that they had no bags of crisps they made some fresh for us - delicious! Nice big pool with a smaller separate pool for babies/children. Plenty of sunbeds and some gazebos for families with children. Pool towels were available at no extra charge you just had to ask for them and sign for them. Plenty of parking space in a secure gated complex, entering via a keycode. This is not a hotel and you will need to buy garbage bags etc and remember to put your garbage in the dumpsters and not leave it outside - just remember it's like staying in a villa. A short drive or walk away (my father-in-law did this and said it took him 10 mins max walking) down a pleasant lane you will find a publix, chinese restaurant/takeaway (which we recommend), chilli's, liquor store and a UPS store; great if you want to courier things home. It is near to the theme parks although Universal is slightly further away. There was no keysafe in our condo, not sure if this applies to all of them, and not sure if there are any safes available should you require one but we honestly didn't feel the need. No room service but you do have the opportunity to have that as an added extra, if you required it. All in all a very comfortable, secure and pleasant resort which represented good value for money. We enjoyed our holiday here and would recommend it, we would certainly stay there again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: After reading a few negative reviews, we didn't know what we might find. We got a great price from GROUPON, and decided to take a chance. Upon arrival, we saw their pool which was quit large and beautiful. We were given a 2 bedroom unit in building 4 with a great view of the golf course. The unit was spotless and well maintained. The staff was very helpful and gave us good directions. This property is very conviently located to a supermarket, drugstore, restaurants, the highway, and Disney attractions. We had a wonderful time and hope to come back again soon.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I was slighlty apprehensive after reading some of the comments but i was pleasently suprised. To get to the resort you have to travel down a long, quiet, peaceful road. At check in we were seen straight away and given three room keys, one each and one for the car as this is what the staff member advised us.We found our condo. The condo smelt fresh, carpet was clean and in immaculate condition. Table and chairs all in good condition, stain free, table gleaming and polished. We were really pleased with our condo the only negative that we found to be: As we were on the ground floor, situated just outside the 1st bedroom was an air conditioning generator, we were fortunate enough to have another bedroom to use. The balcony also overlooked the generator which this spoilt the view, and could also be quite noisy at times, but we were not there to sit outside on the balcony we were there to go to Disney. Next time we will ask for a room away from the ground floor. We intend on coming back very soon. Thank you to all the staff that helped make our 1st visit to the states a wonderful experience.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: A great option for families or couples.
column29: We booked this for a central Florida vacation with the grandkids so we had a place to spread out, be comfy and be near the theme parks. This could not have been a more perfect choice. We took a 2 bedroom, 2 bath condo with a sleeper sofa. The value was fantastic; the condo was neat, clean and well appointed. For those complaining about comfort items, FYI, self-catering means bring what you need for your stay or plan to go purchase when you arrive. Our condo had a roll of toilet tissue, hotel size soap, shampoo & conditioner in each bath. There was a single use dishwasher soap packet and a sample size of dish soap. It got us through the first day while we figured out what we needed or wanted for the entire stay. If you stay less than 7 days you can pay for housekeeping service or use the washer/dryer in the unit. The unit had a few issues with some blinds that need to be fixed or replaced and some stains in the carpet that looked as if they tried to get them out but couldn't. You could see they had vacuumed just recently, and the distinct smell of a fresh cleaning in both bathrooms, so the place was clean, and well maintained for the use it gets.The pool area was lovely, however they do need to upgrade the cabana curtains as most of them were either torn or missing so privacy was not to be had. The outdoor bar is a nice touch, but I was a bit surprised to see 2 of the staff sitting there having a drink and then an hour later they were on duty!The welcome staff was very helpful with directions to anywhere we wanted to go, and they also had discount options as well.If you want to save on hotels & dining this is the way to go.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We arrived at the Tuscana & were happy with our 3 bedroom condo it had everything we needed for our 3 week holiday the local Publix was on hand to run to if we ran out of stuff & the I4 was close at hand so we thought a great start to our holiday!Unfortunately a family moved into the condo above us on our 2nd night & shattered our peace they were loud,shouting & running from one end of the condo to the other & treating the beds like trampolines! this varied from 06.00am to 02.00am every day for 5 days/nights.We reported the noise to reception every day & were told they had been spoken to & reassured us the noise level had been addressed!..We were given Tom's name who was the night watchman to call to which we did but we were put through to the night service security who said it would be reported again the following morning.As we were 2 women on our own with 2 teenagers we even went up to ask politely to keep the noise down but were met with "no speak english!!", We even called the local sheriff who visited the family & informed us they are on Vacation!! & have kids!!! (Really!!!)Finally after 5 days of interrupted sleep & getting fed up going every day to reception we finally got to speak to Robb Kenyon the General Manager who agreed to move us to a new condo on the top floor he arranged for the guys to come & help us move so within an hour we moved to a beautiful condo & finally got to enjoy our holiday.The points I would like to say are some of the staff at reception ie Debbie who wasquite abrupt in her manner & I'm sure when we walked in her eye's were raised !!. Leo on the other hand couldn't have been more helpful even giving us his personal cell number to call him & he would call the condo asking them to keep the noise down thankfully we did not need to use it but reassured us at the same time .Think he deserves a award for employee of the month? Would we go back yes it is a fantastic place with great facilities the restaurant was great value for money & the pool was just what you needed after a long day at the parks.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: We had to change location on medical advice
column29: Having stayed at Tuscana in 2010, we decided to go there this year. We found the resort has dated and standards have dropped. The extent of the standards dropping is that when we had to seek medical advice ($400+ for consultancy and drugs) due to bites my son got in bed, we were just checked out and told that no refund would be given. An apology would have been nice. Do not go here!!!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I have been to Florida 3 times and stayed here on each occasion. It is very easy to get to as the property is very close to the I4 motorway. There is plenty of shops and Publix supermarket close by and an excellent shopping centre at junction 55 a few minutes down the road.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I'm on day 5 of a 2 week holiday in Florida staying at this resort. I've been reading the reviews on here for nearly a year and have to say, I was slightly concerned before my arrival.But I had nothing to worry about. I am sat on the carpet in the front room typing this on my laptop as there is internet access in the apartment (not wifi, but who cares?!). So far, nothing has crawled up my leg from the so called disgusting carpets which aren't disgusting at all, there are some marks, of course there are, thousands of people have walked on these carpets, but they have been cleaned!The blind in my bedroom has about 6 inches broken off too, who cares??!! I'm hardly going to let that ruin my holiday! Publix is only up the road, you can buy toilet extra toilet rolls, washing liquid, etc, who would want to pack such things in their case anyway?!Spent yesterday afternoon by the pool soaking up the sun and then played in the games room, staff friendly and helpful, there was a problem with the key cards when we arrived and they had to change the locks on our first day. Did this matter to us? No!!! We're on holiday!!We couldn't find where to put the rubbish on the 2nd day so had to go back to the apartment and find the map, it's a little bit of a walk but we enjoyed the walk, it's beautiful here and at least with them being out of the way, nobody has to look at ugly dumpsters!If you want the Hilton, book the Hilton, if you want a fantastic, comfy, roomy self catering apartment in a quiet, safe location, book Tuscana Resort.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Stayed here for a fortnight from 5th August and had read some reviews before we arrived so was a little concerned before we got there. Was very relieved to see that in our case the resort and it's facilities were just what we hoped for. The location is excellent exit 58 off the I4 and took 10 mins to get to Disney. The 7-11 and Publix supermarket are only 2 minutes away yet far enough from any hussle and bustle. The staff were pleasant and friendly. The pool was excellent (my son now has gills and webbed feet I think) with cabanas aplenty and an excellent poolside bar with food available. The apartment (block 7) was clean and spacious, yes the carpets could do with a deep clean but with the quick turnaround of guests probably not that feasible in high season. All in all I would definitely return to this resort as found it to be everything we hoped for and on speaking to other guests if there were any little issues then the staff did everything to attend to them.I work in rental property management in the UK and would say that yes some walls could do with a freshen up and as mentioned carpets could do with deep cleaning but this was just cosmetic and unavoidable in the season.Thanks Tuscana for a great holiday and hope to be back someday!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: NICE RESORT BUT APARTMENT DATED & SPARSE
column29: Not so good:-We arrived in the dark and there were no lights in the stairway - not a very nice welcome. Opening the door, the apartment smelled musty and or of cigarettes. The kitchen was sparsely equipped and what was there was of poor quality & cheap. The bath towels were small and thin - barely bigger than a hand towel and one had makeup marks all over it. I did wash the towel and the marks didn't come out which suggested it had been laundered but it shouldn't have been there in the first place. The carpet, sofa chairs etc were all cheap and brown which made the rooms seem very dark & sad. Aircon was not adequate at night time, we thought it was programmed to go off or turned down. Night time is when you need it most.Good:-The apartment was very quiet.The cooker, fridge, washer & dryer were newish.The pool area is very nice and well maintained. Staff on arrival and departure were pleasant and helpful.Easy access to main attractions - about 10-15 mins to International Drive etc. We went to Clearwater for the night which was 1 30mins drive.Publix supermarket & petrol station 2 mins drive

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Disgusting is too kind of a word.
column29: We went here as a groupon getaway thinking that groupon checked out these places. I guess not, because they should not want their name in the same sentence as Tuscana Resort . We took our 6 yr. old grandson on a mini vacaion before school started. We were there Sun, Mon, Tues Aug.12-15 2012. Upon entering our unit, we were met with the most digusting carpet you have ever seen.( I took pictures).When my grandson got down to play legos, I made him get up.Who knows what lurked in that carpet. The blinds were also broken in the bedrooms. I went to the front office and they moved us to a new unit. It was only slightly better, but at this point, we were tired. Again, both blinds were broken. Next morning while making toast, the toaster was starting to catch on fire. My husband quickly pulled the plug. We only got partial rolls of toilet paper for a room that is suppose to hold 6 people. No paper towels or kitchen hand towels. READ what you sign. I questioned about trash removal only because I noticed, (don't leave it outside your door).I assumed that meant leave it in kitchen for housekeeping. NO, you need to bring it to dumpster. The bags are so thin, that the trash started to fall out. I went to office to get another one. He could't find any so he emptied his trash into another one and gave me his. Even doubled, the trash was coming through. You are allowed one beach towel for pool for your entire stay. THIS PLACE IS HORRIBLE!!!! STAY AWAY. The only nice thing I will say about it, is the movie theater. A nice place to stay cool for a couple of hours.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Great Value, but NO Wireless in room!
column29: This was a beautiful resort in a great location - just minutes from Disney and a short distance to the Convention Center! Our three bedroom unit was clean and nicely apportioned. The full kitchen and in unit laundry were very convenient and kept expenses to a minimum. Grocery store right outside the resort! Pool was great and not crowded with a kid's pool that made it easy with small children. Our one critical point is that wireless is available only in the clubhouse and pool. So technology for teenagers was a challenge. Internet in room was one wire, so be prepared to take turns. IPads were not usable with the port. Overall, we had a great time even with the technology challenges. Staff was great!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Embarrassed That I Took Guests to This Resort
column29: On check in the staff was friendly, the exterior of the resort looked good. When we stepped into our unit it took my breath. The first thing I noticed was that the carpet was beyond filthy. We checked in on Saturday. It was Tuesday before it was cleaned. We had to tip toe around after that because the carpet was wet from the cleaning. Why not clean the carpet before you give guests the key to the unit?The dining room chairs upholstery had food stains on the fabric. They looked awful.The kitchen had no ktichen linens.The disposal was not working.The person in our 3 couple group that slept on the twin bed fell twice in one night because the bed was broken and would not support him. They replaced the twin bed. We asked that they replace it temporarily with a queen but management refused. The twin was too small for our friend that is 6'1" and 260 lbs. The other bedrooms were occupied and he needed a larger bed. We probably could have figured that out in the beginning but once all your things are unpacked it is tough to move to another room.We had no choice because all the three bedroom units are two queens and twins. It is not set up for three adult couples. The twin beds were not adequate. One bed was broken the other had to be repaired also.The handle on the door to the deck was broken.Our card locked us out and we had to rekey several times.There was no starter supply of detergent. The shower in the master bedroom was dirty. The ceramic had dark brown stains on the bottom. The outer edges were clean.The starter soap for the unit was one very think bar per the two bathrooms (for six different adults).There was a nest of hornets at the entrance to where we go up the steps to our unit. Many guests had to walk by the nest of hornets. I showed a maintenance worker the nest and he said he would take care of it; however, the guard hornet was still guarding the nest and I dont think maintenance did anything to the hornet nest.The hot tub at the pool area was broken all week. They tried to fix it but it was not fixed.There is no wifi service in the units, only around the pool area.The cell phone service in the area is very poor.We had to go outside the unit usually to use the phone. We were on the first floor.I can never think of a reason that I would go back to this resort.I am sure our friends will never want to travel with us again. We were there for an international church conference. This is only the second poor review that I have to offer of our travels. I am not a complainer and have "looked over" a lot of things in my travels. Please see our list of places traveled. It is extensive. I was suprised this unit was listed through RCI. It was not up to RCI standards.The pool area was nice. The restaurant was nice. The staff was courteous.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We were a family of 6 and it fit us perfectly. it was a very nice, clean and neat place to stay. We were right in the middle of everything. Its very close to Disney World. The kids loved the pool area. I would just have wished we would have known up front that we needed to get extra supplies for the rooms. We had to go back out late at night, but overall we would stay here again. The concerns we did have was fixed in a timely manner.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Great Pool - Great Location - Comfortable Accommodations
column29: My husband and I stayed at Tuscana Resort late February, 2012. We were extremely pleased with the location, as it provides short commutes to the Disney area, Celebration (where we spent many of our evenings enjoying the restaurants) and several Orlando-area golf courses. The apartment was clean, well-designed (two bedrooms, two large baths, living area with adjacent large dining room, and well-appointed kitchen), and well-stocked with blankets, pillows, etc. All necessary cooking utensils/pots-n-pans, etc. were available (although we took a vacation from cooking as well). The apartment was not as sound-proof as we would have liked and there were some stains on the carpets, the only negatives. The pool is fantastic - large, clean, comfortable to swim in temperature-wise, and the attached, open-air restaurant served great food all day! The surrounding immediate area provides a grocery store, restaurants, fast-food, quick hair-cut services, etc. -- certainly everything needed for a week's stay. If you are a golfer, there are some fantastic courses in the area, including ChampionsGate (adjacent to Tuscana) and Reunion, just east, a few miles away.All-in-all, Tuscana is a perfect place to stay to enjoy an Orlando-area vacation. Enjoy!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: This place was to say the least HORRIBLE. Not the cheapest place I've ever stayed in but by far the worse! When we checked in, they wanted to charge us $40. to opt out as an insurance policy in case anything broke or draft $300 from our checking account. At night the smoke detector went off and no one in our family slept. The televisions were not working properly. The pool was full of drunks because they have a bar next to the pool. The elevator stopped working. Our room was located near the highway and as cars were passing by it was hard to have conversations in the balcony. Employees are rude! I will never ever stay here, especially with young children. I wanted a nice holiday before school started and instead got one of the worse trips I've ever had!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Good place to stay, clean room ; TUSCANA ! near Chili's off I-4
column29: This condo was clean, neat and functional. The kitchen needed some utensils but we got some cheap items at the dollar tree. Grandma enjoyed the walk in tiled shower area in her bedroom. A family of 6 will be comfortable and enjoy some pool time. My daughter said the pool needed cleaning, the hot tub needed some help. Yes, I would stay again. rating about 8 out of ten (if you rate Vistana as a 10) ; AC was good, all appliances worked. Tuscana resort near Davenport, Florida.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Stayed for a week while kids in a tournament at Disney's Wide World of Sports. Our team had eight units. Some of us had clean units and others had disturbingly filthy units. All units had musty smell. If you get stuck in a building out by the highway, you hear traffic all night long. Big problem with Tuscana is that there is no staff on property at night. There was a maintenance problem in the middle of the night and people were stuck alone in the parking lot for two hours waiting for assistance. Location was good for Disney, and there were also numerous stores and restaurants nearby. Pool area was nice, but bring goggles for the kids as pool is super chlorinated. Overall I had good stay there, but some in our party had nightmarish experience. I would not stay there again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: we are here again excellent service again best in Orlando we love this place everything you need we are in block one clean great facilities you cannot fault this place and we are fussy come and see you will never go anywhere else once you have been here

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Wouldn't hesitate to go back! Ideal for theme parks.
column29: We stayed here in March/April 2012 and loved it. The apartment was fabulously furnished with everything we needed (there were 4 of us - 2 adults, 2 kids). We felt very at home straight away & the place was very spacious. The Publix supermarket nearby has everything you need & there's a petrol station close by that you'll see as you drive in. Near the Publix there is also a Subway which regularly does "buy one, get one free" offers - great for the theme parks so you don't have to mither making your own. The pizzeria nearby is good but pricey & there's a McDonalds nearby too for those lazy days.It's 20 mins to Disney & really easy to access the I-4 & we regularly went to Disney in the morning, came back for the hot afternoon & went back for the evening shows. The reception staff were good, the bar staff were great especially the bargirls & the food was reasonable in the bar/restaurant. The DVD rental from reception was handy too & we used this a lot. We took our own UK DVDs but had a problem playing them in the US player. The pool area was ideal for a relax & break from the parks. There is a $40 fee payable for damages or an option for a refundable $300 on your credit card which needs to be a bit clearer though. My only niggle was that the white goods in the condo weren't clear and guides need to be provided. We sussed them out via trial & error.Hopefully we will go back soon & I wouldn't hesitate to return.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We are just back from a 3 week stay at the Tuscana. This is our second visit to the resort we stayed 2 weeks last September.Again as before could not fault the place. The condo was lovely and clean and had everything we needed. The grounds are extremely well kept and it really is a place we will return to again.The location for Disney is brilliant and there is everything you need close by.We have visited Orlando every year for the past 10 years and the Tuscana is the only place we have returned to.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed for one week and have nothing bad to say! The accommodations were comfortable,clean, and as advertised. The grounds were well maintained. Staff were responsive and friendly. We were close to attractions but not too close. There was a grocery we could get to quickly for stocking the kitchen as well as restaurants for eating out. The pool area was clean and the pool was big enough to accommodate many people comfortably.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I was very disappointed with our stay here! The condo itself was nice, clean and spacious however, we were not told that we would have to either have our credit card debited with $300 (refundable within 28 days of departure if no breakages, damage to condo occured) or pay a $40 damage waiver fee. I opted for the latter and am quite relieved as when we walked into the condo, I pulled the blind which immediately fell from the window completely broken! The dining chairs were also quite rickety, the plates chipped and the balcony furniture wa past it's best. I dread to think how much we would have been debited had any further items broken.The biggest issue was the groups of 'young men' staying here. The pool area was quite often full of large groups of them taking up the WHOLE of the pool with either ball games or throwing each other around games. On one occasion, I reported this to reception who said that they would do something however, nothing was done and subsequentlty, a young man was thrown across the pool and he landed on my young son. I went back to reception as the blow had knocked one of his teeth loose. I was greeted with no concern at all, told to complete an incident form and given directions to the nearest hospital!! Needlless to say, we did not visit the pool again. The condo above us was also clearly occupied by a family of small elephants as the amount of noise could not have been made by anything else. Add this to the noise from the nearby highway and the large groups of men and the result is not much sleep.I would also add that these groups of men found it quite amusing to shout comments as my daugher and I walked back to our condo. We could not do anything about this as we could not tell which apartment they were shouting from. It was highly inappropriate though and the comments were not the kind of thing you would want your daughter to hear! All of the above is a shame as the resort was very convenient for the parks and there was a Publix and restaurants nearby. If you are visiting this rsort, just be prepared for these issues.I would visit Florida again, but not this resort.We had been looking forward to this holiday all year and feel very disappointed that our enjoyment of the resort was spoilt by inconsiderate guests and un caring staff.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: This is now our 2nd time staying at the Tuscana resort and we plan on staying many time again in the future as we enjoy it so much. The staff are all very friendly and willing to help and cater for all your needs. The food at the pool bar is simply delicous- with a lot to choose from. The wifi cone tons around the pool and near rooms to the pool is very good and strong. You are in a great distance from all attractions as it is a quick and short drive down the I4. Lovely scenery. The condos are very homely and have all the appliances you will need for your stay. Supermarkets and fast food chains are less than a 5 minute drive down the road. I would definitley recommend this resort to anyone with a big or small family and of any age! Had a brilliant stay and I will definitley be returning!! Thank you for a great stay! :-)

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Stayed here on 9th July for 8 days. Thought it was a lovely relaxing place home away from home with the added benefits of a pool. Apartments were large and comfortable and well equipped. You will need your own supply of washing up liquid, dishwasher tablets and toilet roll. this is not a problem as there is a Publix supermarket near by. They do supply a small amount of these items enough for one use. Also it might be an idea to pick up a small few supplies like tea or coffee and milk on the way as there are none at the apartments. If you are thinking of staying here you would need a car to get around as it is a little away from public transport. If I was visiting Orlando again I would stay here again. Had a great holiday and hope to visit again at some stage.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I can't believe all of these good reviews..I am not even waiting to get home to review this place. We are still here but refuse to stay and are paying for another place just because it is that bad. When I booked the room, I asked for a pet free non smoking room. We were given a room that had either been smoked in, or had a pet because the smell of the cleaner was so overwhelming it gave me asthma. Management at first refused to give us another room but finally did. The room we were given smells like it had been smoked in but it was better than the last one. The first room had a horrible bathroom. My daughter flushed the toilet and a bottle cap popped up. The shower was falling apart, scrapes everywhere. My husband went to check the cleanliness of the bed and when he lifted the comforter, he found the tv remote. The management is non existent, When we called to inquire about a different room, he sent up a maid with windex and room freshener. He refused to give us a refund so we could cancel our reservation. the second room we are now in had a filthy blanket that we just removed as quickly as possible. We have stayed at many condo resorts, this one doesn't provide paper towel, or coffee filters, not even salt and pepper. This was a complete waste of money and time, and it was so sad for my children when we waited all year for this vacation.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Tuscanna is a beautiful condo resort with nice units; very spacious and nicely appointed. The management office, however, is horrendous. Check-in was almost an hour of waiting in an un-air-conditioned office. It was very chaotic. Note that the resort caters to youth sports teams and there is no Wi-Fi. Cell service was spotty at best for all guests regardless of service provider. Also while I was there; a traveling companion was stopped by security to ask if he had witnessed vandalism that occurred during the stay and someone placed a pile of trash near a vending machine that remained for almost four days. My experience here paled to others I have had at nearby resorts. My unit (4104) was very spacious and comfortable but light bulbs were out and towels and linens were somewhat worn. The unit above is occupied by a family that lives permanently at the resort. The kids, teens or pre-teens, stay up all night playing video games. I heard yelling, screaming, stomping and objects being thrown every night; two, three o’clock in the morning. When I talked to the mom, I was told she would “try” and keep them quiet. The situation barely improved and resort management pretty much said there was nothing it could do. There are other resorts (Encantada) in the area that are more enjoyable, quieter, and less expensive .

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Ok, accommodations ruined by terrible customer service.
column29: Our stay would have been nice however, we had multiple problems with the locking mechanism on the front door and the initial response from the staff was less than adequate. Upon returning from dinner the first evening we could not enter our unit because the locking mechanism would not work. I went to the office and received new entry cards but they did not work. I returned to the office and they said they would send someone right over. We were locked out for approx 40 min until maintenance arrived to let us in. We were told by the maintenance personel that since it was 9:00 at night some would fix it the following day. No problem. Since we were staying in for the rest of the evening this sounded reasonable. When we left the following morning we stopped at the office to check and ensure that the lock would be fixed. No one in the office knew anything about the issue but they did issue a repair order and ensured us it would be repaired. Upon returning 9 hours later, approx 6:00 pm, the mechanism STILL did not work. I again went to the office and asked about the repair. Once again no one knew anything about the issue. One of the office personnel, Jason I believe, returned with me with actual keys. None of the keys worked. He left saying he would be back. After 20 - 25 minutes of no one returning my wife went to the office, primarily because our younger children needed to use the bathroom, and to check on the progress. When she asked "Jason" what was going on she was told, and I quote, "I'm sorry, you'll have to wait, I'm with another customer right now." The person checking in also yelled at her to wait her turn. After hearing of this situation, I went to office to insist on a solution. At this point it had been 50 minutes since we returned. No one appeared to know what to do or have a solution for us. A simple, "we are working on it and will take care of you." would have been appropriate. in the meantime someone did show up at the unit and let my family in. The maintenance staff did finally respond that evening to work on the lock. Three people worked on the lock for the rest of the evening. They finally finished at 9:30 at night !! They were very pleasant and apologized for taking so long. This completely interfered with the plan for our evening. Our plan was to return to the unit and utilize the pool and relax since we had been out all day. We could not because of the issues. Our children were not easily consoled which just added to the frustration. Instead of relaxing and going out to dinner we sat outside the unit for close to an hour before getting in and then sitting there for the rest of the evening while the door was worked on and eating take out.We stay at many places throughout the year and I completely understand that issues arise, I would be foolish to think problems don't occur. We have encountered problems before and issues were handled adequately. However, it's the response to the problem that we encountered here that was of issue. When we are are locked out with 3 children (ages 12, 5 and 3) and after 45 - 50 minutes of waiting we are told that they are now handling other customers and we have to wait ? That is completely unacceptable !!! While the unit was very nice and the location good I would never return based on the service from the staff. Save yourself the extra money and aggravation and stay at Lake Buena Vista Resort & Spa. Bigger rooms, closer to all the attractions and less money.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Just quickly wanted to say what a wonderful hotel this was, the apartment was lovely and spacious, very clean and quiet, the pool was beautiful and the staff and regulars were brilliant so friendly and helpful, haven't got one complaint it was perfect cant wait to come back :)

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: It was the perfect place for our family. The grandchildren, 3 &5 to start their Florida vacation near legoland and in that wonderful pool! Now that I know their is a big nice grocery store within a mile and to bring extra toilet paper, coffee filters, garbage bags and detergent I will be back! It would be nice if the drapes really closed to darken bedrooms.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed at the resort for 6 nights. During our visit there were several basketball teams at the resort. The resort was full of kids running around making noise all times of the night. We don't blame the resort for the mishaving kids.We found the staff to be VERY unfriendly and a major reason not to return to this resort.The condo was decent w/ minor issues (spots on the carpet and on the mattress & worn bath towels).

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: When you book Tuscana, you get luxury. We got a deal through Lastminute.com, and stayed for 4 nights last year. It's like stepping into a top class hotel room that's just been decorated. Everything was spotless, the carpet had hoover marks in it, there was coffee by the machine ready to go, everything was clean and welcoming. We stayed in a ground floor two bedroom condo, and it was decorated to perfection, TV was modern with 100's of channels, radio and guide books apleanty. The bar area and pool are well attended and eveything is clean and well presented. I'd go again in a heartbeat.....

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I've stayed at this resort before, but never again. What a huge disappointment. Staff was not overly helpful, accommodations were subpar (see pics). This place really has gone downhill.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We had fine stay. The unit we stayed in was pretty clean, other than hair in the tub and a couple of carpet stains. It was pretty bare boned ... one small hand soap, one roll of toilet paper per bathroom. I guess I expected more of a hotel like set-up with soap, a little coffee & filters. One last thing, bring your own pillow ...

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stay at the tuscana for 5 days and we loved it so much. Jason was so wonderful in helping with our check in. After a long 18 hour drive from philadelphia to the tuscana resort we were able to check in early with no problems. Our condo was so nice and clean and real big. the pool area is beautiful. the resturant was a plus. Saturday they had a live DJ and she was great. We would for sure be staying again and recommending this resort to all our friends and family. Also all the pictures on the website are 100% the real deal. no photo shop!!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: OK, but really depends on which building you stay in....
column29: Our stay at this condo was for an AAU tournament. This condo is conveniently located near Route 4 - it is off the beaten path away from Disney/ESPN Sports but easily accessible. (Traffic was never a problem.) Unfortunately, we were in building 5 in a room with a "view" - the view was of trees, behind the trees was route 4. The traffic noise was unbearable for me, I had 5 sleepless nights. Plus, if it rained the frogs were competing with the traffic. Another teammate had a room facing the parking lot and said noise was not nearly as bad. The bedroom also did not have drapes to cover the blinds. So, if you don't mind noise and light, this could be the place for you. However, next year we will be looking for another location - there are so many options in Orlando. I can only assume the rave reviews were from travelers who were in a room off the highway...

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Good value for a long term stay. Great pool and weather.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Enjoyed staying at Tuscana, Its away from all the hussle ans bussle of Disney but still only 15 minutes away if you want to go. Its by itself in a wooded area, but resturants and a Publix are very close. The rooms were comfortable and nice sized. A full kitchen and two baths were nice amenities. The place was clean, the beds very comfortable, and a washer dryer was great. Plenty of room for families and so much nicer then a single hotel room. The price was very good.The pool was clean and warm. I enjoyed my stay there and would go back again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: excellent!! going back again next year !!!
column29: We stayed at this resort , 2 families of 4 ( kids aged 4,6 and two 14 yr olds) , it was lovely , check-in was quick, had to leave a deposit of $300 on a credit card, but that was ok . The condos were very clean on arrival, towels,washing powder, dishwasher tablets, toiletries provided, although not sure if you could resquest more but as it was self catering we just got them with our shopping anyway!!!The resort was lovely , quiet in the day , and night time was enjoyable with karaoke and acts on some evenings round the large pool and bar area!!! so was able to float on my airbed with my drink by my side!! pure pleasure!!! till my kids tipped me up!!!, the childs pool was always empty and i can undertsand why as when i went in with the 4 year old it was absolutely freezing!!! toatally took my breath away, i thought as it was a shallow pool and waterfountaing it would be warm!!! there is a lovely golf course and walks to go on , my only complaint is that there is NO play area for the kids, it would of been great if there was as i wouldnt of had to spend soo much time in the pool cos there would of been something else to do appart from swim. Have emailed them about possibly adding a kids area The bar and food outlet were very good , staff were friendly and its more like a family than staff!!!so thats why we have booked again were going next april 2013 !! cant wait

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Great Place to stay for an even better price!
column29: I stayed at the Tuscana when a girlfriend and I took our children to Disney. The check in was smooth and quick. They have movie machines in the lobby (similar to Redbox). The pool area was clean and it seems always a fun place to be. The resort is tucked away in a wooded area away from the general population of a rather busy street. When we entered our room, I was more than satisfied. It was spacious and provided our group of 7 plenty of room to move around it. THey have large screened-in balconies as well. The Grocery store is about a 3-5 minute drive away. The resort was quiet and the grounds are well kept. It's a bit of a distance to the Disney parks and International Drive area, but for the space, price and peice of mind away from the crowds...it is BY FAR worth the drive. You will need a rental car if staying here. I have no complaints and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We got this accommodation as part of a Thomas cook package deal - but other than at the airport when they directed us to the car hire, that was it for the whole holiday - never heard another thing from them!The apartment was palatial just for the two of us - 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, kitchen, (4 TVs!!) lounge and dining area. It had a good washer/dryer set up, kitchen had most things and it had an Internet cable for the lap top, so handy with emails while we were away. There were some things missing though (glasses), the carpets were really stained and there were lots of extra charges they liked to threaten you with - like a mid-way clean for about $75 and if you left your rubbish at the bottom of the stairs $50 - although how they would know who it belonged to? We had to buy vim and a scourer to scrub out the shower as it was so greasy - not nice.Our queen size bed was comfy, but unfortunately there are no curtains or blackout blinds, just some white louvre blinds that do nothing to block the early morning light out - not great for light sleepers.Things were fairly quiet for our first week until a herd of buffalo moved in above us and we were treated to regular stampedes and a very irritating brat who ran from one end of the condo to the other repeatedly.Reception were not happy to do much about anything complaint-wise, including people who were smoking around the pool and not in the designated areas. During the day there was someone around, but after 9pm ish, it was an emergencies only number to dial.I hadn't realised that there was pretty much nowhere to walk to from the resort which was a bit disappointing. There's a public supermarket, a chilis diner, and a few other bits & pieces but other than that, nowhere nice to amble about and catch some sun. Everywhere is a drive away, and more often than not its along a motorway.The coast is a good hour + on either side, so Busch gardens (which was brill, was about an hour & a quarter) seaworld and aquatica were also fab, but thought universal parks were a bit disappointing.The pool was like a bath and appeared clean (it was June and 90-ish degrees) but usually full of screaming brats whose parents couldn't care less who the were annoying. The poolside loungers have metal arms (can you imagine how hot these get?!) and lots of the strapping is missing - wouldn't take much to fix if anyone could be bothered.Whilst some of the literature warned us about 'showers' we arrived on 2 June to be told their rainy season had started on 1 June. And for showers, read dramatic thunder and lightening storms most days at around tea time.All in all, the place was ok, the holiday had its highlights (usually away from the resort!!!) but I wouldn't dream of going back.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: They pay you to write a good review on Trip Advisor!
column29: Do not believe the positive reviews! This resort will give you 30% off your next stay if you email them a link of a positive review of their resort. The truth about this resort:Pros: Big rooms for decent price. Cons: Showers were not cleaned, hairs, mold, body gel and large bugs crawling from drain!Hairs in towels. Beds and furniture small and uncomfortable. Room smelled like smoke. Loud partiers kept us up all night. Pool is dirty, hairs in pool and they use chlorine in a salt water pool. Resturant had large ants, and bar staff was "interesting." Be prepared to pay $300 when you arrive for incidentals, I was lucky and I received a credit after a few calls, but others waited a month. (Read the fine print they can hold your money for 30 days.)

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Ofrecen apartamentos muy comodos, limpios y confortables..perfecto para familias numerosas y mas si tienen ninos pequenos, la unidad es bastante tranquila rodeada de mucho verde y con buena piscina, cerca de todos los parques de Disney. Tener precaucion si alquilan auto con GPS indicando la ciudad es Davenport no Kissime ni Orlando....para que no se pierdan como nosotros.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Muy Bueno, excelente precio incluye todo
column29: Estuve hospedado en Diciembre del 2011 y no habia dado mi opinion. de verdad supero nuestras espectativas buena ubicaciòn a los parques muy comodo limpio , seguro y tiene todo (ascensor, internet en la hab, estacionamiento etc). es muy familiar tiene lavadora secador, cocina con todos sus utencilios, sabanas, cobijas y el personal es atento. Si necesitas imprimir es gratis mientras sea menos de 4 hojas.muy buen precio reservando por www.despegar.com lo recomiendo 100 %

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Great resort...will definitely stay there again
column29: This was the first vacation my family has ever had. We stayed at the Tuscana resort and it was awesome. From check in it check out it was great. The kids loved the huge salt water pool and we spent a lot of time there. For the type of resort we expected to pay a lot more for it. There is a Publix and a 711 right around the corner and literally would take you a 1 min drive to get there. The condo was a two bedroom. It was spacious,clean and quiet. I am planning on going to Florida again next summer and will definitely stay there again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: From check-in to checkout, everything was terrific. Our 2 bedroom suite was spacious for three adults and two children. The kitchen was well equipped with dishes/pots/pans etc. With a supermarket very close, it was easy to avoid eating out much of the time--a money saver to be sure. Everything was very clean and well maintained. EVERY staff person was warm and friendly as well as "eager to please". These folks could teach others the meaning of great customer service and hospitality.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: My family traveled from Alabama to Orlando to go to Disney/Seaworld and stayed at The Tuscana Resort. Accommodations were excellent and the price was even better. We plan to go back next year and stay at the Tuscana again. Would highly recommnend to anyone.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Great Value, Great Resort, Great Time!!!
column29: This was our first family vacation so we had a hard time picking a resort. LegoLand recommended the Tuscana Resort as one of our choices so we took a chance and we were very pleased. Check in was quick & friendly. The accommodation was clean & I could smell the fresh when we walked in the door. Lots of space, nice sized rooms, closets & baths. Beds sleep average, although the sofa bed mattress needs replacing...springs are popping out in several spots. T.V. in every room. Loved the convenience of a full size fridge, stove, microwave & having a washer/dryer. Kids loved the movie theater and large heated pool. The pool side bar has excellent food & drinks at a average price. Great convenience for grocery shopping at the resort or a Publix not far up the road. We had a great time and will be returning next year.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Estimados viajeros, estuve alojado ocho dias con mi flia en Tuscana Resort, y quiero compartir mi experiencia en dicho lugar: en primer lugar el lugar se accede facilmente, tiene cerca un complejito con todos los servicios /Publix, farmacia, dos estaciones de servicio, restautantes, y un entorno precioso. El condominio en si es muy seguro, privado, con instalaciones adecuadas y espaciosas, gimnasio y la piscina-jacuzzi excelente con un resto-bar muy bueno y con precios muy razonables). La atención en el lobby es muy cordial y respetuosas. Particularmente el departamento que arrende y me asignaron, fue excelente, muy espacioso, con todos los servicios, en perfecto estado de conservacion y funcionamiento, dos dormitorios con baño privado cada uno, el living comedor muy grande y la cocina super equipada. Realmente nuy pero muy bueno el alojamiento en dicho lugar. No tengo objeciones que realizar. Compre via internet x despegar.com, y me cumplieron en todo, no tuve que pagar un solo $ adicional. Me reintegraron el deposito de u$s 300, que haces via tarjeta de credito, al retirarme. Si buscan un lugar que no sea un hotel, con espacio y ambiente fliar. para disfrutar con sus hijos, y un poco retirado del ruido cuando uno busca tranquilidad y relax luego del trajin de los parques y atracciones, les recomiendo no duden en elegir el Tuscana Resort, no se van a equivocar. Les mando un saludo y disfruten sus vacaciones. Gonzalo de Mendoza, Argentina.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: my wife and i have just returned from 2 weeks in orlando. we stayed in tuscana room 3403.check in was excellent and staff very helpful. the accommodation was clean and fresh, rooms are huge with all facilities including washer and dryer.disney is about 10 mins away in a car with universal about 20 mins. super market, clinic,7/11 and restaurants near.i would encourage anyone to stay here

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Estuvimos 15 días con mi familia en Octubre de 2011, viajamos mi esposo, mi bebe de año y medio, mi madre y yo y nuestra estadía fue lo máximo!!!!Nuestro condominio tenia dos habitaciones con camas matrimoniales, dos baños, comedor, sofá cama, y cocina equipada con todo lo necesario (microondas, nevera, lavaplatos automático, tostadora, cafetera, cubiertos, platos....) También lavadora y secadora.... Las camas tan cómodas y el silencio tan relajante que a veces nos costaba levantarnos en las mañanas. Habia TV en todos los ambientes. La zona de la piscina muy bonita y agradable, disfrutamos de ella en varias ocasiones... Muy cerca del hotel se encuentra un supermercado Publix, lo cual es muy practico a la hora de hacer las compras de víveres. Con respecto a los parques Disney se encuentran bastante cerca 15 a 20 minutos aprox. Los parques de Universal están un poco mas alejados a 30 o 35 minutos.Si duda alguna nos alojaríamos aquí nuevamente, no tenemos queja alguna, es un lugar fantastico para descansar!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: My family and I (me, my husband and two daughters) traveled to Orlando for our fist visit to Disney World. When we got to the hotel, the staff was very friendly and quick, and we got our unit right away. We stayed at unit 9, which is the last and the most quiet. The unit was amazing, huge and very clean. We stayed in a two bedroom unit and we where quite happy with it. All appliances looked brand new and worked perfectly, tvs where not flat screens, but our trip was not about watching tv. Bathrooms where clean, the place felt safe and we where 20 minutes tops away from the parks. Overall, wonderful experience, we will definately recommend it and of course, go back.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We choose this resort because of team choice. I read the reviews and dismissed some of the negative results as possible "one time" errors. I will say overall the resort is acceptable. Check in was smooth, room ok. Small issues with room/ condo..sink leak, horrilbe sulfur smell in master bath, mold growing due to unsealed time in master bath, broken shelf, curtain falling off, stain on carpet. I could deal with all that until .. !!! 1130pm 5/27/12, unknown guest arrives in his car and starts BLASTING HIS MUSIC FROM THE CAR WHILE HE UNLOADS, FOR ABOUT 10 MINUTES!!! I try to talk to the man, he is not nice. I call the "front desk" and all Lisa wants to know is my name, which I won't give because I don't want to see the guy again, if my room number or name is accidentally given out. I ask for someone to contact this man and told they will. 10 minutes later nothing, I again call and Lisa gets more rude insisting on my name, I end up calling 911. AS A COP, I THINK IT IS CRAP TO BOTHER LAW ENFORCEMENT WITH SUCH PETTY ISSUES, BUT SINCE I WAS NOT IN MY JURISDICTION AND TUSCANA OFFERED NO ASSISTANCE, I HAD NO CHOICE! I check out the next morning and the very nice, helpfull girl Jessica, says something about when you stay at hotels and there is an issue, you should always call the cops first. I explained why I wouldn't do that. I leave and after an hour discover we left two pillow....they are not worth much at all, but supposedly housekeeping can't find them. Weird since no other persons were in the room and we left it looked, it was no about the pillows, but the principle. I believe this resort has a lot of positive features, but my concern is always about integrity and hiring people who will do the right thing all the time. I don't believe you will get that here. It is nice, and inexpensive with some decent ammenties, but overall .. IT IS A CHANCE YOU NEED TO WEIGHT OUT!!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Family of 6 adults stayed in 3 bedroom private owned condo 8408. Brilliant facilities friendly staff. No road noise. Food/bar in Tuscana was of a fantastic high standard and very well priced. Pool very clean with free Cabanas. Cannot fault this resort in any way and very close to exit 64 Kissimmee & Disney Parks. (Universal exit is 74 Tuscana is Exit 58 = 16 miles on I4 only short distance). The condo was exceptionally clean and the washer dryer was really handy. I have yet to stay in an apartment were salt and extra TPaper supplied. Cant believe what some people class as a negative comment-buy some from Supermarket only $2. Maybe the travellers who complain stay in penthouses with butler service for the price Tuscana charge!!! For price facilites were fantastic.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Large units but some are too close to the highway
column29: We stayed 3 nights in a 2 bedroom condo while we were in town to attend an event. Unfortunately, our unit was in the back of building 6, which is right next to the highway. The highway noise woke us up at night. The unit itself was very large but the furnishings were very cheap. The beds were small and uncomfortable. The linens were synthetic and very unpleasant to sleep on. The furnishings provided were very basic (for example, there was not even 1 roll of paper towel and the unit came with only 1 trash bag). Guests were told they had to buy additional supplies, which is not convenient if you are only staying a few nights. Overall, I would look around at other accommodation if I am ever in the area again. If I had to stay here for whatever reason, I would make sure to get a unit far from the highway.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: Just got back to Scotland after 2 weeks at the Tuscana and had a wonderful time there,it's location is ideal for all the parks just of the i4.All the staff were so friendly and would do anything to help nothing a problem and the bar staff were always so welcoming,had a great 2 bed condo with everything u need and was spotless clean for our arrival.just before the entrance to Tuscana u have gas station,mcdonalds,restaraunts and an amazing supermarket.also great golf courses rite next to the resort.will defo be goin back great value for money

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed at the Tuscana Resort during the week (Tues - Fri), in unit 5301, which is a 3 bedroom condo with kitchen, eating area and couch with TV. Each bedroom has a TV and nice bathroom. Our showers however did not drain properly. We asked the resort to send someone with draino but no one ever came. It has a nice balcony where we had coffee outside before heading out to the Disney Resorts which were only a 15 min ride to Magic Kingdom, Epcot, Animal Kingdom. There is a 711 store and gas station near by so go there to stock up because the condo literally has one roll of toilet paper in each bathroom and that is it. We had to buy paper towels. There is a coffee pot there but you'll need to buy coffee and filters. They could have at least provided a coffee pot that doesn't need filters. You'll need water, the basics. The condo was clean and spacious. The best part is the pool. My daughter is 23 mos old and loved the wading pool area and water fall. They serve lunch and cocktails with cabanas and comfy lounge chairs. We would def stay here again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Close to Everything & A Great Deal
column29: Tuscana Resort in Champions Gate FL (not Davenport) is a great base for your Orlando-based vacation. It is RIGHT off I-4 just 10-15 minutes from the theme parks with groceries, gas, and golf all right there. Very tidy grounds and an excellent pool area with bar service make it a perfect place to unwind (or rewind) after taking on the Mouse, Shamu, or Universal. Families would do well to take advantage of a condo here. I would stay here again.Minor quibbles: Would ask for a full-sized trash can with extra bags, plus some extra TP. (That's not even $1. Just for convenience.) Units above can be a bit noisy.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Purchased a Groupon for this resort and it was the best thing I ever did!! The condo was nice. No problems at all. Was in Building 1. The pool was great as well. The staff at the pool bar/restaurant were the best! Would definitely stay again!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Avoid Bldg 5 - Permanent Rotten Egg smell in bathroom
column29: We shared a vacation stay with our good friends from Europe who got a great deal here on Groupon. Our bathroom smell was so horrid we kept the door closed & took the shortest showers possible. Housekeeping said it may have been a drain problem, but it was nauseating. We did not try to switch rooms because we were all 4 fully unpacked (including filling the refrigerator & cabinets with groceries) by the time we realized it was a continual problem 24/7 in our ground floor unit, whether we used the sink, shower, or just opened the door. 2nd problem, after 3 nights, we asked for more TP and were told none would be supplied, that each unit just received whatever was on the roller when they arrived. (ie. none were in cabinets, etc.) I even overheard a woman who found no TP when she checked in and I do not know if she ever received any.Similarly, the kitchen had not even a grain of salt. Nor sugar, coffee, filters, or any other minimal basics. For guests who must fly and must purchase each of these full size items for a week or less then leave it all, that's a shocker. It was supplied with enough automatic detergent for 1 use only of the dishwasher, although we were there for 4 nights. There was no WIFI at all in the rooms and even around the pool area, it only worked on our IPad or laptop if we stayed within a few feet of the lobby area.Oh, the GYM!! 90% of the equipment you see on the pictures was broken. (loose pieces of the weight cables pooled at our feet) 2 or 4 of the treadmill type machines did work.Overall, the pool area was very nice, but continually crowded & noisy, due to the Groupon price special, no doubt. The employees were pleasant and courteous, but could not fix the main issue we had: the sink/shower/drain/toilet smell!!I would never stay here nor recommend it.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Great stay after purchasing a Groupon!
column29: We purchased a Groupon for this resort and booked a post-cruise stay. Our adult daughter checked in with her family ahead of us into a three bedroom unit. Unit was in building 4 and convenient to clubhouse building/restaurant/pool area. Very pleased with unit size and loved having washer and dryer in unit. It is also really nice to have a fully equipped kitchen in unit to prepare meals and keep food expenses down while travelling.Our grandchild loved the pool area, which was well laid out for old and young alike. My husband and I ate lunch at the onsite restaurant and found the food to be very good and reasonably priced (a pleasant surprise after other on site restaurant experiences). The pool bar was staffed with friendly personnel (thank you for the great service Jenny) and drinks were also reasonably priced. Overall, we were extremely pleased and would not hesitate to stay again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

Publix was just a short distance away to get some food and far enough away so that it was very quiet at the condo. We enjoyed the pool and hot tub very much. Would Love to return in the future.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Was expecting a good resort and was not disappointed.....
column29: Just come back from an 8 night stay and had a really wonderful time. Our apartment was a 2 bed which was very spacious and actually had everything we needed for our stay. Very clean and just a home from home feel . Location could not be more perfect for Disney with a Supermarket just around the corner. Also Chilli's was lovely for an evening meal after a long day. Most days we were out from 9am until late so nice to have a snack from the kitchen on the days where we were just too tired to at out. Would definitely stay again and as a Travel Agent would def recommend it to my customers.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We were pleasantly surprised with our 7 nights stay at Tuscana in unit 6404. We were hesitant to stay in building 6 because of the reviews, but what a wonderful vacation. We had a fantastic view as we enjoyed our morning coffee watching the early birds on the golf course. We had restful sleeps as the beds were comfortable and nights were peaceful. The unit was clean and had all the needs of a home away from home. Our kids enjoyed their own TV’s and use of the internet in this three bedroom condo. The pool area was fantastic and we also enjoyed happy hour at the restaurant bar. We found the staff pleasant and helpful. Over all we found the Tuscana Resort peaceful and tropical and very convenient to all the parks. We would definitely return again and ask for unit 6404 for a perfect location and to enjoy a great vacation.
