column29: We Had a wonderful time at Tuscana Resort we Had A familt of 7 and a 3 bedroom was perfect and roomy enough We love the pool and Night time Music around the pool Our Condo was beautiful thw Pric was the best, We would love to go back there if we could

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Fabulous stay for a great price
column29: We stayed at this resort for the second time now and absolutely loved it! We always look for a self catering facility to save on having to eat out so much while on vacation. We booked a 2bdrm, that has everything like at home, dishwasher, laundry in the condo so we didnt have to pack so much, and both bdrms had queen beds and the balconies are fully screened. There was a pull-out couch as well that we didnt need to use and the condo was plenty large enough for the 4 of us. The resort is a gated community and very clean and very quiet. The amenities are fantsatic including a pool, ( which we spent alot of time at) hot tub, gym, theatre, bar/ restaurant. The staff are very friendly and VERY helpful as well. There is shopping nearby, just up the road and Disney was only a 4 minute drive away. There was shuttle service available to Disney as well if you needed it. We had such a fantastic time and cant wait to go back and stay for a longer time!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: The best weekend getaway I have ever had !!!!!!!!!!
column29: We got this through Groupon and it is the best one I have ever had. We do alot of long weekend getaways and I was very impressed with this location. The rooms were nice...the staff was very nice and the pool was the best I have ever seen. The cabanas...the bar and resturant staf was very nice and made us feel welcome. The only thing I would change would be to offer WIFI in all the rooms. I have an IPAD now so I can not connect to a wire they have for laptops. That being said not a complaint !!! We will definately be back here and we have been telling all our friends about it. The owners and staff should be proud of Tuscana we will be back !!!!!!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Over all, a great stay for the price
column29: First I have to say that I got a great Groupon deal which made this location irresistible. Before we went I checked to make sure it would be easy to get to the parks, and although this property is farther away than others we've patronized, it was an easy drive both to Disney and Universal. Tuscana is just off the highway easy on/off...which brings me to the other item I looked into on tripadvisor-based on other customer reviews I requested to not stay in building 6 due to highway traffic noise. We were in building 5 facing the golf course, and we didn't hear any traffic noise indoors. Sitting on our balcony was a different story, though. Traffic noise was fairly loud. The front desk staff was very helpful, responsive and friendly. They answered all of our questions, made check in/out and everything in between very easy. If I had any issues during my next stay I would not hesitate to go to them for help. They were careful to remind us that keeping our keys next to cell phones can de-magnetize them and we didn't have any problems with our keys.The bar/restaurant staff leaves something to be desired. The waitress we had told us that the bar didn't have any specialty drinks, but then the DJ doing karaoke mentioned the hotel's rum bucket. It's a crazy mixed drink with 6 different kinds of rum, pineapple juice and cranberry all in an oversized souvenir "bucket" cup for $11. The food is just OK (if you like Indian, don't be tempted-the naan bread is nothing like the real deal). It was so nice to have Publix right down the road! We chose Tuscana in part because we wanted to have a full kitchen so although we brought quite a few items for our meals, we did go to the store for fresh veggies and a birthday cake. This brings me to a list I'd like to share with the tripadvisor community that I wish I'd had before we went....the resort provides a "starter pack" of mini shampoo, mini bar soap, one pack of dishwashing detergent and a tiny liquid dishwashing soap, each trash can had only one trash bag in it, and one roll of toilet paper per bathroom (our 3 BR condo had 2 bathrooms) so if I had it to do over again I would have brought:Kitchen:Paper towelsSponge/dish scrubberDishwashing detergentDishwasher detergentSalt/Pepper/oilTrash bagsCoffee filters(A generous supply of "the basics" is provided in the kitchen-plenty of plates, silverware, bowls, glasses and even wine glasses-also plastic mixing bowls of varied sizes, plenty of standard sized pots/pans with lids, dish drainer, a jug for mixing juice, a few utensils including can opener and wine bottle opener, and a set of knives-they were fairly dull but useable, and our freezer had an icemaker) Our unit did not have a cutting board. I don't know if that's standard, but if you plan to do a lot of cooking, I'd recommend bringing a small one just in case.Laundry detergent/fabric softner-there is a stacking washer dryer, and the cleaning fee if you want service mid-stay is rather high so next time I would bring my own detergent and do a load of fresh towels. While we're talking about towels, I felt like I was signing my life away to borrow pool towels...next time I'll save the trouble and bring my own beach towels. Also, I had my kid diving for pennies because I didn't think to bring pool toys...OK-back to the room. For the bathroom I will make sure to take:Soap for each showerShampoo/conditioner(blow-drier is provided in each bathroom)Hand soap and lotionToilet paperTrash bagsHere's the low down on the quality of the rooms-I felt that I got a fantastic deal and was willing to overlook the minor flaws such as stains on the carpet (I felt that things were clean, and the carpet seemed clean even if it did have some discoloration) and a small tear in the sofa and a couple of drawers that didn't open/close quite right. Over all, things are nicely cleaned and I didn't have any complaints in that department. The place was huge-more than I could have asked for in terms of space in the kitchen and dining room, living room was OK space wise only because there wasn't seating for everyone in that space so if we'd wanted to watch a movie together some would need to sit on the floor/bring in chairs from dining room to sit on. Bedrooms have clock radios, closets, chest of drawers, lamps and extra blankets/sheets.The beds were comfortable, linens were provided (I wondered at one point when I was planning my trip) and in our room we had 2 twin beds in one room and the other rooms each had one queen. Living room sofa pulled out. We didn't use it so I don't know what the quality was like on that.The community is gated and generally feels very safe and friendly. Some people live here, some like us were tourists.There was plenty of parking near our building. We stayed on the 1st floor of 4 floors. There are elevators available but I didn't use them so I can't comment on the quality.The pool itself is nice, clean and well maintained. It was busy every time we went. There were plenty of chairs/lounge chairs, though it looks like it might be time to replace several of them since they're missing some slats.Over all, we really enjoyed our stay at Tuscana. If I got a good deal again (under $100 per night including the $45 cleaning fee), I would come back happily. It was easy to deal with the staff, their expectations of us were clearly laid out in the check-in packet (including info about optional fees like trash pickup outside your room for $25), it was easy to get around in the resort itself-we walked to the pool from building 5 and it was an easy walk for us. I love to be able to have space to move around in my rental, and at this price, I have stayed in lousy little hotel rooms with nothing but a mini-fridge just because it was close to Downtown Disney. Here I had a nice big closet, the ability to close my door to my bedroom, 2 bathrooms and a full kitchen. Who can complain about that?

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We just got home from our first stay at the Tuscana Resort and we will definitely go back. Their website gave very accurate information so we had no surprises on check in even though it was 2am. Our welcome package including map, key and info was exactly where they said it would be and in no time we were settled in. The condo was really nice and very roomy, the bathrooms are beautiful and the kitchen is very modern with everything you need to cook a nice meal. The carpets are a tiny bit marked but with the amount of guests that stay there it is certainly understandable. I was so impressed with how well the grounds and pool area are maintained and the staff were excellent to deal with and very friendly. Having the ability to keep up with the laundry is also a nice plus so you don't have to pack a huge suitcase. Grocery stores, convenience stores, etc., are just a few minutes away as well. We made it to Disney in 10 minutes from our Condo. We are planning another stay next year or the year after and we have already decided this is where we want to stay, only longer this time!

column29: I almost hate to share our experience at Tuscana. We've been staying there every year since it opened. We have only praise for the staff and the manner in which they treat us. column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Just back from a 4 week trip to the States. We stayed in this place for the 2nd time and found it really nice again. We had a nice unit overlooking the golf course on the 2nd floor and it seemed to have been recently remodeled. Really nice and comfortable and the units are big (2 bed - 4 of us). Its a quiet spot (the area) and that suited us and despite the resort being busy, we had a good time. Staff were friendly enough but to be honest we didn't have much interaction as we have been to Florida quite a few times. I'd recommend it and will stay again

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: My husband and I stayed at Tuscana for the month of March. This resort allows animals and we travelled with our cat. We had a 3 bedroom unit; very spacious but not clean at all. The rugs were filthy, the dining room chairs were stained to the point we put towels on them to sit. The living room consisted of a terribly dirty and uncomfortable loveseat and a chair that was pretty much in the same condition. There is a $250 cleaning charge when you have an animal. I don't think the unit was cleaned as we found plenty of long dog hairs. I don't think we would return unless we were guaranteed a newer and cleaner unit. Other than that, the pool was great; plenty of chairs. The restaurant served good food.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: For the first time in the USA we met neither service or smile:( and worst of all cockroaches were also living with us in our bath room. Location is not good either for Sea world or dining: far away from everything.The pool is small and there is no playground for kids. The room we had looked worn out and in fact I have no positive comments about this resort unfortunately.This is not a regular hotel. They do not change bedding's or clean the room during your stay unless you pay extra. Pool towels are given to you in the reception and they expect you to keep and clean them during your entire stay.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I stayed there last week for 3 nights with a co-worker in a 2bed villa. Upon check in they took my CC like any normal facility. I read the reviews prior to my booking so I thought it would be a good place. I travel quite a bit for work and leisure and very often to Florida. Looking at the pictures you would "liken" the facility to a "Marriott" well it is a "poser" at best. It poses as Marriott quality/fascade and is more like an off highway Motel and not a really good one at that. We get to our room. I ironed my clothes and hang them up. That night it was like the Royale Rumble from the WWE upstairs from our room from about 10pm to 1a.m. I tried to call the front desk but the phone did not work. Furthermore Bldg 6 is directly off the hwy and all I could hear besides the apparent hurd above me was the Highway. The next morning I called the reservation line and left a message. I did not receive a return call promptly. I went to the front desk and spoke to Debby. I advised her of what went on. I let her know we would like to be moved and I in no way blame them however, it is not relaxing orreassuring that no one was around. She stated she was not sure if she could move me and if she did I would have to pay the $40.00 additional cleaning fee. Also I may have to pay a difference. I stated that I did not find this appropriate but at this point I need to go to an off site meeting for the day and I will be available by phone. She asked if I would like to speak to a manager I told her I would like that. No manager ever called me. She called me sometime later and asked if I wanted to move to a 3 bedroom for an additional 1$0.00 a night and a $45.00 additional cleaning charge. I told herf absolutely not. She would continue to try and get me to another location. She called and left me a further message that I would be in bldg 9 which was fine and an additional cleaning fee would need to be charged. That these are provately owned and the owners should not be charged. In my opinion neither should the guests when the matter is not of thier control. The facility as a "good" gesture of customer service should absorb the charge. We moved to the new room. I got there and Jason called to get my CC I just literally had walked in provided him the information and hung up. Upon further inspection I noted that there was no iron or ironing board in which to re-press my clothing. Also my co-worker noted "used" toilet paper stuck to her bathroom door. I called left a message with no return call within an hour. I called backa dn spoke to Leo who stated that it was too late to get an iron or board and not to mention could he do anything until the morning about the toilet paper. He said he would have these items along with batteries to the remote control snet over since that did not appear to work either. About 15 min went by a maintainence worker came by with batteries and an iron. They never came by and cleaned the toliet paper or brought an ironing board. They just took my extra money and did not really care. I will NEVER stay there again. I would not reccomend it. There is also no wi-fi.. It's too bad it has the looks of a nice place..but that's all..

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Stayed at this resort with five golfing buddies. One of the two rooms rented had issues with card access. On two of the three nights, on return to the unit, none of our door keys worked. On the first occasion (first day of arrival), when our room keys didn't work, we tried to contact the hotel front desk. The room phone didn't work (didn't work the whole time we were there). We went to the front desk, but the hotel management office closes at 10 am (we had arrived back from an evening out at about 11:30 pm. The only contact was an answering service, which we had to call using one of our cell phones.Fortunately, the golfers in the room that were locked out were able to wait for hotel maintenance to arrive and replace our room keys. It took about an hour and three calls to the answering service before Michael, the hotel maintenance man, arrived. Michael was apologetic and friendly. We were told that the door lock would be re-programmed by the time we returned from golfing later the next day. Our door passes were re-programmed. Leo, the office staff member on duty, was unsympathetic, aloof and defensive, and simply pointed out that they don't staff the resort after 10 pm.When we arrived the next day after golfing, the door lock had not been repaired. Michael again apologized and made the repairs.On the third day, on returning from golfing, the door lock worked, but after an evening out, again the door keys didn't work. Michael was on duty, and replaced our keys immediately.Two other issues with the room: one room had a wireless router, but Leo told us it didn't it work, and the only wi-Fi access was at the pool area and in the resort office area.One of our group was able to fix a simple connection issue with the router to allow us internet access.While the rooms were clean and functional, the other problem was that, while the rooms had soap and toilet paper, there was barely enough to last two days, with six people shaing the two rooms. While we understood that the room supply replacements were our responsibility, to supply one soap and one toilet paper for each room is a little unreasonable (most hotels supply a minimum of two soaps, one for the sink and one for the shower).With such a basic issue as access to a hotel room which was paid for, this resort's inability to respond quickly to the problem, and then to have it recur again, is inexcusable. The rude and unresponsive hotel front desk staff member made it even worse. Only the polite and understanding maintenance person were helpful.We will not return to this resort.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Good location for everything Orlando, even 12-hours of Sebring only 90 minutes away.
column29: Good price for a condo which could sleep 5. Reasonably clean and maintained. Don't forget to bring your own household stuff however. These are not hotel/motel rooms and I did not have daily maid service. Not a big deal if you don't mind taking care of things yourself. I will stay there again, quiet area with convenient shopping and access to all the Orlando attractions. Also, only 90 minutes from Sending International Raceway to the south and you don't have to pay Sebring race week prices. Daytona Beach is only 90 minutes to the east. Great location.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Great location...however our condo had stains in the carpet, on the sofa and dining chairs! The kitchen and bathrooms are beautiful but the nasty carpet and sofa was not worth the time and money!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed at Tuscana resort 2 years in a row. We love the location. It is very clean and the condo is exactly as shown. The pool area is beautiful. The staff so helpful. We are returning next year and can't wait to get back

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: we stayed at tuscana in june-july 2011 in block 1 condo was very clean service was excellent, We holiday in Orlando regularly and were so impressed with this resort we are returning this year dont listen to negative reveiws i am very fusssy this resort is fab!!!!!!!we are returning in july cant wait!!!!!!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Delightful family vacation at Tuscana Resort.
column29: I am currently writing this review from my tablet while sitting poolside and letting my daughter swim. We recently booked a three bedroom villa between March 31 - April 7 2012. Being that our last stay here at Disney was spent at the Contemporary Resort within the Disney compound, we all found this resort a home away from home. The villa had plenty of space for our family and we were all extremely impressed with the convience to the Disney attractions. Epcot was less than a 15 minute drive, Universal Studios was about 25 and the airport about 35. I truly feel that as I write this, that this is a hidden gem within Orlando area. Once we stopped at The Publix and Walgeeens for a few things, the inclusion of on site bar and restaurant made us feel like not leaving. The pool area offers more than most resorts in this area by far.. very friendly staff and they even remember your name. Even the karaoke was a pleasant change of pace. The restaurant has excellent hamburgers and other finger food. The drink of choice is a resort special "a bucket of rum". This lovely drink includes 6 different Flavors of rum and helps sooth the nerves. The guests that we met are very pleasant as this resort does offer a very family friendly environment. I would definitely recommend this resort to my friends, family and coworkers. Thank you for the wonderful time... the sounds of music, soccer games on one of the three 55 inch Atvs in the bar, kids playing in the pool, breeze in the palm trees and the laughter from the bar will be missed. Brendan Buechel- Chattanooga, TN

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: great place for family attending wedding
column29: Finding a place to stay with an adult son and daughter, to attend a wedding, that included a kitchen was not easy, yet we had a good experience here. The sofa bed was uncomfortable and they could have added a comfortable chair in the bedroom, but otherwise the decor was good, and the setting wonderful. We especially enjoyed the outdoor pool and hot tub. Location was great; we were close to many things we wanted to do. We liked the screened in outdoor porch. Warning that AT&T phones do not work in most areas; we had to go outside to make calls, and watch where we stood. There was internet access, but only with a cable, not wi-fi, which was hard when more than one person wanted to hook up a computer. There was wi-fi near the pool area, which was huge (so we saw many folks using computers far enough away from the water to be OK. Front desk folks were always very, very helpful--without their help, we might have missed our plane, since they recommended when to leave, explained what else was happening and why we had accidentally come at a very busy season, etc. Also gave good restaurant recommendations, just what we wanted.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Our family of 8 stayed in a 3 bedroom condo at this resort. We loved our time there however the condos can certainly use some updating, the furniture is very uncomfortable with a small sofa and armchair as the only furniture in the living area. The weather was great so not much time was spent indoors, but at the beautiful pool area, were most of the lounge chairs need to be repaired. Happy hour from 4-6pm makes the bar affordable, however, the drinks are very expensive any other time. Loved Karaokee. The food is good, and affordable. Check in was fast and efficient with great customer service. we had a few problems with the locks, but the problems were dealt with swiftly. Big kudos to Micheal for his friendly dispostion and making you feel at home. He was a big part of our great vacation. THANKS MICHAEL!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Stayed at Tuscana from the 23rd of March to the 30th, 2012. The resort is beautiful with lush gardens and very clean. The pool was a huge hit with my kids and I was able to watch them from a cabana, deck chair, or even the lounge at Tavern at Tuscana. The Tavern has excellent food and is reasonably priced, especially after looking at the dining costs at Disney. We liked it so much, we ate there 3 of our 7 nights. We rented our unit privately from the owner of the condo (through Homeaway.com), so I can't speak to the ease of booking, but from what I could see, the staff were very helpful and attentive, even guiding us in a couple small issues we had with our unit (key code wouldn't work). It is a gated resort but I did get the feeling that people would wait outside the gate until someone would enter, then follow them in. I did not experience any problems with security or personal safety what so ever and allowed my 12 and 13 year old daughters to go to the pool by themselves, although we did have 1 of the 3 units that looked over the pool. Our unit was completely remodeled with Bamboo flooring, granite counter tops, and tiled baths. Extremely clean unit. The location was perfect! Less than a 15 min drive to Disney, Seaworld and Prime Outlets Orlando. Universal was about 30 min but I hit traffic. Nasa, Cocoa Beach, and Clearwater Beach were about 1 1/2 hour drive and worth it. I wish I could have stayed longer.I highly recommend Tuscana Resort!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I spend 7 days in this beautiful resort. I stay in a 3 bedrooms... the room was very clean and we have a lot of space for 6 peoples (4 adults and 2 kids 3-5 years old) The pool was very nice... they have cabana on the side. The condo is very well located ( 10 minutes from Disney and all the attractions)I will come back as soon as possible.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: My family and I have traveled to Orlando on holiday every year. We decided to stay at Tuscana and booked in on orbitz. The resort promises 24 hour check-in, we had to wait an hour for some to show up with our key after quite a long flight with the children! Then once we got to our room, the key didn't work. So my wife and dragged out weary children back to find the person that mysteriously appeared previously. Once we got in our room, the smelled terrible and the carpet was stained. Our neighbors were noisy until 2am and apparently this is not a resort as advertised but condos of some sort. I found other accommodation, the next day. But my deposit was not returned immediately and it took many phone calls to get my money back. Awful.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: Lugar recomendable. Llegamos y enseguida nos dieron la tarjeta de acceso al departamento. Departamento con 3 habitaciones, super equipado, con todo lo que pidas en la cocina (lavavajillas, microondas, heladera, tostadora, cafetera, lavarropas, secarropas). Uno de los dias disfrutamos a full la pileta, y la verdad que hermoso lugar.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I recently stayed at the Tuscana Resort in 6406. It was decorated very nicely, granite counter tops in kitchen and bath; great walk in closets; roomy balcony. It was very clean. There were only a few negatives, and it wasn't a big deal. 1. Our building was right beside of very busy interstate and our balcony faced the wooded lot between the resort and the interstate. It was too noisy to sit out there, however, we were so busy it was no loss. 2. The pool was VERY crowded during the day and was difficult to find seating. However, it was sooo warm and beautiful, that we started going at night and there was hardly anyone there. 3. The kitchen had no dishtowel or cloth and there was only one trash bag. Like I say, these are just minimal aggravations compared to how clean it was. The staff was extremely nice and helpful and no one approached us to buy a unit like a lot of resorts do in that area. I would definitely stay there again, just would book a building away from the interstate.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: My husband and I stayed at the Tuscana Resort March 11-17, 2012. We had previously stayed at the Tuscana in August, 2010 with our three sons and had enjoyed it so much,we knew we had to come back.The staff are very welcoming and work to ensure that your stay is memorable. The condo and resort is clean. Our washing machine was not working very well and we advised the front desk and maintenance came to fix the problem within a very short time.We brought our tablet, which didn't connect to the internet wires, but there was a computer in the lobby for guests' use. We stayed in the two-bedroom condo, which is very spacious. The resort is close to many of the attractions and has a very large heated pool and a large hot tub. There is wi-fi at poolside. There is a Publix and McDonald's nearby as well as a 7-11 and Chili's Restaurant.It was a pleasure to stay at this resort and recommend others to visit.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: just myself and husband on this trip,been to orlando twice before with family and stayed near i drive had some doubts after booking due to some of the reviews,condo very clean on our arrival tho furniture was outdated and slighty shabby,but hey,this is orlando,who stays in! yes its about 15-20 mins to disney depending on traffic but we wanted a differant location this trip,all staff friendly and helpful,our sink and toilet was blocked in one of the bathrooms after we'd been there a week and it was fixed the same day we reported it.poolside area is good,nice and clean,guests not supposed to reserve lounge chairs tho all the old folks do, and taverna food was decent enough if you cant be bothered to go anywhere else! chilis resteraunt down the road is very good tho it does get busy! would stay again

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Pretty, but too far removed from the action
column29: Tuscana was a pretty resort, the decor was nice, but it was far removed from the theme parks and dining in Orlando, and there was quite a bit of traffic every evening getting back there after a day at the parks. We were placed in a building that was a long walk from the pool and the lot wasn't well lighted, so I wasn't very comfortable letting my teenagers walk to the pool in the evenings by themselves. I asked, but they said there wasn't anything closer available. And don't even THINK about staying past check-out time! The maids are right there banging at your door, even if you did request a late check-out. There is a 7-eleven at the corner and a Publix and a McDonalds right down the block, which were quite convenient.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Tuscana is a great place for a family or friend trip and is in a fantastic location! We really enjoyed or time at the poolside bar. Bartenders Jeany and Krista are lots of fun and have a do a great job making you feel relaxed and welcome. Janet and Dave also go out of their way to make you feel welcome and they provide help with local knowledge (Dave suggested nearby golf courses we should play) All the appetizers we had at poolside were perfect !

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Positives include nice pool area well maintained grounds and units. Two bedroom unit was large and well appointed.Negatives Guests above our first floor unit sounded like they were literally jumping off the tables onto the floor, rattling the walls and ceiling. Hope you have better folks above. (They did stop when I complained.)Electricity was turned off for three hours one afternoon and the staff did not assure us it would be turned back on. It was after I assume someone paid the electric bill!We would return to this property and hope we have better luck next time...

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Estuvimos con mi familia (matrimonio y tres hijos entre 10 y 16 años) en febrero de 2012. Todo estuvo bárbaro: los departamentos sumamente espaciosos, equipados genial, no les falta nada (lavarropas, secarropas, lavavajillas, horno microondas, una heladera hermosa, vajilla, todo!). Los baños, espaciosos. Aire acondicionado. Plasmas en todos los ambientes. Secador de cabello, tabla de planchar y plancha....todo. No falta nada. Aunque no incluye servicio de mucama. Está bien ubicado, en un lugar muy tranquilo y agradable. Tiene una hermosa piscina y solarium. Se puede estacionar el auto frente al depto donde uno se aloja. El estacionamiento es sin cargo adicional. Se puede descansar bien, es muy silencioso y rodeado de verde. El personal es muy amable. Nos sentimos tan cómodos que nos quedamos con ganas de volver....

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed for 10 days in a great apartment here. Wonderful locaton and great pool area. Would love to go back.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Tuscana is the best in Florida
column29: We were at Tuscana for 7 nights. This property is beautiful from the start until the end. The 3 bedroom condo was spacious and clean with a TV in every room. We had up to 7 people staying in the condo at one time.The pool area was great with cabanas, a kids area and a nice hot tub which was always in use. The pool was about 90 and it is saltwater. There is a new Publix right around the corner to buy all the groceries for the week. There is a 7-11 where you can get gas or munchies.The Tuscana Tavern Bar located right next to the pool was awesome, the food and drink was very good at very reasonable prices. We went to the bar each night to check out the Internet and have a drink. The security is good with a gated entrance. We look forward to visiting again either later this year or next March. Our ground floor unit was great.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed at the Tuscana Condo Resort from Feb. 23 to March 01/12 and our experience for our first time in a condo was excellent. It was immaculately clean, the whole resort was like heaven on earth. We could live there all year round, it would be a dream come true. What a place!!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I've stayed at the Tuscana Resort four or five times, each visit about a week. Located in a gated area next to the Champions Gate resort/golf area with easy access to I-4. These condominiums are a great alternative to a hotel room. They have a full kitchen, dining and livings rooms and a washer and dryer. There is no daily maid service. There is a pool and snack bar.If you are planning on driving to the Disney or Universal resorts you will battle the I-4 traffic, so expect some delays. Otherwise, there are plenty of dining, shopping and entertainment options near by.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: This property is beautiful, The 3 bedroom condo was spacious and clean. The pool area was great, very few kids :) !!!!!! The Tuscana Tavern Bar located right next to the pool was awesome, the food was very good at very reasonable prices. The staff was exceptional......i would like to thank Dionne, Jenny and Krista and the locals for making our vacation so wonderful. We look forward to visiting again

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: My review would probably be like most others on here, clean, roomy, good value; except for ceaseless stomping from the unit above. This commenced late on the second evening, went on into the wee wee hours of the morning, and continued for two nights (and mornings) despite assurances that it would be dealt with. After the second evening of this continuous pacing I actually had to raise my voice with the front desk to get my displeasure across, it seems they were unable to contact the occupants during the day and left it at that. Great holiday experience. The fourth and final night was quiet but the door couldn't hit our butts fast enough on the way out.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Overall the resort was what I expected. The only negative was ther carpet needed a good cleaning. Any problems were dealt with in a short time. Staff were prompt and helpful. You won't be disappointed with this resort. Price was somewhat high but normal for the area I suspect for the holiday's. We would diffently recommend.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: This was one of the best unknow vacation spots EVER! The condo was clean, well equiped, pleanty of room, screed balcony, 2 bathrooms in the 3 bedroom, large kichen, nicely decorated. price that you pay for one night stay is equal to a double room at many hotels. However, at Tuscana you get a FULL CONDO. It was unbeleivable! The The pictures that you see at www.tuscana.net is a TRUE reflection of what you are to expect. The night was fantastic at the bar with a live DJ and plenty of happy patrons. The pool is heated and i love the zero entry level for the kids.The ONLY reason that I did not give it a 5 star is because you are self reliant once you get in the condo. No daily service and you have to restock supplies, tissue, soap ect. HOWEVER this is not uncommon for this style resorte since it is a condo and not an hotel. There is a Publix a couple of miles down the road and you can pick up all the supplies you need.If you pass up this trip, you will never know how GRAND life can be... Have fun!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Great location away from the craziness of Orlando
column29: We stayed in a two-bedroom condo with our 8 year-old son. The place was very clean. Kitchen was reasonably well stocked (could have used a frying pan). Our unit was short on coffee mugs but that was resolved within the hour of us mentioning it.We really appreciated being in a quieter location away from International Drive or downtown Kissimmee. Even being slightly outside of these areas it is only 3 minutes to the I4 and from there you can readily get to all the attractions. We visited Universal, Orlando Science Center, LegoLand, Busch Gardens and Cocoa Beach using this our base and it took us less time to get to the attractions as we could quickly get on the I4.There is a Publix (grocery store) and gas station within 3 minutes of the resort. WalMart is about 4 miles away. You get an initial roll of toilet paper in each bathroom and one sample dishwasher soap package and you probably want to pick up some additional supplies of these on the way in. You will also need laundry detergent. There is an on-site store but I suspect the prices are a bit higher than at a larger retail outlet.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Great Family Holiday - Great Location - December 2011
column29: We stayed in a 2 bed condo which was clean and spacious. The apartment is fitted with all the mod cons and so cooking/washing was easy. All the staff were extremely helpful and very friendly. If you fancy a night after trailing round all the parks/shops, hire a DVD from the machine in the reception area as they have all the latest releases for about £1 for 24hrs rental. The bar by the pool is also a good place to unwind at the end of the day whilst the kids go swimming. (we didn't eat at the pool bar but the food did look good)The resort is only a 15mins drive from all the major attractions and the Chili's at the end of the road offers great food and value for money. Florida Mall is about a 20min driveThe kids loved the free wi fi! Would definately come back and recommend the Tuscana to friends.My tip to all the mums going, make use of the American washing machines/dryers. The washer only takes about 20mins and the dryer is the same. Came home with no dirty washing!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Basic accommodations for a great price
column29: I would recommend this resort for anyone looking for a convenient and inexpensive place to stay while visiting Disney. We thought we were pushing the envelope with seven adults in a three bedroom unit, but there was plenty of room. The unit was generally spacious, although the living room area was disproportionately small. Everything was very clean but worn. The carpeting was especially scary looking, but it turned out to be stained rather than dirty. Another reviewer had mentioned that they thought the beds were full size rather than queen, and we also initially thought the beds were full size. But I measured, and sure enough they are 60 inches across – queen size. I don’t know why they look smaller. The pool area is fantastic with a nice bar and restaurant. A previous reviewer had commented that the hot tub was only warm, but it was extremely hot when we were there, and the pool temperature was pleasant. We had hoped our college age children could use the resort’s shuttle, but it only made one trip a day to Magic Kingdom, leaving the resort at 9am and returning at 5pm, so we didn’t find it useful. Fortunately, the resort is very conveniently located, and it only took us 15-20 minutes to get from the condo to the Disney parking lots.

The kitchen is minimally stocked, but the only significant thing missing was a hot-pad. We would like to stay here again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column27: Tuscana, excelente lugar en Orlando, Fl.
column29: A principios de este diciembre 2011 estuvimos con mi esposa e hijas en un lindo apartamento de Tuscana Resort 1395 Tuscana Lane, Champions Gate, Davenport, FL 33896 La estadìa sumamente placentera, un lugar tranquilo, limpio y con mucha seguridad. Ademàs el personal es muy profesional y honrado, a tal grado dìas despuès de haber abandonado el Resort, llamè pidiendo ayuda por un objeto olvidado, el cual inmediatamente me indicaron estaba nuestra disposiciòn, y tambièn en forma diligente me ayudaron para que llegara a nuestras manos en nuestro paìs Guatemala.Esta es la 4a o 5a vez que les visito, ya que ademàs de lo comentado queda muy cerca de los principales parques de diversiones, por lo que me permito recomendarlo al 100%.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Tuscana Resort: Excellent resort for an excellent price!
column29: We stayed at Tuscana the first week of November 2011. The resort was spotless and our 3 bedroom condo was excellent as always. This is a great place for a group of people wether its family or friends. They always have specials and I have never paid more than $99/night plus cleaning fee for a 3 bedroom condo with free internet. Who could ask for more!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Great place for a great price
column29: Tuscana proved to be a great value for the money. We arrived mid-morning and they called to check if our room was ready - it was and we got right in - no wait! The 3 bedroom we got was a very nice size - plenty of room for everyone. The carpets were looking worn, but not unacceptably so; otherwise the room was in very good shape. The resort is sort of "self serve" - room service is only every 4/5 days if you stay that long (not unlike time shares). There are 4 sets of towels in each bath. Also, while there was a roll of toilet paper in each bath, there was no extra. No paper towels either (they do have dish soap, 1 dishwasher detergent and typical bath toiletries). This wasn't an issue as we were going to the grocery store anyway. Honestly, if you're going to be staying in a place like this, you'll probably have a car and will go to the grocery store anyway. I'd rather save the money on the room and bring some supplies myself. The location is rather good as well - 15 to 20 minutes to Disney World (depending on what part you're going to), 20 minutes to SeaWorld and 25 to Universal. Being off the beaten path is nice after a long day. The resort restaurant was very good, and the other amenities looked good (we didn't use the pool, etc - but they look nice!). There are not a lot of local dining venues - but Chili's does take out. Local gas prices are also very good. We'll be staying at Tuscana again next year and we're looking forward to it!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Excellent Location - spotlessly clean - fab resort
column29: I was unsure of what to expect when I booked Tuscana based on some of the feedback I had previously seen on Trip Advisor. I must say though that my partner and I were extremely surprised at the excellent standard of our apartment. When I book a resort I'm not one of those people that are bothered about what's around me as much as I am about where I'm sleeping. The condominium was spotless. It was like it had just been built. I felt like I could eat food off the table. It's rare that I go to a place and feel I don't need to give it a clean myself but there was simply nothing to clean.The staff at the bar were really nice. The reception staff weren't very friendly I must say but they were just about helpful enough that I'm not going to brag on about it too much.Location wise, it's only about 10 minutes drive from Disney. It's quite a bit away from Universal - about 30 mins drive.Brilliant resort overall and I'd happily stay there again next time I return to Orlando.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We spent 3 nights at Tuscana during a trip to Orlando with another couples friends of ours. The 2 bedroom/2 Bathroom layout was perfect. My wife and I had our own private space, as did my buddy and his wife. I cannot overstate how perfect the location is. It literally took us 5 minutes to get to Epcot and took my buddy and I less than 30 minutes to get to Lake Toho to fish. The resort was practically empty, which was niceWhile the pool area is fantastic but the pool itself was very cold. The Hot Tub was more like a warm tub. The bar by the pool was cool and you could enjoy a cocktail while relaxing by the pool.The accommodations themselves are about as basic as it gets. We stayed in 2403. The TV's were old and all 3 in our room would have a black box pop up after about 10 minutes, kind of like closed captioning without the words, and it would stay on until you restarted the TV and let it rest. It wasn't a huge deal because we weren't in the room much and didn't have time to watch TV. We basically used it as a jump off point for a busy 4 days. The carpets were very light in color and in desperate need of carpet cleaning. There were multiple stains throughout the room. Make sure you bring just about everything you'd need outside of the basics...coffee, filters, paper towels, etc. Each room does have basics like pots, pans, dishes but lacks other essentials. There's a 7/11 and Publix close by which helps. There are mini blinds in the room but no curtains. When that Florida sun comes up, you better be ready to get up yourself! It was a bit unpleasant after a night of drinking...I don’t want this review to come off as complaining, because we left very pleased with what we got for our money. We'd definitely return to the Tuscana again. The staff was helpful and friendly, the grounds were clean, the resort was very secure...all in all it was a great stay and we enjoyed the Tuscana.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: Stayed at the Tuscana resort for 2 nights 8/9th Dec will on a business trip.The resort looks great from the outside check in was good but has to pay extra $38 for the cleaning as I was only staying 2 nights.The Condo was on the ground floor the Kitchen was very poorly stocked not even a T towel or cloth to wipe upLounge funiture was worn and shabby the plastic plants dirty and need removingBed was comfy bath room grubby.toilet flooded bahroom twice while fillingWould I stay again NO

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Great location but service could be better
column29: We stayed at the Tuscana in November and had booked 2 condo's as we were a large party.Our holiday was a package by Thomson holidays. Upon arrival to Tuscana we wer pleased with the check in procedure. Our condo was nice and clean but the patio door lock was broken and a gentle push would give you access to the condo. We complained about this and a maintenance man was sent out to fix it. After checking the door would now lock we discovered that it didn't and again a push was all you had to do to open it. We complained again and it was eventually fixed. Another problem we had was with the toaster which was dangerous due to the heating element was snapped in the middle. This meant any bread would not toast and immediately burn setting off the smoke alarm. We asked 5 times for this to be replaced and this never happend we were left with it. The location of this resort is excellent for Disney however you are limited to only a couple of restaurants nearby. The restaurant/poolside bar serves lovely food and we totally intended to use it often but on our first visit we were very disappointed with how they calculated our bill. There was a party of 10 and we all sat together there was no mention of any service charge being added to the bill, it was not displayed on the menu so we expected to be charged for the food only and make our own decision to how much tip we paid. When we each got our individual bills there was no breakdown and the total amount far exceded the cost of the food. We queried this and was told that a service charge had already been added. Then we got a frosty attitude from the staff who also said they dont normally do this then why do it to us? We paid up but we should have requested a full breakdown so we knew exactly how much the service was. This spoilt what had been a good night for us all and we never used the restaurant or bar again. So watch out if dining here we never had a problem with any other restaurant in orlando and always left a good tip of about 20%.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I just returned home from a trip to Florida with my husband & 19 month old son, and truly had a wonderful stay at Tuscana Resort. The resort was within 10 - 15 minutes drive from the theme parks but as far as I'm aware there are shuttle buses available from reception daily. Within walking distance there was a supermarket, pharmacy, gas station, a typical American restaurant, pizza restaurant, etc. The resort itself was immaculate & our apartment shocked us - as it was so large and welcoming. Its standards of cleanliness was top class and our bed was extremely comfortable. They are very well equipped: a huge (and powerful) microwave, huge oven, huge fridge-freezer, dishwasher, washing machine, tumble dryer & a TV with so many channels my husband and I found it hard to chose. There is also the option to hire DVDs from reception. There was a fee for house keeping (which is a little strange & there is also a call out fee if the toilet gets blocked from anything other than toilet paper, we also found that odd but didn't take too much notice, as we put it down to families in the past, blocking toilets with all sorts of unknown objects)There is a restaurant & bar-tavern (as its called) within the main building ran by English people, on our second day we had lunch there (recommended by a very friendly receptionist), it was very reasonably priced and extremely tasty, something to suit everyone. There is also a small convenience store (very reasonably priced, $1 for a black coffee). The pool area is very well maintained with several lounge-deck chairs, and tables and chairs with parasols for those who chose to stay in the shade. The kiddies poor has a large mushroom waterfall and is in a gated area, very safe for any child but particularly safe for curious kids like my son. Staff were so inviting & helpful from the booking stage to the end of out stay.As our holiday came to an end, I for some silly reason thought we were checking out a day later & when I returned to my apartment, the key-card would no longer work. I walked to reception to explain my situation and when they informed me that my check out day was that day I was obviously distraught with the notion of having to pack immediately and drive to our friends (3 hours away) 1 day earlier than scheduled. One of the managers met with me and told me that it was going to be absolutely no problem what so ever. I was obviously relieved and she offered me either a late check out or an additional night stay - to say the least it took the stress away!!! I just wanted to post this review, because before I booked with Tuscans I spotted one or two negative reviews which nearly turned me off the place. Let me assure you, I am a very very well travelled person, both me & my husband work for an Irish air line, meaning we travel all the time and stay in many hotels & resorts.Tuscans would rank very highly in our estimation and as soon as I arrived home, I immediately told friends and family of our wonderful experience there. We will most definitely be returning there in the future, hopefully we will bring more family the next time, as I beleive it suits all ages & I'm sure my parents would have an equally great experience. It is the perfect destination for families intending to visit the theme parks, or those planning a shopping trip to the very close by outlet centres (also excellent value for money). Please dint take any notice to the negative reviews, as I was there and experienced the resort, and I can now understand why there are so so so many positive reviews.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: Excelente lugar para pasar unas vacaciones en familia. Departamentos equipados con todo lo necesario para pasarla bien, el area de pileta y de solarium es muy buena y vistosa. Fuimos con mi familia y lo pasamos barbaro. Si volvemos a Orlando seguramente volveremos a hospedarnos en Tuscana Resort.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Have been visiting Flordia for over 20 years now and have stayed in nearly every type of accommodation you care to mention from hotel rooms to gated resorts in all the years I have to say that the Tuscana Resort in one of the best I have stayed in. I have used it for the last 3 years and stayed in different blocks no matter where you stay in these resorts you will still encounter the same problems i.e distance from the pool everyday nosies but once you get over the inital concern its fine. The resort is handy to most places however you do need a car.The staff are extremely helpful and friendly. The apartments are well kitted out and have everything you need to make your stay comfortable however you will need a trip to the Publix's supermarket at the end of the road to the resort as you will need some of the basic's like kitchen roll washing powder salt & pepper (if you use them). One thing to note is that the kitchen sink is fitted with a waste compactor so you don't through food out in the rubish you just turn on the water and put the food down the waste compactor use a spoon to push it down gently if necessary (not to far) just past the rubber cover. Switch onthe compactor, the switch is over on the far right from the sink make sure you switch off when finished compacting the waste food. (with the heat food can smell very quickly if you throw it into the dumpsters all attracts animals like racoons etc.I am only home and already looking forward to going back next year.

column29: Fuimos mi esposa y mis dos nenas, todos nos sentimos muy bien, la atención fue formidable, el departamento excelente, bien decorado, limpio, pero comprobé que si es cierto lo que habia leido que las paredes dejan transmitir mucho el sonido ya que en 3 de los 10 dias que me hospedé, el vecino de la via de arriba no se si saltaba o bailaba pero se escuchaba mucho en nuestro departamento, creo que deberian si existiera alguna solución mejorar dicho problema, o esperar tener suerte que el vecino del piso de arriba no sea muy bullicioso.Espero en un par de años volver y no dudaria en quedarme nuevamente en dicho hotel, me gusto que el balcon estaba protejido con malla, los utencilios de cocina muy bien, pero creo que deben de estarse renovando por el uso que llevan.

column27: Tuscana Resort to thumps up from me.
column29: Nice condo's. Spacious and clean. The resort it self has a nice swimmingpool, also for kids, an ok workout room, a bar where you can get a nice meal or just a cop off coffe and friendly employees. If I would come back to Orlando it will most definitely includes a stay here.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Decent resort, few things to be aware though...
column29: First, the resort doesn't provide in suite wireless, however they do have a wired cable for your computer and the speed is pretty good. So if you are driving there and have 1 more computer to hook up, make sure you bring a router. Yes, bring a wireless router here. It will help a ton! I did try to set up ad hoc network sharing but idont know why it just doesn't work.The resort area has very poor cell phone signal, especially in the rooms. My carrier is AT&T, so other companies may have better signal strength probably?The resort provide washer/dryer, but they don't provide laundry detergent. There's a publix 2min away, so you should be able to get it from there. Other than these small issue, the resort is pretty good. There is a golf course right at the back of the resort (directly in front of building 4,5,6), i am not sure which course is it but I think its from the Reunion resort course. So you can just bring your clubs and walk directly into the course (when theres nobody around!) and play 2 holes (a par4 and par3) over and over again if you want :) shhhhhh Overall, this resort is decent for the price, and it's close to Disney and various attractions. Would stay here again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I won't be staying in a hotel in the Kissimmee, Orlando area again. This condo was perfect. It was close to shopping and attractions yet off the main road which provided some additional privacy. The rooms were large and clean with a full kitchen and 2 modern baths. We used the large screened in patio every day. Having a washer and dryer in the unit was a great convenience. The pool was beautiful. However, we didn't avail of all the facilities provided at the resort such as the theater so I can't comment on any of that. The last time I stayed in this area I was in a hotel with bugs in the bed. A mini fridge and basin were the only amenities provided and it nearly cost as much as this 2 bedroom condo!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Excellent location for Orlando Attractions; Good value
column29: Tuscana Resort is in an excellent location for WDW / Universal etc as it is so close to the I4.It is close to the I4 so yes you can hear it; but it is not deafening; and if you spend most of the time in your apartment with the aircon on you wont hear it anyway.First impression of condo (3 bed 2 bath) was that it was rather fusty/fussy decor to English taste; which made it look old. But quality was fairly robust, carpets were a bit dodgy in places; tube TVs which is a bit old fashioned but worked OK. It was clean. However it smelt when you first went in - due to the air-con. Again a standard issue but once you realised that it was fine. One sofa - sat 3 at a squash, plus one chair. For a party of 5 not ideal but worse if you had more in there; sofa not very comfortable; old fashioned style over comfort.Big fridge / ice maker. Kettle and all other standard electric kitchen items. Plenty of sockets; Microwave and full oven / hob. Dishwasher - took a looooong time.Washer / Dryer combo did the job although the Dryer was not as efficient as I would have liked. Showers powerful and no water loss issues (but we were on ground floor). Bath in communal bathroom.Walls quite thin. Floors / ceilings seemed more solid.Parking plentiful, communal areas clean, excellent pool, open late. Pool towels and plenty of sunbeds and canvas cabanas. Extremely hot jacuzzi. Good food at the bar.Yes, I would go again. Significantly better than sleeping 5 to a hotel room with good communal facilities for the kids so didnt feel as isolated as in a villa. Publix and a few restaurants available at Championsgate; but 7-8 minutes to 192 up the back roads, Berry Town Centre about 15 mins the other way.It is self serve and self clean. Gated community - other than the bar staff I didnt really see anyone around apart from the odd maintenance guy.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: Somos 1 matrimonio con 2 niños de 2 y 5 años, y nos alojamos 7 noches en un departamento muy amplio con 2 dormitorios, cada uno cama matrimonial y 2 baños, es muy seguro para los niños, ya que la terraza estaba cerrada con malla protectora. Todo muy muy limpio, especialmente la alfombra. La cama un poco blanda, pero en general muy cómodo para descansar después de un día de caminata en los parques.La ubicación es excelente ya que esta muy cerca de los parques, outlet, farmacia y un muy buen supermercado a pocos minutos.-El único punto en contra que puedo hacer es sobre la piscina , cuando llegamos pasamos a conocerla y estaba "llenísima de gente" y el agua muy muy turbia........no daban ganas de probarla, pero la verdad es que no tuvimos tiempo de ir otro día.En resumen una excelente opción para alojarse, nosotros regresaríamos..................

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: We stayed at Tuscana. The carpet and bed linen was dirty. The tub was blocked. Worst of all they charge a $35 cleaning fee and do not use it towards upkeep of this place. We also requested for a crib via phone. When we checked in the attendant had no record for such a request, nor would she care to look for one to care for our baby's comfort. Also the air conditioning would not shut off and kept running all night at 65 degrees. The thermostat does not work. Do not stay at the Tuscana.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed at the Tuscana in Feb. 2011 for one week in a two-bedroom suite. After suffering horrible flight delays and only arriving around 11 p.m. I was impressed that the front-desk clerk was still there waiting just to check us in. We didn't really like the first suite that we had (bad view, some dirty carpets, and absolutely no furnishings/artwork on the wall so it looked really "naked") so after the first night we asked if we could move to a different suite. The front desk person said it wasn't a problem and we actually got to inspect two other suites and choose the one we wanted. The one we picked was wonderful (sorry I can't remember the number) and was absolutely perfect for our family of four (including two small children aged 4 and 2.) Spacious bedrooms, well-decorated bathrooms, huge eating area and screened balconies. The pool was great, although a little too chilly for my kids (I don't think they heat it) and the location is fantastic, right off the highway and a short drive to all the Disney destinations. There's also a Publix right up the street (great for young families utilizing the kitchen in the suite.) We paid about $100/night which incoporated a promotional discount for Canadian visitors. All in all, we thought Tuscana provided great value for our money.

column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Convenient and close without the high costs of a Disney hotel!
column29: We stayed at the Tuscana in Feb 2010 for almost 3 weeks on a Virgin holidays package. On a previous visit to Orlando we had a lovely villa out at Davenport Lakes, but it was just too far away from the main attractions, and although we had a pool there, it wasn't heated, so was ultimately useless to us in Feb anyway!We decided that the Tuscana would be a better option since it is all apartments, but we were concerned we'd have little room, and none of the luxuries of a villa holiday - this couldn't have been more wrong, there was plenty of space for the 4 of us (2 adults/2 kids) and it was well equipped for our needs. It's placement on the i4 means you are very close to the attractions of Seaworld/Universal etc, and equally not too far from Disney parks. The on site bar and restaurant was great for occasions where we just wanted an easy meal, or a day relaxing by the pool. Staff were great - the chef was a star, and always seemed to enjoy a chat whilst he prepared your food as you wanted it. The pub/bar part of the resort is run by an English couple who were very nice, and had some useful tips for places to go and see etc.The pool here was heated, although we seemed to have chosen one of the coldest spells in Floridian history for a holiday in 2010!!, and spent most of our time wearing hoodies and jeans rather than shorts and tees like on our previous visit at this time of year! :]The resort is located in a nice spot with lots of trees in and around the different apartment blocks, including a good few orange trees, and there is often wildlife to be seen around the site. My daughter and I were walking back from the restaurant one evening with take out, and came face to face with a Raccoon in the groundfloor hallway which opens out to the woods at the back. It was evidently investigating some trash some idiot had left outside their door (there are specific rules to place trash in the obvious trash bins in the car park to prevent this!) - we had an amusing interaction with the animal, and saw others around on various other occasions. We were told that there were Coyotes about in some parts, but we never encountered them.As much as we enjoyed the previous villa holiday, I'd have to consider somewhere like the Tuscana for a future trip to Orlando because of the convenience, comfort and amenities on site for a relatively cheap price compared with the main 'branded' resort locations.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Clean & Safe, but in Desperate need of Upgrading
column29: My family and I own multiple timeshares and we travel at least one or two weekends a month, including long vacations during holidays, spring break, and summer vacation. We stayed at the Tuscana Resort for a baseball tournament we were playing in Orlando. Though the room was very large -- and very clean -- it was in desperate need of Upgrading.First of all, both bedrooms contained "full size" beds -- not even Queens -- we rarely stay any place without a King bed in at least the Master Bedroom. Second, no WIFI in the rooms, which made it difficult for me to take care of business as needed. There were no ceiling fans in the bedrooms -- another amenity that is almost 100% guaranteed in any resort in Florida these days. All rooms had T.V.'s but no flat screens. Entire condo (except kitchen and bathrooms) was old, worn out carpet -- clean but old and worn out. Our coffee pot didn't work. The condo advertised it slept six -- but only if you are ok with 2 each in "full size" beds and 2 in a sleeper sofa that was even smaller than the beds. The family room only held about three people comfortably (very very small). Finally, the walls are so thin, I could hear the T.V. in the room next to us, and it sounded like the people above us were about to come through the ceiling!The staff was very very nice. The location and surrounding area were wonderful. And the Pool area was nice, big, and clean -- the kids spent all three days in the pool and loved it. The only reason I can only give an Average rating is because, based on my experiences, the amenities in the condos just don't measure up to "very good" or "excellent."

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We rented a 3 bedroom that was very clean, it was all the way by the woods and not close to the pool which was o.k. because we didn't have small children. Bring everything with you! There is no starter coffee pack or filters or paper towels and only one roll of toilet paper so make sure you bring a spare! The TV's are old and one of them didn't work. The phone only worked if you didn't move your body at all. It was hard communicating with the reception desk and the door didn't lock which took a couple hours to fix. So make sure you have plenty of time to get situated before starting off on your Disney adventure! Oh one more thing, if you are in building 9, there is a dog that barks all the time!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed at the Tuscana from the beginning of October, 2011 for a ten day duration with three children. It was a fantastic holiday from start to finish and the Tuscana was perfect as a base to get to all of the attractions. You are less than 30 minutes away from most of the Parks but a respectable distance away to feel you have some rest time from all the activities happening in Florida.The Tuscana are seperate condos - we were in room 4107 - and these condos are spacious and clean and have all the mod cons. Towels were provided. There was a washing machine & dryer tidied away in a cupboard within the condo which meant washing/drying could all be done before we returned home. That in itself lightens the load when you none of that to do on return from holiday!The pool there was a good size. I went for a swim every morning at 8 a.m. and had it to myself. Bliss & suprisingly warm, even at that time. The children had a swim most days on return from seeing all the Disney shows/attractions and it wasn't too deep.  The Tuscana is minutes away from a 24/7 & a Publix supermarket, Subway, a Mc Donalds & one of the pizza eateries which we never visited. Everything is quick, convenient and easy to get to.The Tuscana was the icing on the cake on this holiday. It was peaceful, pretty, clean and the staff were very pleasant and co-operative. The location couldn't have been better and we know this resort suited us much more than any of the Disney themed hotels. You can have TOO much of Mickey and his mates....Thanks for a brilliant stay. We have already recommended you to others as a holiday base and we will book here if/when we return when the children are a bit older.Great holiday and it softened the blow of turning 40yrs old while we there ;-)

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I travelled with my husband /sister of 16 an in laws - all of which are clean freaks and very particular so I was nervous about where we were going as I booked the resort.The entrance and the resort itself is really pretty and very clean.Really though the condo had the wow factor. I emailed the resort beforehand and requested a quiet condo away from the road so we were put in condo 9, and recd room 9408. It was huge in size, spotlessly clean and extremely quiet. There are three double bedrooms in this room, two bathrooms a livingroom, dining room and kitchen. The facilities are fantastic and in fact we all felt glum leaving the condo knowing we were going back home to much smaller homes and facilities...When we arrived we were offered to pay either $300 deposit which would get back on check out or pay $39 fee so you wouldn't have to wait for your deposit back so we paid the $39. This was a small price to pay for the extremely clean condo we received.The pool area is lovely and clean and we saw the pool getting cleaned regularly. It was never busy when we were their as I think mostly families travel here and spend their days at the park.I have one small problem overall. The bar and restaurant are not owned by Tuscana, they are owned by an English couple. the husband of which I found quite hostile and unfriendly. i am 27 and I was regularly asked for ID despite ordering drinks their daily. We were unaware that in Florida for food/drink orders at the table you must tip at least 18%. Well we are from Scotland and so a 10% tip is generous, so we tipped 10% even although the staff did no extra work for this, we got the drinks ourselves and she had no smile on her face but we thought we would tip to be fair anyway, however the waitress came over and asked us for more money, we were all in shock and decided to not eat their again.We travelled a lot within our two weeks stay, there really is not a lot of places to go locally, you have a supermarket, pharmacy and a chilis (which was great and cheap). We shopped and cooked a lot in the condo.Check out was a breeze, we simply handed in the five towels we hired when we arrived and handed back the room keys.Would return in a heartbeat.

column29: We stayed here for our main summer holiday booked through First Choice. The location and resort were first class and I would recommend this resort to anyone with the parks in mind. Very close to all the theme parks and eay access to the I4.The only downside was the attitude of the reception staff who could benefit from some serious training. Either they are so understaffed, poorly motivated, or so busy which came access in the way they spoke. That aside we would still go back.
