column29: When I first checked in to the resort I was charged a cleaning fee which at first was no big deal. Later when I seen the condo i was VERY UPSET.. The room smelled like smoke and dog pee. I asked one of the housekeepers and they told me that dogs are allowed to stay inside any of their units. Besides that i found a large blood stain on one of our beds and alot of hair on the twin bed. After i inspected my unit i found a condom and empty beer bottle behind furniture. The day before check-out I had a 10yr old lil mexican boy open my door and walk in on my family and I, he stated that he cleans with his mom and other 13yr old sister and that he will come back tommorrow at 11am for check-out. I was very amazed how on the day of checkout I seen many cars full of SMALL kids and women cleaning other condos nextdoor to us. Maybe thats why my room was not clean, kids cleaned it! I asked for a refund or I would post my expeirance on trip advisory, so here it is. And of course NO REFUND!!!

column29: I spent 10 days in Tuscana on my honeymoon (06/09/11 - 16/09/11, I have to say the Condo was immaculate -clean, fresh linen in both bathrooms, well equipped and quiet. the pool area is amazing well landscaped and the pool is clean, there is also a thermal jacuzzi/spa which is great to unwind in after a long day in the many theme parks within easy reach of this resort (2 exits from Disney on the I4 and less than 20 mins to International Drive). I have no problems in recommending Tuscana to anyone and I have visited Florida three times now and this was one of the best places we have stayed.

column27: AVOID - we suspect the staff are thieves!!
column29: I am absolutely serious when I say I believe that £600 was robbed from us while staying at this resort. The cash went missing from our room. We reported it and were fobbed off. Think about that. The manager does not care there could be a thief working there. Do you want to go to a place like that? DO NOT STAY THERE, it's that simple. We had the misfortune to stay there from the 18th Aug to the 1st Sept. After a dreadful drive from Sanford airport at the equivilant of 1 in the morning, we arrived. This trip was only supposed to take 45 minutes but actually took 2 hours because the place is in the middle of nowhere. We were told at reception we were in a block right at the back. It took us an hour to find it. No-one thought to take us. I thought America was the customer service capital of the world.However it was when we left that things went worse. We realised when we got home that we did not have the remainder of our spending money in our luggage. We of course rang the Tuscana and asked if had been handed in. It had! We repeatedly asked 'Is it definately there? An envelope containing lots of Engish money?'. They said 'Yes'. The Tuscana have even provided us with a letter stating this for insurance purposes. However we wanted it returned. It was then that everyone at the Tuscana denied knowledge of it existing. Even though they said it did in the letter. They are either incompetant or thieves or both.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column27: " What a great place to stay!"
column29: After a jam packed day at a theme park, what you need is to come back to a nice, secure, friendly atmosphere, very clean environment, place. That's what you get with this resort. Me and my family have just returned from Florida where we stayed at the Tuscana resort with me, my sister and five children between us includng a baby. I am a very fussy person for hygiene so I was very impressed when I placed my key in the door and was presented with a very spotless condo. Despite other reviews about this place being very dirty we found that this was not the case and this was not just in our condo we found the whole place from the pool, to the restaurant, to the toilets to be of a very high standard. The condo itself was very well equipped with all mod cons in fantastic condition, it was very spacious and had a television in every room which is great when you have as many children as we had. We found that the location was in great proximity to Disney, Publix, Outlets with the furthest park being Universal but still not that far away and if you don't want to drive to Disney then they have a free shuttle service that is from 9 thru to a 5pm pick up. This wonderful service is provided by the lovely Issac, who drives the nicely decorated and A/C'd minibus, which meant that we didin't have the hassle of driving ourselves and you save the $14 parking fee. We also encountered other wonderful people during our stay like, Karen at the front desk who could have not been more helpful with all things Orlando and Tuscana related, aswell as Jenny at the restaurant who was just so helpful and accomodating. Also to all the other staff who we can't mention by name as we didn't know it but who were also friendly, helpful and polite. We had 2 maintenence issues when we were there to do with the condo and they were dealt with very promptly with a nice note left behind. My children were also always safe enough to use the pool by themselves and walk around safely aswell as enjoying the lovely range of wildlife that we saw. I would definately reccommend Tuscana to others and would say to the sceptical ones out there to not believe in everything you read as Tuscana is a wonderful quiet and peaceful resort in a good location ( which is amazing as it is very close to the I4 expressway) and we would definately go back and I have started to tell friends about it already. Thank You! for adding to our Orlando experience.xx

column29: My family and I stayed here after leaving another hotel due to being dissatisfied with it. The Tuscana was perfect - rooms were clean, staff was friendly, the pool was great and the gym was good. We were at Disney for my nephew's 3rd birthday and had a 3-bed at the Tuscana - it was very spacious and afforded us the opportunity to throw his birthday party there. We ordered the cake at the nearby Publix, bought birthday supplies at a Wal-Mart about 20 minutes away and threw my nephew a 3rd birthday party that we will all remember.The drinks by the pool were great and so was the food at the pool side bar. I also felt secure at the property as staff constantly drove around to monitor the place and it was gated.Very nice!

column29: we have just come home from the resort and i would recommend it to anyone no matter what your age.my husband is disabled and we were given a ground level apartment with a walk in shower.the apartment was excellent,well equipped and there was plenty to do.this was an ideal base for us,it was only 20 mins to universal and 10 mins to the main part of the 192. if you have never been to florida before,i would highly recommend the tuscana and get a sat nav,its great.it avoids all the toll roads so you get to see parts of florida you probably wouldnt see otherwise.we saw christmas on the way to nasa.

column29: Have been to Orlando many times staying in both Disney and Universal Hotels, but if you want to get away from all the commercialism of the resort Hotels then Tuscana resort is ideally located provided you have a rental car. Far enough away to be a little haven of tranquillity, yet only a 15 minute drive from all the fun of Disney, Seaworld etc. Situated in Championsgate it is a quiet location but only a few minutes away from some convenience stores and a gas station. The appartments are ideal for families with either two or three bedrooms on offer. On arrival we were upgraded to a three bedroom appartment at no additional cost. Everything was spotlessly clean and it was great to be able to spread out (which you can't do in an Hotel) and watch television after a long hard day at the attractions or just chill out. There is a nice pool on site and a restaurant where you can get a very reasonably priced and enjoyable meal. And the beauty of it all is the price to stay at the resort - compared to most of the Hotels closer to Disney in Orlando, it is a real bargain. We would definitely have no hesitation in returning to The Tuscana Resort the next time we go on vacation.

column27: Fantastic Resort and Location, and would definitely go back.
column29: Family of seven from Glasgow, United Kingdom.We just got back from The Tuscana Resort, Champions Gate, in Davenport, Florida, today: 13th.July.2011. The Tuscana is an excellent place to stay whilst being on holiday in central Florida. We had a three bedroom Condo as there were seven of us; six adults and a two year old child. The Condo was very spacious with everything you need, first room had a double bed was very spacious and had en-suite bathroom, second room had a double bed and was also very spacious, third room had two single beds and again very spacious, all rooms had plenty of room for storeage, e.g. cupboards, drawers, hangers etc. As well as the room with the en-suite bathroom there was another bathroom with a bath and shower plus basin and WC. The Condo also had a washing machine and dryer, microwave, cooker, sink, plenty of dishes and glasses. There is a table in the livingroom area with six chairs around it. There is a TV set in the livingroom with a DVD player and a TV in each of the bedrooms. There is also an iron and ironing board and a hair dryer. We were on the fourth floor of building number two (we requested that room and building a couple of months before arriving and they managed to accommodate our request) there is a lift in each building and although the Resort was full during our stay we never once waited any length of time for the lift. There is a small gym at the Resort which we used a couple of times, there are a couple of excersise bikes, three treadmills, a couple of cross-trainers and an all purpose resistance machine, the gym has a couple of TVs for you to watch while you train and a cold water dispenser. There is a small movie theatre in resort which to be honest we didn't see, (too much to do in Florida rather than sit in a movie theatre) there is a small shop on site, the pool area is beautiful with a lovely hot jaccuzi aside from the main pool, there are small private Cabanas around the pool. We didn't have to deal with the reception much, but anyone we spoke with was very pleasant and helpful, because there were seven of us we felt we may not have enough towels, we mentioned this to reception and they arranged for us to have some more. We didn't use the on-site restaurant, so can't comment on that. In the Championes Gate area there are some handy shops and eateries near the Tuscana, Chillis and McDonalds, a Walgreens chemist a Publix Supermarket and a Garage selling fuel. Any complaint or moan that you may read or hear about this Resort is, in my/our opinion unjust, I had read some reports about noise coming from the clubhouse and other negative things were said, yes there is a karaoke in the clubhouse, but once inside your Condo you can't hear any noise, my two year old grand-daughter is a light sleeper and she wasn't disturbed by anything, so don't let that put you off. All that said and done, we do have one complaint which is a very small issue and was dealt with by reception staff as soon as approached; the key card to access the Condo sometimes didn't work right away, but once reception staff re-programmed the cards it was fine. All in all, a fantastic place to be/stay, only problem to me was, although staying for two weeks,it wasn't long enough. Go and enjoy......

column29: This the third time staying at this resort. One of the newer perks on the property is a General Store. This is a wonderful place to buy any items which may have been forgotten when packing for your trip. It was so convenient to have the store available. We didn't have to leave the property if something was needed immediately. The staff, food, rooms, and pool areas were as great as our other visits to this resort. Tuscana's location is another reason to stay; it is very close to all the parks and the rental units almost feel like home after a long day of exploring the nearby theme parks.

column29: My family and I arrived on a Monday. My daughter and her husband found what look like a tick on her bed that night. Tuesday morning the resorts regular quarterly bed bug check was conducted. There was not information about this; the pest inspection said that a letter was supposed to be sent. He and his dog didn't find any bugs until I mentioned about the tick looking bug. He then goes back into my daughters room and finds bed bugs behind the headboard of the bed. He tells us we have to move and get clothes for 2 days and come back then. First I must run the clothes and stuff I take out of the room through one complete cycle of the dryer. I go to talk to Management, Robert Jimenez, General Manager. He assured me that they would work on a plan for my family. We were told we could only take a couple of days of clothing and they would assist us in moving to another room. We would be there for 2 days and then move back. Jimenez said that whatever the pest control guy said that would be what they would do. I am thinking who is in charge.  I went back to our room #5307 and waited. Someone from house keeping met me at my room and brought me my keys. I asked where our new room was she said, "in the next tower." I asked is it in this building? Very hateful saying, "the next tower!" then she left. We had to run our 2 days of clothes through the dryer and move ourselves and find the next room. I went and talked to Mr Jimenez once again, he apologized for his house keeper and stated this is all new to the resort this has never happened before. He said they are planning on comping me 2 days but he would get back with me to discuss what the resort was going to do. Friday came and time for us to move back in and get the rest of our stuff. I go back to the room #5307 and talk with the pest people and they tell us we can't move back into this room. I asked about all of our stuff and the pest control stated that everything had to be treated again. I told them that I am on vacation and I could not sped the day playing this game. House keeping said they would bring it to our room when it was all completed. Not happy but I said Ok. I came back that afternoon and had to go find our stuff. I went to the office to talk to them and no information about our situation was passed down. I told the young woman at the desk to call Mr. Jimenez That I wanted to talk to him. She said that she would and he never has tried to get back in touch with me since.I understand that things happen but due to poor management and leadership made a bad trip terrible. I lost a few hundred dollars in food and lots of time that cant be replaced for me and my family at the parks. This was my son-in-laws first trip to Florida and a bad one.

column29: Tuscana is brilliant, as long as you have a car. I've been to Florida loads of times and have yet to find a resort that offers accommodation to this standard, with such great access to the parks at the price you get at Tuscana. Highly recommended.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column27: Out of this world, more than we ever expected!
column29: Just got back from Tuscana resort was better than we ever expected after reading some of the reviews I was a little concerned. But when you get there the accomadation we had a 3 bed condos was spacious & clean & tidy. Staff very polite & helpful restuarant & bar staff lovely made the holiday for us. Food was very nice & well priced for what you get. We would definately come back here its very easy to get to all the parks & nice not to be on Disney door step too. It feels like your away from the hussle of that side of things & you can still have a holiday chilling out by the pool.

column29: Este es la segunda vez que nos alojamos en Tuscana. Que decir de este maravilloso lugar, es increíble, algo insuperable, todo de 10 desde el lugar la pileta la gente la atención la ubicación y el precio. Pienso volver a Disney y juro que voy a volver a Tuscana porque es un lugar donde realmente no gustaría vivir de lo lindo que es. El barrio se llama Champions Gates y está excelente super prolijo, creo que ahí es donde vimos el Mcdonlds más lindo y prolijo de Florida.Quiero destacar la Buena onda de Erika Totorica del Tuscana Resort a la que le hice miles de consultas y siempre me ha asesorado con la mejor de las predisposiciones.

column27: Love the place!!! Will be back next year!!
column29: We have been visiting Orlando since 1988 and Tuscana is by far the best place we have stayed at. We have returned here every year for the last four years because we love the place. We have a young family and this place is perfect and a great base for all the attractions. Would recommend to anyone!!Simon - Sutton Coldfield UK
column59: The Royal Town of Sutton Coldfield, United Kingdom

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Excellent choice for families near Disney World
column29: Our family stayed at Tuscana for seven nights in June. I discovered the resort after getting a 2 bed/2 bath condo there for $71 a night on Last Minute Travel's website. Not only was it a great price, but the resort definitely met my expectations. I am a budget-conscious traveler who appreciates the finer things at a discount, and Tuscana fit the bill for me. The room was very spacious and tastefully decorated. Our kids loved the pool, and I felt it was very nicely designed. The location is fantastic. You're only 15 minutes from Disney World, and there's no traffic to fight. The resort has an on-site restaurant, which to my surprise was very good. My only complaint is that the insulation between floors is very thin. We had a herd of buffalo staying above us and could hear every move they made. I would request a room on the top floor if you plan to stay here. I'd also like to pass along a suggestion to update the restaurant menu that was placed in our room. It was not current...in fact, it was three years old. We loved our stay at Tuscana and will definitely return!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Marvelous stay, friendly staff at the Tavern, Beautiful Pool area
column29: We stayed at this resort my wife, daughter and her boyfriend from May 17 to May 27/2011 as referred by CAA the Canadian version of triple AAA for a family vacation which included Disneyworld and Universal Theme Parks. The resort grounds are beautifully maintained and the condos are large and spacious. My only complaint in this regard, would be that the Resort Management update the T.V.s to flat screen versions as the ones included in the condos are old and outdated including some of the carpeting which had a stain outside the bathroom hallway. Also I would replace or update the couches and chairs in the living room as there was only comfortable seating for 3 and we were 4 people. Otherwise our stay was marvelous and very relaxing. Pool area is large and has that resort feel and look. It was great. Close to the interstate 4 to travel to Orlando and the Theme Parks 20 minutes maximum and groceries and pharmacy were close by 5 minutes from resort as well as restaurants. Tip: stay away during Memorial Weekend as place is packed, pool crowded with kids and noisy in condo hallways at night. Otherwise we will be back.Brian & Yvette, Ottawa, Ontario CANADA

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We the family of 5 stayed for 5 nights. in building 7 room 7201. I stayed in a 3 bedroom for 8 people. There was only 4 towels. The main shower was missing the handle. The sliding glass door lock was broken as well. The master bathroom ALWAYS SMELLED. The nasty Poop septic tank smell always was there I had to keep the bathroom door closed for 5 days just to breathe non smelly air. This place is gross & dirty, the Carpet stinks riddled with stains. Front desk is ONLY nice when you check in, "She" the only person you will deal with will act as though it's a problem if you even ask a question. God help you when you ask for your pool towels. The place is Dirty, seriously there was a old burnt bagel that sat by the elevator for 3 days. A rat most likely took it as for you never see anybody cleaning anything. The main room or lobby area is filled with stuff, papers, boxes, a bunch of trash. the hallway is roped off with a dirty red rope. There is also pets on the property I saw 3 dogs while staying there being walked and pooping in the grass. the poop was just left there for you to step in !! GROSS ...NO WI-FI you can not get a cell phone signal in the room. Bring toilet paper cause you only get 1 roll and they will not give you more..( I didn't ask). Bring good walking shoes When you take out the trash you will need to walk a very very far distance to the trash dumpster. I have been to orlando over 50 times NEVER have I stayed in such a place where I couldn't wait to check out.. Good luck to you if your staying here... I will never be back !!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

The pool area was always very clean we loved the movie room great for the kids, it was good to catch up with emails etc in the room which has a couple of computers, even printed off our return boarding pass.Great restaurant walking distance with tasty food and very welcoming atomsphere, also shops close by.All in all accomadation, weather the views of the golf course were stuning,

column29: Estuvimos alojados en Mayo del 2011, el departamento era excelente , muy comodo , con todo lo necesario para la familia , muy cerca a los parques y a supermercados y restaurantes , llegamos dias antes de nuestra reservacion y nos pudieron acomodar perfectamente a pesar de llegar tarde y sin avisar , fueron muy amables con nosotros y nos brindaron todas las facilidades para alojarnos, sin duda regresaremos en nuestro proximo viaje a Orlando , muy recomendable para familias con niños ,la zona es muy tranquila.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. Rooms are spacious and clean. Found all staff friendly and helpful. Food and drink in poolside bar is very good and reasonably priced. Definitely one of the most relaxing places to stay in and is in close proximity to all of your needs for a holiday in Orlando (theme parks, Golf courses, shopping etc.). Pool area is spacious and clean and well stocked wit sun loungers. Definitely recommend this place to anybody.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Stayed at the Tuscana Resort last year and despite some issues we enjoyed our stay. The major issue which concerned us regarded people Smoking in and around the pool area and not in the designated area provided . The Management assured us this would be addressed but upon our return it appears ' Lip Service' was paid but absolutely nothing has been done.The pool and surrounding areas were dirty, no pride taken in general housekeeping and on one morning i managed to count 30 plus cigarette ends dumped around the Spa and pool area. If these problems were addressed the Tuscana Resort would tick the boxes but sadly i feel this will not be the case.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms

column29: Just returned from a family vacation in Orlando. The location of the resort was great for our needs....parks are a short drive, grocery store, 7-11 and Chili's right outside the property. Easy access to the freeway. Grounds are well-kept. Interior of condo. rather clean and good size. This is not a five-star resort, though (and it's not billed as such). The little staff that you encounter are mostly friendly. Tavern staff quite helpful. For the price, we'd return.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: You Get What You Pay For
column29: This resort has a number of pros and cons, as does many resorts, but after staying at some really nice resorts in Orlando over the past few years - I have to say I am quite disappointed as my expectations were quite high for this resort. The pro's of this resortHandy for Disney - 15 - 20 minutes to Magic Kingdom with no traffic at anytime of day.Pool Area - During the day it was quite nice and clean.Gardens and Building Exterior - Well maintained.The con's of this resortReceptionist - On check in was quite rude (short), which after 9 hours of travelling is not really what you want. Rooms - The rooms are nice, but you can tell they have be well used, again compared to other resorts in Orlando I feel let down.Noise - You can hear every noise that the room above and below makes, Imagine living in a room below a heard of elephants, seriously we heard booming footsteps from above until 1am and then starting again at 7am most days/nights.The rubbish pickup truck comes at 4am and sounds like being on an F1 track.Out of Hours Service - When the reception shuts, you are diverted through to an answering service who gave the impression of not being bothered, we rang up one night to complain about the noise and we were told "Don't worry we will contact them immediately" Rang back 30 minutes later to be told it will be done in a minute and they asked for our telephone number which isn't listed on the phone or in the house file, we then asked how they would contact the room above if they dont know the room phone numbers and the person on the end of the phone got quite rude and ended the call. So we had to put up with continuous noise from the joined apartments for 2 weeks. Pool area - Used the bar on evening and got bit to hell, we now call this mosquito alleyAs the title says you only get what you pay for, if you want a 2** budget holiday then this is for you If you are looking for anything above that rating try Vista Cay or Sheraton Vistana, you pay a bit more but it's well worth it.  In future I will not be returning to the Tuscana or recommending it,

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: This started out as a nice place to stay. I have never been to Orlando, but this place has soured my entire view of the area. We checked in and it seemed okay. I put my electronic key in the door and it didn't work. I went to the front desk and it took over thirty minutes to get someone there to help us. We were standing outside for more than thirty minutes in 95 degree heat with a three month old. The inside appeared okay at first. The carpet had absolutely disgusting stains on it as well as a few bugs. The bugs were not big, but it is still the principle. We were traveling with a three month old and they said they were going to put a pack & play in our room. On multiple occasions I went to the office to ask about it and I kept getting excuses why it was not there or I was told a couple of times it was on the way. We were eventually called FIVE hours later and told they didn't have one and they would have one there in the morning. It would have nice to know before ten o'clock when all the stores were closing or closed. The bathtub had a foot of water in it and the first thing you see when you pull in is a broken down Colwell Banker truck with a flat tire doing their advertisements. The entire complex was filthy and I would not suggest renting from this facility. They were very deceptive on many matters and they claim to be close to the Orlando area. It is probably at least a twenty minute highway drive to anywhere. Had I known I would have looked for a condo on International Avenue (Close to everything). I have attached pictures to show how filthy this place is. In the front office I talked to the "Head of House Keeping" who told me all of the problems were on someone else and had only more excuses for the bugs and not ever bringing the pack & play they promised for my three month old son. She simply wanted to say "have a nice day" in a sarcastic manner. YOU WOULD BE A FOOL TO RENT FROM THIS PLACE. Pictures are very deceiving so I am posting some real pictures. The massage therapist who is at the pool got excellent reviews from my wife and mother-in-law though. She has no affiliation with the actual facility though. I also forgot to mention there were holes in our doors. This is just a cheap awful place to stay.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Just had the best holiday ever, Tuscana certainly played its part.We were a party of 5, in a 3 bedded apartment, very spacious, both bathrooms large & a great shower. Beds were so, so comfortable just what you needed after a busy, long hot day at the parks. Magic Kingdom car park only 20 mins away, so location for us is again perfect, peace and quiet, Publixs, chilis (great food !!) & a petrol station around the corner. The pool area again is just right, pool side bar that did great food & atmosphere , we used the pool more times than we thought, it was great after a long day . Reception staff knowledgable & helpful,We can't wait to come back !!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: On the whole very enjoyable but with some very minor observations
column29: Having read the reviews below I can confirm the following:1. The pool area is currently beseiged by mating flys. They don't bite but are annoying. I assume this is seasonal and seemed to vary day on day, hour by hour.2. The carpets in our appartment were bleach stained but clean. I noticed new carpets going in around the complex so assume the manangement are onto it.3. There is no inventory for the items in the appartment which means you have no idea what you should have nor does the management know whats been damaged or lost.4. Despite the previous management response regarding the tavern staff tying their hair back. I can confirm femaile staff are still not tying back their hair when serving food. The foods great though especially the hand cooked crisps and wings.5. Some reception staff could be less than helpful at times. Think New York attitude and add some. Seemed more interested in answering the 'phone than finishing a conversation.6. The spar service is hit and miss. Tried on several occasions to get a manacure and finally gave up. When someone was in attendance it was the wrong person; however she said she'd make an appointment for one hours time. After having her lunch she shut up shop and left without confirming what was happening despite us only sitting 5 yards away.7. Condos are huge and well equipment apart from limited space in the lounge area for more than 4 people at any one time and no tea towels provided which should be standard.8. Close to the 192, Orlando and Disney. Distance is relative, the same jouney in the UK would take for ever but not in Florida.9. Great access to I4.10. Neaby Publix has everything you need and is cheap.11. Nearby Chillis is good.All the above comments are minor and on the whole this is a great place and we hope to go back. I certainly would recommend to others. Thank you Tuscana Resort for a great stay.

Not dirty as has been mentioned here. Spacious, room for two pre-teen boys 1 teen girl and 2 adults. Everyon had own TV, nice quiet balcony with screen for evening coffee. Lovely pool.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Perfect Resort Location! Just minutes from all the parks!
column29: We stayed at Tuscana Resort and found it to be superb in that it is close to Disney World, Sea World and Universal Studios. The 6 person unit was clean with generous amounts of room in a villa setting having pretty much everything that we needed in the unit. We have stayed in Orlando before in 1998 & 2002 and found that this was the best resort we have stayed in while visiting. Our children loved the pools when we came back from a day of seeing the theme parks. The staff & housekeeping were very polite and eager to care for us. Everything was close by for groceries & outlet shopping. Busch Gardens, Kennedy Space Center, and Daytona Beach were all great for day trips. We will surely stay here again as this resort offers excellent high quality amenities for a great value for an amazing price. I found the 4 day 3 night Disney package on Orlandoparkvacation. I have stayed at some top quality hotels and resorts and this definitely rank right up there with the best. My kids and wife love that it is a secure community giving it a comfortable worry free experience. They did leave the light on by the entrance of the villa for security and safety as it is dark with all the trees on the property. Everything inside the unit was clean and well maintained. The grounds are well landscaped with a lagoon tennis basketball courts BBQ facilities and exercise equipment. I have absolutely no problem recommending this place to anyone looking for a great vacation experience at a price that cannot be beat.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed at the Tuscana Resort for 14 nights over the Easter break, The apartments were very clean, spacious, had a fully fitted kitchen with all appliances. The pool and area was spotless, lovely pool and jacuzzi. The poolside bar had lovely staff, very helpfull all of them. The food was gorgeous, we ate there a number of nights and couldnt fault it, chicken ribs are a must!! Overall I would defianltey recommend Tuscana, and hopefully we will back soon!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column27: Departamentos muy espaciosos y muy bien equipados.
column29: El complejo es muy lindo y cuidado. Los departamentos son grandes y muy bien equipados. Ideales para tener autonomía y no depender de nadie. La cocina esta equipada con heladera, microondas, lavaplatos, tostadora, horno, lava y secarropas. Los cuartos son grandes y cómodos. Los vestidores grandes y los baños muy cómodos. Esta a 20 a 30 minutos de los parques y de los shoppings. Muy apropiado si se esta en auto.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: All staff very friendly.Great to see the pool area and grounds well looked after by attentive staff.Condo, good size; hired a 2 Bed - Great for family (kids had own room).Excellent golf very close by.Would recommend to friends.Great Job!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Great if on a tight budget and don't require a lot of sleep
column29: When we first arrived we were surprised at the spaciousness of the suite. There was plenty of room to move around but like others have said the carpets were stained and really need to be replaced. The dining room chairs could use a good cleaning or have them recovered due to stains. The living room does lack furniture. It has one small sofa and a chair. Our daughter would only sit in the middle on the sofa as she said the rest of it was uncomfortable. I ended sitting in the chair if I even bothered to sit in the living room as the rest of the family sat on the sofa. The kitchen was nice. We did have to ask 3 times to get a frying pan though as all we had was 3 pots to cook in. There were no small coffee spoons in the cutlery tray -- only dessert spoons which barely fit into the single serve yogurt cups. Also, there are no pot holders/oven mitts for taking baking trays out of the oven. Also there was only 1 stained dish towel and no dishcloth for doing dishes. Liquid dish soap is supplied but only 1 small package of dishwasher soap.The pillows are not very comfortable to sleep on. They are thick foam about 2-3" thick. The bed sheet barely covers the bed so if you sleep on or near the edge, don't expect to have any covers. The blinds do not darken the room so the outside lights keep the room "light". I don't think there is any kind of sound proofing at all. The tenants above us sounded like a "herd of elephants" when they come home every night waking all of us up. We called the front desk and asked if we could change rooms due to the noise but as they were fully booked they said they would place a courtesy call asking them to try and be quiet. That only lasted only 1 day. The third day of our stay they did their laundry at 11pm & I could have swore that I was sleeping in their laundry room it was so loud. The next day they started vacuuming at 7am. Our last night their, there were people screaming and yelling outside until 1:30am. In the 5 nights their I was lucky if I got a total of 15 hours sleep.As for being close to Disney World it is not. It is still a 30 minute drive from the resort to Magic Kingdom. If you don't have a car you are not within walking distance of very much.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: It's our second time here, and it just kept getting better and better!
column29: This is our second time staying here. From our first experience, we just had to come back! The staff are very friendly and extremely helpful. Plus, the room was very cozy and had a great view of the golf course. The poolside area is like out of a magazine - picture perfect! In addition, the location of this resort is absolutely perfect. I have no idea how they managed to place such a perfect place minutes away from some of Orlando's greatest attraction. I would most definitely recommend Tuscana to everyone!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We arrived at Tuscana to find out our Condo was cancelled on us they told us our Tour operator cancelled as it had not been paid for, lucky for us i had receipts with me and they quickly re arranged room for us. When we entered our room we were appalled to see the state of the carpets they were covered in stains along with the dining room chairs which were filthy. The beds and bathrooms were clean so we just made sure we didnt walk barefoot on carpets. This resort was very far from parks and shops so we ended up spending a long time in the car travelling to these places. We have been to orlando 3 times and would not stay here again. Pool area was very nice with comfy sun loungers. We didnt eat in the resort as the lady that served food never had her hair tied up and her hair was all over the trays of food she was carrying which was disgusting. I hope you find this review helpful.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Jenny at the bar was awesome! She made our stay the best! The accommodations were average but the price was right. The part that made us love the resort though was the service at the bar. Jenny was awesome. She loved our kids and knew exactly what we wanted better than we did! Thanks Jenny!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: If you want clean apartments don't book here
column29: I agree totally with the comment earlier. We arrived in the evening and were given our keys to our apartment. It was fithy. The carpets were dirty, the bedding was dirty. We went straight back to the reception and were told that they could "Spot clean" the carpets the day after !!!. We refused to stay in that condo and after a lot of huffing and puffing were allocated another one. This was marginally better, but there were holes in the doors/walls, The carpets were still dirty (although not as bad) The screen around the terrace was filthy. The chairs and settee were dirty. However the bedding was clean but we had to wash all the towels before using them as they were stained...... The pool area was nice and the snack bar/bar staff were friendly. We have stayed in Florida approx 10 times now in hotels and villas and this is by far the worst place we have stayed. I think if you had never been to florida before you would think this was OK, but whilst the buildings and common areas are clean and nice the cleanliness of the apartments and quality of the fitings need upgrading.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column27: Awesome place to stay! Our family loved it! Beautiful pool and grounds!
column29: This is an awesome place to stay. Highly recommend it! Pool is beautiful and grounds are well kept. Quiet, clean, no problems at all! Staff was friendly! Favorite place to stay and we are going back again next year!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed at Tuscana Resort for 2 months and will never stay there again. The carpets are filthy, filthy dirty. The living room furniture consists of a 2-seater sofa and one tiny, uncomfortable filthy dirty chair. Dining room furniture was filthy as well. They allow animals so we listened to dogs barking outside all night long. They advertise this property as a "gated community" which is just a joke; there is no one on staff after say 11 p.m. until morning so if you have any issues, no one could get there for at least a half hour. We had a problem one morning with water pouring in through the ceiling vent of the master bath, called the front desk, only to get an answering service who asked for our address and wanted to know, after we explained that water was pouring in through the vent, if this was an emergency or if it could wait until someone came in. (Someone overflowed the toilet above us....thank goodness we were there at the time or it would have been an even bigger mess). We were never to happy to pack our bags and get out of there. If you like a clean place to sleep, you want to look somewhere else. We have been renting in the Orlando area for 4 years now and this was our worst experience by far. It does have a nice pool area and snack bar; however, be very careful if you order a drink and it spills accidentally because the male bartender will definitely let you know he is not going to refill your glass; it was your fault that when you slid your glass across their counter, it had a ridge in it which tipped it over!! Never have we seen such poor service!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: We had a 2 BDR 2BTH. It was huge! Full kitchen, dining area, living room, good size rooms and bathrooms. It was very clean and updated. *Gated community*. It seems to be in a newer area so its not busy like downtown. There is a grocery store, couple gas stations, subway, few small places like that. Its past Disney, no traffic, easy drive. But is only 10 minutes to downtown or Disney. (We were here for Disney World)The pool and hot tub were very nice and clean. Had a bar and served food at the pool. Parking was great. Not busy. I cant believe how cheap these rooms are! I wont stay any where else. Cant beat it.

Nice excerise room, It's a wonderfull place to stay and relax. I visit as much as I can when we arrive we are welcomed and we fill right at home but better. It's in a great location not far from down town Orlando. I would highly recommend this Resort. Rooms have everything you need to fit you stay. Sincerly, Amanda

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: This Vacation Resort was much more than we expected. The grounds were very clean and well-kept. The reception staff were very friendly and helpfull at all time. Our room was clean, tidy and tastefully decorated. We had a 3 bedroom/2 bathroom unit and with 4 adults and 1 child in our party it was more than enough space for all of us to enjoy a week of relaxation and fun. The pool was clean and fun, and staff at pool bar very friendly. With the full kitchen and dining room we saved on meal expense with having breakfast before heading out for the day. We were in building 9 and it was very quite which was great with a young child! The screened in balcony was great to enjoy morning coffee! With the resort being so close to Disney it was great to not to have to travel far after a long day at the parks! This was our first stay at the Tuscana but look forward to spending time with the resort again next year. Great Job Tuscana, keep up the great work!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Beautiful, clean condo with an amazing location
column29: We just got back from our Disney trip and decided we would stay off the Disney resort for some down time. The Tuscana resort was an amazing condo with more than we needed. We walked in to very clean, updated rooms. The condo gave each of my 11 and 12 year old their own room with privacy. We were able to grocery shop 2 minutes away and save money on food. Driving into Disney took all of 10 minutes. When we wanted our down time, we just came back 'home' to relax by a gorgeous heated pool. This is a place that we will definitely come back to very soon. I can't say enough about it. The staff was more than helpful. We really did feel like we were at home here. Thanks Tuscana!!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I have just returned from a stay in Tuscana Resort in Orlando. When I arrived at the resort I was quickly checked in with a security card which is needed for the door and access to the pool area. I arrived to find a very spacious room which was much more than I expected. There was a balcony overlooking the golf course so we had a great view. The rooms were all spotlessly clean as was the entire resort, everywhere was spotless and I witnessed resort staff constantly sweeping up and cleaning around the grounds. I found the kitchen to be equipped with everything you could want although I did not cook myself and choose to eat at the tavern in the resort or other nearby locations. Bathrooms and bedrooms had adequate towels and bed linen and the storage space was great – a huge walk in wardrobe. We didn’t have a car when we stay at the resort so we were a bit limited even without this we still managed to visit Magic Kingdom on the courtesy bus to and from the resort. Another day we went Universal Studios which was really close by. Another evening we went to Downtown Disney and also a bus tour to Kennedy Space Centre. The week I stayed the resort was very busy with lots of families and couples. It seems to cater for everyone. I spent a lot of time by the pool which was lovely. The weather was great so it was lovely to lie in the sun. The pool area was very clean and there was always people swimming even late at night. There was a separate kids pool area also. The tavern is right beside so it was handy for getting drinks, ice-cream and food.There is a long drive way into the resort and if you are walking it will take about 15mins to get to the closest shop, note this drive is not lit up at night time. We walked every day to the shop to get water, snacks etc. it would be great if the resort could provide a small shop that sold all of these supplies that you might need for a stay there.I did enjoy my stay in Tuscana. It’s a quieter resort away from all the noise of some of the other areas. It’s really close to the parks and I think it’s perfect for families.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: The Most Beautiful Resort in Orlando!!!!
column29: FIRST IMPRESSION: So easy to find from the airport! Driving up to the gate and seeing beautiful decor just took my breath away! It was sooo tranquil with the sound of that gorgeous water fountain! It was a paradise!  CONDO: We Went to our condo which was very accessible with the key in a code pad just outside the door! The condo was very clean and spacious! We have stayed at many other places in Orlando but this place will be our return place from now on! The two bedrooms were beautiful with tons of space to lay your suitcases down. The bathroomS are huge! A great space for bathing three kids and changing them. The kitchen was great; very clean and loaded with the necessary items! The patio was also a perfect little getaway to go sit with your morning coffee!  POOL: The pool area is just stunning! The Italian /Mediterranean theme felt so classy.The children were amazed with the size of the pool! We couldn't get them out, which made it easier to relax! The hot tub was very clean, hot and relaxing!My father loved the cabanas. THE RESTAURANT: The restaurant had the best food. The kids loved eating poolside! The pizza and wings and fries was great! The restaurant staff are fabulous people! We met people, poolside, from all over the world, overseas, Canada and different states! We enjoyed the wireless internet poolside as well. It was very quiet at night. The resort is groomed beautifully and kept up . Every day you would see someone mowing the lawn or someone else picking up scattered things around the grounds. I love the big yellow blooming trees! The resort felt sooo SAFE, even at night which was important having three children.  LOCATION: The area surrounding Tuscana had everything you would need! Publix supermarket was a great place to shop. We also went to Chillies Restaurant, McDonald's,The hair Cuttery ect... which were practically next door to the resort. DISNEY: It is a perfect location for any of the parks in Orlando. Tuscana is Very close to Disney! I have posted vacation pictures on my facebook page and everyone is inquiring about this beautiful resort! Thanks to all the friendly staff at Tuscana for making our stay so wonderful!I would highly recommend this resort to families or couples. See you Next winter!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Just to clarify prior review, this is not a timeshare resort. No high pressure sales, etc. When my family and I went right before Christmas,2010, I booked it through a 3rd party website online at a discount rate w/ 2 Disney tickets thrown in. We did have to sit through a 90 minute tour ......at a totally different resort (Wyndham). Tuscana had/has nothing to do with that. It wasn't even mentioned at check-in and I'm assuming they didn't even know. My assumption is the previous reviewer may have did the same since his review just doesn't make sense. We also had a very nice 2 bedroom/ 2 bath and based on 99% of the other reviews, that is the norm here. They also allowed us to check in at 12:00PM since we arrived early. I normally wouldn't post reviews but felt compelled after hearing about this on Facebook (I get resort updates since I added them to my "like" list.) I suggest you do the same if staying here. To verify I'm legit, browse their wall from October/Nov and you'll see some questions I asked them....it's under Anthony Ca__ara.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: At first the "hotel" seemed fine. I was not thrilled when I noticed both bedrooms had double beds. My husband and I don't fit in a double bed comfortably. There were no blankets on the beds, and only 2 blankets in the closet although it says sleeps 6. Only 4 chairs at the table, when the condo sleeps 6. The wall to wall rug in the unit was stained and should have been changed years ago. In the kitchen there was no sponge, no papertowels, no pasta strainer, no pot holders, no bottle opener. I was told by housekeeping that a pasta strainer and bottle opener would be brought to my room but that didn't happen until I asked again the next day. How could they not supple a pot holder if you are expected to cook? There was no list from housekeeping of what is suppose to be supplied in the kitchen area. The units are privately owned and privately rented out. The unit above the one I rented, must have had many people, there were people coming and going all day and night, banging and loud talking at all hours. There is no control over how many people stay in one unit.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Being a trip advisor member for several years now , I have wondered after reading some reviews if it could really be that bad at some places. After my recent experience at Tuscana Resort in Orlando, Florida , it can be! Being fortunate to extend this years family vacation, a friend suggested Tuscana Resort , advice that I shouldn't have taken. Booking online the first week in January for the last week of February I found what seemed to be a great three night price but required payment in full at the time of booking. I had many reservations about this due to the terms,(cleaning fee damage deposit) but went ahead and reserved my room. Taking several days for the confirmation I became quite nervous that I had been a victim of internet fraud. Immediately after my booking was confirmed I contacted the resort and was greeted on the phone by a very pleasant friendly lady who assured me that this was a family friendly resort.A top notch facility. When inquiring about the units she suggested that I would be comfortable in Block 7-8 top floor. Approximately two weeks before our arrival , I emailed like I do at all destinations to make sure that everything was in order. When I failed to receive a response I contacted Tuscana Resort two days before our scheduled arrival. Again I was greeted by a very friendly lady that informed me everything was in order and my time share tour would be the day after arriving. When I told her that I had never agreed to a tour everything in her demeanor changed. It appeared now that I was booked into block 5 second floor. Through experience in my travels(RED FLAGS!) I should have known better . When we arrived I found exactly what I suspected. The lobby or clubhouse as they call it, is nothing more than a time share sales office. After waiting several minutes for those on the phones desperately promoting time share sales, I was finally approached by TJ. Going through check in he reminded me of an inexperienced used car salesman, when I questioned why my Jan. contact with the above mentioned lady was not logged into the computer and honored he became evasive. Now the good part. Upon entering our two bedroom unit, I was greeted by the foul smell of animal urine and cigarette smoke When I opened the patio door to help disappate the vulgar odor , I was blasted by the intense traffic noise from the I 4 , literally meters away.The unit had two double beds not the double and two twins that I was confirmed to get. Not letting my family enter the unit, I immediately returned to TJ to request an appropriate unit. He informed me that perhaps there was something he could do. Returning several minutes later with a smug look on his face, TJ informed me that the resort was completely booked and If I didn't like it I could go somewhere else. I would by no means receive any kind of refund. Having 2 tired children exhausted from a days travel, I returned to the unit.Checking out the pool area was not much better, stained pool and wore patio furniture. That evening was absolutely the most horrific experiences I have ever spent in a condo.The bathroom was disgusting and I had to clean it before I would permit my children to us it (view photo) Not only the traffic noise but the karaoke resignated through the entire unit and to make matters worse, the tenants above us jumped, stomped until the wee hours of the morning. There is absolutley no security at this facility after dark as I found, so don't try to complain to anyone. The following morning I moved my family to the Sheraton (please read my reviews). Returning saturday morning to retrieve grocery items that I had left on site I was lucky enough to talk to a member of the staff that was more than willing to disclose how this place runs. Yes TJ there were clean two bedroom units available in block 7-8 but these are prepared for prospective time share sales and I also was informed that there were several 3 bedroom units available,but not worth the loss of sixty dollars for an unsatisfied guest that won't be buying a time share. This facility was clearly constructed with the cheapest quality and poor location choice that has come back to haunt them and now they must nickel and dime vulnerable guests to try and keep the lights on. I hope this review will prevent others from being misled and taken advantage of by the scrupulous individuals running this low budget establishment.Tuscana Resort is great choice for those that need a place to pass out after a evening of binge drinking.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: I find all these bad reviews are not a true reflection on what the resort is really like people are being petty. The food is lovely especially the breakfast which sets you up for a busy day round the parks. The karaoke nights are good fun but wish they went on longer than 11 oclock.Overall we had a brilliant time and would recommend it and would stay there again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Yes, this resort does lack a few amenities, however, I am a returning customer because I love the location, the size of the two-bedroom condo, and the great value. Each year that we go we know to always bring paper towels and T-towels for the kitchen, a box of kleenex, an extra roll of toilet paper,and a large garbage bag for trash.The front staff (check-in) are rather unprofessional, but once checked in we didn't require their service anyway. Don't worry about the $300.00 charge they make you sign for up front, as they never charge your credit card with this amount. I think it's just a ploy to make sure you leave everything fairly clean. This is a 5-star resort and the inside of the units are beautiful, with granite bathroom & kitchen counters, and very comfortable beds. Lots of room for two couples and the kitchen is nicely equipped with dishes, pots and pans, cutlery etc. We'll return again next year and hopefully they offer the $95.00 per night to Canadians again.

Very good food and the bartenders were very friendly. I look forward to going again just to see them. It is a gated property which made me feel safe. pool is nice.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We have just arrived home after trip to Orlando, FL, for the holiday. We stayed at this resort with absolutely no regrets. Its location was so convenienant to all the parks we visited. The staff was friendly and helpful; they addressed all of our concerns quickly and cordially. The nearby grocery store was a blessing when we needed supplies for our condo. Tuscana's restaurant was a treat with a good menu variety; the fish and chips were excellently cooked and presented. We will definitely be back in the near future. Thanks to all at Tuscana for making our holiday so special.

column29: property was nice but didn't provide basic toiletries after using initial ones at check in. the kitchen should of had paper towels and kitchen towels. Paid a housekeeping fee and there should of been basic daily service or at least mid week. Never stayed at a condo w/o these services.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Thank you Tuscana see you all in March
column29: Great resort, No fine print surprises, i did the $300 HOLD which was explained on the express check in, the money was released when i checked out on Thursday of last week.And i know this may sound crazy because it was cold out side last week but that heated pool was definitely needed, Food at the bar was great, Front Desk staff has great personality. my key glitched once (or so i thought) but it was in my pocket with my cell phone all day so it got demagnetized, On Call staff was still ok, and had a great attitude with getting out of bed and making me a new key. This Resort really got me with the useful washer and dryer i was able to do laundry and repack my luggage with clean cloths versus half/clean half/dirty. -like some other places leave you with as the only option- Check out took like 7 Seconds. WALK IN, TELL THE STAFF CHECKING OUT, GIVE KEY, SAY BYE AND SMILE i even ran into a staff member in the parking lot who gave me the number and reservations person i should talk to, to rebook in March for my anniversary.as stated in the Header "Thank You Tuscana see you all in March".

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: This place is a disaster! All they do is nickel and dime you for your entire stay. To begin with, we had to wait for 25 minutes to get our room key. This is not a true hotel, it is an owner-owned condo-tel so they don't give a damn about the "guests". The staff is rude!They charge your credit card up front for the entire stay. This charge is 100% non-refundable, no matter what your experience is. In addition, they will place a $300 hold on your credit card for up to 30 days for "insurance"... or you can pay $40 bucks for "room insurance". They also tell you not to put the air lower than 75 degrees or you will be responsible for any damage caused as a result of the unit "freezing up". Bottom line is I will never stay here again!!!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We selected this resort because I'm a member at ChampionsGate golf club and we were visiting DisneyWorld, so it was a great location for the combined trip. We paid for a 1 night stay at this resort with airline miles. There was no mention of any fees until after we already booked, there is a $35 "cleaning fee" that is charged if you are not staying at least 5 nights. Then when we got to the resort we were told that they needed to place a $300 hold on our credit card. The alternative was to pay another $30 (or higher) in cash instead of the hold. The person said that the hold would not be released for up to 14 business days, so we opted to to just pay in cash. We were highly frustrated at this point and considering not staying due to these surprise fees. We finally got to our room and they key didn't work. That was our boiling point, so we went back to the front desk and my wife had to argue with them over giving us a refund considering we never even set foot in a room. They said they couldn't refund our cash even though we had just given it to them 10 minutes earlier. They accused us of just not wanting to pay their fees, but if that was the case we wouldn't have paid them in the first place. Their customer service skills are non-existent and we are still having to call every day to try and get a refund. "Toni" called and left a message saying we would receive our refund 2 weeks ago, but we never received the money. And now every time we call we get screened and somehow the 2 people that are supposed to talk to are always out of the office. We will NEVER even consider staying at this place again. We paid approximately $159 with our miles and with the additional fees the total cost for 1 night is approximately $230. It is very troubling that a resort of this nature would play these games over $80. If you're a world class resort, the reputation of your business and satisfaction of possible future Customers should be a priority. We will continue calling until they realize that we're not just going to go away because they keep saying they're out of the office.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
