column29: We stayed here in early November we had 6 in our party one in a wheelchair I found tuscana Very wheelchair friendly we had no problems getting around it at all. We had a 3 bedroom 2 bathroom condo we found it very clean homely and spacious the pool area was lovely and the staff were very friendly and helpful the location is good too just off the I4 had no problems finding it. We will stay here again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We checked in the day before Thanksgiving .The resort is very beautiful! We had a 3rd floor condo with 3 spacious bedrooms and 2 bath. The decor was amazing! We saved money by cooking breakfast at the resort in the full kitchen we had. I also prepared Thankgiving dinner. They offer movie rentals and karaoke as well as a bar by the pool! I would stay here again and refer to a friend! Thanks Tuscana

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We had stayed at the Tuscana 3 times before this and we THOUGHT that the resort was wonderful!! BUT........We arrived and were put into a 3 bedroom unit in building 6 on the 4th floor. All we could hear was the traffic from I-4 all night long. We could not sleep at all. Then to top it off we had someone below us that lives in the building that had 2 dogs that would bark constantly. Sitting on the patio (which is supposed to be relaxing) was not done due to the traffic noise and the dogs barking. Also the linen truck and the garbage truck show up at like 4:30am and all you hear is the beeping from the truck backing up and the banging of the dumpster as they empty it. We went to the front desk the next day to ask to be moved but were told that they could not do it because they had promised the condo owner the revenue. We felt that it was the resort that promised the revenue not us and that to make our vacation pleasurable we wanted to be moved. Of all the conversations we had with the front desk we NEVER talked to a manager. He just relayed the messages through the front desk staff. Another complaint was that we had gone to Disney and came back at 11:30pm with 2 sleeping children only to find out that all four of our room keys did not work. My husband just caught the girls at the front desk before they locked the door for the night. They rekeyed the cards and told my husband that it said in their computer that they had us checking out that day even though we were not checking out until the next day. If we had not caught the front desk employee we would have been stuck outside our room. GRRRRRRR!!!!!! We ranted and raved about how wonderful this resort was until this last vacation. They would not do anything for us except give us a coupon for 1 night free stay. We have given them over a month of revenue in the past year and they are only willing to provide 1 night!!! Crappy Crappy Resort!! We will never EVER stay there again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Perfect place for a holiday - with or without kids
column29: We're just back from two weeks at Tuscana where we had a fantastic time. It was close enough to the theme parks to be convenient but because the resort was slightly further out than some it seemed nice and quiet. We liked the apartment (2 beds, 2 bathrooms), with enough space for two adults and two children as well as a well-equipped kitchen. The clubhouse area with swimming pool and bar/restaurant was fantastic. We ate there a number of times - the food was great and the staff were very friendly, attentive and good with the kids. They really contributed to a fantastic holiday and we can't rate them highly enough. There was a very relaxed atmosphere and all the guests mixed - and the kids all made some new friends. The swimming pool was amazing and the kids absolutely loved it (so did the adults, mind you). We wouldn't hesitate in recommending Tuscana to anyone and are already thinking about going back next year.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: What a gem of a find, staff were fabulous especially at the pool, (Hello Jenny, from Holly), resort is everything we hoped for, apartments were extremely well appointed (only time I've returned from a holiday with no washing). We were in block 9 which is probably a little more quiet than the rest as it is a little further out. We weren't exactly in peak season either. Pool was lovely everywhere was spotless, always people milling around fixing and sorting things, truly you won't regret booking this resort. p.s if you google map this resort before leaving uk it will prob take you somewhere else (it did us), come off Junction 58 of I-4 (w to tampa) stay right and you'll see a chijis restaurant on your right. The championsgate arch is just ahead, you need to turn right just b4 the arch and b4 the 7/11 follow the road to the end and you'll reach the tuscana.Happy Holidays

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Resort staff were not the friendliest. In fact they were hardly to be seen. Apartment was impressive until we couldn't enjoy a peaceful meal or sleep because you could hear every sneeze and stamp of the foot from our neighbours at the resort. There is one pool and for such a large complex it was surprisingly quiet. It was always a good 20-30 min drive to parks and I-drive which was reasonable until you hit morning or afternoon traffic. Gym facilities were poor. Gym was opened from 5am to 10pm yet a lot of the equipment was safety secured and had to be activated by staff who were not in til 8am. Defeats the purpose if opening gym at 5am. I wouldn't advise a ground floor apartment as there are loud generators that will disturb you throughout the day.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Great place to stay, but you need a rental car
column29: I stayed at the Tuscana resort to save some money for my company, when I attended a conference at the Omni at Championsgate. The staff members that checked me in were super friendly and did a great job.  I booked a 2 bedroom and 2 bath room because the price difference was minimal and the place was huge. I walked to the Omni daily (about 20 minutes) and wouldn't necessarily recommend that at night. The path leading to the Tuscana resort is not well lit and there are no sidewalks, but during the day time it's a nice walk.  This resort is also located near a Chili's, Publix, and Walgreens, so you really have everything you would need.  I have pretty basic travel needs, so I didn't need someone to make my bed everyday and have all the other basics of a hotel stay. I would definitely come back here, but I would get a rental car.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Perfect place to stay for visiting Disney/Universal
column29: Just got back from 2 weeks at Tuscana, and can only repeat the positive things other people have said. We stayed in Block 5, which meant there was some noise from I4, but not much more than a low hum, and it did mean we had a lovely view over the golf course. The condo was huge, with two en-suite bathrooms, lounge area, balcony, large kitchen area and good size dining table. Everything was in good, clean condition, and there was a TV in each room, as well as one in the lounge, so everyone was kept happy for the short time we were there in the morning/last thing at night. The condos also have free internet via a wire behind the sofa, or there is wireless around the pool area. The pool was great, and the poolside bar does a nice range of meals.Location wise it is ideal. It's literally 15mins to Magic Kingdom or 25ish to Universal using Interstate 4, and there is a junction practically at the bottom of the road leading out of the resort. Publix supermarket is 2mins away, as is Chillis restaurant which we used 4 times while we were there (they do takeaways too!). Theres a McDonalds & a Walgreen pharmacy there too, as well as two gas stations.Overall we had a great stay at Tuscana, and wouln't hesitate to recommend it to anyone visiting the theme parks.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Excellent resort and not that far from Disney.
column29: We have just returned from a week at this resort and would definitely stay here again.We were in block 2 and we never heard any noise from the I4 or karaoke. The condo was a good size with 2 ensuite rooms, washer/dryer and a fully equipped kitchen, the only down side for us was the lack of seating in the lounge area - one smallish sofa and a very uncomfy chair, could have down with another sofa.The pool area was very good and was not overcrowded during our stay, our youngest daughter spent most of her time in the pool and absolutely loved it.The computers in the clubhouse area are very convenient and the staff were more than willing to help when I needed to print Disney tickets off and airport check-in information. All staff we met were very helpful and always smiling.The resort is literally just off the I4 and we found this to be an ideal location, having previously stayed off the 192 and all its traffic lights etc. We went to the halloween party at Magic Kingdom and from getting in our car at the MK parking lot to pulling up outside the condo was 14 minutes, with two tired girls this was superb.Would recommend this resort to friends and would return again ourselves.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Excellent value, quiet, clean,roomy,good location,TV all rooms
column29: I read some of the reviews and do not think some of the people stayed at this location. The pool is just a very short walk across the parking lot. The rooms are clean and very comfortable. The stay was like living in a three bed room condo with all of the comforts of home. Washer, dryer, dishes, etc. iron, balcony, close to shopping (Publix supermarket) liquor store, restaurants, but close to the Orlando sites if you have a car. The Resort has free rides to the Disney stuff if you like. If you know your way around this area bring your wife or girl friend or both they will to this place they will like it and it will not cost you an arm and leg for this quality of stay. My stay was for one week.PYRO

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: One of the best resorts we've stayed at
column29: Just back form the Tuscana and can only say it exceeded my expectations. The staff cannot do enough for you and were always very pleasant and helpful.The condos were really clean, big and well equipped. We stayed in building 1, apartment 1203, which had two bedrooms on suite, a large kitchen area, dining area and living area with balcony. No doubt at this time of year it was quieter, however the karoke never bothered us in the slightest and we never heard any traffic noise. All in all the condo was really well equipped with everything you needed for a home from home stay. They are a totally self catering facility and there is a Publix supermarket nearby where you can buy anything you need. Its a great location to stay at, as you are within easy access to Interstate4 and all the attractions. We had a car so it was easy to get to where you wanted to go. If staying at this resort would recommend that you have your own transport, although they do run a shuttle bus, not sure of the times as we never had to use it.Pool area very clean and tidy and was never busy when we used it so there was plenty of sun beds and cabbanas.Thanks for a great stay.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: This place was a great value for the...
column29: This place was a great value for the price. Having a kitchen and laundry made for a cost effective trip. The swimming pool and hot tub were terrific. It's less than a 10 minute drive to the parks. I would definitely go back.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: go to tuscana its a happy place [Jack & Amy harrison age 9 &8]
column29: Stayed here for a month aug 13th -sept 11th. Had a great time . Was a bit daunted about the other reviews we read about the noise from the I4 . But emailed them about our concerns and we were placed away from the noise . Kids enjoyed the pool area especially at night when they made lots of friends and we could have a drink whilst they played happily with their new friends. The barmaid was especially kind with my daughter when she ordered pepperoni pizza requesting extra pepperoni and came back with loads . Apartment was nice great for our needs . Not much natural light as you have only 3 windows but when you're at the parks all day its going dark anyway when you get back .Kitchen had plenty of appliances much more than we needed as we eat out mainly when we visit . Great chillis restaurant down the road and publix supermarket . About 15mins from disney and 30 mins from universal and seaworld . Staff were very pleasant and polite .Hoping to stay here again next year.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: My children and I had a great time. The condo was ideal for our needs. Kitchen was well equipped. Dishwasher and laundry appliances like brand new. Bathrooms huge and in good condition. Very comfy queen beds in bedrooms. Plenty of storage and closet space. Stayed in Bldg 7..Perfect location..quiet at night, directly across from clubhouse and pool.Children enjoyed the $1.00 DVD machine for the one night we had time to watch a movie. Office/reception staff were warm and friendly and as helpful as they could be. Enjoyed the pool area with the free WIFI for laptop and the onsite bar for drinks and food.Plenty of Cabana space when it got too hot in the sun. Will absolutely make this an annual or biannual vacation. Wonderful grocery store and drug store close by and perfect access to highway for quick trip to all Disney and Orlando attractions. Beliza in reservations was very kind and informative via email ,while we were planning our trip. For the value of these facilities I am surprised at the grumblings by other guests. Thank you Tuscana for a wonderful vacation and we hope to see you all again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Tuscana looked nice when booking.We have stayed at numerous similar resorts so the comments reflect this.The check in was ok, but having a $300 hold on your card is way over the normal.We were offered Insurance at $40 (non refundable) to cover damage rather than the $300 hold but we declined this.The complex is small in comparison to some with one main clubhouse and pool.We stayed in block 7, top floor, after asking for a ground floor unit, staff said no units were available(but there were numerous ones not occupied when we looked) .There was a lft but it was very slow.There did not appear to be any resort activities at night by the clubhouse.(could be the main season had ended)Rooms appeared clean and reasonably well looked after.The beds were particularly comfortable.Not enough dining chairs for all of us (only 4).Found blood on one of the blankets for the sofa bed, but luckily there was another blanket available.The complimentary starter pack was BASIC, with no coffee,kitchen roll.We were told they are a self catering resort, but in all the other resorts we have stayed in these come as standard.Make sure to bring these especially if you are checking in late.This miserly attitude was further borne out by all the add on potential charges,the $300 card hold , $50 charge for checking out late,$50 charge for any garbage left in the unit and a $50 charge sticker on the toilet for a call out to unblock it.Internet access was by cable in the lounge rather than wireless , which was ok but inconvenient as only one person could access at a time.However, the receptionist very kindly printed documents for me at the clubhouse.There was also a distinct lack of staff at night, with no evidence of any security, no one on the gate(access was by keypad and electric gates).It felt uncomfortable.Overall, we found the rooms at Tuscana comfortable and clean, however, it was a bit far out ,with a good 30 mins drive to Universal etc.We would NOTstay again.There are so many other similar resorts with better service.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Would not recomend for family with kids
column29: Would not recommend for a familyWe stayed at that resort for 6 nights Sept 10 – Sept 10. in a 3-bedroom unit, 3-rd floor, building. #1.The unit itself was really nice and clean. Hotel location is great, close to parks and airport.Before coming I called the resort and asked for quiet unit, not close to the highway. Actually highway noise is nothing in comparison to karaoke.For three nights we could not sleep because of extremly loud noise in Tuscana Tavern at the pool. Every second night they have extremely loud outside karaoke going on from 7 pm to midnight. I called the front desk and the bar and complained, they promised to stop soon but still nasty karaoke was going on until midnight. The guy doing karaoke thing actualy has a good voice, I would enjoy it at a different time.Avoid any building close to the the pool area, especially Building #1 which is about 200 -300 ft away from karaoke! Sleeping is impossible 7 pm through midnight every second night.Also Building #1 must be avoided because it is the 1st one inside the gates. So every car has to pass it on the way out and in. The cars going outside always drive over a rain drain making loud noise.Be careful if you are filling up your rental car near Orlando airport. There is a gas station 2 miles north of Orlando airport that charges $5 for a gallon, while everywhere the price is $2.50.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: FANTASTIC, highly recommended. Already looking to re-book
column29: Best holiday we have had in America so far and this is our 4th time of going. The Tuscana is a fantastic hotel. As these are privately owned condo's there is no maid service, which was perfect for us as we didn't feel we have to tidy up every time we left the room. There were 3 of us and we had a 2 bedroom 2 bathroom. Its was MASSIVE and beautifully clean. The hotel reception staff were always helpful. The highlight of Tuscana is the bar which is English run!. The food is VERY GOOD and extremley good value for money. There is kareoke 3 times a week which you can either go down to listen to whilst having a nice cold beer or be boring and stay in the room. I would recommend if you are looking for a quieter holiday to ask to be given a room in either block 5 or 6. We were in block 5 and couldn't hear a thing. Overall we have a fanastic holiday and would highlighy recommend to friends and we WILL be booking again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Should be downgraded to 3 star by Virgin Hodays
column29: on arriving at the resort the staff at reception went through the general things about staying in a rental owned by someone else... a $300 securety had to be left on the off chance things got damaged. I asked if an infantryhad been done and was told yes, each time the apparment is cleaned. This was not the case as the appartment sleeps 8 and there were enough dining items, plates,cutlery,glasses in some cases for only 4. we were a partyof 6. I went to reception and asked for missing items, but we never got them. The appartment was ok, but a little dissapointing, dark, dated, had to have all lights on to see. Trash bins need to be emptied during day not early morning, the noise of the trucks is so loud... yes we were ground floor next to car park !Pool, excellent... Bar good. A good point to raise when guests are arriving, tell them where local shops are and whats generally in the area. I stayed last year in the Bahama BayResort on the 27, it was a little more money,but a huge difference in the quality of stay... sorry Tuscana we won't be back.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: A good condo, far better than a hotel, great location, clean, tidy
column29: This is our 4th Condo we have stayed here at Florida. Others being BAHAMA BAY,MYSTIC DUNES, LAGUNA BAY.The condo styles are far superior than a hotel if you are not too sure. We dont do hotels anymore.We booked this via VIRGIN again, whom I cannot fault. The car we booked via ATLAS CAR CHOICE, with no problem.The TUSCANA is a great place. Location was brill, if you like the delights of the 192 and I:DRIVE, you would have to come off and and get back on the I:4. The accomodation was clean and well presented. We had a two bed condo that sleeps 6, however, space would be tight. I had a look at a 3 bedroom condo, and they are exactly the same size, except the 2nd bathroom is smaller with an extra bedroom. I would suggest if there is more than 4 adults, you would have to stay in a 3 bed.The staff and check was fine. We reported a faulty lock and this was repaired immediately.The only slight moan was the noise from the AIR CON System which made some rather strange noises at night. We mentioned this at checkout as it was not a major issue as we were that knackered!Upon checkin you are asked to leave $39.00 non return for any damage, or $300.00 on a credit card. This is not advertised anywhere that I could see prior to our arrival.There is free internet in the room, great if you have teenagers, free wifi by the pool, and freeinternet access in the receptionWould we stay here again, yes.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed at the Tuscana last summer so when we decided to come back to Florida we knew the Tuscana was the one for us. This time we had a 3 bedroom condo on the 4th floor in building 3. This was great and exactly what we expected. Great apartment, which was clean and tidy when we arrived. The Tuscana is a great base for Orlando. Its close to all the amenities we needed and all the sights we wanted but far enough away from the busy International Drive area. If we can afford it, we will be back next year. Kids happy with free wi-fi around the pool area.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: This is an apartment complex turned short stay "hotel". Pros: location near parks and highway, fairly new complexCons: beware of building #6. Highway noise is extreme 24-7. Also, if you stay more than a day bring your own soap, shampoo, trash bags.. And pretty much everything you may need, as the resort only provides one days worth and will not replenish. Bottom line - great if you need space and are on a cheap budget. But don't expect much in terms of service or amenities.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Stayed for two weeks in a 2-bed apartment on the top floor. Great size apartment, facilities excellent. Very slight noise from the motorway nothing that kept us awake. We were staying further into the resort next to the golf course though. Publix Supermarket 5 mins away very good, as is the busy Chilli's restaurant. Attractions/Shopping less than 25 minutes away. Apartment had free internet connection through an ethernet cable so take your laptopWHAT WE DID:Canoeing - http://www.canoewekiva.com and did the Katie's Landing trip (8 miles). Good but be aware there is only one real place to stop for a picnic which is around the 7 mile mark. Other than that it's eat in your canoe. It's very scenic but basically marshland with alligators, birds, and the occasional colourful spiders. Katie's Landing destination is not sign posted and is difficult to find. Once you go under the big bridge it's at least another half mile up river on the right. The locals will tell you it's just after the bridge... It's not an easy route in terms of distance versus the time you have to complete it.Airboat Ride - http://www.bcairboats.com. Half hour trip and was worth it. One oddity is they take your photo but you can't buy that picture on it's own, you have to buy 3 or 4 copies of it. ADVICE - Wear the ear defenders. They may not be the height of teenage fashion but the boats are very noisy. A great fun activity and we saw mum and baby alligatorsChef John's Dockside Inn - http://www.chefjohnsdocksideinn.com. Great food and service excellent, worth the trip into the old part of Kissimee townUniversal Studios - Great but disappointed with the organisation for Harry Potter World. This is very very popular because it's new so although you have your ticket into Universal you need to get another ticket (free) inside the park to then get into HP World. They didn't tell us this and we had to go back to near the main gates to get the additional tickets, by which time you were even further down the queue. Annoying as we made a special effort to get there early. Queueing is into HOURS for the various sights and rides especially so for HP but alsso for the main rides in both Universal ParksClearwater Beach - 90 minute journey but the beach is well worth it. Spent the day on soft white sand and the sea is like a warm bath.Shopping - Premium Outlets, Pr1me Outlets, Mall at Millenia, Florida Mall all greatAll in all we had a great time and would stay at this complex again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: From the day we got there it was Great,The rooms were very clean,comfortable,spacious it was like home from home with the sun. It was 10 mins from the Disney parks just off the I4 perfect location, The pool bar was terrific and Dave and Janet and the staff made our holiday. From the pool being open at night for the kids and me not having to drive every night for some thing to eat because they served nice meals from hamburgers,cheesy chipsto steaks and racks of ribs(very nice) all day and night while I enjoyed a quiet beer at the pool while I kept my eye on the kids.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Overall our stay at Tuscana was great.
column29: Overall our stay at Tuscana was great, however, I asked for a quiet block as it appeared a very busy resort and we were allocated Block 6. We were so tired when we got there so didn't notice the traffic noise from the I-4 until 3 am in the morning! From our balcony you could see the I-4 and all it's traffic. Avoid this block if you value your sleep.The condo itself was fantastic and location was spot on - we already knew the area as we had been upgraded a couple of years ago to the Ginn Reuion Resort (fantastic resort).The ammenties of Publix etc just down the road was handy and when we had a problem with our AC cutting out at night, it was fixed within an hour.We would recommend this resort - just avoid Block 6!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Overrall great place to stay.. Really enjoyed it
column29: Tuscana really matched itself with its pictures. Resort is 3-4 yrs old and still looks new. We are still here and staying in a 2 Br condo thats very clean and big. The furniture is up to date but the couch and beds are small. Kitchen is big and equiped well for my family. I really have no big complaints. The pool area is nice and big We really enjoyed jenny and the other guy I cant think of his name but he cooked most of the food for the tavern. Our kids made themselves at home and we all felt safe. I give them a 10 on a 1-10 scale. Publix,chilis, liquor store, nail shop, pizzeria, and 2 gas stations are within 3 minutes. Walmart was 15 minutes away. disney about 20 minutes away. I would definetly come here again next year. We really enjoyed it...

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Very nice but not luxurious, shop around to be sure you're getting a good deal
column29: This is indeed a nice place to stay. Good size condos that have most of the comforts of home. Our famility enjoyed our stay here and we would probably do it again but consider this before you make your reservations:1) If you want quiet, don't stay here. Almost every day between 6 and 7AM a laundry truck backs through the parkng lot with a very loud backup buzzer. While the condos on the golf course side of the comlex have a great view of the course. You also overlook the parking lot and you'll have to deal with that truck every day. Not so great if you looked forward to sleeping in. Consider asking for a room on the woods slide of the complex, it should be quieter over there. This really isn't the best place to stay if you're looking for quiet. The noise from condos above (walking on floors), people walking up and down the hallway stairs and the general parking lot activity can be a little loud at times. We have teenagers so noise wasn't a big deal for us, but if you have young ones who sleep lightly this won't be the place for you.2) Your reservations are not refundable for ANY reason. Read your contract. Our travel plans got messed up so we arrived one day earlier than expected and had to leave one day earlier than we reserved. The total length of our stay was the same, we were just off schedule by one day. The front desk gladly let us check in the one day earlier (charging us for the extra day, which we expected.) Unfortnately, they would not refund our money for the day at the end of the trip that we would not be using. This resulted in us paying for a night which we could not use. I think the front desk staff could have been a little nicer in how they handled the situation.3) These are condos so I'm not sure if every unit is furnished exactly the same, but the bedding in our units was very uncomfortable. The owners of our unit chose a low end mattress which was dissapointing given how nice everything else was in the unit.4) We were part of a large group staying here so we received a deeply discounted rate to stay here. The deal we received made this an excellent value for our money. If we had to pay full price to stay here, I think I could have gotten a better value for just as nice of a complex elsewhere.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Just returned from two week holiday stayed in 3 bed apartment with husband and 3 girls aged 18,14 and 10 all had a great holiday, resort very clean, plenty to do, very accessible to parks, shops etc, restaurant on resort very good, food excellent and people very friendly.Apartment very nice and comfortable plenty room for everyone would definately recommend this place, and would certainly go back and stay there again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I would like to say thanks to Erica for the smooth check in. She was always there to answer all of my questions. The stay was very pleasant and enjoyable. I came with my youth from church and they had a ball. My only complaint was that it was not close to Universal Studios. The ladies at the front desk was very very helpful. I had a young lady as well as my husband that needed to get homework done and she offered their office computers because the other ones were being used by other guest. I want to say thank you to every one and I pray that your business will prosper. I really enjoyed the bar and everyone gave great compliments for the wings but they were all gone by the time I git there, so next time I am in Florida I am coming for the wings. Thanks everyone.Kimberly and Pentecostal Temple Church family

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: La pasamos super bien y me pareció una excelente relación precio-producto. Ademas tnes super cerca y farmacias las 24 hs y está cerca de los parques.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: My husband and I stayed at Tuscana for 2 months.. Feb and March, 2010. We stayed in a 3 bedroom unit for Feb and since we weren't having company for March we moved to a 2 bedroom unit for the next month. Our both units were in Building 3, great choice!! Building and units were clean (with the exception of carpets spots), well stocked with kitchen appliances and dishes, bathrooms were well maintained, but could have used extra towels (bought some extras). Really convenient to have washer and dryer in unit. Didn't mind buying a few extra things since we were there for 2 months. Grounds and pool areas were well maintained and clean. Loved the pool and hot tub ( had problem with heating some of the time, but temp was below freezing a few nights, so that was to be expected). Monthly rate was great, wouldn't hesitate to come back, loved it.. Have already recommended it to friends.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Stayed here with wife and 3 1/2 yr old daughter. 2 bed condo very spacious and clean. Nice kitchenette area. Each bedroom has its own bath or shower. Kettle, utensils and iron and board supplied. Towels also supplied however buy toilet paper!Swimming Pool/area very nice but water is cold!!! Cafe/bar do some very nice food and there is sat tv. We stayed in building 8 which is close to the resort centre yet far enough away not to be disturbed by karaoke singers nad I-4. Recommend this building if staying with children.You cannot fail to find this place from the I-4. it is signposted. 0.5 miles from resort is Chillis (very good food/service), PUblix supermarket, McDonalds (24 HR), Medical Centre and 2 petrol stations.One very slight downside is that is stated that the resort is only 2 junctions away from Disneyworld. this statement is true, but is about a 15 minute drive to main gates (10 minutes if you drive like you are on Mway in UK). This drive is a pain when you have spent all day in a park and your kid(s) tired!There is also free internet access on 2 PC's in the main lobby area!

column29: Muy bueno,eso si,no tiene servicio a la habitacion.Pero estubo EXELENTE

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: reccomend to everyone - Amazing bar food
column29: We booked the TUSCANA for our Honeymoon 12 months before we were due to go. I must admit that on checking this website 2 months before we were due to fly i was having major doubts, afterall this was my Honeymoon and i wanted everything to be perfect, there had been several reviews stating that it the resort was dirty, noisy, that there was never any beds by the pool availabe and that the rooms were not cleaned properly. This did worry me but after working 5 years as an Overseas Holiday Rep i knew that everyone's entitled to their own opinion and we decided to give it a go. I can say that from the minute we pulled up at the resort we did not look back. We were welcomed at reception as though we were old friends, yes there was a non refundable deposit of $39 to pay which we knew about already as it is clearly stated on the resorts site.The block we were in was block 7 and i was pleased to hear.....NOTHING! I was so worried about the comments on here about the traffic noise for months leading up to the holiday but can say that it did not effect us at all and we come from the countryside where the only noise you hear is the cows.The APARTMENT was clean, tidy and was exactly what we were hoping it would be, great cooking facilities, kitchen 2 bedrooms both ensuite and enough toilet paper, washing up liquid etc to last the first few days. We only ate out once in the evening and this was at the Taverna on site - I have to say that the food was out of this world, after repping many selfcatering apartments and eating at the bar's in them, THE MEALS AT THE TUSCANA TAVERNA WERE THE BEST WE HAVE HAD FROM AN ON RESORT RESTAURANT, i would highly reccommend that you try the Tuscana Chicken when you are there.(they also do takeaway's!) The bar/restuarant staff couldn't have been more helpful, we also went to the Karaoke a that was on twice a week which was great fun. The bar was not noisy and open until the eraly hours keeping you awake as someone had mentioned, in fact it closed between 11-12pm each night.LOCATION: This is a perfect loctaion for anyone that is looking to do any of the parks whilst in orlando, we have stayed at another area before but as this was right off the I4 it was so easy to get to and from with no quick exits or trying to cross busy roads. You can walk from the resort to Championsgate where there is a few stores and places to eat. Takes around 10 minutes but the road is really quite as only goes to the resort so very safe.POOL: The pool area was clean and tidy and no matter what time of the day you went there we always managed to get a bed as it was never full.All in all i would highly reccommend this to familes, couples or solo travellors as a great base when in orlando. We will be going back there and will tell all our firnds/family and work collegues about it!!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Just back from our third stay in Tuscana. Everything top class as we expected. Rooms are always spotless, pool area and poolside bar are first class. Staff always willing to help. The most relaxing resort to stay in. See you all next year !!!!.Stephen & Karen

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: The condo's are spacious and come with everything you need. Kitchen was well equipped and it was great to have a dishwasher, washer and dryer in the condo.We were upgraded to a 3 bdrm on check in, so we had lots of room. It was very convenient to have 2 baths and not have to share with the other couple.On check in we were placed in Bldg 6, which is located near the I-4 and did hear some traffic noise but not enough to really bother us. You get this with most hotels located on main roads.The pool area was lovely and had plenty of lounge chairs. The cabanas were a welcome addition. The pool was NOT heated though but did have a hot tub and kid pool.The resort is located about 10 min from Disney and 25 min from Universal Studios. If travelling is an issue either rent a car or stay at something closer to your needs. There is sufficient shopping nearby. There ia a pharmacy, bank, UPS, several reataurants and a 7 - Eleven store and gas bar, all located within 1/2 mile.The restaurant on site is convenient but isn't anything to brag about. the service was good but the food was good but not super.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Excellent location and value for money
column29: Just returned from an 'extended' stay at the Tuscana due to the Volcanic ash. When we found out that our flight had been cancelled the girl at reception managed to move things around so that we could stay in the same condo for another week. On top of this they gave us the room at a reduced rate due to the circumstances. We really appreciated this as we had to pay this out of our own pocket.The condo itself was very spacious and had plenty of room for two adults and two children. The kitchen was well equipped and was great having the dishwasher & washing machine/dryer. We were in Block 5 which was quite near to the I4 and we did hear the traffic noise the first couple of nights but after that we got used to it and it never really bothered us.The pool area is lovely we found that plenty of sunbeds were always available. It was very clean and the Internet room was very useful due to the situation we found ourselves in.We really enjoyed our stay at the Tuscana and would not hesitate staying there again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We liked our 2bed/2bath condo. The couch is a little on the dinky side and the pullout bed wasn't very comfy, but most of them aren't anyway. They obviously don't take care of the trash on the weekends. because when we pulled up, there was a huge buzzard hanging out on top of the bin and there was trash all around it.. We even saw a girl on one of the go-carts go over to it, but she picked up one thing and left. By the time we got back Monday evening, the trash had obviously come through. Great location to Disney and Universal area. Super convenient to Publix, liquor store, 7-11, The only major problem we had was when Elsa I think her name was..She checked us in. We got to the condo, unpacked all of our stuff. Well she called my cell phone and said there was a mistake and she gave us the wrong room, so we had to go back and get a new one. Okay, not happy with that, but the real pisser was when we threw all of our stuff back in the car, I went to the front desk and she said No, It was a mistake after all.I tried calling your cell phone, but it went to voicemail. So we went back to the room. Never once, did she apologize for the inconvenience and she never called my phone, because other than the first call, it never was on there. And if she realized her mistake, why didnt she call the actual room or walk herself down to our condo!!! And because of her rudeness, I will definitely not be coming back!

column29: Lindo, limpio, confortable, excelentemente equipado, un trato excelente por parte de la gente del complejo,no se le puede pedir mas a este lugar, recomendable 100%

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: When staying @ Tuscana just remember it is not a hotel. This was perfect for us. Lots of room,two bathrooms,we cooked our own food, just perfect. The pool area is very clean and the water was just the right temp. It really depends on where you book your rooms. Some of the units are Tuscana's some are booked by others. It is a resort so there will be noise from the bar @ times but it doesn't last long. The highway noise was a dull hum most of the time. You could sit on a deck almost anywhere in Orlando and hear that. The carpet in our unit was a bit dungy and rundown. I agree with other reviews that the livingroom couch and chair look used. One barmaid was a bit ruff but we just stayed away when she was there and made our own drinks. Overall this was just ideal for us. Loved it!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: GREAT Resort!! By far the best Orlando has to offer.
column29: We usually go to Orlando at least four to five times a year. This was the first time we stayed at this resort and looking forward to going back there from now on. The staff is excellent, and very attentive to special request. The units are very well kept and supper spacious, could not have asked for more. This is definitely the best resort/hotel/condo we have stayed at in Orlando.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed in 2203, so the it was 2nd floor. We could hear kids above us running around but it was limited to daytime hours. When we arrived, I found 3 problem, so we stopped in the office on the way to dinner. I wanted the dent in the corner of a wall and the broken door stop documented so I didn't get billed for them and I wanted the broken deck door lock fixed. Within an hour the maintenance guy was up and replace the lock. The interior of the condo was very clean. Grounds and pool were very clean. It is very close to the freeway as far as access but we could not hear the freeway. Chili's was very close and Publix, a grocery store, was just a few blocks away. I would definitely stay there again, especially considering the price was less than a decent but not high end hotel, and we had a whole condo to ourselves. We ate breakfast at "home" each day before heading to the parks and we made lunches at "home" and took them in small backpacks to the parks. After doing the condo routine, it would be hard to say in a single hotel room again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Just back from a 2 week stay in this resort. Overall it has its positives and negatives.Positives15 mins to Disney-Easy access on I-4Overall Resort is cleanChilis /Shops / McD at the end of the lane from resort3 Bed Condo was spacious and comfortableNegativesWe were in a Ground floor condo -The air con units for the four condos above us were located outside one of the bedroom windows so it was extremely noisy at night time .Very hard to get a Sun lounger at the pool area and most were reserved with towels(and no one present)Pool bar-Not ideal if you have small kids - Lots of drinking going on and by early evening pool area got loud.Internet access is only 2 PCs and impossible to get on- Most of the time the PCs are being used by teenagers on Facebook.Also a Non refundable 40 Dollars to be paid when you get there for Insurance for any damage caused or 300 Dollars on your credit card if no damage is caused.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Excellent location - watch for the Karaoke
column29: Just back from 10 days in Florida where we stayed in one of the 3 bedroom condos. Certainly cannot complain about the facilities, plenty of towels for the 4 of us and the rooms were very clean on arrival. There's a DVD machine in the lounge and you can hire DVDs from reception for about $1 a night which can be useful. we did hear the karaoke on a couple of evenings and my daughter complained that it did keep her awake a bit. We were at the front of Block 2 which faces away from the pool area so it might be a lot noiser in a different location. The resort is in a reasonably good location with quick access to the I-4 so getting to the theme parks and so on is quite easy. There's a Chili's restaurant at the end of the road which you could walk to but be prepared for a wait as it's usually busy. There's a 7-11 and a Publix within about 0.5 mile as well. Certainly would consider using it again, but the room location is critical to avoid noise from either the pool or the I-4

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Loved It !!! Going back this August/September...We have a few rooms left in our block too !
column29: I LOVE this resort ! You get the most bang for your buck, the staff is wonderful ,the resort is beautiful and you just feel relaxed the moment you get their, I am so looking forward to our upcoming trip back this August/September I just want to lounge around, shop and eat, LOL.. Sit poolside and look cute ! Tuscana is my home away from home, I so look forward to my Florida trips and once I discovered Tuscana it made them just that much better, and with my current work schedule and all the family has going on, all of us can't wait until its our time to head down. Trust me, you can't go wrong !!! For what you get, the location, the property etc.. You truly can't find a better buy in my opinion. We actually have 2 units left in our block that won't be used now if anyone wants to save $ and book under our block, you would still deal directly with the resort to reserve, and do your own thing, I would just give you the information you need to book under our block so you can save some money,. Every little bit helps !!! : - ) You can save that money to spend shopping, buying food and supplies for your condo... And contact me if you want 1 of the 2 rooms we have left, figured it is better than letting them go to waste, and they won't effect us filled or left empty, but figured they may help a fellow traveler . Contact me at MysistaMyfriend@gmail.com to see if either of them is still available if you want one and to see the exact dates.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We were a long way from the interstate and there was no street noise. It looks like only one block of rooms would give a problem. Rooms were great and spacious with granite counter tops in the kitchen. Only draw back was over head guests could easily be heard running across the floor until 1 or 2 in the morning. Would recommend top floor next time. A true gem of Tuscana was the restaurant. Great food and good variety. I wished we had not waited to eat there until the last night. Great location at exit 58 off of I4. 10 minutes to the park.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed at the Tuscana for 4 nights and found it to be perfectly adequate for what we wanted which was a two bedroom condo with a kitchen and not too far from the parks. Be aware that other than utensils, dishes, some cookware and dishsoap, there isn't much in the way of amenities. Need to buy (or bring) coffee filters, papertowels, tissues, and any seasonings or condiments you want. The restaurant on site is great and reasonably priced. (The English sausage is to die for!) The lady in the office was very nice and helpful, especially for my husband who had business documents to send and receive. I guess we were lucky because our room was not near the highway and we had no trouble with noise. We would definitely stay here again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: Just come back from 2 weeks at the Tuscana. The place is immaculate. The apartments are lovely. The pool area was great and the staff were really nice and friendly. Im utterly puzzled why anyone could pick fault with anything. We are even thinking about buying a place there as it was so nice.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Roomy condo, great location, great pool!
column29: Just got back from Tuscana this morning, missing it already. The condos are very spacious and we only had a 2 bedroom. Bit of a moan that the second bedroom had a queen bed and our 2 teenage boys were not keen to sleep together but managed. There is a sofabed in the lounge. Seems a bit odd though for a family resort. Pool lovely, staff helpful, great location, can't wait to go back and would definitely recommend.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
