column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: The staff were very nice and the check in went with ease. The rooms were spacious and decorated wonderfully. The activity area was exceptional and the food at the restarant was absolutely wonderful along with the staff. We are looking forward to our next visit and will make Tuscana Resort a regular stop on our visits to Orlando.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed in condo 1301 April 1-7. 1. There are NO trollies for luggage.2. When we opened the door, the entire condo had a stench. I had to buy air freshners. I had to rewash all our clothes when we got home.3. There was not enough towels for 7 people. 4. There was not enough pillows for 7 pillows.5. The bedding was inadequate.6. The kitchen was sparsely stocked with utensils/pots/ware. It took over 12 hours for our freezer to freeze.7 The pool lacked pool towels.8 The shuttle is only operated Mon-Friday.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Great Place to Stay but Beware the Karaoke Till Midnight
column29: After reading numerous positive reviews on this site about Tuscana I knew to ask for a unit far away from the Interstate to avoid the heavy traffice noise. We had a unit in block 1 right next to the swimming pool (#1204) - we had a side view of the pool from our balcony and a front view of the car park - not a problem. This unit was lovely and peaceful the first night until "Axel Rose" kicked in with his karaoke until 12pm on the 2nd night and occassional subsequent nights thereafter - probably being more than once a week because of the Easter break. Don't get me wrong we are no old timers and love a good old sing song, however, when you are up at 7am to get to the theme parks for opening to then spend 13 hours walking round them, all you want to do is come home and flop into bed - this was impossible on all the occasions the karaoke was playing because it was far too loud and "Axel Rose" liked to scream through the microphone at every given opportunity. Robert, the duty manager did offer to move us accross the car park but we decided against that because we didn't want to waste half a day moving everything that had already been unpacked. He did speak to the bar owners, who are in charge of the karaoke nights, and made sure that it finished at 11.30pm prompt, which we did appreciate him doing. This would not put us off returning as we feel for the money it is a great value place - however, next time we will make sure we are not right next to the swimming pool and within such close proximity to the bar.On a separate note the food in the bar is AMAZING, especially the burger and chips!One note to the owners of Tuscana - because we were there at a very busy time of year the pool was very crowded and in constant demand and the beds went very early in the morning. We did notice quite a few people coming down very early before 8am(!) to reserve their beds and then not using them for quite a while after. This makes it very unfair for those that genuinely want to sit by the pool there and then.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We actually got there a couple days early and after an 18 hour car ride the last thing we wanted to do was to check into another hotel just to pack up and move a couple days later. The people we spoke with at reception were very helpful and were able to check us into our unit immediately. We stayed at another condo type unit a few years back and weren't sure what to expect when we opened the door. We were in bldg 9 all the way in the back, which has good points and bad. Its much quieter, but further from the pool and main building. We were very pleased when we entered the unit, it was a very big 3 bedroom condo. It was very clean, beds were comfy, kitchen was equipped nicely for a vacation. The people at the Tavern were more than welcoming. We ended up staying for 9 of our 13 nights. We had some medical issues and needed to leave early. The staff was very friendly and did their best to make sure our stay was enjoyable.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed at this resort for 10 nights in March 2010. The staff was friendly and the complex was very clean. The big issue that we had with this site was the fact that it is next to Interstate 4. We were initially given a condo in block #6 which is the closest to the Interstate but after complaining about the highway noise, we moved into block #1. This was a better site but we could still hear the traffic noise from the balcony and even when spending time next to the pool.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Best bang for your buck - immaculate Tuscana resort with its super friendly staff and wonderful amenities.
column29: Dear Linda,  I am writing to thank all of you at Tuscana for a truly wonderful stay. We rented a three bedroom Tuscana condo for a month because my son and his wife, who lived near-by, had just had their second child and we wanted to be close but not an inconvenience for that long of a time frame. The three bedroom condo at Tuscana was like a dream come true. It was immaculate and exquisitely furnished. We felt so at home. We were able to prepare our own meals and do our laundry which was such an economical plus. We were even able to bring Great Grandma along and she was pleasantly surprised at how easily she was able to get around. The heated pool and spa were amazing despite the colder weather, which I'm told was not the normal Orlando winter. We especially enjoyed the food at the Tuscana Tavern and Restaurant and found the prices reasonable. For anyone who hasn't tried them, the homemade potato chips are out of this world! With two little grandchildren living near-by we hope to be able to return to Tuscana again and again. Thanks again to the friendly and helpful staff. We truly had a great time and it was extremely hard to pack up our car and return to Upper Michigan.  Sincerely,  Nancy and Jerry Leaf Ewen, MI

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Nice if price right but not without issues and not 4 star
column29: Stayed here for 2 weeks in a 2 bed condo with my hubby for the last two weeks of Feb 2010. Having read the reviews before we travelled and now having been there, I can actually see why there is such a mixture of reviews. There are good aspects to this place but it felt to us as if they ran out of money half way through. On arrival it all looks fine at a glance but there are silly things that simply let it down and the owners need to invest some, but not really alot of, money if they really want to compete against the millions of other properties on offer in the area. You do need to be concious that some blocks are next to the interstate but we asked for the furthest away and couldnt hear any road (or indeed any other) noise at all. There is no maid service and the towels you are given at the beginning are yours for the entire stay. The barest of supplies are suppied and you will have to go shopping to stock up on loo rolls, shower gel, dishwasher tabs, washing powder etc. The only thing we were given enough of was washing up liquid and soap but there is an excellent Publix less than 5 mins drive away. Internally, the condo had a really old and dark feel to it and smelt musty, the carpets were hoovered but stained and the furniture and fittings were of cheap quality. Our balcony was permanently in the shade and had a view of the car park and bins so we didnt use it but there were others that seemed to have a lovely view - think we were just unlucky. The white goods were all great and worked well. The beds are comfy but the pillows are shockingly naff as are the blind / curtain arrangements in the bedrooms. There are two small venetian blinds at the windows that do not span the entire width and dont meet in the middle either so do nothing to stop the light getting in. There are curtains either side of the window but they are only about 4" wide and are purely decorative. The pool area is lovely but the pool heater was broken while we were there so we were only able to swim in the pool once during our 2 week stay. The hotel claim this was due to unusually low temperatures but we had 3/4 days in the high 60s and 70s so I just dont believe this, especially as there are reports spanning several months with the same complaint. The temperature in the hot tub was never the same twice and ranged from freezing cold to absolutely boiling and because the pool was so cold it was what most people 'swam' or rather dunked in during the day. There is no wireless internet and the cabled internet in our condo did not work once during our entire stay. We have been to Florida before and wherever you stay you tend to need to drive or be driven so you do need a car here but you would anywhere in Orlando. You are probably not more than 20-30 minutes from any of the attractions and within 10 minutes drive in any direction there are more restaurants than you could ever visit during a holday - the Chillis restaurant at the drive into the resort offered great value, with a good menu and service. I must say that the bar staff at the Tuscana were all so friendly and couldnt do enough to make you feel welcome. The food was also surprisingly delicious and served with a friendly smile. Dave and his wife really do put such a lot of effort into keeping it a clean and happy place and there was always a nice ambience there (day or night). If the price is cheap and/or the weather good then Tuscana would be good as a base and if it was smartened up and a little bit of time and attention paid to the finer details, this would actually be a lovely haven away from the madness of the parks. Unfortunately, we paid full whack for this and although overall we had a good holiday, it was because we made it one away from the resort and we would not come back here as we have stayed in far better (Bahama Bay is also 4 star and similar price but is way way better).

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Recently, my wife, son and I stood at the Tuscana Resort for 8 nights, [March 2-10]. It's in a very convenient location...about a half-hour ride from the airport, and right off the I-4 highway. It's a gated facility, and you need a four-digit pass code for the gate to open.We booked a one-room unit thru BJ's Travel, and were pleasantly surprised when we were upgraded to a two-bedroom / two-bathroom unit. I had read in prior reviews that there were hardly any one-room units, and others had also been upgraded. Check-in was a breeze. We bought the $39 "Insurance-Policy" considering that our 4 year-old was with us, and something could get broken. It was really nice to have the washer and dryer in the unit, as well as the full kitchen. We took the 10-minute ride to the Publix market and stocked up on groceries. There are six buildings and we were in building 5 on the third floor. We were in unit #5307. Our balcony overlooked a wooded area, and you could see and hear I-4 traffic, but we didn't mind. The front of the building overlooked the Reunion Golf Course. I think it was the 16th green of their "Tradition" course. The hot tub was super hot and clean. The whole pool area was beautiful, but it never got warm enough for us to enjoy the pool. I guess this was the coldest winter in Florida since 1958. There's a nice pub attached to the pool area. Thursday nights they have Karaoke which was a fun time.We didn't spend much time at the resort. We traveled all over Florida. Locally we enjoyed GatorLand.... a must see. We also took the drive to the Kennedy Space Center followed by a stop at Ron Jon Surf Shop in Cocoa Beach. Last year we stayed at Caribe Cove Resort, which was very similar, but we liked Tuscana a little better. Tuscana had the security gate, pub and convenience to the I-4 highway.I'm sure we'll be back again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Great Value, Great Location, Cheap Supermarket and Restaurants Nearby
column29: Why the mixed reviews? Excellent value for our money. Clean, comfortable, private, close to Disney but nicely off the beaten path, so we could enjoy peace, quiet and sanity upon returning home from the theme parks. Nice Publix supermarket nearby, with inexpensive but tasty restaurants to choose from. We stayed nine days, and never contacted the front desk with any complaints or requests because everything was so well taken-care-of already. I've never bothered to write a review before, but these folks really deserve your business. P.S.: You'll need a car to enjoy this hotel. Shuttle to Disney only departs once per day.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Resort was lovely and condo more than adequate. Only complaint and it is minor is that there is only a couch and one chair for seating in a two bedroom unit. Staff very helpful and we had a nice dinner at the on-site restaurant. Stayed in 800 building across from clubhouse and was very quiet. Would return.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed at the Tuscana for 7 days and overall it was a fantastic experience and a really great value. We will definitely consider staying there again in teh future.The entire complex is very well kept, not at an official five star hotel category level, but everything is clean, functional and most of the staff are very friendly and helpful, too. We had two little issues which might not a be an issue for most people at all. First, we arrived very early. Of course we knew official check in time was 4p, but we tried our luck anyways. And yes, we had luck, we were told we could have our suite any time after 1 p. So we went grocery shopping and came back at 2p just to be told the suite isn't ready and won't be any time soon. It was ready at 4, but you kind of rely on them, if they tell you you can have it earlier. One of the Ladies was very nice and apologetic about it, the other very rude and unfriendly.The other issue revolves around the Tuscana allowing pets. We never had issues with animals on the property, but since I'm very sensitive to pet hair and it causes me breathing problems, I had issues with pet hair in the suite. The carpet seemed to be shampooed and everything was nice and clean, but there was still the odd hair. There always is. You can't avoid it. So I would like to see the Tuscana to designate 100% pet free apartments in the future, for people like me. Some people mentioned the highway passing very close by. It hasn't been an issue at all for us. Our building was facing away from the highway, so we heard nothing at all, but we even talked to people living in the building next to the highway, and they said it is only an issue, if you keep your windows open at night. Otherwise you will more likely hear your fridge or the AC than the highway. So we already started saving for our trip next year. See you then.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I have to say this was the worse place I have ever stayed . The room was dull and dingy. Don't know when was the last time someone dusted - dishes, napkins and placemats displayed on dining table were full of dust as well as the black stovetop.Also, broken dining chair if one of us sat in it we would have been hurt.They claim this place is 2 - 3 years old would love to know where they found the furniture, it looked like it was in excess of 20 years old.The noise was unbearable between the highway traffic and the family above us we did not sleep. Sounded like a herd of elephants above us, someone above coughed all night, we could hear it like they were sleeping next to us. Not a pleasant place to stay.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Very easy to find, we had no problems checking in or out. The 2 bedroom condo was very clean and comfortable. The kitchen was well equipped and the bed nice and comfortable. We enjoyed the pool and the food in the resturant was very good.The staff were very helpful.We could not find anything to fault the Tuscana as a resort. We will definetly return.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: This is probably our 4th time at The Tuscana and it gets better every time.
column29: From our reservations with Beliza, to check-in with the front office staff, to my follow up with Erika, it is always a friendly, accomodating staff that greets us. The room is always clean, very roomy, and makes us feel like we are at home. We have stayed between 2- 4 nights each time we have traveled. We travel with 4-8 people each time. Our stay has everything we need. We can rent a movie, play in the arcade, use our computers and game consoles with the internet, swim, workout, or just hang out on the outside patio and enjoy a beverage. The stores and restaurants in the immediate area are convenient. Then any attractions are just an exit or two away. The staff is the best when it comes to making us feel welcome. I can't say enough about the whole package. It's just perfect. We have promised ourselves to not stay anywhere else!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Very good for what we wanted
column29: -except for the internet connection in our room everything was almost perfect. - Respecful staff- within walking distance of 6 restaurents, Publix supermarket, Walgreen pharmacy, and 2 convenience stores- no smoking in the appartments, fresh smelling- inexpensive service (food and drinks) poolside

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: i've been holidaying in florida for a number of years i came across tuscana about 21/2 years ago and have been back several times since. the condo's are so spacious and clean, the pool area is wonderful. tuscana is my kids favourite holiday destination,we used to rent a villa but this is much more fun....the pool bar/restaurant is a really friendly place to relax after a day at the parks or shopping and the food is excellent and very reasonable.i.ve recommended tuscana to friends and all have returned having had a great time.i would like to thank the staff at tuscana for always making it a very welcoming place....keep up the good work.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Clean, fully equipped, well situated, and friendly
column29: Everything was clean, all the appliances worked and the only maintenance issue, (an unlockable patio door), was fixed the next day. The cold weather limited pool use but the warm and friendly pool-side restaurant/bar staff made up for the chill. We had to put to use the condo furnace, (it worked on the first try), made use of nearby food market and off -site restaurant, (Chili's), and played golf at near-by courses.We are going back as soon a possible but will request a room sheltered from the highway traffic noise, the only flaw we encountered.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I ave stayed at this resort for the past three years and found the personnell Robert, Karen, Elsa and Alisha very polite, friendly and professional--thye are an assest to this organization

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We just arrived back from our trip to Orlando Florida, and stayed at the Tuscana Resort in Davenport, by Champions Gate, for 12 days. It was disappointing to say the least. We (family of 5 ) arrived at 2:30 in the morning to our 3 bedroom condo (which was in the building 6 “right” beside the Interstate 4.) After a long flight, I was just turning back the sheets to tuck my kids into bed, when I saw blood all over the sheets, the pillow, and the comforter, all four beds were checked, and 3 out of the four beds were covered in blood.Well at 2:30 in the morning and the office is not open at night our choices were very limited. All of the extra blankets in the closet had blood on them, as well as the pillows. It was enough blood to make you question if there was a stabbing or something happened in that room. The dresser still had chips, and other stuff in them, and we found a medication container in the closet, and yes I took pictures of everything! In the morning after talking only to the front clerk, (the manager wouldn’t/didn’t even come out to talk to me) I guess maybe the bloody blanket that I spread out at the Hotel Office, for everyone to see, and my cell phone with all the pictures on it convinced them that maybe they should move us. However they had wanted us to pay for the cleaning fee, as we were already in that condo, -that didn’t happen though! Our next condo was much better, however we didn’t receive a phone call from management who we were told wanted to speak with us, and we had to track him down to speak with us, (3 days later.) I would’ve at least appreciated an apology for the condition of our room. The other issue we had was that the website says that the pool was heated. We did have not the greatest of weather, but the pool was so cold that the kids were playing in the hot tub, and the pool was “suposedly”set for 84 degrees, everyone was told. The Tuscana actually is quite a nice place, but the management is what bring this place down! If Management actually existed maybe our stay would have been better!People- there are so many places to stay in Orlando and surroundings –WHY STAY HERE. If I was to give advice to anyone about this place I would say: Go and enjoy yourself somewhere else this place just doesn’t deserve your time, money or efforts, and find a place that they actually value their customers.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Resort was beautiful, poor customer service!!!!!!
column29: We arrived in Orlando after driving for twenty-four hours. Not that this was their fault, but the weather was really bad for the 1200 mile trip we took. We went into the lobby area to check-in and were ignored by the staff for about 5 minutes. It was 1:30 and were informed check in is not till 4 sorry, but we will take a deposit of 300 on a credit card/debit/credit that we will give back to you in 30 to 45 days or you can pay a non-refundable fee of 39 dollars! We signed everything and informed the young lady (had no clue) that we would really like to get a shower. She did offer to let us use the pool shower rooms, however we need to come back no earlier than 4. She was actually paying more attention to the older lady behind us then my husband and I. (Frustrating). We then were informed they have pool towels, but if you do not return them before check out there would be a 10 dollar fee. We came back at 4, checked into our room, room looks just like the picture. The only prob with the room was the outlet cover was broken for the internet. We informed the staff and they simply brushed it off. (We didn't care about it being broken, we just were not going to be charged for something we didn't do). We were allotted 2 rolls of toilet paper and one packet of dish washing detergent. You are informed to buy anything else, that is all they allow per stay. Then, when you went to use the toilet there was a sign posted if anything other than toilet paper plugs this toilet you will be charged a $50 fee. I started thinking to myself, am i going to have extra charges when i leave this place? We were in the last building all the way in the back, perfect! We didn't hear anything, it was absolutely serene. On the second day, we went to the pool and asked for towels, sorry we are out! Third day the same, then the last day of our stay we asked for some, they actually said, "you are checking out tomorrow". My husband's response was "Yeah and we have only came down for towels three times and you haven't had any, im getting the freak n towels and you will have them back tomorrow!" Also, the third night of our stay, my husband and i went to use the hot tub, the heater wasn't working and this is after they supposedly fixed it. Their customer service was very poor and maybe they don't understand because they are sitting at a desk all day checking ppl in and out, but when you spend a lot of money to take a trip, the last thing you want is crappy customer service and to be treated as if you are trash! The only person that helped us was named Elsa Soto, (not sure of the spelling). She acted like we existed and was truly kind. Thank you!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Would return in a heat-beat--great value for money"
column29: 1. Ease of check in2. Maintenance staff excellent --called for broken D.V.D---8:30 p.m.--less that ten minutes he was at the door with a brand new D.V.D., hooked it up and didn't leave til he tested it...now that's service.4. Restaurant on site was really good. fish and chips best we've had..prices very, very, reasonable.5. We were on ground floor...lots of noise from above, but when we called front desk it only took one courtesy call from the desk to the offending tennants and like magic no more noise. Upstairs tennants are probably not aware that there is little or no insullation between floors.6. Hopefully they get the heater fixed in the pool....it was rather chilly.....7. If ever going to Orlando again and need a condo I would return to Tuscana for sure.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Our stay at the Tuscana was overall a good experience.There is one young lady who works the front desk(I am guessing in her 20's).Very non chalant and unhelpful.I called for directions when leaving the airport getting her to even tell me what major freeway they were off of was like pulling teeth.When I arrived she was not friendly she basically said "I need you to pay a non refundable security deposit or i will charge$ 300 to your credit card".I had no problem putting the $300 on my credit card after I was explkained WHY.She lacked customer service skills!I thought to myself "If this how the rest of the staff acts I will not ever spend another dime here"The good thing is they have another lady (blond middle age) Very nice and helpful.This is a nice place to stay,but nonhelpful staff with zero customer service skills can make you spend money elsewhere.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: There are plenty of better places than this in this area
column29: Spacious apartment, clean linen, lots of extras linen and towels. In a very convenient location for Parks and Gulf Coast. All this was overshadowed by the fact that the apartment was shabby, unclean and all the walls and furniture had dirty marks on them. The window blinds were broken in 2 bedrooms. There was a bad smell on entry which we feel was contributed to by the soiled pull up nappy we found behind the nightstand in the second double bedroom. Staff were not helpful, unlike staff at other places we have stayed at in the Florida area

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: The apartments are nice and spacious - although quite remote without a car - but unless you are ok sleeping with a six lane non stop motorway running past your bedroom window i wouldnt recommend. After a first sleepless night listening to trucks constantly thundering past (the headboard actually vibrated) we went straight to reception to be told by the unhelpful clerk (who seemed more interested in standing outside smoking) that nothing else was available until 5 days time. Nothing we said make any impression, she was totally disinterested and casually informed us that the block next door to us was even closer to the interstate than were (we were block 5, block 6 runs right up to it). 5 days later (after learning to sleep with earplugs) we went back to be told there was still nothing available. We asked to see the reservations manager who was apologetic that there was nothing but promised we could definitely move in 4 days time (9 days into our 14 day holiday). he even gave us the number of the apartment we could move to. We thought a peaceful last 5 days was better than nothing so duly turned up at reception on the allotted day (after packing up, stripping beds etc) to be told no-one knew anything about this, nothing was available, the relevant manager wasnt in that day and there was nothing they could do. We were really upset. We saved for 2 years for this holiday and I feel very angry about the way we were treated.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Our family loved it! The condos are great! They are spacious and very comfortable. I loved having the patio to relax outside after a long day at the park. Having separate bedrooms gives everyone space to rest after the parks. The full kitchen helped us fix quick breakfast before hitting the parks and saved us lots of money. The resort is 5 min from the grocery store and a pharmacy.The pool area is large and beautiful...we didn't get to use it as we got to experience the record lows in Florida. We loved having the casual restaurant with great food and delicious drinks.The location of the resort is perfect, right off the highway to give us easy access to the parks but the resort is quiet and relaxing. We really didn't ask for much but the staff was friendly and accomodating. I personally appreciated the free internet access, free parking and no resort fee!! We didn't have to pay the cleaning fee because we stayed 5 nights. We did the $300 deposit and didn't even notice it in the credit card. By the time we got home it was released.Overall this resort was perfect for us! Great value, lots of space, very comfortable and great location!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: When we arrived to check-in, the staff were a little nonchalant, but friendly. We had a groung floor, three bedroom apartment which was in Block 1. This is nearest to the club house & pool area. It was very spacious & clean. 4 TV's, fully equipt kitchen, washer & dryer, everything we needed. The internet access was down when we arrived, so I advised reception the next day. It took 4 days of gentle reminders to get it fixed, but in the mean time there was a business centre in the clubhouse which had 2 PC's for internet access. The pool area was great, a large heated pool, (very) hot tub, unheated kids pool, pleanty of loungers and several cabanas. There is a pool-side bar area that serves drinks and food which are reasonably priced. It's run by a lovely british couple, who are very friendly. We were in Florida to get married, and they kept the bar open late that night so that we could carry-on when we returned to the Tuscana after our reception. There is a Chilis restaurant at the bottom of the road (about half a mile) along with a Publix supermarket, Wallgreens, McDonalds, 2 petrol stations and other stores. The other good point was that there was no pushy time share sales at all, it was just come, stay & enjoy - which we did. The only real draw-back that I could see is that it is along-side the I4 and the apartment blocks furthest from the club house could possibly be quite noisy. We are planning to return this year and will stay at the Tuscana again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: I don't Get the Bad Reviews
column29: Be sure you read everything when you book and read the reviews before you go. There are some quirks (such as the $300 deposit, the cleaning fee and the rules regarding garbage, toilets and bringing your own toiletries) but all in all this was an amazing place to stay. It was to ochilly for the pool but the pool area was great and the hot tub was awesome. The bar and snack area ia amazing. Rob was wonderful with us on our first day down there and we frequented the bar and snack area. The drinks were good and strong and the food was amazing. The prices were very good for the Orlando area. The room was more than adequate. The bathrooms are nice, there is granite everywhere, and the beds were comfortable. We had 8 adults in a 3 bedroom condo and we all fit fine. We cooked breakfast in the condo and ate out mostly at night. The place was quiet and the people were all freindly and helpful. The only issue was that the sheet on the pull out couch was very dirty when we arrived. The front desk gave us a new one but said "You are just in time, this is our last one" so that kind of creeped me out cuz I could have been the next person to ask for one. Overall, a great trip!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Excellent Resort - definately will stay again
column29: My husband and I got married recently in a hotel in the Champions Gate area. We chose to have our extended families stay at Tuscana Resort. We booked a total of 10 condos. The staff were very accommodating at trying to keep our party together, even though they could not guarantee that everyone would be near each other. After 2 days at the hotel, my husband and I moved to Tuscana Resort to be nearer our family. The condos are spacious and come with everything you would need. The pool area is amazing and was great for everyone to hang out together on our days off from the theme parks. The onsite cafe serves amazing Fish and Chips and our families had alot of fun bonding over a few beers after a busy day in the parks. The staff were very helpful to our family from assisting with Tee Times for the guys golf outings to giving the girls the inside tips on shopping.We are all looking forward to coming back to Tuscana Resort!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We came accross this place on the web and saw that it had recently been built, so we thought we would give it a try, and it was perfect. Everything from the location, room, attractions and staff. The room was amazing, full size kitchen and dining area with all the facilitys you need (dishwasher,washer/dryer,oven,microwave,toaster, kettle,blender,fridge/freezer,plates and cutlery. All rooms came with onsuites, and the belcony gave us a beautiful view of there very own golfcourse. Inside the resort is a poolside bar and grill which has a fantastic menu perfect for both adults and children, made by exellent chefs. The staff were very freindly and always made sure we were attended to, and that are experience was a good one(especially bar owners Janet and David Gallacher). It also has a great pool perfect for children and a hottub perfect for the adults. It is in a lovely location just a couple of miles from disney with everything you need around you(shops, supermarkets, drugstores, gasstations and restaurants. I met some really great people at this resort and i really look forward to coming back.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Nice apartments but some of the rooms were very close to the interstate, we had to wear ear plugs too sleep. Thomas Cook booked us in a 2 bedroom apartment instead of a 3 bedroom, the 2 bedroom was quiet but the 3 bedroom we got moved to was very noisey. Pool was not as warm as others we have had in florida, hot tub was too hot . The equipment and furniture in the apartments was very basic, we only has four chairs for six of us.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: This facility is convenient to Orlando attractions, but don't mistake it for a resort atmosphere. It is more like staying in an apartment development. The unit was spacious, but the carpets were very stained and soiled. The furnishings are inexpensive and most unattractive. It is definitely not a luxury facility, just adequate. There was considerable noise from the people upstairs walking around and children running. I would not stay there again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed at the Tuscana for my BF's Bday. Seaworld is a ten min drive from Tuscana. When we arrived we were told there was a $300 deposit to be placed on one of our credit cards OR a non-refundable insurance fee of about $35 dollars for damages. You tell them which one you want. No way were we paying the non-refundable insurance fee. I mean for what? We were basically just showering and sleeping there. Our stay was for only two nights. If you stay I think less than five nights then there is a cleaning fee of $65.00. Upon reading the page long contract (read it before you sign) at the very end of the contract it read that you had to take out our your own garbage. My BF and I asked the clerk at the check in desk why did we have to take out our own garbage? Wouldn't the cleaning fee of $65.00 cover that? They said no. The check in clerk said we had to take all our garbage (kitchen, bathroom, etc..) and walk/drive it to one of there dumpsters. If you left your garbage outside your room they would also charge your credit card another fee. ARE YOU KIDDING ME? I couldn't believe it. We also couldn't get any sleep because a cheerleading squad stayed at our building in multiple rooms and made noise by running up and down the stairs and screaming til 1:30 am. We complained about them, but nothing was done.Good things about the place: It was roomy and clean.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Great for those with kids and on a budget!
column29: We stayed here for a week during the Christmas holiday. We arrived after 12 am. It took a few minutes to get someone to tell us how to locate our keys. This was a bit frustrating. We had a two bedroom condo which was equipped with everything you would need to do basic cooking. Minus the food. There were 2 adults and 3 teenagers. There was plenty of room and the bathrooms were very nice. I would suggest that you bring extra towels, and stock up on snacks for the evening. The café closed early and it was a bit difficult to locate healthy food after 10 pm. The resort was no more than a ten minute drive to the Disney theme parks, Sea world, and Universal Studios. Given that we stayed a week it was great that parking was free. There was plenty of parking . It was a bit cold so we did not try the pool. However, other guests that we talked with said they really liked it. I would recommend anyone who wants to do Disney and save a few bucks try this place. We were very happy. We also booked the room through a timeshare program and got tickets to 3 Disney parks and Universal Studios for 5 people. We thought this was a great deal. All we had to do was listen for 2 hrs and say no at the end. As parents, that felt like a pretty easy thing to do. Given that we do it all the time anyway  We really did have a great time.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Excellent Value, but has room for improvement
column29: The property is just 10min drive to Disney and 30min to the airport. It's very easy to access from the interstate. Comfortable apartment has granite slabs and some very nice features, like an Elevator in every building, free internet in the apartment. The carpets were not very clean and the furniture was cheap. The furniture is NOT kid friendly and has lots of sharp edges which is dangerous for toddlers. We has to buy all basic supplies, including soap and shampoo. We will certainly consider this location when we visit Disney again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I always read trip adivsors reviews before i decide on an accomodation and the website got it spot on. The condo was extremely spacious, clean and well maintained. The staff are amazingly friendly and cannot do enough for you which is what you want when you are on holiday. The location is excellent in that along the number 4 interstate you can get to disney in 10 minutes, seaworld, discovery cove, aquatica and international drive in 15 minutes, universal in 20 minutes and busch gardens in roughly 40-45 minutes. The best aspect i found about the location of tuscana resort was that at the end of a tiring day at theme parks i was able to return to the comfort of the condo in a nice quiet location and totally relax. The amenities provided in the condo were beyond my expectations, dishwasher, large hob and oven, microwave, 3 tv's one in each of the bedrooms and one in the living area, but the best was having a washing machine and dryer as i was able to bring all my clothes home clean. make sure to go to the orlando premium outlets off exit 68, when i come back next january i will not be bringing much clothes with me as on top of the already cheap prices there was the january sales and i got so many bargains that i ended up paying 100 dollars for excess luggage coming back home.Overall the Tuscana Resort is the best place i have ever stayed and believe me i have been to hundreds of hotels, already planning our next holiday to florida and will 100% be staying at Tuscana.......thankyou for making my first trip to the USA an amazing experience

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: A group of us stayed at the Tuscana Resort recently while we attended a conference nearby. We were impressed with the very friendly and supportive staff who went out of their way to ensure that our stay was successful. Everyone found the units clean, well appointed and comfortable. The location was perfect for us, a short distance to the center of where we needed to be. We also loved the fact that the outlet malls and attractions were so close by. Thank you for being so welcoming and helpful - everyone was very appreciative and enjoyed their stay. We would all highly recommend the accommodation at this great resort.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: It was very nice, and spacious
column29: We found the Tuscana World Resort through an on-line travel booking system. The cost was $155 per night, for a 3 bedroom with kitchen. The room was incredibly spacious, with one bedroom at the front of the apartment, and 2 at the other end - this was nice since I have young kids, and didn't want them to hear us late at night. We were a 10 minute drive from Disney World, and 3 minute drive from tons of amazing golf courses. The one thing that I did not like about Tuscana was the dirty carpets in the room we stayed in. My in-laws stayed in a different room, and their carpet was much nicer. Having said that, the rest of the apartment was very clean. People who wish to stay here should be aware that Tuscana is not a hotel, and therefore no products, such as shampoo, soap, dish detergent, laundry soap, are provided - they do provide a starter kits, so you get one of each, but be prepared to bring your own. Also, the maid service is only after your departure, so don't expect someone lese to make your bed. As long as you know this in advance, it is a great place to stay.Lastly, the pool is very nice, warm water, nice play area for children, and a nice bar.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I like to read reviews and always feel that the people who complain about places might just have too high of expectations...the negative reviews about this resort are on par. I wasn't impressed because of the build up made by the website and other positive reviews. The resort was a let down in many ways.I had called a few days before our trip to just make sure we didn't need anything else to check in then we already knew. The lady who answered the phone was short and not very friendly. We stayed in a Super 8 on our drive home with friendlier staff.The internet wasn't wireless which was a surprise...it wouldn't have been a big deal if the cable actually worked. We had to have a technician come in and fix it only for the internet to give out 3 days later. We went in January and were planning on going swimming because of the advertised "heated pool" and "hot tub". The pool was not heated. The hot tub was a WARM tub and we froze trying to get it to work.The $300 deposit made us both very wary about using or doing much in the room. It felt like it wasn't our for the week but on loan and that if we dirtied the tiniest thing we would get charged for it. I felt like I had to be overly concerned with the room which made it slightly less enjoyable to stay there. We aren't pigs either but we didn't know how they would judge us on our stay just to get a buck.The location was alright. It was very desolate. There wasn't much life around the resort. Our veranda looked out at ugly brush. It also was in a prime spot next to I-4 which you could hear from the porch. When 9pm hits, the staff goes home and you are there alone. I've been to 3.5 star resorts that have atleast a nightguard in the guard box. There guard box at the gate into the rooms was just there for show. It is labled "guard box" but is completely empty. The curtains in the bedroom weren't able to close at all which let in a lot of sun light in the morning. When you're on vacation and would like to sleep late, it was fairly impossible.The in room dryer took 2 1/2 hours to dry. We had to check out and find a laundry mat in florida to finish drying our tiny pile of clothes that we wore that week. Overall we weren't impressed and we would not return to the Tuscana Resort. They have the potential to be really nice but they fall too short.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Absolutely disgusting....blood on the comforter and feces on washcloth
column29: I booked this "3.5 star resort condo" through Hotwire and was very displeased with the unit we received. After a long day at the parks, we arrived and I jumped into bed. I immediately noticed blood stains on the underneath side of the comforter. The next day I went to get a facecloth and noted brown stains in two different spots. I contacted the front desk using the front desk button on the phone and continued to get a busy signal. I contacted Hotwire and they spoke to the resort. The resort assured Hotwire they would clean the unit and the front desk button on the phone does not ring front desk so don't use it. The 2 items were removed when we returned but a worn towel was still there with pubic hairs entangled in it and the toilet was still filthy. The worst part is the resort calls itself "self-catering." This means I had to strip the linens, empty the trash and pay a housekeeping fee of $39! Avoid this place especially if you have any concerns about bloodborne pathogens and/or dysentery!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed at this lovely resort in December and did not regret our choice. The property was well maintained and it was everything we expected. Tuscana is well located, very close to the attactions that Orlando has to offer. Our one-bedroom condo was clean and spacious enough for us to feel like we were not in a hotel room. The staff was courteous, helpful, and anwered any questions we had to ask. Parking was convienant, the property was quiet, and the pool area clean. The food was delicious with a good variety of choices. Games and DVD's are available upon request. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Tuscana and will recommend this property to our friends. Management made us feel special and addressed our every whim. We are already planning our next trip to Orlando, and will stay here again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Wonderful - comfortable, spacious, everything we needed and more
column29: Stayed here for 10 days over Christmas and New Year in a 3 bedroom condo (Room 8308) with my husband and 3 year old son. Comparing this to other self-catering accommodation we have stayed in all over the world, this is wonderful accommodation and one of the best we've been in. Check-in was short and sweet which was what we needed after 3 flights from Belfast to Orlando. Entrance to parking lots is by a private 4 digit code allowing access via large electronic gates. Our condo was easily reached by elevator to the 3rd floor. The kitchen had large fridge/freezer, cooker, microwave, kettle, dishwasher and at least an 8 piece set of dinnerware and all necessary cooking utensils making breakfast and making own meals very easy. The large washer/drier was invaluable and easy to operate. Everything was clean and dust free.The 3 very good sized double bedrooms were immaculate, as was the en-suite (with an enormous shower) and the main bathroom (with a bath/shower combi). There was always PLENTY of hot water day and night. Each of the 3 bedrooms had good bedlinen and pillows with extra blankets for the cooler evenings; in each bedroom there was also a television and a wardrobe (one was a walk-in wardrobe). The sitting room had a sofa bed and 2 chairs, a coffee table, a large TV and a DVD player. The balcony (which was conveniently screened in for safety and to keep us bug-free) had a table and chairs set where we ate our breakfast and enjoyed a cuppa late at night when the weather/temperatures allowed. My friends stayed in a 2 bedroom condo and found it to be more than enough space also with all the same excellent facilities; however, they were in Block 4 which was at the roadside and noisy at night whereas we we were in Block 8 which was very quiet day and night.We did not eat in the on-site restaurant as we cooked our own meals with food bought from the nearby Publix and SuperWalmart or we ate out in local restaurants - we highly recommend the Cracker Barrel at Exit 55.The pool area was clean and attractive and the jacuzzi was very hot indeed. The 'business room' consists of 2 PCs and a printer which were adequate for the Internet access that we required.Driving to and from Disney, SeaWorld, Universal, outlet malls, airports etc was easy as it is so close to the I-4 but when traffic congestion built up on the main road it was also easy to use the other roads to get to and from 'home'.I highly recommend this resort to anyone looking for selfcatering with style, expecially those with young children who want a separate bedroom for their young ones so everyone can get a good night's sleep after a long day at Disney. We would definitely return to Tuscana.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: this resort is not what it looks like on the net the restaurant is more like a public cafe how ever the britsh family that run it make you welcome. the accomodation is very basic and not what the read up says.the kitchen is not very well equipped we found it hard to cook a meal in the room be warned On arrival we had to pay a deposit of $300 dollers which you get back 48 hrs after you depart but virgin holidays do not tell you that you have to pay this IT TAKES A BIG CHUNK OUT OF YOUR SPENDING MONEYThe company that rent out the accomodation let the condos out to big groups of teenagers which was very disapointing to find teenagers sitting in the hall ways and stairs . good points are the pool area,free internet and a small gym all in all we would not return to this site.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Great resort and perfect for Disney.
column29: I spent 2 weeks with my wife in Tuscana just before Thanksgiving. We had a 3 bedroom apartment which was far too big for just the two of us, all 3 rooms are double bedrooms, the master contains a large en-suite. The resort itself has a large heated pool which was perfect for the lazy non park/shopping days. Location wise the resort is perfect, it's a 3 minute drive to the I-4 and only 2 exits to Disney or 16 to Universal - Sea World ( roughly 20 minute drive). I look forward to returning in the future.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Good location, good value--great pool, okay accomodations
column29: Not luxury--the pillows are flat, the sheets thin--but for the money, it worked for a family gathering of 40 people with different expectations. The pool is excellent--the hot tub, VERY hot--and the place is easy to get to whatever else one comes to Orlando for. For the $59 per room we negotiated--it worked, though you must follow the rules and advise the front desk of any items in room that are missing so you won't be charged. The 'fitness center' has seen better days--needs work. The cable Internet access was FREE, but slow if you are use to DSL.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Great location, rooms, all you can want!!! Easy access, great for WDW!
column29: Stayed at Tuscana in mid October 2009 for a week. Was in town for a convention. Location right off of I4 at exit 58, just a few miles from the WDW exits. 15 minutes to I-Drive and the convention center. 5 minutes to DisneyWorld. Publix, 24 hour Walgreens, gas and a Chilis just at the entrance road to the resort. Drove in from Tampa, took 45 mins. Cheaper airfares than MCO. I had a 1 bedroom room. Very clean and spacious for 1 person. A family of 4 would have plenty of room. 1 bed and 1 pullout sofa. Queen sizes on both. Full kitchen, however no microwave. I was in a handicapped room which only meant that I didnt have a vanity in the bathroom and had a shower wand. Excellent water pressure!!! Soap and shampoo and even toothpaste provided. Very nice touch. Staff was very helpful at 11AM check-in, was in my room in less than 10 minutes. Top notch security, not that they need it, but there is a controlled gate that you enter a pass code for. I felt like I was entering my own palatial Hollywood Hills estate! Bed was very comfortable, two huge closets in the room. Hair dryer, ironing board and iron in the room. 2 tvs, no VCR or DVD however, but I didnt need either. Washer and dryer in the room which is awesome. Huge bathroom. Very clean throughout!!! Full size refrigerator. I didn't have any cleaning during the week I was there, and to note there is a $39 fee or if you choose, a hold put on you credit card upon check in. I did the $39 resort fee since I was on an expense account. No hassles at all, wonderful check-in experience. Pool area is awesome. Very nice grounds, and excellent hot tub. Temperature was just right for the pool and hot tub. Karaoke in the evening and pool side snacks and drinks!! Pool open till 10PM. Very easy access from any building in the resort. I was on the 4th floor, there are elevators and had a great view of the neighboring golf course. My unit did not have a patio since it was a 1 bedroom. The other units have a screened in, very nice patio with chairs and table. the larger units look very nice as well, I poked my head in one being prepped. All in all a top notch stay, excellent location, quiet, a little away from the hustle and bustle of the LBV and Kissimmee area but still very close and with easy access to I4. Will definitely stay here again with family on a WDW trip!! I booked through Travelocity. Fantastic job Tuscana Resort and staff!! Check out was equally easy, wish I could have stayed longer!! See you again! Bill C-Alameda, CA Note---Try Seito Sushi just a few miles away in Celebration.. excellent Japanese in the wonderful town of Celebration!!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Where do we start, just off the I4 at jct 58 is a good place, that is where you will find the gem they call the Tuscana World Hotel Resort. Just driving up the approach road makes you feel a million dollars, then it appears the condo of all condos. Just to think you could have paid twice as much and had twice as little as what this place has to offer for the price.Okay enough of the small talk, I understand why we flock to the Orlando area each and ever year, the weather, the Theme Parks, the food and the really BIG cars that run on very cheap fuel, but sometimes the accommodation can let you down, not this time I say and I will say it again, not this time, forget the reviews on here that run this place down, it is by far the best you will get at the right price, we have traveled as far west as we have east on this small planet and have stayed at some very high priced wooden shacks, but this beats them all.Moving on to the people that run the bar and food section within the resort, just remember they are English and Americans working flat out to make your evenings last into the small hours, what can I say about Janet and Dave, yes Janet it was the best Haddock I had eaten this side of Harry Ramsbottoms (Blackpool Branch), I hope you do not remain land locked for much longer and can visit the branch for yourself.To end on a high note, just book this place and I promise you will not be disappointed in anyway shape or form, good people, clean rooms, close to all the attractions (no more than 20 mins from them all) and for everyones sanity eat the Haddock or Janet will hit you about the head with her very well manicured hands, and they are big hands just ask John.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: A very relaxing room and surrounding area.
column29: This was a very nice and quiet area. We experienced some delay in getting our room only to find out that they did not have a two bedroom that we had reserved. We were given a 3 bedroom instead. It was very nice but cost us a couple hours at the pool with no room. The front staff was not very friendly and I had to keep checking to see what was the statis of our room. Once we finally got our room it was very nice. The pool area is very nice. Very clean and rooms were very clean. Short drive to attractions. Eating was mostly in your condo, as I didn't see much as far as restaurant type eating. We ordered a pizza. Ordered attraction tickets from a service for a discounted price and the lady delivered them right to our room, paid with a credit card right in your room. Very pleased with her knowledge and suggestions. Front desk will give you her number. If you know your plans she can hook you up with everything you need. We went zip lining and I would highly recommend, if you do not have a fear of heights. It is about a 1 1/2 hr drive.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Just got back from the Tuscana after having stayed at other resorts over the last few years. Personally we had nothing to complain about whatsoever it was a home from home. The condos were very clean and very well equipped. This is the best place we have ever stayed at in Florida and we will be booking next years trip for there again. It really is only 10-15 mins for Disney and extremely easy to get to. It was also great to know that there are supermarkets, restaurants etc on your doorstep. There have been some negative reviews on this site.We have come to the decision that some people are too fussy and would find things to complain about wherever they stayed. Just remember this is not a hotel and you are responsible for all your own cleaning, making beds etc. The pool area and bar are also very well looked after and the jacuzzi is great.We had a two room condo and it was huge and both bedrooms were ensuite with a walk in closet.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: TUSCANA -- ALL THE COMFORTS OF HOME IN A GREAT ORLANDO LOCATION
column29: With easy access to I-4, and Publix, Walgreens & several restaurants close by, these beautiful 2 & 3 bedroom condominiums are ideally located for vacationers to Orlando. Each fully furnished unit has 2 bathrooms, a DVD and TV in every bedroom, a fully equipped kitchen, a washer & dryer, and a screened balcony. There is a beautiful swimming pool with shade cabanas and a large deck area, a kiddie pool, a movie theater, a cafe, an exercise facility, and elevators in every building. The staff is caring, friendly and helpful. One caveat - if you plan to stay several days, I suggest that you bring (or purchase) extra soap, tissues, and toilet paper because only 1 roll of toilet paper per bathroom is provided, the bar of soap is very small and tissues are not provided. Also, we discovered that cell phone reception in some of the units can be spotty although good reception can be had on the balconies. We had booked at Tuscana because of a wedding that we would be attending at a hotel nearby. It offered more comfort at a better price than we could get elsewhere in the vicinity. To say that we were satisfied, would be an understatement. We and the other wedding guests LOVED the place. It exceeded our expectations!! The beds and linens were so-o-o comfortable and the pool area was wonderful for swimming, lounging and hanging out. The housekeeping was outstanding Everything was clean and inviting. Several of our friends said that they liked it so much that they were going to plan a family reunion there and others said they cannot wait to return.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: We are returning to Tuscana again for Christmas/New Years!
column29: We stayed at Tuscana over the holidays from Dec 27-Jan 3 2008/2009. We had a family of 3 with a young child and two grandparents. Our reviews are a bit mixed about this place, but definitely the pros outweigh the cons because we are returning again this year for the same week. You could definitely do much worse in the world of Orlando condo/time share rentals!The PROS:Amazing pool. Large, resort-like, relaxing, and ample lounge chairs. Nice layout of 3 bedroom units. Modern kitchens + washer/dryerThe screened-in patio- we ate breakfast out here every day!Proximity to Disney- 10-15 minutes by car depending on trafficThe CONS:Could be noisy at times. Stairs, people above you, doors slamming. Also if you are along the freeway that noise could be heard at all times. We had no "starter" stuff in our kitchen- had to purchase sponge, dishsoap, DW detergent, paper towels for cleanup, etc. Bring those or be prepared to purchase.Crazy parking lot- lots of near misses every day. Just drive carefully and be on guard!Slow elevator!Notes about the general area:We were unhappy with Publix prices and selection of groceries, they were out of many things. We drove on the I-4 one exit past Tuscana (heading away from the Disney area) and exited on to the 25/27 and found a wonderful Target off of Homerun Blvd. There we stocked up with groceries and goods that we needed for the week. Also, we found we spent a LOT of time at Celebration, FL (just a few exits up the I-4). It's quaint shops, great restaurants and Starbucks location made it an unexpected favorite destination. In fact, we spent New Year's Eve there and will do that again this year. Overall this was a good experience and we look forward to returning, noise and all! The pool made up for any noise we had and the location can't be beat!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: LUXURY!!! This is the place to be!
column29: I just came back from our Orlando excursion and wanted to share with the WONDERFUL feedback regarding my experience at this property. We drove up to Orlando and were running late ( not difficult to believe as we ARE from Miami), I spoke to the reception area regarding a possible late arrival, they assured me that I would be serviced and to call if I ran into further difficulties. Checking in was a breeze, the security gate was a blessing, and the room and property were immaculately clean and impressively spectacular. After surveying the beautiful property, I went to the room. Not only was the room spacious and beautifully decorated, but welcoming and inviting! Plenty of towels and amenities. Our only trouble (small) was a loose shower knob in the guest bathroom. The next morning, I went to the office and spoke to the front desk regarding the knob; a few hours later, the knob was fixed and we received a note regarding who had come in and what they did. This was a courtesy that impressed me greatly! We enjoyed our time in Orlando and heavy hearted checked out of our LUXURY accommodations. Checking out was another breeze and we headed safely back to Miami. Overall, the experience was amazing! My only negative feedback would have been the online website. The picture originally there did the property absolutely no justice! I was SO pleased to see the website went through a great revamp!! I work in the travel industry and am accustomed to great accomodations, Tuscana far exceeded these expectations!

column27: Good facilities, quiet but convenient location, helpful staff
column29: We were a part of 6 - and we all felt that this resort was perfect for our needs - we would definitely stay again

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: i stayed in this resort for 2 weeks in August 2009 with my wife and 7 y.o. and 10 y.o. Had previously been in Orlando but mainly in pool homes before. We flew in to Orlando International and the resort is about 30 minutes from it and located right off the interstate. Check-in was fine and the apartment was huge - we had a 3 bed and it was really roomy. We were looking out on a golf course and if you book definitely ask for that. Place was real clean though I noticed some "guests" left rubbish bags outside their unit but the staff picked them up fairly quickly. Location is great for disney - only 5 miles and access to the interstate is great. It was busy but never crowded and the pool is great for young kids. We got a great deal booking direct & I'd been recommended by a friend who stayed their last year. Will definitely go back and would recommend...

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Excellent resort - particularly for british families
column29: Stayed for two weeks from August 15th to 29th. This was my 6th trip to Florida and my partners first and I have stayed in both villas and hotels before. This is by far the best resort I have stayed in and would recommend it to smaller parties i.e. those who aren't big enough to warrant a private villa rental. The restaurant and bar area are run by an English couple who clearly understand what the British look for in a holiday resort. They have been out there 4 years and will give you all those little details that a travel rep just wouldn't know or wouldn't tell you because it wouldn't make them any money! For example, we watched the space shuttle launch from the bar area and it was visible from the exact spot that the bar said it would be! Despite the fact that Florida offers a different type of holiday from what you would get in Europe, the pool area offers you that little bit of holiday that we all want i.e. a place to relax at the end of the day with a beer and the kids entertained! The pool area states that it closes at 10pm but my 9 year old was still safely swimming with other kids at 11pm whilst you are close enough to sit and relax with drink without worrying - the pool area is big enough that you can still have full view of your children. There is a small games room for kids and all machines are only 25 cents which means they can be entertained for ages for a couple of dollars. One night, we put a dollar in the pool table and not all of balls came out - told the barman who opened up the table and told us to play free all night! You wouldn't get that in Europe! The hot tub is great for adults but too hot for the kids! Its like having a bath! Food in the pool area is fantastic value - good quality, freshly prepared and extremely well priced. would highly recommend the fish and chips (this was recommended to us by the guy in the liquor store on our first night!). Extremely well located to everywhere - disney is about 15 minute drive but don't come off the I4 to join the 192, take the toll road 429 which takes you into the back road to disney - no cars or traffice whatsoever! The $40 pre-paid toll road fee at the airport is probably the best spend - you don't have to worry about coins or coming off the road to pay - they just read your licence plate. Karoke night is a bit loud but not that bad. Condos are better equipped than most UK homes - don't believe what the travel brochures say - there is a washing machine and tumble dryer in every one although limited space to dry clothes that can't be tumble dried - you basically have to hang them on the back of chairs or in your closet!. Our air-con broke three times whilst we were there but the minute you tell reception the maintenance guy is there within the hour and they always give you the option of him coming in whilst you are not there. Reception staff are not particularly professional looking buy are helpful but they don't tell you how to work the pass code to open the gate - I think that is the highlight of their day to sit and laugh at you whilst you try to find the keypad for the code! The keypad is located right outside reception, a good 50m before the gate - if you get to the security lodge and haven't entered a code, you have gone too far! Overall, an extremely well located, clean, quiet, secure and good value resort that is highly recommended for families. There is a Publix, subway, macdonalds, walgreens, chinese, 7eleven and chillis at the end of the road - you could walk it but the road is not well lit at night so I wouldn't recommend it but it is all about a 1 minute drive away. We are planning to return to Florida in two-three years time and would stay here again. My partner thought it was the best holiday he had ever been on and loves me for choosing this place! We are planning to return to Florida in two or three years and would definitely stay here again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: This was our first trip tp Florida and we found that Tuscana was a great place to stay. The condos were well equipt and very clean, the staff were friendly and the surroundings very good. We were there the same time as the basketball teams and that was fine they well behaved and no problem. The good thing about using this kind of accomadation is that you can go off and do the parks in the day and still have time to unwind in the evening by the pool and the children still get chance to meet newfriends. The restraunt and bar are good and publix is an exellent supermarket just two minutes away.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: This was my second staying in Tuscana, I loved it, very relaxing location. Its about 15 miles and 15 minutes to the centre of International Drive. There are plenty of nearby shops, the Public supermarket is 2 minutes away along with a Chili's Tex-Mex Restaurant, McDonalds, Pizzaria, Liquor Store, Walgreens Pharmacy and a Chinese Restaurant. 3 miles away off Exit 55 on the I4 is another shopping centre with JC Penny and a load of other stores. In the other direction up the I4, go down the 192 (Irlo Bronson) for loads of shops a flea markets and Old Town Kissimee etc.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I found the Tuscana Resort to be very nice. I have to agree with the other reviewers that the noise between the floors (we had a family above us with little kids) got a little loud ... but it wasn't anything that was unbearable. Only 1 night it seemed the kids above us were running around late (11 pm) ... but other than that .. it was okay.Check in - this was quick. I asked the resort to send me a PDF of the bill which I'd prepaid - including the 39.00 property fee - so when I arrived to pick up my keys, I showed them the print out which said I was paid in full - and I picked up my keys and left. Took all of 10 min.First Impression of Condo - VERY NICE. We had a 3 bedroom/2 bathroom unit on the 3rd floor in the 8th building. We couldn't hear any noise from I-4; the unit was really large and very nice. There was a check list on the coffee table, and we went through it to make sure everything was there. The dining room table was set up nicely; the dishes appeared to be clean, but just to be on the safe side, I loaded everything into the dishwasher and washed all the dishes with the 2 little dishwasher soap tablets provided.Towels and Blankets - in the master suite which had its own bathroom there were 4 extra towels, 2 extra pillows and 3 extra blankets. Also, in each of the other rooms there were extra blankets. In the smaller room with the 2 beds, there was also a vacuum and iron and ironing board.Bathrooms - Very clean. In the master suite bathroom there was also a hair dryer.Washer Dryer - Clean and very efficient. We washed all of our clothes before leaving - and it was nice not to have to return home with dirty clothes.Park Destinations - VERY CLOSE. It took less than 10 minutes to get to the parks.Mall destinations - Close. It took about 20 min to get to the malls.
