Exit 72-Sandy Lake Road had lots of places to eat and shop.Supermarket - Very close. The PUBLIX supermarket was very close and larger than I expected.Would I return - definitely.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We thought the condos were excellant, we were amazed at how well equiped they were with plenty of space and very clean. Security gates which made it feel more protected. Free internet so we could keep keep family at home updated with pictures.Pool was nice, staff at the tavern were friendly and the food we had was great value. plenty to keep the childen happy and a great base for the parks. Fitness room which was equiped enough for Holiday excercise!! There's a cinema but we didn't get around to using it. Supermarket really close, chillis which we had god food and service at. We were there at the time the basket ball players were there but really no bother at all, We have been to Florida a few times now but would definately book the Tuscana again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: An pleasant base within easy reach of the attractions
column29: OOur trip was a three week stay primarily for the theme parks but our three bedroom condo was a very pleasant resting place that we would recommend for anybody who wants fresh, clean rooms in easy reach of a friendly restaurant. The service staff might deserve more than the three stars we rated them but we had little need to visit them so we can't really say. We can certainly say that on the two occasions we went to them they responded positively and professionally. (Note to self - maybe tick the fourth star if I remember.) The pool area is kept clean, with no towels draped over empty loungers like in European resorts. Dave and Janet run a very friendly restaurant and bar with their staff of Darlene and Rob and I urge you to eat there during some of your stay. Any or all of them will drop by your table and shoot the breeze with you. The menu is a simple one but the food was always good. Always check out the specials too because Chef Rob loves a challenge and he hit the spot on all occasions we were there. Disney and Universal parks are a 20 or 25 minute ride away as are a whole treasure-chest of shopping outlets. ATM and grocery shops are just 1 kilometer away.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: My family and I stayed at Tuscana for a little over a week. We loved it. The two bedroom condo was very clean and well maintained. We drove 20 hrs from Canada and the staff was very quick to get us into a room. The resteraunt staff went above and beyond my expectations. We will be returning again this march break..

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Beautiful clean resort with friendly staff!!!
column29: My family and I just recently spent 10 days at Tuscana Resort in Davenport ,Florida. It is a beautiful, well - kept resort that is centrally located just minutes from all tourist attractions. The staff were all very pleasant , informative and couldn't do enough to make our stay enjoyable. The pool was clean, and there were plently of lounge chairs and cabanas. The rooms were spacious and kept clean. I would definetly recommend Tuscana to all my family and friends from Long Island , New York.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed at the Tuscana while in town for a basketball tournament because it is one of the sanctioned housing options for YBOA. That is probably part of the problem with the complex. Most of the units receive heavy use by teenage boys and their chaperones and the condos and the complex are showing the wear and tear. The first unit we were assigned had filthy carpet and a very strong odor. I went back to the front office and basically had to force the lady working there to move us. She said they were booked up starting the next day and if I didn't take that condo, someone else would have to. I explained to her that that was not my problem. Finally someone from housekeeping came and agreed that the condo needed some work, so they moved us. The next one was marginally better, but at least didn't have the strong odor. Perhaps because of the large number of teenagers (the pool was a packed at night with kids), there was a lot of trash in the hallways that seemed to stay for days. If they are going to rent to a basketball tournament, they need to ramp up the cleaning staff. Also, for some reason, no one's cell phones got service inside the buildings. You have to go outside to the parking lot to make or receive a call. This is definitely not a place to be unless you have to for a tournament. If we return for the tournament next year, I will be finding other housing options.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: The service was crappy. Room was nice close to store and bank. We stayed at the condos for the YBOA Nationals in Polk Co. When we got there Our door was open. My phones did not work, shower door didn't close and tv was out of order. We had a 3 bedroom with only 6 towels when I asked for more the front desk guy acted like I had asked for his first born... I will not stay here again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: estube 8 dia en tuscana y me encanto , todo limpio , todas las camas eran comodas, la cocina bien limpiesita . los baños limpios todo bien bonito deberas q. si me dejaban me quedaba a vivir ahi . ese aire acondicionado estaba brutal deberas q. me encanto se los recomiendo.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Staff was rude to guests while we were waiting to check-in. Guests were only requesting blankets. Would never choose to stay here again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We had people above us that tennants of the resort. From the time we got there until the time we left we thought there was a wrestling match above. They started stomping early in the morning until late at night around 2-3 a.m. The first night we called the staff onsite they told us that they would call the tennants above us to quiet down. I guess that made them mad and they started to stomp harder. I called back to the front desk and they told me I should call the local sheriff. We couldn't even be moved to another room. When i asked to speak to the manager or someone in charge they were never there. I'd be better off staying at a Motel 6 at least the front desk would do something about the noise.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We decided to head to Orlando for my birthday and chose to use Hotwire at the last minute booking the Tuscana Resort. We had a 2 bedroom. We were told to expect a resort fee of around $20/day. Not true at all. We stayed 2 nights, so there was a 'mandatory' cleaning fee of $57. The rate is closer to $70 for a 3 bedroom, if you stay less than 5 nights.There is also a mandatory deposit of several hundred dollars or a non-refundable charge of $39 for insurance. I had not expected an extra $100+ charge for $75/night room.At check in, there is one woman at desk. So if there are people in front of you, get comfortable. She's the only there to deal with everyone. Our room was in the building the furthest away, which was nice, but the quality of the construction was much shoddier than it appeared from the outside. Our room view was of a sign saying something like 'no trespassing' and our other view was of all the air conditioning units. If you go, expect lots of families w/ rowdy children. Further, our A/C did not work. The maintainence guy determined it needed freon, but since it was the weekend, no one could help. He wasn't certified to add freon, so it would have to wait until after we left. The pool area was fairly nice. The kiddie pool was filthy and full of garbage and mulch. It also 'closed' very early compared to the larger pool. Overall, I wouldn't stay again. There are far nicer places in the Orlando area, closer to the theme parks, with friendlier service, and with lower or no fees.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Fantastic condo for a fantastic price
column29: Arrived home 2 days ago from 2 weeks in Orlando. This was our third trip to Florida. The last trips we were in hotels but now our daughter is 11 we felt we needed more space and we got it!! These condos are great. Lots of room , spotless , well kitted out. It was great to have a washer and dryer, everything was washed and ironed before we came home. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The pool was nice and most of the time quiet. The Publix was a 10 min walk and had all you need. We stayed in Kissimmee in the past and it is handy for walking to Old Town ect , Tuscana is out of the way so you do need to use the car for all trips. We are not talking long distance here , Disney 15 mins , Airport 30 mins , Universal 20 mins. Its all very easy I-4 east for attractions , I-4 west back to condo. We would definatley stay here again and highly recomend it.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment for 2 weeks at the end of May 2009, the apartment had more than enough room for the 4 of us, and everything we needed. This is a great bases for a disney/universal holiday, it's so easy to find and a really easy drive to everywhere. I would stay here again and recommend it to friends. The pool area was nice and very clean. The gates are a really good idea because you know that cars can't drive in unless they are staying there. We felt safe and had no problems what-so-ever.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We just got home and I had to get this review in. We spent 7 days at this resort and it is the best place we have every stayed. The pictures on the web are exactly what the resort looks like unlike other places that the pictures are deceiving. We had a 2 bedroom condo by I4 and we could not hear any noise from either the road or other people. The staff was extremely nice and helpful any concerned that came up were handled within minutes. The thing to remember when booking this resort is that these are individual self service condo’s. This means there is not maid or room service and all cleaning is up to you. I like this because it makes it more like a home away from home. The washer and dryer made if very simple to keep clean linens and clothes and the full kitchen made it easy to have good meals without constantly having to spend the money to go out. We will return here often and you cannot go wrong. This is a 5+ star place.Florence, KY

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We have just returned from 17 nights at the Tuscana Resort and I can report that we found it to be a very clean resort with good in-room amenities and a nice pool area.The condos are huge and the kitchen provided all the equipment needed to make it easy to stay in and cook if you wanted to.It took about 15-20 minutes to Disney and 20-25 to Universal.My only complaint is that the staff in the office are not friendly at all, in fact they come across as quite rude to be honest. If the management read this, you really should upskill them with regards to how to be more friendly!!That said, they didn't retract from our enjoyment of the resort and we would definitely return.Finally, we did ask to keep our room for an extra couple of hours beyond the 11:00am checkout time, but were told by the rude staff that if we wanted to do this, it would cost $50.....given that we only paid around this for each night, I thought that this was a rip off and we didn't take them up on it.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: El apartamento es precioso. Tiene de todo, muy limpio y bien decorado. Cerca de todos los parques y del aeropuerto. Hay un supermercado y farmacia cerca, muy conveniente. El area de piscina es muy bonita . Excelente sitio para quedarse con la familia.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: My family and I stayed at this resort during spring break and had a great time! This is a very nice resort and you really feel like you're at home. The property is well kept and the pool was also nice. I wish the pool and hot tub were a little bigger, but that wasn't such a big deal. The rooms were clean but the only negative was that I found a shoe(that was not mine) under our bed when we were packing up to leave. The resort is close to disney; there is a 7-eleven and restaurant on the corner, and the interstate is in close proximity. We enjoyed our stay!!!!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: NOT a hotel, indifferent/rude staff- just a pool and a place to sleep
column29: Sure, you could get by and have a decent holiday staying at Tuscana- but you could also do much better in the Orlando area. We (family of 5, kids 14, 8 &6) stayed 5 nights and didn't particularly care for the place. The pool was nice but the restaurant/bar owner shouldn't be in the public service business- he gets overwhelmed easily and shouts and abuses his staff. His poor waitress was almost in tears a couple times that we dealt with them and he completely screwed up/forgot/ grossly undercooked our order. The front desk staff keep bankers hours and seem to be more concerned with selling realestate than running a resort.The worst part, tho, was getting locked out of our room (all three keycards quit) at 10 PM after a day at EPCOT. The emergency call-out guy was angry at us!!? (Your staff programmed the keys, buddy. How were we to know that they screwed up?) Minimal compensation was offered- worked out to about $7 off our room price so we packed up and got a much better deal at the Universal HardRock.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Nice condos and a nice pool area. Great for kids!
column29: We just got back from a week at the Tuscana. We stayed in building 9 which is the most remote building and is nice and quiet. A little bit of a hike to the pool but tolerable. About the pool, it has all of the facilities you might need like such a bar service and the food is quite good. Had a really nice steak sandwich for lunch served by the pool. And my wife really enjoyed the pina coladas. My 5 year old boy spent hours in that pool and so did we!The condos have everything you would expect such as washer/dryer, TV in every room, DVD player, full kitchen. You need to buy everything though for the kitchen. All they give you is one small packet of dishwasher soap and a small bottle of liquid soap. There is a Publix supermarket a minute away and a Walmart about 10 minutes drive. The staff was friendly and acted quickly when I reported an issue with our DVD player. It is fairly close to all the Disney parks and they do have a shuttle that runs once a day. I would definitely recommend this place if you are planning to visit the parks, want to cook a bit, and have a rental car.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: The resort was fabulous. We stayed in a 2 bedroom and it was so spacious including a reasonable sized kitchen and a huge dining room. The pool was incredible and everything was so clean. All the staff were very friendly and helpful and responded promptly to any requests. A Publix and a Walgreens are both located about 5 minutes away so it was convenient to pick up anything we needed.The Resort is located just off I - 4 and it was easy to get to both the Magic Kingdom and Seaworld. Take exit 58 and head north about half a mile and turn left (just before the gates) at S Goodman Rd and the Resort is about another half mile. It's about 40 minutes from the airport which was also nice as we had an early morning flight.My only regret is that we did not have more time to spend there.Thanks to the staff for an amazing stay.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I recently stayed at The Tuscana Resort and thought it was brilliant value for money. The condos were very spacious, clean and fully equipped. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. I have to give a special shout out to Dave and Janet who run the bar/restaurant and to the rest of their team; Jordan, Darlene and Rob, who all made my holiday an unforgetable one! Wide selection of drinks at reasonable prices compared to back here in England, food was delicious, thumbs up Rob and Dave! We were so sad to leave and will definately be going back soon.I would highly recommend anyone to go and stay at The Tuscana Resort.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We were very pleased with the 2 bedroom condominium. It was clean and very nice. Nicer that I expected after the pictures in the internet. Has a grocery store close and other options for food. My disapoiment came after I returned from vacation and I checked my credit card and I found a chage for almost $70 done the day that we check in. I called their office and I was told that it was for cleaning service if you stayed less than 5 days. They never mentioned that we will charged for cleaning when we check in, it isn't in the copy of your agreement that we received (but they said that is in the one that they keep). Our reservation was done by points from our AA Awards and they never mentioned these charges either.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: The condos are nicely decorated and roomy. The location is about 15 minute trip to Disney but located near shopping. My only problem was the cleanliness of the condo. The carpet was heavily stained. The bathrooms were not cleaned. Nobody was sent to clean the condo even after telling front desk. I just did it myself because obviously the housekeeping department was lacking. They did not offer to comp the cleaning fee ($35) for me. I was disappointed with their nonchalant attitude.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We found the Tuscana Resort a great place to stay! Our two bedroom condo (in building 8) was very spacious, nice and clean. As described by other reviewers, one needs a car to get around... My three kids loved the pool and after all the expensive theme park food, I found the kids meals ($ 5) at the restaurant to be reasonably priced with generous portions... Much better than the Chili's down the road which was terrible! The resort is a gated resort and one is given an access code to get in and out. The check-in service was ok. It seems they are still struggling with their computer system at times... (Didn't know how to print a receipt...) Overall, I would definitely stay at the Tuscana Resort again!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: If you're planning the parks, stay nearer than this!
column29: Just back from a week in Tuscana. While the apartments themselves are very nice - well apportioned, roomy and quiet, they are MUCH FURTHER from the theme parks than you expect. Disney isn't too far, but we were doing Universal parks - all five of them and we spent a good 30-40 mins driving each way daily. If you don't mind that, then fine.Beware if you arrive late. Your travel agent will tell you they are open until midnight - this is NOT true. They pack up well before 10pm and we were left stranded - the waiter in the bar told us everyone complains about this! We were left with a 'lock box', no directions and 6 or 8 identical looking apartment blocks with no lighting, signage or identificaiton. With 2 kids and a 10 hour flight behind us, we were annoyed to say the least. We held off paying our deposit to see who would come and a maintenance man showed up to lock us out!! After much complaining, the GM (mr brown) apologised, sort of.Tuscana is nice, but be aware of these issues. The couple who run the bar are lovely - were very kind to us when we were left high and dry. Also, not exactly heavily booked so you'll have a quiet time and probably the pool to yourself.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: This place was great... everything is right there!
column29: I'm not sure what's wrong with some of the other reviewers (you know, the ones who used 'frickin' and 'freakin') but I thought this place was great. Its location is only about 10 mins from the Disney parks, and about 15-20 to the Premium Outlets (you'll see them on your left when coming from the airport down to the Tuscana).YOU NEED A CAR IN ORLANDO ANYWAY, so I have no idea why people are WHINING about any distances.The area is very upscale (Champion's Gate) and I have no idea about any trailer park or whatever that other reviewer was talking about... they must have had time to search these out while driving all over the 'freakin' place ;-).The pool was plenty fine wrt size and towels are readily available (you just have to actually ask). You can also just bring a towel from your condo anyway.The staff was great to us - we showed up at around 11:30 (check-in is 4:00) and because the condo wasn't ready (I took a chance), they told us to grab our bathing suits and go for a swim while we waited - and YES - they gave me the 'elusive' towels to use.Beers on tap are Bud and Bud Light ($2.50) and they have about 6-7 beers by the bottle... didn't get any, so I don't know the price - Bud light is good enough to throw back when you're beside the pool anyway. The food is pub fare but the chef always has a really good special on for dinner for about 10-12 bucks (Meat/poultry, potatoes, veg, etc) and they have a child's menu for around $5.We had a three bedroom condo - it was fully stocked with all the kitchen items you can think of - they are there, just look. There is also a washer/dryer, ironing board and iron (why would you), TV in every room, fully controllable thermostat, two bathrooms (main and ensuite (ensuite has roman shower)) and everything was very clean when we showed up - even the toilet seats had those 'seat-sashes' letting you know that it was cleaned.I had purchased a 7-day Disney pass thingy and wished I hadn't. My daughter just wanted to stay at the Tuscana and swim with the other kids... and I HAD to just sit there, by the poolside, at 85 degrees, drinking beer... it was horrible... so I did it every night.Amenities - as you have read, there is a Publix (like a Sobey's for you Canucks) which is a grocery store... with lots of beer/frozen foods/ fresh foods/toiletries to purchase to stock your fridge - about a buck a beer, by the way. There is also a Chili's restaurant, a Walgreen's (pharmacy), a 7/11 w/gas, some bank, a SubWay (sandwiches, not the travel) and a few other little shops. the Publix has swimming accessories for sale (goggles, floaties, flippers, etc) and they are pretty cheap.There are 9 'complexes' on the resort and we were in building 2 on the first floor. We were originally slated for building 7 but it all depends on when you show up and what is ready at the time... so there's no point in asking ahead of time. We were at the far end of building 2 and the walk to the pool was a HUGE 28 second venture (again, more sarcasm to the 'frickin/freakin' people). the longest walk (from the furthest building) would be about 90 seconds... I know - bring the car.Well, I gotta go - there's lots more I want to say but the answer is YES - if you have children - come here. If you like sitting by the pool and having a cold beer whilst your kids are swimming - come here.REMEMBER: You are on vacation - LIGHTEN UP!.. and relax...

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We are just back from our stay in Tuscana Resort and had a great time. We stayed in a 2 bed condo, which others have mentioned are very spacious and are extremely well kitted out with everything one might need for a self catering holiday. It's extremely clean and the staff were very helpful. The pool area is great and while we were there it was pretty quiet during the day as most families were at the parks. It gets busy in the evening when they all return to cool off! There isnt much in the area but again adequate for a self catering holiday, with Walgreens, a Publix supermarket, 7/11 and a Chillis ( which does take out) at top of road before you drive up to resort. Nothing much else in the area but not an issue for us as we had a car - which if staying here is essential. Towels are provided for use by the pool, you just need to ask at reception. The resort is ideally located for visiting the parks as its just off the I4 and a few exits down from The Magic Kingdom. The reason I have deducted 2 points is that we had an incedent regarding trash. Guests are responsible for placing their trash in the dumpsters provided - which is fine and we did every day. BUT, one morning my husband went down to the car( we were on the 2nd floor so a 30 second run down steps) and when he came back about 2 mins later someone had left a large bag containing their trash outside OUR condo. Initially we didnt do anything about it as we thought maybe a cleaner had left it there to take away later. But it was still there when we got up the next day but some animals had got to it and it was spread all over the landing. My husband rang reception to report it and guess what they did? Came all the way over to our condo and left a snotty letter telling us we were responsible for removing out own rubbish and that we were being fined $25!!!!!!!! We were inside and had they knocked on the door the sitiation would have been cleared up immediately. We were quite angry at this stage so my husband rang again to clarify the situation and requested an apology but the person at reception just said it was a fair assumption that we had left it there!!!!! Eh hello, we rang to complain about it origionally and also if we were like that would we really leave our trash directly outside our own door???? I think not!! Ok rant over! Other reason for point dedution is the bar and restaurant was very disappointing. It is not a restaurant ( which was our understanding) but more like pub grub by the pool. And the drinks at bar and pool are very expensive and not good value for money. It's run by and English couple, who are lovely, but unfortunately they are giving English measures and over charging for them. Overall I would definitely return to the resort and would recommend it to others.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: So-so....better than hotel but certainly not as nice as other condos and resorts
column29: I would recommend this place over an average hotel if price was no issue. When you factor in the $1300 it cost for a week stay I would say find a hotel or another resort/condo. The place is very close to Disney. Otherwise it is practically in the boonies. You've got a 711, Publix, Walgreens, and Chilis. Past that is frickin COW FIELDS!!! Directly adjacent to the property to the east is I-4. I mean "I can hear what song every car is listening to" close to I-4. To the west is a dirt road with nasty trailers. The place has a gate at the entrance. That's awesome except for one minor detail. THERE ARE NO FENCES! What good is a gate when a theif could walk 30 feet and be at my car anyways? Pool area is way too small and it was impossible to swim laps due to kids. Small hot tub only held 8 or so people and had freaking fire ants IN it. Literally in the water, floating around and biting you. No towels at pool - must bring your own :( Best advice is to shell out slightly more and stay at a realy nice place or save some bucks and get a hotel

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: 2nd Year in a row at Tuscana
column29: This is the 2nd year we have spent spring break staying at the Tuscana. We were not disappointed. The furnishings still look new, and the beds are still comfortable. Having 2 full bathrooms is great. We never had to go to a restaurant for breakfast, as thanks to the full kitchen with all the needed supplies we made a quick meal every morning. We went home with clean clothes, and packed lighter, thanks to having a full sized washer and dryer. Bring or buy dryer sheets, and a small bottle of detergent. You also will need to provide a few things like paper towel and toilet paper, as only 1 roll each is provided for you. The pool is excellent. The location is terrific, Close to Disney parks, and about 22 miles from the Orlando Airport. There is a restaurant and bar on site, we have never eaten there, and the drinks are pricey, We brought bottled water and fruit into the pool area, with no problems. Internet was available via ethernet for about 12 dollars a week, in the room, It is free in the clubhouse. I did recommend the Tuscana to friends and they also stayed here, and said they liked it as well. We have stayed at lots of different places in the Orlando area, and can safely say this this is the best place we have stayed. We plan on staying again in the near future!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed at the Tuscana for 4 Nights in Late March. The Condo's look brand new and are very well kept and maintained. We stayed in a 2 bedroom condo and it is plenty big and very nice. This is a Condo (not a hotel & not really a resort) so their is not much to do there other than the Pool area. No outside food or drinks allowed in the pool area (might be a Florida Law). The Pool has GREAT hours (open at 5am, close at 11pm) and is HUGE. Kids will have a blast in the pool (heated). No grill or park/playground area in the resort. Close to Magic Kingdom (less then 10 min) and other attractions. This is Directly off of Highway 4, so easy to get on & off (also might be noisy if you are in the last building closest to highway). Downfall: No free WiFi in the complex. You either have to pay for access through ethernet cable or use the free computers in the business center (2 available). There is a Publix grocery store & McDonald's less than 2 minutes away. Overall, Clean, Attractive, & a really nice place to stay.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Loved it here, best holiday ever.
column29: We stayed here for 2 weeks in March and couldn't have asked for more. We feel this was the best accomodation we have ever stayed in. We couldn't believe how big everything was in the condo. We had a 2 bedroom one. We felt in was ever so clean, as new really. Kitchen was very well equipped. Reception were very friendly and helpful. Pool area was fantastic, the children loved it, especially being able to use it in the evenings. We felt very safe. It was also good that they had 2 computers to use so had contact with home. Champions Gate are is lovely. We used Publix supermarket, which is round the corner where the staff went out of their way to help you. We found a lovely Irish pub - Beef O Bradys which had good food (and children eat free on a Tuesday), again lovely, friendly people. Disney parks were easy to reach by car. We also did a helicopter flight and swamp tour which would recommend. If we were to come back would not hesitate to use Tuscana again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: This was the best vacation of my life. The rooms were very spacious and very clean. the kitchen had all the utensils. Disney was only 5 minutes away. We were in building 8. Building 8 isn't by the freeway. I would suggest, that you may need to bring your own towels. This property was amazing!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: The Best way to holiday in Orlando
column29: This was the best holiday we have ever had, partly due to where we were staying. The staff were very helpful and the whole resort was very clean. Our two bedroom condo had lots of space and everything you needed including a washer and dryer so you can travel light if you want. The pool area is fantastic and within easy walking distance from all condos. The bar/restaurant is run by a "Brit" called Dave and he is a top guy. Within easy walking distance of a chillis restaurant if you fancy a wander out and don't want to take the car. There are various other places nearby as well such as a Publix, 7-11, a pizza spot, chinese takeaway and a pharmacy. Located with very easy access to the I-4 it takes about 7 mins to Disney, 12mins to Seaworld/Aquatica and about 15-20 mins to Universal Studios/Islands of Adventure, it also only took me 45 mins to get to Busch Gardens.Just to put right some of the complaints by previous reviewers:"You need a car to stay here"- You need a car in Orlando full stop!"The staff are rude"- No they are not at all. Very polite and helpful."It is not like a proper hotel"- Because it is not a hotel and does not claim to be."It does not have 24 hour security"- Yes it does.To some it up this is the perfect way to do Florida with all the benefits and space off a villa whilst having some public areas where you can enjoy yourself and have some social interaction and other meet people.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Tuscana is a great property, we will be back!
column29: My family of 5 (2 adults, 15yr. old, 12yr. old, 4yr. old) arrived yesterday and was greeted by wonderful staff in the beautiful front lobby. We got to our 2 br. condo and we were impressed with the amenities and cleanliness. The unit barely looked used Everything we needed was provided. People who complain MUST remember that this is NOT a hotel, but a self-service property, meaning you can't expect concierge service or a hotel-like environment. The properties that are near the highway are for long-term stays, so for foreign travellers, this may not be the right property for you. For our family, it was perfect. The only issue was a small amount of left over trash in the kitchen trash can, but I'm not a germophobe, so not a big deal. Our kids enjoyed having their own room and own bathroom and I enjoyed having a walk-in closet and a washer/dryer. We will be be back!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Our condo looked like it had never even been used! It was beautiful, extremely clean, and big! I have two boys under 4 and it was fantastic! It was just a few minutes drive down the highway from Disney, the pool was awesome for kids, with a beach walkin for little ones (18 mths old) and the pool was only 4.5 ft deep at it's deepest and HEATED!!! Most of the units are within a very short walk to the pool and you'd swear this was a resort in the Caribbean. The staff were very friendly and we wished we could have stayed longer. When we go to Disney again, we will definitely be staying here. The only, and I mean only downside was that the splash pool wasn't heated so it was a little too cool for the kids. Otherwise GREAT and would totally recommend!!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: My family and I stayed at the Tuscana resort in Champions Gate and will be returning again in the fall. The Condo was clean and very spacious, with everything you need. Less than half a mile away is a Chili's where you can walk to for diner of a few margaritas. 7-11 sells .02c a minute phone cards to call home. Walgreens is the cheapest place to buy cigarettes in the area, and Publix the grocery store is lovely and clean and lots to choose from. There is a liquor store next door to Publix and the bloke is lovely that owns it. As for the condo the only thing I would say is if your a light sleeper do not book a ground floor and go for the 4th floor there is an elevator to get you to the top. The walls are paper thin and so are the floors so if you have someone that walks hard of kids jumping up and down they sound like they will land in your living room 4th floor super quiet.The pool is wonderful with a hot tub, the bar area is run by a fellow Brit Dave and he is lovely. He does a good breakfast and lunch on the weekends. We met some great new friends and at night if you like to see nature you can catch a glimpse of the raccoon in the bin by the pool. Very funny!!! As for getting to everything like Disney, Sea World and shopping the resort is just off the motorway and a 5 min drive to Disney, 20 min from the airport and the shopping is easy to get to. I highly recommend going to the mall of Millennia as the outlets are good but still high street prices. At the mall you get better quality and newer styles at the same price. Don't forget to get plenty of dollar bills for the toll ways at a $1 a pop. By the way there is no scams with this place I booked with last minute and it is all the real deal. No time share presentations no obligations no extra hidden costs.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: I Though It Was A Great Place
column29: I obsolutely loved this place. My family and I stayed for a week and we have no complaints. Everytime I went to the front desk, they were wonderful, they helped me with what I needed at all times. It is a very peaceful area and at a great price, we do plan to go back next year. The area is so clean, the pool was very clean, I don't have anything bad to say about the place. I can care less about a 24 hour person at the front desk because when the office people were there they helped out a great deal. We had a late flight so we got to the hotel at 12:30am and at the front door stands this nice young lady and gentlemen with my reservation and keys. Let me remind you that I was suppose to check in that afternoon at 2pm so I never called to inform them about us coming as late as we did. (That Was A Gamble) It was a very, very, very easy check in I have ever had in my life at any Hotels/Condo. It is close to all stores and if you have a car, Universal, Disney and all the other adventure parks are only 25 minutes away, which I thought was wonderful. As far as security goes every night we seen a security person driving the little carts around the area, because we was on the first floor so we really felt safe. I was so suprised to see the condo, it had a kitchen with all the amentities, washer & Dryer, Iron Board, T.V in each room (so no fighting over who watching what) and the decoration was beautiful from the dinner ware on the tables to the wall and the bathroom I couldn't stay out of. I never wrote a review and I'm glad I'm actually getting the chance to express that Tuscany Resorts I recommend to other visitors, family and friends..IT WAS GREAT!!!! :0)

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Stayed hear for two week at the end of January through to the beginning of February, so lets get the bad stuff out of the way first. It seem strange with the golf course and the land available in this area why they choose to build some blocks less than a stone throw from the I4 and I therefore understand how noise could be an issue for those staying in these apeartmentsAccess to the resort is through a large gate and by punching in a four digit code given to you at reception when you arrive, there are no other sign of security not even a fences around the resort and therefore makes the gates seem rather pointless.The apartments are clean tide and well equipped except when it comes to the televisions there was one 21 inch and two 19 inch no HD and no Flat screen , if each condo was selling for 360,000 dollar in 2007 surely one could have been provide in the sale?There is no maid service except when you leave therefore cleaning the apartment , and clean bedding and towels etc are all down to you during your stay here,Although it would appear from my critic above I would be reluctant to return here nothing could be further from the truth, we both enjoyed our stay here , as it was quiet during our time here regardless of the I4, also it is well a way from usual tourist traps of International Drive and Kissimmee but is close enough to a Publix and few other shop for the day-to- day provision without having to venture on to the I4 with its east and west access very close to the resort Exit 58For those who wish to visit Disney Parks or Down Town Disney it is no more than a exit or two on the I4 east The pool is clean and tidy and the gym was quite well equipped also a pool towel is provided

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Has potential but very DIRTY AND NOT MAINTAINED.
column29: I read the reviews prior to booking this resort and was hoping to find a "hidden gem." NO SUCH LUCK. When I walked into our 3 bedrm. suite, there were stains all over the carpet throughout. It looked like a child with a sippy cup went all over spilling his/her drink. Apparently the maid didn't notice. Also, the shower in the master bedroom was not clean. Someone else's hair was still on the floor. I reported both to the front desk and they told me that they would note the stains. When we returned from dinner the shower had been cleaned. Of course, I had bought cleaner and disinfected it myself prior to using. (Great vacation) The suites are actually very large and nicely set up. If the resort took the time for cleaning and maintenance, it would be a great resort. I got an awesome deal on this room so I cannot complain too much but I would have rather paid more and stayed elsewhere. The pool area is actually nice and does offer a bar and small cafe. This is the best part of the resort. However, this was listed as a 4 star resort on the site that I booked it. It would be lucky to receive a 2 star rating. I cannot believe that it is associated with Wyndham. I would only recommend this resort if people were going to stay in a regular room (Holiday Inn, Days Inn). They could pay the same amount here and get 2 or 3 bedrooms. Just bring your cleaning supplies and don't pay $150 or more cause it is NOT worth it.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed, with another couple, in a 2 bedroom condo. The condo was very clean, nicely decorated and very roomy. We never felt like there wasn't enough room for the 4 of us. Each bedroom had its own bathroom and walk-in closet. The pool/hot tub area was clean and big enough for quite a few people. My only complaint about the resort itself was that the staff were not very helpful, nor were they very hospitable. However, we really didn't need them for anything, so it didn't matter!The resort is very easy to find, close to Disney, Universal Studios, and other attractions. There is a Chilis, with great service, very close by. We also found the 7-Eleven, Walgreens and Publix to be very handy.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: To call this a hotel is really a big stretch on the imagination. Firstly there is no 24 hour service at reception and I did not notice any night time security - a big NO NO if you're considering bringing kids. Location is pretty good, fairly close to attractions and unfortunately the I-4. If you get a room close to this forget about sleep. Would not recommend and will NEVER stay here again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: To call this a hotel is really a big stretch on the imagination. Firstly there is no 24 hour service at reception and I did not notice any night time security - a big NO NO if you're considering bringing kids. Location is pretty good, fairly close to attractions and unfortunately the I-4. If you get a room close to this forget about sleep. Would not recommend and will NEVER stay here again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We went over Tuscana Resort for two weeks during Christmas time. There were good and bad points. Let’s begin with the good ones. The resort is well located for Disney Parks, it takes a 10-15 minutes to drive there. There is a grocery, a drugstore, some restaurants nearby. If you need to go to Walmart or HomeDepot, you will have to drive 10 miles. The condo we rent was nice, clean and very spacious. The whole resort is very clean as well as the pool and the exercise room.The bad point is that it is very very noisy. The building is almost new but, as many others in Florida, is not really insulated, the structure is weak, the walls are thin – some of them are located directly along the I4 (the highway). Then you cannot rest. Sleeping at night is a challenge. The doors are not adjusted correctly, instead of closing they slam and when it does, all the building shakes (daytime as well as knight). It seems to be like that in all the resort, even in the office. The heat pumps are noisy and are installed directly under the bedrooms windows. Even when the windows are closed, you hear people talk, shout, have arguments. Early in the morning, you hear the laundry trucks, landscape tools, etc.We cannot say for other time of the year, but while we were there, it was the party all around and late at night. As the office is closed at night and there is no guardian, you cannot tell anybody. Then if you make a reservation at this resort, at least, ask to have an apart behind the building (as the parkings are in front) – it might be more quiet. Look at the resort plan to choose a building that is not too close from the I4.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Si dormir n'est pas important pour vous
column29: Version française à la finTuscana Resort Davenport = Tuscana Resort KissimmeeNous avons reside au Tuscana Resort durant deux semaines à la période des Fêtes. Nous avons constaté de bons et de mauvais points. D’abord les bons : Le Resort est très bien situé par rapport à Disney, environ 10 minutes de route. Il y a une épicerie, une pharmacie et quelques restaurants à proximité. Le condo que nous avions loué était beau, propre et très spacieux. L’ensemble du Resort est très propre ainsi que la piscine et la salle d’exercices.Le point négatif, c’est que c’est très très bruyant. L’édifice est pratiquement neuf, mais comme bien d’autres bâtiments en Floride, ce n’est pas vraiment isolé, la structure est faible et les murs sont minces – quelques bâtiments sont situés juste à côté de la I4 (l’autoroute). Ainsi, vous ne pouvez pas vous reposer. Dormir la nuit est un défi. Les portes ne sont pas correctement ajustées; au lieu de fermer, elles claquent et quand ça se produit, c’est tout l’édifice qui tremble (le jour comme la nuit). Il semble que ce soit ainsi dans tout le Resort, même à l’accueil. Les thermopompes sont localisées juste en-dessous des fenêtres des chambres. Même quand les fenêtres sont fermées, on entend les gens parler, crier, se disputer. Très tôt le matin, on entend les camions de lessive, les outils d’entretien paysager, etc.Nous ne pouvons parler pour les autres temps de l’année, mais lorsque nous étions là, c’était le party tout autour. Comme l’accueil ferme la nuit et qu’il n’y a pas de gardien, on ne peut se référer à personne.Ainsi, si vous faites une réservation à ce Resort, demandez, au moins, une unité située à l’arrière de l’édifice (vu que le stationnement est situé à l’avant) – ça devrait être plus tranquille. Aussi, ce serait prudent de consulter le plan du Resort pour choisir un édifice situé le moins possible à proximité de la I4.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We booked this resort visa RCI. The location of the hotel is to the west of major attractions of Orlando. To really enjoy the place; make sure you have a car. The resort does offer free shuttle to Disney, but the options are limited.The rooms are very clean, the decor is nice there are even granite counters in the kitchen and the bathrooms. Free internet in the condo, cable TV on all the three 32" TVs. The central AC unit was quite adequate. The kitchen is well furnished: American sized oven, huge microwave, dishwasher, good size sinks. The two bathrooms are big and nicely decorated. The staffs are very nice. The supermarket, the pharmacy, gas station and restaurants are only one KM away. If coming from Europe or Canada, bring an empty suitcase as the shopping at the Premium outlet mall is excellent. Pool area is beautiful. Gym well equipped.  Like other people the noise from I4 is a bit distracting, wish the resort had better sound insulating windows. The blinds in the bedrooms does not do much to block the sunlight in the morning. Hotel type curtains would be very welcomed to enjoy late mornings. DVD player did not work.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Would stay again, very impressed! Read full review, it will be helpful.
column29: Booked the morning we were flying to Orlando. Expedia hadn't yet done their part with getting reservations sent over, but staff took care of everything right away and they all were VERY nice and helpful. I' am surprised at reading the negative comments which is why I felt the need to comment on our recent experience. It is not "secluded", it is 1/2 mile from resturants, gas and shopping. Right next to interstate. The 1/2 mile road to Tuscana Resorts seems like you might be on a road to no where, but you come up to a gated very beautiful complex...WOW! We had a 2 bed/2 bath, just being there made it feel like you were home away from home. Bedrooms have huge walk in closets with tv's and their own very nice bathrooms. Full kitchen with all appliances, dining room with set table and smaller livingroom with chair, sleeper sofa, tv. Everything seemed brand new and CLEAN and we kept it that way. We felt it was extremely quiet, didn't notice the hwy sounds/traffic at all to us it was a nice relaxing change. Our rate was $89 per night, which is unbeliveable considering The Omni which is blocks away is a couple of hundred dollars per night for a regular room. Champions Gate is beautiful, Tuscana is right there...very nice and safe location absolutly no complaints. No offense, but for the hotels you see on the travel sites for under $75 you will pay for what you get. There was lots of "dumps" on this one main strip called Irol Bronson Hwy trust me what you see on the internet isn't always what you get. READ REVIEWS, I at first thought why not pay $40 per night we were not going to be in the room much...I' am sooo glad I read reviews and we decided to pay more, it was SO worth it! Also, get a rental car we have used Alamo in Orlando and Vegas with no problems. They are located in the airport, which beware some are not! Husbands softball team found out the hard way two months ago. First time going to Orlando, not impressed EVERYTHING is very spread out it wasn't what I thought it was going to be. Tuscana and a rental car are a must!Stay at the Tuscana, we had a perfect experience and I can't explain some of the complaints. Some people are not happy unless they are complaining.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We booked this through RCI. It was a beautiful gated condo community. We basically had the place to ourselves. The rooms were outstanding. We had a 2-bedroom condo for 6 of us. The kitchen was fully stocked and everything was brand new. The location was perfect -- close to Publix and close to the theme parks. Our condo was right off the highway, and it was definitely noisy. Turning on the fans helped mask the noise at night, but the jake brakes of the trucks startled us out of our sleep a few times. The pool was nice. The kiddie pool was broken and closed. The hot tub was great. The towel policy is a bit ridiculous and should be done away with. However, other than that, we would definitely return here again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We have just returned from an excellent 3 week stay at The Tuscana Resort. Condos were very well equiped, gardens & pool area well maintained (pool guy was there EVERY day so pool very clean), location excellent but you do need a car. Pepperons pizza restaurant is close by & pizzas are soooo good. As previous review says the only problem were the Love Bugs though nothing at all to do with Tuscana resort it was the time of year - they are always bad March\April & September\October - it did mean that we were unable to make use of pool area for very long each day as they got really bad around 11:30am which was a shame as the pool area was lovely, very quiet & clean. We will definately be back next year & would recommend condos.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Just back from a 14-night stay at the Tuscana and we loved almost every minute of it. The room was lovely, very clean, well-maintained. All the comforts of home (3 TV's, 2 bathrooms, washing machine, tumble dryer, dish washer, microwave, cooker, toaster, coffee maker, blender, hairdryers, iron/ironing table, vacuum cleaner, extra bedding, blankets and pillows). Pool towels were also provided (you return them when you're checking out). The only problem we had was with the "bugs". There were LOADS of them (and I mean loads). My 3 year-old daughter was petrified so we couldn't actually sit at the pool at all. That is my only grumble and, to be fair, it's nothing to do with the apartments and can't be helped. The place was VERY easy to find, just off exit 58 of the I-4, turn right and you're there! It took about 25-30 minutes to get there from Orlando International Airport. It was a 10 minute drive to Disney and the 192. In addition to the Publix and Chili's, there's a Chinese restaurant, a Pizzeria, hairdressers, beauty parlour, off-licence, McDonalds (24 hours), Walgreens pharmacy (24 hours) and a couple of other shops. We didn't eat at the on-site restaurant so can't comment on whether the food's any good or not. Because it's right off the I-4, it's really easy to drive to places (and I would agree with previous posters that a car is a necessity but it would be a necessity wherever you stayed in Florida in my opinion). I would definitely recommend these apartments to anyone and, if I ever get enough money to go back to Florida, this is probably where I would stay. Definite thumbs-up!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Just returned from Florida, the condos were really clean and comfortable. Staff were friendly and helpful.Food was great, lots of it. The condos are also near some restaurants and takeaways also a Publix supermarket near by.Had a great stay there, and will be going back in the future.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Was at the Tuscana back end of August for 10 days. We had a 2 bed condo which was clean and well maintained with all the homely comforts you needed. We got there late on the Sunday when reception closes at 18:00. But a helpful guy came out of the back office and helped us retrieve our envelope with the keys to the condo. He also opened up the gates for us and pointed us to our block. Anytime I went to reception I was met with a friendly face ( Veronica ) who was pleasant and helpful. The Tuscana was easy to find just off the I-4 on exit 58. As you exit the ramp keep right, turn right and right again between Chillies and 7 Eleven. Drive up the road and you can`t miss it as it is the only development there. People need to remember that these are apartments and not a hotel so those people complaining might have had their expectations set too high. Regardless these are great condos and well kept and nicely decorated and equipped. There is also a great swimming pool, gym and a business centre at reception with free interent access. For groceries there is a Publix ( Supermarket ) just up the road about 3 minutes drive. Disney is a junction up depending which way you go and ideal for family with kids. International drive is 20 minutes ( 1 of the 4 exits ) and for shopping, the Prime Outlets are just a 10 min drive on the I-4 toward Orlando. All in all this was a great stay for us and we plan to stay at the Tuscana again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Nice spacious condo, pool area really tidy nearly always managed to grab a cabana. Location of the resort was fairly central for all the attractions. Felt quite secure with gated access. On the downside there was no safety deposit box in condo which should be supplied. Another gripe was the towel service at the pool. Towels supplied at start of holiday to be washed in the condo and returned at end of holiday. A 10 dollar fine if you did not follow through these instructions. Every resort I have visited have provided clean fresh towels on a daily basis! Surely this service could be provided. Reception staff not paricularly friendly, one 'lady' in particular was very rude and abrupt! A big problem with holidaymakers dumping their garbage under the stairwell. Could be a potential health hazard and the management really need to address this problem. Big garbage containers at the end of the complex so there is no need for this to happen. Extreme laziness on tenants part, also lowers the standard of the resort. Apart from that a lovely little resort.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We have just returned from tuscana yesterday (13 August 2008) after staying there for 16 nights. I travelled with my huband, daughter aged 7and friend. We booked holiday with holiday genie. We flew from Manchester to Atlanta, then Atlanta to Orlando, with Delta Airlne's, they are good but Virgin are much better, more freebies etc and children's goodies. Hired car with dollar. Drive from aiport is approx 30 mins, straight forward drive on 417 then I4 exit 58. Due to location limited restaurants and supermarkets, but if you have a car this is not an issue. The supermarket Publix has everything you need, but if you are prepared to drive to I Drive you will find the prices cheaper!!!! We stayed in block 3 on 1st Floor, everything was immaculate. Our accomodation consisted of 3 large bedrooms and 2 bathrooms, one with en-suite. Towels were supplied in the bathrooms plus lots more. Bed linen was top quality and the table was laid with crockery and wine glasses etc upon our arrival, which we thought was a nice touch! The pool was lovely and bar very cheap!!!! One evening my friend and I asked for a glass of white wine, we were given a pint of champagne!!!!!! There was everythng you needed a full kitchen, oven, microwave, fridge freezer with ice maker, hoover, iron, ironing board including a washing machine and tumble drier, this is the first holiday I have come home without dirty washing!!!! You are perfectly placed for disney approx 15 mins, resort also offers free shuttle to disney. Universal and Seaworld are about 30 mins drive, you can use shuttle at a cost of about $15.00 for a family. The reception staff were very helpful. The pool area was clean and safe. I would definately recomend this to people of all ages travellng with or without children, and would definately stay there again.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: OMG What a Great Place to stay
column29: We booked this condo through OwnerDirect.com and rented the condo from Barbara Proctor with Many Happy Returns. We got an exceptional deal. The Condo itself was wonderful, clean, spacious with three bedrooms and two baths. A great kitchen and balcony. The location is great as reported in earlier reviews just 10 minutes from Disney and very close to I-10. The staff was kind and very helpful. The pool area was fun, clean, and they even had a cookout on Thursday night with Karaoke. I would reccomend this hotel to any family needing room to spread out on vacation. After driving 26 hours to get there it was nice for the family to all have thier own space!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: went here in july 08 couldn't get out of it quick enough. room dirty ,smell from furniture. also furniture was from a butlins/maplins resort. staff couldn't care less, toilet didn't work !had to repair it myself. food left on stairwell for a whole weekend. other guests did not want to use the rubbish skips, so they just left their rubbish at the lift's. the restaurant didn't open for two days because the chef had "babysitter problems". intimidating atmosphere around the pool, wich was packed with young adult group's. very disappointing just to many things wrong to recommend it to anyone!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: This place looks nice in pictures but the quality and level of service is nothing more than poor. The staff there is unhelpful and rude. You have to ask and sign out pool towels which they charge $10 per towel to your bill if they don't get the towels back. The so call business center where you can use the computer is always packed with kids doing IM and chatting. You cannot even print your boarding passes because it is never no ink in the printer. The restaurant is so bad that I don't see how they stay open. The food is always cold, never enough help, RESTAURANT DO NOT OPEN FOR BREAKFAST, so you better bring your own breakfast food. Food is always cold, always quick to put in microwave, and have to wait for long time to order. There is one lady that owns the place that tries to do everything. Please don't let the pictures fool you you don't get the bang for buck at this place.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: My wife and I just got back from a 2 week stay here. Disregard the bad reviews - this is an excellent place to stay. Easy to get to, near all the attractions, safe & secure, excellent standard of accommodation and supermarkets, shops , ATMs & banks all nearby. The pool area is excellent if you just want to relax.Julie from Wigan runs the poolside restaurant and does an brilliant job. And she's still got her English accent & sense of humour!Tips ? No need to take pool towels, they're provided free of charge. Internet access is also free from one of two computers next to the office, and the fitness room is first class (and free too). Also, if you want to phone home get a $5 phone card from Publix or the Seven Eleven. It'll last ages!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We booked this condo through lastminute.com at an acceptional price.The condo itself was clean and spacious and fitted out to a luxurious level. On site there is a pool to chill out along with a bar and restuarant which has the usual bar menu. Friday evening there is a BBQ and Kareoke. There is a gym on-site and internet should you care to check these out.The staff were extremely helpful and friendly too.The location we felt was okay, as its Orlando after all and you will need a car everything is just too spaced out to taxi around!! there is a Chilis restuarant and the end of the road, probably would take about 15min walk but we would highly recommend, food is great.Overall we couldn't fault this condo, and met numerous people who travel from all around the world who have stayed there time and time again - guess that says it all!! Enjoy your stay!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: My family and I stayed at Tuscana at the end of April/Beg May for 2 1/2 weeks. We absolutely loved it!!!The Resort is in an excellent location with easy access to the I-4 which takes you everywhere... Disney 10 mins, Universal 25 Mins. We wouldn't recommend this resort if you are not hiring a car, as their shuttle service is restricted to one in the morning and one back in the evening, but as we hired a car it was perfect for us. The bonus for us of staying in Tuscana was, at the end of a very busy day in the parks it was fab to jump in the car and get back to a quiet, comfortbale resort... recharge the batteries for the next day. The apartments are large and spacious and very well equipped. Loved having a washer/dryer as for the first time came home from holiday with suitcases full of clean clothes!!! The pool area is large and very clean. They have a bar which serves food from 11am until evening (think 9pm) The food was lovely and not too expensive. We found all the staff to be very friendly and helpful.At the end of the road, beside the I-4 there is a Chilis Restaurant, Pharmacy, Bank with Drive through ATM, Publix supermarket, McDonalds, 7Eleven Gas Station and Pizzeria.We will definitely be back to Tuscana. We loved it!!!!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: My family and I have just returned from a 1 week's stay at the fabulous Tuscana resort and had a brilliant time.I read in other reviews before going that it was at the end of an undeveloped road and too far from all the parks however i would have to disagree. At the end of the road there is a number of ammenities including Chillies Restaurant, Pharmacy, McDonalds, Off Sales and a supermarket, therefore i would not class this resort as remote.No matter where you stay in Florida you have to drive, and The Tuscana's location (just off the i4) made it simple and quick to get to Disney, Universal and all the outlets for shopping. We found the resort very quiet and this suited us. After spending all day at the parks it was great to go for a swim in the beautiful pool.We rented a 3 bedroom condo which was huge and fully equipped. The condo had a washing machine, tumble dryer, cooker, microwave, dishwasher, hair dryer etc and all importantly air conditioning. The properties are spotless and the grounds of the complex are also excellent.All the staff at the complex are very helpful and friendly and i would have no hesitation in reccommending this resort to families looking for a base in Orlando.We will certainly return to this resort the next time we go to Florida.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Not the right resort for us
column29: The resort is set back on an undeveloped road. I assume they have plans to build other condos in the next few years. You need a code to enter the gate but they do not have security or staff on site after hours except a 1-800 number. If you do call the number for anything - we were told to expect a 1 hour delay for any after hours calls. The pool was nice but there were creepy guys hanging around. One warm early evening 2 of them watched our young daughter like she was food and they had not eaten in weeks. It bothered us enough that we decided to leave the pool early. The 2 guys got up and started following us. We knew they were not staying on our block so I back tracked and subsquently checked out early. We did not feel safe. I had to pay for all nights of the stay as the fees are non-refundable. The condo was new, clean and had a washer and dryer in the unit. The location was close to a pharmacy, food, grocer, and a very quick exit to get on I4. To go to Disney expect 15-20 mins in traffic. The staff were nice and were polite and helpful (except for after hours secuirty)We will not return but this resort does have a lot of extra amenities over a standard hotel room of the same cost.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: So just back from 2 weeks at the Tuscana. We were a young(ish!) couple and we were not warned beforehand as to how far away from everything we would be. When we arrived at the airport we had transfer services arranged but could not get on the normal bus as we were so far from everything. Turned out nice as we got a lovely chauffer driven Sudan to take us personally to the apartments, but even he kept commenting on the remoteness of our lcoation! We arrived during the day so had no problems with getting our key from the reception. They were friendly but seemed very unorganized (both at check in & check out). They only work 8-9 during the week and 9-6 at weekends which make it difficult to get hold of them (as we were generally out all day and arrived back after they had finished). The apartment itself is lovely...large, fully equipped, comfortable and has everything you could possibly need. There is no way we can fault the apartment at all. Thankfully we picked our car up the next day which was a blessing as there is nothing to do in the area. It takes 2 mins to get onto the I-4 which is the main road to Disney/Universal/Kissimmee. Disney & Kissimmee are only 15mins away, Universal 35mins. (NASA is approx 1.5-2 hrs away and well worth the drive! ) The problem is that if you want to go out for dinner and have a glass of wine etc at night one person always has to drive. We tried walking to Chilies at the end if the road but I would not recommend it - the road has no footpath and is unlit. Basically, as you drive down the I-4 our location is signposted as a service stop as it has a Chilies Diner (which is really nice), MacDonald’s, Supermarket & 24 Gas station. Location aside our main disappointment of the trip was the pool bar. The pool area itself is gorgeous...plenty of beds, well kept etc. The pool bar however is run by incompetent, rude, bad mannered English Family which was a shame as we would have gone there most nights for a drink/dinner etc. They offered cocktails but could not actually make them, when I took one drink back and said it tasted nothing like a margarita she replied that she had followed the ingredients and then turned and walked off. They argued and lied about tips in front of us, lied about which chef was working when we asked them, and when I asked for a taxi number one night they basically said they couldn't help and again walked off. I would recommend Tuscana as the place itself is lovely, I just would not recommend it for young people who want to go out for dinner & drinks on an evening and who don't want to spend all their holiday driving around.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We booked two weeks before we arrived and got a great rate for less than £40 a night. We first had to go to the Welcome Centre on the 192 to pick up the details and then drive about 20 minutes to the resort. The girls in the Welcome Center were very nice but we did have to wait till 4pm before we could be seen. When we did get to the resort checking in was fast and were in our apartment within 10 minutes. I wasn't expecting to much because of the low price but what a nice surprise, the apartment was brand new, big kitchen with everything you would need in a working kitchen. Both bedrooms were large with en suit, walk-in wardrooms and TVs. A large dinning room table that was full set on arrival. Also there was a sitting area and another TV, 3 Tvs in all. The whole apartment was nicely decorated, clean and very large and had everything you would need to run a household ( washer/dryer, dishwasher, full fridge, A/C, vacuum, brooms, dustpan and brush). There is no house keeping at this resort but if needed it could be ask for at a charge. The pool area was lovely with lots of sun lounger with a few umbrellas, you could rent out the large cabanas if needed and I think they were about $10 a day. The pool was a good size but not very deep. Most of the pool is only 3 feet deep and 4.5 feet at it's deepest.  There was some things that were a bit upsetting. On the first day we were told off for having our own drinks around the pool, this was a self catering holiday and I feel was a bit out of order. The hot tub never got warm the whole time we were there (10 days)and back at the apartment there wasn't any black out curtains, well no curtails at all really in the bedrooms so the bedrooms did light up early in the morning. Not great for a good sleep. The location wasn't bad about 20 minutes from Disney, 30 minutes from International Drive. The resort is on the I4 at junction 58.
