You will also find a Chillies, 7elven gas station, Publix supermarket and a few restaurants at the end of the road that runs from the resort. I would stay here again in a shot, for the price and the standard of accommodation it is excellent.  I would not want the few negatived points to put any one off from this wonderful resort.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Loved this place! We had a 2 bedroom unit with a bathroom for each room, walk-in closets and fully equipped kitchen. The balconey was nice and was screened in, so you could let your patio doors open.The pool and the grounds were beautiful and clean. Staff isn't there 24 hours but are very friendly and there's a 24 hour emergency number available. Nice amneties we didn't get to use (there for a week and went to Disney!): such as the movie theatre and exercise room. The club house also has computers to access the internet.Nothing is perfect, so the minor annoyances were:- the jaccuzi didn't work for the first few days (but when it did, so nice to sit in on a starry night!)- our elevator hardly ever worked and we were on the 4th floor...- shuttle to Disney : ask 24 hours ahead or its not available. Plus it only goes at 8:30 am and picks you up at 5:30pm. Not convenient if you want to stay for the fireworks. So we used our rental car and paid the parking - Disney is really easy to drive to from there.The tavern is really nice - they have an outdoor bbq on Friday nights and the service is great. My husband and I got a free drink since it was our wedding anniversary. Really nice people! Only bad thing about our trip was that it had to end!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Where do you start? The development is perfectly situated for both family vacations near the theme parks as well as for golfers close to a multitude of fantastic courses.The resort has a shuttle bus to take you to the Parks and can't seem to do enough for you. The condos are wonderful with plenty of room. It really does feel like home from home. All mod cons are included with en-suite bathrooms, modern contempory furnishings, DVD, Cd and MP3 player, huge kitchen, and small terrace overlooking quiet wooded area.A must visit for anyone looking for a classy retreat for a fantastic holiday within easy reach of every facility you can think of.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: What a fab holidays. Would recommend Tuscana apartments to everyone. 10-15 minutes away from disney but located in a nice quite location. Apartments hugh, we wwent with our 9 year old son and two friends so had the two bed with ensuites. Hugh walk in wardrobes so lots of hanging space and draws. Own bathrooms which we really big, also hair dryer in drawn. Kitchen has all the utensils you require and also has diswasher, washing machine, dryer and iron plus ironing board. Couldnt fault them at all. Staff really friendly, food lovely, only had lunch a couple of times but nice and really cheap. Pool not too deep, includes small childrens pool.Chilli's down the road to eat which was lovely, burgers/ribs. McD around the corner. Nice Italian restaurant by Publix supermarkets. Have takeaway pizza on a couple of occasions which was great.Borrow a dvd from reception and you can watch in their own private cinema! Free internet acess and all the latest equipment in the gym.Hired a car and sat nav. Sat nav was great as it was programmed with all the disney parks and more, well worth the 6 dollars a day charge.

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Ten out of Ten for Tuscana
column29: Have just spent a week in the fabulous Tuscana Resort. I can't say enough good things about this place. Firstly, it's just off the Interstate 4, about 10-15 minutes by car to Disney and about 25 to Universal and about 30 minutes from Orlando airport. The facilities are fantastic, an amazing pool area, complete with Jacuzzi and plenty of loungers etc. A clubhouse with a gym, a mini cinema and free internet access for residents. We stayed in a 2 bed unit each room with its own bathroom and walk in wardrobe! Units are decorated to the highest standards with every mod con known to man including a washer and dryer. The staff were really helpful and friendly and couldn't do enough for us. Nearby restaurants include Chilis, (fantastic service, food and value), a chinese, italian, subway and mc donalds. Publix supermarket was superb. The Mall at Millenia is about 25-30 mins by car. It is heaven! Macy's, bloomingdales, abercrombie, tiffanys, you name it, it's got it, a must for shopaholics! I could go on and on but will just say I will definately be returningto Tuscana for a little piece of heaven!

column6: #2 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Kitchenette, Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥612 - CN¥2,400 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Hi Everyone, Its been a while, been very busy but here it is. We stayed at the Tuscana Resort in Davenport Florida. This place is beautiful, it is located near Champions Gate, easy access to the interstate. I would say about 10 minutes to Disney and 20 minutes to Universal Studios, this is where we went(had an awesome time there.) My husband and I were celebrating our 25th anniversary with our two children. I booked directly through Tuscana with Robert Jimenez. He was great to deal with.Our unit was brand new, which I loved. I told Robert we wanted everything to be perfect for our anniversary. Boy, did he listen. When we opened our unit, he had a anniversary card for us, dove chocolates and a bottle of champagne. He also had the ice box stocked with eggs, sausage, orange juice, milk, butter and many other things. We were very impressed. We felt very pampered.I can’t say enough about the security guards that work there, they were awesome they were so nice, just about every time we came we would stop and talk to them. By the time we left it felt as if we made new friends. The entrance and grounds were very secured. My husband used the spa and my daughter used the pool, which they enjoyed very much. They also had a theater you could pop in a DVD and watch your favorite movie. I must not forget, right down the road is the publix market, McDonald’s,Chili's and other places to eat and shop. Tuscana is located in an awesome location.. We were having so much fun and I loved this place, I could have stayed and lived in our unit forever. So, if you looking for a new place, easy access to the parks and shopping Tuscana Resort is the place to be. Oho.....if you remember tell Robert Pam and the gang says hi!

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Nous avons logé durant une semaine avec toute ma famille dans une très jolie maisonnette. Tout était parfait, la propreté et l’état des équipements nickel. Nous vous recommandons vivement c’est endroit!

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: My brother-in-law has stayed at the fountains many times and recommended it to us so we tried it this time and were not disappointed! I have been coming to Florida with my husband for the last 18 years and have stayed in many types of accommodation but the lovely house, facilities and staff at the fountains are by far one of the best places we have stayed. We had a lovely 3 bedroom town house, beautifully decorated, very clean and had all facilities. For me I love being able to do my own laundry and make fresh coffee, which is not an option in hotels! The pool is incredible too, my husband loves to swim and also lay in the pool at the lower end on hot days. While I enjoyed hiding in the shade of the cabanas! It’s by far the nicest pool area we have found!And location is key, it’s with perfect distance too all the theme parks and as Disney annual Passholders this is very important to us! But being so close to the supermarket, restaurants and an ale house is an even bigger bonus! We cannot recommend the fountains enough to anyone visiting it’s perfect for both couples and families! And to prove how much we loved it we will be staying again in December for our pre-Christmas trip!

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: The Fountains is in a great location, has a fantastic pool area, a lovely clubhouse with small gym for doing cardio workout. The staff here are always very helpful and friendly, they cannot do enough to make you’re vacation as great a possible. The houses are modern and well furnished, and this is now my fifth time here in two years. It’s a home from home, and always sad to leave. Will return next year

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Thanksgiving week stay....townhouse was in a good location, not far from attractions and things to do close by. Modern amenities, the four bedroom provide a lot space for two families, pool area was clean with awesome cabanas, nice quiet area." Located near plenty of restaurants and gas,CVS....

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Just returned from a family vacation and must post my disappointment in an effort to prevent this from happening to another family. Within the first hour or arriving had to notify the front desk about ceiling bulbs out, vertical blinds missing and a hole in the ceiling from what appeared to be a leak. I informedthem of this to prevent any charges to my card. I was informed that each unit has a separate owner. The owner of this unit to care less about the upkeep nor is anyone holding them accountable. The carpet on the stairway wasnasty where we ensure the kids kept house shoes and socks on at all times. I also noticed that the Local Business Tax Receipt and State of Florida, Division of Hotels and Restaurants license were expired and I intend to call the first business day I can to report such. There may be a part 2.

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: My husband had to be in Orlando for business. So, we tagged along to roll in some vacation time. If the villa wasn’t paid for ahead of time and we would have arrived earlier, I WOULD HAVE NEVER STAYED HERE. Where to start. The downstairs half bath smelled like urine. The floors were disgusting and walking around in socks, you looked like you had ran down the road. The linens were of such a poor quality that they probably didn’t have a thread count. There was one blanket with the paper thin sheet that was the thickness of a towel. The master bathroom was mildewed. The horrible decor and wonky chairs I could overlook. The house being gross is unacceptable. I called and called and they answered the phone but instantly put you on hold where you stayed. Just don’t do it. I have stayed in third world countries, in hostels that were cleaner and nicer.

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: I stayed here while attending a conference at the Omni Hotel. Not quite a walkable distance if that is your plan. So we rented a car.The townhome was fine. Three bedrooms. Kitchen not stocked with anything but didn’t expect it to be. Might have been nice to have more than one bar of soap in the house... maybe one for each bathroom..  Bed was comfortable I slept like a baby. I would do it again.

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: We stayed here in October for 4 nights 5 days. We were in building 1. The room was by far above what we expected. Lots of space, clean and comfortable. The building is showing its age a little, but it is in the middle if a complete renovation. Of note is that we never actually heard any excessive noise from the renovation work.I would highly recommend staying here to anyone. Great staff, good service and it's very close to all attractions in Orlando.

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: El chalet que nos dieron era muy completo(cocina full equipada, garaje para el auto y sala, comedor, 3 dormitorios y dos baños y medio), cómodo y precioso, felices con el espacio pues eramos dos familias, 5 adultos y 3 niños. La piscina grande y riquísima a pesar que era invierno (Febrero 2017) nos metimos y hasta al jacuzzi.Lo malo fue que olvidé una bolsa donde tenía objetos personales y cosas nuevas que había comprado en Disney, el valor habrá sido de 200 dolares, me di cuenta que había dejado la bolsa cuando ya estaba en otro hotel, llamé para reportarlo pero ellos dicen que no encontraron la bolsa, y yo sé que se quedó ahí pero quizá algún personal se lo quedó.

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: My company uses a travel booking company for our hotel stays and my colleague and I stayed here for a conference. We got into the hotel late and thought it was so strange the way you check in and didn’t feel safe. We got our key from the security guard who seemed confused then we got to the gate and at 12:30am three random cars came out of nowhere behind us following us into gate. The scary part was there was a strange black SUV and a strange white van they both pulled into the unit next to ours we didn’t get out of the car because we were scared. They pulled out of the driveway in a very sketchy way which scared us even more. The whole situation seemed like it could have been a possible sex trafficking situation which is a real and scary thing. When we arrived the entire apartment smelt awful like mildew, the carpets were filthy, the beds were the beds to give your kids when they’re potty training, and the furniture was beaten up and old. There was so much space in the unit but all wasted space with limited furniture and everything seemed like it was pre-owned from a old hotel auction. I will never stay here again and reported it to my company’s travel company to eliminate it from their approved list of hotels as this was not what it appeared to be online. I HIGHLY caution anyone to stay away from this place as they are not accommodating to your issues and has misleading photos on here and their site.

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: Stayed here for 6 nights with my husband and two adult sons. Spacious and well equipped town house.Had a few issues that required fixing ie no hot water, but within 10mins of being reported maintenance had appeared. Think after 3 days in a row we were on first name terms!!Yes the stair carpets could do with a scrub and some of the furniture was chipped and dented, but this made me feel more at home and able to relax.......if it had of been pristine I would have been constantly cleaning and making the family's life a misery.Used the pool a couple of times.....it was deserted which made it feel like your own personal oneIdeally situated for shops and eateries. Husband and son used the golf facilities up at the hotel Just of the I.4 so easy access to the parks shopping outlets etcThe only downside is that the back of the property is not very inviting, nothing to sit out on and it opens straight out onto scrub land.Would come back

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: Is there a basketball court for the teenagers?? I can't go anywhere there isn't one LOL I'd love to know what things the teens can do besides the pool?? if they are not kept busy they are not happy LOL Thank you!!

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Great. Been many times and will continue to
column29: We have been coming here since it opened I’d say around 3/4 years ago now. It’s still our favourite place to stay as it’s got everything we need and want as a family. We have stayed between 2-4 week each time. Andre at front desk is friendly, efficient and there’s nothing he won’t do for you. One thing I don’t like on reviews is if people say “oh this didn’t work, that was missing etc etc”. Call reception / Andre and ask for what you want fixing, replacing etc. These things are brought or fixed to you WITHIN MINUTES! It’s unfair to leave reviews complaining if you’ve never once brought it to someone’s attention. These guys genuinely want you to have a nice stay. The net at the front of one of the windows was missing. I like to open windows for an hour or two a day to get some “real air” (I’m from the uk! I like real fresh air at times not just air con! ). Within half an hour maintenance had fully fixed the window. No questions asked. Someone at the pool said their toaster was missing. I said have you asked... no.. I said so ask. A new one will be with you within minutes. I don’t get it. Please take a thought and if you have an issue call front desk and ask for it to be sorted. Not fair to complain after the fact. The site is excellent. Great pool. Lovely hottub. Yes there are some beds around the pool that are worse for wear but every day we were there and are here they are replacing furniture around the pool. New umbrellas. Two brand new gazebo’s for shade. The houses are great. Yes the staircase carpets etc do need deep clean regularly at times but they get so much traffic and maybe guests should have a little more respect and take off shoes in the house. Especially when going upstairs. You would do it in your own homes. If you can’t live with something on it, again, give them a call. They’ll sort it for you. No one wants to look at a horrid stain day in day out for weeks. This is an excellent place to stay. Decent price. Well kept site. Friendly helpful staff everywhere around, from front desk to house keeping to maintenance. This is very much a home from home for us and believe me I am mega fussy but these guys are wanting to do their best for you all round, especially Andre so stay without hesitation, because we will for years to come. See you at Christmas guys xx

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Nice and Spacious, Feels Like Home
column29: Our family of five enjoyed a 3 bedroom, 2.5 bathroom, townhome with garage and mini back and front lawns.Best parts: Cable TV in all bedrooms, Huge master bedroom big enough to host family game night, great programmable air conditioning, washer & dryer upstairs, and full kitchen with an ice-dispensing refrigerator.Flaws: Dryer did not dry the clothes well (perhaps a clogged outflow duct), sink disposal did not work, and a huge wasp nest was on the back porch ... we went out for bug spray!!!Otherwise, our kids loved the place. Lots of stairs to climb way up to the top floor, but the carpets were comfy and cozy.Advice: head out as soon as you can for groceries, including food, paper towels, toilet paper, and other toiletries. The resort supplies a starter set, but that will deplete fast if you have a big family. There is a Publix supermarket just up the road. No need to worry about towels ... lots provided.In summary, it's a nice big spacious place to "live" while you're on vacation. Your neighbors are connected to you, but the walls seemed quite sound-proof. Our neighbors had a big party and we weren't bothered, except by one person parking a car in our spot (they politely moved when asked). Our minivan did not fit in the garage, but a small car will, giving you space for another in the driveway, if needed. You get a code to enter the premises when you check in at the Tuscana desk across the street. Overall, a nice place to stay.

column29: We stayed at The Fountains at ChampionsGate for our 10 day Orlando vacation and would highly recommend! We historically have stayed at another hotel/resort but with a larger family, we needed the accommodations for a total of eight--7 adults and a baby and decided to "venture out" from previous. We loved the four bedrooms and were delighted with the modern, "newer" look and feel of our condo. The one drawback would be the initial day of arrival. There is no signage to tell you to go to the Toscana to register to get into the gate at The Fountains--it is very confusing if you do not know this and there is no direction. A simple one or two signs along the road up to The Fountains or on the intercom box by the gate would be very helpful~ The staff are friendly and helpful. A bit longer drive to WDW and US/IofA but the accommodations were worth it!

column29: Let’s start at the beginning, I truly love the drive up curb appeal the place offered. It was beautiful! We went from a family vacation of 4 to a family vacation of 7 within no time BUT they were very accommodating to my sudden need for 4 bedrooms rather than a 3 bedroom townhome. Check in was quick! The home was NICE! It was clean and neat. It’s about 15 minutes from a Walmart, plenty of food places nearby. It’s definitely a must for a great family vacay! The kitchen has all the necessities to cook if you would like to spend the day inside. Williams 2018 Family Vacation was a great success!

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column27: 2nd visit there, just as good as the 1st
column29: Family of 5 stayed there end of May for a week. Got a free upgrade to a 4 bedroom unit as they had no 3 bedroom units available. We only encountered small minor issues. The blinds in the upstairs master bedroom were stuck open. Not a big issue as we used the other bedroom instead. The living room tv wouldn't work the last 3 days. We managed without it as we were only there in the evenings, and kept busy doing other things.The unit was clean, pool was good, nice landscaping throughout the property. Would go there again.For all those people who complain about the "hidden fees".... Its not hidden at all. Its clearly marked on your booking. Keep up the good work Fountains and Tuscana.

I told them my hotels.com booking included all fees and they said I wouldn’t be charged they were just for awareness. They then billed my credit card without my permission. Also the carpets were filthy in our accommodation. If you book here you need to add substantial additional costs as they decide to the price.

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We are a family of 6 who stayed at the Fountains during April in a 3 bed townhouse.From the outside it looked quite small but this was not the case and we were pleasantly surprised at internal space. All bedrooms were a great size, plenty of storage and comfy beds.Downstairs we had everything that we needed in the kitchen (which was a great size, modern and clean)Check in was smooth, staff were very pleasant and helpful and the amenities were spot on. The pool area is well maintained with ample space and the jacuzzi pool was a welcome relief after hours walking around the theme park. You have lots of local shops and eateries (which we made use of) The only thing that I would mention is that the lock on the sliding door in the lounge didn't seem overly secure but then the property is in a Gate secured resort which gave us peace of mind.As mentioned by a previous reviewer, we also experienced a raccoon in the trash bin area which was quite funny as we had never seen one before and my daughters thought it was great We've had another fantastic holiday in Orlando and without hesitation would stay at the The Fountains again if we were to return. I would definitely recommend to anyone looking at staying in the Championsgate area

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I offered management the opportunity to reach out to me following an email and review of their property but nobody responded. My daughter has special needs so I rely on hotels with full kitchens to prepare her meals. The kitchen was ill equipped (no knives, only two small pots). Check in was difficult. I had to return the next day between 8-11, which was hard because we had early morning Disney reservations at the Botique and I had to leave the park to complete check in, then return to the park after. It was time consuming and expensive to make the trip. We were given a complimentary upgrade to a 4 bedroom townhouse, but I was asked to then pay a cleaning fee of $120. I’d rather have had the 2 bedroom I booked.. my daughter and I were the only guests and I was not asked if the upgrade was okay. I would have declined. Additionally, I had to sleep upstairs in a smaller bed to be on the same floor as my daughter- the king size bed was downstairs, and two full size and two twin beds were upstairs. I went back to the office after check in because I wanted the room I had booked and was unaware I would be staying in a 4 bedroom townhouse, but they were closed. The hidden fees are the worst part, I booked online and it said fees may change but jumping $30 in the HOUR between when I booked and when I arrived? Sort of uncalled for, just be transparent and offer integrity pricing where you are honest with customers. Night one, our smoke detectors beeped nonstop. I don’t like to disable smoke detectors but the front desk did not answer my calls. Nobody provided WiFi information. Paths are poorly lit at nighttime and it was very difficult and unsafe getting from the car to the door.

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column27: Casas muy comodas y bien equipadas
column29: La casa era muy amplia, con 3 habitaciones con closets muy comodos. La cocina esta muy bien equipada. Living con sillones muy comodos. Ideal para familias que quieran o deban cocinar y disfrutar la casa. No tiene servicio de limpieza durante la estadía, pero al momento del check in la casa estaba impecable con suficientes toallas y demas insumos para una estadía agradable de varios días (en mi caso 8 dias). A la casa sólo podría objetar que eramos 5 personas y la mesa contaba con 3 sillas. Luego cuenta con 4 bancos para comer so bre el desayunador.La pileta me encantó. Agua cálida. Siempre bien mantenida. Cuenta con yacuzzi con silla para acceso de personas con problemas de mobilidad.Respecto de la ubicacion, la zona es muy bonita, con muchos comercios y restaurantes cerca y un supermercado Publix (supermermercado con muchos productos orgánicos y algo caro). Fuí en temporada alta por lo que llegar en auto a los parques tematicos de Universal lleva algo de tiempo (40 min aprox). En temporada baja deben ser 20 o 25 min.

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Ficamos hospedados numa casa de 4 quartos que comporta confortavelmente 8 pessoas ( ao todo são 10, se usar o sofá cama da sala, porém, não testamos) do dia 24/01 até dia 03/02. Encontramos a casa exatamente como nas fotos (nossa casa era a número 8127). Possui todos os itens e utensílios necessários para preparar algumas refeições e também material de limpeza e higiene para os primeiros dias. Havia toalhas em número suficiente para o número de hóspedes indicado no momento da reserva (reservamos pelo Booking.com e o pagamos o total no momento do check in em cash) e nós mesmos somos responsáveis por lavá-las durante a estadia. A casa é maravilhosa! Possui 2 andares, sendo duas suítes king (uma fica no andar inferior) com box de vidro, um quarto queen, um quarto com duas camas de solteiro, um banheiro social com banheira e cortina de plástico. Todos os quartos com closet e cabides. Tem lavabo no piso inferior, closet para mantimentos, lavadora/secadora de roupas e pratos, tábua e ferro de passar, secador de cabelo, garagem coberta para um carro (pode estacionar outro carro em frente à garagem e também em algumas vagas do condomínio). O cofre fica no closet da suíte do andar inferior. O lixo pode ser colocado no contêiner do condomínio em qualquer horário (achei ótimo isso pois em alguns condomínios é preciso obedecer dias e horários estabelecidos). O condomínio é lindo e bem cuidado. É novo, então, torna a estadia muito agradável. Não deu tempo de usar as piscinas, academia ou pegar filme para assistir. O check in (as 16:00h, mas chegamos por volta das 13:30 e a casa já estava disponível, sem problemas) e o check out (as 11:00 h, sendo que 15 min antes a responsável pela limpeza tocou a campainha, porém já estávamos prontos para sair) é realizado no condomínio ao lado, o Tuscana Resort e lá você recebe senha para o portão de entrada e cartões para a porta da sala. Fica perto dos parques da Disney e distante de Orlando uns 25 min, dependendo do trânsito. Isso não nos incomodou pois estávamos de carro e já sabíamos que seria desta forma. Muito perto tem posto de gasolina, farmácia Walgreens, supermercado Publix, restaurante Chillis, lanchonete Wendys, Red Robin (hambúrguer gourmet com refil de batata frita), McDonald’s e muitas outras opções de comércio. Alguns detalhes como por exemplo, a falta de uma iluminação mais forte sobre a pia do banheiro e acessório para pendurar toalha de rosto em alguns deles, o fato da água do chuveiro não esquentar muito quando mais pessoas tomavam banho ao mesmo tempo e a persiana da varanda da sala estar com algumas lâminas se soltando não nos causou nenhum transtorno considerável, pois no geral tudo funcionou perfeitamente e passamos momentos agradáveis durante nossa estadia. Sabíamos que não contava com limpeza diária, mas era isso mesmo que queríamos, conforto e privacidade! Enfim, decidimos por nos hospedar neste condomínio após ler a opinião positiva da maioria dos leitores, e realmente, ficamos muito satisfeitos com a escolha. Recomendo para famílias e grupos de amigos que preferem se hospedar com o conforto que a estrutura de uma residência como esta pode proporcionar sem se importar em executar pequenas tarefas domésticas e realizar maiores deslocamentos para acessar alguns pontos turísticos e as principais atrações.

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: A family holiday staying in a 4 bed townhouse in the Fountains at Champions Gate. Check in was short and sweet and a little short on customer care skills from the guy that dealt with us at the Tuscana resort next door and another encounter with a lady on reception was poor as i was greeted with not a hello as you would expect but card, she wanted my credit card as she thought i had come to check in when infact i had come to collect a parcel. Home was a spacious modern home with all the amenities with nice out look onto lake but on closer inspection once we had spent a number of days in the house we noticed it had some issues. Sliding patio door did not lock, blind to same door jammed and slat broken, furniture tops marked from wear, walls and paint work in need of repair. For a property that is not that old, it was showing its age in places. Did report issues at reception but blind and door still needed fixing when we left. On a more positive note, pools both at the Fountains and Tuscana are lovely with towels available free at poolside. Grounds are well kept and nice setting. Close to I4 and decent choice of fast food, restaurants and food stores etc just at the end of the road. In summary, nice place but i found myself a little disappointed, was expecting quality of home and attitude of reception staff to be better as i have stayed in Tuscana before and had better experience s.

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed here in April 2017 and I forgot to write a review. We had a 3 bedroom villa and it was lovely. Great amenities at the clubhouse, gym and pool. Staff were friendly and the location was perfect for getting to parks. There was shops and restaurants nearby for takeaway and eating out. The bedrooms in the villa were spacious and kept well and the villa had all the mod cons needed. We wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again should we visit the area. Recommend going into Celebration and doing the bike ride if you want a break from Mickey!

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Have just left The Fountains after a great week! The villas are superb, very clean and extremely spacious. Beds were very comfy, couldn't fault the location. Close to some good eating places and supermarket. Pool area was clean and well kept with a good supply of clean towels which is always a bonus. Had a problem with key card one day which was swiftly sorted out by a friendly guy. Would definitely stay here again, and would highly recommend it.

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We have just returned from a 10 night stay at The fountains, we loved it. We stayed in a 3 bed town house which looked quite small on the outside, however we were pleasantly surprised when we entered. It's large and spacious with modern decor. The kitchen and bathrooms were all sparkling clean although the beige carpet on the upper floor and large rug in the living area really needed a carpet shampoo. The ground floor is all tiled and also could have been cleaner, this aside it really is a lovely place to stay. The bedrooms are all really large and comfortable, and it's a very quiet peaceful area. The local pub/ restaurant Millers is only 5 mins walk away and was the best food we had overall and was very reasonable. Publix is a 10 min walk and also a chemist, fish and chip shop, subway, dunkin donuts.This is a gated community so feels very safe, however the rear of the properties are not enclosed so not suitable for small children, and a couple of lakes with signs saying beware of alligators!! We didn't see any but I did have an encounter with a raccoon at the waste bin!Overall this is a nice place to stay and I would definitely stay again next time we visit Orlando.

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Me and my boyfriend's family stayed in a townhouse (3 bedroom) at Fountains from August 27th - 10th September 2017. The resort is gated, which makes you feel very secure. All the rooms were immaculate and modern. There was 6 adults sharing one of these townhouses, and we didn't feel like we were all on top of each other at all as the house and rooms are spacious. Netflix is on the TV in the lounge which was good for of a night. The pool (both smaller and the main) were lovely and modern, lots of sun loungers and only a small walk from the townhouse. We were caught up in Hurricane Irma, and although we were lucky to avoid any damage or real issues, we were stuck as we were due to depart the day the hurricane hit Florida. Fountain's allowed us to stay on an extra 2 nights without any hassle at all. While we were in the pool the day before, a lovely gentleman came and reassured us about the hurricane and gave us a print out with some tips and guidance which was very appreciated with us never experiencing anything like it before. During the hurricane our alarms tripped and an engineer was with us within minutes to fix them at 2am. The location was ideal, 10 minutes to Disney and only about 20 to Universal. 2 minute walk away from 7/11 garage, Millers, Chillies, Publix and Dunkin Doughnuts as well as many other shops. Would definitely go back, lovely accommodation in a lovely area. Staff were brilliant.

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We booked this place as a getaway though timeshare. The pictures were beautiful! However, this is not what I was expecting. This is NOT a resort. The units are off a parking lot so don't expect a whole lot of landscaping or shade. These townhouses are for sale. They are most likely being rented out through a company till they sell the units. So a unit you rent will most likely have a for sale sign out front and/or one in the window. That's not a big deal. What is a big deal is the lack of care these units get. The kitchen faucet was broken. I could literally pull the whole faucet off the counter top. The water still ran so I just sucked it up and and decided to just make do. The back patio is open. No screen, no grill, no table, no chairs, only one lounge chair. That's it. The carpet was dirty, they AC stopped working, the dryer didn't work (it took two cycles to dry a load of clothes), lack of kitchen utensils/pots/pans, chipped dishes, the television stations quality looked like it was from the 80's, dead bug juice on the walls......I mean the list could go on. You could tell all the furniture in the unit was rented and old. Just rubbing my legs on the legs of the kitchen chairs left brown stains on my skin. The beds were horrible and squeaky. Our week couldn't end fast enough. I won't be returning.Pros:* Parking was convenient* Pool area was cleanCons:Everything else.

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I loved the interior design of this townhouse! It was nice, however, i did notice stains in the carpet, mostly going up the stairs, as well as, some stains in the carpet of upstairs and in each of the bedrooms. The bathrooms upstairs were clean, but I noticed crumbs or something on the floor of the half bath downstairs. The twin beds were really loud. Every time I shifted, the bed made noise. Not only that, but the headboard banged against the wall no matter what. Just sitting on it would cause the headboard to hit the wall. For the bed I slept in, I shoved a pillow between the wall and the headboard to keep it from banging against the wall. The other twin bed was used for my luggage, etc. and that bed was the same as the bed I slept in, loud. I couldn't imagine having someone sleep in the room with me and hearing their bed squeak and the headboard hit the wall every night just from turning over or getting up. Also, the railing going up the stairs was wobbly. I noticed it wasn't screwed in to the wall well. I also noticed the railing once you got upstairs was wobbly. I refrained from touching either for fear they would break. The living room area was very clean, the couches were comfortable and clean and the HD TV was amazing. The dishwasher wasn't draining the water inside so someone had to come fix it. Also, the alarm system kept chiming every so often. Couldn't be heard upstairs which was great. One morning, the kitchen lights and wifi went out unexpectedly and it wasn't until my father messed with the box in the garage that everything turned back on. I will say that there should be policies and consequences for guests and/or residents who are inconsiderate of others staying in this gated community. The first night here, a huge transit bus was stopped just in front of the driveway of the townhouse my family was staying in. My father had to ask the driver to move up. Mind you, every single night and morning, this bus pulled up in front of the driveway, blocking our vehicle in. If we wanted to go anywhere around 10am, too bad because that bus was always boarding people right there and stayed for at least 30 minutes if not longer. Every night, I had trouble getting any sleep because the bus would drop off all of these people and they would run around like chickens with their heads cut off laughing and playing in the street at 12AM-3 AM! Running back and forth down the street and into the townhouse next door and townhouses down the street and across the street. I mean there were multiple buses passing the bus in front of our townhouse, letting off dozens of people. Absolutely no consideration for others. Doors were slamming, people were screaming. It was like this EVERY night. My dad had to go make a complaint and they said security would take care of it and that other people complained about the same thing!! Out of all of those nights, i witnessed a security guy stop by the townhouse next door with teenagers out front speaking to them. I believe he was telling them to be quiet. Hell, he could've been conversing because once he left, they were back at it. Another note: these buses weren't even supposed to be coming through the gate and that's coming from front desk. One night I looked outside, and I saw a group of these people standing in our driveway behind our vehicle doing god knows what, laughing and talking and such. The day we left, my father was loading our things and he noticed someone had used their finger to write on the back of the truck. Funny thing, the day we left was the day they looked like they were leaving. They ruined the experience of this place. Not sure if i'll stay here again.

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE Place to Spend Your Money
column29: The people who manage the Fountains and Tuscana are rude and inconsiderate. The person taking our order at the pool side restaurant was rude and disrespectful. She treated us as if we were trash. When I told the manager of her lack of customer service, she wrote something on a piece of paper, but I'm sure it ended up in the trash. This is not a good place to bring your family. Don't let the pictures fool you. They do not look that good. The pictures are deceiving. The customer service is worse.

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: A estadia no The Fountains at Champions Gate foi fantástica. O condomínio é bem localizado, próximo aos parques Disney (cerca de 15 min) e a casa que escolhemos, de 3 quatros, é espaçosa, aconchegante e limpa. Os chuveiros, roupa de cama e banho, além dos eletrodomésticos atenderam muito bem a nossa necessidade. A recepção para check in e check out fica no condomínio ao lado, mas em nada atrapalhou a estadia, pois também há uma recepção e funcionários no The Fountains. A área de piscina e lazer também é bonita e limpa. Recomendo. Viajei com a minha família, em um grupo de 6 pessoas e foi super confortável.

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: My family and I decided to stay at the Fountains, we stayed at the homes in Cahmpion Gates and they were beautiful. So figured the townhomes would be just as nice. The check in was ok and we did not get to enjoy the pool due to weather and time there. But the townhouse floors carpets were dirty, I was afraid to not wear shoes on the floor, the walls were dirty. Could use a little love in townhome #8177. Asked the receptionist at the front for their best home, she stated it was their best. Would hate to see the second best. Not sure if we will use the Fountains again as a vacation choice. Love Champions Gate!

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We are in our final day of our stay at the Fountains at ChampionsGate, and the end can't come soon enough! This place is awful!!!!! We are in Orlando for a baseball tournament, and this was one of the accommodations listed by the tournament to stay. Clearly the person recommending has never stayed here! The management staff is not helpful at all, and show no compassion or care for the issues that have come up. Here are those issues:*The carpet is old and dirty, walls are dirty, and bedroom furniture is all dinged up and paint peeling.*We were never given a garage door opener. When I told the front desk mid-week that I couldn't find it, they said, "oh we should have given that to you when you checked in."*Lights are blown out in the master vanity. I asked twice if they could be replaced. Both times I was told they would, but only one of the blown out lights was fixed. it's very dim.*The dryer barely works.*The gate to get into the complex was not working. There was a line of cars waiting to get in at 10:30 last night. The only way we got in was when a car left.*The air conditioning is weird. Even if it is set at 67 degrees, the downstairs is still very hot!*The pool has been so busy, we cannot swim. One day there was huge group in the pool (I'm talking 40-ish people), and they just stood in the middle talking. It was impossible for us to even move around in the water or swim.*The gym does not open early. This is my biggest issue! I workout 6 days a week, and needed to get my training in early each day before leaving for the baseball games. I went to the gym the first morning at 5:15am, tried to use my keycard, but the door would not open. There was a security guard walking around outside who told me the gym does not open until 8:00, and that I should go back to bed and come back at 8:00. Jerk! I did a workout outside that day, only to be hounded by dirty raccoons eating the garbage that people left outside. I called the front desk and they said, the gym at the main office opens at 7:00 if I want to use that the next day. I explained that it was too late, but again, no one really cared. I worked out outside the next two days, only to be chased by dogs, and bit in the face by fire ants while doing push-ups. Finally today, I went to the main office gym at 7:10, to find it closed. A security guard at that office told me that the gyms are supposed to open at 5:00am. What? Finally a person showed up to open the gym, and guess what? There was a guy in there working out!! I said to the girl, how did he get in? She said "I don't know. If you want, we can let you in early too." OMG!!!! I have been asking for that all week!!!!! This place is a joke! I will never recommend it to anyone!!!

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: This is a perfect resort for the Orlando attractions. It is close to the i4, walking distance from restaurants and supermarkets. The townhouses are very clean, very spacious and have everything you could need while staying there. They are decorated to a high spec, and were very comfortable. There are two pool areas, one for the townhouses and a main pool area with poolside cabanas which appears to be available to everyone in the resort. Both are very pleasant, and were never too busy. We did not try the restaurant in the resort as there was so much choice elsewhere. We were around 20 minutes drive to Disney and around 40 minutes to Universal. There were shopping outlets along the way. There is a Millers Ale House, Red Robin and Chili's within walking distance, also McDonalds, Subway, a pizzeria, 7-11, Publix and Walgreens all in the same area. Across the road were more eateries, including Wendy's. The staff were pleasant, although not overly interested or keen to promote the facilities. We discovered for ourselves that there were two clubhouses, one for the resort and one for the townhouses, which had a cinema room, a gym and facilities to borrow dvds and PlayStation games.We would return to this resort in the future, and really enjoyed the comfort and convenient location.

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Nice modern, clean and spacious property and clubhouse. All the mod cons required for stay were in the property. Pool area nice clean and never overcrowded.Location was fantastic for travelling to Disney and other locations as right on the I4 junction with 10 min drive.2 mins Walking distance to local 7-Eleven, supermarkets(publix) and many restaurants.Very helpful reception & concierge staff to help buy Disney tickets.Will definitely stay again for next trip!

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: This location is a hidden gem! I was a little concerned about the distance between the Fountains and Disney but I quickly realized that traffic was not so bad. Resort clean and comfortable for family especially with young kids. Amenities nearby like grocery and dining! We enjoyed our stay and we will stay again!!

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Lovely Houses and massive main bedrooms
column29: really lovely place to stay. the House we stayed in was huge open living area on the ground floor and the bedroom where huge. the ensuite was something else:-) The only thing that was negative was that the bath and the toilet kept on blocking up due to internal plumbing. There are two pools to choose from and i recommend the Fountains one -Quiet and one one uses them. the Team who ran the complex where very friendly and helpful. Food was a disappointment and expensive which was a shame, 20 mins to Disney so not too bad but very close to Walgreens

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Planeamos unas vacaciones en familia en la zona de Orlando, y necesitábamos un espacio grande y cómodo. The Fountains at Championsgate fue el lugar perfecto para nosotros. Las casas son cómodas, amplias y equipadas con todo lo que necesitas para pasar unos días fuera de casa.

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Son casas muy confortables y amplias con lavadora y secadora muy útiles cuando se viaja con niños.El colchón de la habitación principal necesita cambiarse en la unidad que nos toco.A veces hay poco caudal de agua pero solo por minutos.Muy completa la vajilla.

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Ideal para familias con ganas de familia
column29: Gratamente sorprendidos por este alojamiento en un barrio cerrado o "Villa" a 15 minutos de ida a Disney y a 30 de Universal. Casas amplias con muy buenas prestaciones que se regentean tipo hotel desde una administración que estás "al lado" en Toscana (otro espacio similar) y con quienes se pueden compartir servicios como la pileta. Es un ambiente muy tranquilo como para descansar del ruido de los parques y tener momentos familiares por la noche. Muy cerca hay supermercados, estaciones de servicio y el acceso a la ruta rumbo a los parques a menos de 300 metros. La atención es cordial y las instalaciones de la casa muy nuevas: tienen lava y secarropas, horno común, microondas, heladera gigante, cafetera, lavavajillas etc. Como para ir al super y cenar en casa. Las casas son tal cuál están en la fotos de la página web. Mencionan que tienen parrillas pero no están en la casa sino en un sector tipo camping que no usamos. Volvería.

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: Incrível, excelente localização, condomínio tranquilo e lindo. Há menos de 05min de carro há restaurantes com Chillis, Red Robin, Miller Ale, Wendy's além de Publix e Walgreens. Fácil acesso para I4, 15 min do complexo Disney.

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Stayed with some friends and truly enjoyed the resort ! Staying at the fountains gives you access to a private pool that is really nice. The rooms are large and extremely comfortable for 4. Will stay here again next year!

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: A group of 8 stayed in two 4BR / 3BA condo's. The grounds are very clean, the condo's are newer and have granite counter tops & stainless steel appliances, washer & dryer. There is a supermarket, liquor store and restaurants within walking distance. Beds were comfortable. Maintenance is on site if any concerns. The pool was closed for maintenance, however we were advised we could use the pool/ spa at the sister property down the street.

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: This was our second time at the Fountains after many times at Tuscana Resort and everything was great again. The townhouses are beautiful, quiet, and well maintained. We love having a pool at both resorts we can use whenever we like. We always have a great time at the Tuscana Tavern thanks to David, Jenny, Craig and rest of their team. Hope to be back again soon!!

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: Our first time at The Fountains at champions gate. it was a family vacation everything was clean and confortable, the older kids liked the resort amenitities, it was excelent! clean and Luxurious accomodations!! Perfect location, we experience a great service by the staff! comfortable townhouse!

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Excellent! Luxurious accomodations, very roomy, easy to get to the interstate.
column29: Our second time staying here. Richly appointed, clean and roomy. Near restaurants, grocery store (Publix), and liquor stores. Very comfortable. The garage is quite small unless you're driving a Mini or something like that. The driveway is short, as well. We wound up parking our Expedition in the general parking across from our garage. Not a big deal, and really our only complaint. If you want to stay "someplace nicer" on your visit to the Orlando area, this may be for you.

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Caso você vá a orlando e a ideia é ir a parques todos os dias, este hotel pode ser um pouco longe para isso. Porém a casa é de excelente qualidade possui amenidades que outras do mesmo padrão não possuem como sabonetes, detergentes para a cozinha e sabão para máquina de lavar louças. No restante tudo impecável.

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Caso você pense em ir para orlando com a família e os parques da Disney são apenas um complemento, esta é uma opção excelente. Porém se você irá aos parques todos dos dias, esta casa pode se tornar um pouco desagradável devido a sua distâncias das atrações. A casa é muito confortável, oferece algumas amenidades como Shampoo, sabonete, detergente e outras coisas que a maioria das casas similares não oferece e você tem que sair para comprar com urgência.

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Amazing Property! Perfect Home Away from Home! Can't wait to go back!
column29: The Fountians at Championsgate offers fully stocked self-care units that include everything you'll need for the perfect stay (except food, Publix is less than 5 mins away). We arrived after hours & security was there waiting for us with our key. The gentlemen was extremely nice and helpful. Once inside the unit we were all AMAZED, it was just beautiful! We stayed in the 3bedroom 2.5bathroom. The following morning I went to do the official check-in and received great service from the girls at the front desk; they too were also very infortmative and helpful. Please understand that check-in is to be completed at the Tuscana Resort. The location was ideal, close to the supermarket (Publix) , 7 eleven, Wendy's, McDonalds, and etc. The major theme parks are 15-20 minutes(depending on traffic). The resort also has an onsite concierge that can help assist with purchasing park tickets. This property was more than I anticipated! We all loved it and cant wait to come back this summer! Thank you for providing exceptional customer service and a high quality home away from home :) Travelers you wont regret choosing this place! 2 pools, a park for the children, within vicinity to nearby restaurants for family outings, and so much more. The ideal location for family vacation!

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: The townhouses are great.Very spacious and clean The neighborhood is very quiet, away from all the Orlano crowd. 20-25 minutes form Walt Disney theme parks and 30 min to Universal Studios Parks. Restaurants nearby.

The beds and bedding were comfortable, as were the in unit towels and wash cloths. The towels by the pool were somewhat skimpy. The unit had amazing closets everywhere. We had 4 children and 5 adults and we were not crowded.This is not a hotel. It is 3 and 4 bedroom town houses.

column29: O lugar é muito amplo. Todos os quartos muito bons. Fica localizado em uma área muito tranquila e com bastante verde. Estávamos em 7 pessoas sendo 3 crianças e nos acomodamos muito bem. A independência era total. Com a cozinha equipada fazíamos nossas próprias refeições. Excelente lugar.

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: New, quiet(ish) and close to everything
column29: Pros: -friendly and courteous staff - responsive to requests (including accommodating our arrival time of 230am but ensuring the security staff had our keys and check-in documents)-close to grocery stores, gas station, Dunkin Donuts, liquor store, and numerous restaurant (Millers Ale House, Red RObin's and Chilly's)-15mins to Disney attractions-outside the busy city enough to be quiet(ish)-new build-clean and visually appealing-great pool and hot tub (we were more often than not all by ourselves in the pool)-free DVD rentals / YouTube / Netflix on TVs / Free WifiCons:-all browns and beige? Could we not inflect some Floridian color into the scheme of the community?-walls between townhouses are paper thin (I question whether the builders considered installing sound reduction measures)-a little difficult to find tucked away down a side street-no salt and pepper in the kitchen?-lacklustre yard and no outdoor furnishingsWe'd stay here again. Thanks for reading. -

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Hidden fees ruin a nice place to stay.
column29: There are a lot of pros to this property. The 3 bedroom condo is spacious and very nicely appointed. Granite/ stainless, etc. the pool is awesome and heated. Location is decent. A few major major qualms (and reading the other reviews I am not the only one who has felt this way). At check in I was hit with $113 in fees. I had already prepaid for the room and did not expect any charges at check in. Let alone these exorbitant fees for a 1 night stay. I travel often and I do read the listings. These fees are not prominently mentioned anywhere... they are indeed hidden. I would not have chosen this property had I known of the fees. In addition my check in was comically slow. It literally took over an hour. The keys didn't work, back to the main building, new keys didn't work, back to the main building, "we'll send maintenance" wait for maintenance for 20 minutes for him to look at the door and say "the locks don't work just get the garage door opener and enter through the garage" back to the main building get the garage door opener and finally get in. Over an hour and there was no line when we got there to check in!Also mentioned in a previous review was that it is hard to find. The property commented back that they never get that complaint. Let me go on record as agreeing with the guest... the property and check in area is VERY hard to find if you've never been there. Nice property, but a lot of improvements to be made, and ultimately there is no excuse for hidden fees which are dubious at best.

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Family of four, 2 kids 8 and under. Villa was clean with a very well equipped kitchen. We ended up get supplies from the local Publix supermarket and eating in most evenings and every breakfast. Lounge was comfortable with nice TV (including Netflix). Some of the dining chairs were in bad condition however and looked like they might have been broken and repaired poorly. We raised this and they were fixed again but I still didn't feel comfortable sitting on them (I weight 11stone, but they still looked like the legs would cope with any weight on them!) bedrooms were comfortable and the bathrooms were nice with good showers. Only issue we had was it smelt as if previous guests had used the garage as their smoking room. Only had to go in their to park and get in the car so not a major issue but stale smoke never smells good. The swimming pool was nice and there were lots of seats / sun loungers - however very few families were using the pool whilst we were there. I can imagine at peak season that it could be a little too crowded.Proximity to the major parks was great and to Orlando International Airport.We would definitely consider staying here again when we next visit Orlando.

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column27: Hanging up at reception desk 3 times ?!
column29: We called at reception desk around 3 times around midnight to get some simple information and we figured out that reception desk is not aswering the phone rather they hired some outside office for that, who hanged down our phone 3 times in a row, they even asked some stupid questions like in which country we are stated and so on.So, if something happen after certain hour, you could have serious problems after getting any help or answer (maybe they call it optimisation, we call lack of proper resources).What is not ok is also that almost half of the lights are not working in the villa we hited and that you can hear everything through the walls of each room, especially from upper to down floor.The last but not least, there are no beds adjusted for kids (we were actially two families with 4 kids)

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We were greeted at the front desk immediately and our check in was flawless. We stayed in 4 -4 bedroom houses that included all the immunities you needed. Extra towels or soap,garbage bags were provide upon asking. We had our own pool away from the main resort.We were provided great assistance by Consuelo Zuluaga. We asked to keep one of our house until we returned from the golf course to shower and store our luggage and this was provided at no extra cost. A great place to stay with remarkable staff and restaurants and grocery shopping steps away from the resort. Also a very easy access to the I-4.

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Rented a 4 bedroom and it was great. Nice and clean and brand new. A few things to be aware of: ac is on 2nd floor as a result all the cold air is pushed out on 2nd floor while the master ac has bad air flow. Thus, everyone on 2nd floor freezes while master first floor sweats. Also the master bed room door has one door knob with a lock but no other door knob so you can't lock the door for privacy. Not sure if they are all like this but management might want to make this a working door lock. Master bed floor bathroom shower also doesn't have strong hotel water flow but I think that's the nature of the beast. Besides these issues I would certainly stay again with my family of 6. It would be nice if a hose was kept in garage for those who have own cars to wash since a faucet is outside. You can get a garage door clicker from front desk which is nice. One bad thing about the garage door is that it sounds worse then a freight train when opening or closing. Sounds so cheap of aluminum and not sure how the builder installed something so horrible sounding. If you have ev car you can charge in the garage. Photo is of a tesla charging with regular outlet at 3 miles per hour (better than nothing).

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: AMAZING. We stayed at the Fountains. Everything you need from a home away from home. Absolutely not one complaint. The washer and dryer was perfect. Didn't need to over pack. The drive to Universal is about 25 minutes. Shopping and eating was practically in the backyard. Highly recommended if your looking for a luxurious Villa. I'm a bargain hunter myself and after researching for several weeks, the Fountains provided the most for your buck. The hot tubs at the end of a long day in the parks was the best part of our trip. Gated community with your own driveway and garage was the seller for us.

column29: My husband was lucky enough to find this great rental. The property was nice. We were able to take nightly walks and felt safe thanks to the night security. As with any place there are bound to be a few issues. Ours were addressed and fixed immediately. To be honest my favorite part was the beautiful pool and friendly staff. There is a McDonalds, Wendys, Red Robin, Chili's and Millers pub as far as restaurants. In addition a Publix grocery store, liquor store, decent pizzeria, Dunkin Donuts and a 7-Eleven all within walking distance. The property itself has Tuscana restaurant.

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: My Family and I booked our holiday via Thomas Cook, initially staying at Tuscana Resort but upgraded to The Fountains
column29: As previously mentioned, we originally booked our holiday with staying at Tuscana Resort. However, after further research with cleanliness and additional space we decided to upgrade before traveling and contacted the Aston Group via email for an upgrade, receiving a prompt reply. I would advise travellers to contact the Aston Group rather than amending with a travel agent as additional fees are normally added when involving a third party.The staff at the resort were excellent in terms of providing providing information, along with the maintenance acting professional and very polite. The air conditioning had a few issues which maintenance were aware of but we didn't even notice up on arrival and the staff fixed within minutes along with a blind with a missing panel and this was also fixed immediately.The accommodation was to a high standard, open plan living area and W/C along with access on the garage which could be locked from the inside for more security and the patio doors had locks to the screening too which is a plus if you have children and don't want to open the patio door for safety. The main reason why I comment on safety is the Alligator in the lake which we noticed sunbathed on the bank and as there is NO gate or fencing between the Alligator(s) and the people sunbathing on the patio area technically the Alligator could have easily walked on our patio area and entered the villa through the patio doors. However, after speaking with many local residentants in Orlando they advised us Alligator have a tendency to keep aware from people and I believe this to be case with the Alligator in the lake as overtime we opened the patio door when this on the bank approximately 6ft away from the patio area/patio door he/she would jump back into the lake and kept himself to himself but and I stress BUT I don't think for one moment I would leave my children on the patio and they are 15 years old and 8 years old as my Husband and I noticed the Alligator looking at our Son probably due to his small frame. (So parents, beware)!!!Apart from the Alligator issue and he wasn't very big approximately 4ft considering the size of some of them in Orlando but enough to harm someone I suppose if he wasn't to shy and then again, it depends where the villa's are located as ours was obviously backing onto the lake where the three fountains are. However, some villas backed onto woodlands and what seemed like a car park maybe with a small garden. I would like to point out that there could have been more sitting areas on the patio rather than just one sun lounger but I imagine this might be a deterrent to prevent people sunbathing with Alligators present. Again, there are signs stating do not feed the Alligator(s) so again, families please do advised to safe guard children, especially considering what happened this year with that poor little boy.Overall the complex is lovely and well kept to a high standard, having two good sized swimming pools, one at The Fountains and the other having access to the Tuscana Resort pool with nice sunbathing facilities and a bar at the Tuscana Resort with a restaurant too.The Fountains reception area before entering the pool area has a small gym, dining facilities for self-catering (no service) and plenty of sitting areas for both adults and children with TV's and games etc.Additional charges for cleaning are available and a charge per day was mandatory for access of maintenance and Playstation games, TV etc. All the bedrooms were relatively large with en-suite his and hers sinks and the children were of a good size too with plenty of storage, walk in wardrobes and plenty of room for hanging of clothes and suitcases, which is important as you don't want to be falling over your suitcases, especially when you are staying for a long period like we did (3 weeks). Overall, the villa was pretty much a home to home feeling and we loved the space. The villa we had was a 3 bed but they do have 4 beds too I believe and if I must say so well worth upgrading from a condo to a villa for additional space, along with luxury of course as these relatively new homes to a high spec. Perfect for a family with teenagers - children and parents who need there own space after spending long periods of the day together and want their own time less arguments and more happy memories in our case anyway!!Champions Gate is minutes from restaurants, Walgreens and the super market and a short drive from Celebration which is a must as such a lovely place, international drive is approximately 10-15 minutes by car and Disney 20 minute drive and probably the same distance but the other direction for Universal.My Family and I would recommend and have done as this provides a relaxing environment have such a hectic day at the parks sunbathing and plenty of space for a good sized family, rather than being couped up in a small space, like some hotels or complex's and well worth upgrading as opposed to staying at the Tuscana Resort as most of the condos are quite dated when comparing with one of the villas.We are returning to Orlando 2017 staying at Disney's Floridian Hotel but will be returning to this complex probably 2018-2019 primarily due to excellent service, accommodation and a spacious, relaxing environment.

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms

column27: Not a toddler proof facility whatsoever
column29: The first thing we had to do upon arrival was to go to store to purchase toddler door knobs and a special door latch for the front door because there was no lock at the top of the door. All bedrooms are on the second floor so if you do have a toddler you will want to get the knobs to prohibit them from escaping their room and falling down the stairs. You will also need to bring or rent a high chair or pac-n-play for sleeping. These items are not made available from the facility. And, lots of glass, EVERYWHERE. TVs not attached to wall, tables, side tables, dinnerware, no plastic at all. There is a very small playground but at the farthest point of the adjoining resort.On the good side, the units are beautifully decorated unless you are a little on the hefty side. The dining room chair legs had to be rescrewed several times. For your toddler, you can use the garage for a playroom if you find a way to keep it away from the water heater.On the bad side, the units were not built to last so if you're thinking about a purchase here, make sure you get it inspected. One lounge chair and one chair per unit is unacceptable for a six to eight person unit. There was no table or even side table for what was there. An extension of the very small porch area would make for a more comfortable outdoor experience. We had unit 8107. It was close to the pool and clubhouse. The garbage dumpster was on the other side of the clubhouse. We did have very good wifi but facility has several rental options so cost is unknown.
