column27: Wonderful place to stay, clean, friendly and affordable.
column29: I stayed at The Fountains from June 13th-18th and I must say the stay as amazing. Very relaxing and the staff was awesome. There is even a washer and dryer in the units. It felt like home and only minutes away from Disney world. There are a lot of convenient amenities in the areas and also nice areas to go for a run.

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: This place is great and in a perfect location. Championsgate is it's own community. You have Publix supermarket within walking distance, along with a walgreens, dunkin donuts, McDonalds, a pizzeria, and Chili's Restaurant. They are developing 2 more restaurants currently. Once of which that looks like it will be opening soon. A red robim and miller ale house. It is not a hotel, but a townhouse. We stayed in a 3 bedroom 2 1/2 bath townhouse. It includes, a washer and dryer, full kitchen, utensils, living room with flat screen tv, and tvs in each bedroom. The master bedroom has a queen bed with a small walk-in closet and his/her sink in the bathroom. The other bedroom has a full and the 3rd bedroom has 2 twin beds all on the top floor. There is an additional bathroom on the top floor for the other 2 bedrooms to share. There is a half bath downstairs. This place also comes with free wifi, free movie rentals and free video game rentals - place comes with sony playstation. They have a movie kiosk in the main lobby area and another in the pool area of Fountains. The main lobby is in Tuscana - where you check in. This is very confusing, only issue we had. We didn't arrive to the location until 11:00pm and the GPS kept taking us to another location. So, if you are checking in remember to put in the GPS the Tuscana Resort location. This is where the check-in and main lobby is. This is not like a hotel that you get cleaning services and change of towels, extra toilet paper, and etc. everyday. There is a fee for those services and any additional items you may need. We went to the Publix down the street and purchased toilet paper, paper towels, etc. And if you need clean towels you have to wash them yourself. It is basically, renting a town house or condo for the week. There is a one time cleaning fee at the end of you stay, it is billed at the end of your stay.Now about the property, it is very clean. Stainless steel appliances and well maintained. However, I don't think the property is that old, Tuscana is older. So, for 2 years old it is very clean and very nice. It is gated and you will need a pass code and pass card to go in and out of the property - we felt very secure. If you are going to Disney or Universal Studios, it is only a 10-15min car drive depending on traffic. So, ideal for families or large groups. The pool area is perfect, not a huge pool but a nice pool. This is where the gym is located and the movie room is located. You can make arrangements to rent out the movie room for the night, and it is free. Nothing bad to say about this place, I would stay here again. It is near a lot of places, walking distance too, great clean rooms, large space, secure and safe location, and close to all theme parks.Only thing that was a disappointment was that when we called to make reservations and had questions about the room sizes and bathroom. We were told that a half bathroom is not really a half-bath since it has a shower. Guess what that was not true, it was really a half-bath (toilet and sink). We actually need the extra shower, but we made this work. We would have rented the large 4 bedroom, if we knew this. Also, for anyone that goes again or stays here, supposedly all the townhouses are different. Not all 3 bedrooms are the same nor are the 4 bedrooms. Other than that it was perfect.

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column27: Impressive property - beware of the hidden fees!
column29: This place is beautiful, comfortable and overall exactly what I expected... except for the more than $200 in hidden fees that were only communicated to me at the time of check-in. When you pre-pay for your stay, the last thing you want to do is find out that you have to pay an extra $200+ for 'cleaning and resort fees'... This didn't ruin my vacation, but felt really petty. Management would be better off by just including the fees in the rates (like most other places).We stayed in a 3 bedroom house; it was clean, spacious and had everything you could want/need for a family vacation (washer/dryer, multiple TVs, WiFi, kitchen utensils, linens, etc.).The pool area is perfect for small children and was very pleasant.The location is convenient and offers easy access to most places in the Orlando area.

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: 5.0 star rating 5/15/2016First to ReviewBrand new upscale and gated Mediterranean 2 story 3 or 4 bedroom townhouses with garage.We stayed in a 3 bedroom with a 2.5 bathroom. The rooms are very large and very clean.There are large flat screen TVs in the LV and each bedroom. The kitchen has granite and stainless steel appliances, including all small appliances, cooking and serving accessories and a pantry. There is a divider with 5 bar stools then an open DN with 4 seats. The LV opens to a small patio with a wooded view. The 2nd floor has a full size washer and dryer and a large water heater. The beds are firm with soft sheets, duvet and over sized pillows. There a full sized closets with a walk in and safe in the master. All bathrooms have soap, shampoo/conditioner, large soft towels and rain shower heads. The master bath has a double sink.Clean, spacious, well appointed, upscale decor. One of the best rentals!

column29: We have been planning this trip for a year. I have 3 grand daughters and went with my son and daughter in law on a Disney Vacation. This town home was perfect for us. Lots of space for everyone. I (grandmother) had my own room tucked away with plenty of privacy. Very nice decor, nice furniture. And all new Stainless steel appliances. Even a washer and dryer. We even had Playstation and free movie rentals. The pool/hottub and club house were beautiful. It is also a private gated community. We were a little unsure about the location. Exactly how far it was from Disney world. Well it was 15-20mins tops, depending on which park you went to. A Publix grocery store was 5 mins away. The house is provided with a couple garbage bags and dishwasher tablets,toilet paper, and paper towels. But I would suggest you bring your own laundry detergent, few extra garbage bags, salt & pepper, extra dishwasher tablets. All in all this was a comfortable, spacious and convenient home away from home for our Disney vacation. Would definitely visit there again.

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,087 - CN¥2,889 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Newly built, well appointed, great place
column29: We were searching for a condo/house for a one night rental for a meeting/party and things were going here and there. We found The Fountains at ChampionsGate with a bit of an internet search. Perhaps saying that it is in Davenport can be a bit confusing, but it is really just a few short miles from the major attractions in Orlando. In addition, the property is immediately off from Interstate 4 and easy to find.Checking in was painless and we were given the security code for the gate - assuring that there was indeed a nice level of security. The properties are actually condos built in townhouse style - 2 units with a common wall. I think were actually the first tenant for the particular unit we were assigned.Three bedrooms upstairs, one king with an attached full bath, one queen and a room with two single beds. The queen and singles share another full bath. The upstairs is spacious - with the access not a narrow aisle but rather a nice open space that also features a clothes washer and dryer, ample storage and more storage. The layout is well thought out and makes every practical use of space.Downstairs, coming in the front door, you are greeted to a nice combo living room space with a dining area that was well appointed. Then the full kitchen - a small island for prep area, dishwasher, full size fridge and freezer with ice maker. Just off the kitchen is the master suite - huge area - brilliant master bath with a huge shower, enclosed toilet and a huge closet that has a built-in digital safe typical to many hotels.Around the corner and in almost every nook, you find a door leading to more storage - noting is wasted. Also around the corner from the Master suite is a spacious half-bath. Every area was supplied with soaps and shampoos as required, plenty of towels and wash cloths. Finally, the last door on the bottom floor leads to a singe car garage that also houses the water heater.There is (reasonably) secure Wi-Fi in the condo specific to the each section. Televisions and entertainment are in every room. Again, we think we were the very first occupants for our meeting/party as everything appeared unused and there were the typical stickers on the oven and such saying not to be removed except by owner.The kitchen was fully equipped, with cork screw and even a cheese grater. There was an empty pair of salt and pepper shakers, assuming someone would fill them. We just bought a quick salt and pepper combo at the nearby Publix market. Nearby means a quick walk... perhaps 3-5 minutes at the most or a back passage way so you do not have to enter the main traffic area. There is a Walgreen's drug store, a few fast food places, a few restaurants, a liquor store that featured a well informed and amiable clerk/owner (?) that was a delight to talk with while picking out a few items.Overrall it was a great stay, perfectly laid out, complete, nice level of quality and painless check-in check-out experience.The ONLY thing we might say is a down side is that being so close to Interstate 4, the traffic noise can be a bit noticeable at 4-5AMish, but if you have been at the theme park attractions all day long, you will probably be too tired to notice.We plan to use it again!

column6: #3 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column27: Luxury stay in a great location!
column29: The Fountains is a newly opened development at Championsgate, and we stayed there for a couple of weeks. It's great! The houses are all newly built, and our 3-bed house was really spacious and well appointed - furniture is really nice, kitchen is great and beds really comfortable. Flat screen TV's in each room too, which was good, and we had a great view of the Fountains too! Everything is quite contemporary and on trend. The house also had a Blu-ray player and good wifi connection.The resort is now complete, but still very new so was very quiet when we were there - we had the use of the gym in the clubhouse and the pool (which is spectacular) and spa to ourselves almost the whole time. The Fountains is linked to the Tuscana resort that is a short walk away, and there's a good pool there which is a little busier with a decent bar and restaurant too.Great location for Disney (it's about 10 minutes along the I-4) as well as International Drive, Kissimmee and LEGOLAND. Championsgate has good local amenities - supermarket, restaurants etc are a 5 minute walk/1 minute drive.Only comment I would make is that the Clubhouse is a lovely building, but it's currently got nothing in much of it - would be good if they could make something more of it so that it has a use. Maybe they'll do that once it gets busier.All in all, a great new place to stay on our Central Florida visits.

column27: Pretty Decent - Don't expect a hot hot tub
column29: Each property here is independently rented out either directly by the owner or through various rental companies. We stayed in a 5 bedroom home on Archfeld through Magical Memories. Obviously the specifics of each unit and its condition will vary with the ownership and rental arrangement so I will try to keep my comments focused on the overall area. The location is great. It is an easy drive to most Disney properties and just a short trek up to Irlo Bronson Blvd for groceries, Target & Walmart. The property is immaculately maintained and houses are separate enough to not have sound issues when inside. No one seems to ever be outside except to jog or sit by their pool so it does have a bit of a stepford surrealism. The property does not have an onsite spa / salon. It does have a lovely pirate themed play structure and park, as well as a common pool with water slides. The area does not have any internal trolly / shuttle service nor does it offer shuttles to the parks so you will need a car unless you plan to stay in and don't mind walking 2-4 kms to get to the common pool or groceries. In part because of the private backyard pool and in part because of the distance we never actually made it to the main pool area. The property size and private pool made it ideal for a family rental. We did however have serious issues with the pool. Apparently because of noise the pools are only permitted to circulate between certain hours. These don't include any hours prior to 9 am, or after 10 pm. There also appears to be a chunk mid day until about 6pm but we couldn't quite figure it out. Without the pool circulating it doesn't heat. Generally speaking the temperature was around 73 F without heating - but that was with an air temperature over 30 C most days. The hot tub is also directly on the same system as the pool. Basically the hot water enters the hot tub and then flows over into the pool to heat it. However with the limited circulating hours which are centrally controlled for the resort, it is impossible to actually have the hot tub be hot outside of a 7-9pm window, and even then it's only about 95F. Also despite the noise rules over the pool motor, the neighbours had no problem having their outdoor tvs on well into the late evening, and with a whole double row of pools filling backyards the sound definitely carries.

column29: We stayed at The Windsor Hills gated community this last fortnight and I have to say it was everything we were told. we booked through Ocean Villa in the uk but they do have an office just up the road from Windsor Hills which is always nice to know. The villa was 5 Bedroomed 4 bathroom and this was very handy as there was nine of us. All the rooms were large but the kdis loved their room as it had 4bunk beds which they loved the Villa was clean and well looked after. It had its own pool, a games room, a large pool table, its own wash room and its own cinema room which was lovely. Plenty of towels. Ocean Villas had left us a lovely welcome pack which consisted of all the basics milk Bread sugar cereal and other helpful bits.It is a gated community so it was safe. The Gate (staff 24hrs ) were lovely and very helpful. The community have their own pool, games room, mini golf and kids play areas. Everyth8ng is so close. Magic Kingdom, epcot, holliwood movies, Disney springs etc were literally 10minutes. Universal and .discovery cove were 20 mins. Shops were all close bye and restaurants of every discription on your doorstep. We would certainly stay there again and we have already recommended to our friends who are going next year..

column27: Barrio cerrado de calidad y muy cerca de los parques
column29: No estoy seguro de catalogarlo como resort, es un barrio cerrado ó country club, ya que nosotros alquilamos una casa. Claramente hay diferentes sectores, algunos con casas mas pequeñas y en nuestro caso, como viajamos dos familias y eramos 11, alquilamos una muy confortable casa de 6 dormitorios, piscina, sala de juegos, etc. El condominio esta realmente a un paso de los parques de Disney (desde nuestro jardin se veían los fuegos artificiales del show de cierre de Magic Kingdom). Un Wal Mart de 24hs a 1.5 kilómetros y estaciones de combustible, restaurantes y tiendas. Algo mas alejado de los parques de Universal, pero muy cerca de los accesos por autopistas. Nos hubiera gustado disfrutar mas del condominio ya que tiene piscina, un pequeño parque de agua para pequeños, gimnasio, un drugstore y un restaurante. Nos acreditamos el primer dia y la seguridad de la entrada nos dio una tarjeta con un codigo de barras para cada van y la entrada y salida era muy sencilla, pasando el codigo por un lector. En un excelente entorno y muy tranquilo, tambien daba para salir de caminata, pero despues de los parques uno no da mas... En resumen, si cuando en los sitios de alquileres de propiedades privadas para alquilar les trae una casa en el complejo, no duden en alquilar!

column27: Avoid 2615 Archfield and All Vacation Group at all costs
column29: We booked a 6 bedroom house through booking.com for the Spring Break and for my friends 50th birthday. We chose Malaquita House Champions Gate which we learned wasn't in Champion's Gate. Three days before we left Canada we received an email from all vacation group stating they had relocated us to Windsor Hills. I had spoke to the manager and she assured me this wouldn't happen, She ;lied, Told we were getting an upgrade we arrived to a house that had not been rented in some time. You could tell the horrible smell of the water, the COCKRAOCHES and BROKEN POOL. I don't want this to happen to anyone else. We booked through booking.com then received an 8 ish page contract and no refund. There is no transparency they are con artists. Booking did not help either. We called and emailed for the first three days of our trip with no resolution. The Manager of All Vacation Group is so nasty and spoke down to me when clearly had difficulty speaking English. She laughed at me on the phone when I was asking why the pool was only heated for 6 hours a day. They charged me 37 USD per day for pool heat and won't refund when we did not heat until the last day. They also charged me $135 USD for using my VISA. Booking.com only responded to say they reached out and were told that the issues were resolved and they were not. It is a real shame as Windsor Hills is a nice resort but this house should be condemned. I should also mentioned we paid close to $3000 Canadian for the house. BEAWRE of ALL VACTION GROUP as a third party for BOOKING.COM. Do your research and don't have your celebration ruined by liars and thieves.

column29: This is my third five star review of Windsor Hills! We love it here, and feel that it is a value! Condo was huge, and had deluxe amenities. Location, again great. Fancy high end place. Main club house pool was awesome too. The only obvious flaw I found, was the pool heat at the house was extremely inconsistent. The day we arrived it was warmer than it necessarily should be. Two days later it was too cold to swim in. Called maintenance, adjustments were made, oh and more cold water was added from the hose.? Pool remaind cold for the rest of the stay. That being said, with so many other things to do, and with the main pool so close, this was a minor flaw. Oh, well we really enjoyed Windsor Hills, and would recommend it to anyone visiting the area to unwind.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124

column29: We stayed at Windsor Hills resort and spa in mid February. We were blessed with amazing weather in the 80s every day. We rented a 3 bedroom townhouse with a dip pool. Units are rented through the Windsor Hills web site, VRBO and various other private rental companies. Our unit was very clean and spacious. The pool was heated to the perfect temp-not too hot and not too cold around 85. The kitchen had everything we needed, although salt and pepper and sugar would have been nice to have available. The bedding in our unit was pretty worn, but clean. Everything was in working order. My only complaint was we would have enjoyed some pool toys or floats for the kids. We used a grocery delivery service with no issues...don’t forget trash bags because there are none provided. We loved having the washer and dryer in unit. The thermostat was pre-programmed for the AC to run only to 76* we felt that was a little warm-but not a deal breaker for us since we were not in the unit that much.  We had no issues getting in and out of the front gate-if you use Uber or a local taxi service they will need to show their ID. The resort is meticulous and well maintained. There were separate areas, larger homes by the playground further out on the property, townhouses and 2-3br condos. Some of the condos were near the pool and you can hear the pool noise. The staff was very kind and friendly, we particularly enjoyed the front desk staff and the water slide attendants. The pool was by far our favorite part. It was clean and well maintained. It was heated and there was one water slide. They are currently building a larger water park area with 3 slides we look forward to returning and using that in the future. I am told there may be a fee associated with it. Upon booking we were told there were no resort fees. Which is true however...if you intend on using any of the sports facilities there IS a fee-so technically that is a resort fee. The fee is $5 PER use...which can add up when you have kids that want to play basketball, then tennis, then volleyball. There is a equipment deposit also but that is returned when you bring it back. The sports fields and courts are about 1/2 mile walk from the clubhouse. All facilities were well maintained.  There were plenty of chairs but they do fill up fast. You can bring small coolers to the pool which we appreciated. Pool was spotless. The crowd was mixed with seasonal renters and families. There is a small arcade many older games and a small gym. There was also a movie theater where times can be reserved to watch a movie of your choice. There were a couple playground areas, the castle one we loved. The other was in a further away area and we didn’t make it there. The one and only area we felt needed improvement was the “sundry store.” They sell some small overpriced groceries, cold drinks, ice cream and food. The store was always swamped with people. There didn’t seem to be proper equipment to make the fried food fast enough. Many people were waiting awhile for some not so great fried food and pizza. We did not care for the food at all and would not call this a dining on property option. Ice cream was slightly better but toppings were limited and being served from cups with suran wrap over them. Maybe proper storage containers would be a better idea. Staff in the shop seemed grouchy and often not friendly.  The whole property is gated and very safe. We did have a few rowdy neighbors that were rentals but someone came and they quieted down real fast. We did see a large number of black cats roaming the property at night...many were thin and looked like strays. On a walk back from the pool on night we counted 12 in a 6 minute walk...just strange. Overall we look forward to returning to Windsor Hills Resort and checking out the water park area when it’s finished.

column29: Llegamos al resort después de 24 horas de viaje. La puerta de la casa no abrió con los datos que nos habían dado en Dunmore Travel. ¡Con 5 niños! Viajando no teníamos Internet. Desde afuera nos conectamos al wifi de la casa y ahí vimos que teníamos un mail de hacía unas pocas horas en el que nos decían que lamentablemente hubo u error por parte de ellos y que la casa no estaba disponible. La habíamos pagado hacía casi 3 meses. Nos dieron una provisoria en otro resort. Cuando protestamos el Sr. John nos destratò. Finalmente se encargó otra persona más razonable y nos dió otra casa en otro resort que no debía estar en uso porque estaba muy mal mantenida. En la sala de juego había mugre de muuucho tiempo y el inventario tenía más del doble de cosas que las que había en realidad. Nos ofrecieron como compensación calentar la piscina a su costo. Pero también estaba sin mantenimiento así que a los pocos días dejó de circular el agua. Por lo que no sólo no estaba caliente sino que no se podía usar. Lo del título: Una mala experiencia

column27: Comfortable but Noise Can Be a Problem
column29: We stayed in an Almatron Loop condo, 1st floor, 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms. (We didn't really need a place this big, but it was all we could get on short notice.) There was a small screened patio, and a kitchen that was sufficiently equipped for our needs. The overall size of the condo was fine. Physically, the place was comfortable. It was in mostly good condition, although it could use a few small repairs or updates.We could hear random noises from adjoining condos - fortunately, nothing too bad, but we were aware of movements upstairs (they got up a lot during the night) and we could hear plumbing sounds when people ran the shower, flushed toilets, or used the garbage disposal.The hallways in this building are very echoey, and unfortunately a lot of people think it's great to let their kids wander through there, shouting and shrieking. A lot of adults also shout to each other from one end of the hallway to another. The noise is greatly amplified. We were very happy not to be near the pool, as it was a magnet for loud screaming people and their kids.The worst was one day when we wanted to stay in and rest. It happened to be landscaping day at our building. From 8:00 am to late afternoon, incredibly loud machinery, often right by our window. I know landscaping has to be done, but must it go on and on for eight hours in one location?Except for the landscaping day, the noise problem wasn't enough to ruin our stay. The location is good. It's reasonably close to all the Disney parks. There is also shopping and dining not far away. And it's near major highways, so we didn't have much trouble taking day trips.

column29: We stayed with friends at their Almaton Loop 3rd floor 3 bedroom/2 bath condo in November 2016. We had no idea what to expect and were subsequently blown away by this beautiful property. The condo itself was absolutely stunning with a fully appointed kitchen, in-unit laundry facilities and screened in lanai. It was tastefully decorated with new porcelain tile and granite countertops. Staying here we had full access to all that the Windsor Hills Resort has to offer: spectacular lagoon style pool, hot tub, slide for the kids, tennis courts, arcade, fitness centre, beach volleyball, basketball courts, convenience store and more. Located literally minutes from Disney, and close to Universal, it is perfect for families wanting to visit the parks. We were so impressed we decided to buy one for ourselves and have been back several times since. The rental prices are amazing...many of the units (including ours) start at $90 (USD) a night.

column29: We loved staying here so much! It was close to everything and had a homelike feeling, while being away on vacation! When we go back we will definitely stay at Windsor Hills again. We enjoyed every moment!!!

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We come to Orlando several times a year and stay at Windsor as often as possible. The location is great to the highways and parks. A new Walmart is coming nearby (might increase traffic a bit, but convenient). Lots of restaurants and shopping nearby if you have a car (which is a must for this location).The rentals are owned by different people, so conditions will vary. This is our 4 stay since 2014 and we used the same company 3 of the 4 times. So we kind of know what we are getting with the unit The other company had a reputable unit as well and the furnishings were also great. I will say it is hit or miss with what comes in the unit. These are rentals and not a hotel. There was one that had such crappy towels and wash clothes, we went out and bought our own. One unit had dishwasher detergent, extra toilet paper, paper towels, and washing detergent and others didn't. Just be on notice.The facilities are decent. Pool with slide, game room, pool table, table tennis, store with prepared concession type food, basketball, tennis courts. We spend most of time away at the parks and other attractions, so it fits us okay. We do a day at the pool, table tennis, and two games of pool (deposit required and time limit for pool and table tennis, sport stuff). The theater was down this last time, but we have never used it before. We have never had an issue with noise but we don't stay near the pool. We've only stayed in 2/3br condos. Parking can be hard for some units but you will find a space somewhere. The gatehouse can have a long line and they are pretty strict about getting everything set up with your access pass. We like Windsor Hills and looking forward to our next stay in 3 months.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We have stayed at Windsor Hills many times in the past as it has always been such a perfect location for a trip to Orlando. We booked our villa through thetopvillas.com and we stayed in number 450, which is number 2345 on Archfeld Blvd in Windsor Hills and it was brilliant. It was a lovely villa, i think it was one of the more recently built ones from the photos of other villas we looked at before booking ours and it was perfect. It's a six bedroom villa and we were a family of four, which worked out well for us as we did a lot of shopping in Orlando and ended up using one of the rooms for suitcases and shopping bags! It was an extremely well equipped villa, particularly in the kitchen, which contained everything we could possibly need and more - although we ate out most meals so we didn't use it much anyway. I've read other reviews of it being very loud and drunk people however we found it the complete opposite. On the first night the family opposite us were quite noisy but we only heard them whilst we were bringing in the luggage from the car but apart from that the other 10 nights of our stay it was really peaceful and calm. The villa we stayed in was very nice with nice furniture and very clean and modern with big flat screen tv's in every room and a nice large pool. The only couple of things that could have been better is that nearer to the end of our stay, a few ants started to appear in the master bathroom - I'm not sure where they suddenly came from but it wasn't ideal! The other issue is that there was only a tiny amount of toilet paper in the house, which was fine as we went out and purchased it along with drinks and things to fill the fridge but i would have expected for them to give us a little more in the first place. Overall, i highly recommend this complex if you're staying in Orlando with kids or just a group of adults wanting to do all of the parks. It is a perfect location, only minutes away from disney, our villa was very nice and the area was kept in very nice condition and it is very secure with 24hr security.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We have stayed at Windsor Hills many times over the past 15 years. It used to be such a great resort, in a great location with easy access to the parks. To say we are shocked at the decline of this resort is an understatement and if you are travelling with young children AVOID unless you are the type of family that are happy to throw your kids in bed and leave them to it while your outside getting drunk and partying the night away. Because this is now Windsor Hills party central where all you can hear is loud music and adults screaming and shouting to each until 3 or 4 in the morning. I'm sure some villas are in competition with each other to see who can be the loudest. It as been so bad some nights we have ended up with our grandchildren in bed with us because they have been woken up scared by the noise. The villa we stayed in was in need of upgrading but was well equipped with the basics we needed. Saying this if I was an owner here I don't think I would upgrade with the change in clientele. Has I would say Windsor Hills is now suited for more older families with teenagers or the group's of young adults we have seen. We did get a few good night's when we went to the coast for a few days which we loved. So if your young and love pool parties throughout the night. This is the place to be.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: Our 4th trip to Windsor hills, once in a condo, 3 times in a 3 bed condo with small plunge pool. Perfectly located for Disney, bit further to universal. Lovely complex with communal pool, jacuzzi, club house, shop, playground. Highly recommended.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: First let me say that we have stayed at Windsor Hills numerous times. We have stayed in two other condos and they were excellent. Well equipped and very clean and furnished nicely. Had almost anything you would need including beach towels, plenty of bath towels and wash cloths, plenty of sheets, newer TV's in every room, etc. We absolutely loved it. This time we stayed in #101 on the first floor. The furnishings are older and missed matched. The coffee pot base hasn't been cleaned in a long while. The pots that are there are scratched to the point of absolutely needing replacement. Everything stuck to them and they were horrible. No washcloths. There were only 4 in our party, but if we had had 8 like we normally have in our group we felt there wouldn't have been enough towels unless you kept washing them each time to have enough. We bought a couple of new towels to use. Since we were on the first floor, you heard people walking around the condo late at night and whoever was above our condo was running constantly at night even at 11 PM and one night until 2 AM. The other condos we had stayed at were on the upper floors. The pool which we normally loved had many large groups of people who would congregate in the entrance way to the pool with liquor, coolers and were very loud. Then the kids were in the pool unsupervised and some of them were jumping the fence and using the slide after hours. We saw someone smoking in the pool area. An adult with a group of children in the pool with a drink (liquor) and cursing. The unsupervised children were being obnoxious and splashing and making it hard for those with smaller children to swim. The TV's in the two bedrooms (the third bedroom did not have one like the other condos did) were fuzzy and need to be replaced. If you don't put the dryer on the timed dry it keeps running and doesn't shut off. There is no mixer and any baking pans at all. So if you want to make pizza, brownies or anything else that you'd like to bake bring your own pans. We were checking the pillows and there was hair on one and stains on one of them so we ended up going and buying new sheets and new pillows to use during our stay. In our opinion everything is older, some things stained and needs updating or replacement. At 4 AM the TV in one of the bedrooms popped on. We've decided that when we come down again we will be looking for another complex which is a shame because we've always liked Windsor Hills and have recommended it to our friends. Suggestions: Put in ceiling fans, make a listing of TV channels and laminate it for ease to find channels, replace two TV's in bedrooms and purchase one for the third bedroom, buy several more bath towels and add normal sized beach towels, replace pans and add bakeware, buy a mixer. There was a bench seat and 4 chairs which would seating at the table for 6 people not for 8. There was a large seat on the patio and it would have been nice to have a small table with chairs so you could sit out to have coffee in the morning or eat a snack. Replace pillows. We could not get the screened door locked on lanai so we didn't want to leave our beach items out there to dry. I also bought my own dish towels, hot pads and dish rags and left them for future guests. That's all that I can remember. P.S. I just called the management company to try and voice my concerns and he really didn't care. So that is a shame that they wouldn't want to take comments to make vacationer's stays more enjoyable.

column29: Stayed in a 5-bedroom, 5-bathroom vacation home in Windsor Hills with my in-laws in June 2017 for an 8- night Disney vacation. The address of our rental was 7709 Comrow St. We had a wonderful time and would definitely return. The resort community was clean, well maintained, and very secure. We lucked out with a great owner to work with as well. I was impressed with the close proximity to the Disney parks (which was my main concern going in to this trip as we are normally 'on-site' Disney guests). It took us less than 10 minutes to get from our door to any of the Disney parking lots. My only complaint about Windsor Hills was the temperature of the community swimming pool. It was uncomfortably cold, even considering the Florida June heat. Other than that, everything was great.

column29: I stayed here for the 2nd time in 3 years and the resort is still my favourite gated community in Orlando. It is safe, secure and quiet with a great pool area. Each of the houses have a private pool and can be rented directly from owners. It is very centrally located to both Disney and Universal Studios as well as the shopping outlets. I would definitely recommend this resort to anyone looking for a relaxing location after a fun filled day at the parks.

column29: We were upgraded to this resort when we had problems with our booking but wow! Really delighted to have been here. We had a condo with three double rooms and with extra sleeping facilities in the spacious living area so plenty of space for our group of 9. The beds were really comfortable and everything seemed pretty new and clean. There was an extensive kitchen too. The general site was peaceful and beautifully laid out. My daughter's and grandkids loved the pool so much that several days were spent on site. The resort is located off a quiet road running off the I192 and as such is close to a very wide range of shops, activities and eating places. However we found it best to have a hire car to have best freedom and convenience for accessing the main parks etc. We would be very happy to stay here again.

column29: We stayed at the Windsor Hills condo in May of this year and it was fantastic! All you needed was food, toiletries and of course some cool drinks. The property was very nice, clean and fun. The pool was great and the kids spent a lot of time there. Our condo was 3 bedroom and 2 bathrooms. We spent a great 10 days with our daughters, son-in-law and 2 of our grandchildren. This place is perfectly located so it was 4 miles to Disney and about 11 to Universal. There wasn't any amount of loud noises or any worry if you walked around the place at night. Kodos to you Windsor Hills for a great vacation.

column29: My family and I stayed at a large 6 bedroom home on Daulby St. In April 2014. We loved the pool and hot tub area that was large enough for all 12 of us. The home was clean when we arrived and had everything we could possibly need during our stay. We did venture to the main pool with the waterslide a couple of times which was nice but preferred our small private pool much better. The reason we chose this complex was because we liked the proximity to Disney, which was around a 10 minute drive to the Disney gates. There were 3 other home rented by our friends and family during the time we were there and no one had a complaint during the 10 days we were there. Windsor Hills is a gated community so you always feel safe. We would definitely stay here again when we travel to Orlando, especially with a large group!

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124

column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: USA the right way, Daulby Street!
column29: We arrived on the 24/04/27, after a 9 hour flight from the UK to a very warm Orlando!We had to collect our car, which was stress free and then find the offices of Global to collect door codes and so on for the villa. Tired but alive, we got to the complex and security at the gate were great and friendly. We parked up and entered a air conditioned cool villa at 2628 Daulby St, first impressions were awesome and it was a very good villa with a pool and spa, games room, 6 bedrooms, 4 bathrooms, 2 sitting rooms with a dinning area in one of them and a great kitchen area with a dinning area. In short it was massive and amazingly well kept.We had a pool table, games consoles, table football, air hockey table too! (In the games room). Also there were a selection of pushchairs/strollers that came in very handy during our stay.We stayed for 2 weeks, during that two weeks we had 3 issues that dampened our stay: 1) our upstairs air conditioning unit failed, it was 30c plus, walking from down stairs to upstairs was a bit like opening a hot oven! But this was fixed within hours and when the engineer came at around 1am he was really good about it and had it fully working within half an hour. Was a really good bloke too, after a short chat it was apparent he'd started work at 5am and still had work to do, but he was so chipper about it. 2) the freezer stopped freezing, after one repair that sadly failed they replaced the freezer and offered reimbursement for perished food. Whole thing took two days and Global were great in terms of time frames and so on.3) our pool turned green shortly before we left, this meant we couldn't use it for a handful of days before we left. Which was a shame as we were looking toward to a soak in the pool before we left. Again Global got someone out straight away and although it wasn't sorted to a usable standard before we left, it was fixed. But even though we had these issues, it didn't ruined our holiday and as I said above they got on it and got it fixed as quickly as possible. Can't fault them, things break sometimes sadly. On the upside the next guests should have a a fully working freezer, air con and pool. He he.I would recommend a villa to anyone who is planning on visiting Florida, this particular villa is minutes away from all the parks, half an hour tops to most of the main theme parks. The longest trip we had to make was 1hr 45mins to clear water. The airport is only 25-30mins away too. Yes the villa is a slightly more expensive option but for ease and access it's definitely the better choice. Will be going again, will be hoping to stay in the same villa. There is also a main communal pool on the complex, also a shop, gym and so on. Great stay great place.

column29: We stayed for 5 days in a condo/apartment with 3 bedrooms, 2 baths at 7675 Comrow, #101 in this beautiful gated and guarded community. This place ended up being the absolutely perfect location. Ground floor access right out a screen porch to the street, cross the street and there's the path directly to the pool! And I'd take ground floor cool and quiet comfort any day over 2nd, 3rd, or 4th floor heat and people stomping around. The apartment was actually completely quiet and the resort itself didn't even have many noise/troublemakers. The pool is definitely the best part with it's 84 constant degrees, beach-like slope for toddlers, and small water slide for the bigger kids. The pool even overlooks Reedy Lake, which is a small, idylic, man-made pond with lily pads and tons of water birds. There is a small clubhouse with a workout room with a half-dozen weight machines and a few treadmills/elipticals, as well as a small theater that they show movies at. And there are even two pool tables. Across the breezeway, there's also a small store for emergency essentials, and they also serve a couple of beers there on tap in plastic cups that you can take right out to the pool area (got a couple of Stellas for only about $6 for a 16 oz!) -- actually many people were drinking right at the pool as long as there weren't glass containers.We absolutely loved our apartment, and we'd definitely stay at Windsor Hills again...maybe next time we'll upgrade to a townhouse or even single-family rental which they also have here!

column27: Great resort with nice communal pool
column29: The house we stayed in was not what you would call cool but it was huge and very well appointed. The pool was awesome. The security really makes the place seem safe and it is so close to the parks. It takes less than 10minutes to get to Animal Kingdom, 12 to Magic Kingdom and about 20 to Disney Springs. This meant we could leave the parks in the afternoon, chill for a bit and then head back for shows or a few more rides into the evening. Having a little distance is actually what we wanted and the close proximity to the 192 makes getting your bearings very easy.When we checked out on our final day we used the communal pool and showers and just chucked all our wet stuff in a hold all. The little cafe did decent sandwiches and drinks so it worked out well. It is only a 40min drive from Orlando Airport too so we really maxed out our last few hours before flying home.We would highly recommend staying here for your Florida holiday, especially if you want to be able to dip in and out of the Disney Parks.

column27: Not a great place to stay - in need a cleaning, upgrades, and repairs.
column29: I do not recommend this resort. This is my second time: once in 2008 and now in 2017. It is as if nothing has changed.... same carpet, flooring, paint except now they are full of food stains and other dirt. The house we stayed (2568 Archfeld) in very dirty and in need of repairs, maintenance and significant cleaning. The game room is poor: pool table is uneven, the hockey game does not work and the pop a shot not set up correctly. Suggest there are new locations with cleaner, nicer homes for equal or less money.

column29: This is the second consecutive year we have stayed at Windsor Hills. Our specific location was 7658 Sir Kauffman. We love staying here. Fancy, upscale accommodations, at a fair price! Located just off of N old lake Wilson Blvd. It is 1 mile from world Blvd which is where the Walt Disney World property is. The location is ideal. Also security is a super high priority, and everything has an entry code, gate, or camera near it. The condo has its own swimming pool screened in and attached to it. Main pool area is super nice also. I won't list all of the amenities, but they're aplenty, no disappointments here. Located near a Publix Grocery, and a super Target so you can stock up on food and eat at home. Save lots of money this way, and eat meals out as a luxury, not a necessity. Stay right on condo property in between days going to theme parks, for​ lots of rest and relaxation. I am very impressed with how much we got for our dollar. I would suggest this for anyone on a budget or not! This property has quite a few different types of homes, so it is feasible for many different requirements. Try Windsor Hills! We will be back.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: We have stayed at Windsor Hills twice now and can say that it is a wonderful gated community. If you are doing the WDW visits then you are only 5 minutes away from the 'Gates of Disney' and minutes away from all the restaurants on the 192.Upon arrival at the resort we have always been greeted professionally by the gate security staff who are always jovial….even if there’s a typhoon or hurricane going on around them (Hurricane Matthew!!) Every time you pass through the gates after this, they always give you a wave and a smile. We had a very minor issue with our gate access card not working, they were apologetic and got the problem rectified fairly quickly.The resort is laid out in a logical manner. When you first drive in, on your right is the junction for the club house and access to the Condos. If you carry straight on to the left are the ‘town houses.’ As you keep travelling forwards/ahead there is a conservation lake to the right which is fenced off with neat metal fencing. There are trees lining down the centre of the road up to this point. If you continue ahead there are a multitude of junctions which lead to the 4,5 and 6 bedroom houses.The 2 houses we have had have been 5 and 6 bedrooms. The most recent trip was a 6 bedroom house and it was fantastic, plenty of room for our family of 3 and the also 3 grand parents!! The houses are well kept as are the grounds which the grounds men/women work very hard to keep the grass cut and bushes trimmed. Dotted around the site are children’s play areas, one of which is a large castle style structure. We have only spent a short period of time there which my daughter did enjoy…..kids wouldn’t get bored.The clubhouse is kept smart and the pool is a decent size with a fairly big waterslide for a resort like this. We only went to the clubhouse once as we did have our own pool and were doing the WDW and Universal attractions all day so really didn’t get much time in to do the clubhouse!!Overall……Windsor Hills Resort is a fantastic security gated site in a great position and I believe the closest one to WDW. If you like peace and tranquility after a day at the parks then this is the place to stay. All the staff are welcoming and polite in my experience….we hope to be back soon!!

column29: For our second trip to Orlando we didn't hesitate to stay once again at Windsor Hills. The gated community has so much going for it. Rental options - want a condo, town home or house? All of these are available for rent; just find the right one for your group! Our 1st visit we rented a condo and it offered so much for the price - 3 bedrooms, kitchen, etc. Our 2nd visit we opted for a bit more space and wanted our own pool so went for one of the town homes. Both were great options. Location - Disney is just minutes away! Sure you have to rent a car and pay for parking to get there, but think about everything else you'll get for a way better price (comfortable home, save on meals, clubhouse activities, etc.). Lots of restaurants nearby too. Handy location for getting to Universal and other attractions too. Activities - park, large clubhouse pool with slide, tennis courts, golf green, small game room, the list goes on...I'm sure there are other similar, good options available - but I can't think of anything this area is missing, so why search more!Don't hesitate to book a stay here!

column29: Our home that we rented for 4 days was very clean and well equipped. The pool and whirlpool were very warm and welcoming. A bit too much furniture for my taste, but your opinion may vary. Since we left our children at home -- so it was just my wife and I who travelled, having our own private pool was worth it. Otherwise, we could have rented just a small apartment but would have had to use the public pool. The fitness room at the club house is minimally equipped, and in the future, I don't think I would pay extra just to stay somewhere with a clubhouse. The managers and cleaners were extremely pleasant and helpful. When we booked, we had asked for a later checkout (11 o'clock instead of 10 o'clock), and received it for no extra cost. Nice. One thing, though. When checking in, there may be a long line up, so don't be surprised -- especially if you check-in just around 4:00 pm.This was a great place for us, and good value even for Canadians like us!

column29: We stayed at the Windsor Hills Gated community for our late Sep.2016 Disney visit. I can highly recommend this set-up. We were in a quiet, well-cared for, landscaped, safe, secure community with every amenity imaginable! All guests renting homes within the community can use the gym facilities & game rooms. There is a convenient store on site to pick up necessities, although we had a rented car and there are a huge number of stores & restaurants close by in the surrounding area like McDonald’s, Publix Supermarkets (huge selection & great prices & deals), Super Target, Chick Filet, Black Angus Steaks, Ponderosa,Taco Bell, etc ! The home we rented was perfect for my 2 yr. old granddaughter. The kids’ bedrooms had many stuffed Disney characters & we had many Disney DVD’s, books & puzzles; as well as adult board games, pool table & fooseball table for entertainment. Our kitchen was 1st rate (granite & modern) with anything we needed to cook –new dishes, pans, cloth napkins, cutlery etc. We mostly ate out but usually ate breakfast at the house as well as some lunches. We did laundry with our washer & dryer and had a screened in pool & adjoining hot tub plus large gas grill. There is a large pool that all guests may use that is excellent and large play areas for kids.We were sharing the house with my daughter’s family so this made it about as expensive as renting individual hotel rooms once we’d split the cost. However, we had so much more for the money – the house had 2 spacious master bedrooms with adjoining baths and the 2 extra bedrooms each had their own bath as well. So technically, you could share the house with 4 couples without kids; or 2 or 3 families with a few kids. Lots of options! This was an excellent choice I’d highly recommend.

column27: Outstanding condo, ideal location, beautiful place
column29: My husband, baby and I had been staying in a condo at Lake Buena Vista for 2 weeks; my parents had booked a condo at Windsor Hills and because of hurricane Matthew we made the decision to vacate our condo and go and stay with them. I only wish we had done this sooner - their condo at Windsor Hills was beautiful. They had a 3 bedroom unit which came with its own living room, full kitchen, 2 bathrooms, a washing machine and dryer - and everything you would ever need! They had a beautiful view from their balcony of the lake. The condo was decorated well and didn't feel old or tired. The whole condo was spacious and very comfortable.It was a 2 minute drive to the 192 where there was an array of restaurants and shops, and it was only a 5 minute drive to the entrance of Walt Disney World - ideal for us Disney freaks! I cannot recommend Windsor Hills enough and am already looking to book a unit there for a holiday next year. The communal pool was amazing - so clean and lovely. The security staff on the gate were friendly and professional. Everything was run extremely well and we would love to return here next year. Thanks for a lovely stay, we only wish it was for longer!

column29: This was our second visit to Windosr Hills, stayed in Bldg 7664 Apart. 301. We were not disappointed during this stay by our accommodation or the resort itself. The proximity to the Disney Parks makes the travel no longer than 10-15 minutes by car. These condos are privately owned and managed by some of the vacation rental groups in the area. Our condo was well appointed, comfortable and well stocked with every sort of utensil and having your own laundry facility makes life easy. The ability to have a meal at home in particular, breakfast or dinner allows you to relax prior to or after taking on the parks. Access to a grocery store is not easy so you will need a car, with a Publix (equivalent of Woolworths) store located around 5 minutes away. The resort pool is well supervised and not too deep so it is suitable for all ages, in particular young children. Security at the main gate ensures positive control of the facility. Overall this facility is well maintained and comfortable. If you are staying in the Kissimmee area you will need a car, because access to the myriad of parks, shopping centres and tourist destinations is not well supported by public buses. We would highly recommend this resort to anyone who asks, in particular, young families wanting to experience Disney World and Universal Parks whilst also getting good value for money accommodation.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Windsor Hills is a gated community, one of the closest to Disneyworld. A lot of the homes are privately rented, so you'll need to find one that suits your needs. Something to think about is the direction it faces. We had a south facing villa which meant that we had all day sun on our pool. We also had one that looked onto a dry bed which meant we were not overlooked from the back, which gave us some privacy. The resort is clean and well maintained. Great for a morning run before hitting the parks. There is a club house with pool area, but we didn't frequent this as our villa and Disney kept us very busy. I would stay here again if I was to visit Disney.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Condo 7673 was pretty good, close to pool & amenities. Comfy beds & furniture, clean & warm pool. Hated the back sliding door though, it was really difficult to slide, plus the pool alarm on it made it hard to enjoy the outdoor area - if u r cooking & kids in the pool, u can't see or hear them, hard to take in & out drinks & snacks, towels etc - it needs to b fixed & a safety barrier installed like some of the other condos. There's no basic foods supplied so you'll need to bring your own salt/pepper, coffee, sugar etc. The soap wafers provided don't last a day. They also need a tea towel supplied (we had to use the pool towels to dry dishes), kitchen tongs, ice cube tray. The communal pool is nice, shame about the overkill of rules though, more commonsense & less policing would b nice on holiday. Location pretty good, nothing restaurant & shopping in walking distance though. All in all 3.5/5.

column29: We visited here from August/September 2016. The house we stayed in was massive with 6 bedrooms for 5 of us with a lovely pool and jacuzzi outside. The house was very clean and the area outside of the house was quiet and immaculately clean.We visited the clubhouse once. Whilst we were there we went in the pool which was a very good size to accommodate lots of people to use. The staff were all friendly to us as well so we can't really fault this amazing place to stay!

column29: Having travelled to Orlando about 16 times I highly recommend this complex. It is very close to Disney shops restaurants and lots more. It is a gated community has a small shop on site. Communal pool is fab with plenty of sunbeds plus tables and chairs. Slide in communal pool. Shop beside the communal pool sell hot food and beers. Area is spotless and very well managed. You can rent a condo, town house or a villa with a private pool. Highly recommend this community.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: It's taken me a while this review, my family and I visited very late last year, we booked this villa as part of a holiday deal with flights included through Virgin.The villa itself was ok, definitely not a luxury villa, I travel to Florida on an annual basis and have stayed at several other villas that are not necessarily described as luxury however they ve been much nicer all round in general but like I say the villa was ok/average. The only good thing about this resort is its location which is very close to the main Disney parks about a 10 minute drive, also there's some good souvenir shop and a smallish super market close by about a minutes drive away.Now for the bad it may have just been bad luck but our particular villa seemed to have a cockroach infestation. On our first full day we were sitting in the lounge area relaxing and something ran past on the floor, I immediately put my feet on the sofa, within a 1 minute period something else ran across the floor, my partner went to investigate and to our disgust cockroaches. We contacted Virgin who had someone come and fumigate the house. The day after the fumigation we woke up to dead roaches about 5 just in the living room area alone not to mention the hallway. We were advised that after fumigation we would likely see dead roaches so it wasn't too much of a shock albeit disgusting and seriously made me itch. The day after seeing the dead roaches I went to the toilet in the middle of the night and screamed as again an alive roach running by, it was too late to call anyone being the middle of the night so I waited until the morning and made the mistake of going into the open wardrobe and yet another cockroach alive and well, to cut a long story short we demanded to be moved but unfortunately we were not moved far enough same resort but different villa, first few days were good but our last two days again yes you guessed it cockroaches alive and well darting across the floor and kitchen area.In a nutshell I would definitely not go back to this resort, we were so scared we would bring one of those disgusting things home with us in our luggage, also very unhygienic for my 12 month old who was still crawling at this stage,plus the first villa did not have commentary wifi the second villa that we moved to did though. Lastly I noticed that Virgin Holidays have stopped advertising this villa on their website I wonder if they no longer want to be associated with the place due to huge amount of complaints relating to cockroaches.

Private gated community, clubhouse with massive beautiful pool area.The villas on Windsor hills are all of great standard, and are all huge.Living and kitchen areas are massive, bedrooms very large, even the small rooms are big, decoration is very good. The pool areas are always fist class.A truly great way to spend a holiday, own space, plenty of own space, very secure and fully air conditioned all times.I would highly recommend staying in a villa to do Florida properly.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Amazing resort but felt let down by the villa (2615 Archfield Boulevard)
column29: We rented a 6 bed villa for our 2 week stay in Orlando on Archfield Boulevard on Windsor Hills complex. We went with extended family so there were 11 of us. The villa had ample room for all 11 of us 4 double bedroom and 2 twins with 2 of the rooms having their own en suites. The villa comprised of a walk through living-diner-kitchen area, 4 bathrooms, 6 bedrooms and a garage/ games room. The outdoor area had 6 sun longer a decent sized pool with a jacuzzi and there was room to park 2 cars of the front drive. The pool was fenced in by a big netted canvas which prevented bugs getting in but had a gate so the maintenance people could come and go as they pleased and clean the pool.The villa had wifi which was fast and connected well through the house and is located on a quiet road a short ride away from the disney parks.There were no issues with where the villa was situated the neighbourhood was quiet and the gate was 24/7. The first issue arose when we emailed the villa owner to ask how to turn the jacuzzi on. He informed there was an electric point outside near the pool which needed turning on. when we found the box it was hanging off the wall and seemed quite hazardous. We again emailed the owner to inform him of this issue. He said it would be sorted the next day. It was not. In fact it was not sorted until 4 days later.The second issue was that the aircn did not work in 2 of the bedrooms. Normally I wouldn't make a deal out of this but when it's 39 degrees Celsius with the sun shining directly in it becomes unbearable. The owner did not respond to this issue.On the 4th or 5th day of our visit there was a storm where lightening struck our local energy feed and caused a power outage for many homes on the complex. This was obviously unavoidable and no ones fault but when we contacted the gate house we were told to contact the villa owner as he would have to inform the energy supplier. We were told this would be fixed no later than 1:30. By 8:30pm we still had no electric. We contacted the villa owner but had no success. The power eventually came back on sometime later but we heard nothing from the home owner.As a result of this power out a component in our aircom unit had blown causing the temp inside the house to rise to 30 degrees C during the night and no one could sleep. The following morning we contacted the villa owner again who told us we could not contact him before 9am unless it ws an emergency, we explained that although he may not view it as an emergency it was something that needed fixing urgently, he told us to contact his office. The lady at the office was very helpful had someone out in a few hours of us contacting them.However, once the aircon was fixed it still did not work in 2 of the bedrooms. We informed the home owner of this via email but had no response. The information book which was provided by the home owners was also very out of date. A member of our party was taken very ill one night and the information provided in the book for ER and other various medical centres was all out of date. When trying to make a local call which is free from the landline was almost impossible as the phone line was so poor. So many complications in that situation could have been avoided if the phone worked properly and we were provided with basic and correct information.Two members of our party also resorted to sleeping on the sofas most nights as the beds in one of the rooms was so uncomfortable and dipped in the middle.We also had issues with all but one of the TVs in the house and could not get them working.Many of these things may seem like trivial issues but when you've paid a lot of money for a top rated luxurious villa you do not expect to be contacting the owner every other day. It meant we could not even live comfortably for our 2 weeks away in Florida and put a slight dampner on things. The complex itself was lovely and in close proximity to Disney and not too far from Universal, but we can say we will definitely not be stopping in this villa again. It is not worth the money or the hassle. I cannot speak for all villas on this complex but the villa on the corner of Archfield Boulevard 2615 is not one I would recommend.

column29: Nine of us booked this villa for two weeks at the end of August and it was delightful. Although it's called Pooh's Palace the twins room was decorated Frozen Style (they are six) and they loved it. The other child's bedroom was baseball themed - a bit more grown up for the eight year old.The house is large with five bedrooms all with their own bathroom so we all had our own space. All nicely decorated with everything you would need even soap and toiletries and change of bedding if needed.The best bit was the attached pool and hot tub. Great during the hot August days. It is so close to Disney you can see the fireworks from the pool area.The estate is nicely kept and very secure and Deanna was always available for queries before we went. We had a fantastic two week stay and would thoroughly recommend this large spacious villa. Oh it also has a pool table in the garage.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124

column29: We booked a 5 bedroomed Villa even though we only needed 2 rooms. In the past when we have booked 2-3 bed villas they haven't been so good. This villa was luxurious and we overlooked onto the lake which was wonderful. The villa was very large and spacious with all the amenities you would expect from this villa type. The screened pool was a big hit as you didn't have to dodge the insects although we had a gecko with us for our stay outside in the pool area!! Check-in was quick and the security guys on the gate were friendly and we felt safe. We had to keep a card in view in our car when parked in the resort and coming in we just scanned our card at the gate although for our last week the entrance area was being re-roofed and the guys would scan you in using your card. We didn't use the resort pool as it sounded noisy and we had our own lovely pool so didn't bother. The wi-fi was good at the villa but forget TV it was not good! Limited channels. Kitchen was great with American fridge and ice dispenser was a big hit! Washing machine and tumble dryer was great. Bedrooms were all large and nice bed linen. We shopped at Super Target on Rolling Oaks Blvd which was about 5 mins drive away. My only gripe with the villa ... there wasn't much privacy when outside. Each villa was side by side and very close. Villas we have stayed in in the past has shrubs so there was some privacy. You could hear neighbours conversations and it became annoying!! On the whole a lovely holiday and a great base for the parks.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms

column27: A HOUSE WAS MORE COMFORTABLE THAN A HOTEL
column29: After contacting my old travel agent Sherri(not old in age), we had been working together since 07, and explaining that we wanted to do a Family vacation for August(I emailed in late Dec15) she suggested a resort home, something I hadn't ever did or knew about. It started out with 15 people and by August the faithful 8 were on a road trip to Florida. With 6 drivers and 2 vans, a 5th old girl, 8 yr old nephew , his brother whom turned 18 2 days before, my 21 yr old daughter, my mom whom is a fabulous 71, my niece 33(those are her 2 sons) my brother and his wife,their 26 yr old son and his wife(5 month Maya is theirs) we zipped down the highway with maybe 5 stops on our 15 and half hr drive from Dallas TX. We arrived around 6ish Monday evening, where we checked out Id's at the gate, retrieved our car window sticker and door pad entry into home. I was the 2nd person to enter the home and scoped out a big bed straight ahead, so I ran to it and claimed that room for me and my daughter. My sister in law whom was the 1st to enter had to admit I was quicker(bad knee and all). The only one who tried to persuade me to give up this large bathroom attached room was my niece with the baby(she asked 3 times) I just looked at her(it is what it is). After My 2 nephews settle on the Disney room(twin beds), their mother grabbed the other Disney room(1 bed), my brother and his wife took the last big room upstairs. My mom took the room next to the entrance with the daybed, and the parents plus baby took the room to the left with bathroom attached. there was a half bath downstairs and the people on top shared the one bathroom. After the 1st day, the shower with the couple was stopped up(I know this though I never looked because they started using ours),The water was nice and hot. I never used the pool and small sauna(for maybe 2 people), but my nephews did outside on the patio. The couple at outside twice by the pool. We enjoyed eating together at the big table for 8, and playing cards/dominoes/checkers(we brought ourselves).There were a thousand people at Walmart on a Monday(it was a jungle, zoo, or concert inside literally) LOL. The game room which was in the garage was very hot to me(my nephews brother and daughter went in there every chance they got)they had a ceiling fan but still not enough for me to be in there over 30 min. We tried letting up the garage but there was no way to do this. We went to the community pool which was larger with a slide and played catch football. I went down the slide and it was fast for some and slow for others. plenty of room in the pool, they had a store to purchase snacks, food, wine, beer, pool items etc. The community was well kept up, clean, the trash is taken up every day before 8am(it says 7am). My bed was comfortable(I always bring my own sheets everywhere so that made it even more better). My 33 yr old niece said they could have washed the sheets and made them smell better(though she never took them off to wash them herself). We washed practically all the towels we used daily( I know housekeeping appreciated that) and my brother had the nerve to vacuum the upstairs before we left. We had fun and enjoyed our stay, I really cant say if I would go there again(maybe another one). We went to workout twice (me my daughter my brother his son) they had 2 treadmills, 2 elipticals, a few weight machines.i brought my dog(shitzo mixed with poodle) and he acted like he was at home, probably because everyone from home was there. We put him in his kennel with his toy when we went out. We were close to everything to do and eat. Overall it was comfortable than a hotel.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124

column29: Check-in is really slow but once cleared no problem coming and going from the resort. Ideally located for Disney World and supermarkets/restaurants. Nice size pool and clubhouse. The biggest letdown was the luxury villa we rented, from the start we were given the wrong keycode from Global Management to finding out the most basic of items were missing, not a day went by without some problem rearing its head, fortunately our holiday company in the UK got their representative in Orlando to step in and help resolve some of them. This villa was booked on seeing the photos on Global's website, one of the sofas was missing and therefore not leaving enough seating for our party, there was no Fooseball as shown, and you could not use the Pool Table as there is not enough room to take shots. Two other points this is supposed to be a 5 bedroomed 10 people luxury villa there was not enough seating round the pool, and apart from the main bedroom all the other beds were uncomfortable and need to be replaced. We are taking this matter further with our holiday company, but l would advise anyone not to book villa 7769 Tosteth Street on the resort until it has been brought back up to the Luxury standard it is supposed to be.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: My wife and I stayed here with our 3 kids for a Disney vacation. This is a great location for running back and forth to any of the Disney parks. We often took a mid day break and ran back to our townhouse. We stayed in a 3 bedroom, 3 bathroom townhouse. Fun at Windsor Hills 2 to be specific. We were close to the main pool but still had to drive over with the kids. The pool was nice but the pictures online are deceiving. It looks much bigger in photos. It is a decent size but it was very crowded. Especially in the evening. They have a small water slide but our kids did not care for it. Follow up and communication from Windsor Hills was awful. The owner of our property was very attentive as I had to go to her for everything since employees would not respond. The townhouse was a perfect size but it is in need of routine maintenance. I had to personally fix some things while on vacation. Not what I wanted to do but I did it. We never got any follow up after our stay. No thank you, no how was your stay etc. our townhouse had a plunge pool. Our kids used it once because it was not very clean. Never saw anyone come by to clean things. When we arrived we had to check in with security at the gate. They were very slow and honestly not sure how much security they would be able to provide. They gave us a pass to use while getting in and out of the resort. You had to leave the pass on your dashboard in view. I find this funny as the personal gate codes for getting in the pool area and other places was clearly published for anyone to see. I thought maybe everyone had the same code so I checked someone else's vehicle and they had different codes. Not much security I would say!!Overall we enjoyed our stay and would probably stay at a different property within the resort. On a side note, there are a ton of different properties to stay at within this area. The location is great.

We have everything we would have at home, Kitchen, Laundry, Large living rooms and bedrooms could ask for more.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: I stayed in Holiday Paradise Villa, a four bedroom house with a screened in pool on Archfeld Blvd. I can't say enough nice things about this place! We stayed at Disney's Wilderness Lodge in 2014, and paid way less for this vacation than we did for the Disney Vacation in 2014. The house especially suited us because our young son became ill during the second half of the trip. My husband and I agreed that caring for him when he was so sick was way easier in a house than it would have been in a hotel room.Our house came with 4 bedrooms, six beds, 4 bathrooms and the screened in in-ground pool. It also came with a game room with pool, an arcade style game, air hockey and 2 video game systems. Everything was wonderful. There was also a main clubhouse with a pool with a big waterslide. We had a fantastic owner we worked with too. Thanks again Karen!

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Very affordable and clean. The hot tub was out of service the entire time we were there. The store inside the community center is very pricey. My sons loved the pool and game room. Be prepared to bring laundry soap, dishwasher soap, cleaning pads, paper towels, toilet tissue, etc.... I was very happy to have a washer/dryer in our townhouse. It's a very short drive to Disney World, 10 minutes tops.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
