column29: Toda avaliação é subjetiva, depende do grau de exigência ou visão do hóspede...mas achei o condomínio sensacional, excelente custo benefício. Ideal para quem tem filhos ou quer levar os pais mais velhos, pois a rotina pode ser seguida como em casa mas adicionada com quartos temáticos, cozinha completa e uma variedade enorme de lazer. Eu enchi os armários e geladeira com sucos orgânicos, verduras lavadas três vezes prontas para consumir, pães deliciosos, salmão do Alaska , frutas e legumes ( tudo comprado no Walmart ou Publix a bons preços) para que todos tivessem comida em casa à vontade. Vamos lá: tem uma piscina principal com tobogã muito boa, que é aquecida nos meses de inverno e funciona até as 22 hs no verão. Ela é usada pelas pessoas que ficam nos prédios, pois as casas do condomínio tem piscina própria. Há música ambiente e jacuzzis aquecidas, porém só permitidas para uso adulto. Tem guardas na piscina que ficam de olho nas crianças e professora de hidro às quintas. Há também um mini mercado com as conveniências básicas e uma batata frita na hora que é um vício... A concierge é bem útil, chama taxi, presta informações gerais. Parquinhos de areia, castelinhos, balanços, quadras de vôlei, basquete e tênis e uma paisagem gostosa para caminhar ou andar de bike. Enfim, para colaborar com mais informações sobre custo benefício: apartamento de 3 quartos e 2 banheiros: média de 175 dólares dia em julho e 130 em janeiro. A limpeza do corredor e das escadas deixou a desejar, mas isso, para nós, foi só um detalhe. Estávamos tão cansados ao fim do dia que uma noite de sono feliz era só o que víamos pela frente!

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: My family and I really enjoyed our stay, the kids really loved it, the private pool,the bedrooms are very nice only minutes away from Disney. We will definitely be coming to stay. Cookie Moss & Family

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: This was our first trip to Disney World and we rented a 3 bed/3 bath town home in Windsor Hills. It was perfect for my family of 5. It was two levels, each room had it's own bathroom, and it came with a full kitchen with all needed cookware and utensils. It even had a Keurig. Besides the space being big enough to comfortably fit all of us, it also had a splash pool in the back. My kids loved the fact that they could go right outside the door for a swim. The community is gated and only owners and vacationers have access. Check in was a breeze, I only had to show my confirmation along with my ID. The community amenities were good and available for all guest to use. It only took about 5-6 mins to get to Magic Kingdom and there are plenty of stores and restaurants in the area. This was my first time renting a vacation home and I was a bit hesitant because of all of the scam artists these days, but Paul and his staff at Signature Florida Homes were great. They were always available to answer questions and he responded to all of my emails within a matter of minutes. I will be using them again in the future.

column29: We rented a vacation home, for a family of 10. We arrived in three different car. The check in at the gate was quick. We were informed of all the security gates. The attendant was very helpful. We had a 5 bedroom home with privet pool. It was very clean . It was a great location. 5 minutes to the entrance a Disney world , which was very convenient. The whole family really enjoyed the home.

Accessibility to main road is so easy and travel time to Disney parks is maximum 10 minutes that includes parking up. A car is a must otherwise I would imagine you would spend most time travelling.A bit of a journey to universal and shopping outlets but that was not an issue as u cannot be near everywhere. Communal swimming area was kept nice and clean each time we visited.

Logicamente, cada casa tem uma decoração e pode ter pequenas diferenças.

Believe it or not we never had to wait for the bathroom. We were able to cook and save money there. All in all it was really great.

column27: Simplesmente um local maravilhoso para hospedar-se!
column29: Ficamos 15 dias no apto da Leila, o ap é muito bom, acomoda perfeitamente 6 pessoas, estavamos em 5. Bem mobiliado, cozinha completa, máquina de lavar e secar, o que é muito bom, vc pode lavar todas as suas roupas e não trazer nada sujo para casa. Achei extremamente seguro, portaria 24 horas. A localização muito boa. Super indico, ficar em apto te proporciona conviver um pouco da cultura local e ainda te dá a possibilidade de preparar sua própria comida, o que reduz bastante os custos da viagem

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column27: Best place to stay in Orlando!!!
column29: We've stayed in the condos and a house which we booked through Florida Sun Vacations. The management company keeps their units clean and updated. You can't beat the prices for the space you get. The kitchen comes equipped with what you need except dishwashing detergent. Most of the units I've stayed in have glass top tables, so I usually have to purchase Windex to keep them clean. I wish Windex was included. The pool is very nice and closes at 10:00. Getting through the guard gate is confusing if you e never been here before. Left lane is for arrivals and right lane is ONLY for those who already have a parking pass. I've seen units that were not booked through Florida Sun Vacations and the furniture is different--not as nice. The town homes are not worth renting for the dipping pool--which is only a little larger than a hot tub. The pools at the houses are very nice and all of the homes through Florida Sun Vacations have garages converted into game rooms. The homes are great for sports teams who are playing at ESPN.

column29: Beautiful, clean...3 bedroom, 2bathroom condo. Lots of towels, dishes...coffee maker full kitchen, 3tvs. Screened in porch. Nicely furnished, 2king size beds. Very clean. There is a pool with a water slide and a fitness center along with a clubhouse with video games. Very friendly helpful staff. Secure gates, staffed and coded for entrance! Also affordable...

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: Alugamos um apartamento no Windsor Hill através da Palm Tree Vacation Homes. Era um ap térreo, 3 quartos (1 suite), sala, cozinha, todo montado. O custo x benefício foi excelente, a diária ficou em torno de 100 dolares e o ap acomodava 6 pessoas em camas ou até 8, sendo as outras duas em colchões extras. Ficar em ap foi uma boa experiência em termos de espaço disponível e também para evitar os cafés da manhã de Orlando, que são bem caros, foi uma boa economia, mesmo pra nós que não estávamos nem um pouco dispostos a cozinhar!A segurança do condomínio é ótima, funciona bem o esquema da portaria. A localização é bem boa, próximo à Disney, tem muitas facilidades ao redor (considerando que você alugou um carro, o que é uma excelente ideia para quem vai a Orlando!).Voltaria com certeza!

We loved the pool, pool side DJ and games on Saturday afternoon. We did not eat at the onsite deli/grill but several in our group did and all were happy with their selections. It was a clean resort, great security, and we really enjoyed our stay. Best part, was the literally 7 minute drive to the Disney Parks! Super close and super easy access.

column29: The villa we stayed in was lovely. With ample space, a lovely fitted kitchen including dishwasher, washing machine and dryer.The pool was the perfect size for 6, anymore and would probably be a bit cramped. It wasn't the most luxurious, but was perfect for us and a great place to chill out at the end of a busy day.Its perfect location with only a short drive to amenities and theme parks. The facilities onsite are good, with a small shop and games room. There is also a communal pool although small and shallow served us well on our final day as we had to be out of our villa by 10am and our flight wasn't until the evening.Perfect location for families, although the villas are quite close together it is overall pretty quiet of an evening.

column27: Villa rental with Ocean Holidays horrible don't book with them
column29: Windsor Hills resort beautiful but rent a villa with them gated community with a beautiful pool area the whole resort very clean and well kept the whole family loved it,if we go again we will book a villa at this resort through them.The so called executive plus villa we rented with Ocean Holidays was not an executive plus standard, many faults that they new about but still let us stay in it.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124

column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We are big Disney fans, normally going in August, but we wanted to experience it at Christmas. I have to say it didn't disappoint. We booked a Windsor hills villa through virgin so didn't know it beforehand, it turned out to be lovely. 5 bedrooms, lovely views out front not too overlooked out back. The pool was heated as well as the hot tub.Only disappointing point was having to pay for wifi. When you've paid top dollar through virgin you'd expect free wifi.We didn't use much of the resort facilities as we had the pool and were kept busy by all the parks.The weather was fantastic for the time of year.The parks were packed full but we expected that and it added to the atmosphere. Going at Christmas, seeing snow on Christmas Day, smelling the candy in the parades made it all the more magical.If you get the chance to go at Christmas visit the town of Celebration at night just to see the decorations.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: July 1st of 2015 we vacationed at Windsor Hills for a 4 night stay it was very enjoyable.The resort was very nice and clean,a gated community with a attendant 24 hours a day.We enjoyed the clubhouse where the community pool is located they have game room,fitness room and theater,also a sundry shop.The condo was spotless and the townhome other family had was clean too ,it had its own private pool.We will be going back next year,it will be our family vacation area.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Booked a golf trip for myself and friends through Golfpac. I have booked with golfpac before. The golfpac web site only a shows the likeness of a typical 4 bedroom house. We arrived on Saturday May 14, 2016. Walked in the house on comrow street and it was so dated I felt like it was 1985. 20 inch tube television in the living room and the same in the master. The other two bedrooms had no TV. The house was beat up, outdated and was sparsely stocked. Opened up the curtains to look at the pool and it was green! Called Global and they said they would send over the pool company. Early Sunday morning they were cleaning the pool. We went golfing came back around 2:00p and the pool was still green. The house certainly wasn't rental ready! Called Global and wanted a new house between the pool and the beat up dated house we had enough. They gave us a beautiful home for the rest of the week.This is what you need to watch out for. Make sure you see pictures of the exact house that you'll be staying in. I'm not sure who to point the finger at but I would say both golfpac and global. First golfpac should know what kind of home and what condition it is in. They should have have a standard that they should follow. As for Global they need to inspect their properties before they rent them for the week. Also stayed at other resorts like this and some have standards regarding what type of furniture, appliances and electronics in the house. Some owners could care less (like the home on comrow street). For dining purposes Eddy V's was awesome! The service outstanding from start to finish. The fresh seafood tower was worth $75.00. Shrimp & lobster cocktail, oysters and lump crab meat. Shrimp & lobster bisque served in in its own pot poured into a blazing hot ceramic bowl. Ahi tuna and sea bass was exceptional. The desserts were truly phenomenal. The bananas fosters was grand as well as the others. Reasonable priced $$$$ for what you get.Ruth Chris on a Sunday was dead. Although the steaks were great and the sides are good as well, it seems that they are losing to likes of Capitol Grill, Eddy V's and some other very fine dining venues. Ruth Chris's not worth the money anymore.The only thing I will say about fish bone grill is don't!

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed at one of the townhouse rentals. For the most part everything was good. The house was clean and had everything we needed. The kitchen was well equipped and had lots of clean/newer frying pans and good assortment of utensils and sharp knives. They even had a waffle iron in the shape of Mickey Mouse which was cute. Each bedroom had a ceiling fan which was great to help keep cool when sleeping. We had the pool heated and it was very warm! The townhouse is very close to the main pool which is great! Because we were so close to the main pool we didn’t use the pool at the house much at all. There is small shop by the main pool which is reasonably priced and has snacks and snack bar food and alcoholic drinks too. I was surprised that there were no beach/pool towels in the house to use, so we had to use the white bath towels. I would not stay at that particular townhouse again, but would definitely stay at Windsor Hills again!The community pool was awesome! It was the right temperature and the waterslide was fun for the kids. The playground on the resort was a lot of fun also. We didn't explore any of the other items like tennis or basketball or golf.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124

column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Currently on our second vacation here with virgin. Fantastic yet again nice villa , pool , and a fantastic gated community . I would recommend this place to anyone ... As far as I can tell the bad reviews come from Thomas cook guests :/ they must use different villas because we have stopped in two different villas here now and both have been great ... If there is a down side it's that the pool heating is very expensive @ $500 for two weeks :/ & our tv in the room would only pick up one channel :(

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Excelente condomínio, muito seguro e confortável.
column29: Passamos uma semana hospedados em um apartamento de 3 quartos nesse condomínio. Ao todo éramos 6 adultos e 2 crianças. O condomínio é muito seguro, fizemos a reserva através de um site de reservas. Na véspera do check-in, recebemos a senha do lockbox onde a chave do apartamento estaria, além das informações necessárias para nosso check-in. Como estavamos em 2 famílias, não houve problema em fazer o registro dos 2 carros que utilizamos. Havia segurança na portaria e ronda durante vários períodos do dia e da noite. Sempre há vagas para estacionar próximo à entrada do nosso bloco, e o condomínio era bastante silencioso. Ficamos hospedados no 4º andar, e não tivemos nenhum problema durante o período. No apartamento, havia cozinha amplamente equipada, máquina de lavar e de secar roupas, 1 suite com cama king size, closet e banheiro, um outro quarto com cama queen size e closet, um outro quarto com duas camas de solteiro, um banheiro social com banheira, uma sala de estar com sacada, sofás e tv de 50 polegadas, uma sala de jantar para 8 pessoas. O apartamento, com exceção dos quartos que tinham carpetes, era de piso de cerâmica e estava limpo. Haviam muitas toalhas de banho, roupa de cama suficiente para todos. Os sofás viravam camas, não eram tão confortáveis, mas era suficiente para um jovem adulto. A internet wifi era ótima. Apartamento lindamente decorado.

column27: Disney break with family and friends in Windsor Hills
column29: A 2 week stay at a 6 bedroom property on this resort was wonderful. The house, booked through Home Away was excellent. It was huge with our own pool, games room with pool table, games consoles, etc. The resort was spotless with a lovely communal heated pool with slide for all to use. We felt safe and secure at the resort. Travel time to Disney, Universal, Sea World and the outlet villages was 15 minutes or so, excellent location to reach all. There were 4 adults and 4 children in our party and we had relatives visit (another 3 young children and 1 adult) too. There was still plenty of room. The pool size seemed small but was ok for us. We didn't pay for the pool to be heated which meant it was a bit cool. We didn't spend that much time in it so i'm not sure whether i would pay in future for this. The communal pool was lovely and made a nice change. We didn't spend that much time in the villa so it didn't ruin our holiday.

column29: We had a 3 bedroom condo (each room has it's own bathroom). That, I would consider luxury. My kids loved the Mickey Mouse theme throughout. Our unit was a 2 min walk to the clubhouse, which was equipped with a games room, a large pool that was only 3 ft deep (safe for kids and those who do not swim well), and a little store to buy all the essentials not provided ( toilet paper, garbage bags, dishwasher det.). The kitchen is well equipped however. The property itself is very well maintained. The security at this gated community is something else. The guards are all nice and polite but there is this older guard-who really takes his job seriously. Our pass was hard to scan for the first cupla days for some reason, until another guard took it back and fixed it somehow. We held up one of the lines to exit, and this guard came running out, red-faced, screaming to the cars behind to move to the other lane and to keep the lines moving. It became a joke with our girls before we got the pass fixed. Every time we got to the gate, they were on their best behaviour and they kept saying "daddy, hurry it up before that guard comes out and screams at us". I want to take him home. LOL. All in all, I'd definitely recommend this resort. Very clean and safe. Plus, fun for kids and families in general

column29: We stayed in Storytime #4, 3bed townhouse with pool.House was just perfect. Clean and comfortable. Only a 2min walk to clubhouse (serves snacks and drinks in small shop) and main resort pool which is great for kids. The owner was easy to contact and prompt to reply and available for any questions.Large master bedroom with king bed. Second bedroom with 2 single beds in disney themed room was great for the kids. We did'nt use the 3rd bedroom downstairs which has a queen bed.Nice kitchen family room with large sliding doors to splash pool.We paid for pool heat, which made water temp just right, as despite being april a couple cooler windy days. Pool surround was very clean with clean pool. A couple brick pavers around pool deck had sunk a fraction, but these homes are 10years old ! and did'nt cause us any problems at all. House had plenty of towels for use.This was my second time at Windsor Hills resort. It's conveniently located for the main attractions and all the main restaurants nearby on 192. It took 13mins from Disney parking lot to being parked back at house, although traffic was kind that night.Would recommend this resort of Windsor Hills and this Storytime #4 townhouse to anyone looking for a quite stay in a great resort with great facilities.Tip: do not check in between 4 and 5 on a saturday. Maybe a bit later as lots of traffic queing out of gate for entrance pass, although it was'nt too bad.I will return again one day.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column27: Get away from Mouse for a while or Central for Golf
column29: This is a rental neighborhood about 2 miles away from the entrance to Disney. If you are staying off property and you plan to drive in and out/park at Disney yourself this is a great option. Universal and Seaworld are about 20 minutes away. Windsor Hills is gated, safe, the grounds are kept well and the public pool/playgrounds are well maintained. I've stayed at 4, 5 & 6 bedroom houses, as well as 3 bedroom condo's at Windsor Hills Resort. Each unit is individually owned so the decor and updating varies from unit to unit. Make sure you browse all photo's of each unit to make sure it accommodates your needs. There are grocery stores and restaurants all within a mile of the neighborhood and it is about 30 minutes from the airport. When you check in, there is sometimes a line which could take 20 minutes or so before you get into your rental home. This is because the security team is very thorough which we appreciated to ensure safety of vacationers.The pool is quite large and heated with waterslide, snack bar and gym all at the nice clubhouse. For condos, the large pool is your only option. Most of the houses have a private pool/jacuzzi in the backyard. Tip: to use the heaters for the pools, you have to pay extra. Make sure the heater is turned on before you get there from whomever you rent from. The pool can take up to a full day to get warm depending on time of year. Windsor hills is also centrally located to get to many golf courses. Mystic Dunes, Reunion, Disney, Grand Cypress, Tranquillo, Celebration, OCN, Orange Lake, all within 20 minutes or less.If you are looking for a relaxing, Orlando vacation with close proximity to the parks without staying on premise, then Windsor Hills is a very nice option for families.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Fantastic Stay at the private 5 bed villa!!
column29: Just came back from March break with my two sons, age 4 and 6, and my parents. We stayed at a 5 bedroom villa rented from a private individual. FANTASTIC stay. The resort is VERY conveniently located, roughly 15 mins from all major Disney attractions, 10 minutes from Target (which has Groceries), and 10 minutes from TJ MAX and ROSS (which is VERY important for us Canadians looking to do some value shopping!!). The resort offers luxury villas, such as ours, townhomes and condos. The villas maximize the comforts of home (fully equipped kitchen, laundry, 4 bathrooms and TVs in each room) which makes travel with kids and extended family quite doable! The resort has a wonderful large pool with a slide the kids enjoyed, as well as the usual arcades/ping pong/billiards and ice cream set up. The noise level at night was fine, especially in a villa, but if looking to maximize silence, aim for a villa off the main street, ideally with one neighbour and backing out onto the greenspace.The one issue I encountered: Check into the "gated" part. The first time you enter the resort, you must register your vehicle and you get all the pass codes for the main gate, the gym, the playground, etc. We were checking in on saturday night of the beginning of March break, and therefore, there was an HOUR wait at the gates. I'm not sure if this was due to March break, or if this is every saturday night. Needless to say, my kids did not fare well with this after all the travel (neither did I to be honest). We got out of the care and proceeded to our home on foot (luckily took about 15 mins) while my husband waited. However, please calculate this into your travel as a possibility.I DO believe that the resort could easily rectify this by having more staff available for check in during busy times. They did not seem overly concerned by the 30+ car line up in front of their gates!Other than that, lovely stay!!! Enjoy!

column27: Ok, but town home requires deep cleaning
column29: We stayed in a 3 bedroom 3 bath town home located steps from the resort pool. The house needs a deep cleaning and refurbishment. The resort it's self is lovely, huge! Walked the resort every day and spent most days at the community pool. The biggest complaint is all the security codes for EVERYTHING! Need to have a barcode scanner for the front gate to get in and out. The pool requires a code, if you have to use the restroom at the pool that requires a code, gym, games room and all the playground parks require codes. A bit overkill! The grounds are beautiful and I would stay here again as it is very close to Disney, attractions and shopping.

column29: This resort is a regular for us. We've stayed at two villas and just recently a town house. Each time we've used a different rental company. For people who are not familiar with this resort, the units are generally privately owned and either rent the units themselves or use a rental company. This review is for the resort, and does not reflect any opinions about the rental companies, you'll have to search elsewhere for that.Back to the resort: The facility has 24hr security and is very presentable. The Home Owners Association has very stringent rules about the appearance of the resort. I've never seen as much as a chewing gum wrapper on the ground. The grounds are well prepared and the buildings are very we kept. The public areas are to end! The pool and pool deck is very well maintained and water is clean a crystal clear. We were there during a failry busy time and there was still ample room to lounge by the pool. There is a well equipped gym, a games arcade, table tennis, public theatre, kiosk, tiki bar and more.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: We had a three bed two bath condo rented for a 2 month period. Being very Nieves we never expected what turned out to be "bed bugs." These units are individually owned but managed by IPG who inturn have resident managers. When reporting this terrible situation we received no support other than we'll phone the exterminator. The exterminators advised we had to vacate the unit. March break seemingly no availability in Orlando. After hours of phoning & driving settled on the last $400 ++ room . There were 6 of us, not an easy find. Summing up Windsor Hills can be a good resort as long as your unit is well maintained & you don't need management for anything other than incidentals.

column27: Excellent place to stay if you are visiting Walt Dinsey World
column29: I stayed at this location for a week in February 2016. Leading up to our vacation, I researched countless properties in the Orlando area to stay at. I decided on the Windsor Hills Resort because it had excellent online reviews on Trip Advisor & other websites, its location was very close to the Walt Disney World area (less than 5 minutes away), the amenities the resort offered were great- gated community with security, large complex swimming pool & hot tub, movie & games room at resort clubhouse, convenience store, very large park & playground area for the kids, and the pictures posted on their website looked very nice. Once I decided this was where I wanted to stay, I researched the available properties there. From what I could tell, the available units in the resort are rented on an individual basis, and can vary greatly. Some are managed by the resort, others by 3rd party rental agencies, or run individually. In the end, I decided on “Bashful’s Bungalow", you can look it up online, a 3 x bedroom townhouse unit. Based on the information on their website, this is one of 2 x properties available by the owner at the resort complex (the other is called `Happy`s Hangout, which I believe is the townhouse unit right next door`). The reason I decided to stay there were many. First- their website for this property listing was very professional. This is important, as to me it is an indicator of not only how they run their business, but also how serious they are about renting and maintaining their property. The pictures posted online were excellent quality- not all fuzzy and blurry. It shows they really took the time to advertise this unit accurately. Second- the listing stated that the unit was completely renovated last year, and all furniture & appliances in the unit were brand new. I figured having everything top to bottom brand new had to be good. Third- this unit had its own screened-in pool, which I thought was a wonderful bonus feature. As stated- there is already a pool at the resort, but having your own private pool is great. Fourth- the layout of the unit was what I was looking for. It had one bedroom off the main entrance with its own full bathroom, 2 x other bedrooms upstairs, each with its own full bathroom. For me, this worked out well, as we were travelling with the grandparents, and they were able to stay on the main level, not having to worry about climbing up and down the stairs, and also had a bit of a break away from the kids in the evening. Booking the unit was very easy and straightforward. It was all done online via email, payment via credit card. Standard rental agreement forms, security deposit, no issues with any of this. Extra charges for the unit included the pool heater, and renting a BBQ for the week (based on my research these appear to be standard extra charges for most rentals in the area). Now- since it was February when we stayed there, I would highly recommend if you are visiting during the winter months to get the pool heated, definitely worth it in my opinion. Note- you can`t adjust the pool temperature yourself, so if you want this be sure to request it ahead of time. Confirmation of rental, directions to the property were fine- no concerns finding the place. Upon arrival, we found the place very clean. All the furniture as stated was brand new and in great shape. The pictures are definitely accurate- it is really beautiful inside. The flat screen TV in the living area is massive- perfect for the kids watching Disney movies. There are also TVs in every bedroom too (all brand new flat screens), all of them have cable. Wi-Fi is available at the unit. All the appliances worked, no concerns with the kitchen area. There was plenty of space, it didn’t feel cramped or crowded. The main bedroom upstairs is very large, plenty of room. In the kids room upstairs- the “lighted beds” were a huge hit. My daughter loved them, plus they were a lot of fun for the adults too. Gaining entrance to the resort and the property were problem free throughout our visit. The keyless entry was handy- I didn’t have to worry about losing the keys or locking myself out. The unit is conveniently located just across the street from the resort pool and clubhouse- very short walk- like 30 x seconds. No issues at all with noise or traffic during our stay. There was a stroller located in the unit- this came in handy for taking to the theme parks. Pool temperature on arrival was great, and the BBQ was there as requested. There is also a washer & dryer there as well- normally I don’t like to do laundry on vacation but I did find this useful. The resort is very close to a wide variety of restaurants, gift shops, and other Orlando attractions as well. There is a grocery store, Target store maybe 5-10 minute drive down the road, so you can find virtually anything you may need. The resort advertised that it did have a shuttle service to/from the Disney Parks, but I had a car so I never used it- I can’t tell you whether it is good or bad. Most of the people staying in the resort looked to be families with small kids on vacation, and the occasional retirees. Overall I thought the place was fantastic. If you were thinking about visiting Disney World, but did not want to stay at the Disney Resorts, this place is perfect. It is obvious that this rental unit is professionally run, and well maintained. I am sure that I will be visiting Orlando- and Disney World, again in the future, and I would definitely stay here again. We had a great time, and I would highly recommend this spot to anyone.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: The only negative thing I have to say about our stay here is that we did not even have time to enjoy the property amenities because we were so busy with our days spent at all of the Disney Parks. The location was minutes from all of them. Everything else you may need during your stay was only minutes away as well. We had 4 adults and 2 small children in a 3 bedroom, two bath condo for a 4 night stay. There was plenty of space for all of us. The property was very safe and secure, in a gated community. My sister felt safe enough to stay there alone while we had a late night at the Magic Kingdom. The condo was super clean, well stocked with dishes and such. I do recommend bringing your own trash bags, paper towels and coffee filters. We even grabbed some laundry detergent at the Super Target up the road and took advantage of the washer and dryer so we did not have to come home with dirty laundry! The unit we had was managed by Global Resort Homes. We arrived at 9:30 that night, the office was closed but the after hours process was simple as all we had to do was pick up our packet from a coded box. If you do have to do a late check in, the only down side is having to physically check in at their office before noon the next day. This was a little inconvenient for us because they did not open until 9 and we wanted to be at the Magic Kingdom at 8. This will definitely be our go to location for future trips!

column29: We booked through Virgin Holidays having read the mixed reviews I was a bit apprehensive. But we arrived when it was closed to have to try and find out where a box is located to enter a code to get an envelope with an address in no key! This could of been emailed to us making our travel after a long flight straight to the villa then one trip the next day to the office when it's actually open! The actual villa was in great location in Windsor hills it's located 15 mins drive from Disney 25 to universal sea world. We loved it's easy access location. The villa itself was very clean the kitchen cupboard doors need a good scrub though! It was huge and modern great games room and a pool and jacuzzi we didn't pay for heating but did go in the pool after the initial getting in you don't feel the cold so don't waste your money we had great fun getting in a right old giggle! Would I come back YES

column27: Highly Recommend Story time Vacation Rental
column29: My family and I just returned from a week at a 3 bedroom pool condo rental with Story time Rentals at Windsor Hills. We had two adults, two older teens, and two special needs children (Down syndrome), one age 7 months, one age 3. We loved the Disney theme. The condo was spotless, and very spacious. There is a washer/dryer in the upstairs, which was great. Also, there was a very nice playpen/crib, two strollers, and a booster seat. There were plenty of dishes and towels. It was a nice quiet area.You are very close to Disney, and can see/hear the Wishes fireworks show. There is space for one car at the condo, and I would imagine other parking would be available. The wifi worked great- even with two teens using it! The owners were very prompt the few times we needed to contact them (we forgot the key code ). They were pleasant and easy to deal with.The only down side we had were the security guards at the gate - on two separate occasions, they were very rude. We didn't bother complaining because it stopped after the first day.We highly recommend this establishment for a hassle free Disney trip.

column27: Lovely place to stay in when visiting Disney
column29: The Windsor Hills resort is one of the resorts that are found close to Disney World. We were a big group of 3 adults and 5 children who were visiting Disney Magic Kingdom and Disney Blizzard Beach for 3 days. The apartment that we stayed in had 3 spacious bedrooms, living room and a kitchen. The bedrooms had different themes such as mickey mouse etc. There were TVs in all of the bedrooms and the living room. There was also a PS3 gaming station in the living room. The resort has a club house which houses a small cafeteria, mainly selling sandwiches and snacks. There is a pool and small water slide also at the club house. There is also a gaming arcade and a movie theatre. The members of staff were quite friendly and helpful. The place is very clean. We all enjoyed our stay there.

column29: Windsor Hills Resort is a well appointed destination, close to Disney World. There are many levels and varieties of properties within, I would like to comment on our recent rental. The property is pretty much as described by the Rental Manager (All Star Vacation Homes), but unfortunately the property could be greatly improved with a detailed "tune up". Several important issues have been overlooked (ignored) by the Manager (eg: out of date worn out mattresses, completely inadequate internet service, peeling plastic laminate kitchen counters and cupboards, somewhat inadequate "fully equipped kitchen" items (what fully equipped kitchen does not have a coffee maker - tea pot - table knives (six were available), burned out light bulbs throughout etc. etc.), a BBQ being disgustingly filthy without any ability to light it, broken garbage container, absolutely filthy entrance slab and windows, and the list goes on. The refrigerator was superficially clean, however had an overwhelming rotten fish odor apparently left over from previous renters. The under sink garburator leaked significantly. On a positive note, the games room, and the three small bedrooms are very pleasantly decorated and comfortable, the private swimming pool / hot tub combo was great and overall the property is decent accommodation for a reasonable price in a good location, however, far from luxurious as represented by the Manager. Accommodation for 10 is comfortable, 12 a stretch. A great improvement to render the outside patio area more pleasant would be a sound wall to hopefully mute the unbearable noise from the neighboring A/C unit.Conclusion, a reasonably priced convenient property for a large group (we were 9) but in need of significant updating and fine tuning.

column29: We have been coming to the Orlando area for over 20 years. We have stayed at too many locations to remember! Some good, some not so good. Windsor Hills was chosen because of the location and also the price, which was very affordable when split with our son and daughter in law. The 3 bedroom, 2 full bath condo was clean and came with nice furniture, beds, washer and dryer, nice stocked kitchen full of nice dishes and pots and pans, etc. This may seem as things one would expect but we have plenty of stories about how one shouldn't make assumptions! The condo has 10 foot ceilings, nice eating area, plenty of hot water with good pressure, effective air conditioning, and a nice walk out lanai which also served as a second entrance door as we rented a ground floor unit. The welcome center is small but offers a small theatre, exercise room, game room, and sundry shop. The swimming pool is absolutely great for young children, as it is not deeper than 3 1/2 feet and has a great curvy water slide. The only down side was that everything required a passcode to enter, even restrooms, but too much security these days is better than not enough.

column27: Excellent Property but Beware of dishonest condo private owners

The owner Michael Ryndak took $70 off my security deposit to pay for the damage.This was a defect in the property and of could have damaged one of us.I made calls to the main office and they could not help.The $70 is no a lot of money but FOREIGN TOURISTS HAVE NO RIGHTS

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: First of all this property is NOT 'Brand New' - false advertising! Actually built in 2006 The location is perfect for Disney and the villa would have been great if it was clean and the Management Company dealt with issues! The villa is a little tired and needing some money spent on it eg .. kitchen utensils, outdoor furniture. We had problem from the start with lack of communication from Management Company, they do not answer their phone so end up leaving messages which they do not deal with. Shower door was missing in one of the en-suites, it had been broken by previous occupant however it was replaced within a few days. our major issue was with jacuzzi, pool heat, filthy pool area and COCKROACH infestation. We had communication with owner who tried to sort things out with Management Company but they did not do what they were asked. The villa/pool area were 'deep cleaned' in September but when Sandy Wang the owner saw our photos agreed that this HAD NOT been done! We had a problem with no pool heat which we paid for and a jacuzzi that didn't bubble (filterss were blocked) but kept being palmed off being told that the pool was at the correct temperature. Turns out that the power had tripped and there was no power going to heater. Only then was it sorted, a few days before the end of our holiday! The pool area/furniture was covered in spider webs, complete with big spiders and cockroaches! Someone turned up with a brush to sort that problem!! Said they would come back the following day to power hose.That didn't happen because when we returned after a day out we still had our resident spiders/cockroaches. We complained on numerous occasions about the cockroaches inside the house, not just in one area - upstairs, downstairs bathroom, on the cooker!! We were told pest control had been and couldn't see anything!! There was no evidence of the house being sprayed. Pest control and the Management Co decided they were coming under the garage door and told the owner they had built a small wall to prevent this happening until the door could be sorted LIES!! Generally the villa needs a little TLC, replace bulbs in lights/lamps, batteries in remotes etc,etc.... We had part of our pool heating payment returned but I contacted the owner requesting a further refund as we were unable to use the pool/pool area and found the cockroach infestation unacceptable. We have stayed in many other villas in the area and never experienced this. We were told by the owner that 'normal' people would have checked out straight away and she would have refunded us 100% - I doubt this very much!!! Even if we had where were we to drum up another $4000 to rent a 'luxury' villa??? This was a special holiday to celebrate various special birthdays within the family and it was spoilt due to the condition of this property! When I told the owner I would be taking matters further I was told not to threaten her!! Unbelievable, I do not threaten people!! Perhaps the villa lies empty and the Management Company do not keep on top of things?? The owner admitted that they promise the world and do not carry things out. That is for Sandy Wang to address to ensure that guests do not have to put up with these conditions! My advice would be to avoid this property and if you have already booked I would consider cutting your loses and cancel even if it means loosing your deposit!

column27: Not as good as last year
column29: We've rented twice before at Windsor Hills and this experience was a terrible one. The first night there,the electronic smoke alarms kept beeping every minute all night long, then the TV went down and then the wifi/Internet went down. We stayed for seven days and had no Internet for 4 of those days. The phone didn't work most of the time (you had to wiggle the chord and hold it ). The small little pool in the back probably hadn't been cleaned in quite a while, the kids wouldn't even get in. Not sure I would recommend it this time around.

column29: We always stay here when we visit Orlando, it is so well kept, has a great family atmosphere and is super close to the Disney parks, also just a short drive to the other attractions. The pool area is immaculate, somewhere we visit every evening and the sports facilities look good too although we never used them.We have stayed in a villa before but now tend to prefer the condos - they are all of the same design, very spacious with a balcony and very comfortable. Different owners though so the interiors can vary dramatically, some are gorgeous, some not so much. My advice is to look carefully at the location as well, lots have views over the car park - but a few have lake views which are gorgeous and some have pool views which is also nice.All in all a great place to stay, I highly recommend.

column29: Não tenho palavras para descrever meu desejo de voltar. Pesquisando os condomínios de Kissimmee, o windsor hills está entre os 3 melhores no quesito localização, segurança e serviços. Piscinas, bar, apartamentos com donos altamente selecionados. A única coisa ruim é que eles não recebem encomendas então compras feitas pela internet necessitam da pessoa no apartamento ou casa na hora da entrega. Aconteceu comigo da minha compra voltar para o remetente e depois eles deram a dica: escrever um bilhete e colocar na porta dizendo que estão todos nos parques e que você irá buscar a encomenda no post office ("correios") mais próximo. Assim eles levam para lá e aguardam a retirada em 7 dias.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Good stay but will do it differently next time
column29: With the flooding in South Carolina (October, 2015), we were hesitant to book a place until we knew for sure the roads were clear enough to get to where we needed to be. Because of that, our options limited as to availability. So, bear that in mind as you read my review.Each condo, townhouse, and home is privately owned, so you are renting from an owner or a management company for the owner. That is noteworthy for a couple of reasons. 1. The toiletries and supplies may vary considerably, and:2. You cannot change units if you have any issues.3. Each owner lists his/her own unit but may leave out some details compared to a company listing.We stayed in a 2 bedroom condo on the second floor.The one we stayed in had only 1 roll of toilet paper per bathroom. A tiny bar of soap (enough for hand washing for the week) was supplied. There was no shampoo. I didn't realize there was no shampoo or soap until my first Target run, so I had to run back immediately.The unit I rented was clean and nicely decorated. I have no complaints there. I also didn't find any bugs. It was not updated as the kitchen didn't have granite and the bathrooms didn't have granite or tile, but they were clean and functional and those things aren't as important to me, but I am mentioning them because some people may feel they are important.My only complaint was the noise level. I don't know what in the world the people above us were doing but they sounded like a heard of elephants going back and forth and banging around. They didn't settle down until around midnight each night, sometimes a bit after midnight. The people next door, however, thought 6am was a great time to get up. UGH. So, sleep was a bit of an issue.If you rent at WH, I suggest you either find a top floor condo or rent townhouse or house. If we go to WH again, we will not be getting a condo with people above us.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column27: The house was perfect in many ways, but the bugs gave us the creeps
column29: The first morning waking up and turning on the toaster and to have a swarm of cockroaches come crawling all over the area of the kitchen where food was, shocked and disgusted me. Adult cockroaches and baby cockroaches scurrying all over the counter. After I had made coffee, I also found baby cockroaches crawling in the coffee grounds. That evening around 8 pm, a brazen cockroach came crawling out around the toaster area. We still found a cockroach crawling around after the exterminator came. One morning we found a huge palmetto dead on its back lying on the bathroom floor. We were uncomfortable all week long. We were so careful not to leave any doors open and also did not leave any food around. I had to wash every dish and glass every time we used them because we were so repulsed at the thought of the bugs crawling on the utensils and dinnerware. This was a first time experience for me to have to live with cockroaches for a week. The owner and the management have been made aware. Hopefully the exterminators will get them & someone else's vacation won't be spoiled.

column29: Dejlig pæn og ren lejlighed med gode indkøbsmuligheder i nærheden og tæt på de forskellige parker bl.a. Universal Studios. Stedet har også gode faciliteter fx pool, træningsrum, butik, bar m.m. Poolen er perfekt til børn, da den ikke er dybere end 4 fod og er dejlig stor. Der er også en stor rutsjebane (minimum højde 42"). Desværre var både pool og butik/bar lukket flere dage under vores ophold pga. rennovation. Dette vidste vi ikke på forhånd, så det er et STORT minus, da vi jo har betalt fuld pris til vores udlejer. Vi har lejet vores lejlighed igennem Hotels.com / FunQuest Vacation Homes. Alt kontakt med dem foregår via mail eller telefon. Tjek-ind foregik vha. en nøgleboks placeret ved døren, hvor man skulle bruge den kode, man havde fået tilsendt via email. Tjek-ud foregår på samme måde. Vagterne ved indgangen og personalet ved informationen er således ikke nogen, der har ansvar for den enkelte lejlighed. Men de er MEGET hjælpsomme og gør hvad de kan for at løse eventuelle problemer. Vi vil helt klart anbefale stedet til andre og selv vælge at komme tilbage, hvis det skulle blive aktuelt.

column27: Did not want to come home........
column29: To ANYONE thinking to stay in Orlando - I cannot rate All Star Vacation Homes high enough - we have just stayed at Windsor Hills Resort (Aug 2015)- everything was spotless, clean, fully working, spacious and luxuriously comfortable - home from home - with the beauty of being able to pick the EXACT property, thus being able to choose decor, position and even which way the sun faces! We chose a 3 bed/3bath home with pool with all mod-cons.....including a PC with full internet access - usefull for information and recieving my sons GCSE grades!....it was on Fitzclarence Street which wasn't far from the gated security entrance - it felt very safe and incredibly well maintained.Windsor Hills is a 2 min drive from a variety of restaurants and the supermarket Target. 10 mins found you in the heart of the Disney parks and 20mins Universal - everything was so conveniently placed.....I honestly could not fault them........my children even 'chose' to stay a the villa instead of going to Typhoon Lagoon one day!!!...my only gripe is that they are not featured in Europe......yet?Please feel free to ask any questions and I will answer honestly........

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed at Windsor Hills for 3 weeks over summer. Great location! Very much liked the fact that it was a gated community and the security staff were always friendly.Being my first visit to Florida, loved staying here as the roads looked like I'd seen on American TV and films! The house was huge and very impressive, like something out of Dynasty or The Colbys. Kitchen/living area well set out and cosy but spacious, dining table just about fit us all around it so not sure it would be good enough for more than 8 people (even though it was a 6 bedroom condo), pool cost a lot to be heated but we didn't need to pay as the hot tub spilling into the pool made the temperature perfectly pleasant. The rooms were all great (especially the master bedroom and en suite - one word, wow!)We didn't spend any time around the clubhouse or shared pool but did have a look and it all seemed very nice. We instead made the most of our private pool spending quality family time together (or playing cards if raining) if we were not out at Disney etc.As with most rented places there could have been more in the way of kitchen accessories, spare light bulbs etc, and more sunbeds, but nevertheless thoroughly enjoyed our 3 week stay and will always have fond memories and would love to live there!

column29: We loved our 2 week stay in this resort in Orlando. It was close to all the parks and all the shopping outlets, restaurant etc. The house itself was very nice, and well maintained. We had a 5 bedroom- 5 bathroom villa with pool and games room. If we were going back to Orlando again we would definately stay at this resort and can't recommend it enough.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: This is the second time we have had a family celebration at Windsor Hills Resort and hopefully will not be our last. The location is superb and so easy to get to at the end of a long day at the theme parks, especially when you have young children with you. The villa and pool gave everyone plenty of space ( 10 of us in total ) and the games room entertained both young and old. The grounds are pristine and the security at the gate made you feel very safe and comfortable. I recommend this venue to everyone I know.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: 2649 Dinville Street - 6 Bedroom 4 Bath Luxury Villa
column29: Having been to Orlando 3 years prior to this visit and stayed in a similar style villa we had no hesitation in booking this one which although slightly bigger than the last villa we stayed in this fitted the needs of our 2 family group comprising 4 adults and 6 kids (8 -18)Booking process and communication from Steve & Rob throughout was faultless and always followed by a confirmation emails to give added security.Arrival process was quick and painless consisting of a 5 min wait for the security pass given out but this just reiterated for us how secure and safe the resort area was.The villa itself was superb, beautifully presented and well located for sun all day meaning even when arriving back from the parks late afternoon you could still enjoy the sun around the pool till well after 7pmThe layout was ideal for our group and although there were 10 of us staying the villa was so spacious it never felt like we were ever on top of each other.The 4 bathrooms provided really well for all there and the plentiful supply of towels was great and meant there were always plenty even when you had loads in the wash.Very well equipped kitchen with all mod cons and plenty of glassware, plates and cutlery - The only thing i could suggest would be a small welcome pack with a 1st night supply like a couple of items in it like toilet rolls, detergent, soap bar etc just to give people a chance to get to the supermarket the next day.Everything else is supplied and is very well thought out -The iron gave up the ghost while we were there and i contacted the management company to ask if they could replace... 2 hours later they delivered a new one. Excellent service.The 2 lounge areas are great for relaxing and the sports and movie packs on the cable TV mean there is always something on if you want to relax with a bit of TV.The free WIFI is great and handled all 10 of us on our mobiles / tablets etc without a problem.Bedrooms all lovely and clean and beds very comfortable with nice bed linen and covers.Air Con works very well, and the pool, deck area is just fantastic and a massive selling point to this villa. Many nights spent relaxing there having a cold drink and some food after a hard day at the parks.The games room was a massive hit with the boys and they spent may hours in there on a night playing pool, air hockey and table football.I would have no hesitation in returning here or recommending it to others.Thanks GuysJohn McConkey UK

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: This is an amazing place to stay! It is really close to Disney - Animal Kingdom is only 5 to 10 minutes drive maximum, even at busy times. We have stayed at this resort three times in different villas and are returning from the UK again next year and we always feel really safe and secure staying there. Most problems that other folk reviewing have raised seem to relate mainly to their having booked through various unsatisfactory owners/agents. We have always used Villa Direct, who let a large range of properties in this community. Their staff are really friendly and courteous and, most importantly, always resolve any problems quickly. We were once locked out of a property due to an electronic failure in the door locking mechanism late at night during a very heavy thunderstorm and their engineer was at the property in 20 minutes and sorted it straight away. Also, with this company, you get free international and local calls (great if you need to phone home) and free Wi-Fi.The properties have stayed in have all been well maintained and clean and linen, towels and cleaning are all included in the rental charge. The two properties we would recommend are Dutch Royal Treat and The Irish Jig (both in the quiet Comrow Street), which have their own pools and whirlpool tubs and a good outlook. These are north facing, which means you can be lovely and warm on a sunbed in the shaded lanai area without getting fried.Top tip - use Sherberth Road (off H192) for the quickest route into Disney.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We stayed on Daulby Street in a home for 13 people. Great location, house was more than roomy and comfortable. Our home could use some updates in decor and appliances, but it worked for us just fine. Room decor was fun and cute for the kids. We left some articles behind and were notified nearly immediately via email, however you are charged $20 to get your items back. I would agree with security behing a little over the top. When out on a morning run, we were questioned about leaving and coming back in the property. Yes, you have to "badge out" when leaving as well. Some days in the morning the traffic would get backed up so they had no choice but to keep gates open for the rush. The main pool was fun to visit and a change of scenery. Great pool attendents and the pool was large enough for a couple hundred guests!

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124

column27: Clean and quiet, but overkill on security measures
column29: I'm fine with security at the front gate, but then one needs a code to get into pool (made a couple of trips back and forth from condo to pool until I figured out the right number to take a picture of with my phone so I would not loose my in/out pass. Once you are in the locked and gated pool, you need the code AGAIN to go to the bathroom, etc. Really? If someone has gotten as far as the pool, don't you want them to be able to use the bathroom instead of peeing in said pool? It was such a hassle. Someone even pulled the gate shut in my face just as i was about to reach it, and at that point, i was using the wrong number off my pass (the one that said for playground, etc). Security guards everywhere, constantly getting on kids for this and that. I found it uncomfortable and unwelcoming. I did really like how quiet the complex was, however.

column29: We stayed at In Renshaw Street , Windsor Hills July 14-28 from www.windsorhillstownhouse.com . We had the most brilliant time. The villa was really lovely and comfortable with 3 bedrooms,3 bathrooms, heated outdoor pool and the owners were fantasic. The resort is brilliant we had 2 teenagers with us there is so much to do with basket ball, volley ball,tennis courts etc as well as a gym, cinema and so close to Disney. The club house is run by a great family they are so nice. I would have no hesitation in recommending this villa.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Stayed for 3 weeks. Huge resort. No map given....so guesswork is needed. The resort communal pool is very pretty with a slide that was supervised during all opening times. However there should be 2 pools for size of resort. In a sunny day it is way too crowded, bit like the river ganges on holy day....you cant swim and are constantly hit by others and pool toys, sunbeds are premium on these days. 4 times wecwent to the pool in the evening. First, slide was closed...apparently maintenance....other times whole pool was closed due to "drink related" incidents. Gave up.Loads of codes to remember. Code for side gates, enter pool, enter gym, enter games room etc.Grounds immaculate. Roads and areas very clean. Dustmen come 6 days perweek. Front gate always manned so very safe.Good location for all parks, 10 min drive to disney, 20 to universal/seaworld.Dont go in Publix supermarket.....very dear....turn left on 192 and go to supermarket behind jungle golf (formosa gardens I think) formerly winn dixie. Much cheaper and bigger variety....and nearer!

Would recommend & stay again.

column29: There were four rooms here, all attached with bathrooms, 2 rooms with king beds and 2 rooms with double queen beds, we shared the villa with my brother and his family 1 room was fully themed for boys and 1 for girls. It was a huge villa with all the necessities available, laundry, ironing, microwave, utensils, Central air conditioning, baby cots, extra foldable beds, extra sheets, blankets, towels, swimming pool, dart game, pool table, everything a person could ask for!! It seemed like our own place in Orlando, it was amazing! The mattresses on the bed though were a little too soft which seemed a bit uncomfortable, but it was a perfect holiday package!!

column29: Booked via Virgin Atlantic and stayed at 7761 teascone blvd. villa was huge with great pool and hot tub. Few down sides there was no welcome book so had to find everything out for ourselves this included trying to find lights for the pool after three calls to hotel beds they finally sorted it out. No iron! For self catering accommodation this was hard to believe. Had hire car provided by Alamo which was 15 seater bus. First few days car started making funny noise so had change of bus. Second one had bugs running around our feet and up our legs. Again changed straight way. Windsor hills is perfect location for all parks. Staff very helpful and polite. Place keep immaculate all in all a fantastic holiday. Shame we had no games room in villa for the children but had great pool to keep us busy when at the villa.

column29: We rented here to have easy access to the parks in Orlando, which was great. You spend little time in the car. The resort is nice with a pool area and a small water slide which the kids loved. There is also a small store where you can get the most important stuff. There is also a play area for the kids and a small gym with A/C. Friendly people and great atmosphere. column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: I don't typically write reviews but felt that this experience deserved one. Our stay was mediocre at best but acceptable. The problem really didn't arise until we left. It was my fault that in a rush to leave I forgot a bag in the bathroom but the way the situation was handled, and the fact that my items were not returned after the confirmed they had found them, was ridiculous. After numerous attempts to contact the property we were told that the items were found and someone would be in touch to get our address and payment information for shipping. After a couple weeks we reached out again, and again, and agin, at naeusim. When someone finally called us back, after over a month, we were told that they only hold item for 15 days and we were SOL. Fantastic. I hope someone is enjoying my expensive blow dryer, straightener, curling iron, electric toothbrushes and beauty products! The rate were reasonable until you factor in the the over $400 loss. Won't ever be back and we are annual park pass holders who go to Orlando 5+ times a year. Shame.

However pick your accommodation with some care as they are all privately owned, some are better than others, so take recommendation from this site or from another forum before booking. Very attentive and back to us super quick with answers to our questions. Already booking again for March. Stay on Maneshaw Lane if in a small party. It's close to the security gate with a nice selection of town houses.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Thomson Holidays 6 Bedded Orlando Plus Villa
column29: We arrived on the 12th June for a 3 week holiday. After arriving at Sanford airport, the Thomson Holiday rep, handed us an envelope with the details and instruction of where we were staying in Orlando and that we would need to register at Hotel Beds the following morning.The Windsor Hills is an impressive array of properties in a fantastic location if your intention is to visit Disney and Universal.It is a gated community, meaning that you have to check in with security at the gates who issue you with a barcode pass.The properties in the resort are a mixture of privately owned or managed by property management companies.The villa we had booked with Thomson Holidays is a 6 bedded Orlando Plus Villa.On arrival we noticed that there was no hot water in the villa, along with13 other issues which ranged from the A/C in the games room not working, to no provision of oven trays, etc. to be able to use the oven, the number of sun loungers, 2 in a six bed villa, to the state of the crockery, cutlery, pots and pans, pool lights, microwave not working, oh!!! and an infestation of cockroaches, to name but a few.Did we mention that this was a self catering holiday, without the use of an oven or a microwave, not sure that the Windsor Hills will allow us to build a camp fire to cook food on?We are now well within our second week and trying as hard as we can to get Thomson Holidays Florida resort, customer services and their 24/7 holidayline, to pull their finger out and actually do something constructive. Instead they just forward our emails and phone calls etc, to Hotel Beds who in turn forward these to the property management company (A certain catchphrase of the Chuckle Brothers comes to mind).In fairness, since we notified Thomson Holidays of these issues, it only took 2 days for the hot water issue to be resolved, which the property maintenance man had to drill through a locked cupboard in the garage/games room before he was able to turn up the hot water controls, which begs us to question how the cleaners managed to clean the property without hot water??All other issues took about a week to resolve, apart from the replacement microwave and fumigation of the family of cockroaches who we are currently sharing our villa with. These were expected to be resolved today, Monday 22nd June, but we are not confident they will be.We also requested a transfer of villa on several occasions, given the no. of issues we have reported since arrival but Thomson Holidays chose to ignore our requests, in fact they haven't really been in touch with us, apart from an occasional reply to our emails, in which their response is, they are doing everything they can to resolve these issues...... And will forward these details on!!For us, the customer/family who are supposed to be enjoying our holiday and relaxing....... this is definitely not the case.It is also unfair for us to bemoan the Windsor Hills resort for the actions or not of Thomson Holidays, as we are extremely impressed by the location, cleanliness and security of the place. It is just unfortunate that Thomson Holidays don't seem to care what happens to their customers once they have their money.Thank you Thomson Holidays.... Not really.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms

column29: Booked this on vrbo with a lady who was amazing to work with! We stayed in a town house unit. It had 3 beds, and 3 full baths with our own private small pool! Arrival was a breeze, checked in without any hassles. The unit we were in was an end unit. There was just 4 of us in our party. We had our own parking area!! The town house was very clean, and the pool was just cool enough for the hotness outside! The beds were Very Comfortable!! We slept very good at nights! Loved having the washer/dryer, came home with all clean clothes! Loved having a kitchen with lots of pots and pans for cooking, we for sure took advantage of that!! We were in the pool Everyday during our visit, and sometimes even late at nights! We did visit the community pool area with the water slide 3 times during our visit. (it was just a short walk from our unit). We even ordered some foods from the store area they have. I highly recommend eating at their food area! The foods were GREAT! My daughter Loved the Water Slide!! We loved that the resort was gated with security! Honestly I could go on and on about this resort, it was amazing! Honestly my husband and I are considering looking at buying a town house in this resort in the future. Until we do this will for sure be our #1 top place to stay when going to the Disney area! (Which your only like 1.5 mile from the entrance to the Disney Gates). Very nice and pleasant stay at Windsor Hills! :) Highly Recommend!

column29: Overall a nice property, but in need of some updating and cleaning. We did manage to have two old rusted sun beds replaced legs actually rusted so badly they had fallen off. Rusted legs had left marks around the pool area, and bits of rusted metal have left marks on the pool floor that we tried to clean! Jacuzzi empties every evening unable to use it, light also does not work in jacuzzi and light in patio area did not work. Informal dining area seats dirty and stained, outside area soft furnishings dirty and well worn. Mattresses into main ground floor bedrooms need replacing. Carpet bugs in front double bedroom, shower heads need replacing on ground floor and sinks blocking regularly, although a plunger is provided!Cockroaches in the garage and main living area, Internet was disconnected prior to our arrival which was inconvenient, blinds falling down in main living area, previously reported by other occupants nothing done. Photographs taken!! We still enjoyed our stay but the property needs money spent on it and upgrading !! The resort is not a 5 star with properties like this !!

column29: Can I start by saying what a great resort this is, clean and very secure and only 5 minutes from animal kingdom if you take the shortcut.We booked with IPG and were disappointed with our accommodation. It was advertised as a 4 star plus property and really wasn't! It wasn't clean enough and dated but liveable. After complaint they did send the cleaners in again, but after staying in previous IPG 4 star plus properties it was a disappointment. The resort however is great, and would stay again but not with IPG.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column27: Great for a Disney family vacation
column29: We rented a 3 bedroom condo that was wonderfully decorated with Disney pictures, bedding, and even plates! This was perfect for my family of 6. This place definitely has a lot of security measures in place, but not overbearing. The location to anything Disney can't be beat! It is 1.5 miles to Animal Kingdom and maybe a 10 minutes drive to the farthest park, Magic Kingdom. The pool was large with plenty of lounge chairs. My kids really enjoyed the water slide. I was a little discouraged that we had to supply our own toilet paper. They also wanted the towels washed and dried before checking out- which means purchasing laundry soap. Plus-it's nearly impossible to wash and dry towels after 6 showers while packing to leave before the 10:00 check out (or face a $200 fine for late check out). Overall this was a wonderful place to stay and I would come back. It was clean, safe, roomy, and family friendly. It is in a good neighborhood with lots of places to eat nearby.

O condomínio é lindo, seguro e tranquilo, é ao lado dos parques da Disney e tem supermercados e restaurantes próximos. Ficamos em um apartamento de 03 quartos que era enorme e super bem equipado. column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124

column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Great Vacation Rental Home near Disney (7770 Teascone Blvd.)
column29: This resort is a very nice, gated community comprised of a mixture of homes and condos. There are several parks and a very large resort-styled pool to enjoy. After considerable research, we rented a 6 bedroom home with a private pool, game room and hot tub. It was perfect for our large family!Windsor Hills is VERY convenient to the Disney entrance (about 2 miles) and there is a large Target, several supermarkets and many restaurant choices all very close by. I have read some reviews that complain about the rules at the resort. True, you have to pass a guard house to enter the resort and cars are not allowed to block sidewalks, but the few rules keep the resort safe and looking nice. Garbage pick-up was daily (except Wed) and all personnel were very friendly and helpful. If you have rented a vacation home in the past, you know homes can differ greatly, even in the same resort. This may account for the varied reviews. Our rental home was kept up in every way. The home was fully stocked with everything you would need in a kitchen and all the towels and linens were provided. The air conditioning, pool heater, WIFI, washer/dryer, mattresses, etc were fine. And there was plenty of hot water for our large fam to take showers! Finally, the owner we dealt with was always prompt with email responses and very accommodating. So if you are considering staying outside the Disney property, I would recommend Windsor Hills.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: we stayed in a 3 bed town house which was just perfect for our needs. the pool was very small but as we were a few steps from the main pool this didnt bother us. fab location far enough away from the mayhem of disney but close enough to reach all the parks and attractions. we would never stay in a hotel again as having your own space (like home) is unbeatable as you can relax and chill in your own space without worrying about the people in the room next to or below you. the main pool is just perfect and never that busy so there is always room to find somewhere to sit and the pool is so inviting for the relaxing days when you dont want to be upside down on the rides! i would really recommend staying here and we will certainly be back. we booked direct with the owerns of storytime villas who helped make our stay perfect.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: OK, there is an advantage to staying in a condo. We've stayed at a few other places and we're not that picky. BUT- security overkill. Front gate- not getting in until scan pass. Go to pool. Enter code. Go to game area, enter code. Seriously. Signs and rules everywhere. No this, don't do that. What kind of welcome is it when one of the first thing you see is a "bill" if anything is missing? You need to do inventory to make sure you don't get charged if missing. First impression when open door? Overwhelming cleaning product smell. Didn't mean that the dust was removed from the master bedroom covers and pillows. Even had dirty towel still hanging up. What is the cleaning fee for?No dishwashing liquid (Need to run to store). Don't forget salt and pepper. Nothing here. Yes, close to Disney and stuff. We really didn't get the warm fuzzy here. Oh yeah, before you leave, it would be nice if you strip the beds. Sheesh!

column29: you just can't call this an Executive Plus Villa, as it was not up to standard at all. It needs a complete refurb and modernisation. WiFi didn't work for 4 days and had to report it several times before it was repaired. 2 of the hob rings on the cooker didn't function and had to report it. The tiles around the pool had sunk and were dangerous especially as we had 4 children. We had to clean massive cobwebs from the pool area and around the sun beds before we could use them. There were only 2 sun beds and insufficient chairs for 12 people. The washing machine was making a very loud clonking noise so we reported it but it was no better after someone had come out to repair it. It was a shambles to be honest.

column27: Para ir e ficar sem vontade de ir embora!
column29: Fiquei mais de um mês hospedada em um apartamento no Windsor Hills. A vantagem de ficar em um apartamento é a sua maior desvantagem também: A vontade de voltar para casa nunca ocorre. O resort(ou condomínio no nosso caso) é completo, com uma pequena loja para compras emergenciais, academia, grande piscina e área de lazer. Férias Inesquecíveis na terra do sol.
