column27: Loved Windsor Hills! 2774 Almaton Loop, Unit 104
column29: Windsor Hills was a perfect resort for our family of six. four children ages 12-5. The pool was perfect, large enough to accommodate the crowd during peak season. There is a walk in area for the little ones, and a small sprinkler pad as well. There was adequate lounge chairs for all guests, and shaded areas as well (which is a perk after long days in the sun). We rented through Magical Vacation Homes, which I highly recommend. We had a couple minor inconveniences with our unit, which were taken care of immediately with a phone call. Our unit was ground floor, and quick walk to pool, basketball and volleyball court right out back. The beds in our unit were amazingly comfortable, all 3 bedrooms were equipped with high quality mattresses. This unit does need some cosmetic clean up, bases boards were worn, walls were scuffed, but it was minimal. I did have a little trouble preparing some meals, with the lack of mixing bowls.Other than those minor issues, we LOVED everything about Windsor Hills, Unit 104 and Magical Vacation Homes.

column29: This was the third time staying in Windsor Hills. Different units each time. Rented Windsor fantasia condo this time. Second building, 3rd floor. Could not have been better. Owner provided everything as promised. Location to Disney was excellent. 10 minutes tops. Lots of room (3 bedrooms, 2 full baths, could've slept 8 comfortably), full kitchen, dishwasher, dining area, washer & dryer. Flat screen TVs in every room. The one in the Living room was 60" or larger. Condo was clean with no bugs or insects. Plenty of bath and pool towels. Saved so much money not having to eat out every meal. Commons area was great with plenty to do: playground, tennis, basketball, huge pool and hot tub, movie theatre. Nice to decompress after a day at the amusement parks.

column29: We stayed here for a week with friends who were renting a home here. It is a very lovely gated community. Beautiful homes, townhomes and condos to rent. Our friends rented through Global Homes and they were all praise for them. The home was a four bedroom, 4 bath home with a private pool. I would recommend a house that has afternoon sun if you're there in the cooler seasons. It can be quite cool for swimming otherwise. The home was very nicely set up. Lots of kitchen stuff, bedding/towels are provided. It is super close to Disney, Downtown Disney, restaurants etc. The community centre is quite nice as well. We didn't use the community pool because it was too crowded on nice days because during our week we didn't have very warm weather. I guess you can book a room to watch a movie as well, that would've been cool but we just didn't have time. If you like to walk in the evenings, this is a nice secure place to do so. I would even walk by myself. Front gate staff are amazing! I would recommend this.

column29: We have stayed here 3 times and every time our stay has been wonderful. We have rented both 2 and 3 bedroom condos. The pool and hot tub are clean as are the grounds surrounding the entire community. It is also very close to Disney, restaurants and shopping.

column27: Nice place for a families to stay
column29: As we were travelling with 5 adults and 5 kids we needed some space. We rented "Windsor Wishes Villa" house from Windsor Hills Resort. It was a great place to stay! Imagine this: big rooms, even big bathrooms (something we Europeans seldom have), lots of clothes rooms, kitchen by the private pool area and a game room to entertain kids.We were also allowed to use all the services of Windsor Hills Resort. There were a great pool are with a water slide and jacuzzi, tennis, volleyball & basket ball courts with equipment free to use. That was so great! Kids spend three days just swimming and playing tennis.All the rooms were clean and there was absolutely nothing to complaint. Only thing I wondered is why we were supposed to by our own liquids for dish washing and washing machine. Guess owner of the machines would have made better selections as we did as tourists. Buying washing liquids, garbage bags and toilet papers isn't actually the way I like to spend my precious holiday.But that was just a small detail. I really recommend this place to stay. It's close to Disney World and Universal Studios, but still a very peaceful and beautiful resort.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We've stayed at Windsor Hills 3 times: once in a condo and twice in a Villa (detached house). This most recent Villa on Comrose St. was called the "Irish Jig" and it was quite disappointing. We were guests of the renters. For the uninitiated, the villas are actual houses, some larger than others, but they all have virtually identical private pools. First off, you pay extra if you want the pool heated, and it takes a day or two for it to fully heat up, but the property management won't turn it on in advance, so right off the bat you lose a day or two to a cold pool. Ours was 71F and took two days to get up to 85F, and this was after calling maintenance. Then the hot tub didn't bubble or heat up much above 90F. On our last full day, they came again and found that the filter needed changing, and that was causing flow problems, but too little too late for our visit. Here's a list of some of the other oddities and shortcomings:The dishwasher was broken, missing the little roller wheels to help guide the lower rack in and out, and it wouldn't preheat the water so it wouldn't wash very well unless you ran the hot water in the sink for awhile just before turning it on. The fridge ice maker would clunk horribly all night, so we simply turned the switch off, which then produced a flood overnight all over the floor, nearly causing one of us to fall over backwards in the early morning and break a neck. There were no towel racks in the bathrooms. The lighting was horrible throughout the house. The pool light worked but the hot tub light did not. The decor and furnushings were extremely dated. All TV's were the old CRT style, and there was even a VCR. The remote for the TV didn't work unless you squeezed the life out of it. All the batteries in all the clocks throughout the house were dead (we went to Publix and bought new batteries). One clock on the wall was missing all the numbers except the 12 and the 5.The sink was missing the stopper, so you couldn't fill the sink and wash dishes by hand. We contacted the property management about the maintenance issues and they quickly sent someone over, but none of the issues were properly resolved before we left. We asked for a discount but we're told "no, we solved all your problems". We've had good luck with other units, but not this one.

Windsor hills resort is in a fantastic location, the onsite facilities were fantastic. The community is well looked after and we would definitely look at staying here again when returning to florida.

column29: We stayed in a townhome in this community for 2 weeks. Well maintained property, large community pool, small fitness facility and game room. This is a huge property with condos, townhomes and single homes but it is quiet and family oriented. There is also a small theater on site with a directory of movies available. Our townhome was OK, seating furniture was worn/uncomfortable with little support but everything else was fine. We had a small spa/pool off living area but did not even use it. We were at Disney, Universal, etc most days and night were very chilly so we paid extra to have the pool heated which was a waste of money. Our townhome had 3 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, washer/dryer, and complete kitchen with all appliances. This was so convenient for breakfast, snacks and occasional eat-in lunch or dinner. Overall it was a good place to stay and very close to Disney, outlets, restaurants and traffic was not as crazy as some other areas.

column29: This was the first time that our family has ever stayed in a condo. We usually opt for hotels. I was pleasantly surprised about the amount of space in the townhome that we rented. It was only a few minutes walk to the pool area. We fully enjoyed the heated pool and the hot tub. It's a nice combination to have the surplus of space (3 bedrooms plus 3 full bathrooms) and a resort style pool. We prefer to enjoy a bit of social life at the common area pool vs. spending time in the townhome's private pool. We have 2 boys, ages 17 and 12 that participated in the games at the pool plus the occasional ride on the waterslide. The staff was very friendly. Comforting to know that if we had forgotten to bring any necessities, I could probably purchase something from the store/snack bar to tide us over for the week. Super handy to have in-suite laundry, I really missed that when we continued in our travels, staying at hotels with no laundry facilities. We rented through Michelle at Behlor Realty - she was very helpful before and during our stay. They allow for late check out upon request if they are able to accommodate it, which we inquired about and were permitted to do so at no additional charge.

column27: Return Stay As Good As The First!
column29: It is important to note a couple of things about Windsor Hills: First - There are three kinds of accommodations - Condos (flats), Townhouses, and Villlas (homes)Second - All the accommodations are owned by individuals (some are managed by small companies) so your experiences may vary widely.We returned for a second stay in a 3BR Condo. It is on a first floor and is handy to the parking area. The furnishings are very tasteful and the beds very comfy.When we arrived the condo was sparkling clean and well equipped.From our unit to the pool is a short 2 block walk and to the tennis courts, sand volleyball, picnic, and putting greens in the common area is also very close. (They just resurfaced the tennis courts and they are very nice!) The children's playground is a little further - kind of in the middle of the Resort property. Each condo has a laundry built in. There is no maid service, so long term stays (we are here for 2 months) require you launder your own bed and bath linen.The workout center is small but well equipped. We found that waiting until just after lunch yields the best access. A small convenience store has many of the things you may have forgotten, but we are only 1 mile south of US192 (Irlo Bronson Highway), so many stores and restaurants are readily available.Access to the property is controlled using a modern bar code system so no one can sneak in. The main gate is manned by guards 24X7. Location is great - very close to Disney and Old Towne Kissimmee as well as I-4 for a quick run to Winter Haven, Lakeland or even Tampa.We've been informed by or owner that she is selling the condo, so not sure if we'll be back next year. I hope so, we really like this place!

O condomínio fica próximo de todos os parques da Disney, Sea World, Legoland, Outlets... quem estiver em dúvida, vale muito a pena este condomínio resort!!! a rua que ficamos foi a Almaton Loop.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124

column27: On your own with any issues!
column29: My husband and I recently stayed in condo building 7650 unit 104 from Dec 24-Jan 2. I'm very disappointed with the service we received especially for paying prime dollar during the holiday season. We arrived and the condo smelled very musty due to air being set so high and no air circulation. It took two days and a bottle of febreeze to get the smell to a point to where I could handle it (still washing clothes over and over at home to get smell out of them). The condo was not overly clean...found a used maxi pad in washer stuck to the side and washer was disgustingly dirty with scum around the top of drum. Dryer took 1 1/2 hours or more to dry a small load of towels. Bathrooms had mold in showers and black stuff (assume mold in toilets). We had a loose door handle on lanai that my husband tightened but the knob feel totally off after a couple days. I called the number provided at 9:14 AM and no one called back by closing time so we were forced to go buy and install a new door handle if we wanted a locked door while we slept. That's exactly what we did (our expense) and NEVER received a return call the whole time we were there! Not only did we pay over 1700.00 dollars to rent the condo we also paid for a new door handle, time to install, cleaning supplies and time to clean the condo to our comfort. They say the condos are professionally cleaned...I suggest they do some checking on the job done. I hire a housekeeper back home and never would I find my home this dirty and gross!We also had a cockroach in our kitchen...I mentioned this when I called about broken door handle but again heard nothing. I know this is common for the area and was thankful we never seen another one. This was my second time staying in a condo at Windsor Hills; however I will not be returning!

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: Alugamos um sobrado de três quartos e 3 banheiros no Windsor Hills Resort para 6 pessoas (4 adultos e 2 crianças) e havia espaço de sobra para todos nós! A casa era totalmente equipada, contendo inclusive, liquidificador, torradeira e outros utensílios de cozinha para quem quiser e tiver tempo de preparar refeições. A casa contava ainda com uma piscina privativa. Os quartos têm pequenos closets, o que contribuiu para evitar malas/sacolas de compras espalhadas e assim manter a organização. O condomínio é muito bem cuidado, com ruas amplas, arborizadas e limpas, além de bastante seguro. A casa estava em boas condições de uso, até mesmo o carpete (escada e quartos) tinha uma aparência razoavelmente nova. Colchões confortáveis (camas king size, queen size e solteiro), chuveiros excelentes (dentro da banheira, o que não é muito adequado para pessoas idosas). A suíte das crianças, com duas camas de solteiro, é temática e bem bonitinha. Bem perto dos parques da Disney e com algumas boas opções de compras por perto, como Ross, TJ Maxx, Target, Dollar Tree, mas bem longe dos parques da universal, dos outlets mais procurados (Premium) e dos shoppings, o que não deve ser um ponto negativo, pois dirigir pelas ruas de Orlando/Kissimee pode ser considerado um prazer! Recomendadíssimo.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: We received a Groupon for Oakwater Resort, but Global Resort Homes placed us here instead due to being overbooked at the other location. We were excited to be placed in a 3 bedroom townhome vs. a condo, though either would have been fine with us. There is no doubt that the amount of space was great - living room, full bath and bedroom on the first floor, two full beds and baths on the second floor. The townhome was definitely dated, but given that we were there for the theme parks that didn't bother me much - though it did feel a little dirty. To give an idea, there were only VCR's available in the townhome. The major issue has been the administration and their responses (or lack thereof) - before our arrival we had asked for a pack and play and were told there was a $40 charge. We brought our own (what a pain to fly with) and when we arrived there was one available in the pantry closet. After we left, we realized we had left our baby monitor camera in one of the rooms. I called and emailed and was told they were very busy but would get back to me. I didn't hear anything regardless of how many calls I made, but received an email 6 weeks later saying I was being charged $53 for a broken soap dispenser in a bathroom we hadn't used. I responded to the email explaining that we hadn't used that bathroom, and more importantly, I'd like a response on the baby monitor camera (which was $50). She said she would forward the response to management. I followed up and was once again told they were very busy and she would send a reminder. Nothing as of today.Unfortunately, my "deal" ended up costing me $150 more than I had planned. I stayed at the resort nearly 3 months ago, and I feel that I gave them a very fair amount of time to at a minimum respond, but hopefully rectify this issue. Given that I still have not heard back I think it's fair to share this experience with others. We are returning to Orlando next month but will be staying elsewhere.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: This is the second time that we have stayed in Windsor Hills and the first time in a townhome property. We have explored and stayed in other Kissimmee/Disney areas, but we have not found one that combines proximity to the parks, amenities at a community and value for price paid better than what we have at Windsor Hills.This property was no different, in fact, we far preferred staying here to being in a condo because of the space and location of the home. The noticeable differences between this and the condos are that this has en-suite bathrooms with every bedroom, a larger kitchen area, a private pool and a great open-concept first floor with eating and living areas.The owners were extremely responsive and always were in e-mail communication quickly with any questions we had during the reservation or pre-arrival process. Everything was taken care of swiftly, leading to an easy beginning of our stay.As for the value, I can't imagine getting a better price for what you are receiving. The townhome has large bedrooms and bathrooms, as well as common living space, and it is very clean and very comfortable. There is nothing over-the-top about the amenities, but it has everything you'll be looking for in a rental property.One of the big reasons we like Windsor Hills is the great community pool and clubhouse area. It is heated during the winter months and perfect for families of all ages. It's nice to have a private pool, although we opted not to use it, but the community pool is a two-minute walk from this property and a great location. There are also several playgrounds in the community that are terrific for younger children.We will definitely stay here again should we choose to come back to the area!

column29: Windsor Hills is very close to Disney, possibly the closest community to the parks. The community pool is nice but the water was cold and in peak times I imagine it could get very busy. There is one water slide. We stayed in a house, close to the pool with a pool of its own. There is a small onsite ahop also serving snacks near the pool but plenty of restaurants and shops a short drive away. We have stayed at Reunion twice before and thought we'd try WH for a change. Although it was good we'd go back to Reunion next time as it has an amazing water park which is brilliant for kids and several onsite restaurants.

column27: Fantastic resort and location (7724 Teascone Blvd)
column29: Just returned from two weeks in an amazing house at 7724 Teascone Blvd, Windsor Hill.Firstly the house:It was perfect. We were three couples and having three double bedrooms of similar size was great. The house layout was really good with no wasted space. It was spotlessly clean and we only saw one cockroach in the entire stay. The television was massive and televisions in all bedrooms. Garage converted to a games rooms which was a real bonus. Also a bonus was the excellent wifi. I really cannot praise this house enough and as this was our 8th visit and stay in a house, we have sufficient experience to compare. The owner was incredibly helpful prior to departure and during the stay. He provides a great service and deserves to have his home rented out all of the time.I highly recommend this property.The resort:We have preciously stayed a couple of time in Davenport, three times in Formosa Gardens and once in Oak Island Cove. This is far and away the safest resort with great security. The biggest difference between this and Formosa Garden is the extra security but also the houses are tighter packed with less ground. To be honest this didn't bother us. The location is great, just a couple of minutes drive and you're into Disney World. Shops and restaurants near by and we also found using taxis on an evening really convenient. The main pool are was closed for refurb which is a shame, but didn't impact us too much. Any questions, please ask.

column27: Once you get a condo, you never go back
column29: We had a large group, more than a hotel would work for. It was great. We were close to the pool which I recommend. We all got our own rooms, two bathrooms, a smoking area if you're a smoker, and an amazing kitchen. We saved a ton of money cooking our meals instead of eating out. Some of the furniture was out dated, but fine. We had a tv in every room plus the living room. Free wifi. Two dvd players, cable tv. It felt safe, it was comfortable, and there were no bugs!!

column29: Resort excepcional para famílias próximo a Disney. Ficamos em 6 pessoas num apartamento completo de 2 quartos, com cozinha, varanda, amplos closets, 2 banheiros, TV a cabo e Wi-Fi. O resort é muito tranquilo e seguro, pena que a piscina estava sendo reformada (mas havia a opção de utilizar a piscina de outro resort próximo). Nas proximidades existem farmácias, mercados, postos de gasolina e fica apenas a 5 milhas da Disney. Certamente voltarei a ficar aqui.

column29: We were two families that rented a villa here, 2601 Daulby street. We loved everything about this place. The house was awsome, the resort was great, specially for the kids. The thing we liked the most though was the location. Everything is close by. The themeparks, shopping, restaurants! Would recomend this place when staying in the Orlando aeria.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We really enjoyed our stay at this condo. The pool was such a huge hit that we never even made it to the big pool to swim, although we visited and it looked beautiful. We also loved the extras like the Ipod dock in the kids room, the DVD and comic book collections and the closet full of family board games. It was great being so close to Disney World- it didn't take much longer to get to some areas than it did when we stayed on site at the Wilderness Campsite for our last visit.Beds were comfortable and the sofa newly replaced. Overall the unit was very clean. There were a few minor items in need of attention: the washer had a slight musty smell, the dryer squealed when we used it, pool area not as clean as the rest of the condo, burnt out light bulbs, missing batteries and some bedroom furniture nearing the end of its lifespan, but not enough to drop the star rating.

Não aproveitamos a piscina mas a área de lazer é agradável e tem uma loja de conveniência dentro do resort.

column29: House was beautiful in pictures for renting. Arrived to a house much smaller than appeared in photos but the size of the numerous cockroaches was unreal! They were gigantic and we were told that it is common in FL in August and that the neighborhood has a big problem. First morning we awoke to a 4 inch cockroach on our bedroom wall. We were told exterminator could come out maybe the NEXT day....what?!?! And once they came we were assured we would not see others...but rest-assured day and night all over neighborhood...abundant at night to the point where we tried to leave parks early so as not to have to fight off cockroaches on way home each night ...spend the extra money and stay on Disney property...SO much nicer and no gigantic cockroaches!!!

column27: Great Place to Stay for WDW!!!
column29: This is our second stay at Windsor Hills in four years. This time we rented a townhouse (2 Adults 3 Children), we rented the condo last time. The accommodations are great! We had a small pool that the kids enjoyed after the parks. The kitchen was fully equipped and each bedroom (3 total) had a their own full bathroom. The townhome we picked was fully equipped with flatscreen tvs in each room. One of the rooms had bunkbeds and was decorated with Disney characters. After a quick trip to the Publix (local grocery store) or Super Target we stocked up for the week -- it was great (especially having a full kitchen including a toaster and coffee maker). The location is extremely close to the WDW resort (Animal Kingdom is 5 minute drive) -- and driving in-and out of the park was quicker than riding the resort bus (we stayed on the resort many times). This resort is great for our family as we like to go at our own pace and enjoy having the fully features of a house (washer/drying, dishwasher, pool, etc...). You can't beat the price -- we'll be back!

If the kids are looking for something to do the movie there is a good place to start. They usually play three movies a day. You can request a movie and showing time for any day with advance notice and it will be there ready to roll on the big screen If you are looking for a clean safe quiet GATED community then this is the right place for you

column29: I rented a large house here for a family reunion, and trips to Disney. As it was our first time in the area, I was a little uncertain what we would get and how close it would be etc. Everything was perfect. The site is secure and safe, it has a reasonable sized children's play area and some mini play areas too. There is a an onsite pool and club - though we didn't use that. It has a shop, which was smaller than I expected and not quite large enough, though a fuller shop is near by back on the main road.We had no problems getting to Disney, it was about 2 miles drive away and the traffic was never a problem in the mornings. Theres a large number of restaurants in the area but they fill up very quickly, so either go early or book if you can.If I'm lucky enough to get to return, Windsor Hills would be my preferred choice.

The villa itself was immaculate, the pool and hot tub superb and the amount of towels and other extra quite amazing.I would strongly recommend this property and resort to any families considering where to base themselves for a stay in Orlando.The kids particularly enjoyed the free Wi-Fi and games room.

Our villa was so spacious and the beds were massive. We had a full size pool table which the kids loved. The pool was of a good size. Great location for all of the theme parks.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: We booked through Floridabedtime.com . We are three adults with two grandchildren . Having spent numerous times at Disney , this trip was not for the parks. We wanted to stay in one place and enjoy a nice pool and other on site amenities . In all fairness we probably booked the wrong type of property. We requested a condo close to the pool and clubhouse . We were assigned the farthermost building from everything . We had to drive to the pool and clubhouse . The first day ( Friday ) we reported the icemaker not working .. The ice maker was replace on Wednesday night . We had ice our last day . Overall I suppose this is a nice villa depending on how well the owner of the unit keeps it in good repair. Our three BR condo had one flat screen tv in the LR , A small flat screen in the master BR . A post card size TV in BR 2 and none in BR 3. The condo was clean and comfortable . After a couple of days we got used to the routine of going back and forth . Would be a good place to stay if you were planning a Disney Vacation . We probably won't be returning due to the fact it doesn't fit our needs. If we ever did return we would not deal with Floridabeedtime.com . We would try to deal with the condo owner direct . This is how a few of the people we met handled their rental and they got the location they wanted.

column27: Close to Disney, great for families
column29: We stayed here on a recent visit to Disney with 4 adults and 2 small children. This is a pretty large complex with condos, townhomes and larger homes. We rented a 3 bedroom condo from magicalvacationhomes. All condos and homes are individually maintained. The grounds seem well-maintained by the Windsor Hills staff. Check in was simple at the front gate - no problems. The condo was just as described in the photos online, nicely furnished and updated. The kids loved the mickey-themed room. In the 3 bed condo, there was plenty of room for everyone. We were on the 4th floor, so the elevator was much appreciated after a long day at Disney. The location is great for visiting Disney - about 10-15 minute drive to the parking entrance to Magic Kingdom. There were several grocery stores within a few miles of the resort. The pool was great - perfect for small children and not too crowded.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Week 1 - not a good experience - old, dirty, damaged
column29: We booked as part of a virgin package and hotel beds were looking after the allocation of the villa while a third company acted as a 'management company' - therefore it's difficult to allocate blame here. Week 2 was better, but still new things went wrong...in general, the villa we were allocated has been neglected and unloved and is in need of some tlc.On arrivalThe villa allocation was wrong and security said that hotel beds had double booked so we'd have to find alternative accommodation (we found this out after going to the allocated villa but two cars were on the drive). The 'welcome centre' on site at Windsor hills were less than welcoming but eventually called hotel beds who said they gave virgin the wrong number.After calming down our 8 yr old who was crying and convinced we'd need to find an alternative, we eventually found the right villa.Once in, we were disappointed- Bed mattress v old and sunken - did not make us feel comfortable as we were sleeping on several years of visitors' use - we switched rooms after the virgin/hotel beds inspection on day two as there was no option to switch villa.- Smoke alarm battery needed replacing and through the constant beeping it kept us awake first night - when we complained to hotel beds on registration the morning after arrival, this and other issues were dismissed as 'they don't have time to do a detailed inspection before every new occupancy' - we were not impressed - they only relented to some action when I threatened to reject the holiday in its entirety and put this in the hands of our lawyer - they agreed to do a joint inspection with the Virgin rep. However this inspection was clearly just an attempt to put sticking plasters over the issues and actually cost us another >$1000 in theme park tickets that the virgin rep sold us in what I now term as a hard sell as she did this while saying that she would see what colleagues would be able to do as compensation - which gave us the impression that all these tickets might be reimbursed - not the case, we ended up accepting a cheque for a few hundred pounds so that we could at least try to enjoy week two - the offer of a cheque took over a week to come and we were sick of the hassle. Frankly this was about poor service and not money as we had paid over £8,000 for the holiday with Virgin. The rep initially tried to dismiss our concerns by saying the bulk of our holiday cost was flights, but we bought it as a package - otherwise what's the point of a package holiday!- Dirty plates, cups and cutlery- almost everything needed re-washing.- No garage - owners turned this into a poorly maintained games room (air hockey barely worked and pool table had no markings left so was in need of re-felting).- Shower heads were very dirty (orange and green scum around the nozzles) as was the fridge ice/water dispenser - the virgin/hotel beds inspection on day two resulted in replacement shower head inserts and a simple clean of the fridge dispenser - but the water dispenser still wouldn't work.- No safe in the villa so you need to be trusting or find other arrangements.- V old cheap TFT TVs in all but main lounge - all working but in need of investment in decent technology.- House appeared smaller than on photos - although was 5 bed, 3 were on ground floor.- rear doors onto pool area did not lock, it was clearly damaged previously which didn't inspire confidence - the virgin/hotel beds inspection on day two resulted in a bodge job to make the lock work although this only worked when the whole frame of the door is lifted into level position. They also said they would fit plastic retainer locks which they did two days later and only after complaining a second time, but they dropped off the night that they were fitted and wouldn't stay on - poor.Good pointsNice big house on the inside.Great pool - kids loved that.Location - 15 mins to Disney and 20 to Universal.General estate is very well maintained.Themed rooms in two of the rooms (boys sports and a princess room - although all this was light touch and felt like it was done on the cheap).Clean generally - as in there weren't dirty marks everywhere and the sheets/towels were clean.Great fridge and cooker - typical US super-sized ones.I definitely wouldn't recommend this estate unless you know exactly which villa you're getting!!

".. the pool area was full of weeds which we had to clear up ourselves , and the pool heating was turned off 4 days early after we had paid £250 for the two weeks. but all in all a fantastic place to stop I would recommend to anyone. wish we was back there.

column27: Great place to stay for families!
column29: We rented a 3 bedroom, 3 bath townhome for our family vacation through HomeAway.com. We stayed with me, my husband, our daughter, my mother and my brother all in the same house. I was so happy with the rental as it would have cost so much more to book 3 hotel rooms. The location is very close to Disney - takes about 10 minutes to get to parking lot from the resort. We had a personal lanai so never got to use the community pool at the clubhouse. We were able to have food delivered to the town home instead of going out. There is also a lot of restaurants nearby and a Publix. If we ever have a large group going to Orlando again, we will definitely be going back here.

column29: We stayed at Windsor Hills during a recent trip to Disney and highly recommend if you are looking to stay offsite. This was our first time staying offsite and this property was perfect!!!!We had a 3 bedroom townhouse, private pool, clubhouse with community pool, game room, etc. location was minutes from shopping and dining and 15-20 from parks.

column29: We booked this unit through Discount Vacation Rentals Online who were very helpful and professional throughout the booking and vacation. There were one or two snags when we arrived but DVRO ensured these were attended to. We booked a 5 bedroomed 5 bathroom villa which worked extremely well for two families. The house was well furnished and had plenty crockery and cutlery. However, the mattresses in the bedrooms are very soft, uncomfortable and need to be replaced. The towels could also be replaced as they are very threadbare. Windsor Hills is a 10 minute drive to the Disney parks and 20 minutes to Universal.

column29: Just stayed in a 3 bedroom condo at Windsor Hills last week Building 8 unit 104. We rented a unit right next to the pool, and were very happy. The unit it self was nicely furnished, and had flat screens in every room. Being close to the pool was key as I was with my 9 yr old, and we spent a lot of time around the pool. The pool is large, although it gets crowded at times. They have a twisting slide that the kids (and myself) had a lot of fun using. My only complaint was the pool was WAY too warm...maybe upper 80s? It barely cooled you off. There are tons of food choices near by, and the drive into the parks was easy 15-20 minutes. I would definitely consider staying here again. Hard to go wrong with a 3 bedroom condo for $125 a night.

Pool area was busy but it was Easter sch hols. Different security code was needed for apartment, pool & exit gate-take a notepad to keep numbers handy! Would recommend it without hesitation

column27: Magnolia View, Manesty Lane, Windsor Hills - Excellent
column29: We booked this 5 bed, 5 bathroom property independently after much internet research and were not disappointed. The owner Andrea could not do enough to ensure we enjoyed her property and the area and called during the week of our stay to make sure we were 100% happy. It is about 2500 square feet in size, has all the amenities you will need and was a 8 minute walk to the communal facilities. Good choice, good spot and would definitely return to the same property. We went with another family so the property offered great space for 4 adults and 4 children who took the top two twin ensuite bedrooms!

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124

column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: 2619 Archfeld Blvd. Don't waste your money.
column29: In a word, overpriced and not what you see in the photo's. Firstly, the 2 problems we reported on our day of arrival, the first a broken ( well smashed to pieces electric socket ) in one of the bedrooms, the second extremley uneven and dangerous areas all around our pool, neither had even been looked at when we left 2 weeks later. 2 toilets in the villa disgusting, 2 showers and one bath with mildew on the grouting. Human hairs from unmentionable places in areas that you really do not want to see them. All booked through Virgin holidays who kindly send you an email showing photo's of the actual villa you will be staying in --- ignore it !!!, it is nothing like the actual one you will get. We booked a five bedroom / 5 bathroom villa which had a total of only 4 wine glasses in !, plenty of chipped plates and chipped glasses available though. Marks and scuffs over walls etc.Bedding, well, depends what you are used to I suppose. What we got was sheets so thin you could almost see straight through, they also did not fit. As for the quilt covers, you cannot take them off to wash them, imagine how many people have slept under those before you slip into the bed for a good nights sleep !!!!, doesn't bear thinking about.A lesson learnt for us but I would insist on getting up to date pictures of the accommodation they will be giving you.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: We found an independent owner of a 3 bedroom (which had great reviews) at Windsor Hills and we had a great Disney vacation. Check-in was pretty painless, but timing is probably everything - if you arrive right at 4pm (our checkin time) on a Friday, you might have a long line. You'll need the printout to be able to checkin and we told the guard and was able to get my parents in who came later. They'll give you a pass and you'll need that to get in AS WELL as to get out, which requires holding it up against the sensor for a few seconds, which was a little annoying.The room itself was independently owned/designed, so the décor and furniture and accessories (towels, TVs, dishes, etc) is probably going to vary considerably - its not like the Celebration resort where everything is professionally designed. Our place was very dated in design (80's mirror decorations), but was very clean and very well taken care of. I suppose there is a risk that you might get a place that's poorly taken care of, so keep that in mind. The walls itself showed age with the patterned walls (kinda like popcorn ceiling for walls) which wasn't bad, but certainly wouldn't be seen in a luxury condo or resort. Having the small wading pool was actually pretty nice. Deep enough to play in and have a nice break. The (required by FL law) door alert thing was very annoying. You had to push a button everytime you opened the door and again if it stayed open for more than about 30 seconds.The resort pool was nice. We had to drive to it, which was a minor minus, but it was clean and large. There were a ton of people (probably 60-70 in the pool itself), but it wasn't stressful and there were only about 6-7 kids waiting in line for the slide.In terms of location, its about as close as you can get outside of Disney property... but does that really matter? If you check Google Maps, it'll show a 10-13 minute drive to Epcot and that's about right. It'll then take you 15+ minutes to park and take a shuttle, etc so it's not like you can just walk out of the park and be back. It'll be a 30+ minute process at least and probably longer for Magic Kingdom with the monorail/boat step as well. I'm not saying that distance doesn't matter, because you SURE don't want to be stuck in Orlando commuter traffic while trying to get to Disney when it opens, but don't get caught up in whether its 1 mile or 2 miles or even 5 miles away. The local Publix wasn't too crowded or stressful, which is a very nice positive change compared to our previous stay (Blue Heron) where it was an absolute madhouse trying to get groceries.Will we stay here again? Probably, although I didn't feel like this resort was "it". It didn't have that overwhelming niceness like Celebration did, but certainly had it where it counted.

column29: Windsor Hills is a resort community very near Disney and all of the attractions of the Orlando/Kissimmee/Celebration are without the expense.We rented a three bedroom condo for two months and loved it! The eight high rise buildings to the right of the entrance are all condos. They are all owned by individuals or small companies, most of who rent them out. Some will not consider long term winter rentals but many will.We discovered that we could rent a three bedroom unit for slightly less than a two bedroom - the advantage of dealing with individuals. The disadvantage is that to check prices, you have to send out individual emails. I sent approximately 35 emails to various owners. Googel Windsor Hills Condo Rentals and then just follow your nose.Townhouses are clustered to the left of the main entrance while houses occupy the vast majority of the property. (Most of the houses seem to have private small pools).The community is gated and the gate is guarded 24X7 and you use a bar-code pass to enter and exit. Our condo was clean, tastefully decorated, and had a full kitchen. In the past, we have eaten out nearly every night. I love to cook and we were able to eat in most meals and even entertain.Our condo had a home theater, flat screen TV, cable HDTV, FM radio, CD player, etc. Both the Master and second bedroom had King beds which were comfortable.We love the area and love spending about half what other places charge.We've already put our deposit down for next winter!

column27: Windsor Hills la mejor opcion cuando visites Disney!
column29: POr segunda vez nos hospedamos en Windsor Hills. Mas o menos ubicado a 15 minutos de Magic Kigdom, a 30 minutos del aeropuerto y a 20 minutos de Seaworld. Jardines preciosos, entras con palmeras a los lados y llegas a la garita donde estan los guardas de seguridad para pedirte identificacion. Luego que haces el check in desde tu auto te dan la llave de acceso para que pases por la aguja . Llegas a la casa club donde tienen una piscina climatizada, gimnasio y un supermercado. Sigues hacia tu town house o tu condo (los town houses tienen piscina privada) pero todos tienen las mismas condiciones. Eramos mis 2 hijos menores de 6 años y mi esposo y tomamos un condo con 3 habitaciones, totalmente equipados con las habitaciones decoradas con temas disney, cada cuarto con su baño, cocina, comedor, sala, lavadora, secadora todo esto sino mal recuerdo por $550 la semana. Para la segunda semana queriamos ir a un hotel para variar y nos fuimos a Double Tree by Hilton at sea world, y la verdad me decepcione cuando llegamos porque era un solo cuarto para los 4!! pero bueno, teniamos que seguir disfrutando y tratar de estar lo menos posible en el hotel asi que les vuelvo a reiterar que no hay nada mejor que este precioso lugar rodeado de bellos jardines y sobre todo tranquilidad. Cerca tienen supermercados ymuchos restaurantes de cadena. Gracias Windsor Hills, hasta pronto!! Pueden ver fotos en booking.com

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: Hi, I have never commented before however after researching vacation homes and found that Westjet used this resort in their packages, felt that this would be the perfect choice. It was not, after walking in the town home with private pool realized I had made a mistake. The home looked JUST like the pictures however when you looked a bit closer, there were bugs in the kitchen...everytime the dishwasher was open tonz of bugs ran from the inside, including the kitchen sink, counter..they went everywhere in the kitchen! The rug looked like it was never cleaned, including the living room furniture, which I put sheets over so we could sit on them (the sheets were grey they were so old). The first morning we tried to go in the pool, there was a dead frog floating around and so much scum on the sides it looked like it hasn't been cleaned in months! When I called the 'Magical Vacations' line I was told I get what I pay for, that I had a full-town house and things were differant in Florida than Canada and that I could not be moved as it wasnt a hotel. Then the man on the phone scolled me saying he had jeu spent an hour of his day on the phone with me because of a frog in the pool...this was not the case, its because it WAS NOT CLEAN, the house or the pool! The main floor had mostly tile but the one-bedroom did not, the space in-between was bug, with frayed carpet and nails sticking outward which I stepped on and was bleeding...My goodness, I can not believe I had taken my daughter & mom to such a dirty place. After returning from a busy day, we walked into cock-roches in the front area by our shoes....I called and asked to be moved, I was told I can not be moved but they will bring in someone to spray the next business day, then was told "you are the woman I spend an hour with on the phone because of a frog in the pool", we were on the phone because the pool & home was dirty and never did get cleaned! I left to another resort the next day and was reimbursed for the days I did not stay however this was state policy. There are many other wonderful vacation homes, with very reasonable prices out their, please be aware, it does look just like the photos but my goodness I do not recommend this at all and wouldn't want anyone else to have that experience.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124

column27: Will never stay at a hotel in Florida again!!
column29: We had the pleasure of staying in a 3 bedroom,3 bathroom house for 2 weeks in November. The home is owned by Canadians and rented to Canadians. It was spotless and we were thrilled when we walked in the door.It has it's own pool (you need to pay extra to turn on the pool heater..but it's well worth it to be comfortable). It also had laundry which made our stay easy.Our home was situated farthest away from the clubhouse but was a short walk. In the end, we were happy to be a little farther from the busier townhouse area which had a lot of traffic coming and going.The clubhouse was nice and having a convenience store on site was useful for odds and ends. We didn't use the theatre or gym but thought it was great to have as an option.This resort is very safe,people were friendly and it is located close to everything if you have a car. We even drove to Tampa twice since it was only an hour away.The only negative was that the homes next door on both sides were 'owned& managed' by a company, which meant they were booked continuously..3 days at a time. Meaning: every 3 days we'd have new neighbors who were thrilled to discover their private pool,would party the first evening loudly...then leave early loudly for Disney, come home late after Disney, hit the pool and recount their adventures...then repeat the same scenario the next day..finishing their last night with a party before leaving loudly for the airport the following morning. This repeated on both sides every 3days. We even had partying neighbors park on our lawn one night, which was dealt with quickly by Windsor Hills. They have a 0 tolerance policy and the local Sheriff will show up if called.We didn't call, but it was nice to know that there are rules that can/will be enforced if needed.In the end, we knew everyone was just happy to be on vacation...so we tolerated the noise.I could see this resort being a literal paradise during the slower vacation periods when the resort is less occupied. It is so well maintained,you are challenged to find any flaws.

column29: visited florida several times but this was my first in a condo. we travelled as a family. myself, mum,dad and brother. the condo was three bedrooms with two bathrooms which made things easy and not claustrophobic. the condo was spacious and very clean with all the amenities required for self catering. There is a heated communal pool with loungers and chairs to relax and while away the day if you are not shopping or visiting the parks. There is an onsite supermarket which does hot snacks, a games room and gym. the site has everything you could need. has a free cinema and a dvd rental facility for guests. The site is quite close to numerous restaurants and big supermarkets and not too far away from the theme parks. Highly recommended and will be staying here from now on.

column29: Stayed in a 5 bed 5 bath villa over the Easter Break, via Virgin Holidays. Ideal location for disney an 192 eateries and supermarkets. Quiet but large gated community, with beautiful pool and surrounding landscapes. Very secure, even the childrens park has a coded entry. Would recommend highly.

column29: Our first time at Windsor Hills and we were not disappointed we have a lovely townhouse with a splash pool on Renshaw Street that supplied everything we needed for a excellent stay we did not want to come home, only a short walk to the resort pool and clubhouse. The street was very quiet, clean and tidy the outside trash bins were emptied on a daily basis this worked very well. Sometimes there was a long line for access to resort when new people were checking in but this was not often. This resort is very close to all Disney parks.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: Let me just say we spent $2,200 dollars for an entire week, We had a villa, soon as we walk in we notice the TV's in the room are 10 inch box tv's in the rooms, the 2nd bedroom TV didnt even work. They said their was Wi-Fi and we end up calling someone over to help us with it and ended up telling us we had to plug in dial-up from the phone!! Then they said their was a golf course - definitely isnt. The process of getting to the gate and getting your card took us 45 minutes waiting in a very long line of cars. The gatekeepers are pretty terrible as well. the pool in the back of the villa was pointless, i could stretch both arms and reach both ends. No dishwasher detergent, ONE ROLL of toilet paper. They literally did not give us anything. Let me just say we stayed at the Fountainbleu Resort in Miami and paid less and they cleaned, provided, and had everything we needed (Nicer Resort Ten Fold). This was terrible in comparison. The pool wasnt too bad, overcrowded nonetheless. The beds arent very comfortable, bathrooms were decent. There is absolutely NOT enough hot water when taking showers. We all had to wait like 20 minute intervals just to take a decent shower. There was alot more but it would take too much time but i definitely will not ever come back here again for a visit. Just get a hotel at the Marriot or Hilton for what you pay here - ALOT MORE AMENITIES.

column27: First time in a villa - great experience
column29: We stayed in a 5 bed 5 bath villa on Windsor hills. Booked via owners direct, very efficient and very helpful owner. Villa was clean and had everything in it you would wish for (although some washing up liquid would have been nice - note there is no cleaning/washing products at all) resort was clean and felt very safe. All staff working there were friendly and helpful. Private Pool was clean and cleaned twice while we were there, children's park was a nice addition. The only downside of staying in a villa was the driving to parks and the paying of $15 per day for this. Having stayed in Disney before with the free transportation I would do this again over villa option but that is personal preference. Please note - don't order take away from recommended leaflets. We had two bad experience, one awful tex Mex that was two hours late, cold and order was wrong and the second time we got a cold over priced pizza. There are lots of restaurants on 192 and a publix not far either.

column29: Third time staying here in Kissimmee area. First in condo, second time in townhouse and this time in a 4 bedroom house. Can't beat the room for the value for a family of 5. Gated community area includes basketball courts, tennis, large pool, game room and theater. Very close to Disney and all the Orlando attractions.

column29: Beautiful secure place to stay, close to parks, shops, places to eat and all amenities. Our 8th time in florida and would recommend staying here. We hired a car so not sure what transport links are available if you wont be driving as everything is just a little bit out of walking distance, also our villa was quite far away from the communal pool, so was a bit of a walk but this isnt necessarily a bad thing. our villa was huge and very modern! With own pool and jaccuzi, which is very cold but you can pay to have them heated which we did. The only bad thing where the love bugs which were everywhere!!! An amazing holiday though and a great place to stay! X

column27: Love having enough room to spread out during a Disney vacation
column29: This is the third time that we've stayed in a 3-bedroom condo here at Windsor Hills. You can't beat it. Having three bedrooms, two bath, four TVs (but this time the 4th doesn't have cable) plus a washer and dryer gives everyone enough room not to get on one another's nerves. I don't think we'll ever stay on the WDW property as long as Windsor Hills is available.

column29: Stayed here with extended family Nov 2012. Great location, near the parks and loads restaurants and a few supermarkets. Onsite shop was handy for small bits, staff very friendly. Didn't use the pool as we had own one with villa, but had a look around and it looked fine, certainly had good few people there. Security guys on gates were great too, ready to help if any problems with gate scanner. Felt very safe there, and our particular villa, Kamena Villa, was fantastic !!

column29: Estuvimos alojados en mayo/2012, alquilamos a traves de Villa Direct un townhouse. La verdad que nos resulto muy comodo, era una linda casita de 3 dormitorios, todos en suite, living y cocina con todo lo necesario, heladera, microndas, lavavajillas, lavarropas, secarropas. Un lcd en cada dormitorio. Y una pequeña pileta tipo spa. El resort cuenta con una pileta en el clubhouse muy linda, tambien tiene un drugstore, y un sector de juegos electronicos, ping pong, etc. Esta muy cerca de Disney, cinco minutos en auto. En la zona hay muchos supermercados, restaurantes, etc. Super recomendable.No recomiendo Villa Direct, ya que compre las entradas a Disney a traves de ellos y tuve un problema que no me resolvieron y tuve que abonar nuevamente una de ellas en los parques.

column29: We visit florida often and have tried other resorts such as legacy park but windsor hills is still our favourite. One great advantage is that is a gated community so it feels that little extra bit safer. When staying in non gated areas such as legacy my younger brother was playing on the street and we were approached by the mail man who said 'don't let your son play around in this neighbourhood' which made us feel unease. Windsor hills offers everything and more that you could wish for. With a communal pool area, bar, gym. We always stay in villas which are up to standard each time we visit the resort. The pool area is spacious with a barbeque, the games room offers a lot of enjoyment for the kids, it has a large 55 inch television, large kitchen diner, 2 twin rooms and 3 double rooms with exceptionally large beds! Each with ensuites. The cleanliness of windsor hills is something which cannot be ignored as it is always pristine. The grass is cut often, the bins emptied every day. The location of the resort is also fantastic! Around 10 minutes drive away from all the theme parks, and 5 minutes from a large selection of restaurants, bars and shops, it offers everything that you would need. A definite must go! We will continue to return here.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: We stayed in this 5 bedroom/5 Bath home in Windsor Hills and it was less than what I expected.For starters - when I received my quote from the owner, I was told that my quote included the use of a BBQ. When we arrived at the home, there was no BBQ there. I contacted the owner about this and was told that it was old and gross and they decided to get rid of it. They had no plans to replace it. At the time of this review, it is still being advertised with pictures of it on the website for the home.One of the large reasons we booked the home was because it listed a PS2 and an Xbox360 on the website. When we arrived at the house we did see the two consoles, but there were no games for either of them. I asked the owner about this and was told that guests had removed them from the home and they had no plans to replace them. I was also told that I could rent games from the clubhouse but when we called the clubhouse, they informed us that they do not have games to rent. So basically we had unusable game consoles unless we wanted to go somewhere and shell out money to buy games for them. For both of these items I asked the owner for a partial refund. We thought it was only fair that we get some money back for a missing BBQ and no games for 2 game consoles. I was told by the owner that they were not going to give me a refund because of the following:#1. We did not pay extra for the BBQ so there was no reason we should have expected it. I explained to the owner that it was specifically listed in the quote she gave me for the house and she again told me that it was a free amenity so I was not to expect it at the home. I was also told that they removed any advertising of the BBQ some time ago. At the time of this review, you can go to their website and see several pictures with the BBQ in them.#2. The owner said they never advertised games for the PS2 and the Xbox360. That is true. However, if I rent a home with game consoles, I expect there to be games to play with them. They are of no use to anyone if they do not have games. When I asked the owner about them I was told that they were removed from prior guests and that was something she had no control over and that they did not intend on buying new ones. Maybe that is something I should not have expected, but we rented 3 other homes in Windsor Hills at the same time and all of them had games to go with the consoles.The house itself is beautifully decorated and the kitchen is well stocked. However, it was not as clean as I would have liked it to be. The management company only works on Mon-Fri and we checked in on a Saturday. So I had to wait until Monday to have someone come out and re-clean a few of the bathrooms.I wanted to write this review to inform people that there is no BBQ at the home and no games for the consoles in case they booked the home specifically for these items. I think it is only fair to let people know. Here are more details of the home and our experience.When I walked into the bathroom there was hair (pubic and regular) all over the floor and worse, all over the bathroom mats. I also found toenails both on the bathroom floor and in the rug in the bedroom. I brought this to the attention of the homeowner who basically told me I was a liar and that she had just been there and personally cleaned all these items herself. I know what pubic hair looks like and it was everywhere on those bathroom rugs. I ended up rolling them up and throwing them in the closet because there was no way that I was going to step on them, they were that gross. After the owner went on and on about how there was NO WAY that I was seeing all this stuff, she told me that she contacted the mgmt. company to contact me. The next day (Sun) someone came out to take a look at things. He agreed that the bathrooms were gross but paused when I mentioned the bug that were on the floor behind the couch. He asked me where they were and I told him that I already vacuumed them up because they were gross and I wanted them gone. So since they were not there when he came, I think he was not sure if he should believe me. He told me that the crew does not work on weekends and the earliest someone could come out was Monday, we checked in on a Saturday. So Monday this ONE guy comes in the house with a broom and sweeps the bathroom floor and spays some bleach solution in the shower and leaves. He was there not more than 20 minutes and was supposed to re-clean all 5 bathrooms. No way that happened, but I was so done with it at that point I was not going to argue my way through my vactation.When I got home and after I contaced the owner about a partial refund ($250) and she said no, I told her that was her perogative but that I would have to write a negative review based on my experience with her and her home. She then THREATENS me and said that if she finds any negative review from me or anyone associtated with me, that she would sue me.So I would stay FAR AWAY from this house and this owner. There are so many other GOOD owners in WH that understand how to treat their customers.

column29: Our party of 9 (6 adults & 3 children) stayed in a 5 bed, 5 bath villa in Dinville Street, at a cost of just over $3000 for 2 weeks, this included an extra payment for the pool to be heated. On our rest days we visited the main pool, but although being advertised as being heated, it was cold, so we relaxed in our own pool and spa, well worth paying for!The complex is kept very clean, each villa has its trash collected daily (except Wednesdays). There is a feeling of being secure within the complex, the staff on the entrance are friendly and efficient. Location wise, the complex is ideal for the Disney parks and about 20 minutes from Universal & SeaWorld. There are plenty of places to eat within 5 minutes on the 192.The villa we had, had the garage converted into a play room with a pool table, football table, darts,basketball game and tv/video games along with the washer and drier, very warm in there, but the kids loved it. We only saw 3 cockroaches throughout our stay, so it may have something to do with the garage having been sealed when it was converted into the games room.All in all I would recommend Windsor Hills to anyone who does not want to be driving for ages to get to the parks, last year we stayed in a villa in Davenport, way too far out from anywhere!

column27: Holiday of a lifetime made perfect by the people with us
column29: Windsor hills is an amazing place to stay. All eight of us stayed in 7718 Comrow Street at Windsir hills it had four bedrooms a pool well equipped kitchen games room and was just a short walk from the club house and main pool.Windsor hills is a short drive from all the attractions Universal as well as Disney. 192 is on your doorstep with supermarkets shops and places to eat all the way along it. The main pool gets very busy at the resort so I would suggest you use your own pool and pay for it to be heated, we made the mistake of NOT having it and boy did we regret it. It was an extra two hundred pounds for the two weeks we stayed there and the water was freezing despite the fact the temperatures in Florida at that time was really high.The villa was massive and spacious, all eight of felt we had lots of space with no one feeling cramped or closed in. The pool was large and the kitchen had all the mod cons. The games room had a washer and drier so no need to do any washing when you get home from your holiday. Every bedroom had its own tv/DVD player and the main living room has a 55 inch tv DVD player Xbox and sound system to keep everyone in your party happy but remember your uk games WON'T work on a USA system.I would highly recommend windsor hillsresort and this villa. Can't wait to return to both.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column29: We stayed in a Five bedroom villa in September 2012 and it was wonderful, we booked platinum with Thomson and received good customer service, and even had a call from our local team on our return to see what we thought of the resort and to check if all had went smoothly on our arrival in Orlando. The location of the villa was great, although not sure how guests without care hire would feel, but we had cars and found we were not far from the Disney parks or I4 which leads to Universal. The villa had all amenities and enough kitchenware to host a full scale party!! the only thing I hated was the Cockroaches in the garage at night, so we had a rule that the door into the house from the garage remained closed and locked at night. the beds were lovely and comfortable, although air conditioning did not appear to work that well in our bedroom on the ground floor. all rooms were ensuite with good closet space and most had walk in Wardrobes and a private area to dress. It is the first time I have stayed in a villa, but due to there being 9 in our group, it was by far the cheaper option, if like me you enjoy comfortable surroundings. I found the villa, comfortable, clean and if I was travelling in a large party again would definitely stay in a villa, and even though I would recommend Windsor Hills, would probably stay somewhere else, just because I don't like staying at the same place twice. externally I would agree with others, security is good and very friends but the amenities were poor (arcade, shop...), but there's a Target and Publix nearby...if you have a car!

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Like other reviewers we booked a platinum villa with Thomson on the understanding that we would be allocated a villa which would meet the standard to be defined as platinum. God help those who had booked bronze silver or gold!!! First impressions are ok though did look a bit dated. As the time progresses you notice marks on the walls, poor grouting in bathroom areas and actually quite a dirty property. Unfortunately our pool pump stopped working which also removed the water from the spa. Hotel beds advised us that Florida stores who manage the property would be contacted but as it was a Saturday would not be out until Monday (it was Tuesday) and heyho after a short spell of working on the Friday the pump went off again. Was advised that water was ok to swim in. No chance slimy film on the surface dead insects on top of the water and other items in the water. At the same time the temperature kept fluctuating and on the Staurday was at 89 degrees which indictaed a faulty air conditioning unit. Obviously this is a well maitained villa Hotel beds said someone would come straight away which to their credit was true though not after informing us that if it was a manual fault we would be charged. You cant move in the villa for signs and rules advising you that you will be charged for this that and the other. The location of Windsor Hills is excellent the property of 2686 is not. I remember reading a review on here relating to this villa and hoping i did not get allocated it. It would seem that Thomson's have not addressed some of the concerns previously identified and i have also sent a complaint in regarding the villa and await their reply

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124

column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column27: Top class - take it from me, we ended up buying here!!
column29: We own a vacation rental in Windsor Hills. It all started a few years ago, when we stayed in a condo on Almaton Loop for two weeks and fell in love with the resort, so bought a home and have been going there ever since!! It's a great resort!! It's extremely secure with Security check-in at the front gates so its safe to let kids roam free! Houses vary in size and in condition, so its best to check with individual villa rental companies to see what each house is like, don't judge too much on people's photos of homes because each home is completely different! There is a large communal pool area with a great buzz and a real tropical feel! There is also a small gym, a small "cinema" and you can request movie showings from a list in the welcome office. There are also playgrounds, two large tennis courts, a volleyball area, putting green and basketball courts. All have floodlights so you can play into the evening when the temperatures cool down! There is also a sundry shop that has all the little things you need and also serves pool snacks. This property is located approx. ten minutes from Disneyland, 20 minutes from SeaWorld, 20-25 to Florida Mall, 30 mins to Mall at Millenia and about an hour and a half to Cocoa Beach on the East Coast or St Pete's beach on the West (perhaps this sounds like a lot but with a Car on Florida's roads its a breeze!!) It's also about 5 minutes from some great restaurants, including Longhorn Steakhouse, Outback, Bahama Breeze, TGI Fridays to name but a few. Formosa Gardens is about five minutes away and has a large supermarket and liquor store, there is also a SuperTarget just a little bit past that on the US192 and WalMart isn't too much further away. You won't find a better location than this, trust me!! I recommend a home nearer the pools, Almaton Loop has some great condos, Comrow has some great large villas and there are some great town-houses off Teascone Boulevard!!

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Excellent location, excellent facilities (pool, arcade, gym, cinema etc) and very secure. We stayed on Comrow Street in a 5 bedroom Villa which was excellent value for money compared to other states in the US.The owner even sent us directions for a short cut into Disney which saved us a lot of time each day, I'll pass them on to anyone who wants them.What really impressed me about this resort was the security team. Very friendly but very keen, will not let anyone in without their bar code card. DO NOT lose this as you need it to get in and out. When I awoke early on our first morning I saw the security team patrolling the area and they passed on numerous occasion which was very reasurring, not that we needed to be reasured.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners

column27: Stayed at 2686 manesty lane dec/jan 10/11 and 7770 (main rd club house is on). Good location would return!
column29: Well like another reviewer we were also given 2686 manesty lane, was not impressed by this villa at all. 4 bedroom villa, the furniture all looked nice on 1st appearance but the more you look around the more you seen how dirty the villa actually was. It could really do with a lick of point and good clean. The pool is in the shade all day & night. We were originally booked into Windsor palms but were apparently upgraded to here when we arrived, I rang to complain there was no games room and we paid for 1, I was told that we were upgraded to a better villa location, I told them to put me back were I should of been then & in my executive villa with games room as I knew myself there was not much difference between the 2 villa complexes. Stayed in 7770 dec/jan 11/12. We booked this villa privately and this was a big 6 bedroom villa. The pool received the sun most of the day, the furniture the the villa was nice although some of the bar stools were broken, as was the Hoover. Games room was ok but really needs a good clean out. I don't blame the owners for this as they lived in England so obviously don't go and check this every few weeks, this is down to the management company and other visitors who probably don't respect it due to it not being there own belongings. I would return to Windsor hills as I felt safe, this year however were returning to emerald island again as it was alot cheaper.

column6: #1 of 7 Specialty Lodging in Four Corners
column10: 2600 N Old Lake Wilson RdFour Corners, FL 34747-2124
column14: Suites, Kitchenette, Non-Smoking Rooms, Family Rooms
column16: CN¥1,025 - CN¥3,796 (Based on Average Rates for a Standard Room)
column29: Ok so we booked this with virgin holidays the accommodation was £3000.00 for 17 nights. When we landed at Orlando we arrived 20mins early so because we have been 10 times already we decided to make our way to the villa as no virgin rep was present.We got to Windsor Hills to be told that we had to o to Hotel beds to register after a long flight thats all you need. They were very quick in giving us all our info. We stayed in Manesty Lane not sure what no think it was 1723. We got in and thought wow this is amazing then on closer inspection we thought oh maybe not. The pool area had loads of toys bundled in the corner and a dirty towel on the floor not what you would expect from a 5star property. The rooms were clean and tidy the bathrooms were not there was mould in the shower in the en-suite which made me feel sick. There was no cleaning products or mops or brooms to keep it clean so after a couple of days I got out the hover it did not work. We wanted dinner so decided to eat in it took ages to work out how to work every kitchen appliance (instructions would be handy). On the 3rd day we decided to go to the communal pool lots of rowdy teenagers fighting in the pool so our kids wouldn't use the slide(we never went back to the pool after that) the problem was in our villa we only had 3 sun beds our villa is meant to sleep 12 people, the patio are had a broken chair which we reported but it was never replaced so if you are travelling with a lot don't expect to all sit outside as there is not enough seats or beds. Not that there is a lot of patio space anyway. Like I said before we have been a few times so we really wanted to sit and sunbath but we couldn't. The games room was good my son enjoyed playing pool but the darts didn't work and neither did the air hockey. Also the dinning area only had 6 seats round the table so we couldn't all sit and have dinner together. On the 4th day we decided that maybe the villa just was not for us so we emailed virgin to see if we could transfer to a hotel they said no(very rude and abrupt) they were so nice with 15 phone calls when I was booking disney tickets with them. So we bit the bullet and paid ourselves to stay for a few nights and disney swan and dolphin we had a great time and it was the only bit of sunbathing we did the kids played in the pool all day then we caught the boat to the parks from the hotel and made the most of the free transport offered by disney. Im trying not to be negative but it is tricky the villa overall was big and spacious but just a bit tired and grotty not worth the money at all our friends stayed 7 miles away and we went to their villa although it was the same standard it cost them a lot less £600 per week as they booked it independently. I think when we go next time I will book my own villa and try to find something of better quality. The shop on the complex stocks essentials only but we thought it was very expensive so we drove to wall mart which was much cheaper $1.00 for a dishwasher tablet is quite expensive. We love Orlando so we will stay at a villa again but not through virgin. Its nice having your own space in the mornings and evenings. I noticed in an earlier review they said the gate got quite busy at times they seem to of sorted that as a guard(who are all very friendly) stays there at busy times now so its no problem.

column29: We stayed at 2524 archfeld boulevard its the first time we stayed at this gated complex, but family have stayed in the same villa before, totally spotless and lovely inside, the owner was prompt in returning emails about some cups that broke during our trip ( not our fault) it felt very safe and secure, never used the complex pool but it looked fine and the shop was useful for desperate stuff, iPhone co-pilot live satnav found it fine, it is very near disney, but about 12 miles from universal, just set off a bit earlier to avoid congestion on the i4 (simple) there was no sun on a night over the pool but to be honest that's a welcome relief, beds are huge and really spacious bathrooms especially 2 downstairs,,, jacuzzi heats up quick..plenty of food places about 5 mins drive away..don't think you would want to walk it though, for publix turn left on the 192 Bronson memorial it's about 2 miles down on your right ..Walmart is further on its signposted just of the Bronson ..try and fit in a couple of hours at old town Kissimmee get a taxi about 40 dollars return, go of an evening, shops and bars all in one street, so you can leave yr menfolk in the bars, while you pick up some shopping :-)
