column29: We have been to Orlando 9 times and this is the first time we have rented a Villa.It had six bedrooms, its own private pool and a games room in the garage. The villa was excellent and had everything we needed. The kids really enjoyed the pool at the villa, but also enjoyed the lagoon pool at the clubhouse which they could walk to themselves. Windsor hills is a gated estate and our kids aged 13 and 11 could go to the playpark or games room themselves. There is a small shop selling a good range of essentials - the prices were very reasonable. They also sell sandwiches ($3.50), draft beer ($11 for a large pitcher), chicken nuggets&fries ($5) which we found great for the afternoons at the pool because we didn't have to go back to the villa when the kids got hungry.Our friends rented a 2 bed condo at the same time and they loved it too.There are lots of great restaurants 5-10 mins drive away (Black Angus, Olive Garden, Texas Road House, Angels, Longhorns and our favourite orlando restaurant - Wildside). There is a Publix Supermarket about 10mins drive, a Walmart about 7 mins drive, a huge Walmart about 15mins away and a Wallgreens about 5 mins away.Windsor Hills is really close to Disney, but a little further to Universal Studios and Seaworld. We used the I4 to get to Universal and it was often congested and it sometimes took 30mins to get there.I would recommend Windsor Hills if you want to enjoy the theme parks and have somewhere relaxing to return to afterwards.We enjoyed our hols so much we have booked for next year already!

column29: Wonderful 5 bedroom 5 bathroom villa with great pool and games room converted garage. Lovely furnishings and so comfortable.. Perfect location for Disney. Great complex. Only downside was battling with access to complex gates - the bar code reader was temperamental and some security guards non too helpful. Both Saturdays we were there queues built up on main road with new arrivals checking in so made it a slow return home for those of us just back from a day at the parks. 5th visit to Florida and would definitely recommend

column29: We booked a four bedroomed 'Platinum' villa at Windsor Hills through Thomson Holidays (a UK travel firm). When we arrived at the airport we collected our documenation and was advised that we had been allocated 2686 Manesty Lane. On our way to the villa we called at Hotelbeds and completed the necessary registration. You have to leave a $500 security depoist (on cc) or you can pay $39 'insurance waiver'. We left ours via the cc.As I know the area reasonably well we set off and were soon outside of our villa. We were all excited, especially my son's GF who had never been to Florida before. When we opened the door we were greeted by that 'musty' smell you get when a property hasn't been used in a while. Once we were into the property and opened the blinds I felt an immediate sense of disappointment. No way was this a Platinum property! If it was, heaven help the people who book, gold, silver or bronze properties.There were scrape marks all over the walls. The doors, door frames, skirting boards, were scrapped, dented and chipped. One of the bedrooms had pencil scribble on the wall. I went to open the patio door to look outside and the patio door tracks were filthy! Not dirty, filthy! The breakfast table was all marked and chipped. In fact the whole place felt shabby. To say we were disappointed was an understatement. I called Hotelbeds as you have to inform them of any damage with 24 hours. 'Sorry about that, we'll report those matters'. That was it. Well we decied we would make the best of it as we were at least in sunny Florida. We had arranged to be at MK for rope drop next day so I decided I would call in at Hotelbeds the next day to discuss matters further. We unpacked and went straight out to get something to eat, intending to return and have an early night. Unfortunately when we got back to the villa we found that the sockets in the kitchen weren't working. Hubby checked the fuseboard and said it appeared OK so we had no idea what the problem was, but it was something else to tell Hotelbeds. We also had to go and buy coat hangers as there were only about 10 between the whole four bedrooms! However these are only about $3 for 18 at Walmart, so not to much of a problem.When we got to the HB office and explained about the 'shabby' villa the agent just shrugged his shoulders and said I would need to take the matter up with Thomsons. Regarding the electricity he rang the Florida Store who are the property management company. They gave advice on how to reset the electricity and I wondered if it was such a common occurrence why they didin't have something about it in the villa. Apparantly there is a reset button in the middle of the socket. Being from the UK I had never encountered this before. I also asked about the safe but was told that I would have to wait until Monday to speak to the management company about it. I decided to have a look in the cupboards to see what there was in the way of cookware and found two pans that were absolutely disgusting. Rusted and dirty, they were only fit for the bin. Fortunately I wasn't planning on doing much more than making breakfast.On our fourth day I decided I would change the beds. Guess what, there was no change of bedding for either of the king beds. I phoned the management company and they insisted that the bedding was there so I said in which case could they come and find it. They also insisted that the property had only one king bed and two queens. Since I was standing looking at the beds I think I would know what I was looking at. They said they would send some bedding. When it didn't arrive in a couple of days, I emailed and asked them about it again. A lady appeared a couple of hours later and said it would be in the closet. 'Feel free to look' I said. Well when she couldn't find any she said she would drop some off later in the day. I did clearly explain that they were TWO king beds that I needed bedding for. While we were out one set of king bedding and one set of queen bedding was deleivered. I emailed the office again but by this time I was so sick that I just changed our bed, washed what I took off, dried it and put it on the other king. I should also mention that the sheets were the poorest quality bedding I have ever had in Florida, whether it be in a private rental or hotel.All in all I have to say that we had a lovely holiday, but the problems with the villa should not have happened. I saw the Thomson rep at the airport as we were leaving for home and I told her of my disappointment but she just said 'You will have to write to Thomsons'. I emailed Thomsons while we were in Florida and I followed that up with a letter when I got home (mid May). Thomsons have not even given me the curtesy of a reply. I am writing this review purely to warn future travellers what to expect.I hope that you will be able to see from the photos (if I manage to upload them) the kind of 'shabbiness' I refer to. Unfortunately I only took a few photographs but quite a bit of video and I can't get it to upload.

column27: Better and cheaper than a hotel
column29: We booked a 2bed apartment for a week in April. It was large and clean, with a full kitchen and laundry area. It was like home from home, cheaper than a 4star hotel and with a nice lounge to relax in. The childs room was disney themed, with plenty of cuddly toys and mickey wall paper. The resort is only 2miles to Disney. There are restaurants (McDonalds, Pondarossa, TGIs, Outback) just outside the complex on 192, and we drove to Walmart on sr27 around 5miles away.The complex pool is lovely for kids, zero entry with a water slide.The only thing for improvement could be a on site bar area/clubhouse type room, which serves food.Would recommend this resort to anyone staying in the Orlando area, especially families where you need more room than a standard hotel room, and for a lower cost per night.

column29: We rented a villa at Windsor Hills in February 2011. The villa consisted of 6 bedrooms and 4 baths a games room, laundry, heated pool and hot tub. Everything was to our expectations, and even more so. We and 2 other couples rented the villa and had tremendous amount of space ... and at a superb price!!The owners were extremely easy to deal with, and the villa was extremely clean and well kept. Windsor Hills is located very close to Disney and all amenities. Even Orlando Airport and Port Canaveral are less than 30 minutes!I would highly recommend the particular villa we rented. We are also looking forward to spending more time at Windsor Hills.

column27:
2518 Renshaw Townhome
My Sons Injury Equated to the cist of a damaged Pool Net
column29: We have stayed at Windsor Hills 3 times now and let me say first our first two stays in the town homes were PERFECT. The same unfortunately can not be said of our most recent at vacationmoms 2518 Renshaw. The pool was filthy (see pictures) and freezing. Apparently the pool heater was "off" and the owner believes we turned it off rather than the possibility that it may have been mistakenly not turned on. The stairs to the upstairs bedrooms had a shotty repair with a nail sticking up in the middle. (see pics) Upon notifying owner the repairman thought it logical to fix it by adding 5 more nails which kept popping out as we used the stairs ... End result a nail through the foot of my special needs son the night before our 4 am flight home. Understand that the homeowner was made aware off all things in shotty order in her home. Drawers (false covers) that were off or about to fall off upon our arrival and a ripped pool net along with the concerns of the pool and the stair. One month after being home the home owners resolution to our compromised stay was to accuse us of breaking the net and smoking in her home and she was willing to return my damage deposit with $60 to cover the 3 days of no pool heat provided this was the end of it.When I clarified that she was really suggesting that my sons injury (actually he stepped on the nail twice but the first one just scratched the side of his foot) was worth a damaged pool net (which FYI we did not damage) and her allegation that there were cigarette buts found in here home and the home smelled like smoke implying we smoked in the home (which WE DID NOT ... My husband smoked a cigarillo each night on the front driveway) I was appalled. My suggestion was to reimburse 1/2 our rental since medical expenses were covered by Canadian taxpayers since we came home within hours of the injury I had it checked here in Canada. She stated that if I didn't take the deal she would be keeping my damage deposit. I replied she could keep that and anticipate a cost more in line with what it would cost a nonresident to receive the medical attention our son received in Canada. FYI We were also charged an additional $10 per night for a second child to stay with us. We had 2 adults and 2 children in a 3 bedroom home with a capacity of 8-9. This made no sense to me as an entire bedroom remained empty but we paid it willingly. Please don't let this keep you away from Windsor Hills as it is an incredible gated community that we will return to. Just remember that homes are privately owned and experience can vary greatly depending on that.

column29: We stayed at Windsor Hills in Disney Villa which we rented directly from the owners. The villa was excellent, well equipped and with a great pool that got sun all day. The location is great for all the Disney Parks and for Universal and International Drive. There were also plenty of restaurants nearby and only a shirt drive from the town if Celebration. column29: We stayed at the Windsor Hills Resorts from June 18 to the 25 and would certainly stay there again. We had a travel party of 12 people and stayed in three seperate condos. All of the units were very big, clean, and provided exactly what we were looking for. There is a clubhouse, pool, and exercise facility. The pool has a cost of $10 for an access card, but you will be refunded that money upon checkout. There is a small bar at the pool that serves drinks and light food. The exercise room is adaquette for a vacation and the good part is you must be 18 to enter so there are no kids running around while you try to work out. The proximity to Disney is great within 2 miles of the main gate, but you will need to drive a little to get to Sea World or Universal. The service we were provided was great, one of the units had a problem with the air conditioner and a technician was out within a half hour and had the problem quickly fixed. The property is very secure with only one way in and out and security gates that you must pass through.

column29: The Villa was absolutely perfect , beautiful decor, exactly how it looks. Every thing was pristine, the location ideal for Disney, Universal etc and the owner a pleasure to deal with.Sounds a bit over the top but this really is how it was. Being very sceptical about individual renting I went into this cautiously, I was also advised by another owner to beware of lies and false pictures. There is none of this, what you see is exactly what you get. Having rented another Villa which was a 7 bed exec in the same location for our last 5 days dus to this one being unavailable I would most certainly not hesitate to rent this one every time.
